entries.title: Coin-Op Kid
entries.description:
![Title.gif](///raw/f12/2/z/21e50.gif)

Play at Itch.io: https://cosmicadventuresquad.itch.io/coin-op-kid

#### :robot: Summary
You are the Coin-Op Kid and your job is to bring at least one coin to the final coin slot in each level. Don't forget that your life is currency‚Äîyou need at least one coin inside you to stay alive.

* Solve unique puzzle-platforming levels
* Jumping will expel a coin!
* Manage your coins to make it to the end
* You must have at least one coin in you when you reach the final coin slot

#### :video_game: Controls
Keyboard: 
- Arrow keys to move
- Z to jump
- X to shoot
- R to restart

#### :bulb: Credits

- Vu Ha - Code :computer: (@strega)
- Rose Peng - Art :paintbrush: (@rosypenguin)
- Johan Soriao - Music :musical_keyboard: (@tenlki)

entries.title: Oink Royale
entries.description:
## Destroy the oinks!

As a lonely piggy bank you must bankrupt the other evil piggy banks by shooting your coins at them. But beware! When you're out of coins, you explode!

![oink_2.gif](///raw/f34/z/20943.gif)

https://youtu.be/nIbyVN91ktA

### Controls

* Move: WASD
* Aim & Shoot: Mouse

### Game

* Shooting means you lose one coin
* When you're out of coins you lose the game
* Hitting an enemy makes them loose two coins
* Pick up your own "bullets" to restore a coin or pick up enemies lost coins
* Survive as long as you can

*If you survive over 2 minutes you are very good at this game!*

entries.title: Consume
entries.description:
![Cover2.png](///raw/693/2/z/237c8.png)
![Snap1.png](///raw/693/2/z/233be.png)
![Snap2.png](///raw/693/2/z/233c4.png)

Consume is a tile based strategy game where an adventurous mage delves deep to uncover the truth about a strange dream that called them to a mysterious dungeon far away in an forgotten land.

# Bindings and Movement
### [Mouse] 
Use the mouse to navigate the tiles adjacent to the player. You can move up, down, left, or right, but not diagonal.
*Note that when you move, the adjacent tile you're moving away from will move with you.
### [Tab]
Use [Tab] if you get stuck, it will kill the player and return you to the shop keeper.
### [F1]
Lowers the resolution of the game for smaller screens
### [F2]
Brings the resolution back to normal.
 
# Tiles
### [Multiplier wand] 
Multiplies the power of all tiles adjacent by the wand's power. Can multiply anything including additional wands.
### [Potions]
Heals the player for it's power.
### [Scrolls]
Gives the player a random spell with the scrolls power as a modifier.
### [Monsters]
Various monsters roam the dungeons 15 floors. On every floor, on monster holds the key to the stair case that will allow you to progress.
### [Stair Case]
Stepping on this tile with the key will allow you to progress to the next floor.

# Combo System
If you manage to kill more than one creature in a row, you'll be awarded with a combo! Each time you receive a combo you'll gain a souls multiplier and health based bonus based on the number of combos you've chained. 

# Gameplay
In Consume, you move around the board by clicking on adjacent tiles with your mouse. If you enter a tile occupied by an enemy, you will need to trade your own life force to absorb their soul. Souls are used as currency to be exchanged for permanent upgrades from the shopkeeper, he is found when you meet your inevitable demise. Spell scrolls can also be found scattered throughout the dungeon floors (spells do not consume life force to cast). Other items that can be found inside the dungeon are health potions and multiplier wands (this item multiplies number values of both health potions and enemies in adjacent tiles, so use wisely). Consume also uses a combo system, absorb multiple enemies in a row to reduce the amount of life force used and recieve additional souls to exchange for permanent upgrades.

entries.title: Drytown
entries.description:
A 1 bit, topdown game were your health is the most valuable resource for the citizens of Drytown.

![gif_postday_2.gif](///raw/0eb/z/23a9b.gif)

Drytown, the old vampire village is doomed to failure due to the lack of fresh blood since the human disappearance after the last "Great War", that is true until an airhead human appears in the town brought by the train. This airhead will try to get out of Drytown using his blood as the only currency valuable in the town.

---

#### Controls:

Move with WASD and Arrows

Interact and Attack with SPACE/Enter/Left Click

Gamepad Supported

---

#### Drytown is made by:

Eliphas [@eliphas343](https://twitter.com/eliphas343)

Sercante [@sercante_](https://twitter.com/sercante_)

We hope you have fun playing it!

entries.title: Lousy Life Lessons - [LLL]
entries.description:
![titleheader.png](///raw/028/3/z/23623.png)

![ComicSheets.png](///raw/028/3/z/24308.png)

-----------------------------------------------------------

**Pawel Purrlovski** is your man for exceptional jobs. 

But he's not just burning (literally) with the desire to perform the most daring stunts ever, but also to finally be with the love of his life.

A love so deep, he will go to hell and back, just to brag about it.
Experience a story, so action packed and full of passion, you will get emotional whiplash from it (or even acutal whiplash, depending on the quality of your chair).

Join Pawel on a journey trough his nine lifes and witness a whirlwind of love, passion and explosions!
 
Nine lifes - one decision

In the end there is always a price to be paid.

-----------------------------------------------------------

![EyeHeartsGIF.gif](///raw/028/3/z/24bd4.gif)

**Playthrough:**
https://youtu.be/lyROPTd0A_w

-----------------------------------------------------------

Jawusch - Kodu

Julienne - Design staging and scriptazzling

Rackel - Movementations

Seemon - acoustic endeavours

Duzinger - Picturations

Lotti - Visualications

Loki - best doggo and Product Owner

-----------------------------------------------------------

**Jam Entry 0.1.0:**

We fixed some bugs related to the platformer mechanics. You should no longer get stuck on edges or die randomly.  

**Postjam Version 0.1.4:**

- Gamepad support!!! (A functions like the spacebar)
- Added a ‚Äúskip‚Äù button for the cutscenes
- ‚ÄúRetry‚Äù can now be triggered with ‚ÄúAnykey‚Äù
- A few general bug fixes
- general improvement of platformer mechanic, especially jumping of ledges should be less frustrating now
- adjusted some frustrating colliders
- Improved camera movement. It now moves in the direction the player is facing
- Tutorialscreens will now be disabled after a few tries
- Added screenshake when dying
- Improved some audio transitions
- Added a lot of sfx
- Improved a few UI animations
- Music will be played with lower volume while dialog is playing

-----------------------------------------------------------

entries.title: Path of Redemption
entries.description:
![2.png](///raw/db1/6/z/24256.png)
## **Story**
In Path of Redemption you play as a person who has been accused of a crime and have been ordered to complete a series of tests to see if the gods deem you innocent or guilty. To goal is to beat 24 increasingly difficult rooms to get to the final Boss and earn your freedom.
.



## **Need some help?**
If a Puzzle is too difficult you can always **Pay life coins to skip it**. Simply go to the Blood-well and press the **[E]** key.
![1.png](///raw/db1/6/z/23cc2.png)
.




## **Armor**
Each piece of armor provides you a 1/3 chance to block incoming damage. The armor piece that blocked the damage gets reduced durability. When an armor piece has blocked damage 3 times it breaks and you drop it.
![armor.png](///raw/db1/6/z/23d08.png)
.



## **Create your character**
You can choose between playing as a male or female and customize your appearance. 
![generate.gif](///raw/db1/6/z/23d58.gif)
.


## **Gamble with your life**
If you are brave you can open chests by spending life, if you are lucky you might get a great reward!
![gamble.gif](///raw/db1/6/z/23d48.gif)
.


## **Dodge attacks**
Remember to dodge incoming enemy attacks (their **weapon glows red** right before they strike). Pressing the [Spacebar] key while running allows you to dash a short distance.
![dodge.gif](///raw/db1/6/z/23cd0.gif)
.


## **Avoid traps**
A lot of things will try to kill you, avoid them best you can. The Dash ability [Spacebar] comes in handy here as well.
![traps.gif](///raw/db1/6/z/23cd6.gif)
.


## **Do some old fashioned murdering**
Apart from encountering other people who are trying to prove their innocence by completing the trials, you will also face stone guardians. They need to be killed, before they kill you.
![fight.gif](///raw/db1/6/z/23d03.gif)
.


## **Inventory**
Check out what stats your current weapon has, the following is displayed (Top to bottom)
- Movement speed
- Attack Range
- Attack Speed
- Attack Damage  
There are **15 different weapons** and a full set of armor to collect.
![inventory.gif](///raw/db1/6/z/23d25.gif)
.



## **Controls**
- **[W][A][S][D] / Arrow keys - Move**
- **[Spacebar] - Dash (while moving)**
- **[Left Mouse Button] - Attack**
- **[B] - Open inventory**
- **[E] - Interact (Read, Pick up, activate)**
- **[Escape] - In game pause / Quit game when in Menu**
.


## **Credits**
![credits 2.gif](///raw/db1/6/z/24540.gif)

entries.title: Heartaker
entries.description:
![13090.png](///raw/69c/1/z/22117.png)
![GIF3_explaining.gif](///raw/69c/1/z/221a6.gif)
![Middleimage.png](///raw/69c/1/z/221a7.png)
![GIF2_explaining.gif](///raw/69c/1/z/221a8.gif)
![13090.png](///raw/69c/1/z/22117.png)
![1cd00.png](///raw/69c/1/z/221fe.png)
### Hey folks! How you doin‚Äô?

I'm thankful for presenting you Heartaker - a hack n slash about slicing enemies in a half with a katana!

Before you download the game, I would strongly advise you to get a **mouse in order to play** the game - it might be a bit harder playing in the trackpad.

![1cd00.png](///raw/69c/1/z/221fe.png)
### Developer Comments

After so many Ludum Dares **I think I'm getting good at creating games that I enjoy play and make.** I've had a hard time working almost 30 hours in this project and doing all sorts of stuff; from game design to programming, drawing, animating, making music and some sounds with my voice - recorder on my phone haha!

It is worth mentioning that, although I made the entire game in the weekend, some things really helped me a lot, like using a proper **engine and some powerful tools**, like Game Maker Studio 2, Photoshop, Spine, Audacity, Sony Vegas and some AI-based tools.

Composing and animating were for sure the hardest parts of the game. It is worth saying that I used a lot of music and sound effect generators for this game, that was later mixed with some of my voice and drum/flute samples till I get an original and meaningful soundtrack.

![1cd00.png](///raw/69c/1/z/221fe.png)
### ChangeLog

The version for download **has been modified** after the weekend, in order to:

[Version 1.0.0.1]
- Fix a bug that would stick the player on the afterlife of the game.
- Fix a bug that would prevent the game from continuing whenever an enemy fell out of the map on specific waves.

[Version 1.0.0.2]
- Gameover screen is faster.
- Upgrades are cheaper.
- Shopkeeper's dialogue is faster.
- Spawn time is faster.
- You can restart the game.
- Enemies reset attack timer after dash encounter.
- Camera correctly looks at the player if he falls from the map.
- Game starts in fullscreen.
- Samurai's icon should look sharper.

**Original source and executable at the [Compo - Original] link.** *This version may get stuck at some points of the game, in this case, the only alternative is to restart the executable.*

![1cd00.png](///raw/69c/1/z/221fe.png)
### That's it
**I hope you enjoy my game! :)**

*Please, let me a comment to know what you think about the game, this way I can also play yours later!*

entries.title: Digital Gray
entries.description:
CURRENT HIGH SCORE: 1191 (chopstick)

You are the only one left.

The last drop of light in a dark world.

The last human among machines.

Digital gray.


![GIF.gif](///raw/ce9/2/z/22a77.gif)


Controls: 

WASD to move (press K and L to toggle ZQSD)

Mouse + Left click to aim and shoot

Right click to dash (once unlocked)

Space when standing on the upgrade station to... upgrade

(Note: you need full energy to do so)

E: Toggle screenshake

R: Start game

Esc: close game


![gif2.gif](///raw/ce9/2/z/22a7c.gif)



Your objective: destroy all the machines. The more you fight and are overwhelmed, the more you will need to sacrifice a part of your humanity - of your life - for a stronger, mechanical body. That is the price to pay for you to one day, across multiple lives, wipe the machines off your world. But it will not happen today.



The game is a highscorer! Kill as many enemies as you can, bam bam bam!

As you upgrade, you trade your maximum health! Be careful as you progress - power comes at the price of your life.


[there is only a windows build]



Inspired by the music of King Gizzard and the Lizard Wizard

To compete, just send a screenshot of your own achievement! :D



Team:

Art -> Essence https://twitter.com/EssenceArtThing

Code - Distorter https://twitter.com/theDistort

Music + Code -> Fusionnist https://twitter.com/Fusionnist

entries.title: This is your life now
entries.description:
## :raised_hands: Live an entire life in 5 minutes or so

![Ado-GoodGrades.gif](///raw/1e0/1/z/238e6.gif)

Make **difficult choices**, and suffer their **consequences**.

From **baby** to **old person**, you'll get to live something **unique**, and maybe you'll find the **meaning of life**.

**This is your life now.**

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QodeGSHkNlo

### :video_game: How to play : 

**Keyboard :**  
Move with arrows or wasd or zqsd  
Jump with Spacebar  
Buy stuff with Spacebar

**Gamepad (XBOX pads at least) :**  
Move with left stick  
Jump with A  
Buy Stuff with A

### Credits

Everything done by me in 47 hours or so for Ludum Dare 44.

entries.title: Bank Burner
entries.description:
https://repine.itch.io/ld44
![banbner.png](///raw/80a/d/z/22010.png)
## Story & Gameplay
You're a greedy banker who values their currency more than their life. After a strange incident, your money turned sentient and lit your bank on fire! It's up to you to rush in and capture all of the currency. Better make it quick, or you'll be toast in this fast-paced top-down shooter.

To beat each level, you must bag all the money monsters by shooting them. But make your shot count because you only have enough bullets as there are enemies! And you gotta make it quick because the flames are closing in! But you get a little more time each time you capture an enemy.

## Controls:

* WASD - Move

* Mouse - Aim

* Left Mouse - Shoot

* E - Restart Room

* Space / Escape - Pause

* F / F4 / F1 on menu for fullscreen (windows).
![bb2.gif](///raw/80a/d/z/23199.gif)

**Stuff I used**
* GameMaker Studio 2 for tha game
* Famitracker 0CC for tha music and some sound effects
* bfxr for when I needed more sound effects
* Aseprite for tha art

entries.title: Escape from the Mint
entries.description:
Control quarters, nickels, and dimes, as they work together to escape from the mint! 

![stuck.PNG](///content/8f5/6/z/2366a.png)

## Controls
This is a puzzle platformer where you control multiple characters, who are coins of various denominations. Specific controls and mechanics will be explained in the game. There are 12 total levels (including 3 tutorials) of various difficulties.

- Left/right to move. 
- Up to jump.
- J and L to cycle through the coins. 
- Down to enter payslots.
- R to restart the level. 
- M to mute the music.

## Credits
Made with Unity.

### Programming
Lennart Jansson, Jon Schneider, and Anderson Wang

### Art and Sound Effects
Lennart Jansson

### Music
Anderson Wang

### Design
Lennart Jansson, Colin Lu, Jon Schneider, and Anderson Wang

## Post-LD changes
We added the mute functionality as well as some camera fixes (so that it doesn't go offscreen) after the competition ended. We felt these were minor enough to count as "bug fix" changes, but are mentioning it here for full transparency.

![stuck.PNG](///raw/8f5/6/z/2387e.png)

entries.description:
![gameplay.gif](///raw/9bd/z/21d71.gif)

## Read This First

a little rogue-like about being a bag of money in a hostile dungeon

collect coins, shoot coins at shopkeepers to buy upgrades, and stay away from reds or shoot coins at them to kill them. you can stand next to shopkeepers to see what they're selling and how many coins it'll cost you. you can even shoot coins at walls to destroy them, but every coin you shoot is one less coin in your bag, so use them sparingly! 

reds move after every second step you take, and if you end up next to a red when it's about to move, you lose a coin. if you get hit and have no coins, you're dead, game over!

step on the staircase to go down to the next floor of the dungeon. as you go deeper, enemies get tougher and more common, and shopkeeper prices go up

how many gems can you buy before you die?

also there's no audio, sorry

![gameplay.png](///raw/9bd/z/21d7d.png)

## Controls

** hold down TAB to see what the numbers mean**  

press ARROW KEYS (or WASD) to **move**  
hold down SHIFT (or Z or SPACE) and press ARROW KEYS (or WASD) to **shoot**  
press ALT and ENTER to toggle **fullscreen**  

controller also supported (hold A to shoot, hold the shoulder buttons to see what the numbers mean)

![explanation.png](///raw/9bd/z/21d80.png)

## About The Game

made in about 15 hours using Gamemaker Studio 1.4 and [Aseprite](https://dacap.itch.io/aseprite). the colour palette is the beautiful [Master Palette](https://twitter.com/Fleja2003/status/967112700018024448) by [Fleja](https://twitter.com/Fleja2003). the (very basic) pathfinding script and a few helper scripts  were taken from [Death of a Lich](http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-33/?action=preview&uid=3479), but everything else was written from scratch including the dungeon generation (which uses a corridor-and-rectangular-room approach)

I really enjoyed making Mr Moneybag and I hope you enjoy playing it!

**BUILD VERSIONS**

the Original Build is the one made during the 48 hours, with two bug fixes (listed below). the Updated Build includes slightly faster movement, animated reds and dead-end corridor prevention

**BUG FIXES**

* fixed a game-breaking bug where coin damage wasn't being calculated correctly
* fixed a game-breaking bug where one shopkeeper was improving the wrong stat

entries.title: A Cup's Life
entries.description:
Each room is a new little puzzle for you to solve. While you play as a cup of tea you push and pour water on cookies in order to get through to the next room. 

![aCupsLifeGif_6.gif](///raw/2a8/22/z/21f88.gif)

![aCupsLifeGif_3.gif](///raw/2a8/22/z/21f89.gif)

entries.title: The Stranger
entries.description:
![stranger.png](///raw/b4e/22/z/21541.png)

An NES game I made in 48 hours. Whew! 2 all-nighters' worth of hard work! I would've loved to add more content such as more screens and all but deadlines are deadlines. C'est la vie!

This is an actual NES ROM that runs on real hardware! Or your favourite emulator :) - For those that don't have one, I've included MESEN with Sour's authorisation.

I hope you enjoy it :)

entries.title: Seed.
entries.description:
![banner.gif](///raw/b42/3/z/2453e.gif)

It takes thousands of years for a jungle to grow, and it could thrive on its own for millennia.

But for us human, the wood is a valuable material.

Their life is our currency...

![evo-path.gif](///raw/b42/3/z/241ee.gif)

### Controls

Left click: Select tree to plant, plant tree.

Right click: Cancel planting.

![chop-chop.gif](///raw/b42/3/z/241ef.gif)

(If you like the game, there are 2 different endings)

entries.title: Journey Through the Blood Tribe Lands
entries.description:
![gif4.gif](///raw/841/4/z/22d71.gif)

**You signed a pact with a deity: great powers to destroy your tribes' enemies in exchange for pieces of your life.**

![Pic2.jpg](///raw/841/4/z/22d77.jpg)

![PIC3.jpg](///raw/841/4/z/22d81.jpg)

entries.title: Depths
entries.description:
![anim8.gif](///raw/e58/2/z/21b10.gif)

Depths is a game about survival. 

You awake in the middle of the ocean, clinging to a piece of driftwood. You have no memory
of how you got here, however you know you need to survive. Unsure of your surroundings,
you set off to explore. 

You find yourself feeling weak, and can barely tread water. Yet somehow, you survive.

As you travel on, the seas become more treacherous. Can you make it through to the end?

**Important**: This game makes some references to suicide. If this is a concern, you may wish
to pass this game up.

## Controls

A Button (Z): Talk/Interact

Directional Pad (Arrow Keys): Move

Start (Enter): Pause


## About the Game

![ld44_001b.png](///raw/e58/2/z/21979.png)

I took a break from my usual carefree game style for this Ludum Dare. I wanted to make something that
has an impact on the player for once. I really am not sure how I feel about how this game came out, but I feel
I had to make it. It probably isn't for everyone, but I guess it was for me.

It was inspired partially by [an article by Anna Borges](https://theoutline.com/post/7267/living-with-passive-suicidal-ideation)

This game was developed for the original Nintendo Entertainment System. A ROM download is available below

It was built using [NES Starter Kit](https://cppchriscpp.github.io/nes-starter-kit) - a C-based game library
for the NES. 

## Contact

Past the close of the competition I probably won‚Äôt be checking comments on this page much. However, feel free to reach out to me on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/cppchriscpp) about it! If I do anything with this in the future I‚Äôll be sure to share there too. Thanks for stopping by.

## Does it really work on the NES?

As usual, yep!

![Photo Apr 28, 9 30 40 PM.jpg](///raw/e58/2/z/2195f.jpg)

entries.title: The Grim Tower
entries.description:
### Conquer the land and sacrifice villagers for greater evil of the Dark Lord!

Battle simulator with spells. Use blood of sacrificed enemies to buy units and unlock spells. Defeat 17 settlements on the ‚ÄúPeaceful Isle‚Äù to satisfy the Dark Lord and fulfill his great plans of world dominance.

Controls: Mouse only

Tips: 
- Make sure to restock on units before every battle. 
- Blood also serves as your health pool in battle.
- Some spells damage both your enemies and your troops.
- Check defense score when choosing next target.
- Spells cost blood to cast, so be sure to not spend all of it on units

![Screen1.jpg](///raw/282/f1/z/22052.jpg)
 ![Screen2.jpg](///raw/282/f1/z/22054.jpg)![Screen3.jpg](///raw/282/f1/z/22055.jpg)

entries.title: ORBid
entries.description:
![YTthumbnail.png](///raw/b6a/f1/z/24fce.png)

## Description
A game about using your life for all types of stuff. Invest your life wisely and you may pass the levels, make foolish decisions and you shall perish.


## Trailer
https://youtu.be/UmGr40w-m40

![gif1.gif](///raw/b6a/f1/z/24fd1.gif)


![gif2.gif](///raw/b6a/f1/z/24fd4.gif)


![gif3.gif](///raw/b6a/f1/z/24fd3.gif)


![gif4.gif](///raw/b6a/f1/z/24fd2.gif)


## Controls
All of the controls are explained in the game, except for the part that you can move with arrow keys not just WASD.

## Developer notes
Couldn't reach the level of polish i wished for, but still very happy with the results. You can mute sound in-game with F1 if it gets too annoying. This is my second time participating in Ludum Dare. The game crashes when you reach level 17 because it's the last level and I wasn't able to add a winning screen in time. I also misspelled the word defeat but I don't think it warrants a patch. I would really appreciate if you could rate my game on itch.io!

Thank you for all the kind comments :heart:


## Post compo minor fixes :

*-Changed WebGL presentation resolution because some people were getting their screen cut off.*

*-Moved enemy behavior from Update() to FixedUpdate() because people with different framerates were getting different enemy speeds.*

*-Fixed a typo in the tutorial text and added the part that says you can move with AWSD.*

entries.title: Animancia
entries.description:
[![Download Animancia](///raw/d10/81/z/23bf4.png)](https://d1gital-cuts.itch.io/animancia)
A game about using your own soul to cast magic. Ok, maybe not just your own

![Animancia_gameplay.gif](///raw/d10/81/z/23bef.gif)

New spells are learned using scrolls (which also reduce your maximum soul capacity).

To cast tier II and III spells, hold the left mouse button.
![ssh.png](///raw/d10/81/z/2354a.png)

entries.title: Leaving with Ladders
entries.description:
## Into the depths, and leaving with ladders

On a walk through the park, you fall down a giant hole. There's only one way out, and it's buying ladders from some jerk.

Every time your heart beats, you lose a dollar, and if it drops to $0, it's game over.

### Controls

W,A,S,D, Spacebar : Movement.

Q: Teleport to shop.

W: Miscellaneous Actions.

Number Keys: Swap selected tool. (1. pickaxe, 2. ladders, 3. lanterns)

Mouse: Aim, Mine, Place Ladders and Lanterns.

![LWL_2.PNG](///raw/b02/2/z/216fd.png)

![LWL_4.PNG](///raw/b02/2/z/21700.png)

![LWL_5.PNG](///raw/b02/2/z/21702.png)

### Pro tip: Keep an eye on your money. If that drops to zero, you're dead. Don't waste all your money on ladders. keep a nice buffer of money to go around.

### Known issue: Don't teleport while touching walls, you'll be stuck when you arrive at the shop.

entries.title: Sick Business
entries.description:
You just started in the hospital business. To get things running you borrowed some money from the Mafia. In return they expect ridiculous amounts of danegeld from you as the doctor. So it‚Äôs up to you to keep the cash flowing, no matter what the cost, or your business will be closed down! But beware, the police is not too keen on seeing body bags being dragged around the streets...

WASD / Arrow keys, Space bar and number keys to control the game. Esc pauses the game. No mouse needed. Gameplay happens in your browser, so no additional download is required.

Story, gameplay, graphics, music, etc. were exclusively created for this game by us. Just some sound effects were taken from freesound.org (all CC0-licensed).

![sickBusiness1.png](///raw/ea2/91/z/22838.png)

![SickBusiness2.png](///raw/ea2/91/z/2284c.png)

![sickBusiness3.png](///raw/ea2/91/z/2283a.png)


Bugfixes - since the release we fixed a couple of bugs in the game. Here's an overview about all the changes we made:
- ending screens could be closed accidentally by pressing space ingame just when the screen appeared; added a short delay where user input is ignored to prevent players from not being able to see the ending screen
- it was possible to continuously restart minigames by holding return key, which was especially confusing with regards to the "give organ" treatment
- fixed minigame description text display to make clear players should use the space key, as some players tried return instead, accidentally ending the training mode (potentially resulting in failed patient treatments and thus casualties and difficulties to beat the game)
- attempt to fix a bug causing game freezes on rare occasions, but unfortunately it didn't seem to work (note: in case you encounter such a crash, it would be quite helpful if you could open the browser dev tools (usually via F12) console and let us know about the error message)
- there was a bug where restarting the game after winning or losing would play the second soundtrack over the first one

NOTE: Please use Chrome or Firefox to play this game for now. Other browsers may not fully support the game, or not run it at all. Sorry for the inconvenience!

entries.title: Microtransaction Mages
entries.description:
Try to get as many stars as possible by throwing fireballs at orcs before they reach your fortress.

![banner_6.png](///raw/aba/3/z/220d0.png)

![screenshots.png](///raw/aba/3/z/21a73.png)

## [Download (Windows)](https://plasmastarfish.itch.io/microtransaction-mages)

## Instructions

ARROW KEYS: Move left and right along the bridge.

SPACE: Shoot a fireball. You can hold space for rapid fire.

ESCAPE: Something needs to fund your constant purchases in-game. Press escape to go to work at your minimum-wage office job.

**Keep an eye out for story elements as you play. The game does have a story and an ending.**

Hope you enjoy!

## About

Made with Pygame!

**All assets, other than fonts and personal logo, made from scratch for the 48-hour Compo.** I started with some base Python code, which you can check out on [my Github](https://github.com/jeremycryan/pyracy). Thanks Paint.NET, MuseScore, and SFXR for being really solid tools.

Be careful about **spoilers in the comments section.**

entries.title: Ghostly Tricks
entries.description:
Leave your body and become a ghost holding your own life. Exchange your life for items at very special vending machines. However, don't take too long to return to your body, because ghosts don't last forever.

*Unfortunately I didn't have time to make many levels so it's pretty short (mostly tutorial)...*

![print1.png](///raw/cbf/91/z/220de.png)

![print2.png](///raw/cbf/91/z/220df.png)

entries.title: Arcade Wizard
entries.description: In this game you must grow stronger by collecting power ups from monsters, but beware the power ups cost lives!![ludum3.png](///raw/f12/42/z/20f96.png)

entries.title: Designated Victim
entries.description:
Dear Citizen,

Congratulations! You have been chosen to be the next Designated Victim of Vokania. Effective now, life energy originating from YOU is considered the currency of this country. Be proud that you served Vokania.

As you may have noticed, most of your life energy has already been expropriated by the state for the greater good. However, to keep the process humane, enough energy was left in you for about 60 seconds of life.

Please live the rest of your life here peacefully, and do not touch the Portable Life Drainer if an official accidentally left it beside you. Have a nice day!

![gameplay.gif](///raw/483/32/z/2110a.gif)

## Controls

* Movement - W/A/S/D
* Buy Upgrade - E
* Mouse - Aim
* Left Mouse Button: Fire
* Right Mouse Button: Switch Polarity
* Esc: Pause

**As some players are confused about this in comment section: You can only interact with the vendor machines while standing in front of them!** To progress in the tutorial, you have to stand in front of the vendor machine and press E.

## Prologue

Ever since life energy manipulation is known to Vokania, raw life energy has soon attained the status of currency for its enormous value. To regulate the draining of life energy, the position of Designated Victim is created by the state, as the only person whose life energy can be legally drained and used as currency.

Today, you were picked to be that person.

Just as you think you're going to die in around 60 seconds, you found this curious "Portable Life Drainer" device lying conveniently beside you... Maybe by using it, you can take your life back?

The moment you tried to activate it, a loud alarm pierced the concrete walls. Oh well. Looks like there is no turning back now.

## Tools Used

- Godot Engine
- Krita
- sfxr
- Studio One

## Fonts

- Silkscreen: http://www.kottke.org/plus/type/silkscreen/index.html
- SH PINSCHER: https://www.behance.net/gallery/49541299/SH-Pinscher-Free-Bitmap-Font

entries.title: Die Back
entries.description:
![ezgif-2-f78c773f796c.gif](///raw/b82/a/z/22f30.gif)

## WELCOME TO "DIE BACK"

Beat all the 10 opponents if you can!

You may trade your **Life force** for skills between the fights. Then you just relax and enjoy - the battle is automatic. Every enemy has different tactics! Be careful and use your cunning to win.

Three abilities are available for purchase before each battle. Buy by clicking on them, or roll if you want to try getting something else. Each action's price is below it. Also every ability has a tooltip with info.

You may reorder the abilities you have to change priority for spells. You may also sell them for half the price. Press **fight** button when you are ready. **Escape** opens main menu. **Space** pauses the fight.

![tutor1.png](///raw/b82/a/z/22338.png)

![tutor2.png](///raw/b82/a/z/22344.png)

The team behind Die Back is **Konfa Games**. We are the three guys, who released [Despotism 3k](http://store.steampowered.com/app/699920/Despotism_3k/), which was originally developed for LudumDare39.

entries.title: The Tail of the Serpent
entries.description:
Little puzzle game where the snake body is the solution. 

You are what you eat.

Enjoy!

![Screenshot 01.PNG](///raw/a1e/2/z/22810.png)

Disclaimer: The web version takes you to the level selection menu instead of the next level because HTML5. The original version (Windows) does let you play all the levels in sequence without having to access the level selection menu.

entries.title: Little Baby Bloodbag
entries.description:
## Raise an army of friends and escape the lab! 
Play it here! [https://trevorshoe.itch.io/little-baby-blood-bag](https://trevorshoe.itch.io/little-baby-blood-bag)

![LBBB_ScreenCap1.PNG](///raw/227/22/z/21919.png)

## Instructions
Raise as many zombie pals as you can, and escape the lab. Replenish blood by consuming your zombies.

## Controls
- **Arrow Keys** or WASD to move
- **Space bar** to raise dead (1m range)
- **Shift key** to steal blood from zombies (1m range)


Created for Ludum Dare 44, "Your Life Is Currency." Started out as a game about selling blood, and ended up with zombies. Funny how that happens :)

Game development in Unity. Art assets created in Maya and Photoshop. SFX recorded in Audacity. Music dynamically generated using Wolfram Tones.

**Thanks for playing!**
Play it here! [https://trevorshoe.itch.io/little-baby-blood-bag](https://trevorshoe.itch.io/little-baby-blood-bag)

![LBBB_ScreenCap2.PNG](///raw/227/22/z/21911.png)

![LBBB_ScreenCap3.PNG](///raw/227/22/z/21918.png)

![LBBB_ScreenCap5.png](///raw/227/22/z/21934.png)

entries.title: Pucamuc
entries.description:
![logo.png](///raw/989/d/z/23463.png)
**Pucamuc** is a platformer where you control **Puck**, who wants to get an iFone. The problem is that Puck cannot walk, he can only jump. To make the matters worse, the payment is done by blood, and his only source of blood are chickens and babies.

![puckgif.gif](///raw/989/d/z/23790.gif)

The game is made by **Mors**, with music and sounds from **Catonator** and additional promotional art from **irri**!

![scr2.png](///raw/989/d/z/23535.png)

**Changelog:**

**1.0.1:** Windows build! Fixed an issue with the HTML5 version where Puck would double jump while holding the jump button. It seems to be an issue with GameMaker and I had to use a workaround so please let me know if it still happens.  I've also fixed a part where you'd die by just jumping on a bounce block.

**1.0:** Initial release.

![enjoy.png](///raw/989/d/z/234d8.png)

entries.title: 15 Minutes to Live
entries.description:
The year is 20XX. Ageing is a thing of the past, and all humans have predetermined lifespans, shown by digital clocks embedded in their arm. Time can be bought, sold, or traded - just like a currency.

You are Vance Anderson. Your lifespan has just been stolen. **You have 15 minutes to live.**

...unless you can find whoever is responsible.

![preview.png](///raw/da6/11/z/20fc1.gif)

**Controls:**
- Arrows: Move
- Z: Talk
- X: View inventory

**Changelog:**
- 29/04/2019: Fixed incorrect names and broken restart button.
- 29/04/2019: Fixed missing event flags
- 07/05/2019: Fixed "hitbox" for talking to NPCs

Made entirely from scratch in the TIC-80 engine.

entries.title: Bloodletter
entries.description:
You're stuck in hell with your trusty shotgun and your only choice is to shoot your way out. You have made a deal with the gods to buy time with your own life to help you in your battles.

Bloodletter is a stylish old-school inspired First-Person Shooter with multiple levels and difficulty settings to cater to more people.

The game is built on the FTE QuakeWorld engine, which gives it an authentic quake-like feel. The QuakeC source code is included in the downloads in the game/src directory under MIT license. 

Other tools used:

- 3d: Blender

- Mapping: NetRadiant

- 2d: GIMP

- Sound: Audacity

- Music: SunVox

![fte-20190429023221-0.png](///raw/a57/41/z/21535.png)
![fte-20190429024107-0.png](///raw/a57/41/z/2153c.png)
![fte-20190429024205-0.png](///raw/a57/41/z/21542.png)
![fte-20190429024247-0.png](///raw/a57/41/z/21545.png)

entries.title: BETRAYDED
entries.description:
[![title.png](///raw/e33/1/z/221c2.png)](https://roilbauk.itch.io/betrayded)

### [PLAY HERE (Web - 2 players)](https://roilbauk.itch.io/betrayded)    
![jump_shadow.png](///raw/e33/1/z/221e1.png)
During the Cold War era, two enemy factions __trade their prisoners' lives:__ spies who were captured.


__Hands and legs tied down__, prisoners must find their way through the exchange area, having their movement ability limited. They must __reach their ally faction__, going as fast as they can! 

Indeed, the factions __might not be as honest__ as you think‚Ä¶

![006.png](///raw/e33/1/z/2267e.png)

![003.png](///raw/e33/1/z/22146.png)

![007.png](///raw/e33/1/z/22681.png)

[BETRAYDED](https://roilbauk.itch.io/betrayded) is a __two-player__ platforming, duelling and racing game. 
You can __impede your opponent__ and stun him to earn a few __precious seconds__‚Ä¶ 
![chief_shadow.png](///raw/e33/1/z/221e6.png)
Once you have reached your allies, the victory is almost yours! 
One last thing must be done in order to satisfyingly close the deal‚Ä¶
![bazooka_shadow.png](///raw/e33/1/z/221e5.png)

#### Instructions:

- [__Click here to start playing !__](https://roilbauk.itch.io/betrayded)
- Use __W__ (P1) and __UP__ (P2) to jump
- Use __A__/__D__ (P1) and __LEFT__/__RIGHT__ (P2) to pick a jump direction
- Save your prisoner first, then aim your opponent with your rockets before he runs away!

__/!\ QWERTY__

#### Made by :

- Thomas Gu√©gan (@Barbiche) : Game Design, Development
- Maxime Chabance (@Drestin) : Game Design, Development
- Lo√Øc Touzard (@Roilbauk: Game Design, Development, Level Design
- Aur√©lien Coussat (@acoussat) : Game Design, Development
- Erwann Martin (@Entropy) : Sound Design
- Pierre Terakopiantz (@karreg) : Game Design, Pixel Art

#### Made with :
- Dev : Construct 2
- Pixel art : Aseprite
- Sound design : Ableton

![skull_shadow.png](///raw/e33/1/z/222aa.png)

----

#### Update :
We did some bugfix according to some comments people posted (no gameplay modification). You can pick whichever game version you like both are available : in jam time version, and bugfix version. You can check the patchnote to make up your mind.

#### Bugfix patchnote :
- The cinematic can now be skipped pressing "spacebar" even on the first time you see it.
- Replaced reachable barbed wires' sprites with regular platforms' sprites. Barbed wires were misleading the idea of 'danger', which was not the case.
- Applied pixel font to the texts missing it.
- Fixed asymmetric platforms.
- Title screen's music is now correctly looping.
- Fixed the infinite rocket's sound bug.

entries.title: Battle Hearts!
entries.description:
**PLAY HERE: (HTML5)** https://barrierx.itch.io/battle-hearts-ld44

If you get a **black screen** in **Chrome**, do this: Chrome -> Settings -> Advanced Settings -> Enable Hardware Acceleration


You are a space BLOB with 7 hearts, no hands and the evil Blobs are coming for you!
But don't worry! Your hearts turn into guns!

![DragToStart.gif](///raw/e9f/81/z/20ca5.gif)
But don't leave them out for too long! They need to go back inside your body to recharge.


You can also sell your hearts for increased firepower
![SellHeart5.gif](///raw/e9f/81/z/20ca7.gif)


And don't pull out your last heart!
![LastHeart.gif](///raw/e9f/81/z/20ca6.gif)


Full playthrough video here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hBATXREdROw

Probably best if you play the HTML5 version or download the windows version.
Android works but it probably won't be very playable on a small screen.
Unity project is not structured very well and the code started getting really hacky :>

entries.title: Fehu
entries.description:
![screens1.png](///raw/c24/z/22685.png)

Fehu is a solo project made using Unity 2019, Photoshop CC, and Audacity. I used the full 72 hours, and some code snippets from previous projects, so this is a Jam entry.

The only controls are the mouse. Click in a direction to move along paths, and click on certain elements in the environment to interact with them.

entries.title: Mr. Bank's Journey
entries.description:
![itch-banner.png](///raw/d21/z/21fb6.png)
![ld-explain.png](///raw/d21/z/220f6.png)
Mr. Bank wants to go home. Find money so that you can buy a bus ticket to your next destination. Plan out the route that will get you the most money, and use your weight to your advantage.

entries.title: Inflate Me to the Moon
entries.description:
[Cocoa Moss](https://cocoamoss.com/) presents: **Inflate Me to the Moon**

![itch-io-gif.gif](///raw/b57/z/24b60.gif)

![title_downscaled.png](///raw/b57/z/24b5f.png)

A really weird game.

Harness the power of inflation, to FLY TO THE MOON.

**This game best played using a mouse.**  (Sorry trackpad users!)

Known issues:

- **You need to move your mouse REALLY REALLY FAST to fan the flame on the 3rd level** [Fixed in Post-Jam version]
- Cutscenes can occasionally drift out of sync (esp when losing focus)
- Sounds potentially cut out sometimes (too many being played) [Fixed in Post-Jam version]
- I know people want their cursor to be locked inside the game window, but it isn't quite yet possible.  The hammer swing is based on relative movements not absolute position, so just swing your mouse up and down wildly :D [Works better in Post-Jam version]

**Post-Jam version (v1.02): https://cocoamoss.com/inflate-me-to-the-moon/inflate-me-to-the-moon.html**

**iOS: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/inflate-me-to-the-moon/id1462594167**

**Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.cocoamoss.inflatemetothemoon**

**Jam version (v0.03): https://ddrkirby.com/games/inflate-me-to-the-moon/compo-version/inflate-me-to-the-moon-compo.html**

**Soundtrack download: https://ddrkirbyisq.bandcamp.com/album/inflate-me-to-the-moon-original-soundtrack**

Post-jam version mainly introduces a bunch of quality-of-life improvements, along with some very minor additions and fixes.  Full changelog below for reference.

Programming, Audio, and Cutscenes by @ddrkirbyisq

Animation by @xellaya

Voiceover by @ddrkirbyisq

Additional credits:

- SNES instruments from Chrono Trigger, Earthbound, Super Mario Kart, Illusion of Gaia, Final Fantasy VI, Final Fantasy: Mystic Quest, etc.
- "Fly Me to the Moon" original arrangement by Bart Howard
- References those styles along with To the Moon, Viva La Vida, Undertale, Ducktales, etc.
- **Everything is derivative works (rearranged from scratch), so we're still OK to be rated in audio :)**

Changelog:

```
v1.02 (Post-Jam)
- Update site lock code

v1.01
- Recompile to allow offline play via the itch.io app

v1.00
- First mobile release - added touch controls for hammering phase
- Redo difficulty curves for fanning the flame -- especially for level 3 which was way too hard before
- Made hammer and fan based on absolute mouse/touch position instead of relative movement
- Added skip functionality for all cutscenes (hold mouse button or touch to skip)
- Added new sfx/particles for end of flattening phase
- Make tutorial displays show for a bit longer (first 3 actions instead of 1)
- Significant performance improvements when there are many turtles to reduce FPS drops
- Added faster tempo intro fanfares for levels 2 and 3 to match the main music tempo
- Add some additional notes to the ending text
- Trim silence for sound effects to prevent exhausting sfx channels
- Very minor tweaks to some music files

v0.03 (Jam)
- Tried fixing cutscenes getting off sync when app loses focus (changed a single setting)

v0.02
- Made the application keep running even when in the background

v0.01
- First release!
```

entries.title: Drowning in the Rain
entries.description:
![ld44_ss01.gif](///raw/c1/z/21c87.gif)

Drowning in the Rain is an autobiographical vignette with mild puzzle elements. It covers a very important and difficult period of my life.

**Description**  
I took a slightly lateral approach to the theme this time. If we take 'Your life is currency' as a statement directed at the reader it reads 'My life is currency' or put another way 'My life has value', 'My life is meaningful'. With this in mind I created a small abstract narrative experience about a five year period of my life that began with the death of my father.

**Instructions**  
*wasd+mouse* to move, *c* to crouch/stand, and *LMB* to interact. There are clues in the narration for what to do next. Headphones are highly recommended.

**Tools**
- Unity  
- Clip Studio Paint  
- Audacity  
- Notes(OS X)  
- Wacom Bamboo  
- MacBook Pro  
- A cheap PS4 headset microphone

**Walkthrough**  
If you get stuck, but would still like to see the whole game here is a little walkthrough.

*Shave*
!>Take the scythe from the statue and cut all the tall grass

*Growing*  
!>Take the ring and plant it in the patch of dirt opposite the statue

*Feed*  
!>Take fruit from tree and feed fruit to goblins

*Listen*
!>Stand near the scarecrow until he finishes talking

*Shattering*  
!>Break open all the eggs

*Carry*  
!>Take the pixel from the last egg and walk off into the fog

![ld44_ss02.png](///raw/c1/z/21c9c.png)

entries.title: Maeko's Memories
entries.description:
![Ludum_Dare_44_2019-04-29_21-25-22.png](///raw/7ae/5/z/233b4.png)


Maeko is a single mother with a 15-year-old daughter, struggling to make ends meet. One day she gains consciousness outside a curious shop, with no memory of how she arrived there. She learns from the proprietor of the shop that she decided to sell her life experiences, that is, her memories. Now she can‚Äôt remember what happened in the last three days. At all.
 
With her newfound credits, Maeko could choose to buy back her memories -- to learn what really happened to her -- or maybe just spend it all on a top-of-the-line audio system. It‚Äôs up to the player to decide what Maeko remembers ‚Ä¶ and what she forgets.

_All writing, art, and audio, created in 72 hours. Visual novel engine also created from scratch._

**Note:** In the original version first day of the game is playable (and you can also access Maeko's lost memories, if you manage your currency). In the full version, all three days of the game are playable, and with seven endings to unlock! Please base your rating on the original version.

Thank you!

![Ludum_Dare_44_2019-04-29_21-21-39.png](///raw/7ae/5/z/233b2.png)
![Ludum_Dare_44_2019-04-29_21-21-02.png](///raw/7ae/5/z/233ae.png)

entries.title: Paynplayne
entries.description:
‚ÄãYou have finally sprouted as a being whose body can turn PAIN into GOLD.

Your creator, M, a witch, has a simple task for you: Bring a letter to her sister at the other end of the Paynplayne...

---

Short experience. Should take a little under 10 minutes to complete.

CONTROLS:  
[ARROWS]       - Move  
[NUMBERS 1-5]  - Inventory  
[A]            - Interact / Confirm  
[S]            - Use selected item  
[D]            - Skip dialogue  
[LSHIFT]       - Sprint  
 
---

Everything (visuals, sound effects, music) was made within the 48 hour period. The game uses a base that I wrote beforehand for blank gamemaker projects that includes player handling, collisions, dialogue, etc.

A lot of features didn't make the cut, but oh well. I hope it's an enjoyable experience for its size!

entries.title: The Cult of the Morning Star
entries.description:
You find an old book in your attic. You decide to read it. Big mistake, you are now a devout worshipper of Az'gath the Slain. You must do everything in your power to summon him from the depths of hell. Even sacrificing yourself and the lives of fellow cultists to achieve your goal.

## Clarification of the rules
**NOTE**: If you want to discover the mechanics of the game yourself, don't read this.

The end goal of the game is to summon Az'gath the slain. To summon him you play the card "Ultimate Summoning".
For you to be able to play the card you need to awaken the Triad of Destruction. The according crystal in the summoning circle will light up when a member of the triad of destruction has been summoned. After three days you will get the first card to start this quest.
 
## Clarifications of the mechanics
You have two types of cards: Sacrifice Cards & Event Cards. Sacrifice Cards reside to the left and Event Cards to the right. You can play a maximum of three cards per turn but only one sacrifice card per turn. The gems in the top right corner light up to indicate the cards played this turn. If you press the Favor meter in the bottom center you can draw a second card at the cost of 10 favor

In the top left corner there is a suspicion meter. The gem will change color from green to red as you gain more suspicion. When the gem turns completely red (when suspicion reaches 20+) there's a chance to trigger a raid event. If the raid event is triggered you lose your suspicion, cultists and favor.

![ScreenShot.PNG](///raw/cfa/z/232d5.png)![ScreenShot2_Compresesed.PNG](///raw/cfa/z/23381.png)![ScreenShot3_Compressed.PNG](///raw/cfa/z/23384.png)

**Changelog:**
+ Fixed a bug where failing to summon a demon would sometimes give you two summon cards back
+ Fixed various graphical issues pertaining to cards and the card overlays
+ Fixed some mismatches between what cards say they do and what they actually do

entries.title: Venture-Out!
entries.description:
Venture-Out is a mix between classic Breakout and classic Nintendo ARPGs like The Legend of Zelda.
Or at least, it would be if I'd had the time to flesh it out some more!
It is winnable in its current form: Find a way to open the two chests.

The game is made for DOS, using Watcom C and NASM to produce the binaries.
To run it, double-click on one of the batch files to launch DOSBox in your preferred configuration.
Once done, you might have to manually exit DOSBox by closing the window or typing 'exit' and hitting enter.

The idea behind this is to invest in a bit of a risk by cutting into your life-pool (Your spare balls) to
get the items you need to clear the game.

Due to the obviously rushed nature of the game, things are a little bit rough around the edges: The ball
is just using pure diagonal movement with no angular change. This can make things a bit tricky.
If you have enough spare balls, you can launch some extra ones!

=== GAME CONTROLS ===
 - PADDLE MOVEMENT-> Arrow Keys
 - LAUNCH A BALL -> Spacebar
 - CHANGE SELECTED BALL TYPE -> TAB
 - EXIT GAME -> ESCAPE

Move off-screen to change between areas.

If you're on the screen with a door in the cliff, press UP to enter it (That's the shop).
To choose an item, use the LEFT and RIGHT arrow keys, and press SPACE to select.
To leave the shop, press DOWN.

Thank you for trying this game out!

entries.title: DEADline
entries.description:
![intro_540.gif](///raw/7f2/3/z/24d44.gif)

You are a lone cursor in a cruel world full of words. Avoid the terrible deadline by typing the platforms that are gonna carry you to your victory or at least prolong your short existence. **Create platforms by typing them and platforming around to score as many words as possible**. 
 
Words are your path, your score, your lifeblood and your currency as you can spend them in shops to make the typing and platforming a bit easier. 

![deadline_upgrades.gif](///raw/7f2/3/z/24e32.gif)  

### Controls:
- **Movement - A/D**
- **Jumping - Space**
- **Pause - ESC**
- **Words and all** - everything else is controlled by, well, **typing**
- **Purchasing upgrades** from shops is done by typing *buy*
- **Double/Super Jump** - both of these can be charged by typing their respective words

![main_1__540.gif](///raw/7f2/3/z/24ab2.gif)

#### Changelog
*1.0.1*
- fix: trigger-based walljump
- fix: grace jumps take precedence over trigger-based walljumps
- fix: superjump powerup description
- fix: the first shop is always preceeded by a horizontally moving platform (to reduce the number wonky level gen)
- added: main menu and an online leaderboard - please take that into consideration when rating  

*1.0.2*
- fix: score data should no longer be invalidated by alt-tabbing during the run
- tweak: leaderboard - only the top score per player is shown

*1.1.0 - POSTJAM* (rate 1.0.2)
- added toggleable CO-OP mode (P1 just types, P2 controls the cursor, disables leaderboards, enables gamepad controls)
- added AZERTY support

*1.1.1 - POSTJAM* (rate 1.0.2)
- fix: springs should not activate when ovelapping with the player
- added: WebGL version
- tweak: player sprite skewing is limited per frame to prevent glaring visual glitches when dropping frames (looking at you, WebGL)

*I recorded my top run (and added a death reel just for funsies)*  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q0OwtG1UABQ


#### Credits
The lovely music tracks are from *[incompetech](http://incompetech.com/music/royalty-free/).*  
- *Villainous Treachery Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)  *
- *Comic Plodding Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)*  
*Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License  
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/*

entries.title: Cold Dream
entries.description:
A survival solitaire card game. You've been exiled to a decommissioned science station on Makemake and left to die. Every turn, a new crisis arises and you have a handful of cards with different effects that you can use to try and keep all your vital stats above zero.

I haven't had the chance to take part in Ludum Dare for a long time, and it really showed. I was a lot slower at pretty much every stage of the process. Well, I'm still delighted that I managed to finish something - it was touch and go for a while.

Please note that Edge is not currently supported. Maybe the game runs, but it looks all wonky! Perhaps try the game in Firefox or Chrome.

Software: VS Code, Inkscape, Krita, FL Studio + EWQLSO, Firefox, Chrome, Windows.
Code base: extracted some bits from one of my previous entries.

entries.title: Sigillis
entries.description:
![Gif Main.gif](///raw/48d/d1/z/21d6c.gif)

## [Play it now, WEB, WIN, LINUX, MAC](https://justcamh.itch.io/sigillis)

# Draw on the screen to cast spells. 

Pay attention to the different symbols, which will be required to defeat enemies. Sacrifice your health to buy special spells that have custom effects, or to swap out unwanted or complex symbols with easier ones. 

### Post jam fixes released

A bunch of bugs, brought to my attention by you awesome people have been patched! The game is otherwise the same, you're just less likely to fall into a messy pit of bugs.

### How it works

The game uses a pattern recognition algorithm that I developed entirely during the 48 hour jam period. The algorithm scales your drawing to a constant size, then compares it against all the patterns in the game. The main feature of the algorithm is flexibility; each step has a wide range of acceptable inputs to ensure that a match is found. Unity source code available below. More info will be available in an upcoming devlog, if you're interested, you can [follow me on Itch.io](https://justcamh.itch.io/) to be notified of when that comes out. 


Please enjoy, downloads (and WebGL version) below! :smile:

entries.title: Gravy Train
entries.description:
Can you learn quickly on the job?

If not, you might get cleaned out, because these darn green guys just keep interfering!

Well, at least you have the one tool that solves all of life's problems: a shovel.

![SS1-Start.png](///raw/81b/z/21958.png)

Dev Notes:
---------

(You don't have to read this to play)

This LD was unusual.  I generally leave sound effects for the very end, but I just couldn't get down to the gameplay core without making the train feel more alive... so a huge part of Saturday was a diversion into the land of foley sound recording.  The various sounds are made mostly from items I found in my kitchen.

After doing a weird game last time, I told myself that LD44 would be a return to simple arcade fun... and then I made this.  So much for plans!

Still, I hope you enjoy your ride on the Gravy Train.

Love to hear what you think, good or bad.

-P

entries.title: Insert Coin
entries.description:

![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/aae/1/z/237b3.png)

![Screenshot_4.png](///raw/aae/1/z/237b5.png)

![Screenshot_2.png](///raw/aae/1/z/237b8.png)

![Screenshot_3.png](///raw/aae/1/z/237bc.png)

### Genre:

Narrative platformer

### Description:

Experience the most important cases of Bell, a private investigator. Discover the moments of his deepest regrets or the remnants of his joy ‚Äì you decide. Anything could happen in a world where to live longer you'd only have to... insert coin.

* 3 difficult cases
* 3 endings
* 3 coins hidden per level

P. S. For those only interested in the story and not the platforming challenge, try typing in "2244" while in-game. ;)

### Controls:

* A/D or Left/Right ‚Äì Moving left/right
* W or Up or Space ‚Äì Jumping
* X or J ‚Äì Moving your clone to your position 
* C or K ‚Äì Teleporting to your clone
* Arrows/Enter ‚Äì Navigating the menus, dialogues
* Escape ‚Äì Pausing (in-game)

### Credits:

* Art, Animation ‚Äì Tay Elenberg (@tay-elenberg)
* Programming ‚Äì Gil4 (@gil4)
* Music ‚Äì NZ-Odin-Wattan (@warrior-of-love)

### Hotfix 30.04.2019 - v.1.1:

* Fixed sounds not playing with proper volume frequently (damn OpenAL).
* Fixed letterboxing on higher resolutions.
* Fixed two dialogue typos.
* Changed one name in the credits (per its owner request).
* Fixed one decorations layer Z-position.

entries.title: Penny Arcane
entries.description:
https://youtu.be/URUn2yxeRaI

![ld-banner.png](///raw/bda/41/z/229a1.png)


You‚Äôve done it this time. They all warned you not to get involved with the Dirty Cash Cult, but you didn‚Äôt listen. Also, you were in way over your head and weren‚Äôt able to come through on your promises. Now they‚Äôre demanding payment by 7 o‚Äôclock.. You‚Äôve got to make some major cash fast. Nobody makes a fool of Penny Arcane! You‚Äôve heard tell of an underground den close-by that‚Äôs crawling with treasure-hoarding monsters. It‚Äôs risky, but what other option do you have? Time to pay back your debt!

![longhero-ld.gif](///raw/bda/41/z/24073.gif)

Penny Arcane is a rogue-like dungeon crawler where you play as a coin mage named Penny. Battle your way through the randomly generated dungeon acquiring quirky items and gold. Use your powerful coin magic wisely at the cost of health, but with the ability to heal with coins. Find shops, ATMs, and chests along the way and reach the end to fight a challenging boss with three heads. Be wary though, that doggo isn't the only thing that bites!

![mimic.gif](///raw/bda/41/z/24070.gif)

[Listen to the soundtrack here on BandCamp](https://juniperparadise.bandcamp.com/album/penny-arcane-original-soundtrack)

## === Controls ===

WASD - Run

Shift - Dash

Mouse - Aim

F - Interact

Left Mouse Button - Fire!

Right Mouse Button - Angry Fireball

Q - Dazzle

E - Coin Shield

R - Make It Rain

Escape - Pause Menu

Toggle Fullscreen - alt + enter

** BUG FIXES: **

** -Fixed teleporter text disappearing **

** -Fixed enemy healthbars disappearing **

** -Fixed damage text disappearing **

** -Stats now display properly at end of game **

** -Added video resolution options to address bug for mouse only moving in top left of screen and enabled full screen toggle with alt+enter **

![cerberus.gif](///raw/bda/41/z/24071.gif)

## === Contributors ===

Code: Patrick Hill / Aron Hommas / Kevin Ulrich

Art: Sam Bragg

Music & Sound: Tristan Deniet

Script: Tristan Deniet

entries.title: G√ñLDF
entries.description:
**Browser version available, plus Windows and MacOS builds!**

Think you're good at golf? Then put your money where your balls are... _were_... LOOK, IT'S GOLF WITH COINS, OK?!

Each time you shoot a coin, its value reduces by $1 - when it hits 0, that coin is dead: you can't take any more shots with it! You'll also encounter obstacles that require payment to remove or use: fences cost currency to smash down, and pressure pads only trigger when coins of sufficient value sit on them. It's a mercenary world out on the G√ñLDF course!

Remember: GOLD + GOLF + an umlaut for no reason = G√ñLDF

**Controls**
- Click and drag back to shoot a coin (aim and power will be shown)
- Arrow keys to pan the camera around
- Use "Prev" and "Next" buttons to jump camera between coins
- "Reset level" if you get stuck!

![Screenshot2Small.png](///raw/b8b/61/z/22ae7.png) 

![Screenshot3Small.png](///raw/b8b/61/z/22ae9.png)

All assets (art, music, SFX, code) were made from scratch during the jam by our team.

Your overall score will be shown at the end - the more $$$ the better! Let us know how you do, and let's see who can get the best score!

entries.title: altar of a dark god
entries.description:
A simple strategy game, featuring a lot of programmer art, excessively dramatic music, and so, so many bugs.

Made with Unity 2019, Photoshop, Maya, and Hookpad.

You are a dark god, trying to gain a community of followers so you can gain enough power to emerge into the world.

You can sacrifice your followers to gain power (their lives are your currency), then use your power to build new buildings for your community. Pick off only as many as you can afford, since you also need them to create more followers for you!

Your followers will fall in love, grow old, and die. If you arm them, they'll even fight for you (but they're bad at it).

The basics (most of this is explained in-game too):
- Followers will only fall in love (and thus make new followers) if there's available housing. So start by making some houses.
- Use towers and smithies for defense.
- Use temples to gain followers faster.
- Use graveyards and statues to gain power faster.
- **The bonuses granted by temples, graveyards, and statues each stack up to 10 times.**
- If you have a lot of power but not enough followers, choose a follower and press [E] to make them spontaneously have a baby. An EVIL baby. (Okay, it's just a regular baby.)
- Once you have a lot of followers, you can use Mass Sacrifice [M] to sacrifice a lot of them at once and gain lots of power!

![darkgod00.png](///raw/187/c/z/20f32.png)

![darkgod01.png](///raw/187/c/z/20f38.png)

entries.title: ÔΩâÔΩéÔΩñÔΩÖÔΩíÔΩîÔΩÖÔΩÇÔΩíÔΩÅÔΩÖ
entries.description:
![header.png](///raw/36d/b/z/21734.png)

ÔΩâÔΩéÔΩñÔΩÖÔΩíÔΩîÔΩÖÔΩÇÔΩíÔΩÅÔΩÖ is a short text adventure about a person coming home from work, and then the time after, and then the time before.

The game runs in your browser. Make sure to keep your sound on!

This is a puzzle game, so some answers will be tricky. However, if you feel like you're really stuck, don't worry! Take a look at [the internal story guide](https://github.com/y2bd/invertebrae/blob/master/src/story.json). Feel free to use it to get back on the right path (or heck, get on all the paths!).

**Update (May 3)**:

First post-jam update! Contains the following quality of life fixes:

- Make keywords in the story **bold** so they stand out a bit more
- Add the ability to double-click on keywords to automatically move them around (drag-and-drop still works too!)
  - **May 4:** Fix regression where you could double click words as many times as you want
- Add less cryptic help text to the help button for people who are actually looking for helpful help
- Add some automatic scaling to account for smaller screen sizes

As no changes to the story or puzzles were made (nor were any bugs fixed!) I'd wholly recommend playing the updated version. However, if you are an honorable purist, the original version is still linked below

entries.title: The Last Drop
entries.description:
![main.png](///raw/62d/32/z/24356.png)

## Introduction

Imagine a lonely water sprite living in a borderless desert... Luckily you have the plants to keep you company. However, the plants needs water to grow up, and the only water source is YOUR OWN BODY. What's more, you have to defend your garden from the endless monsters in the night, and your only weapon is also the liquid inside you. How long can you survive, when the only resource is the current inside you?

**Plant seeds into the soil, water them, and they will bear fruits in the following days. The fruits can either rehydrate the water sprite or give you permanent buffs. Defeat the monsters in the night to find more seeds.**

## How to Play

**In the Days**: Use WASD to move. Move near a block of soil to plant seeds. You should water them so that they can bear fruits in the following days. CLICK THE CLOCK in the bottom-right, when you are ready, to enter the night.

**In the Nights**: Use WASD to move. Hold left mouse button to shoot bullets. Click right mouse button to throw bombs towards the cursor.

![9.png](///raw/4f9/32/z/23cf3.png)

## Tips

**Use right click wisely.** Water bomb can do AOE damage but will cost you considerable health in the beginning period.

**Don't water all the seeds you have.** Make sure you have a good health bar for the night fight.

**100 HP is not maximum health.** The character have 3 states with different full health.

**The Ghost is invincible before it splits.** Sorry, maybe it's a bug that we have no art effect to show this. If it come near enough to you it will split. Please let it split first then attack it.

![bS5TTe.png](///raw/62d/32/z/2433e.png)

## Videos & Screenshots

https://youtu.be/X7Tjby7DQeE

![1](///raw/b89/32/z/22e49.png)

![2](///raw/b89/32/z/22e56.png)

![3](///raw/b89/32/z/22e5f.png)

Enjoy our game!

entries.title: TRIWAR
entries.description:
![cover_small.png](///raw/3c8/91/z/23ac6.png)

Play the game at https://donitz.itch.io/triwar

**TRIWAR** is a strategy game about revenge and triangles. The high priestess of Tressia shall vindicate her fallen civilization by transforming the very life of her enemies.

**TRIWAR** can be played in the browser using keyboard+mouse (highly recommended), mouse-only or with touch devices.

The game was coded in pure Javascript ES6 (so no Internet explorer, sorry). An interesting sidenote: This is the first game I've made which is completely devoid of graphical assets. Everything in the game is rendered through Javascript as 2D shapes. As a result this game will render crisply at any resolution.

Another tidbit: The AI in this game was based on a boids-like model, with each unit type having its own rules: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boids

I hope you enjoy the game!

![screenshot_1.png](///raw/3c8/91/z/2256e.png)

![screenshot_0.png](///raw/3c8/91/z/2256f.png)

![screenshot_2.png](///raw/3c8/91/z/22571.png)

entries.title: Blocks for Life
entries.description:
At the start of each level there is a shop. You can spend hearts on 3 things:

- Blocks: use these to build bridges, barriers, and to clobber monsters
- Jetpack fuel: press and hold jump while in mid-air to use your jetpack
- Gems: become your final score

Life is replenished on completing each level.
Monsters also drop fuel and blocks sometimes.
You can modify your block placement with up+left/right etc.

Hope you have fun! -- zep <3

entries.title: Faustian Sands
entries.description:
![ld44_submission_screenshot.png](///raw/fc0/42/z/2105d.png)

When I first saw the theme, I spent some time thinking and then wrote the following:

> 'Life' is not just our physical body or our conscious mind - it is everything we interactive with too. Even the stars in the sky are a part of our life.
>
> Would you give one of these things for another?
>
> How much would you give up?

This was the interpretation of the theme that I had in mind going into the compo, and hopefully this idea is reflected in the game.

### Controls

When given options, use the `Number Keys` to choose. Otherwise, use the `Enter Key` to proceed.

`F11` toggles fullscreen mode.


### Change Log
* 1.0.1 Fixes game-breaking bug where seeing all events would enter an infinite loop and freeze the game.

entries.title: See:NoMore
entries.description:
![](///content/96/z/233e8.png)

A massive international corporation called the Global Indexing Foundation is reaching new records for tracking nearly every persons activities in their daily lives. Will you just stand by and watch, or will you act?

![](///raw/96/z/2364e.png)

I apologize for the lack of music, sound effects, and ambiance; I usually put a lot of effort into audio, but this time I had to focus on the story and puzzles this time around. :sweat_smile:

I also definitely get that it doesn't strictly follow the theme, it's mostly just in the undertones of what the G.I.F. is involved with: selling people's private data.

entries.title: Hollow Priest
entries.description:
![header.png](///raw/34a/d1/z/217c7.png)
![UE4Editor_2019-04-28_12-50-33.png](///raw/34a/d1/z/21116.png)
![2019-04-28_12-52-59.png](///raw/34a/d1/z/21118.png)

Second Ludum Dare. This theme started out as a personal favorite. 
Very creatively challenging theme, I'm sure others have come up with better ways to utilize it.
That said, i had fun. I didn't push myself as hard as I did last time though, that was brutal.

This game is about using your "life force" as a resource to launch magic, and in doing so, propel yourself around the map.
Scoring is based on how few deaths you managed before reaching the end.

It's purposefully very difficult, which makes it fun for replay-abilty. Pause menu allows you to reset the game if you want to reset the death counter and skip checkpoints.

https://youtu.be/yYb5JGPLVio

```
Controls

    WASD - Move
    Mouse - look
    Mouse 1 - Fire
    Spacebar - Jump
    ESC - menu (And releases your mouse)

Supports Gamepads (Not recommended way to play)

    Left Analog - Move
    Right Analog - Aim
    Right Trigger - Fire
    A - Jump 
    Start button - menu
    
```


I used...
- Maya
- Photoshop
- Substance Designer
- Unreal4
- 3d-Coat

--

![intendedExperience.png](///raw/34a/d1/z/22418.png)

*Update Log*
- Added WebGL version
- Fixed a mouse lock bug in both versions

This game can be completed in **10-15mins**.

entries.title: Purple Dimension
entries.description:
![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/947/31/z/21c7f.png)
**Overview:**

Because of scientists' inefficient experiment a portal to another dimension was opened and hordes of monsters came out of it. Only you are strong enough to get there and destroy the crystal that keeps portal opened.
You can use injections to upgrade your skills but unfortunately, the side effect of their actions is the reduction of your life energy. They can be really helpful though.

**Features:**
- 6 types of deadly monsters
- 1 type of even more deadly weapon
- 6 powerful skill upgrades
- ~~countless types of bugs~~

**Controls:**
* A,D - move
* Space - jump
* Mouse - aim
* LMB - shoot


**Notes / Tips:**
- Difficulty is not really well balanced, but here is a tip: choose better upgrades for easy mode and no upgrades for hard mode
- There is actually something at the top of the building. This is not an infinite game. You will feel rewarded
- Don't jump out of a window. There is nothing outside apart from DEATH (i just forgot to add collisions)
- I wanted to make several types of floors, but ended with only 2 :/ guess why haha.
- creating working stairs in video games is real pain. Never again!
- I am quite good at music but sadly this one is really short. Hopefully you like it anyway.

entries.title: Bartleby in Space
entries.description:
![BartlebyGif.gif](///raw/c16/1/z/21652.gif)

Bartleby, intrepid intergalactic explorer extraordinaire, has a bit of a problem. His ship broke down and now he's stranded in the middle of an asteroid belt. He needs three components to fix his ship: fuel, a new hyperdrive module, and an asteroid shield. The strange inhabitants of the asteroid belt may have the things he needs, but they come at a high price: his precious oxygen which is already ticking down. Can Bartleby fix his ship and travel home before his air supply runs out? His fate is in your hands.

(I recommend playing the downloaded version so you can play it in a higher resolution, but the WebGL should work too!)

![screen_octo.jpg](///raw/c16/1/z/216a0.jpg)

**Controls** 

- Left Mouse Button...........Activate Thrusters
- Right Mouse Button........Open Map/Inventory 
- Space....................................Interact/Repair Ship

Bartleby's space suit is equipped with zero-gravity thrusters. Just hold the mouse button down and Bartleby will rocket away. The further the mouse cursor is from Bartleby, the faster he will accelerate.

Bartleby's map is his most valuable asset. It shows key landmarks in the galaxy. Search near the landmarks for characters who want something from Bartleby. If its not in his inventory, they'll also tell him where to find it. Follow the chain of requests to get the items Bartleby needs to fix his ship!

Bartleby has ten minutes of oxygen in his tank. If you install one of the key items (fuel, hyperdrive, or shield) into his ship, his oxygen will refill. Use this to stay alive!

![screen_bruce.jpg](///raw/c16/1/z/216a3.jpg)

This has been my fifth Ludum Dare (fourth time finish), and also my first time streaming my process, which was a lot of fun. I felt really good about how everything went: I had a good scope from the outset, I adapted my initial idea to work with the theme, and I had a lot of fun with the art and writing, which is more my forte than programming. And I didn't work *too* crazy hard, so all in all, one of my best LD experiences!

Please leave any and all feedback, and if you run into bugs I will try to track them down. Looking forward to playing everyone else's games! 


![screen_hubble.jpg](///raw/c16/1/z/216a4.jpg)

- Engine: Unity
- Code: C#
- Art: Photoshop
- Music: FakeMusicGenerator
- SFX: bfxr

![screen_ship.jpg](///raw/c16/1/z/216a6.jpg)


4/29/19 -- WebGL version added
4/29/19 -- Linux version added (untested, let me know if there are issues -- preferably play in 16:9 if it doesn't force it)

entries.title: Hell's Pinball
entries.description:
![logo scale up.png](///raw/b01/31/z/22e98.png)

An infernal Pinball. Try your luck in devious challenges that will reward you with many points, but don‚Äôt run out of time or you will pay for your mistake with your life.

Features : 
- A finely crafted pixel art pinball table
- Many challenges for you to complete
- One final boss fight
- Finely tuned physics
- One heavy metal inspired midi soundtrack
- Many earth shattering sound effects
- Screenshake
- ~72 hours of work

Controls : 
- Left flippers / Choose in menu : Left arrow, A, Z, Q, S, W, X, Left Shift (doesn't work in web)
- Right flippers / Choose in menu : Right arrow, P, O, L, Right Shift (doesn't work in web)
- Plunger/ Confirm menu : Space, Down arrow
- M : Mute Music

Instructions : 
- Go inside the demon shop 3 times to choose a challenge. If you take the bet, you will have to complete before the timer expires. Finish the challenge to complete the pentagram at the center of the screen. But beware, if you run out of time, you will loose your ball.

- Once the pentagram is complete, you can go inside the portal to fight the boss. Kill him to score many points !
- You can activate the side ball savers by completing the HELL word at the bottom of the table.

- You can activate the central ball saver by hitting the four purple aliens.

Tools used : 
- Game Maker Studio 2 (Code and physics engine)
- Aseprite (Sprite Work)
- FL Studio 20 (Music and sound fx)

entries.title: Angry Planet
entries.description:
**Important:**
1. **I uploaded a second webGL¬†version, where i ramped up the volume a bit. Nothing else altered. Download versions are the original ones., the original webGl version is available too**
2. **Play in fullscreen. Everything is a little bit tiny otherwise.**
3. **Read the short instructions below. No time for ingame instructions.**

You are a adorable little Planet floating through space, full of valuable resources.   
*But be aware!* Some greedy colonists just discovered you and are coming for your precious entrails!    
Fight them off, as long as you can!!

**Instructions:**

- You can rotate: Press LMB and move mouse
- You can shake: shake mouse (without pressing LMB)
- You can move clouds: LMB click on a cloud, with pressed LMB you can move the cloud!
- You can charge clouds to release thunder & lightning: While holding down LMB on a cloud, shake the mouse to charge a cloud


- Colonists wandering on your surface will deplete your resources over time. Get lost of them!
- You can shake colonists off, but only those on the bottom!
- Colonists will construct buildings, gathering even more resources! Those can only be destroyed by lightning!

![Bildschirmfoto 2019-04-29 um 02.56.23.png](///raw/2bf/22/z/21aa3.png)

**About:**

This was more like a 24h jam for me. Because off my two lovely children. And the lovely weather...
Therefore i couldn't finish quite a few wanted features (vulcanos as weapons e.g. :( ) but anyway...
I hope some off you will enjoy it nevertheless. I'm looking forward to play your games!!

**How:**
- Unity 2019
- Hand drawn sprites via light table and scanner
- Sfx via mic & garageband
- Ambient Sounds via field recording
- Music via Moog Sub37 & garageband

entries.title: Bet Your Life
entries.description:
![bylwidebanner.jpg](///raw/105/81/z/21bd7.jpg)

## Wager your lives in this super-tough platformer!

Start the game with a bank of lives. Each level, you'll wager how many lives you think you'll need to beat that level. If you run out of lives in your bank, it's game over. Finish the game with as many lives in your bank as you can!

*‚ÄãSupports keyboard or Xbox Controller*

** Too challenging? There's a secret hotkey that lets you skip levels. There is also a restart level hotkey in case you get stuck. Find them here: https://pastebin.com/ZFCQ2BaK **


## Detailed Rules

- Each level will have a par value which is how many lives the level might take to beat.
- If you bet that you can do better than par, you will be rewarded with extra lives.
- If you wager more lives than par, you won't be rewarded and will lose the extra lives no matter what.
- If you run out of lives on a level, you'll lose lives from your bank equal to par.

Try to beat all 15 levels without running out of lives! The amount of remaining lives is your score. 

Art, programming, and design by David Payette and Brad Beyea. Made with GameMaker Studio 2. Credits for royalty free music and sound effects below. Follow us https://twitter.com/stargardengames and http://stargardengames.com üíú
