entries.title: SimuCorp
entries.description:
![chrome_2019-04-28_22-12-29.png](///raw/f05/1/z/21ad0.png)
*Operate a business by managing employees and the office fixtures!*

![2019-04-28_22-15-11.png](///raw/f05/1/z/21ad2.png)
*Hire new employees, grow your building, and make as much money as possible!*

# [Click to play in browser!](https://nostyleguy.itch.io/simucorp)

## Game Background

You're CEO of SimuCorp, a (soon to be) household name in the something industry! 

Manage your building, employees and payments in order to make the most profit you can!

## How To Play

The goal is simple, become a titan on industry by operating Simucorp for as long as possible without missing a payment!

* Furnish the office with a balance of productive tools, as well as fun items that let employees recover motivation.
* Hire and fire workers to balance profitability and payroll requirements.
* Balance cash-flow around critical days of the month to pay your employees and make rent.

### What is going on?
* As minions work, they will seek out productive tasks 
* Productive tasks make you a certain amount of money (black text with '$') per tick
* Productive tasks deplete the minion's motivation (red text with '-') per tick
* When a minion's motivation is very low, it will stop working and seek out an unproductive task
* Unproductive tasks don't make you any money, but refill the minions motivation (green text with +)
* If a minion needs an unproductive task, but none are open, it will wait (yellow '???')

### Office Item Stats:
* "spots": The number of minions that can use the item at the same time
* "profit": The base amount of money made (per tick)
* "motiv": The base amount of motivation gained or lossed (per tick)
* "cost": The amount of money the item costs to buy (once)

### Minion Stats:
* "Motivation": the current amount of motivation available. Represented by the green bar above the minion's head
* "Quality": Affects the "profit" made while doing productive tasks
* "Work Ethic": Decreases the motivation drain of productive, and increases the motivation gain of unproductive tasks  
* "Salary": The amount of money the minion costs. Reflected in payroll amount.

### Cashflow info:
* "Payroll" : Total amount of money due to all employees. Must be paid on the 1st and 15th of each month
* "Rent" : Total amount of money due to the landlord. Must be paid on the 1st of each month
* "Cash" : Total amount of cash available to pay bills

## Tools:

* Unity
* Paint.NET
* Audacity

## Changelog:

* 1.0.2 : Fixed bug where somtimes the second story was added before the first rent was due (game breaking)
* 1.0.1 : Fixed bug where payroll display wasn't updated until you fired somebody (very confusing)

entries.title: Pulsation
entries.description:
![inline.png](///raw/39/z/21a22.png)

-----

## Notes about the new build

I have uploaded a new build with a slightly tweaked tutorial and an undo button, which should make the game a lot less frustrating.  I would strongly recommend playing the new build, as the content is identical, though the original is still available.

-----

## Clarification about pushing / pulling:
This was probably a poor description of what the pulse is doing, so here is an alternate explanation.

**When you pull:** Everything in the large circle in shrunk down to fit into the small circle

**When you push:** Everything in the small circle is stretched to fit into the large circle

-----

Use your pulse to contort the environment

The ring will show how many pulses remain

The pulse will pull things in when the circle is large

The pulse will push things away when the circle is small

The circle cannot overlap with the player

![pulsesGIF.gif](///raw/39/z/21b0c.gif)

WASD / Arrow Keys to Move

W / Up / Space to Jump

Click to Use Pulse

Right Click / Z to Undo - Only available in the newer build!

R to Reset

P to Skip

![ss1.png](///raw/39/z/21a16.png)

entries.title: Rashness
entries.description:
![KeyArt_LDJam_PNG.png](///raw/dbd/31/z/216a9.png)

**RASHNESS** is a boss battle game, where you will have to defeat only **one** enemy. Be ready though, he is tough and he won't go easy on you. Killing it with the basic attacks is hard and very long, so what you can do (and probably should !) is sacrifice some of your health in exchange of different interesting upgrades. It's up to you to find the way you like to play, or to find the most efficient powerups combination ! :wink: 

![LDJAM screens.jpg](///raw/dbd/31/z/21f9c.jpg)

## CONTROLS
**Move** with *WASD / ZQSD* (for French keyboards)

**Fire** with *Mouse Left click*

**Dash** with *Space* (if you choose the upgrade!)

![Run03.png](///raw/dbd/31/z/242ac.png)

This is my 4th participation to the **Ludum Dare**, but above all the first time I hit the compo submission. It was a really interesting experience, but I think I could have done a more complete game, maybe I was a bit too afraid of the short amount of time I had working alone. I'll keep that in mind for the next time if I go for a solo game jam again, but I think I'd rather work with a team !

## [FOLLOW ME ON TWITTER !](https://twitter.com/SixRobin1)
## [‚ô• PLAY MY OTHER GAMES ON ITCH.IO !](https://saering.itch.io/)
## [‚ô¶ RECAP / POST MORTEM OF THE GAME CREATION](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/44/rashness/recap-post-mortem-of-my-weekend)

![WebVersionAnnounce.png](///raw/dbd/31/z/242a4.png)

entries.title: 2019 Game - Ludum Dare 44
entries.description:
Pong Tournament Universe:

Pong Tournament Universe was created by Spencer Rieu for the Ludum Dare 44 Compo Competition.

This game is about a dad and his journey to save his family from aliens. Life is the currency of the universe and you must battle to save you and your family.

This game has a single player story mode and a local two player mode. The style of the game is a classic pong meets platformer fighting game. Move around the terrain to keep the ball out of your net, and encounter different enemies along your way. Have some fun bashing and smashing your way to victory.

Enter the universe or mortal pong tournaments, help this dad rescue his family and become the next Pong Tournament Universe Champion.

Please enjoy your time playing!

![Screenshots-Vertical-(Edit-0-1).png](///raw/a04/22/z/22360.png)

One note is that the download, unity folder and source code are all the original contest entry. I have made small adjustments to the web version like updating the instructional text to make it more playable.

entries.title: Kappetalize
entries.description:
# [REQUIRES GAMEPAD]
In kappetalize you play as a hobo trying to earn some sweet sweet cash! Because you can't have a life without money. Collect money from various items in the town, or rob the civilians. Be careful tho, the police does not tolerate violence.
Deposit your money into the bank before the timer runs out. The hobo with the most money in the bank when the time ends win.
![abff45413aef64ce1a00f4c7ce3a64b1.gif](///raw/263/3/z/223da.gif)
The 3 of us set out to make a fun, crazy party game where the goal was for homeless people with no "life" to get one by becoming rich. We spent a lot of our time fixing the physics, particle effects, sounds and creating an ‚Äúalive‚Äù world for the players to interact with, while our simple graphical design made it easy for us generate a lot of assets to place in the world.
We had a lot of fun over these last couple of days and we are all very happy with the result and the amount of polish we managed to create in this relatively short amount of time.
![300d97fed7b106982ce699cdc44d128e.gif](///raw/263/3/z/223ce.gif)
The game supports 1-4 players using controllers (btw unitys input system for multiple controllers sucks)

* Start - skip cutscene, join game, start game (after everyone has joined), Restart (when game has ended)
* A - Jump
* X - Punch
* Left Stick - control character
* Right Stick - control camera

Remember, money is heavy! With a big bag of cash you will become very slow. But you also hit harder!


Please try it out, even if you play it alone it is a lot of fun! And watch out for the cars on the road, they hit hard‚Ä¶.And fast

https://youtu.be/-aoo2GCB7ck

entries.title: Energy Tanks
entries.description:
![Banner.png](///raw/fdf/z/22609.png)

***Energy Tanks*** is a fast paced twin stick shooter with a shared health mechanic. When someone on your team gets hit your team looses energy and if it runs out you are all dead. Energy can be also used to buy weapons and cast abilities, but remember that you are spending your life points so you will be easier to kill.

The game supports both **single player** and **multiplayer** (up to 4 players)

![EnergyTanks.gif](///raw/fdf/z/226fc.gif)

![Screens.png](///raw/fdf/z/2275e.png)

![SplashScreen.jpg](///raw/fdf/z/22772.jpg)

To host multiplayer games you need to forward standard Unreal Engine 4 ports (7777-8100).

*The game was created in 72 hours by a team of four*

*Music by Ville Nousiainen*

entries.title: PATH, a game of life
entries.description:
![LD44_banner_last.jpg](///raw/db1/z/22a0c.jpg)

                             "Journey matters more than the destination"

### **PATH** is a game about life. It's all about the choices that you will make, and the things that you will learn and discover, within the imparted time (meaning, the rest of your life). 



Explore a world constantly building around you, try to unravel its most hidden secrets, or spend your life looking for your soulmate...Set your own objectives and live the life you choose. One may not be enough, tho!

![screen1_chess.PNG](///raw/db1/z/2293b.png)![screen3_love.PNG](///raw/db1/z/2293e.png)


In order to achieve all this, you'll have to meet other people, learn from them and from yourself. But learning means sacrificing big slices of life, which is a precious currency, especially as time is constantly running against you...


![LD44_ExeIcon_128.png](///raw/db1/z/224e5.png)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


### CONTROLS

**Move** - WASD / ZQSD / Arrows

**Spend time** - Space bar / Left Click on button

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![companion_face.png](///raw/db1/z/2261e.png)


*Devs note : 
Here we go again for another Ludum Dare. No exception made, we had a ton of fun developing that game. It's kind of a "premiere" for us to look for such a moody, experience-driven game for a Jam.*
*We really hope that you will enjoy playing it as much as we enjoyed creating it!*
*There are a lot of different endings in the game. Let's see if you are able to find them all ;)*

*Any comments or feedbacks are, of course & as usual, more than welcome!*

*Mathieu Clavel & Louis Denizet*![screen7_farm.PNG](///raw/db1/z/22940.png)

entries.title: Don't wake a sleeping vampire
entries.description:
The pesky druids are at it again. Rummaging around for something to worship they've woken you up! They'll all pay!

Eat all the druids to advance the levels.

Arrow keys to control, up jumps and while in the air, pressing down will smash down and stun an enemy.

Using powers costs you health. Eating druids replenishes your health.

You can restart a level by pressing R. You can skip a level by pressing 9.

Ran a bit out of time at the end, so the content is just four levels. Weird parallax layer GL rendering errors really ate my time and caused frustration at the end.

![Screenshot 2019-04-28 at 23.27.26.png](///raw/060/1/z/21191.png)

Done in 48h (compo) using:
- Code is Haxe using HaxeFlixel (VSCode)
- Graphics with PixelMator (the moon) and Pixaki on the iPad (all the rest)
- Levels made with Tiled
- Music is done with a ukulele, a ukulele bass and Garageband on iOS
- Sounds are made with Chiptone

entries.title: Mercs
entries.description:
------------------------------

#### DESCRIPTION ####

A not-so infinite shooter, in which you can hire, or be hired, by crews of mercenaries to clear levels of alien bugs. The talent pool isn‚Äôt that deep but you might find an elite or a weapon upgrade worth the investment.

It‚Äôs not overly clear but there are two types of missions on the job board, *MERCENARY* and *CONTRACT*. With the former, you hire yourself out to an existing crew, but you only get a small cut of the winnings. With the latter, you and your crew take on the whole contract and all the spoils are yours. The contract missions are more difficult though, make sure you hire some fodder to distract the bugs.

#### THEME ####

As the leader of a band of mercenaries you risk, exchange even, the lives of you and your crew for monetary reward. Your life and theirs are currency in a never ending bug hunt.

Another interpretation of the theme; money is more important to you than anything in your life.

I'm sure there'll be lots of entries where the theme has been taken quite literally; life force used as a form of currency. I have not.

#### DEVELOPMENT ####

There‚Äôs quite a bit of stuff I had to strip out of the game, massively over scoped, as always. No music, the force-field upgrade is never available. No terrain or enemy variation unfortunately, but there are three weapons and two different merc characters.

The game desperately needs some balancing, I didn‚Äôt have time before submission, so apologies if it‚Äôs too easy or too hard. Let me know!

I‚Äôve stuck comments on anonymous so you can trash me all your want, but if you do leave your name I will be happy to play/rate your game in return.

I hope you enjoy the game!

----------------------

*UPDATE 2019-04-29: I fixed a spelling mistake* üò¨ *and a bug where your could walk out of the teleport beam at the end of a mission.*

------------------------

entries.title: Remember
entries.description:
![remember01.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/21a28.png)

![remember02.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/21a68.png)

![remember03.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/21a69.png)

**_Remember_** is a simple text-based adventure game where you play as an amnesiac, forced to trade your few remaining memories with other characters in the hope of remembering who you are. Any any stage, simply type in the number of an action to perform it.

Each character has a story to tell, and a memory that will benefit them; when you share it with them, you will gain access to one of their memories in return. Pay careful attention to each character - both to their story and to any descriptive clues - as your overall score will depend on how efficiently you share your memories.

**Recommendation:** I would recommend two playthroughs. For the first, try and achieve the best score possible. For the second, explore some of the other interactions available to you!


**N.B.** This game is narrative-heavy, and so text-heavy. As such, I didn't have time to proof-read it all before submitting. If you come across a typo, or anything that seems odd, then please do let me know and I'll endeavour to fix it. Thanks!

**UPDATE - 13/05/19:** Fixed a couple of typos in the text, along with a bug whereby the game would freeze if the text log became too long. Thanks to the people who pointed out the bug to me!

entries.title: Ransom
entries.description:
![Screenshot from 2019-04-29 20-53-31.png](///raw/36f/2/z/23dac.png)

# Ransom
An quick adventure game about two friends, a ransom, and life force as currency.  This is my kids first game and first Ludum Dare!

# Play the game
This is an HTML5 and can be played in any modern browser. Just click on the HTML5 link below to play.

# The Team
- Jared Sprague - Coding (Dad)
- Rowen Sprague - Art (age 14)
- Elliott Sprague - Music (age 13)

# About the game
This was my kids first game and I gave them complete creative control just to see what they came up with.
I was very impressed with their creativity in art, music, and story.  Rowen created all the art assets using
a Wacom draw tablet and my Son composed all the original music from sheet music using noteflight.com.

There was more that we wanted to add like the ability to move the character around with a walking animation
but we ran out of time.  We'll definitely be creating a post jam version.

This was also my first time using Phaser 3 and I really loved the experience compared to Phaser 2.

# All original soundtrack
All the music and sound effects are completely original and were composed by Elliott from scratch sheet music.

# Tools used
We tried to use as many open source tools as possible creating this game.  Here is a complete list of tools used.

- Phaser 3
- Firealpaca
- noteflight.com
- Gimp
- Audacity
- Google Chrome
- Webstorm
- Fedora Linux

entries.title: Once Upon A Plague
entries.description:
![Once Upon A Plague Splash](///raw/2e1/z/240d4.gif)

## Web : https://graal.itch.io/once-upon-a-plague (10-20 minutes to play)

A desolate place. Lonely church in a middle of nowhere. Dusk light fills the air, wind brushes through the grass, it is such a beautiful sight. Almost makes you forget. 

If only you could. 

A little flake of black, obsidian ash slowly waltzing down on your shoulder, and disappears in a purple flash of otherwordly light. The Plague's here. Time to do your job.

---------------------------------------------------

![LD44 - Volcanic Giraffe](///raw/2e1/z/23a49.gif)

#### CONTROLS:
- Game is controlled by a mouse
- **Left click** to select a unit
- **Right click** to order movement
- **Q,W,E** uses abilities (sorry Dvorak folks)
- **1-4** selects heroes

The church priest will be happy to help you, if you are willing to pay the price.

![Once Upon A Plague Screenshots](///raw/2e1/z/240d7.gif)

#### TOOLS:
- [Unity 2019.1](https://unity.com)
- [Blender 2.79](https://www.blender.org/)
- [Audiotool](https://www.audiotool.com)
- [Audacity](https://www.audacityteam.org), sounds: [freesound.org](https://freesound.org)

Both in-game tracks sources (made during the Jam): [1](https://www.audiotool.com/track/r5lhgr5r/), [2](https://www.audiotool.com/track/kj5b21lgz/)

```
All the code, Unity project, and .blend/.fbx files you could find in the repository.
```
There are some known issues with the controls, game balance and new content ideas. Not going to implement this until LD44 ends. Thank you for the feedback, you are awesome!

#### CHANGELOG:

entries.title: Demonidle
entries.description:
![SC_00.PNG](///raw/e23/6/z/2158b.png)

![Demonidle - GIF.gif](///raw/e23/6/z/2158a.gif)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

**Demonidle** is an idle game about using human souls to destroy humanity.

Will you be able to take them down?

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Made in 18h for the Ludum Dare 44 Compo by Carlos Izquierdo [carlosvVk](https://twitter.com/carlosvvk)

-----------------------

:beginner: **Controls**:

You are *Voran*, the Demon of Death.

Use your powers to kill humans as fast as possible.

Improve your powers by consuming human souls.

When the Earth is empty, your reign will come.

------------------------

:monkey: **Conclusions**:

Hey! I really liked how the game ended. Most of all, the art, I think that for being my first attempt at pixel art, it is nice. I made an idle game because maybe it's a game a little forgotten in jams, so I gave it a try.

I wanted to implement more features, but I haven't the time, so this is it! :smile: 

-----------------------

:tools: **Tools**:

Unity and Adobe Photoshop.

------------------------

:love_letter: **Contact**:

carlosizquierdo.dev@gmail.com

-----------------------

entries.title: LIFEBLASTER
entries.description:
![Screenshot 2019-04-29 at 02.32.54.png](///raw/d8d/8/z/2199b.png)     
  
**INTRODUCING "Lifeblaster"!**  
The brand new '3000' model of your favourite resurrection, exorcism and health-sharing multi-tool.

* Move: WASD
* Shoot lifeforce: Left click
* Fullscreen: F
* Mute: M

Found some zombies or undead? Give them a blast and send them straight up to heaven. Watch out though, this new design saps your own health power in exchange, so don't get too trigger happy! (Subject to warranty period. We don't mind either way - we'll make more sales with more dead things running around.)

Hint: you can pickup and re-use life/health/ammo shots once they hit a target. Your life is currency.

**Please follow/join my game development here:**

* [Discord](http://forceofhab.it/discord)
* [Twitter](http://twitter.com/forcehabit)
* [Facebook](http://facebook.com/forcehabit)
* [Website](http://forceofhab.it/)

**Tools:**

* Custom C++ game engine
* Photoshop
* Reaper

**Post-mortem?:**

* Concentrated lots on the movement/game feel - what do you think?
* Unfortunately it's just one room - I didn't get enough time to implement proper 3d collisions to enable walls/corridors/etc!
* For my first _ever_ project **and** game jam with 3 dimensions, I'm very happy!

**Post-compo changes:**

* Fix fullscreen mode WebGL.
* Reduced player slipperiness.
* Reduced mouse sensitivity by 30%.
* Added controller support.
* Added reason for dying on the game over screen.
* Added mini-map.

entries.title: Petite Cuiller
entries.description:
Hi,
This game is really personal to me so please be kind!

This is a game about the everyday life of a person with depression. You have to spend wisely your spoons that are a limited ressource and symbolize your energy for the day.

It's not always possible to do what's best when you're ill. I hope this game helps you understand mental health issues.

If you are interested in the spoon theory there are plenty of ressources out there.

Do what you can and don't forget to treat yourself :seedling:

entries.title: Tree of Life
entries.description:
![Tree of Life 28.04.2019 22_54_32.png](///raw/835/z/2121d.png)


![Tree of Life 28.04.2019 22_54_38.png](///raw/835/z/2121e.png)


![Tree of Life 28.04.2019 23_03_09.png](///raw/835/z/21221.png)

## Story:
You, a freshly sprouted young tree, will you be able to grow up and become a magnificent big tree. Nature is cruel and some inhabitants around you want to feed on your life force. You have to carefully split your life energy between growth (not spending it) and staying alive.

## How to Play:
It's basically a tower defence but any life force you don't spend during the level (wave) is added to you maximum life force at the end of each level (and you will grow!). The life force is then replenished to the full amount, so saving as much life force as possible in each level is a good thing to do!

## Controls: 
**WASD / Arrow Keys** Move camera around

**QE** RotateCamera

**Left Mouse Button** Select Tower / Build Tower

**Right Mouse Button** Cancel Building

**CTRL / CMD + Q** Quit game any time

## Team:
[Martin Nov√°k](http://www.twitter.com/wolaroj) - Coding

**Ond≈ôej Dovec** - Animations, Enemy Design, Food Delivery

**Luk√°≈° T≈Øma** - Level Design

**Adam Lys√°k** - Coding

**Matƒõj Fiala** - 3D Models, 2D Graphics

**Wolar Games** (Our company) -  [Web](http://www.wolargames.com) | [Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/wolargames) | [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/wolargames)

## Tools:
Unity, Photoshop, Amplify Photo, Blender, 3DMax, Audacity, DoTween (Unity Plugin) 

## Notes:
This time we worked for around 28 hours in total (14 hours per day, 2 days)

**We did not create all the Audio (we have downloaded music and some sound effects) so we opt-out Audio category. Music was downloaded from [https://www.bensound.com/royalty-free-music](https://www.bensound.com/royalty-free-music). We have also not created fonts.**

entries.title: Venatio
entries.description:
**Welcome to Venatio!** 

Set in ancient Greece, our once seemingly invincible hero has found himself in dire straights. After being taken captive he must now fight in the Colosseum for his freedom. The goddess Alethina that has been watching over our hero fears for his safety. She intervenes to save her champion, gifting him the amulet of Yendor. Each of the seven stones within the amulet allow our hero to restore himself to life one time.
The gods are watching and both sides are will have their hands in your fate. Fight for your freedom, you WILL die, but will you also survive?

# How to Play

- **WASD** - Move

- **Left Mouse Button** - Primary Attack

- **Right Mouse Button** - Secondary Attack

- **1 - 4** - Use Skill

- **Q** - Equip Weapon Left Hand

- **E** - Equip Weapon Right Hand

- **Escape** - Exit Game

entries.title: BULLDOZERS! FROM OUTER SPACE
entries.description:
Space: the final frontier. Vast and mysterious, yet sometimes not big enough for everyone. One day you're minding your own business, orbiting happily in your solar system, then bam, suddenly you have pesky invaders scurrying about your surface! 

They came for your mighty trees, your shiny ores and to kill your worshippers! It's just profit for them, for you however,  the very essence of life - literally your face, dammit! Well, they won't get away with it that easily - time to show them what "hostile environment" really means! 

Unleash devastating disasters and wipe them all out, but beware the cost of such destruction!

![hue9vp.jpg](///raw/f84/61/z/2282c.jpg)

How to play. 
1. Use forces of nature to destroy the invaders. Summoning disasters costs some of your own life force.
2. Place the Temple to replenish energy with prayers of your faithful.
3. Eliminate all invaders to win! You lose if you your max life force reaches zero.

Controls:
Click on spells to select and click on enemies to cast them.
Hold RMB and drag to pan the camera.
Use mouse scroll or W/S keys to zoom-in and zoom-out.
Use Q/E to rotate your view around the planet.

entries.title: Kill'em
entries.description:
![ssa.png](///raw/e13/8/z/212b8.png)

Kill‚Äôem is a poker game which is played with a 30 card deck, a revolver, a sub-machine gun and a flail. In this super brutal game, instead of betting money, players bet their health. The last one who resists loss of blood wins. The rest probably deserve to lose.

Players start the game with 100 health. Each bet, damage and healing is 5 health. A round has 3 betting phases. The first one is mandatory. After the last betting phase, if you bet 5 more health, you can discard a card and draw a new one.

The player who has the greatest number of cards with the same type wins the round. For example, 1-1-2-1-3 beats 5-2-2-1-3, because that hand contains a combo with a length of 3. If two hands have the same combo length, the combo with higher card value wins (e.g. 1-2-2-4-3 beats 2-1-1-5-4). If there is still a draw, players with lower combo lengths lose their bets. Also, cards don‚Äôt show their effects in this case. If only one player is left in the round, others lose their bets. In short, just try to have the same type of cards.

ps. I don't have anything against these player names. I just designed three different ai behaviors and named them this way.

![ssb.png](///raw/e13/8/z/213f3.png)

entries.title: 8-bit Knock Out!
entries.description:
Knock out your opponent in this hardcore pixel-art‚Äã fighting game!

![1.png](///raw/744/8/z/21302.png)

## Rules:

- 

‚ÄãThe more damage you take, the more damage you deal.

- Rack up bountiful combos to push your opponent even further!

- Try to get your enemy off the level.

- Practice first in Training mode, where the opponent will only focus on not falling off. The Solo AI is quite tough!

- If you have a bud, try out Party mode for local multiplayer fun!

![2.png](///raw/744/8/z/21304.png)

## Controls:

‚ÄãPlayer 1 - Arrow Keys + Enter

Player 2 - WASD + E

(You can use both configurations if you're playing solo)

Left Right / A D - Move

Up / W - Jump (you can triple jump and wall jump)

Down / S - Shield (while standing on the ground)

Enter / E - Dash: this is your attack. Dash while holding direction keys to dash in that direction. Dash into an opponent to attack them.

Esc - Pause game

![3.png](///raw/744/8/z/21306.png)

## Credits:

‚ÄãAll assets made by me EXCEPT:

'4 pixel font' by [Groszak](https://fontstruct.com/fontstructors/926068/groszak)

Text-to-speech from [NaturalReaders‚Äã](https://www.naturalreaders.com/online/)

## Gameplay video:

https://youtu.be/Uml5mLCHSCc

entries.title: Grand Theft Life
entries.description:
![ld44-done.gif](///raw/6c4/1/z/234b2.gif)
**Grand Theft Life** is a game about spending your life doing stuff. 

Get **EDUCATED, WORK** and make money, pursue **ART** or **SCIENCE** or commit **CRIME**.

Doing stuff spends **YEARS** of your life. How you choose to play is up to YOU! 

Good luck and remember, there is more to life than going **POSTAL** (although it is an option).


### Controls (Mouse)
**Move: L-click**

**Use weapon: R-click**


### Tools:
Gamemaker Studio

Cubase

Photoshop

entries.title: The Joy of Creationism with God Ross
entries.description:
Experience the Joy of Creationism together with God Ross.

During this game you should relax, lean back and watch creation take
its course as you invest your own lifeforce into the world.

This game is meant to be experienced, there are no scores attached to this.
Watch the world evolve through your actions and make up your own story.

entries.title: Polar Delivery
entries.description:
![banner-nopengu.png](///raw/b56/31/z/210d9.png)

### Dealing with the theme
Did not want to go with *exchange life / hitpoints / time for some abilities / actions / powerups*, so I just used the theme as an starting point for something ending more like 'Your life is crucial for what is going on'. Placing player not into direct control of the game, but with key influence (and responsibility, in this case, for cargo delivery).

### About the game
This game is intentionally missing any action mechanics. It is more like bringing you as a player to relaxing meditative environment. Observe and navigate the sailboat by telling your helmsmate. There is no other goal to reach than the sailing while avoiding obstacles itself.

![cover.png](///raw/b56/31/z/21d83.png)

### Post submission
Preferable version to play with few little tweaks done after 48h limit. Original binaries at same location.
- Adjustable mouse-look sensitivity
- More true collider shape of the ship
- Ability to go back to title in menu

#### I apologize for not testing properly Win & Mac builds this time
Well seems like all of you playing so far can confirm Windows build works :)

### Tools and resources used
- Unity 2018 on Linux üêß
- Inkscape, FL Studio, [SFMaker](https://www.leshylabs.com/apps/sfMaker/)
- Ostrich Sans Font by Tyler Finck (https://www.theleagueofmoveabletype.com/ostrich-sans)

### Thanks to [gamedev.cuni.cz](https://gamedev.cuni.cz/events/ludum-dare-44-mff/) for organizing the site

![pengu-wave.gif](///raw/b56/31/z/2104f.gif)

entries.title: Biomass
entries.description:
In the deepest of space, strange creatures fight violently for survival of the fattest.

Mass is your life source. Consume it. It fuels everything.

![Biomass](///raw/f87/32/z/23b27.gif)

**Game tips:**
- Watch the bottom left bar, the whole bar represents your mass. If it hits 0, the game restarts and you lose your upgrades.
- If the red bar (inside the mass bar) hits 0 after taking enough damage, you drop a lump of mass.
- Be careful not to overspend your mass, as it brings you closer to death.

**Notes:**
- This ended up being a sandbox; time ran out before I could add any specific goals.

**Controls:**
- Move with WASD.
- Rotate with mouse.
- Left-click to fire.
- Hold space to upgrade.

**Credits:**
- @jobus : Programming, Visual Effects, Sound Effects.
- @flavoredpickle : Modelling, Texturing, Animation.

entries.title: Haemogoblin
entries.description:
![58818454_1028324917361031_3069752794492698624_n.png](///raw/e67/e/z/22880.png)

‚ñ∂Ô∏è[Play on itch.io](https://cloakedninjas.itch.io/haemogoblin)

*It's about bloody time for a vacation.*

### üíü THE GAME

Sell health potions to heroes battling the forces of evil... but at what cost?

- ‚öóÔ∏è As the shop keeper, draw your own blood to brew health potions!
- ‚ù§Ô∏è Sell health potions to heroes to pay for your long overdue vacation üèñÔ∏èüå¥(and some traps... we'll get to that later)!
- ‚öîÔ∏è Throw on your disguise and battle the heroes as the infamous Goblin Monster to steal back the blood and regain your health!

### üíü THE STORY

The Goblin Monster is terrorizing the land, and valiant heroes are set on slaying him! You, the guileless shopkeeper make a meager living selling health potions with the ultimate goal of making enough coin to take a much-needed vacation.

Unbeknownst to the heroes, the health potions are actually made from the shopkeeper's blood! What a twist! Double-unbeknownst to them, the shopkeeper is in reality the fiendish Goblin Monster, who is harvesting the blood from the heroes trying to defeat him and using it to heal himself! WHAT A DOUBLE TWIST!

### üíü HOW TO PLAY

**Haemogoblin** is played in **two parts**:
1. **SHOP** | Draw your blood üíâ to brew potions
 - Don't draw too much or you'll surely perish at the hands of a hero later
 - Once you're done, sell your potions and rake in the coin üí∞
 - Don't poke the spider ‚òùÔ∏èüö´üï∑Ô∏è
2. **BATTLE** | Fend off the forces of good in a game of tower defense
 - Spike traps damage heroes that come into contact with them and gather blood to refill your stock
 - Spiders üï∑Ô∏è shoot web üï∏Ô∏è at heroes, slowing them down - slowed down heroes take extra damage on spikes
 - Defeat heroes by killing them with spikes or slowing them down until their stamina is drained and they teleport out of combat.
 - If a hero reaches you, they'll hit you with their sword! Try not to die or it's game over - worse yet, there'll be no vacation for you! üö´üèñÔ∏è

![haemogoblin-screenshot-main.PNG](///raw/e67/e/z/227f7.png)

![haemogoblin-screenshot-ingame.PNG](///raw/e67/e/z/2262d.png)

### üíü CREDITS
Programming by @cloakedninjas | Art by @treslapin | Music & SFX by @dorkulon

entries.title: All Become One
entries.description:
### The Game
*ALL BECOME ONE* is a "God Game" where you can consume the lifeforce of plants and people to and funnel it into godly miracles.

![god2.gif](///raw/faf/z/21a5d.gif)

Look after your people with an assortment of whatever spells I could program in the time. *Careful with the lightning bolt one.*

![god1.gif](///raw/faf/z/21a5f.gif)

### Mostly useless instructions
Mousewheel between an incredibly two, yes TWO zoom levels. Left click and drag around the map. Right click to cast miracles when they're selected from the bottom of the screen.


### Thoughts
Black & White meets Rimworld in the most absurdly over ambitious jam game from me yet. This is the most unfinished game I've ever submitted, but to be fair that makes me pretty happy with my batting average! I fully expect this to score in the bottom of all my games though. It misses out on so much. No sounds, music, a million and one missing QoL essentials and just fundamentally not balanced or tuned with what feels like a missing loop. The overall experience feels weird, frantic with just too much chaos on the screen to really care much about it after more than a few minutes. I wanted to add a lot more stuff to humanize the... um, humans. More stuff in the simulation and character names + meaningless details & descriptions and interactions. More spells that let you shape the world. Also walls that would have justified the fact that I bothered with actual pathfinding for once ARGH!

![god4.gif](///raw/faf/z/21a63.gif)
This is fine.

entries.title: Signal
entries.description:
Life in **Rustburg** has been rough lately. The **Mysterious Energy** that gives life to it's robot citizens has started driving them crazy! It's up to you to put a stop to it.

## Explore Rustburg ![Explore.png](///raw/16/z/239b5.png)

## Buy Upgrades! ![BuyUpgrades.png](///raw/16/z/239b6.png)

## Save your Friends by... Exploding Them? ![ExplodeFriends.png](///raw/16/z/239b7.png)

Your friend, **Dr. Cogburn**, can help you out at her **Mechanic Shop**. Only problem is, she needs to build upgrades out of **Spare Parts** from your robot body. At her shop, **Your Life is Currency**...

-------------------------------

### Controls
- Move - **WASD** or **Arrows**
- Aim - **Mouse**
- Shoot (with gun) - **Left Click**
- Talk/Interact - **W** or **Space** or **Up Arrow**
- Jump (with upgrade) - **W** or **Space** or **Up Arrow**
- Select  - **Space** or **Enter** or **Z**
- Dash - **Double Tap Left** or **Right**
- View Map (with upgrade) - **Hold Tab**

### Pro-Tips
- Don't worry if **you can't jump** past an obstacle yet, or when you start the game.
- You can **recover your health** at **Dr. Cogburn's Body Shops**, or by collecting **Golden Gears**.
- There are only eighty-six thousand four hundred **seconds in a day**.

### Version History
**Apr. 29, 2019** :: *v1.0.2*
- Jam Release

**May. 4, 2019** :: *v1.0.3-jam*
- Added gameplay analytics
- Bullets have a maximum life of 2 seconds
- Removed one misleading line of dialogue
- Fixed a bug preventing dog alert sound from playing
- Fixed a bug switching the confirm and cancel sound effects

**May. 4, 2019** :: *v1.1.0-post-jam*
- Added gameplay analytics
- Bullets have a maximum life of 2 seconds
- Removed one misleading line of dialogue
- Fixed a bug preventing dog alert sound from playing
- Fixed a bug switching the confirm and cancel sound effects
- Fixed a bug where bullets could be fired through walls
- Make the cancel button advance dialogues
- Moved Tangled Arboretum sign so it doesn't get in the way of a fight
- Pickups no longer collide with enemies
- Pickups now despawn after 5 seconds
- Enemies now respawn after 5 minutes, or when the player dies
- Added walking and jump animations to characters
- Added the MiniMap upgrade
- Added the Radar upgrade
- Added the Time Surge upgrade
- Changes the prices of existing upgrades
- Increased accuracy of player weapons
- Improved the camera tracking system

**May. 10, 2019** :: *v1.1.1-post-jam*
- Fixed a bug which sent the wrong coordinate in some analytics events
- Fixed a bug which drew some entities behind background elements
- Fixed a bug which played the wrong sound effect when collecting a pickup
- Fixed a bug which prevented the radar from rendering if purchased before the minimap
- Minimap now updates less often (for performance)
- Enemies now deactivate when far enough from player (for performance)

### Walkthrough
If you got stuck, or maybe just hate playing games ^_^
https://youtu.be/7sbuSS7YOrM

entries.title: Ghost Avenger
entries.description:
![itchio.png](///raw/e40/3/z/21eee.png)  

Hey everyone!  
I've made this game in Sunday after my WIP engine failed on me on Saturday.  
I also lost the first music track when I tried to save while it was playing on Pico 8 :face_palm:   
It's not as complete as I wanted but it's playable.  

## The rules are:
1. Keep the ghost in the center of the screen alive
2. Use it's life to buy an detonate bombs that will kill every enemy on the screen. Each bomb costs 1/4 of the ghost's life bar. Use it wisely. 
3. Keep an eye out for the bombs that will appear in the map when you kill enemies. This bombs will kill every enemy on the screen without charging for ghost life.
4. Pick the speed powerup when getting to 50 kills.
5. Destroy the enemy spawners to win the game. Make sure you use the "clock" power up for  this task.

Don't give up if you find it difficult. If you use all the powerups and actions you can easily beat it without getting damage.  

![ld44_002.png](///raw/e40/3/z/21690.png)  
![ld44_003.png](///raw/e40/3/z/21691.png)  
![ld44_004.png](///raw/e40/3/z/21693.png)  

Made with pico 8 and the super fast framework.

## Some tips (Don't read them if you want to figure it out yourself!):
~~When destroying a spawner you get a health pack that restores some health for the player and the ghost.~~  
~~Since each bomb blast costs 1/4 of the ghost's health, you have 3 to use consecutively coming from a full life bar in ghost. If you combine this knowledge with the step 1 you can risk going for a spawner without getting hits on hero or ghost and then with the health pack regain a new bomb blast for future use.~~  
~~At this point you should have gotten all the powerups and be killing everything in your way.~~

entries.title: D.R.I.E.D.
entries.description:
![Header.png](///raw/af9/32/z/23546.png)

**The Premise**

You are a lone robot in the remnants of a ruined city. The world is a dusty wasteland. Fuel reserves are low. Make your way across the barren cityscape before your fuel dries up.
 
You'll need fuel to reach your goal - without it, you're just a hunk of useless metal. But it's also the only resource worth a damn in this world, and you might need to trade some of it in order to get by...

Programming : Jason Davey ([StrayBasilisk](https://twitter.com/StrayBasilisk))

Sound : Efilheim ([BandCamp](https://efilheim.bandcamp.com/releases))

(We teamed up randomly over Reddit / Discord to make this - this is the first thing we've ever worked on together).

entries.title: A Burning Rabbit Experiment
entries.description:
![itch_logo.png](///raw/cb1/z/20e16.png)

![bunny2_optim.gif](///raw/cb1/z/2107b.gif)


## Game concept:
You control a bunch of burning bunnies. The longer they keep burning, the more money they will yield once they hit the ground and die. That's the game goal: try to keep rabbits alive, but when they are precious enough, sacrifice them to earn money. However, every sacrifice will reduce one life, so make sure you'll have some lives in stock!

The bunnies will turn more yellow ("golden") over time, and once they hit the max gold value, they will also give an extra life once dying.

**‚ÄãNote:** ‚ÄãIt's not obvious, but the game ends when you run out of lives, not bunnies.

## Controls:
- **Arrow keys**: move
- **Down arrow**: quick fall
- **Z**: Jump, "flap"
- **Enter**: pause

## Music?
There was "music" for a short amount of time, but mystically it disappeared!

## Screenshots:
![5.png](///raw/cb1/z/20e17.png)
![6.png](///raw/cb1/z/20e1e.png)

entries.title: Nuclear Arms 7: Railway to Heaven
entries.description:
![Title7.png](///raw/c45/z/22459.png)

![Nuclear Arms 7 Screenshot 2019.04.29 - 17.16.16.12.png](///raw/c45/z/22469.png)

![clip1.gif](///raw/c45/z/2245d.gif)

![clip2.gif](///raw/c45/z/22470.gif)

![clip3.gif](///raw/c45/z/22485.gif)

![clip5.gif](///raw/c45/z/2248b.gif)

Craig Killbane has run out of energy trying to return home after his fight with the Waste wizard. Lucky for him he was able to hitch a ride on a passing space train. Unfortunately for him, the train is under attack by the Coal Cabal. Killbane will need to the help of the drifters on board the train to help fight off the intruders so he can get back to earth!

As Craig you'll fight enemies in each train car in order to make it further down the train. There are drifters onboard who are willing to sell you their upgrades as long as you give them some of your energy. Weigh the risk of going for the better upgrades at the cost of your remaining life!

- WASD keys to move
- Mouse to aim
- Left click to shoot
- E to buy upgrades at the shop

- You heal half of your health inbetween each train car from the solar radiation
- Upgrades are random each playthrough, and stack as well. You may get lucky early on, or you might need to hold out for better upgrades later.

This game follows the adventures of Craig Killbane. You can check out the previous game in the series in our last Ludum Dare submission here:

[Nuclear Arms 6](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/nuclear-arms-6-waste-wizards-tricks)

Or the entire list of Nuclear Arms games from my profile [here](https://ldjam.com/users/logicon211/)

Another busy Ludum Dare weekend done. We had the usual crew around for this plus a little extra but this time we have a group logo! We're still trying to stick to genres we haven't done or tried yet. This one sort of threw us for a loop as we had a harder time coming up with an idea that we thought would be too close to our last. However in the end the roguelike style we went with ended up feeling like a much different game.

As usual we had a lot of fun coming up with Craigs next adventure and what new characters he'll interact with next. We hope you enjoy! And if you can't get enough of Craig we made 6 other games with him in it! Go check it out.

Credits

[@Logan Marks](https://twitter.com/Logicon211) - Programming (Enemies, Bosses, Map, Effects), Sprites/Animations (Enemies), Sound effects/filters, Voice (drifter)

[@Amanda Gallant](https://twitter.com/Kaput33) - Sprites (Enemies, Bosses), Slide Art, Voice (Killjane)

[@Brodie Beaman](https://twitter.com/BrodieBeaman) - Programming (Powerups, HUD, UI Elements), Sprites (UI) Sound Editing 

[@Chad Gerein](https://twitter.com/GodTierLuck) - Programming (Enemies, Parallax, Bosses)

[@Mitchell Maclean](https://twitter.com/NachoTrap) - Programming (Player, Powerups, Bosses), Voice (Jingle), Humor Consultant, Game Design

[@Brenden Roach](https://twitter.com/FTL_Sloth) - Story Board, Slide Art, Humor Consultant, Voice(Fossil Fuel)

[@Taylor Seely](https://twitter.com/electricbatman) - Sound Design, Story Board

entries.title: CurANTcy
entries.description:
![demo.gif](///raw/dae/2/z/2193b.gif)
Try to get an ant to space with a just a quarter and a lot of friends. It is quite difficult! It's OK if you only play a little and move on, but there's a bonus mode if you can get the ant to space.

Controls: Click, press the spacebar, or tap your touchscreen.

Extra Notes:
- This game is heavily inspired by the Rhythm Heaven and WarioWare series, most significantly Rhythm Heaven's 'Coin Toss' minigame. (If you haven't played these games, please consider it! They are excellent.)

entries.title: Bloodalchemist

Confirm - F

Switch Right - E

Create Potions, gather items to pledge your tribute to the trophy statue and make the customers happy - or give them a potion!

entries.title: Danko
entries.description:
> *"What else can I do to save these people?" Cried out Danko above the thunder. And suddenly he ripped open his breast and tore out his heart and held it high above his head.*

The Ludum dare 44 is the first for our team. 


![2335a.png](///raw/a86/91/z/23b4d.png)


**The Art**
 [Padla](https://twitter.com/PadlukaPadla), [Deprra](https://twitter.com/Lanius00)

**Programming**
[Pixel_Error](https://twitter.com/Pixel_Error_), [Wazti](https://twitter.com/_wazti_)

**Sound**
@Hani-Koi


Description
----------------
This game is a top-down slasher with tower defence. You are the last person to whom the only thing left to protect is the altar. Even your life is not so important. Do not be afraid to give away your organs in order to restore health to the altar and receive its power in the form of buffs and debuffs.
 

**Your goal is to survive 5 waves and don't let to fall your altar down.**

**:crossed_swords: Destroy enemies!**


**:skull: Give your organs to heal your altar's and get buffs/debuffs. **


**:skull_crossbones: Be smart and balance your hp and altar's hp.**


**:video_game:  We hope you enjoy the game. All feedback is very important for us. Good luck. Have a fun!!**


![ezgif-1-7a3d60ba2a7c.gif](///raw/a86/91/z/23b3e.gif)

+ Fixed bug with pause button
+ Fixed bug with damage hero
+ Fixed bug with lights in webgl version
+ Fixed bug with sound of skeletons 
+ Fixed bug with colliders

**Controls:**
+ W,A,S,D - walk
+ Left Mouse  - attack
+ E - use altar
+ P - pause
+ Esc - quit game

entries.title: HackZ Memories
entries.description:
![Banner.png](///raw/e3b/22/z/22936.png)

*HackZ got robbed of his memories and try to get it back. But... there is something weird*

Check it on [Itch](https://blackpotion.itch.io/hackz-memories)

## THE GAME

**HackZ Memories** is a puzzle game. Try to make money and unlock the ending of the game. In this world, memories can be sold in the dark web, and hackers are feared.
Unfortunatly you were robbed and don't remember anything. The only solution you got is to steal memories from other peoples. But everything will not turn exactly as you expect.

## HOW TO PLAY

- Arrow keys or ASDW to move
- Right click to turn the camera
- Middle click to drag the camera
- Keys 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9,0 to switch selection of memory (or click on it)
- Click on the cells near your character to create friends using Childhood memories.
- Each friends will generate memories through time
- You can buy new memories and upgrade in the shop
- When you use a Non-Childhood memories on a friend it will change color and begin to generate the new memory you set
- You can use a special effect of each memory type when you use it on a Non-childhood friend
- After 30 seconds a Detective will arrive to catch you, you have to logout before he arrives to you
- Try to combine special effects to unlock the secret ending

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=teVRe4W5Ql0

*EDIT* Fixed bugs :

 - currency spawn in shop duplicating currency
 - detective use the wrong timer for speed acceleration
 - Zoom is not working
 - Hover Text showing when nothing to display.

## CREDITS

Programming by [@Chapo](https://twitter.com/kavaliero) and Narcisse members of [Black Potion](https://twitter.com/blackpotionhq)

You can check our work at [BlackPotion.fr](https://blackpotion.fr) !

entries.title: SPENDOTRON: 2019
entries.description:
Arcade shooter where money is everything
- An homage to the classic Robotron: 2084
- [Sound Effects using ZzFX!](http://www.3d2k.com/js/zzfx/)

How to play...
- Destroy the rival currencies!
- Use WASD to move.
- Mouse to aim and shoot. Hold left click to shoot rapidly.
- You start with $3, don't waste it!
- Bullets cost ¬¢1 each, but... you get ¬¢1 back for each kill!
- Collect copyrights for extra cash, each one is worth 5 more!
- Death cost $1, if you die with less then $1 it's game over!
- Score is the money you spent, not the money you have.

I will personally mail a $20 bill to the first person who beats $20!

entries.description:

# Oscilloscope

## Gameplay
![ezgif-2-90df41f8a857.gif](///raw/dda/z/22092.gif)

Puzzle game about collecting coins using interpolation.

*This game changed so much along the way that it no longer fits the theme, but I'll submit it anyways.*

**How to play:**

Read the GOAL section in upper right corner of the game for each level. It gives you hints on what do to.

**Controls:**

You control the game by first clicking on the "cursor" and then tapping the "physical" button on the side of the oscilloscope screen. Cursors are 2 white arrows on each side of the screen and the red dot in the middle.

Created for Ludum Dare 44 compo in under 48 hours using Unity. **Play here:** https://shard.itch.io/oscilloscope

The robots made by humans have turned against them.
They started to build a new civilization, but bumped into another civilization and angered them and have to pay them if they want to stay alive.
Now the robots have 2 choices: Pay the aliens until they get wiped out, or conquer the humans and with their technology, destroy the aliens as well.

entries.title: Nexcidium
entries.description:
![nexcidium_5.gif](///raw/659/c/z/2177b.gif)

This game is a vertical shooter wrapped with a fairly dark story. It's not designed to be very hard - the whole game can be completed in ~5 minutes or so.

Thanks for checking it out, I had a good time making it!

## Story

The year is 2098. Earth's human population has reached 15.2 billion. Under pressure of dwindling resources, the government passes the 'greater good' act. Under this act, families are paid to voluntarily terminate a loved one. As a government worker, your job is to carry out these terminations. The method of choice: 100mg 'nexcidium' injection.

## Controls
- **left/right arrows**: move player, selection
- **z/x**: fire, make selection

![nexcidium_000.png](///raw/659/c/z/217e0.png)
![nexcidium_002.png](///raw/659/c/z/217f2.png)

entries.title: At all costs
entries.description:
*First of all: This game is hard. To understand everything you may have to die a couple of times. I advise you to read the description.*

# Story:
A poisonous mist came down to earth.
You play as a survivor who managed to hide in a shelter.
Resources in the shelter will last only a few days. What are you willing to sacrifice in order to survive?

![Screenshot_15.png](///raw/958/z/2155a.png)

# Gameplay basics

## Contol :video_game: 

WASD - movement;

Mouse - look around;

"E" - Interact with items;

Esc - Lock/Unlock cursor;


# Usefull info (you can find it in game) :
- You need to eat at least once every 3 days.
- You need to drink at least once every 2 days.
- You need to survive for 20 days.
- While on the surface, you will constantly lose health.
- You need a toolbox for repairing and dismantling boards.
- If your health drops to zero, you will die.

**Good luck**

# Hints :star: 
- Keep your shelter warm (>50%). You will restore much more HP over night and farm will produce food more often.
- You REALY need a toolbox! Get it as soon as posible.
- Food also restore some HP!
- Don't forget to collect food and water.
- Farm works even faster if there is an additional light source.
- There is a **predator** in the garage. Be careful! ;) 


P.S. Many features was cutted from the game (for example buildings, craft, other materials, etc.)

P.S.S. Perhaps you will find an inaccurate translation in the game. Forgive me for this.

![Screenshot_14.png](///raw/958/z/21558.png)

entries.title: The Circle of Life-Defense

This is a small sandbox tower defense game where you must repel swarms of festering zombies, rotten flesh vying to consume your very being, with naught but your very own blood, sweat, and tears. Use your life shards to construct venerable defense towers, but be weary, building towers can hurt you as well!


**CONTROLS:**

-WASD or Arrow Keys to move

-Left Click to build a tower (cost 1 life shard)

-Left Click on a fully healed tower to upgrade it (cost 1 life shard)

-Left Click on a damaged tower to heal it and boost it's health (cost 1 life shard)

-Left Click on nearby blocks to pick them up and place them

-Right Click on a tower to destroy it




**CRITICS ARE RAVING ABOUT THIS CRITICALLY ACLAIMED ADVENTURE!**

"Dude" - My Friend Brian

"If only I had more time!" - The Game Dev Himself

"Why are those little green things bouncing so much?" - My Mom


**TOOLS USED:**

GameMaker, GIMP, Magix Music Studio

**COMPLIMENTS AND PRAISE**
 
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/silvervalegames)

entries.title: H2GO Tayne's Adventure
entries.description:
![h2goCover.jpg](///raw/4f4/a1/z/2440b.jpg)

![1dedd68fbd90d636434def8ecbc9a70d[1].jpg](///raw/9c3/2/z/23a71.jpg)

![cc7709289065293d01546b03cb86b28a[1].jpg](///raw/9c3/2/z/23a72.jpg)

## Description 

You take the role of Tayne, a space water miner out in the ring system of a distant gas giant. You must locate and bring back wrecks from among the asteroids and derelict stations to sustain Humanity and also to fuel your ship. You can also choose to drain the fuel tanks of the wrecks on location if you don't have enough to make it back. Just use the component scanner to locate the fuel tanks and suck them dry by attaching your harpoon. Choose carefully how to spend your fuel, disabling Auto Stabilization will save fuel but will make it much more difficult to fly. Crashing into asteroids or wrecks will cause fatal damage and breaking wrecks into pieces will make them less valuable.

Bring back 3 wrecks to the station to win or run out of fuel and perish among the asteroids!


## Controls


- RMB     Orient Ship
- 1/2	Arm Harpoon (Left/Right)
- LMB	Fire/Release Harpoon
- Q/E	Roll Ship
- Z	Enable Auto Stabilize (SAS)
- F	Pulse Scan
- R	Component Scanner
- C	Cut Wreck while close


Attribution:
The music is Water Lillies by Density & Time from the Youtube audio library.
The sound effects are from Freesound.org with minimal editing.

entries.title: BOB
entries.description:
![LogoInteiro.png](///raw/e45/z/22cc3.png) 



A game where the player, as an AI inside a computer of a colony spaceship, has the task to decide when it's a good idea to spend its ship energy, taking into consideration the intentions on these situations.

![bigIntro.gif](///raw/e45/z/246ce.gif)

Each decision the player makes saves or spend the ship's energy and modify the moral and storyline over the crew aboard the spaceship.

![bigEnding3.gif](///raw/e45/z/246cf.gif)

The final goal is to make good decisions to make it until the new planet humans want to colonize, without (much) incidents. But it's all about the journey and every kind of endings and tribulations the player may find.

![bigEnding2.gif](///raw/e45/z/246d0.gif)

Get on board and don't let the energy run out!

![bigEnding1.gif](///raw/e45/z/246d1.gif)

*[PATCH NOTES]*
- Discovered some broken endings that ruined the experience, and as the game is only based on it, we made a fix for it.

![gameplay3.gif](///raw/e45/z/246d6.gif)


[DEV DISCLAIMER] It needs an english spelling check yet, just saying :P
 

**_[!!!SPOILER WARNING!!!]_**
- So, if you already played the game, maybe you have noticed it basically runs with 3 attributes, being one of them the visible Energy meter and two other hidden values, *Hope* and *Chaos*. This other two keep going up and down following the player's answers, sometimes both changes, sometimes only one, depending on the answer, but one of them always changes.
Here are the endings list, as "achievements titles", and how to achieve them. Good luck!

*BASIC ENDINGS*
- **New Home** - Survive until a certain number of turns.
- **Powerless** - Just let energy run out.

*MID-GAME ENDINGS*
- **Spoiled Humans** - Keep the Hope attribute at 100% for 4 consecutive turns.
- **Hopeless Humans** - Keep the Hope attribute at 0% for 3 consecutive turns.
- **Rage Quit** - Keep the Chaos attribute at 100% for 4 consecutive turns.

*QUESTION/ANSWER DEPENDENT ENDINGS* 
- **Cold BOB** - Let people be sacrificed and keep the Chaos attribute at 100% for 4 consecutive turns.
- **Mad Captain** - Accept Captain to take command of the ship for a while and keep Energy around 0%~20% and Chaos around 70%~90% for 4 consecutive turns.
- **Greater Evil** - Accept the Alien refugees in the ship and keep the Chaos attribute at 100% for 4 consecutive turns.
- **Defective Ship** - Deny avoiding the asteroid belt, then deny fixing the hull with the machinery and keep Energy around - 0%~20% and around 70%~90% for 4 consecutive turns.
- **Sick to Death** - Accept funding the Doc experiments, then deny the Kid's demand on keeping the lights on, and let the energy runs out.

entries.title: Might of the Druids
entries.description:
[![CoverScreen.png](///raw/cf6/2/z/21add.png)](http://www.wyattcheng.com/games/MightOfTheDruids)


You are a Druid summoned by the Forest to aid against attackers.

Use the power of the forest to save nature. 

This is a deckbuilder game. I took inspiration from
* Dreamquest
* Slay the Spire
* Meteorfall

In keeping with the LD theme, upgrades are purchased with your maximum life rather than a currency such as gold.

What are you waiting for? Save the forest! [Play Now](http://www.wyattcheng.com/games/MightOfTheDruids)

Tools used:
* Unity
* Photoshop
* Audacity

Game Jam was streamed on Twitch at http://www.twitch.tv/candlesan

Post-Compo Change Log
* Tuning pass on cards

entries.description:
## /!\ -- /!\
- You can hold SPACE or (A) to speed up dialogs. (But I advise you to read in order to understand the story !)

## Description

Chains & Ores is a little narrative/plateformer game where you play as a slave who want to be free.
You will have to cooperate with your comrades in order to get enough money to buy your freedom and get your life back

## A little word

I'm quite proud of this entry, I gave my best during this whole weekend and I like the result.
I have to cut a lot from my original idea, but I think that it's look like a real and complete game anyway.

I hope that you will like it, and have fun playing it ! üòâ

entries.title: Blood Money
entries.description:
I only had 12 hours to spare for this Ludum Dare.

INSTRUCTIONS

Controls:
* AWDS to Steer
* Mouse to Aim
* Left Mouse Button to Fire

How to Play:
* Destroy enemy spaceships
* Pickup Hearts to gain life
* Pickup PowerUps to improve rate of fire / number of weapons / damage

Be Aware! 
* Your Life is Currency when collecting PowerUps. If you don't have enough life you may die from the powerups.
* The number displayed on hears and powerups indicate how much life you will gain or spend

Goal:
* Stay alive for as long as possible. Survival time is your score!

Making Of:
* The game was made in Unity 2018.3
* The spaceships were made in Blender 2.8
* The textures are photos of the dashboard of my car with colorization
Due to severe time constraints for this Ludum Dare:
* The sound effects were made using bfxr (https://www.bfxr.net/)
* To avoid having no music at all, I used a few arp presets and assembled the tune in 15 minutes (normally I have 3-4 hours allocated to making music)

![Screenshot 2019-04-29 04.35.08.png](///raw/d02/z/21b1c.png)

![Screenshot 2019-04-29 04.10.28.png](///raw/d02/z/21b1e.png)


If you are interested in creating modular spaceships, have a look at this tutorial that I created that demonstrates how quickly and easily you can make them:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vZe00W_WDq0

entries.title: The Aging Soul
entries.description:
The Aging Soul

![logo.png](///raw/eac/12/z/2348f.png)


STORY

"A young lad during his adventures accidentally encounters vicious Shadowbeast. Trapped in a cursed cave he must find his way out. You must hurry as time flows differently in this cursed place."  

ABOUT

Aging Soul is a platformer with aging mechanic, trying to pay homage visually to late Gameboy Advance games. You can make yourself older or younger at your will, though the second option comes with a cost of some your life time left. Use different age forms to achieve different goals. For example the toddler can't run or jump, but can squeeze through narrow corridors while playing as a kid allows you to move faster and jump higher. Sadly the old man form only works as a warning you are closer to running out of time, as we run out of time while making this game :P. He is though immune to something, we will let you to figure it out.    


CONTROLS

* Movement: Arrow Keys
* Jump: X key
* Get older: A key
* Get younger: S key
* Mute/unmute: M key
* To skip cutscene: X key

![02.png](///raw/b60/42/z/24108.png)
![01.png](///raw/b60/42/z/2410a.png)


Music: Eric Skiff - Come and Find me (B mix) - Resistor Anthems - Available at http://ericskiff.com/music

entries.title: Green Goo
entries.description:
![ScreenShot.png](///raw/eb7/z/22450.png)
Manipulate gravity to coordinate swarms of nano-robots in order to "greenify" a planet.  
Fuel the expansion by spending your nano-robots to build mines on the asteroids.  

## Controls

Mouse left and right click for interactions, scroll to zoom, and edges pan or WASD/arrows for moving around.


## Development

This Ludum Dare I wanted to try using Unitys upcoming "Data Oriented Tech Stack".
This means the game can easily handle thousands of physics objects.
The drawbacks are that the scope is more limited than originally envisioned 
*and* that I'm unable to do a WebGL build (multithreading not yet supported by WebAssembly).

A more thorough look into my experience can be found [here](https://github.com/Aggrathon/LudumDare44/blob/master/Documentation/dots.md),
where I also describe an interesting technique for handling gravity and navigation (a vector field).

## Tools Used
 - Unity
 - Visual Studio Code
 - Blender
 - Inkscape
 - Abundant Music (randomly generated music, but opting out of the audio category)
 - Audacity
 - Github

entries.title: The Branch
entries.description:
# Welcome to The Branch


The Branch is a ‚Äòslice of life‚Äô documentary looking at the staff who work at the local high street bank.

![alt cover.png](///raw/38c/2/z/24422.png)



In tonight‚Äôs first episode we meet branch manager - Clinton Meeks. Clinton‚Äôs obsession with currency is preventing him from ever loaning the bank‚Äôs money to anybody! In charge of the Bureau de Change is xenophobe - Mildred Pew. An elderly woman who‚Äôs only interested in the GBP and wants to get rid of all other currency. Then finally there‚Äôs body builder, branch security and delivery driver - Derek Armageddon, who‚Äôs suffered a severe spinal injury since using the vault as his personal gym. For these 3 people - currency is their life.

Tune in now!

![VkpY6N.png](///raw/fb6/z/23fb3.png)

The Branch is a simple narrative driven experience. Meet the characters and play out their day to day activities. There is no winning or losing, just doing. Have fun!

If you‚Äôve played our other Ludum Dare entries then you‚Äôll know what to expect, questionable gameplay, questionable voiceovers, and stupid humour. We hope you like it!

![cN7Dl_.png](///raw/fb6/z/23fb1.png)

entries.title: Wanted
entries.description:
**HEY SHERIFFS!** :cowboy: 

Wanted is a reaction game where you have to almost perfectly time your reaction in order to become the Sheriff of the Wild West! 
Government will pay you for killing your enemies, but be careful, you will also become a face on one of those wanted posters!

**HOW TO PLAY:**

Duel consists of three phases marked with three different sounds:  
* Ready phase,  
* Steady phase,  
* Shoot phase  

Once you hear that the shoot phase has started press **space key** as fast as you can!

First one that comes to **3 wins**, wins the duel!


**CONTROLS:**  
  
Single player: SPACE KEY - SHOOT  
  
Two player:  
A - first player shoot  
L - second player shoot

entries.title: Sour Business!
Space Struggle
entries.description:
![2019-04-28-ld44-screen1.png](///raw/2dd/z/211ce.png)

Space Struggle is a space management game.
You are the captain of a rebel ship that fights the Dog Catcher Association (DCA) to protect the dog population of your solar system.

Today you attacked a DCA outpost and freed seven cute puppies. Several DCA ships are hunting you as a result. They hacked your bank account and you are not able to access your money. You must reach your Home planet. They can defend you from the DCA.

Your fuel is limited and you will have to trade parts of your ship for fuel to reach Home. Selling parts will make you slower and weaker. Selling too much of the wrong parts can mean death. Your ship has four types of parts: Scanning, Speed, Damage, and Defense parts.
Check the ingame help screen for more explanations.

Let's hope you can make it Home.
FOR THE DOGGOS!

The game was developed with [Monogame](www.monogame.net), Pyxel Edit, Bfxr, and Bosca Ceoil.

You can send me feedback on Twitter: https://twitter.com/yellow_what

Thanks for playing  :-)

entries.title: Dragon's Den

It's a day in the life of a dragon!

Your life is currency - Theme Interpretation:
---------------------------------------------

------------------

The Princess is your shield, protect her and she'll protect you!

### Keyboard:

### Xbox Gamepad:

06/05/2019

entries.title: Kill The Money
entries.description:
Kill The Money is a retro-themed platformer shooter game where you play as a thief in the dungeon of the most secure and unrobbable bank. Your goal is to make it to the core of the bank and steal the cash. To do this you must defeat the treacherous currency turrets that protect the core.

In this game the amount of cash you have acts as your health, and the amount of change you have acts as your ammunition. Both are dropped by enemies (Cash more rarely) and both are used as currency for purchasing items in shop rooms.

There is a selection of weapons to discover within these chambers, however you start with your trusty old rifle, because you can't afford a better one.


![screenie1.png](///raw/08e/22/z/22f76.png)

![screenie2.png](///raw/08e/22/z/22f9d.png)

![screenie3.png](///raw/08e/22/z/22fb9.png)

![screenie4.png](///raw/08e/22/z/22fe3.png)

**KNOWN BUGS**
* If you press S while on a platform next to a wall, you can go through the wall briefly while falling (And possibly fall through the game)
* There is no pause menu. Currently the only way to quit the game while in combat is to press alt+f4
* If you are blinking from taking damage and you die, you will continue blinking and not stop.
* Items from the shop don't have any lighting and stay the same brightness.

**BUGS FIXED AFTER COMPO**
- (4/30/2019)
-   Fixed how restarting after dying you are not able to use doors.
-   Fixed idle animation not playing
-   Fixed one hand appearing for some two handed guns

entries.title: People Poker
entries.description:
![CoverWithTitle2.png](///raw/5c1/z/21ea2.png)

Escape the poker table of the creatures that would use you as currency in their cosmic poker game.

# How to Play

Get to the edge of the table and jump to freedom (or perhaps, at least, a quick death). Take cover near large objects to escape the attention of your captors. Don't get poked.

# Controls

WASD to move, shift to sprint.

XBox controller works with movement on the left stick, A to sprint. Other controllers may work also.

## Screenshots

![NextToGlass.png](///raw/5c1/z/21ea6.png)
![EdgeCards.png](///raw/5c1/z/21ea7.png)
![Tentacle.png](///raw/5c1/z/21ea8.png)

entries.title: GTApp - Great Tube App
entries.description:
Today, thanks to the internet and smartphones, it has become very simple to share one's daily life with friends, even those on the other side of the planet.
**But have you ever dreamed of sharing it with the world? and get paid for it?**

That's what **GTApp** offers, the first rewarding Live-sharing application.

How it works ?
Just start stream and share live funny moments with your audience!
The more thrilling actions you share, the more your audience will enjoy, grow and tip!

## How much money can you make with 1 second of your life?


![ldjam-Stage.png](///raw/f48/c/z/22900.png)
![space.png](///raw/f48/c/z/23d1b.png)


** This is our approach of the 44th ludum dare theme: "your life is currency". **

In this game you are in the shoes of a Streamer driving his pure-bred sports car. Enjoy the heady feeling of driving down the steets at high speed, drift, graze pedastrians or smash boxes!

++ TIP: find our home made Rocket League arena and try to score!


![space.png](///raw/f48/c/z/23d1b.png)

-----

**Controls:** Press arrows or WASD to move the car. Press escape to take a look at your phone.

**Made by:** Julian & Thibaud & Julien & [Leonaaard](https://dribbble.com/Leonaaard)

**Music credits:** [Dubstep](https://www.bensound.com/royalty-free-music/track/dubstep) by Benjamin Tissot & [Lucidity](https://bit.ly/2VGeFFA) by Kings

-----

entries.title: JUNO
entries.description:
WASD / arrow keys: throttle & steer
Space: shoot

![final_2.gif](///raw/dc1/z/20ed6.gif)

Asteroids, but with a twist - power ups cost money, and without money, you are vulnerable to being smashed. Do you take a powerup, gaining increased ability, or keep the dosh to be able to take an extra hit?

Made with Unity. Audio was done in Ableton, using a Roland System-8 for everything but drums.


*I've noticed some discrepancies in the WebGL version, but i'm leaving it up for accessibility. For best performance, please use the Windows version, or compare your experience with the Youtube playthrough.

entries.title: Dr. Ectomy
entries.description:
![im3.png](///raw/e13/1/z/2355d.png)

You are a surgeon. Expert in organ removals, replacements, and rearrangement.

Your clientele are strange folk, with unique ailments. Survivors of your operations pay top dollar, but one mistake and your reputation will be tarnished.

"Your life is my currency," you tell each one as they lie down on the table. 

Anesthesia takes their consciousness. The last thing they see is you looming above, sharp scissors glistening in your hand...


**Instructions**
- Your clipboard describes the goal of each operation
- **Left Click** organs to move them into and out of the patient
- **Right Click** or **CTRL** to rotate organs

Organs can be moved to the operating table, but lose health while outside the body. If an organ dies, the operation is a failure.

Good luck :smile:

entries.title: Dusty
entries.description:
Dusty is a dungeon crawler where you have to spend your health points to purchase perks.

As one of  Mr.Necromancer's spawn, explore his dungeon and fight other creatures for a chance of getting your life back!!

entries.title: Battery Life
entries.description:
Battery Life is a top-down action/puzzler game. You are a battery and you have to use your energy, (your lifesource), to solve puzzles and defeat enemies.

https://youtu.be/6tkJ4xl4Tc0

The game only has 5 levels as I was pressed for time, (duh). But it is a framework that I can work on in the future if people like the game idea.

Use W, A, S, D or the arrow keys to control the player battery. Shoot with the mousecursor and left mousebutton.

This is my first game on Ludum Dare and basically my first game ever! I really enjoyed working on the game and the concept of finishing it in 48 hours. The game is buggy and needs a lot of tuning and improvements, but it works and I think everybody can see where I'm going with this.

- Arrow Keys: Move

Number of coins, placements of coins, placements of dig spots, and placement of foxes are randomized. Every play is a little different.

entries.title: Shooter on a Budget

You play as "Budgit", a robot that runs on coins. Your mission is to defeat the boss hidden deep within one of the dungeons in this open world game. But watch out, almost everything you do costs money. Run out of money in your wallet and it's game over (unless you have a credit card ... ).

Thank you for trying our game out and make sure to rate and leave a comment!

entries.title: Where There's Smoke
entries.description:
Take a leisurely walk through a beautiful forest on two, stumpy iron legs.

Play as Bernie, a sentient furnace on an exploitative adventure. Interact with other machines, and find your way through the wilderness. You have a purpose‚Ä¶ but you can‚Äôt quite remember what it is. Guess you‚Äôll have to wing it!

Your only concern is your delicate flame, slowly dwindling within.

![Capture.PNG](///raw/f92/22/z/24dc5.png)

entries.title: Soul Tycoon
entries.description:
![SoulTycoonFeatures.png](///raw/38d/21/z/24a82.png)
# Description
In Soul Tycoon you play as a bankrupt capitalist who must sell out his soul to begin his investments into a new money making scheme. Purchase property and buildings to work towards buying your soul back and making some profit along the way.

[**Play Game in Browser**](https://orangejuicepanda.itch.io/soul-tycoon)

[Source Code](https://github.com/Orange-Panda/Soul-Tycoon)

## How to Play
* Left Click - Action (Buy, Collect)
* Right Click - Modify (Repair, Sell)
* W/A/S/D or Arrows - Move Camera
* Middle Mouse or Space - Go to Cursor

## Tools Used
* Unity 2018.3 (C#)
* Visual Studio 2019
* Krita
* Audacity

### Personal Critiques
What I think could be better about the game if I had more time:
* Districts don't have any visual feedback
* Utility buildings were unable to be implemented
* The art is not very good

![early.png](///raw/38d/21/z/21b38.png)

# Post Jam Quality of Life Update
* Added a simple tutorial
* Added a once per day collect all button
* Right click now brings up modify menu instead of left click
* Fixed a few minor UI bugs

NOTE: There is an alternative page that has the original build without the changes.

Play directly from your browser with this link : https://ashtrail.itch.io/survive-the-heist

This game is an interactive story where you have to survive a bank heist. As a hostage your life is the currency to the bank robbers survival. Will you manage to save as many people as possible ? Find out in the 4 different endings.

## Controls

entries.title: Maintenance Costs
entries.description:
![Sans titre 18.png](///raw/46b/d1/z/21714.png)

Hello! And welcome!

Maintenance Costs is a puzzle game in which you give instructions to your robots. Unfortunatly, robots are pretty exepensive to maintain, and greatest economists of the world say that it would be more efficient to avoid maintenance costs. 

Keep your focus on two things: achieving level objectives and letting go the old robots that hold you back.

Difficulty level only change the amount of money you get when you start the game. More money, more place for errors.

### This game is difficult.
Seriously, I didn't want to make it that hard, but it is. Some tools were created to help you:
 - In-game help: enable it on the launch screen (enabled by default, recommended).
 - In-game tooltips: if you don't understand what something means (UI or tile), there is probably a tooltip linked to it. Place your cursor over it and see a message box appear at the top of the screen.
 - In this description ("More about game mechanics"), you get advanced explaination about the programmation mechanic (I suggest you try the game first; read this section if you don't understand how to play)
 - There is a walkthrough page to help you if you get stuck in a level at http://nathanistace.be/ludumdare/44/walkthrough/

### Changelog
I provide two links to the game, the original version and a fixed version. Original version is working correctly, but fixed version gives better comfort, without changing the gameplay.

Added in the fixed version (you are not rating this):
 - Fixed a visual bug that would show the level on the menu scene
 - Lowered the default volume of some sfx
 - Cheat code: in game, type "money" to get +$1000 ("But... Isn't that a way to avoid the theme?" "Well if you need to restart the game you lose time, you lose parts of your life, and time is money. So we could say that this cheatcode is actually more in the theme than anything else in the game!")
 - Cheat code: in game, type lvl# where # is 0-9 to jump to another level.
 - Walkthrough page


Good luck and have fun!

### More about game mechanics
If you get stuck and can't understand how the game works, here is a more complete explaination than the one you can find in game. If you didn't start the game yet, you should start it and give it a try before reading this.
 
![Sans titre 3.png](///raw/46b/d1/z/21d35.png)

Conditions work as a IF .. ELSE IF .. ELSE. Each turn, the robot will do the action corresponding to the first matched condition.
A condition is given as IF [A] CONTAINS [B] THEN DO [C], where
 - [A] is a tile next to the robot
 - [B] is the content of the tile
 - [C] is the operation to do

Example: Option 0 on this screenshot tells the robot IF [tile on right] CONTAINS [nothing] THEN DO [move to the right]

The OTHERWISE case only contains the [C] part, that will be executed if no other option condition is matched.

Content conditions: 
 - The star matches anything on the tile: steel blocks, wooden boxes, flags, spawn platforms & robots
 - The full square matches fixed or pushable items: steel blocks, wooden boxes & robots
 - The robot matches robots
 - The empty square matches empty tiles
 
Operarations:
 - The left arrow tells to move left
 - The right arrow tells to move right
 - The star tells to do the robot's special action
 - The Zzz's tells to do nothing

entries.description:
Anthill is a short puzzle/action game based on a physical arcade game from 1983 called Zeke's Peak, which I have never played, but once saw a youtube video of.

![Screenshot 2019-04-28 18.07.22.png](///raw/782/9/z/21849.png)
