entries.title: Bloodbarn
entries.description:
*Available for Windows and WebGL (HTML) here: https://honestdan.itch.io/bloodbarn*

### CONTROLS
- WASD - Move 
- Mouse - Aim 
- Left Mouse Button - Use Weapon 
- E - Equip / Drop Weapon , Consume 

https://youtu.be/HD66dAfSBc8

### THE GAME
You are Fydo, a simple farmer who's discovered the **secret to growing more than just vegetables**. Through planting materials and fertilising the soil with **his own blood**... he is able to bring to life non-organic objects - like Microwaves, Toasters, Clown horns and much more! And these non-organic objects are worth top dollar!

![game1.jpg](///raw/ecb/c/z/2347a.jpg)

However, this goes against the *Farmers Fair Trade Act of 1963: "One must only grow organic matter"*. As a result, the **vegetables are mad**. Their real mad, and will come and **attempt to destroy your farm on a daily basis**.

![game3.jpg](///raw/ecb/c/z/23480.jpg)

Plant combinations of wood, metal, plastic and blood to grow over 10 different plants. Once fully grown, you can harvest these items to help **protect your farm**! Each object has a special ability. Throw televisions, mow down some carrots with a desk fan, stun the tomatoes with the flash of a camera! Your farm is worth defending - but save *some* of your grown loot... a farmers gotta earn!

![game2.jpg](///raw/ecb/c/z/23483.jpg)

entries.title: Lifelight
entries.description:
‚ÄûOnce upon a time in a world filled with darkness, monsters lived in peace and harmony. 
Until a creature of light was born.
Tortured by the light emitted by the strange creature, the monsters began to attack to bring back the natural order of the world.
Just as the first monster‚Äôs strike was set to end the gleaming light for good, the light began to transform into‚Ä¶‚Äú

In this game you will play the manifestation of light born in a world filled with darkness. It is your destiny to bring light into these dreary malicious realms or else you will get consumed by the shadows. Hordes of monsters will get attracted by your light like moths and they will attack you in waves. Killing a monster with your beams of light will grant you light life, which will protect you from their attacks and even strengthen your very own offence. But be aware, the more powerful your attacks are, the more they will drain the light out of you. 

What happens if darkness perishes once and for all? It is about you to find out

This game is my (Kromzem‚Äôs) third entry for the Ludum Dare Game Jam and the second entry for both Manti and Gumbarius, who already participated in my past projects during the past two Jams. 

Credits:

Kromzem: Coding  
Manti: Sprites, Artworks  
Gumbarius: Balancing , Animation, Translation into English

entries.title: DEA-7H
entries.description:
![titlescreen.png](///raw/faf/12/z/21c05.png)

**I'm seeing a lot that the mouse doesn't always work in the title menu >.< Sorry about that. If you get that bug use the keyboard, the mouse works fine in the game proper.**

**Controls** *Move left/right with the arrow keys or A/D. Scan people with a left mouse click, and talk to people by pressing enter when you are close to them. Escape will take you back to the title menu.*


**Hello, DEA-7H. Welcome to The Corporation...**

You are Debt Extraction Android 7H (DEA-7H). It is your job to seek out debtors that owe the corporation and have defaulted so that they may settle their debt through... other means. Unfortunately it is common for these future slav...I mean people... to go into hiding.

You must talk to the people, attempt to learn what you can about your target's disguise so that you can bring them in.

Scanning a person will show you the known details about that person as well as what you know about your target.

Be careful, however; talking to too many people will tip your target off, and they may slip away before you uncover them.

If you think you have worked out who your target is, you can talk to them and accuse them, but false accusations will immediately tip off your target.

Here's a video. The content of what I'm saying is really directed at the viewers of my YouTube channel, but there's a solid 4 minutes of gameplay on the screen while I'm saying it.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=okIZbcNcpYQ

entries.title: LD44: Minter
entries.description:
You have been working on the mint for decades. You love this place. You love this job.

You are the minter.

*Your life is currency!*

![Minter-03.png](///raw/61f/b/z/2400b.png)

**Instructions**

Your goal is to keep the mint working, keep the money flowing, keep your job. The mint will make coins automatically as long as the machines are in good shape: raw metal is delivered in one side, coins leave on the other.

Keep an eye on the "coins per minute" indicator. If it falls to zero, it is game over for you!

Control the minter (your character, the green thing on the screen) with the arrow keys or WASD. Execute actions with Control, Enter or the space bar (they are all the same; this game uses a single "action" command).

*Machines:* Machines decay naturally as the time passes and sometimes they just break. You can fix them using tools. The worse the machine state, the slower it will send the mintage to the next stage in the production pipeline.

*Tools:* You fix machines using tools. You start with a wrench, which never breaks but is not really a good tool. You can buy other tools which are faster to fix things up but have a chance of breaking upon use. Buying a tool will reduce your "coins per minute" for some time. You can get your tools at your office.

*Visitors:* The mint has a nice museum by the reception area. Visitors are blue and are welcome. Too bad, sometimes visitors get curious and decide to wander through the forbidden areas of the mint. Don't let them do that! These areas are dangerous, and an injured visitor will cost you some "coins per minute" as restitution. And let's not even think about how much would cost of a visitor lost his life in a mint accident!

*Thieves:* Since Money Heist (La Casa de Papel) aired, the number of red-clothed people trying to steal money from mints has skyrocketed. Expect some of them.

*Weapons:* They work are just like tools, but can be used to kill thieves and to convince rogue visitors to go back home. Avoid hitting visitors too hard, you don't want them dead!


**Technical detals**

* Engine: [Godot](http://godotengine.org) 3.1.1.
* Graphics: [Krita](https://krita.org).
* Font: [Lato](http://www.latofonts.com), by ≈Åukasz Dziedzic.
* Audio: Some effects recorded by myself, some generated by [jfxr](https://jfxr.frozenfractal.com), edited with [Audacity](https://www.audacityteam.org).
* Music: A Kazoo reinterpretation of a Pink Floyd classic, which I called *Short of Money*. Despite all my musical talent, I must admit I still prefer the original version.


**Known bugs**

* The title screen says "May 2019", but the game was evidently made in April!
* There is no way to turn the music off.

entries.title: Coin Boys
entries.description:
# *IT'S SODA TIME*
Coin boys are here, and they love you. They want to spend all their time with you, and are star-struck by the sight of you!
![CoinBoys_2.jpg](///raw/253/9/z/21c17.jpg)

## How To Play
Personally I wouldn't really call this a "game", but... it should be a fun, short little... *thing*... yeah... let's just call it a **thing** for now. 
Oh, um, yeah just do what you want, talk to some coin boys, buy a soda, jump off the edge when you're done with everything else you want to do, you'll figure it out. Just try it.

![CoinBoys_5_Cropped.jpg](///raw/253/9/z/21c1f.jpg)

## Controls
If you've played video games before, then *you're in luck* because it's basically the same as everything else.
- WASD - Movement
- Mouse - Lookin'
- Space - Jump
- Shift - Sprint
- Left Click - Pick up / Drop *(you should see a little note pop up under the reticle when you can pick something up)*

![CoinBoys_3.jpg](///raw/253/9/z/21c1d.jpg)

## AND MOST IMPORTANTLY
enjoy!
oh, and be careful. Your actions have consequences.

![CoinBoys_4_cropped.jpg](///raw/253/9/z/21c23.jpg)

# Trailer!

https://youtu.be/U_l1L78CnRE

entries.title: Arcade Wars
entries.description:
# [Play now! (Web)](ludum.thenet.sk/ld44/) | [(Itch.io link)](https://aurel300.itch.io/arcade-wars) #

![ss1.png](///raw/133/z/2300a.png)

# Gameplay #

Survive onslaughts of arcade machine enemies! The **coins** on the right side of your screen show your current health, as well as ammunition. Collect dropped coins from destroyed enemies into your **funnels**. You can also collect bullets into the funnels, but be careful ‚Äì bullets hitting your **chassis** (the green box) will hurt you!

![ss2.png](///raw/133/z/23011.png)

# Story

In an arcade far, far away...

It is a dark time for the arcades.
Although the regulars still play
every day, newcomers are unheard
of. The arcade machines, whose
lifeforce comes from the coins,
now have to compete with each
other.

So, in the middle of the deepest
nights ... the war has changed.

![ss3.png](///raw/133/z/23014.png)

# Controls

 - **Arrow keys** to move
 - **Spacebar** to shoot
 - **B** to bomb (clears enemy bullets for five seconds)

entries.title: Game Dev Life
entries.description:
‚ÄãBorn, learn, get fun and work in search of a dream: become a successfull game developer.

Every decision has a life cost. Manage your happiness, money and vitality and reach your dreams!

# How to play?

![GameDevLife.960x600.20190501134154440.png](///raw/e4e/z/2417e.png)

## Goal

You are a boy that wanna be game developer. Your goal could be reach your dreams, become rich, being happy or get older (or maybe a mix of all of them, it is possible!!!). Also, you can play to discover several ways to die :P.

Game ends when you spend all your life and die (it could take about 2-3 minutes if you get that far in the game). Then the game will show you a summary of your life.

![GameDevLife.960x600.20190501134111868.png](///raw/e4e/z/2417d.png)

## Game flow

Every month you can make an action. **All actions take a cost of life**, and will change your life state. You have 3 game indicators that will give you all the information that you need for knowing the progress in your life.

### Life

It's the most basic parameter. **When life is over you die**.

### Happiness

Most of the actions you make affects to your happiness. If this bar is over your life cost of your actions will be increased dramatically. **Be sure you take a break every now and then ;)**.

### Money

Get fun costs money. Get independent cost soo much money. **Living is not free!** If your money is negative you will start to lose your Happiness.

## Actions

Actions (or decisions) are divided in 3 sections that you can navigate clicking the gray buttons. If you put the cursor over an action, a panel in the right will show you the immediate consequencies of that action.

### Fun

![GameDevLife.960x600.20190501134315087.png](///raw/e4e/z/2417f.png)

It will improve your happiness. At the beginning your only action is "Play", but you will get more ways to get fun in the future!

### Study

![GameDevLife.960x600.20190501134214995.png](///raw/e4e/z/24181.png)

Learning is essential to get a job. As in real life, the most of the early years you will have to learn the basic stuff (General learnings). After that you could start to study about your vocation: videogames.

### Work

![GameDevLife.960x600.20190501132818326.png](///raw/e4e/z/24182.png)

When you have basic learnings you can have a crap job and earn some money. If you abandon your dreams, you can get experience and apply to better jobs. Maybe it could be easier being happy and rich! Else, **your first jobs in the videogames industry will be unpaid**. You must work as internship or make free jobs before you can become a game developer. Nobody said reaching your dreams was easy!

**NOTE:** There are a lot of jobs that you could unlock studying and working. For example, if you get experience as programmer and artist, you could work as technical artist. Even, if you work hard, **you will be able to found your own big videogames company!!!**

### Special action: become independent

![GameDevLife.960x600.20190501135258668.png](///raw/e4e/z/24184.png)

When you are 18 years old you feel that you need your space. **If you get independent, you will spend $1,000 per month, but if you stay at your parents home you will be less happy every month**. Become independent as soon as you have a paid job!

entries.title: My Life is Not Currency
entries.description:
It is the year 2024, after the fall of civilization.

The neo-capitalists are attempting to regain control of the earth, using Life brand cereal as currency.

At the Quaker Oats guy, you are duty-bound by your oath to honesty, integrity, and purity to stop them.

Retrieve all the cereal before it is too late!

WebGL build forthcoming!

## How to Play

Make your way through each of the four levels, finding all the cereal boxes around. 

Watch out for enemies:

* *Clerks* are patrolling the levels. If they see you they'll give chase
* *Capitalists* are often found milling around near boxes of cereal. Beware their binding contracts!
* You can fire some of your precious Life brand cereal at the enemies to temporarily incapacitate them.

## Controls

Supports both keyboard and controller.

### Keyboard:

* WASD/Arrow keys: move
* Space: Fire
* Escape: Quit

### Controller:

* Left stick: move
* A: Fire (or whatever maps to "button 0" in Unity)

## Known Issues
It's a Ludum Dare game, there's probably something!

## Changelog

### v0.2, 4/29/2019

Minor bugfix release for the following issues:

* On restart, additional music player gets instantiated
* Under some circumstances, picking up an additional life grants 2 or more
* A few small cosmetic issues in level design
* Mouse click fires projectile
* Life bar expands leftwards for negative values (ie on level lose), instead of just not rendering

## Timelapse

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6qwwApk7Rt4

entries.title: Axed
entries.description:
Defend against industrial robots that want to cut you down to use your life as currency! Use your energy to fend off waves of enemies and use their life to build traps and defenses. How many days can you survive before they cut you down?

The game is intended to get to wave 12+, so if you‚Äôre having trouble getting there, consider the strengths and weaknesses of your traps and reconsider your strategy!

Update 1: Added an optional easier mode (your main move does 2 damage instead of 1!) as we would rather users get further through the game if they so desire.

entries.title: The Ultimate Frontier
entries.description:
You are an intergalactic colonizer that reaches a new planet just to realize that you were sent to the wrong one. Given your limited resources you can't hope to survive for long in this planet, so you resource to making deals with the devil in exchange for your life. To last as long as you can.


The game plays as a survival endless game where you have to sacrifice life in order to gain powerups.

entries.title: Failing Human
entries.description:
>**_Now with added web version!_**

![Gameplay.png](///raw/e89/c/z/22015.png)

Keep your human's body from giving up on them for as long as possible, but be careful, they're very good at getting into accidents!

This time round I decided to make a clicker game, where you trade blood for various stats such as strength, intelligence, and food with the organs of the body. I'm happy with how it turned out, but didn't end up fitting the theme as much as I would've liked

Programs:
I used Unity (again) as a game engine, and used PyxelEdit for all of the graphics. Audacity and Bosca Ceoil came in handy for the music and sound effects.

entries.title: Mint Sprint
entries.description:
![Screen Shot 2019-04-29 at 08.18.11 PM.png](///raw/436/2/z/2323f.png)

![Screen Shot 2019-04-29 at 07.52.00 PM.jpg](///raw/436/2/z/231fc.jpg)

## It's time to make a mint!

Take control of *Bill the Buck* and push around the parts and pieces of this puzzling production line. It's time for this buck to make some dough!

## Instructions
![Mint-Sprint-Instructions.png](///raw/4a5/2/z/24bbb.png)

Assemble a working production line by pushing conveyor belts and machinery into place. Flatten ingots into sheets, then stamp the sheets into coins, before depositing them into the end goal. Items can only be pushed ‚Äî not pulled ‚Äî so be careful to not get stuck!  

## Controls
![Mint Sprint Controls.png](///raw/4a5/2/z/24bbd.png)

**Movement:** WASD, ‚Üë‚Üê‚Üì‚Üí, or Joystick  
**Push:** Walk against the light blue machinery to push it! Dark red machinery is stationary.  
**Undo:** Control or Gamepad Face Buttons  
**Reset:** R  
**Quit:** Escape  

If you get stumped on one level for too long, try this:

**Secret Level Skip:** Tab
  
## Credits
Art & Design by [Kyle Hall](https://ldjam.com/users/ransom)  
Programming by [Kai Clavier](kaiclavier.com)

entries.title: The Price To Pay
entries.description:
Your love died and her fate is in the hands of the devil. Thus, you can't afford to live without her so you decided to start a journey in the Devil's den in order to save her.
However, you'll have to pay tribute with your own body or soul to keep going through the Hell's trials.
Pay tribute with your arm or leg and become less powerful or forget a memory of your love life in order to keep your abilities ?...
Make the right decisions to save the love of your life but remember, everything has a cost...![Capture_3.png](///raw/5ff/12/z/2291a.png)![Capture_8.png](///raw/5ff/12/z/22922.png)![Capture_4.png](///raw/5ff/12/z/22c11.png)![Capture_1.png](///raw/5ff/12/z/22c07.png)

entries.title: Double Deal
entries.description:
![logoText.png](///raw/e42/z/21c1e.png)

You are currency. Trade to make the *cursed* Doubloon (‚àû) the most powerful monetary unit of the seas. Control the market, or the curse will die with you.

Left Mouse Button to select/command ships. Right Mouse Button and Scroll Wheel to control camera.

![gif_03.gif](///raw/e42/z/21b0f.gif)

I have no clue if the game is actually beatable. Trading might seem very confusing, so here are a few tips:

- You'll want to use the ships you control to collect different currencies from different traders to generate *doubloons*. Cursed ships (those that you control) **convert other currencies** to doubloons as soon as all currencies are present in their inventory.

- Be wary of how much of one currency you accumulate and of how much doubloons you spend, since if your *doubloons* lose their dominant status on the ship, the curse will lift and you will lose the ship.

- There is no RNG, all prices are dynamically calculated under set rates based on country demands. Try to speculate on various offers of the seas to maximize profit.

**Changes**

[04/28/2019] - Fixed UI sizing for HTML, changed Unicode character for Ranc currency, fixed typos in Country declaration

[04/28/2019] - Fixed typos in Country conversion

[04/29/2019] - Fixed typos, added quality option for HTML build, fixed conversion issue, lowered audio

entries.title: Dungeon of the Blood God
entries.description:
![title.gif](///raw/924/e/z/21bb2.gif)

Enter the Dungeon of the Blood God in search of riches. The longer you stay the more health he drains from you.
Defeat enemies and make decisions that trade blood for gold.

Controls - Mouse

Engine - Game Maker Studio 2
Art - Aseprite
Music Generated using the Abundant Music procedural generator

As I have used some premade sounds I am opting out of Audio.

entries.title: Work Life Balance
entries.description:
Perform menial jobs to help generate profits for the corporation. Work efficiently and you might get some time to recover.

Death is inevitable as your workload piles up. But last as long as you can and your contribute to the company will be briefly remembered.

![ScreenShot.png](///raw/6e8/21/z/24996.png)

entries.title: Robots in Hell
entries.description:
Hi, i‚Äôm Andrea Di Bartolo, 3d Artist currently working for Shoppe Keep 2, fourth Ludum Dare that i do alone, as a 3D Art guy with very little experience in coding, this time i tried to step up a bit and do a game with more mechanics, albeit simple ones: a Tower Defense!

![Ld441.png](///raw/86d/c/z/22068.png)
Robots in Hell is a Tower Defense game where you have to defend your infernal palace from hordes of evil robots that are invading your sanctum! build towers and cast spells to dispose of them, but be ware, there is no money in this game, everything is paid with your life force!

Features:

-3 types of enemies

-3 types of turrets

-2 spells

-5 levels

Controls:

Standard tower defense controls, click on the ui buttons to select a tower to build, click in a free spot to build it! right click and drag to rotate the camera.

entries.title: Victor Spumante And The Raindrops of Burgundy
entries.description:
The game is about a gentleman called Victor Spumante, who is the last man an earth, surviving in his lonely castle in a world overtaken by vampires. Fittingly for the theme "Your life is currency", Victor is forced go get creative in surviving.

It is a trash game, developed in a stream of consciousness style. A devlog is available on my Twitter https://twitter.com/gimblll/status/1122045038400286720

![banner1.png](///raw/dc0/52/z/2100c.png)

No further screenshots. You need to experience it. Full on. Or maybe not. Your brain may not survive the experience. Actually, I don't think anyone should touch this. Bye.

entries.title: Regal Pain
entries.description:
*As your aging father retires, it is your turn to take the throne. Unfortunately he retired late, so you are already aging and frail.*

Regal pain is a game about increasing your reputation while trying to stay relative healthy.
Try to gain as much fame as possible before any body part reaches 0!

**Features:**
- Aristocratic debauchery
- Dubious medieval healthcare

**Instructions:**
- Click the buttons!
- At the end of every season (5 days), you will take 1 damage to all your body parts. This increases to 2 dmg in year 2, etc.
- ESC brings up options

![Unity_2019-04-29_18-41-33.jpg](///raw/c8e/e/z/22ebb.jpg)

Credits:
- Art, code, design by myself (except the banquet and speech scenes)
- Made with unity & adobe photoshop

Twitter: [@polyhatsteve](https://twitter.com/polyhatsteve)

*Note: Unity Linux version and web versions soon to come*

entries.title: Carl Currency - Expert Exchanger
entries.description:
![2019-04-29 23_42_43-Greenshot.png](///raw/58a/z/22847.png)

You are Carl Currency and currency is your life!
You work as a currency exchanger and need to fulfill your customers wishes. Unfortunately though, you have no idea how much each currency is worth. Evaluate your visitors' reactions to find the correct exchange rates!

Good luck! :)

entries.title: LD48.Paylife
entries.description:
![paylife2.gif](///raw/e6f/81/z/24cea.gif)

Welcome ! [**Paylife**](https://deformhead.github.io/LD48.Paylife/index.html) (Ludum Dare 44 Theme: Your life is currency) is built in plain HTML5/JavaScript with a framework I am developping.

**I challenged myself creating this game in only 24h instead of the regular 48h !**

**Rules** :

- it is a mouse-only game
- you have 60s to break your best score

- clicking on cards cost life
- cards increase life per second releasing hearts
- catch hearts to gain life

- when an heart flies away, you lose 1 life

**I'd like to** :

- add sfx

**This was my second Game Jam, so I hope you'll like this game. Thank you for your support.**

entries.title: Force of Nature
entries.description:
![fon-title.png](///raw/17a/32/z/22fa3.png)
## About
This is the developers first Ludum Dare.

Force of Nature reminds players to get in touch with their roots. Play as the protector of your forest and its people. Use abilities to stop those who want to destroy your lands! Build structures to gain resources and increase your strength, expanding the energy and life of the forest.
The only price is....your life.

## Features
- Use abilities to attack waves of enemies!
- Build structures to strengthen you and the forest!
- Upgrade buildings to survive longer!
- Harness enough forest energy to rest!

entries.title: Bloom
entries.description:
You are not just a flower.

You are the nature.

Trying to escape them.

Go on.

Bloom.

entries.title: Deadrun
entries.description:
Your life is currency. Literally.

Death has a debt to pay, and he needs your soul to pay for it.

Avoid him at all costs. Find the exit. Escape.

# Controls

* WASD: move
* Mouse: look around
* F: fullscreen

# Browser Support

Tested in:

* Chrome 73.0.3683.103
* Firefox 66.0.3

# Tools used

This is my first 3D game. It was written from scratch (no 3D libraries) in 48 hours using TypeScript and WebGL.

* Code: Visual Studio Code
* Art: Gimp
* Music and sound: FL Studio

### Changelog

#### 2019-05-03

- Added missing death sound effect
- Fixed a bug where enemies would be much larger on smaller resolutions making it impossible to see
- Fixed the same bug for the exit tile particles
- Both of the above bug fixes involved optimizing how these objects are rendered

### Known issues

* Link to compo page on last screen doesn't work well (takes you to a page that doesn't scroll, itch.io's fault)

entries.title: limbostore.heaven
entries.description:
I died only once
and now I am here.
Trapped in limbo,
no chance to flee.


Hello death, my new friend,
my so called life still has value to you?
Or am I just a puppet on a string,
only here to entertain, 
to dance, to die, to sing?


Staying forever seems like a grim fate,
I was never too fond of false new beginnings.
But using deaths careless offerings
there might just be a chance to escape...

![21164.png](///raw/c02/42/z/248b3.png)

## About

At the limbostore, you pay with your life. Literally.
Trapped between life and death you collect hearts to buy upgrades and proceed to the top level of the building. Trying to get to heaven and find peace.

![58909963_1057342934474895_1423822611137167360_n.png](///raw/c02/42/z/2115d.png)

entries.title: Biomass
entries.description:
![Screenshot from 2019-04-29 00-12-36.png](///raw/bfc/1/z/21407.png)

‚ÄãA game where you try to grow the biomass of your planet.

## Goal of the Game‚Äã

There are asteroids passing by.  Each type of asteroid carries a kind of resource necessary for life.  However, life is fragile!  In order for it to develop, you need to provide your planet with exactly the right resources, by diverting asteroids away or towards the planet.

Complete the current "recipe" to produce more biomass.  When you reach enough biomass, your life forms will grow to the next stage, requiring different resources.  Be careful though!  If an asteroid not required hits the planet, it will cause a small-scale extinction, which reduces your biomass.  In the worst case, this might throw you back to a more primitive life form.

## Controls

‚ÄãClick and drag on an asteroid to move it.  It works like a rubber band: stretch in a direction, then release to send the asteroid flying the opposite way.

The menu on the left shows:

- On top: your total biomass
- Below that (in white): the current "recipe" for life that you need to fulfill.  Each asteroid remaining is half-transparent.  Asteroids that have already been collected are full coloured.  The number "+xxx" indicates the amount of biomass gained by completing that recipe.‚Äã
- At the bottom (in red): the next "recipe" for life, that will be unlocked when your total biomass is at least equal to the number at the bottom of the recipe.

This game is best played on a touch screen, in landscape mode.  Try
it on your convertible laptop, your smartphone or your tablet.‚Äã

## End Game

There is no upper limit to your biomass, but you lose if you ever reach 0.  In that case, the game crashes, because I didn't have time to make an end screen! :-D‚Äã

## About the Theme

The game talks about life, but the "currency" part isn't really there.  That's because I wanted to add a "store" part to the game, where you'd spend your biomass on upgrades.  Unfortunately, I realized this wouldn't be possible with the remaining time, so I focused to make the basic game fun enough to be played as it is.

"*It's been almost a hundred years since vampires reaveled themselves and started coexisting with humans.*

*However, with each year passing, humans saw their liberties and their rights diminishing, until they were reduced to little more than pets.*

entries.title: [Don't] Insert Coin
entries.description:
### ABOUT OUR GAME

Lopista is a video game character who lives his tiring life in his arcade cabinet. After decades of playing and dying repeatedly, somedays **he just does not want to step in his own game**. Help him **kick the coins out of the arena**, preventing them from entering the device that starts his game.

**Press, hold and release the action button** to kick the coins. The more you hold the button, the stronger the kick and farther the coins go. However, coins pile up when they collide with each other, making them more vulnerable to stronger kicks. With the **movement buttons** You can move the character around or change direction while holding the kick button.

entries.title: Proton
entries.description:
## Proto‚Åø
**Electrical Repairbot Prototype**

![Proton-TitleLarge.png](///raw/c7e/1/z/23c90.png)

A brief concept game by Greg Lord, Stellar Door Studios

## **Play or Download the *Post-Jam* version with audio** 

- **WebGL:** https://s3.amazonaws.com/krowocstudios.com/LD44/Builds/WebGL/ProtonPostJam2/index.html
- **Windows:** https://s3.amazonaws.com/krowocstudios.com/LD44/Builds/Windows/ProtonPostJam2/PostJam2.zip
- **Mac:** https://s3.amazonaws.com/krowocstudios.com/LD44/Builds/Mac/ProtonPostJam2/PostJam2.app.zip

![Proton-Gameplay1.png](///raw/c7e/1/z/23c9d.png)

The Robotics Facility is rapidly going offline, and it's up to you, the experimental PROTO(n) unit, to carry the last sparks of electricity to the dying facility.  As a walking battery bot, you will have to carry and deliver your own electrical charge to restore these broken devices -- and be careful to preserve enough electricity for yourself.

![Proto-Tired.gif](///raw/c7e/1/z/23c92.gif) 
![Proto-Recharge3.gif](///raw/c7e/1/z/23ca7.gif)

Use your battery's dwindling charge to move through the facility, to plan routes around hazards, and to deliver yourself to the scattered recharging stations that remain.  Getting there will require restoring operation to the doors and mechanisms along the way that block the way to the heart of the facility.

![Proton-Gameplay3.png](///raw/c7e/1/z/23c96.png)

Good luck, little prototype.  It's time to for your real-world test.

### Controls

Press TAB or Start at any time during gameplay to see the controls

**Look/Move:**

- **Keyboard:** WASD / Arrow Keys; then Spacebar to move to highlighted tile
- **Mouse:** Hover over tiles, then click to move
- **Controller:** Left Stick: move view, A Button to move to highlighted tile

**Camera:**
- **Keyboard:** WASD / Arrow Keys (Look); Q/E (Rotate View); Mousewheel (Zoom)
- **Controller:** Left Stick (look); Right Stick (Rotate View); Left/Right Bumpers (Fixed Angles); DPad Up/Down (Zoom)

**Use:**
- Stand in the same square as the panel or object
- Use Enter Key, X Button, or F Key to use the object

**Restart Level**
- Use the Delete (or Backspace) Key, or Back Button

### Credits

![Proton-Gameplay2.png](///raw/c7e/1/z/23c9a.png)

All models, animations, designs, and code by Greg Lord

Stellar Door Studios

[www.stellardoorstudios.com](https://www.stellardoorstudios.com)

Special thanks to the awesome friends at Stellar Door Studios, and to our Frederick Game Dev group!  This was started (quite late) as a background project during a group game jam event, and only made its way to a submission (if not quite a finished one) with their support and encouragement.

### Post-Jam

Now that things have calmed down after the jam weekend, I've had a chance to add some of the missing features that didn't make it in by the jam submission hour.  So far this includes:

- Audio / Music (and hopefully more of this still to come)
- Improved controls and camera
- Bug fixes outside the scope of the normal jam bug fixing

I'd love to hear feedback about both versions, and I'll keep the changes rolling into the Post-Jam version at the links below.  (Please remember that review scores should be based on the jam version!)

**Important note:** WebGL is probably the easiest way to play this, **but** the Windows version has audio features that WebGL doesn't support (whicih was pretty disappointing to learn)!  If you want to hear some fancy audio effects dynamically interact with your little Proton's battery level, try the Windows version! (Mac might work too, although I can't currently test Mac builds!)

## **Play or Download the *Post-Jam* version with audio** 

- **WebGL:** https://s3.amazonaws.com/krowocstudios.com/LD44/Builds/WebGL/ProtonPostJam2/index.html
- **Windows:** https://s3.amazonaws.com/krowocstudios.com/LD44/Builds/Windows/ProtonPostJam2/PostJam2.zip
- **Mac:** https://s3.amazonaws.com/krowocstudios.com/LD44/Builds/Mac/ProtonPostJam2/PostJam2.app.zip

## Official Jam version, for scoring:

entries.title: Overburnt
entries.description:
![cover-00.png](///raw/7c1/z/24409.png) 
### What is it about?

Overburnt is a relatively straightforward time management game with a twist in the form of additional fatigue management. You're the exploited assistant to the mayor of a village where your local heroes tend to stop to stock up equipment, and your task is to satisfy their requests, maximizing profits while at the same time you're trying not to burnout from doing too many tasks at once.

I added the fatigue mechanic because coupled with the time management core and the usual themes you can find in games of the genre (waiters, cooks, etc working themselves to death to maximise income) it felt like a great fit to the theme. However, I cut a couple of features that made the connection more obvious (A player avatar controlled with joystick/keyboard, and some in-between levels narrative scenes) , so it's a bit loose now. :sweat_smile:

![cover-recipes.PNG](///raw/7c1/z/2440a.png)

### Controls

Drag and drop with your mouse from resource node to craft node or from node to character face to fulfill a request. Most actions have a timer, so you can't drag a resource onto a busy node until it is completed.

### Tools/credits:
Unity 2019 as IDE.
Aseprite + Affinity Photo for art.
Trello for task tracking.
I used a couple of free fonts from Dafont.com:
* [Minecraft](https://www.dafont.com/es/font-comment.php?file=minecraft)
* [Retro Gaming](https://www.dafont.com/es/retro-gaming.font)

I recently got a PO-20 (love it!) and a Midi controller and I would have loved to make some music, but I ran out of time :sob: 

### Changelog:
* **29/04/2019**:
    * **v0.0.3 - ~~(COMPO Submission)~~**.
    
    (Half an hour later...) 
    * **v0.0.4 - COMPO Submission(for real this time)**. It added a small UX fix: Target income should appear next to the earnings. Also, I had to make some UI tweaks to make it look properly on devices but I managed to make an Android version :smile: 


* **02/05/2019**: 
    * **v0.0.4  MacOSX and Linux builds**. I haven't been able to test Linux tho, so if anyone can try please let me know if there's any issue.
    * **v0.0.5 Win / MacOSX POST-COMPO**. This hopefully first post-compo iteration adds a bunch of music tracks I've done with Famitracker, fixes some issues regarding level resets and increases the collision areas so drag&drop is easier (especially on mobile).


* **03/05/2019**:
    
    **Patched Web, Windows and Android COMPO versions** (Mac and Linux will have to wait a couple of days):
    * A blocking issue that caused crafts to get stuck at 99% has been fixed.
    * Crafts in progress can no longer be dragged until finished.



### Compo version known issues
Some of these have already been fixed in post-compo builds. They'll appear in italics.
* *Fatigue will not reset if you restart the level after losing it because of exhaustion.*
* *The End level popup earnings texts are misaligned.*
* *Game Beaten popup not showing after level 3. Also, restarting the game will not do so from level 1.*

entries.title: Lifarm
entries.description:
![screenshot2.PNG](///raw/823/e/z/20c91.png)
Farm sim, where your life is currency and you must fight monsters to plant another day! Should you keep ‚ù§Ô∏è for the next fight? Or should you invest them into plants for some health later?

entries.title: GERYDAS TOWER
entries.description:
Long ago, a mysterious item called the Sigil of Light was discovered. It has the power to make it's owner invincible. When your sister becomes deadly ill, you do the same thing so many adventurers did before you... you venture to the tower built to protect the sigil. Can you make it through?

![cover_gt.png](///raw/513/z/217b0.png)


## FEATURES: 
- a good story
- epic intense top down fighting
- a soundtrack that made my computer die multiple times

## CHANGELOG
#### Note that every version listed here was made and compiled after the compo ended. Unless noted otherwise, the new versions only fix bugs and don't add / alter gameplay.

#### 1.0.1
- Fixed slimes / shooters spawning in walls
- Fixed slimes oscillating rapidly in some cases
- Fixed a bug where slimes would clip through walls if the player teleported while they were attacking
- Fixed a bug where the effect of the second special room would persist in new runs
- Fixed slimes not playing their attack animation in some cases
- Fixed a bug where the sword could only hit one enemy at a time
- Fixed a bug where shooters would ignore their cooldown timer in rare cases
- Fixed various visual glitches

#### 1.0.2
- Fixed a bug where attacking a shooter projectile would crash the game
- Fixed some sprite misalignments

#### 1.0.3 - if you only played 1.0.2, please update before voting!
- Fixed the player's hitbox being completely misaligned

#### 1.0.4
- Fixed a rare crash when selecting the second option in the second special room

entries.title: Gather Drone
entries.description:
Your ship is out of fuel and running on reserve power. You must explore the planet to find energy ore to fuel it. But you run on the same power as the ship, so you must make sure to keep some for yourself or you will power down forever. 

The currency in this game is the energy you need to run(life) as well as fuel the ship to escape. 

![Gather Drone by Vimlark - Google Chrome 4_28_2019 5_54_06 PM.png](///raw/a75/f1/z/21752.png)

![cap_1.png](///raw/a75/f1/z/21779.png)

entries.title: Moneyman and Pennyboy
entries.description:
![banner.png](///raw/a71/9/z/2197a.png)

David Osh is one of the most despicable people on this planet, maybe even worse than corporate lawyers: By spending excessive amounts of money on pay-to-win mechanics in his favorite game, Battleshoot, he dominates its rankings. However, his life gets turned upside down when the "legendary gamer witch" turns out to be a bad loser and turns him into money! Will David become human again? Will he grow as a character? Will the Ludum Dare deadline keep killing everything it touches? All these things will be revealed in Moneyman and Pennyboy! 

Note: Press R to restart a level, the mystical tutorial hobo forgot to mention that.  
Update: Added a root folder to the zipped Windows file, because I know there are some strong feelings regarding those out there + linked assets into the exe (they're still on github if you're curious and/or terminally bored) + Dreamcast port.

entries.title: Fateful Dealings
entries.description:
![ezgif-1-de55e5131640.gif](///raw/4a2/21/z/218e1.gif)

Play in browser: https://vfqd.itch.io/fateful-dealings

**About:**

Fateful Dealings is a systems driven card RPG where you play as one of the recently deceased. You look back on your life and the choices you have made to determine where you'll end up at the time of the final reckoning. It's inspired by the likes of Cultist Simulator.

**Controls:**

Requires a mouse: click, hover, drag n drop. Drag and drop resources into the middle to use them.

**The Theme:**

I wanted to take a different twist on the theme to the one I anticipated most people would do. My interpretation here is: what if someone's life, their very existence, was a currency, and their various actions gained or lost this currency.

**Tools Used:**

Unity, PyxelEdit, Audacity, Bfxr, NoiseMachine, WolframTones

Follow me on twitter - https://twitter.com/vfqd_

![hm4Ncv09uf.png](///raw/4a2/21/z/21a9a.png)

entries.title: It's not easy being me
entries.description:
If you think your body has it easy trying to keep you alive, then why don't you try doing it yourself! In "It's not easy being me" you use your life, the blood in your veins and the air in your lungs, to keep your body alive and kicking. As organs grow you'll struggle to keep up.

Good luck!

Instructions:
- Your heart pumps blood around your body.
- Your lungs fill blood that passes through them with oxygen
- You must supply organs with a constant supply of oxygenated blood or you'll die.
- Hold the left mouse to mark new veins for creation
- Veins will be made when blood arrives at the site
- Hold right mouse to delete existing veins

A note on the WebGL version: I provided a WebGL version to play if you don't want to download anything. However, at least on my computer the performance is kind of bad and the graphics aren't as good. If you do have the time, I would highly recommend downloading the windows version. If you do want to play it on WebGL, please full screen the game for the best experience. Some of the GUI elements got messed up when it's minimized.

Screenshots:

![LD44_StartMenu.PNG](///raw/341/41/z/238c8.png)
![LD44_final.PNG](///raw/341/41/z/238ca.png)
![LD44_died.PNG](///raw/341/41/z/238cb.png)

Gifs:

https://imgur.com/a/sMzJRUe


Changes:

04/29/2019 - Fixed bug in pressure calculation that caused poor performance, especially in WebGL build.

04/29/2019 - Fixed bug where, due to pressure floating point truncation, blood would stack in veins.

entries.title: Rock, Paper Scissors: After (School) Hours Edition
entries.description:
---Description---

Not the traditional kind of rock, paper, scissors. Reaction-based, fast-paced, and with a small twist. You'll be facing your fiercest classmates in a battle to the death. Over time, your classmates will become inpatient and speed up their turn. The only way to calm them (temporarily) is giving up one life. How far can you make it before you need to sacrifice a life (as a currency)?


---Controls---

- Z - Rock
- X - Paper
- C - Scissors
- Space - Give Up a Life


---Your Goal---

- Counter the opponent's attack before their timer runs out. Their timer will gradually increase in speed every turn.
- When you can't counter their attacks fast enough, press space to sedate them temporarily, losing a life in the process.
- Try and defeat as many classmates as possible before the time is up (and you have to go home). Every 5 opponents you defeat, you gain 15 seconds to the timer.


---Screenshots---

![TitleScreen.png](///raw/dfc/12/z/20e91.png)

![GameScreenshot1.png](///raw/dfc/12/z/20e92.png)

![SampleGif.gif](///raw/dfc/12/z/20fcc.gif)

You use hearts to buy new ugrades. Each time you complete a level, you gain the amount of hearts that you had left over. Go to the shop to sell them to the devil. If you're stuck on a level, try replaying an older one to get hearts and new upgrades.

entries.title: Dungeon Buddies
entries.description:
# Dungeon Buddies

It's a short rogue-like dungeoneering puzzler! This game was created from scratch for LD, including all assets and music.

If you encounter any problems, or just for a general chat, drop by the #ludumdare IRC channel on afternet.org!

I used the following tools and libraries to make this:
* Tools: text editor, Audacity, Logic Pro X, Pixilart.com (sprite editor), Gimp
* PIXI.js (a HTML5 canvas library)
* Howler.js (for audio)

I made this game mainly on my new Linux workstation, except for the music (because of Logic Pro) :smile: 

## How to Play

* You can play with mouse or keyboard.
* Num Pad or Arrow keys to move, attack, or interact
* Most actions cost you hit points
* Attacks work by subtracting the hit points of each participant from the opponent
* R restarts the level
* Tab switches between characters
* Special abilities are explained in the sidebar
* There are 10 short levels
* You must get one character to the exit in order to complete a level
* "Cheesing it" is allowed and encouraged

## Random Notes

* There is no upgrade mechanic, you get all the abilities from the start and XP is basically just for high score (because I couldn't come up with a dungeon design that wouldn't screw people over who upgraded "wrong")
* You'll see how well the other players did on a given level on the level end screens
* It should work in most modern browsers, but I tested on Chrome/Chromium only. Frame rates on Firefox will most likely suck, but it should be playable.

## Post LD Patch Notes

* Changed the XP stats to show percentages instead of number of participants

![ld44-screen1.jpg](///raw/2cb/z/2322d.jpg)

## Videos
* Elysia Griffin plays Dungeon Buddies: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/421751050?t=03h21m43s
* MrJoshuaMcLean plays Dungeon Buddies: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/419497157?t=10h14m19s

entries.title: shoot out your life
entries.description:
![Shoot out your life (LD44) pic4.png](///raw/264/z/243e2.png)

# shoot out your life
is a little 2D arcade shooter that I created alone within about 12h in total

I wrote it in the programming language [Rust](https://www.rust-lang.org).

As engine I used [Tetra](https://github.com/17cupsofcoffee/tetra)


# Gameplay
Shoot with your life and prevent the black hearts from touching the ground.

If you keep the shoot button pressed, the shot charges and can hit more than one opponent.

But beware, every shot costs lives.

![shoot_out_your_life.gif](///raw/264/z/2464f.gif)

# Controls

## Controler
* Digital Cross for left and right
* A to shoot, hold A to charge shoot
* start to start and restart

## Keyboard
* arrow key for left and right
* space to shoot, hold space to charge shoot
* space/return to start and restart 

# Tools
The applications I have used are IntelliJ, PyxelEdit, Affinity Designer, lmms and LabChirp.

entries.title: Sofa Kingdom: Change of Thrones
entries.description:
# Links
---

- ** [HTML5/WebGL](https://lando.systems/games/ld44-sofakingdom) **
- ** [Desktop/Java](https://lando.systems/games/ld44-sofakingdom/ld44-sofakingdom.jar) **
- ** [Source](https://github.com/bploeckelman/LudumDare44) **

** You can't die or lose, and the game can be completed in a few minutes. Enjoy!**

When Ludum Dare gives you a theme you couldn't chair less about...

You make a game that will knock some cents into theme voters.

This game is Sofa Kingdom: Change of thrones!

Coin you believe we made a game about the objects found in your couch?

![introsofaking2.gif](///raw/503/z/234fe.gif)


# Controls:
---

- ** Left click or CTRL** To shoot
- ** Up arrow or Space Bar** To Jump
- ** A and D or Left and Right arrows ** Moves you Left and Right

![controls.png](///raw/503/z/2312d.png)


# Game:
---

Here's the general flow of the game:

- Battle through the Sofa Kingdom as Pursey. Collect coins, find your way, and defeat the bad touchy hands!
- The game can be beaten in only a few minutes so we hope you enjoy the complete play though. 
- Shoot coins at enemies to stun and kill them.
- Pound the ground to bounce coins so you can catch them in your pouch.
- You can't really die, and we give you coins if you run out, so you can see and enjoy the entire game.


![sofaking.gif](///raw/503/z/2337d.gif)

[LandoSystems](https://lando.systems) is a group of jammers from Madison, Wisconsin that varies in size from 2 to 12 people. This is the team's 19th Ludum Dare game!! :grinning:

entries.title: Brain Drain
entries.description:
![cover_banner.png](///raw/2b9/31/z/23799.png)

## "The future is now!"
"Have a tough calculation you need done? Why not use the brains of your fellow man to help solve the problem. Literally."

## Now with Linux and MacOS builds!

![1TL5DBmxyE.gif](///raw/2b9/31/z/2380d.gif)

## Get rich
Make money by connecting willing subjects to the calculation contracts you have coming in. The faster you complete them, the better. You might want to keep an eye on the mental health of your subjects though, you don't want to fry their brains right? Or maybe you do.

Just let them relax for a bit. And then they'll be back again.

Make sure to post your top score in the comments!

![Brain_0not1YWLEa.png](///raw/2b9/31/z/2379e.png)

## How to play
Left click & drag to move around subjects or contracts

Right click & drag between subjects and contracts to connect them

Right click on a connection to remove it

Note that subjects only stay for a short while before leaving.

![Brain_iVdqeWTAvV.png](///raw/2b9/31/z/237a0.png)

## Pro-tip
Subjects further up a chain gets burnt out slower.

## Known issues
Somewhat rarely the game crashes, currently being investigated

## Changes
Added hint on disconnecting connections and made info a bit more clear

Added Linux and Mac builds

entries.title: Bill Hunter
entries.description:
![Banner simple - large.png](///raw/921/31/z/222ec.png)

![Logo - wide.png](///raw/921/31/z/225a1.png)

![Banner With Face - large.png](///raw/921/31/z/222bf.png)

## Short Description
"Bill Hunter" is an attention-requiring puzzle game where you play as a hitman called Bill Hunter. You work for a big organization that has a long history of money printing with a small twist to it. Your money is made of real presidents that become the figureheads once the procedure is done. It's your job to deliver those presidents and print this special money.

## Gameplay
In "Bill Hunter" you can play 3 missions, each on a different difficulty level. In each mission, you are given a list of targets and see how they look like in the upper right corner of the screen. The targets are random mash-ups of features from multiple presidents and look different every time you play the level. The targets are somewhere inside a crowd of people. For some reason, everyone in this crowd looks almost exactly as the targets you are looking for. Differences may only lie in a single feature like outfit, hair, face, beard or accessories. Who knows... maybe there is some kind of presidential cosplay event around.

Once you found a target and are certain of them being the real one, you can kidnap them. However, be careful of other people seeing you. If a person witnesses your act, they will flee from the area and escape. If you don't watch out, another one of your targets might escape before you even have the chance of encountering them.

If all targets are either kidnapped or did escape, or the time limit is reached, you will return to your organization, and do what your organization has practiced for over dozens of centuries now.

## Controls
Information about controls is accessible from the game's menu.

## Technical Details
* The game was made in Unity 2D
* All sounds and graphics were made by ourselves

entries.title: Jailocorp
entries.description:
![cover_2.jpg](///raw/86a/2/z/21a34.jpg)

**Story:**

In the future the prison population will be a commodity to trade with. Lives are bought and sold to the highest bidder. Jailocorp is the market leader in this new exciting area. Their clients have standards for talented workforce and you are shipped to be evaluated by Jailocorp. You want to succeed. Otherwise it might be the end of the road for you.

**Game:**

Jailocorp is a short Myst-like puzzle game where you are up against 4 puzzles of varying difficulty. You must prove yourself to the Jailocorp analysts and get to live another day.

![cover_3.jpg](///raw/86a/2/z/21aee.jpg)

**Controls:**

WASD = movement

Mouse = look around

E or Mouse1 = interact / pickup / use an object

Mousewheel = change active item

Select "None" for the item if you want to interact with objects without trying to use an item.

entries.title: Cats Without Cars
entries.description:
![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/885/22/z/23b87.gif)

Your cat may not have a car, but it has rocketpowered hoverboots, a gun and loads of fun.

In this insane Arena-Shooter any upgrades you want to purchase cost your life. Luckily, you're a cat and therefore got 7 of them. Even luckier: you can steal the other cat's lifes by shooting them with your big-ass gun. 

![photo_2019-04-30_02-53-32.jpg](///raw/d85/22/z/232b4.jpg)

The first upgrades come cheap. But watch out, the really good upgrades, that make you a flying bulletstorm of pain and agony for everyone around you, cost up to 5 lifes and even a badass life-stealer like you, can never hold more than 7. 

![newscreen1.png](///raw/d85/22/z/23ad0.png)

So power up your boots, distribute aerial-style headshots like a croupier of death and become the ultimate killing-machine. 
Only after you took all lifes of your enemies, you will be victorious.

But wait, there is more: To spice things up, you can just start again in a **brand new, one of a kind arena (Random-Generator)**, you have never seen before.

![photo_2019-04-30_02-54-50.jpg](///raw/d85/22/z/232e1.jpg)
![WinningScene.PNG](///raw/d85/22/z/232c8.png)



![MainCharacter.PNG](///raw/d85/22/z/2334c.png)![enemy2.jpg](///raw/d85/22/z/23351.png)

And for everyone who enjoyed our **Kickass-Music**: 
All the credits go to Markus Graf-Gabriel. https://www.youtube.com/user/TheStickstring1 

If you ever wanted to watch wild programmers and artists in nature, now we give you a chance. Our **timelapse** clip gives you a nice overview how we created "**cat without cars**" in the **72 hour Jam**. And some stayed up **all day and night**:
![optimized_ludumDare_gif.gif](///raw/a85/22/z/242ef.gif)

ChangeLog:
- 1.1.1
 - Fixed a problem where cats could dissapear and not be killable.
 - Fixed a sound bug that played the wrong effect when hitting a palyer or the shield.
 - Player now wont freeze any longer in the shop after dieing.
- 1.1.0
 - Player stucked in Mid Air after shooting an enemy while he was dieing with 1 life left.
 - Fixed a Animation Bug in the Start Screen.
- 1.0.7
 - We thought it's unfair that the enemy can kill you right after you start the game, so we removed that feature.
 - But for removing that feature we increased the enemies life by 1 (in total they have 3 now)
 - We know that cats love laser pointers. So do we! Therefore we increased the size of the target laser pointer.
 - To compare scores with others, we also included your bounty in both end screens, not just when you die. **(Post your scores in the comments by the way. We would love to know how well you did!)**
 - The camera now rotates more intuitively and you are even able to rotate it by pressing Q/E
 - Improved the UI by simplifying text and buttons
- 1.0.6
 - Relocated huge bounty UI element, that was blocking the view. He just had a big ego
 - Play sounds now when and where they should play, and not before their time has come
- 1.0.5
 - Fix Laser Pointer hiding behind trees. We commented out the shy factor
- 1.0.4
 - Initial Release (Download below)


**IMPORTANT NOTE FOR MAC OS AND LINUX USER**

We could not test the builds for those Systems.
Mac users will have to **[ctrl]** + **click** the App and choose **open**. You Probably have to try it a **couple** of times. Then please **install** the recommended software. Starting the App can lead to error messages but giving the App some **time** can fix that problem.

entries.title: The Oarsman

entries.title: Trinket Town
entries.description:
### Story
- You are in debt to the local crime syndicate (the Trinket).
- You have to steal to pay back the debt.
- If you fail to give them enough cash each day, you will not see tomorrow.

### Controls
- Android - Finger
- WebGL - Mouse

### Video
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ty83Npjs7y4

### How to play on Android

If you want to run this on an Android device you will most likely have to allow "install apps from unknown sources" in your settings under Security & Lock Screen.
After which you can click the link to the Android file, and install it.

### How to play on iPhone
I do not own an iPhone/iPad etc. so ... iPhone users will have to do with WebGL.

### Personal goals for this Ludum Dare
- Learn how to publish to mobile (Android)
- Learn how to manage scenes

### Tools Used
- Unity
- Audacity
- paint.net

entries.title: Attack on Jerry
entries.description:
https://youtu.be/TwTBj7tcUSc

![screenshot.png](///raw/2cd/d1/z/2317a.png)


## Introduction

After winning last jam's race, Jerry wanted to fulfill his dream of becoming president,

so he started a campaign that had overwhelming success among citizens.

But, oh no! Jerry caught a flu!

He needs your help to recover and achieve his dream.

Defend Jerry's brain and heart by placing organs and paying for them with your own blood, around the two paths to defeat the bacterias!


## Controls

mouse lol


## Towers

The eye attacks enemies from a distance, killing them in one hit.However, it can only target one at a time

The nose attacks nearby enemies with rapid fire. Each shot only does a small amount of damage.

The mouth attacks enemies with an AoE projectile, they work well near enemy spawn points

The ear uses powerful AoE attacks to take out multiple enemies at once, however, it's fire rate and range are fairly low


## Soundtrack

Get it [here.](https://soundcloud.com/the_real_astrodex/sets/attack-on-jerry-ost)



## Credits

Astrodex - sound

James - ultrasonic super fast coding

lau - trailer and sound

Noogai - sprites and 2D

Red - 3D models, ui, and coding

Rjwest - team mascot (he also helped a lot with the idea)

entries.title: Ultimate Financial Championship
entries.description:
![collect-coins.gif](///raw/f5/z/21c34.gif)

# [Click to Play! (HTML5)](http://www.jezzamon.com/ufc-jam)
or
# [ Play NEW AND IMPROVED POST-COMPO version](http://www.jezzamon.com/ufc)

:moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag: :moneybag:

***

## FEATURING GAMEPLAY FEATURES FROM ALL THE POPULAR GENRES

:white_check_mark: IDLE

:white_check_mark: MMO

:white_check_mark: FIGHTING

:white_check_mark: COOPERATING?

:white_check_mark: ROGUE-LIKE-LIKE RANDOMLY GENERATED NAMES

:white_check_mark: NOT QUITE FINISHED

## HOW TO PLAY:
### :cityscape: STREET PHASE
- CLICK ON A COIN to get it. When you get the coin say loudly "COIN GET" or "PUT THAT IN YOUR WALLET AND SIT ON IT"
- Click a FINANCIAL FIGHTER right in the belly to start a TRADING BATTLE. Click them RIGHT IN THE BELLY. Real close. None of this "Oh the hitbox should be larger" nonsense. **Jez tip: If there's no one else playing, open a new window/tab and fight against the idle fighter. Or invite a friend!**
- Watch people move around and be part of the HUSTLE AND BUSTLE of the financial district.
- Participate in NON-VERBAL FINANCIAL INTERACTION with your fellow businesspeople.

### :boom: BATTLE PHASE
- During the BATTLE PHASE, fighters are given a chance to invest in other fighter's stocks and gain a COMPETITIVE EDGE.
- Fighters need to buy and sell stocks to meet their AGGRESSIVE PROFIT QUOTAS. You must end with more assets than you started with!
- Due to INSIDER TRADING LAWS the other fighter DOES NOT PARTAKE in during the trading battle. Victory is YOURS FOR THE TAKING.
- Are you COOPERATING or COMPETING with your fellow fighter? Who can tell?
- Winning the financial battle will give you a 49% SHARE of your opponent's assets. Your opponent doesn't lose anything though? Sounds like a GOOD DEAL TO ME.
- Added winning bonus: Gain LUCRATIVE STOCKS that generate dividend money while you sit there!
- Losing will HALF FINANCIAL QUARTER your total money! By which we mean losing will make you lose half your money.

## :question: *The mystery name*
- Every player gets their own name but they don't know what it is! Only by climbing the ranks of the HIGHSCORE TABLE and by PROCESS OF ELIMINATION can you discover your TRUE IDENTITY

## :two_men_holding_hands: TEAM UP WITH A FRIEND
- Insider trading NEVER LOOKED SO GREAT! Just DON'T TELL THE COPS.

## :cyclone: EMBRACE THE VOID
- Go too far away from the starting zone and you PROBABLY WON'T BE ABLE TO FIND YOUR WAY BACK. Become one with the void!

## :family: YES THIS IS ACTUALLY MULTIPLAYER
- All the other people are people that are currently playing this game or people that have WALKED AWAY AND GOT BORED.

## :no_mobile_phones: MOBILE ONLY WORKS IN POST-COMPO
- Compo version is DESKTOP ONLY for now. The CSS is KIND OF BROKEN. But all's well in the post-compo version :)

---

Haha, but seriously...

It's a fun little game! My first time attempting an idle game -- I didn't get to everything I wanted to, but happy where it sits :slight_smile: It's a lot more fun playing with other people, so I'd recommend sending it over with someone and seeing who can get the most money fastest!


---


## POST-COMPO CHANGES:

Gameplay Tweaks:

- Persist state between plays
- Add basic leveling system
- Make it so extra dividend bonuses stack

UI Tweaks:

- Fix up mobile UI
- Make text not selectable
- Make sounds quieter
- Fix hitbox sizes for players & coins

entries.title: Brothers in Prejudice: Colombian Bam Bam
entries.description:

![screenshot.jpg](///raw/14c/z/234a2.jpg)

Miami, Florida, 1984

Take aim in this bargain bin Hotline Miami clone, shooting up the bad guys as two of the department's highest ranking detectives. Dodging enemy fire like a badass will net you sweet, sweet cash, but be careful - take too many hits, and the department will let you go.
 
To slow down time, use your dash move (L2/Right Click) near enemy fire. If you're up for some extra difficulty, try finishing the game as much left over money as you can.

A controller is recommended, but not required. Sound and other options can be set by pressing Start or Escape.

**Writing:** KappaJin 

**Project Management:** Slemmens 

**Art:** rbatistadelima 
 
**The HTML5 version has performance issues on some systems - please consider using one of the download versions, which are only around 20 MB.**

entries.title: Meat Your Unmaker
entries.description:
Card Collection meets The Dating Game! Answer questions to fill out your Deck of Cards. The cards represent your life (memories, choices, likes, dislikes, essence etc) - this will be your currency later in the challenge. With this small selection in hand, you are thrust into an existential cosmic struggle. The aim of the game is to find your perfect match while not angering any of the other Gods (they will straight up end you.) It is okay to be initially confused by the Gods; as you will find out, they are also confused by Humans.

Use Left Mouse Button to click on Things.

Divine Aspects:

![241d9.png](///raw/d5f/2/z/241fe.png)

Like
![HappyIcon.png](///raw/889/32/z/241e1.png) 
Dislike
![SadIcon.png](///raw/889/32/z/241e2.png) 



Tell us in the comments: Which God would you date? Did you win someones heart?

Last minutes of compo so i have to hurry up!

**DESCRIPTION**

Suddenly, you found yourself in the dangerous snowy area and you have to reach end of the this area by defating the dangerous enemies.

I am not sure about the game balance but maybe later i can work on it for a post jam version.

entries.title: 99Hearts
entries.description:
![ezgif.com-gif-maker (1).gif](///raw/09f/61/z/21c3f.gif)




# OVERVIEW

You are building the world around you by laying down the rooms in the world. You get upgrades and fight enemies while potentially becoming insanely powerful.  Your life is the currency so you use it for everything you do.

Inspired by the board game Carcassonne. I love the ideas of placing down tiles to build a world so I wanted to explore that concept within a game.  Other game inspirations for this game include spelunky, risk of rain, and forager.

üíú Hearts to build the world with rooms **(32 Hand Crafted rooms)**

üíú Hearts go down if your timer lowers (only when enemies are present)

üíú Hearts go down if you take damage from enemies **(6 enemy types)**

üíú hearts can be used to get upgrades **(9 upgrades)**

üíú Enemies scale up as you progress

üíú Game will endlessly loop so you can keep playing with all your upgrades

# TIPS
* Hold Down Space/Action to shoot in place without moving
* If you get negative hearts you can still earn hearts to get positive again
* Bombs can set off other bombs causing chain reactions
* Spawner enemy types don't move they just spawn and do no damage
* If the game feels too hard  use R key to restart it's all randomized


# CONTROLS
-----------------------

### GAMEPAD SUPPORTED

**GAMEPAD DPAD** AND **LEFT STICK** = **ARROW KEYS**

**ANY FACE BUTTON** AND **TRIGGERS** = **SPACE**

------------------------

press **ARROW KEYS** (or **WASD**) to **move** and **shoot**

press **SPACE** to lay **bombs** which hurt enemies and destroy rocks

hold down **SPACE**  and press **ARROW KEYS** (or **WASD**) to **shoot** standing still

press **SPACE** for in game actions like **building rooms** and buying **power ups**

press **R** **START** to restart

press **F4** to toggle **fullscreen**

press **F1** or **SELECT** to toggle **stats**

press **F2** to mute all sound

------------------------

# GAME PLAYTHROUGH

https://youtu.be/IEYaHDZijNM



------------------------

# CREDITS

**Code , Art, Sfx** by [Barret Vasilchik](https://twitter.com/RagTagBarret)

**Color Palette** by [KerrieLake](https://twitter.com/KerrieLake)

https://lospec.com/palette-list/rustic-gb

**Music** by [Failpositive](https://twitter.com/failpositiv)

entries.title: MeltUP
entries.description:
![ldBanner.png](///raw/8d0/41/z/218f8.png)
 

A roguelite platformer where the only currency is deadly, radioactive uranium. **WARNING:** This game is **hard.**

![ss.png](///raw/8d0/41/z/21a12.png)

Collect radioactive material and exchange it for a brand new genome. Run faster, jump farther, teleport through walls -- if you don't succumb to radiation poisoning first.

![hs.png](///raw/8d0/41/z/2450c.png)

The game includes a crappy built-in tutorial, but here are some directions:
* Left/right arrow to move, Z to jump, X to use special abilities.
* Hold Shift to see names and descriptions of all of your genes.
* The more uranium you carry, the more genes you have, and the higher up you go, the faster you'll lose genes.
* Time is paused when you're in a checkpoint/shop area. Use them to take a breather.
* There are 12 different genes to find. Catch 'em all!

This was an exciting one, despite the theme! The more I stared at it, the more I became convinced that it's basically a subset of the last theme. I ended up looking to the other final-round themes for inspiration, but still found a way to incorporate "your life is currency"... at least I think I did. I suppose you'll be the judge. I was determined to make a more actiony game since my last three have been word-based, but it meant straying way outside my artistic comfort zone. The art took a ton of time. I don't even remember writing the music. The code was no walk in the park either... it really came down to the wire! I went 30+ hours without sleep at the end, and it was worth it. I learned new stuff and made a genre of game I've never made before.

Done in Unity/C#. Also used Photoshop, Illustrator, FL Studio, and Audacity. Font is Umba Soft by Anita J√ºrgeleit.

**KNOWN ISSUES**
* It's definitely possible to become unable to progress due to lack of genes or misaligned map chunks. I can try to fix it if you post a screenshot.
* The balance is pretty poor, in general. If you play enough of it to get a sense of the pacing, let me know of any changes you think should be made.
* There's not that much level variety. Feel free to fork it on Github and add some!
* I haven't tested the Mac or Linux builds at all. I'm sure there will be problems...

entries.title: Populistic Optimization by Genetic Selection
entries.description:
You are in dept and you need to repay in souls. A creature have been created in your image. It will breed and try to create a small society. However, you can select which properties of the creatures that will be passed on to future generations. A well-growing population allows you to harvest souls to pay your dept.

## Controls
#### LMB - Select Creature
#### RMB - Sacrifice Creature
#### Space - See Help info

Help
The population will grow faster with more productive creatures, resulting in new creatures moving in.
Note that the likelihood of creatures to have offspring increases with less time spent working.

entries.title: Computers in a Nutshell
entries.description:
Put the **Computer** where it belongs! Put it **in**to **a Nutshell**!

![screenshot.png](///raw/8b0/1/z/21282.png)

The download is a simple Windows executable. No zip, installer or fax involved.
There have been issues in the past with Windows 10's own and other virus scanners. The game is built in [Go](https://golang.org) which is known to produce Windows .exes that anti-virus softwares don't like. You can however trust it anyway. If you still do not, feel free to build the game yourself, build instructions are included on the [Github page](https://github.com/gonutz/ld44).

**If you encounter any further error messages, please investigate them and figure out what the problem really is. If you cannot play the game please post a comment here to let me know what exactly went wrong so that I will be able to provide a fix for it.**

By the way, do not read the comments, they might contains **spoilers**.

entries.title: The Blood Gladiator
entries.description:
The Blood Gladiator is a shooter game where you fight in an arena. Between each fight, you can trade your life points for power-ups. To finish the game, you have to win 5 fights. In the main menu you can activate the easy mode in which the damages you take are divided by 2. The game is available in french and english.

Warning : this game contains programer art and musics made with voices, your brain will maybe not bear it! :smile:

Keys:
- Move: Z, Q, S, D or W, A, S, D
- Jump: space bar
- Fire: left click

Enemies:
- Purple: normal
- Pink: less health
- Green: quick, but dealing less damages
- Red: slow, but with more health and damages

Tools used:
- Game engine : Unity (with the Zenject plugin)
- Code : JetBrains Rider
- Sound : Bfxr, Audacity, the Windows vocal recorder (and my horrible voice)
- Graphics : Paint.net

Changelog:

- 29/04: Added all english translations

entries.title: SPACE SPACE
entries.description:
You are Captain Heinz of the HMS Tin. 
You have been tasked with assisting the local space Colony maintain life.

You must collect carbon which you gain from destroying rocks and enemies
in order to replenish the colony's resources and upgrade both your ship along with
the colony's ship.

You must try and last as long as you can, do not fail us!

Press left click to move to a location.

Press right click to shoot your blaster towards your target.

entries.title: Life of the Party
entries.description:
![Cover Image.png](///raw/b4e/12/z/2341a.png)

Manage the life-force of your heroes to survive until nightfall!

Controls
--------
Left-click to add a red or gold heart to a hero. **More hearts means faster attacks!**

Right-click to remove a heart from a hero so it can be used by someone else.

Heroes
------
Shift hearts around quickly to adapt to incoming waves of enemies by balancing your heroes' strengths:

**Archer:** Long-range, medium damage

**Knight:** Close range, high damage

**Mage:** Medium range, low splash damage

Scoring
-------
Can you last until nightfall?
Use your hearts wisely because **only unused hearts (gold) count towards your score**. Good luck!

Credits
-------

Asset attributions on itch.io

entries.title: remnant.
entries.description:
You awaken in a swamp with no recollection of what led you there.
Regain your memories by helping those around you to discover your past.

Embark on an adventure and experience cinematic cutscenes! Play as Tupi the Capybara as you explore your surroundings by rolling and whipping anything that gets in your way in this top down, action adventure game.

## CONTROLS:
- Move: WASD/Arrows
- Menu: Q
- Interact / Attack: Space Bar/Left Click
- Roll: Left Shift

## TEAM:
- Screamrawr: Art
- DankOvens: Code/Design
- MaggardJosh: Code/Design
- Zachbard/FatBard: Audio

![screen4.png](///raw/ad5/z/23791.png)
![screen5.png](///raw/ad5/z/237bb.png)
![screen1.png](///raw/ad5/z/23776.png)

entries.title: Darkling
entries.description:
![Darkling-Header-1.png](///raw/7cb/81/z/24ced.png)

### Is this reality?

You "wake" to find yourself in an eerie landscape.  Strange voices fill the air, and the 
trees that surround you seem to be made of bones, or of something else not of this world.

Suddenly, your right arm is filled with a fiery pain.  Looking down in horror, you realize that your arm is gone,
instead replaced by some terrible demonic entity.  You can feel its evil power surging through you, burning like hellfire.  

Peering off into the distance, you can vaguely make out hordes of ghastly shapes rapidly approaching, while the infernal pain in your arm feels like it's about to explode... 
 
------------------

![GIF-4.gif](///raw/7cb/81/z/24738.gif)

![GIF-5.gif](///raw/7cb/81/z/2473a.gif)


 
--------------------
 
### How to Play
- Survive waves of enemies that grow more challenging each time
- You may choose to upgrade between waves at the cost of your MAX LIFE
- Collect GREEN ORBS to gain LIFE
- Collect RED ORBS to gain MAX LIFE
- Collect YELLOW ORBS for a temporary speed boost
- Collect BLUE ORBS to become temporarily invulnerable

### Controls
- WASD - Move
- Mouse - Look / Aim
- Hold LMB - Rapid Fire Explosive Beam (unlimited ammo)
- Click RMB - Launch Grenade Volley (this costs Life)
- CapsLock - Run  (L-Shift was causing problems)
- Spacebar - Jump
- Z - Zoom

### Hints
- Keep moving!
- All Orbs expire 30 seconds after they drop
- Upgrading between waves is optional, not required
- Aggression is encouraged rather than "circle strafing"
- Enemy projectiles can be destroyed
- There is a cheat code that grants max upgrades...

### Thanks for playing and rating!

---------------------------

### Me playing "Darkling:"
https://youtu.be/r-zM7qe_qko

---------------------------

### Check out streamers playing "Darkling"

[Playdungeonmans](https://www.twitch.tv/videos/421001904?t=02h17m43s)

[Ursagames](https://www.twitch.tv/videos/420044893?t=04h52m23s)

--------------------------

### Credits: 
- Jordan Tanner:  Graphics, Programming, Design, Sound
- Please drop me a line at jordan@jordantanner.net

(ROBO font by George Edward Purdy)

entries.title: Bullet Vomit
entries.description:
Bullet Vomit, a top down twin stick shooter (without the sticks).
Avoid enemies, shoot them until they die from it, pay with blood to boost your stats to play longer.
You cannot heal, but you will improve your starting HP for future runs!

Saves to local storage, so you can pick up where you left off. 
Missing features, balance is something on the TODO list, and no sound at all.

Almost every graphic was made with the same 2x2 white square.

WASD to move, mouse to shoot.

entries.title: LAZERBOI
entries.description:
![lazerboi_animatedlogo.gif](///raw/55a/1/z/232de.gif)

*LAZERBOI is Earth's last lone warrior against an onslaught of Cyber-Spiders. They are many, but so is he.
To gain the strength to save the world, is Lazerboi willing trade his life?*

---

## HOW TO PLAY

![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/55a/1/z/231d3.gif)

Shoot Cyber-Spiders to increase the value of your life.  
*Death is part of the game.* After you die, respawn and grab your former body ‚Äì sell it to improve your new life.

Toss *your former body* into the *coffins* at the shop to increase one of three stats:
* Dash Cooldown ‚Äì Dash more often
* Health ‚Äì Take more hits without dying
* Fire Speed ‚Äì More speed for your LAZERS

---

## IMPORTANT

This game has very deep lore. To experience all the glorious lore,
make sure to download a standalone build, as the WebGL build does not have as much fabulous lore.
Also, epilepsy warning. For real.

---

## CONTROLS

#### Gamepad (recommended)
* Left Stick: Move
* RIght Stick: Aim
* RT/R2: Shoot
* LT/L2: Dash
* A: Pick Up / Throw Body

#### Keyboard
* WASD: Move
* Mouse: Aim
* LMB: Shoot
* RMB: Dash
* Space: Pick Up / Throw Body

---

## CREDITS

LAZERBOI is made by the [**Pixel Maniacs**](https://pixel-maniacs.com/)!

Follow us on twitter for further updates!
https://twitter.com/pixel_maniacs

#### Developers
* Markus Esch
* Alexander Schmidt
* Johann Bauer
* Thomas Otto
* Steve Crouse

#### External Assets
* Laser Sounds by Mike Koenig 
* Theme by http://www.nihilore.com/synthwave
* Thunder Sound by Grant Evans
* Rain Sound by Pwlae

---

entries.title: The Haunting of Jonathan David Jones
entries.description:
Based in an eldritch horror universe, a demonic presence places Jonathan David Jones in cosmic purgatory. For Jonathan to keep his life he must pay the presence with his memories of loved ones. Only then will he be released from cosmic purgatory.


Click the portraits to "Enter the memory of that person", Find their keepsakes and throw them into the fire to forget them.  Fulfilling your debt to the cosmic horror by paying with your life's memories.

entries.title: Ludumkula
entries.description:
You are in debt to the most powerful mafia "**Ludumkula**" in the world. He is torturing everybody in the town. Somebody has to do something. You **Angutio** have that **power** in your **blood.** Choose your **path** now. Do you want to **save** yourself and everyone in your town? Or just give him whatever he wants until you die. 
![img1.png](///raw/074/32/z/22ce3.png)
Or you can just **suck everyone's blood** until you become strong enough to be the new **Ludumkula** 

![img2.png](///raw/074/32/z/22cf4.png)
Your battle will be **legendary!**

-Use your **abilities** to pass multiple levels.

-Unlock new abilities from your local **potion dealer.**

-Don't forget to defeat **Ludumkula!**


**Controls**

**A - D** or **Arrow Keys** to **Move**

**W** or **Up Arrow** to **Jump**

**X and Z** to use your **abilities**

entries.title: Artvertising: The Battle of the Dollar Stores!

# Hand of Death
A game made for [Ludum Dare 44](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/44/hand-of-death) (Theme: *"Your life is currency*").

## Introduction
Hand of Death is an adventure game about death trying to stock up on souls for an important appointment. He visits a castle to convince the residents to accept that their time has come too.

![screenshot.png](///raw/4ae/22/z/24a6f.png)

Your life is *CRNC* (pronounced **kurr-n-see**)....
**C**OLLECTING **R**EALLY **N**ICE **C**ATS

See? Totally fits the theme.

**Streamers:** please wait until the title sequence fully completes before going fullscreen.

Left and right arrows for movement, shift to pick up/hurl a kitty, and space bar to jump!

Gertrude must collect all 20 cats in her trailer before time runs out to win. Watch out for the naughty children, they'll knock her over and slap any cat she's carrying out of her arms!

This old trailer is full of holes, so you can conveniently toss the cats inside through the roof!
