entries.title: Crossroads
entries.description:
You're the last known survivor of the apocalypse. In a desperate attempt to stay alive, you make deals with the devil at an abandoned crossroads...

*Rules*
- Enemies come in waves. Survive as many waves as you can.
- Your health is restored between waves.
- Between waves the devil appears for a short time. If you stand close enough you can sign pacts to become stronger, but you lose one max. health for each pact you sign.
- Every 5 waves one max. health point gets restored.
- All upgrades stack. For example: if you get piercing bullets, your bullets will pass through 1 enemy. If you get it again it will pass through 2 enemies, etc.

*Controls*
- WASD - Move
- Mouse - Aim
- LMB - Fire
- 1 - Buy upgrade 1
- 2 - Buy upgrade 2
- M - Mute/Unmute music

*Tools/Libs used*
- Unity 2019.1
- [RetroKit](https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/tools/utilities/retrokit-131423) (made by me): 
Used to create all sprites, animations, sound effects and music for this game.
- [NavMeshPlus](https://github.com/h8man/NavMeshPlus): 
For path finding/object avoidance.

entries.title: Snek Farm
entries.description:
**There have been been some issues with the music not playing, so if that happens try changing browser!!**

![tutorial.png](///raw/9cc/91/z/232ba.png)

A game about slithering and growing crops! Join Snek, the smollest grin snek that believes himself to be a worm, in his quest to grow (*and eat*) a lush garden of fruits and veggies!!

____________________________

Instructions:

Select a map to play in!

Slither onto the dirt to make trenches.

Press **Z**, **X** or **C** to plant **Lettuce**, **Strawberries** and **Watermelons**. *Planting consumes your health*!

Go into the **water** to collect it, and back to the crops to **water** them.

*Keeping them watered makes them grow faster!* Once they're ripe, they're ready to **eat**!

**Lettuce** is the *fastest growing*, but gives back the littlest amount of *health*.

**Strawberries** have *medium growth* time, and give back a medium amount of *health*.

**Watermelon** takes the *most time to grow*, but it gives back *health* aplenty!

See how long you can become before hitting yourself, or the walls!

Press ESC at any moment to go back to the map selection screen!

____________________________
Made by these fine folks:

**Code**: [hermbit](https://twitter.com/hermbit)

**Graphics**: [_t3nshi](https://twitter.com/_t3nshi)

**Music**: [Failpositive](https://twitter.com/failpositiv)

entries.title: Who Wants to Be a Vampire's Heir?
entries.description:
Your quest to court the daughter of a vampire lord goes awry when he catches you red handed. Now you must play his game or end up as his dinner, the choice is yours. Pay for your missteps with your own blood, but be careful not to run out...

This game is a satire of Who Wants to Be a Millionaire, and plays very similarly. You have two lifelines, 50/50 and Ask the Audience, but be careful not to waste them as they are a one time use. Complete twelve questions successfully to beat the game.

If you play your cards right you might even be able to find multiple endings...

*Some materials sourced from Substance Share. Vampire character model taken from Paragon free assets but heavily modified by us. Painting sourced and modified. Music based on the Who Wants to Be a Millionare theme song. Everything else made by us.*

**Controls**

Click and Drag to look around the room

Click on one of four answers for each question

Esc skips dialogue

![LD_Page_Screenshot.jpg](///raw/af8/1/z/246fc.jpg)

![2019-04-30 07_12_27-LD44.jpg](///raw/4eb/z/225a2.jpg)

### Our info
* More games from us at: [our website](http://2bitstudios.com.au/games/)
* Twitter: [@2bit_studios](https://twitter.com/2bit_studios)

entries.title: Mutual Exchange
entries.description:
‚ÄãControl a human and a demon simultaneously as they make their way to through 3 levels. To overcome the obstacles on their way they must exchange life force between them to increase their abilities.

As the human gives his life force to the demon, his jump abilities increase at the price of his resistance and health.

When the demon returns life force to the human, he increases his weight, allowing him to press heavy switches and walk across heavy winds.

![lv2.png](///raw/d40/3/z/2132b.png)


‚ÄãControls:

Arrow keys -> ‚Äãmove

‚Äã‚ÄãZ -> ‚ÄãJump

‚ÄãX -> ‚ÄãGive life to demon

‚ÄãC -> ‚ÄãGive life to human

‚ÄãEsc -> ‚ÄãExit the game (Linux and Windows downloadable versions)

entries.title: Zoltan's Idea
entries.description:
# One man one soul, one cat...9 souls!

### Souls acquisitions haven't been going very well lately

### Until The Devil's cat, **Zoltan**, has a brilliant idea!
### Since cats have 9 lives, it's 9 times more efficient buying their souls!

## Now Zoltan needs to find the most evil cats on Earth.

### Drag the cats to hell and put them to the test!

### win the **different minigames** and fill the hell with cats.

#### Will the Devil be happy with that?
![immaginePOST_01.png](///raw/ed8/3/z/22a12.png)
### YOU WILL SEE:
![immaginePOST_04.png](///raw/ed8/3/z/22a34.png)
![immaginePOST_02.png](///raw/ed8/3/z/22a24.png)
![immaginePOST_03.png](///raw/ed8/3/z/22a45.png)

## About the Team

This is our **second jam**. Our first one was on LD38.
**We really wanted to make everything from scratch** and we did the impossible to produce every asset and code in these 3 days, even if this is a jam.

We were a bit scared by the theme at first but then we were much more scared when we met Zoltan!

@tommyflower: graphics + code
@fanu : code
@ioleoso: music


We used **Unity**, Photoshop and AfterEffects.

**Recommended resolution 16:10**

(Note 1 in Italy, where we are from, cats have 7 souls, not nine. Still a lot :) )

Note on video: **if you have trouble watching the intro** video after the splash (Debian maybe), 
just **click and it will start**. If you still have trouble watch **the intro** here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vOMxQ67XfYk

**want some spoiler?**
Watch the gameplay. 
But come on! Since you are here why don't you **play it! it's more fun!** :)

https://youtu.be/VUaicgZISSc

### Update 2019-05-01

```
# Intro
- Fixed intro video exit behavior and forced exit after 45s

# Town
- Fixed cat falling animation in trapdoor
- Added sound to trapdoor
- Cats should make more noise when idle
- Moved 'Back to Hell' button
- Fixed multiple cat trapdoor herding (and broke everything else, and fixed again)

# Foot Scratch game

# Computer game

- Fixed sexy kitten frame not showing
- Code cleaning

# Carpet Fun game
- Instructions should be clearer
- Fixed Precision stat weight
- Added a feedback text for puking
```

### Update 2019-05-13

```
# Town cat
- Added trigger to forgotten scratch animation
- Sped up walking animation

# Minigame feedback
- Added a 'Next' button to the end of the minigames to prevent skipping the info accidentally
- Added a good/bad cat to the end of the minigames as feedback

# Hell

# Foot Scratch

```

entries.title: Life Path
entries.description:
‚ÄãThe theme for Ludum Dare 44 was "Your life is currency", so in this game you start out deciding what you will do with your life. you "spend" your life on work, fun or family.  

(The game is playable here : https://kristinnes.itch.io/path-of-life)

After You have decided how you want to spend your life a variety of events based on your choices. F.x, you will get work related events when your life is in a work phase.

![screenshot2.PNG](///raw/936/22/z/21125.png)

entries.description:

Life-Time is a top-down shooter where you can trade your health for time. Press the right mouse button to barter your life for slower time. entries.title: Blast Run
entries.description:
Blast run is a bullet hell / twin stick shooter game.

entries.title: Rude Bear Reassembled
entries.description:
Cut off your limbs, swap them for others, use them to fight. Go to the pig to swap your limbs for other limbs. Swap your limbs at the bull for guns.

The Dumpster Dude will save you if you die, or you don't have enough limbs to trade for another arm, or you lose your guns, but he'll charge a price, and he will claim it back.

Eyes = See further
Ears = Hear music (also the cheapest and most common)
Leg = Run faster
Hand = Hold more guns

Bloodgun = Spam blood
Bone Action Rifle = Slower rate, higher damage and impact
Heartzooka = Very heavy, high impact, high damage, destroys walls

=== Controls ===
Keyboard & Mouse:
WASD = Move
Space/V = Jump
12345678910 = Equip guns to different hands
Mouse = Shoot
Esc/C = Back or B

=== Hints ===

If you have enough legs you can run to the east of town. Buy a gun, kill some monsters, hoard some ears, swap them for better body parts. Investing in weapons is good because you can always pick them up again. Or you can just drop them in town if you're scared. Once you have a tonne of arms and legs you can go west and storm the base and kill motherdrain.

== What‚Äôs a Rude Bear? ==

This is the 18th Rude Bear game in the RB core series, the 20th Ludum Dare extended universe Rude Bear game, and the 20th extended universe Rude Bear game. It was made for Ludum Dare 44‚Äôs jam, under the theme ‚ÄúYour Life is Currency‚Äù. 


                      === CREDITS ===

         @AlexRoseGames - Code, Design, Animation, Sound
                 @BitsAndCrafts - Dope ass Art    
                  @Atmospherium - Music 
                          

If you want to support the series, buy Super Rude Bear Resurrection on Steam/PS4/Switch:

(Gamespot GOTY 2017 Editor‚Äôs Choice)
http://store.steampowered.com/app/384250

entries.title: Dealing with LIFE
entries.description:
Welcome and THANK YOU for playing to Dealing with LIFE.

![V+nqrY.png](///raw/045/z/23b61.png)

This game is about draining your opponent's life before they do the same to you.
To achieve this, you play out cards in turns which can then attack your opponent's cards or his health core directly.

At the beginning of the game you are both dealt 5 cards, with 1 card being added to your
hand each turn.

The cards you place on the table in front of you can be used to attack your opponent's cards,
or your opponent directly.
To do so, click on one of your cards that's not currently tabbed, then select an enemy card or his health core at the opposite end of the table.
After playing a card, the card remains tabbed until your next turn.

LIFE COUNT
The red number on the bottom right of your card is its life. In order to play a card from your hand you sacrifice the same amount of life from
your own total.

ATTACK
The green number on the bottom left of your card is its attack value. When you attack your opponent's cards or his health core, this is the amount of damage the card does. If your card is attacked by your opponent, it will defend itself, causing damage to the attacking card as well.

COOLDOWN
Every card has a cooldown, indicated by the timer symbol on the top left. As long as a card is in cooldown, it remains tabbed. On your next turn, your cards' cooldowns are decreased by one.

LIFESTEAL
Some cards posses the power to steal life, indicated by a red blood droplet in the top right. Any damage dealt by a card with lifesteal is added to your health pool, allowing you to regenerate.

ADDITIONAL DRAWS
Some cards - when played from your hand - allow you to draw an extra card.
This is indicated by an image of a blank card in the top right.

CONTROLS
You can exit the game at any time by pressing Escape.
To view a larger version of your card, hover over a card and keep your right mouse button down.





Cat'sn'Wheels Studios

Made with ‚ù§Ô∏é  using Unity, Blender, Krita, GIMP, Audacity and VS2019

textures.com - freesound.org - bensound.com

entries.title: Peepo's Parlour
entries.description:
Hello! I'm Peepo! And today is the biggest day of my life! It's the grand opening of Peepo's Parlour - my very own ice cream parlour. I did have to borrow quite a bit of gold to get it up and running... But I'm sure it will be a great success! And if it isn't... well he says there is more than one way to pay him back... Could you help me get the store up and running? I don't really want to be in debt for too long you know?

![ld44scoop.png](///raw/bb5/22/z/2337f.png)

[image redacted]

Deal with the joys of owning a small business!

This is our first Ludum Dare and our first ever finished game! Thanks for playing <3

entries.title: Doki Doki Boom Chaotic
entries.description:
![s0min.gif](///raw/67b/z/21e1b.gif)

![out00038.png](///raw/67b/z/21e1e.png)

![out00257.png](///raw/67b/z/21e1f.png)

## The Game

Ali's only movement method is its trusted bazooka, Cigar. Jump around and kill all the enemies, and try not to kill yourself!

## How to Play

Shooting the bazooka or getting hit by enemies bullets raises your heartbeat.

You lose if your heartbeat goes above 220 bpm!

Use Painkillers to reduce your heartbeat.

Use the bazooka's backfire to move on the screen.

Kill all the critters to complete the game!

Play in fullscreen for the best experience!

~~Sorry, I was unable to add a restart function, so you have to restart the game manually from the start.~~ 

Nevermind, I added the possibility of restarting.


## Commands:

    Arrows: move/aim
    z: shoot bazooka
    x: backfire (use to jump)
    c: use painkiller

## About

Made by Andrea Montagna ([fullmontis](https://twitter.com/fullmontis)) in Godot 3.1.

Check out my other games [here](https://fullmontis.itch.io/)

entries.title: Fateshift
entries.description:
In this combat simulator, defeat monsters and bosses in a dark dungeon, all the while making deals with a demon to trade your life for items that will make you more powerful. See how long you can survive!

![image_2019-04-29_22-38-21.png](///raw/edf/22/z/23481.png)

![image_2019-04-29_22-38-35.png](///raw/edf/22/z/23489.png)

---------------------------------------------------------

**Update:**

Hello everyone! 

Thank you so much for playing our game and for the huge amount of support and critique. We are very grateful for it!

This was our first serious jam and we are still learning how everything works. :hammer: 

We had an amazing experience in these 72 hours and we've learned a whoooole lot. We hope to be able to apply all this newfound knowledge in future games. :smiley: 

As a note, we had some misunderstandings when submitting the game and we ended up not making it rate-able in Humor. So if during your gameplay you laugh at something, tell us in the comments! We love knowing we made someone smile! :smile: 

:star: Stay Awesome! :star: 

--------------------------------------------------------
**Controls:**
- Left mouse click or F to Attack.
- Right mouse click or D to Defend.
- 1 - Bash/Stun.
- 2 - Rapid Slash.

- You can also parry with a well timed block.
---------------------------------------------------------
**Change Log:**
* Fix for the item icons and abilities icons.
* Bug fixes on the parry and block systems.
* Balance improvements.
* Item description and effects are now showing on the trade screen.
* Animation canceling fixed
---------------------------------------------------------

Developed by: 

- Douglas Lima https://twitter.com/lumiadoug

- Ligia Assis https://twitter.com/ailaghast

entries.title: Rising Pyramid
entries.description:
First of all, this game seriously lacks polish. It was made in the last 8 hours, and some stuff like tutorial or highscores were roughly bodged together, and it lacks sounds and decent graphics. But, the core gameplay is all there. Entrance barrier may be a bit higher, so be prepared please.

---

 # If you don't like reading walls of texts, play in your browser [now](https://boltkey.cz/pyramid_rise/)!

---

![cover.png](///raw/194/z/21966.png)

Take role of an elder pharaoh, preparing for his death by building a pyramid for himself. In other words, tell thousands of your slaves to build it for you.

Build the pyramid from blocks as they arrive from the mines. Try to make areas of same symbols. Will you cash out early, or will you build your epic combo at risk of getting nothing at all in the end?

## Controls

 * Click above your pyramid to place blocks

 * Right click to swap symbols on the selected block

 * Click inside your pyramid to cash your blocks

 * Press 1-4 to select different blocks to place

 * Press P to restart

## Gameplay

Start off by joining together blocks of same color. If you click on a group, you cash it.

The amount of money earned is the triangular number of number of symbols in one group.

| Number of symbols | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4  | 5  | 6  | 7  | ... |
|-------------------|---|---|---|----|----|----|----|-----|
| Money gained      | 1 | 3 | 6 | 10 | 15 | 21 | 28 | ... |

In this example, I am going to earn 6 money after clicking the group of 3 green blocks.

![screen1.png](///raw/194/z/218a8.png)

Once you have money, you can (and should) use it to open and upgrade mines. There are 4 mines total, and at start you only have 1 active.

If you manage to place all the blocks from all the mines and finish the pyramid, you win. Your final score is the total money earned throughout the game + money left at the end + remaining time (in seconds). Try and hunt for the top spots!

---

*"BoltKey! But what does this game have to do with the theme?"*

Good question fellow jammer! My first idea was trading slaves. Each one had some skillset, and you had to carefully sell and buy slaves in order to earn the most. I started with about 17 hours to go and spent about 8 hours on it.

I completely lost the vision. I didn't know how to finish it. I overscoped.

But the other theme about slaves was pyramid building. I was thinking of some system where you have slaves that work in the mines, slaves that transport the stones and slaves that actually build the pyramid. You would buy and sell slaves of each specialization as needed.

I could not see that coming together in 8 hours.

So I ended up with just the theme of building a pyramid. I made a simple fast puzzle concept, had it completely prepared, and put it together in those last 8 horus.

Thanks for reading! Have fun playing the Ludum Dare games today!

---

I really hope to have time to make post-compo with sounds and graphics as I quite like the core gameplay.

---

Congrats to @martomate for being the first to finish the game!

entries.title: Demonic Dealings
entries.description:
Your bet with the devil didn't go as planned, and now you must collect enough souls to buy yours back! Luckily, you're not the only one eager to gamble for such high stakes...

**Follow the gripping storyline!**

![DeadlyDeal.PNG](///raw/4e3/6/z/2189a.png)

**Challenge opponents with innovative card-based combat!**

![HighStakes.PNG](///raw/4e3/6/z/2189c.png)

![SoulSearching.PNG](///raw/4e3/6/z/2189e.png)

Walk around the map using the arrow keys. When in combat, use either the left and right arrows or the 1-4 number keys to select cards.

entries.title: Devil Slots
entries.description:
![demonslots.gif](///raw/66e/1/z/2178e.gif)

(WARNING! I ran out of time, so almost no art and it needs some balancing tweaks.)
(HTML5 version not thoroughly tested, white impact flashes don't work too, I recommend playing the executable)

###### ABOUT THE GAME:
Death is bored and wants something to relieve his gambling needs, what better to do than to go to hell and gamble some souls away to the devil?

Devil Slots is a top down survival shooter where you gamble your life away on a slot machine with effects that can either help or destroy your run. 

You can get some pretty hilarious OP runs if you are lucky, attributes don't have limits, so lot's of interesting stuff can happen (like having bullets so small you can't see them)

###### DEVELOPMENT NOTES:
I'm a little disappointed in myself to be honest, I thought I was going to be able to do more, I overjudged my abilities and overscoped the game.
The thing that botters me the most is the lack of art assets, I'm no artist but in retrospective I should have given more time to it.

I cut a lot of stuff I wanted to do, like
- More attributes
- Bonus floors with crazy slots (those would either break the game, or make so useless you would die)
- Devil as a final boss
- Almost all of the art

But! I hope you enjoy playing it, the game is beatable and it can be quite fun if you get lucky. Let me know what do you think of it, I have some cool ideas I want to try so maybe I'll finish this one day! Thank you for playing! :smile:

If you want to see stuff that I'm working on, follow me: https://twitter.com/carluspedroso

entries.title: Death City
entries.description:
## Info
"My life isn't currency, YOURS IS!" - Mayor of Death City

DeathCity is a city builder style game where its population is the currency. Want to build a new house? That's gonna cost an arm and a leg literally... Maybe even a few.

To keep your "lovely" citizens ~~alive~~ happy you need to keep up with supply and demand. Each building has a set size (didn't have time for tooltips sorry!) that is based on it's price. The bigger the building the bigger the size.

To earn more population each building is "taxed". If there's not enough population for that building it won't be taxed though so beware!

Once your population hits 0 it's game over. Good luck!

![screenshot.png](///raw/21c/2/z/214ac.png)

## Tools Used
#### Engine
- Godot 3.1
- Jetbrains Rider

#### Art
- Aseprite
- Pyxel Edit

#### Audio
- Audacity
- Abundant Music

# Controls
- Arrow keys to move
- <> OR -= to make time go faster or slower
- Space to pause/resume time

Buildings are grouped from left to right. The underline under each building tells it's type:
- Residential is green
- Commercial is blue
- Industrial is red

Any feedback about Linux and Mac builds would be great. I can't afford a Mac (sorry if you dont't speak broke) and I currently don't have Linux installed on this computer but I'm willing to help solve any issues.

entries.title: Bot escape
entries.description:
Hello everyone! Hope you are having a great jam!

In this little puzzle game you will control a bot that needs to escape its doom in a factory where bots work relentlessly until their battery exhaust.

You can control your bot with arrow keys, pick up objects with the down arrow and find a way out in this 10 level game.

You can recharge your power in sockets and pick up a battery to actually have a longer life if the level has one.
Be careful not to run out of power and try to escape!

PS: We hope to see your highscore in the comments if you manage to finish all 10 levels ;-)

entries.title: Information Age
entries.description:
![TitleBanner.png](///raw/5e7/z/212e0.png)
A/D to Move

This was a fun one to make. The game needs you to buy things with personal information. The Game is Heavily inspired by the 1975 Album "Brief Inquiry into Online Relationships" and Bastille's single "Doom Days". Gotta admit, the game isn't really "fun" but for the direction I went it really wasn't supposed to be fun. 
I played around a lot with a e s t h e t i c s and 2D Lighting. the lighting turned out to be pretty neat. 

![TyN8aHaeid.gif](///raw/5e7/z/21104.gif)

Disclaimer: I do NOT keep/track/record any of the information entered. It is more fun to use Real information, and I was too lazy to do form validation. I also don't necessarily agree with any points made in the game, but the message fits really well with the theme. 

Used Rymtik Studio for music, Gimp for assets, and Unity as the engine.

entries.title: Deadline
entries.description:
![Banner2.png](///raw/71e/z/23c1f.png)
Deadline is a game about setting up chain reactions to cause the biggest accident possible.
You control a Reaper who, due to procrastination, has to amass 1000 human souls in a single week - or get into some major trouble with ol' Satan.

Shopkeeper Greed's gadgets will help you set up chain reactions to maximize your, uh, efficiency.

All actions in the game are performed with the Mouse, especially the left mouse button for most of the time. 
You can hold left click when placing Propane to choose a launching angle.

HINT : If you struggle with the chain reactions, there are some puzzles on the map that can give you an early edge in souls or a late bonus to get those thousand souls.


![Banner1.png](///raw/71e/z/23c20.png)
* Programming with GMS 2 by @sn4pi, @tnam
* Art, Music  and "game design" by @peringo

entries.title: Grim
entries.description:
![gameplay.gif](///raw/46a/3/z/22eee.gif)

_Satan is seeking to take over the earth, and to do so, he has released all of the souls contained within, in an attempt to wreak havoc on the living._

_You play as the Grim Reaper, and you are not pleased with Satan's choice to free all of the souls you've collected for him over the millennia. He broke the contract, and your goal is to collect all of the souls before they can escape._

_The restless souls, angry for their time spent in the bowels of the earth, will not be captured without a fight. Should you last long enough, garner new skills and improve your weapon's capability until you deem yourself strong enough to battle Satan himself._

**HOW TO PLAY**
- WASD/Arrow Keys - Movement
- Left Mouse Button - Swing Scythe
- Right Mouse Button - Throw or retrieve Scythe
- Q - Show Stat Upgrades Shop
- E - Show Scythe Shop

**HINTS**
- Your soul meter is your health bar. Be careful of over-upgrading!
- You can deflect incoming fireballs if you swing your scythe at the right time!

**CREDITS**
- [Psychobagger](https://ldjam.com/users/psychobagger/) - Artist (Piskel)
- [Sanavesa](https://ldjam.com/users/sanavesa/) - Programmer (Unity)
- DeviantArt for Tiles/Background Art
- Freesound.org for SoundFX
- ‚ÄúChiptune Throne Room ‚Äì Eight Bit/8-bit‚Äù by TechnoAxe for Game Music 
- ‚ÄúHoshi Hana - Tough Fight‚Äù for Menu Music
- Rogue Legacy for the training dummy
- WoW for the Icons
- Diablo for the Font

entries.title: Love Your Heart
entries.description:
**Love Your Heart is an action platformer.** Your goal is to overcome all obstacles and reach your throne. You have two special abilities at you disposal - **Slowing time and Spawning flying platforms.** But every time you use one of those abilities, you have to pay with one of your lives. You can collect those in the game. The bigger the heart above the more lives you have. **If you lose your heart and die, all your progress will be lost!**

**Controls:**

**Movement - WASD or arrow keys**

**Platform spawning - Space or Enter (3s coooldown)**

**Removing platforms - R**

**Slowing time - Shift (5s coooldown)**

entries.title: Make a Million
entries.description:
You're a specialist antique banknote forger. Your life is currency.
	
Your ambition is to make a million from your forgeries then quit your life of crime. Unfortunately, the police are on your tail and you find yourself moving from place to place to carry on your 'business'.
	
Your task is simple, copy the watermark on each note before the police arrive. As your notoriety (and bank balance) increases, you will have less time to make each copy.

The better your copy, the more profit you'll make; poor copies will make a loss. When your bank balance hits a million you can retire. If it falls to zero, well, you can retire in a different way!![screenshot.png](///raw/9bd/22/z/20e08.png)

entries.title: Your life is my money
entries.description:
![GameScreens5.png](///content/78e/e1/z/242ff.png)

As the leader of your village, it's your duty to travel the harsh desert and sacrifice cattle to the god of the Fire Mountain to pray for the village's survival.
But in this world, cattle is used as currency. You will need to part ways from it in order to progress, haggling with merchants to acquire resources or simply to bribe a lazy woodworker. However, you can also gather treasures (such as fruit or cloth) and trade them back for cattle. And of course, when talking about money you can't forget thieves, who will try to steal your cattle and take it to their hideouts. Defend your herd and kill the bandits, or risk losing all your 'funds'.
But that's not all: the sheep, goats and cows you will conduct to the God of the mountain each have another use.

Prepare to spend money in order to make money.

CONTROLS:
WASD to move

Left Mouse Button to attack with your spear

F to interact

Q to stop the cattle close to you from advancing!!



Music by Ryunocore https://soundcloud.com/ryunocore



Update: we added a post-Ludum Dare patch that fixes some things. If you want to try it out, please do! But remember that this patch was made after Ludum Dare was over, so do not use it to judge our game. Use the base game for that.
Thank you and enjoy the game! :smile:

entries.title: Meaningful Life
entries.description:
# Meaningful Life


*Thank you for taking the time to play my game for the compo category. I am delighted to have had some time to participate in this edition!*

*I have developed a small experience that I think fits very well with the theme. Although it is very short, I think I have been able to convey what I intended.*

*I am currently working as a serious games programmer in VR / AR, so I use these competitions to learn new tools, such as substance painter or blender, and take a break from my daily routine.*

*I hope you like it!*

## Two different endings!

>If you want to check the whole process, you can see the timelapse that I recorded during the development.

https://youtu.be/9xNeIxknICw


## Tools used:

* Unity 2018.3
* Blender
* Substance Painter
* Audacity


## Controls:

* Mouse: Rotate Camera
* WASD: Move Character
* Esc: Exit Game
* F5: Restart Game

A Real time operating system creates you and ask you to execute tasks and resolve problems.
The thing is that you only have a limited amount of time to achieve it.

** Quick ! :warning: The clock is ticking. :clock1: **

entries.title: Zugzwang
entries.description:
### Requires 2 people to play!

![Zugzwang Cover.png](///raw/640/1/z/22e83.png)

### Requires 2 people to play!

You each have 5 units, and one goal...

** Destroy. Your. Opponent. **

A strategy board game where your own units' deaths earn currency that allows you to change the landscape of the battle.


**Gameplay**
On each turn, you may move each of your units one time, they will automatically attack anything in their attack range. When one of your units dies you will receive a coin, which you may use to bribe a local wizard to change the landscape of the battlefield, or take a cheap shot at the enemy.

When you run out of moves, or you want to end your turn early, hit the "Pass" button and hand the mouse over to your opponent.

**Controls:**

Left click: Select Unit / Move Unit / Use Abilities 

Right click: Deselect Unit


**Unit types:**

*Slider* - 4 Health - Slides to the last tile in a direction of your choosing, damages enemies when you slide into them. Does not harm friendlies.

*Healer* - 2 Health -  Moves one space in any direction. Heals any unit on any surrounding tile when it moves.

*Volatile* - 3 Health - Moves one space in any direction. Attacks any unit on any surrounding tile when it moves.

*Sword* - 3 Health - Moves up to 2 spaces, can not move diagonally. Attacks the four squares diagonal to them. Only harms enemies.

*Hopper* - 3 Health - Jumps one space horizontally. Does 2 damage to the enemy unit they hop over. Does not damage friendlies.



**Abilities:** (costs one coin each use)

*Rift* -  Adds a row/column to the board in a location of your choosing.

*Blocker* - Adds a blocker unit to a tile of your selection. These don't move and have high health.

*Ping* - Cheap Shot - Directly deal 1 damage to an enemy unit of your choice.

**Alternatively** Tim's personal house rules: 

Chess:
*Ping* is only allowed to be used on your own units, and you must move only one of your pieces and may do one spell on your turn.

True Zugzwang:
*Ping* is only allowed to be used on your own units, and you must move ALL pieces on your turn. You are free to use spells at will in your turn.


**Design by:** 
[Mark](https://twitter.com/Riv_Roy)
[Devin](https://twitter.com/poe__)
[Tim](https://twitter.com/Trurkowski)

**Programming by: **
Mark
Devin

**Art by: **
Mark
Devin

**Music and SFX by:**
Tim

entries.title: Killbi
entries.description:
This game is meant to be played with a 16:10 aspect ratio.

The map is randomly generated each time a new game starts, so if parts of a level gets compeletly cut off(which is unlikely, you should restart the game).

You are meant to be killing as many enemies as you can. How you do it is completly up to you. Every enemy has a Normal, Suspicious, and Alerted state. Some enemies are terrirtorial and will not stop chasing you until you leave their region or are killed. Others wonder everywhere and lets you go with time. The only way to receive health is by "sucking" your enemies in a style totally not inspired by some Pink blob made by Nintendo. 

[Cap2.PNG](///raw/b9b/71/z/218d0.png)
[Cap1.PNG](///raw/b9b/71/z/218c7.png)

HOW TO PLAY:
There are two weapons, A sword and a gun. You can switch between them by pressing "Q". Holding Left Click with the sword will cause it to Swing back and forth while clicking right click will cause you to do a powerful jab. 
The gun's bullets can bounce and will not be noticed by surronding enemies, making it a very good tool for silent takedowns, it is not advised you run and gun because the gun has a mildly high cooldown time. Both weapons will only drop coins when killing an enemy

By pressing "E", Killbi will start to do a sucking motion, pulling every enemy in the cone towards him. By letting of of "E", Killbi chops down and kills only one enemy wthin choping range. This awards Killbi with the same amount of health the enemy had. 

You can go into the "Buy" menu by pressing "B", to exit out of it you just press "esc". Inside you can buy upgrades, abilities, and one-use powerups with your health and coins. To do spoil the fun, you can go and test out what each upgrade does for yourself!

entries.title: Piggy bank
entries.description:
---
#### Description
As a piggy bank, your life is all about money. You need money to get higher up.
You also need money to extend your life, so choose wisely as you climb!

How high can you get? Please let us know your highscores. Comments are very welcome. :)

#### Goal 
Try to get as high as possible! 

#### Controls
* Arrow keys: move around
* Space bar: collect a coin you are standing on to increase your health
* R: retry
* P: pause
* M: mute audio

#### Hints
*  You can see your health in the two side bars.
*  Collecting coins will increase your health, but you might lose some altitude.
*  Your health drops quicker and quicker, so climb as quickly as possible.
*  There are some small platforms on the sides for you to rest on while you wait for more coins to fall.
*  The direction of your jump depends on your position on a coin.
*  Not all coins are created equal.

##### Issues
Audio might not load the first time... Working on it!  You could refresh, and then you might hear some music. (And you can use M to mute it :stuck_out_tongue: )

Only tested in Chrome so far.





---

HTML5, JavaScript, CraftyJS, InkScape, LMMS, Audacity,  [jfxr](https://jfxr.frozenfractal.com/)

entries.title: Safe Travels
entries.description:
Humans have preserved themselves in cryopods while searching for a new habitable planet. Their survival depends on a maintenance robot named N0V4 that needs to keep the energy running in this not so high tech ships cryopods by using its own energy. 

There are also other tasks to attend to, the ships navigation needs constant calibration and its engines have seen better days. Are you able to keep everyone alive until you arrive to your destination?![banner_icon.png](///raw/d54/d1/z/223ee.png)

entries.title: Fortress Knights
entries.description:
Welcome to Fortress Knights. Where your knight is a fortress. 

Breaking bricks with your head will regain your HP
Taking Damage or building bricks will reduce it
Watch out for the wall of flame encroaching from the left. Destroy all the fortress knights to emerge victorious.

Controls:

Arrow Keys or WASD - Move
[Z] or [.] - Attack
[X] or [/] - Jump
Attack + Jump - Build a Brick under your character


I made this as I was really wanting to make something in the gameboy style for its anniversary. What would a 2019 style game feel like with the sort of concessions to adapt for the form factor. It's my first time working with screen effects to shift the color and pixel density, and also 2d animated sprites. I have so much to learn and improve on.

This game was made with Unity 2018.3, SFXR, and Aseprite. There was so much I wanted to add (more complex brick building shapes, many more weapons, and enemy patterns). Hope you enjoy it!![Yca7OFIk2P.gif](///raw/ee5/z/2127a.gif)

entries.title: Lifeless space
entries.description:
![ld44_l55.PNG](///raw/f24/22/z/23abb.png)

Control an unprescribed form by releasing its own elements. Embark on a journey full of sacrifices and choices that costs life. Find a soul in a lifeless space... but... is it really lifeless?

![ld44_t3.PNG](///raw/f24/22/z/22b93.png)

Logic puzzle with different elements combinations. Pass through the challenging mazes, while the only currency here is life. You want to move - you need to pay with your own body elements. Though sometimes it's necessary to sacrifice others lives...!

[ld44_lvl1.PNG](///raw/f24/22/z/22b89.png)

entries.title: War Crimes
entries.description:
# War Crimes 
## A game by √òivin Madsen about stealing oil with your tank

![Untitled-2.png](///raw/467/f/z/243c0.png)

- **Collect oil by destroying wells and other tanks** :oil: 
- **Return to base to sell oil for upgrades** :rocket: 
- **Be careful not to spend too much, as the oil doubles as your fuel** :fuelpump: 
- **Press ESC to pause (and mute the annoying music)** :musical_note: 

![game.gif](///raw/467/f/z/21afa.gif)

War crimes was made in significantly less time than the Compo allows due to a tight schedule. :smile: 
Unity was used for development, as well as Audacity, Blender, Photoshop, Substance Designer and Adobe Illustrator.

### Featuring guest audio appearances from:
- My fridge door
- My microwave door
- The annoying beep from my induction stove top
- A bag of cereal
- Off-brand coke

*If you're wondering why the game is consistently in British English, its just because I always write in American English without offering it a thought. I decided to make a conscious decision for this one just because as a Norwegian, I shouldn't inherently favour either writing system*

entries.title: Teller Me More
entries.description:
![MoneyNEWLow.gif](///raw/ffd/c/z/227a2.gif)
### Welcome to the first day of the rest of your life!
You work for the man, the machine, the money, you know; you work so you can live.
Except you are at your desk 23h a day - the extra hour is your performance daily review - so keep up with the queue, the customers and their boring *alive* conversations, and don't fuck up the change or their Yhellp review is gonna be as bad as your next day.

Teller Me More is a time management game, where you struggle with the daily task of handling a bank counter - make accounts, give and receive the *right* amount of money while keeping your highly annoying and varied clients entertained.
Not an easy task when you are the last human teller on this downtown busy bank - downright animalistic working conditions.

![TurtleGifNEW.gif](///raw/ffd/c/z/22735.gif)

### TUTORIAL
#### Controls
LeftClick
Hold, Drag & Release
Press Space bar to continue Dialogue
Type to type

Clients start to queue
Interact with the clients
- Pay attention to info: what they want, amount, account number, client data Tip: it's on the post-it on your desk
- Write the info in the appropriate fields
- Keep the client entertained by responding appropriately to their conversation - Take too long or offend them and your performance rating will decrease

![TurtleGifNEW2.gif](///raw/ffd/c/z/2273b.gif)

Withdraw:
- Type the requested Amount
- Type all the client Info
- Press Withdraw - to withdraw from their account
- Press Dispense
- Throw the money at the client
Deposit:
- Type the requested amount
- Type all the client info
- Press Deposit - to deposit on their account
- Throw the money on the dispensary on the left

Survive the day...

### Credits go to our amazingly fun team:
- Benedikt Kirchmeier
- Diana Alves
- Ingelis Wipfelder
- Mathew Varkki @rayvshimself
- Patricia Cotrim
- Sam B√§umer
- Vivien Baguio @hollowspecter

http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

4 minutes narrative / rhythm experience.

entries.title: TimeForYourSouls
entries.description:
Some day in the past you made an unfortunate deal.
Time to pay has come.

Is *your clone's* life worth the same as *yours*? Do cloning machines really work when time goes backwards?

Play the game to find out!

**Remember:** After the clock measures 24 hours, the level ***restarts***.

![demo3.gif](///raw/05e/81/z/212e2.gif)


Can **you** beat my time?

entries.title: PROFIT
entries.description:
![Banner.png](///raw/fc9/52/z/22d40.png)
![Profit Promo_1.png](///raw/fc9/52/z/22d42.png)

PROFIT is a dungeon looter with shop management elements set in a world where monetary currency has been replaced by life force. People from around the world will come to your shop to buy your freshly acquired wares. You are becoming tired of running your business day in and day out and have thus decided to pursue economic independency. In other words you must **become immortal**.

![Screens.png](///raw/fc9/52/z/22d5a.png)

In PROFIT your primary goal is to gain enough life points to claim the ancient relic of immortality. In order to achieve this goal you must first search the deep dungeon for familiar items to sell for exorbitant prices.

CONTROLS:

**Move:** WASD.

**Sprint:** Double-tap WASD.

**Attack:** J.

**Dash:** K.

**Open inventory:** I.

**Equip item from inventory:** L.

----------------------------------

CREDITS:

Lead Programming: David Styrbj√∂rn @mieeh

Lead Game Designer: Max Benecke @max-b

Lead Artist: Emil Bertholdsson @emilbert

Lead Sound & Music Producer: Linus Karlsson @Linnet5

Lead World Builder: Viktor Carlsson @RobotGandhi


We had a lot of fun doing this project and many of us were flexible with our roles and tried our hands at new aspects of game development.

entries.title: CoinStory
entries.description:
![Welcome.gif](///raw/b15/42/z/224dc.gif)

# CoinStory
## This is my first ever entry to a Game Jam
#### - please enjoy and I welcome feedback!

![Death.gif](///raw/b15/42/z/224e0.gif)

You are a coin. After being dropped by your old human, you want to remain free to value your own life.

![Puzzle.gif](///raw/b15/42/z/224f7.gif)

Avoid humans while traversing the room, using your ability to activate things around you - but be careful! Using them to help you isn't free and you'll lose some of your value as currency every time.

![Dancing.gif](///raw/b15/42/z/224fb.gif)

The game isn't super long but there is **music** and **dancing!**

#### If you like to follow me on either:
#### - Twitter   [itsandyjones](https://twitter.com/itsandyjones)
#### - YouTube [WTG](https://www.youtube.com/c/itsandyjones)
#### That would be great!

> Art is all original by me.
> Used [Aseprite](https://www.aseprite.org) for the animations

> All code was written solo by me but some elements are modified versions of code from helpful YouTubers:
> - [FriendlyCosmonaut](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKCKHxkH8zqV9ltWZw0JFig)
> - [Shaun Spalding](https://www.youtube.com/user/999Greyfox/videos)
> - I have included the Source Code - its by no means any good and its messy (because I was rushing towards the end) but maybe it will help someone!

> Sounds came from either of the sources below:
> - [WolframTones](http://tones.wolfram.com/generate/GzwEtRbclNiqhYBdMg4y3DREmFulf8g6hhaqqixG6Xp1)
> - [LeshyLabs](https://www.leshylabs.com/apps/sfMaker/)
> - and one of me rolling a coin on a table..

entries.title: Croissants From Hell
entries.description:
![MenuScreen.png](///raw/0ba/52/z/232b2.png)![PipBloodDealer.png](///raw/0ba/52/z/232b7.png)![Overcooked.png](///raw/0ba/52/z/232c0.png)![PipComingForYou.png](///raw/0ba/52/z/232ca.png)
Your dream to become a baker has finally come true!  Except you made a deal with a demon to do it.  
Sell delicious baked goods or die trying.

---How To Play---

Sign the contract by left-clicking on "SIGN HERE" and pressing enter or tapping away.

You may also type in your name if you'd like.

Left-click the dough buttons on the bottom left corner to buy dough. (Do not drag the buttons.)

Left-click and drag the purchased dough into the oven to bake them.

Drag the dough onto the display cases on the left to attract customers who might want to buy your dough.

Your life is a time and currency resource that must be replenished by customers purchasing your dough.

Buying a dough raises its price.  However all the dough prices will slowly decrease over time.

Try to survive for as long as possible!


---Creator's Notes---

This was my first ever Ludum Dare submission and I'd never finished a game before.  So I'm grateful for the experience, because Ludum Dare forced me to narrow down the scope of the game so that I could complete it!

All graphics (except the HP meter bar is a Unity default asset and the font used is not mine) were drawn by me, all coding done by me during the Jam, and there is only one song in the game(when you die), made by my friend JonnyBenny.  In hindsight, I regret not putting in free audio/music into the game.  I hope you enjoy anyway. :3  <3

entries.title: Rent is Due
entries.description:
![RiDCover.PNG](///raw/3e7/d1/z/21509.png)

CONTROLS: 

Move up and down/Navigate menu - Arrow keys

Shoot/Select - Z

Hold Z to shoot repeatedly

----------

In a world where life is currency, Snail Man gets a call from his landlord, and he is not happy...

Guide Snail Man through the levels and shoot snail goo at the ninjas. They will steal your hearts if they touch you or get past you. As the levels go on your landlord will become angrier and send tougher ninjas!

The goal of the game is to collect hearts (you can hold 50 at a time) and deposit 60 of them so Snail Man can be a functioning member of society for once and pay the rent like normal people.

Unlike normal people Snail Man has special powers, make sure to upgrade them in the shop to stand a chance!

This was a fun jam! Unfortunately I didn't have time to add sound, but otherwise I'm happy with how it turned out.

My twitter: https://twitter.com/JakobTheQuizGuy/

entries.title: Board of Life
entries.description:
Cross the board too win

Each field has an effect be it losing health or teleporting, you need to cross playing field before your health runs out.

![BoardOfLifePic2.jpg](///raw/732/31/z/21ae6.jpg)

The controls are simple, you can use ¬¥wasd¬¥ and arrow keys, but It was to limited gameplay without being able to move to a field that isn't north, south, east or west, so by using the mouse you can teleport a short distance to then have access to 8 directions without being in a situation where you are influence by 2 fields at the same time. 

For memory sake the lvl cap is 36, though at that lvl it would be truly challenging or impossible to complete

Have fun!

entries.title: Blood Money

A procedurally generated old school shooter!

Blast your way through waves of skeletons with your finger guns, steal their life coins and upgrade your vampiric powers.

We probably spent too much time making the skellies dance to "Thriller", but I'd personally say that is time well spent. Enjoy!

entries.title: Tomb of Temptations

*"Long life, even immortality, is within your reach. You need only ask for it, but all things have a price - can you earn what the Tomb offers you by escaping alive?"*

Collect all of the keys and bring them back to the portal in order to move to the next floor. Your health gradually decreases with every floor cleared, so you will need to purchase difficulty modifiers in order to earn back your lives.

entries.title: CrazyAmbulance
entries.description:
![Logo.png](///raw/208/e1/z/22d61.png)

**Welcome to CrazyAmbulance!**

On the way to the hospital a **horrible accidents** happened! The doors of your ambulance car swung open and **you've fallen out**, lying on the ambulance bed. In the last moment you've grabbed the tube of your **blood transfusion**. Not being able to signal yourself to the driver that he should stop, you **try not to crash** into any cars. **Good luck!**

**Goal:** Get as much points as possible, avoid other cars and avoid the guard rail! Collect blood pack crates to live longer.

**Controls:** A or Left Arrow, D or Right Arrow

## Important ##

We highly recommend to use the native platform versions for the best visual output. We only provide the Web version for easier testing purposes. If you want to please your eyes, take a moment and download the game.

entries.title: Life in the Fast Vein
entries.description:
![Life in the Fast Vein](///content/817/z/240a0.gif)
[Play it on itch.io!](https://xhg.itch.io/ld44)

[Example Gameplay Stream VOD](https://www.twitch.tv/videos/419233271)

Hey there *Blood Mage*, are you ready to rip it on the world's most dangerous road? If you're fit to make the cut, fire up the engine on your sanguine screamer and get ready to tear it up! Can you reach the end of this dangerous track, or are you going to be left in the dust?

Out here, your blood is the only thing worth anything, which is lucky for you: your ride runs on high octane blood, so if you start to run low you know where to get that from - yourself! Just pump the brakes and start bloodletting and you'll be fueled back up in no time! Burn that extra blood with the turbo boost and blast ahead for the quickest time! If you don't feel like fueling up from yourself, take it from the road. There are gallons of blood just waiting for you - from cauldrons, goblets, or even those labcoats working the local blood drive.

You aren't the only thing on the road; you didn't think it'd be easy did you? The rough road is covered in obstacles that'll slow you down and drain your health, so stay on the straight and narrow and slow down to make those tight turns. It looks like the Ghostly Ghouls want to put a stop to your fun - run them off the road before they scrap you and take their blood! Don't worry though, if you run out of blood you can always pump the brakes and push the needle to fill back up!

So, it's quite simple really: race to the end, boil that extra blood with your boost, brake to fuel back up, and take what you need to get the edge. When you've reached the end of the gauntlet, send in your time so we can know if you're Top Blood Mage or just another burnout!

![ezgif-3-6fba4ec7bcff.gif](///raw/817/z/238c7.gif)

# CONTROLS
## WASD, Arrow Keys, or Numpad

**LEFT**  - A, ‚Üê, 4

**RIGHT** - D, ‚Üí, 6

**BOOST** - W, ‚Üë, 8

**BRAKE** - S, ‚Üì, 5

**PAUSE** - Esc

![ezgif-3-ecd8a750c669.gif](///raw/817/z/238c6.gif)

# Tips:

- Bloodletting slows you down. Keep yourself topped off from the track!

- Boost when you will have extra fuel - it'll speed you up. Be careful, you'll lose your handling if you go too fast.

- Your blood drains quickly, especially while boosting. Make sure you collect extra blood on the course to reduce the amount of time refueling and maximize your boost!

- Tight corners and precarious obstacles require good handling - slow down to make sure you stay on the road!

- The shoulder and barriers of the road really slow you down and drain your blood - keep control of your ride!

- The Ghostly Ghouls seem tough, but if you can knock them into a wall you'll take all their fuel for yourself! Try hitting them near edges or as you round corners to turn them into scrap metal.

Enjoy the ride, and don't get drained!

entries.title: A day at the farm
entries.description:
Game Info:
A day at the farm is a survivor farming game, you are farming Blood Flowers, the only way to get seed for this flower is to buy it for your local vampire shop. You guest is they only let you pay with blood, but you eating Blood Flower gives you blood back.

The ground in this area is very bad, so you have to fertilize the ground before you can plant, once a plot has been fertilized in can support a few plants before you have to do it again.

When a flower is fully grown it will pop off the ground, Blood Flowers are very delicate, so pick the up quickly before they vanish

You will get attacked by monsters, when a monster hits you you lose blood. Be careful so you don‚Äôt bleed out. You can see your blood and seed count in the top left corner.

The vampire shop don‚Äôt only sell seeds, it also has a few upgrades and if you get enough blood you can buy your freedom.

Keep in mind, your body can only have so much blood inside it, luckily the vampire shop is also your local blood bank, so deposit some blood if you are near your max. When you buy something the price will first be subtracted from your blood bank account.

Controls:
||Move - WASD||
||Plant/Fertilize - E||
||Attack - Left Mouse||
||Pause - Esc||

Programs:
||Unity||
||Visual Studio||
||Paint.net||
||https://www.bfxr.net||
||http://www.abundant-music.com/||

Font:
||8 Bit Operator by Grandoplex Productions||


This is not my greatest game and sadly I didn‚Äôt have a lot of time for balancing, but I had fun and learned a lot, hope at least some of you have some fun playing it hehe.

entries.title: Ticker Clicker Defence
entries.description:
Ticker Clicker Defence

![LD44-screen1.PNG](///raw/7d2/3/z/220e2.png)
![LD44-screen2.PNG](///raw/7d2/3/z/22978.png)

# How to play

The game is a mix between a tower defence and a clicker.

Place your defences on the grid and wait for the waves of enemies to arrive. All costs of units and the upgrades of those will cost health from your heart.

Every killed enemy drops health but be quick to pick it up as they disappears quickly.


### Tools used:

- Unity 2019.1
- Aseprite
- Ableton Live
- Gimp

All graphics, music, audio and code was created during the Jam.
No assets from Assets store was used. A few standard Unity provided packages was added and used.

## Credits

Programming - Nicklas L√∂f

Graphics - Mathias Lindfeldt, Nicklas L√∂f

Music - Mathias Lindfeldt

Sound effects - Mathias Lindfeldt

# Running the game

If the webversion is not working in your browser or is too laggy please try one of the downloaded executables instead.

On Windows you might get a Smartscreen notification. Click More info and the Run anyway button.
On Mac you have to right click and select open on the app to allow unsigned executable to execute. 



## Post-jam version 1.1

### If you are going to rate this game DO NOT play the post-jam version!! Play the link further down instead.

After the release we was inspired to do a post-jam version with a few annoying bugs fixed (quicker restarts, better menus, flashing towers instead of the upgrade text) and some tweaking done to the enemy spawner.

[https://cloud.rhapsody.st/ld44/Post1.1/html5](https://cloud.rhapsody.st/ld44/Post1.1/html5)

[https://cloud.rhapsody.st/ld44/Post1.1/Windows/ticker_clicker_defence.exe](https://cloud.rhapsody.st/ld44/Post1.1/Windows/ticker_clicker_defence.exe)

[https://cloud.rhapsody.st/ld44/Post1.1/MacOS/TickerClickerDefence.app.zip](https://cloud.rhapsody.st/ld44/Post1.1/MacOS/TickerClickerDefence.app.zip)

entries.title: Zup
entries.description:
Move through the map by moving the mouse.

![StartScreen.png](///raw/39d/91/z/20d51.png)

- use slow mouse movement to move around

entries.title: Soul Checkout
entries.description:
![SplashScreen.png](///raw/8c4/32/z/248a5.png)

It's the year 22XX. Humans have aqquired the technology to have their minds run on quantum computers, making them practically immune to most kinds of physical injuries. In the last decade a so-called 'full-emersion VR experience' game hase become more and more popular. people bet on surviving the longest in this virtual shooter environment, but of course, everything has a price: one you can only pay with your mental health.

I didn't really think a lot about humor in this game, I guess the sometimes stupid enemy AI is kinda funny.. :)
- Pepijn Bakker, aka Coderstools

entries.title: Change Lives
entries.description:
Ok, ok, so like, bear with me for a second...

It's "Change Lives" like the common phrase, meaning to strongly affect people (which we hope this game does to you!)

Also like Your Life Is Currency, so you can exchange your lives in the game for other things, like literally changing lives into stuff.

But we're not even done yet. The name of the game *isn't* "Change Lives" like you probably thought, "Lives" actually rhymes with "Gives"! It's like "Change" like coins, like spare change, and it lives cause they're the characters in the game. Your Life *Is* really Currency!

And just look at that logo! The C and S are the cents and dollar signs, and the arrows in opposite directions represent exchange!

If Ludum Dare voting had just one category, and that category was title, and you only vote for your own game, we would definitely win.

entries.title: Orb of Life
entries.description:

My first ever submission for Ludum Dare! Learned a lot, still everything left to learn!

Orb of Life - A combination of Tower Defense and Clicker genre.
Summon Orbs with Life energy to prevent negative life energy from depleting your life energy!
Sacrifice your life energy to enhance the power of Orbs!
Complete 5 waves to Ascend! Each ascension allows you to enhance Orbs but also increases the power of negative energies!
Try to see how many waves of negative energy you can outlast!

Play the game on itch.io: https://gcttirth.itch.io/orb-of-life



Google drive folder with literally everything dumped in it: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1XJuSZ6TdGyDBC7h03mTzds6AZie9Jy4p

Will post my detailed experience later, probably :)
ANY feedback is appreciated <3


Twitter: [@gcttirth](http://twitter.com/gcttirth)

entries.title: Zap Signal
entries.description:
![Untitled-1.gif](///raw/6e9/2/z/248c9.gif)

## An on-rails shooter that you control with only your voice.


You're in a high-tech suit, but all your manual controls are dead. Switching to voice control!


## üïπ controls: "pon" to shoot, "waaaah" to reload your gun

During calibration, just say "pon" in a normal speaking voice. The game saves the loudness level, and uses that during gameplay.
The targeting reticle disappears when you need to reload. Do not panic, reloading makes it reappear.

C&C very very welcome!


## üñ•tools used

* photoshop cs5
* construct 2
* audacity

This was my 16th LD!

Re: the theme! I totally failed to keep up with the theme! My initial idea was "at the end of a level, your remaining life is currency used for upgrades". Then I thought what if the upgrades scrolled automatically and you had to say "now" into a mic at the right moment... Then I abandoned the theme in favor of a fun mechanic :id: 
Don't feel bad rating me 0/5 on theme

entries.title: Let's make really bad life decisions...
entries.description:
![LifeIsCurrency_WfREkQCSKE.png](///raw/948/f1/z/21b9e.png)

## Intro
Bad life decisions, specifically financial ones, are all around us and they are so easy for fall victim to. It often starts with a little too much momentum into the wrong direction and before you know it, your stuck in that routine. Getting out is really hard but the best thing to do is just to steer clear once the momentum starts building up.

## Gameplay
You task is simple. Don't build up too much momentum into the wrong direction (right) and always keep track if good financial‚Äã goals. Also don't forget to stop and smell the roses (I put in a few inscriptions to lighten the mood).‚Äã


## Instructions
"A" and "D" to move left and right
"Space" to jump

## From the creator
As I stared at the theme I only saw three words: your, life, and currency. I guess it's mainly due to the big steps I recently took in life and it started when I quit my job.

From that first day I started looking at things differently. Mainly realizing what was important to me and what wasn't... Forgotten friends resurfaced. Bad habits become nonsensical. Shallow relationships grew sour. Expensive restaurants were boring.

Three years later, I'm in different country (ZA->CA), different career (webdev->gamedev), different outlook (materialistic->frugal), and happier than ever. Enjoy my game. Peace :)

## Build Request
I'm pretty remote at the moment so if anyone is willing to trade a Mac build for a Windows build I'd really appreciate it. (project is currently on Unity 2018.3.12f1)

## Music
Sadly I didn't have enough time to put in music so here is a song you can listen to as you play:
https://soundcloud.com/stevenobrien/upbeat-jazz-piece

## Screenshots
![LifeIsCurrency_EjFE0UPDQf.png](///raw/948/f1/z/21ba0.png)

## Help me?!
I figured since a lot of people are struggling with the first level I'd leave this to help ease the pain:
![ezgif.com-video-to-gif.gif](///raw/948/f1/z/24423.gif)

entries.title: Galaxy Explorer
entries.description:
The year is 2119 and Earth has long been left behind. You play as a brave Space Explorer, who's job it is to find find useful resources in space. It's the future, so money is not used anymore, everyone uses fuel instead, but it is also keeping you and your space ship alive. You can drop supply shuttles down to asteroids to build different building, ranging from:

![Building Icons.png](///raw/1a0/2/z/22311.png)

- **House**. Houses are used to house people and people are used to load resources to your space ship. Every house can house up to five people, but it will take some time for people to get born.
- **Drill**. Drills are used to dig up resources, those resources are then collected by the people living on the asteroid. You can collect resources from an asteroid by landing on it, but don't place too many drills on a planet, they will not work as efficiently, so you have to find more asteroids.
- **Rocket Silo**. A rocket silo is used to launch other space ships. Space ships have linked resources, so you do not have to worry about that.
- **Barrack**. Barracks are used to keep people more calm, but you still have to watch out, a riot might start and then you are going to lose buildings. If you land your space ship on an asteroid, then people will calm down.
- **Observatory**. Observatories are used to discover new asteroids and what resources they are.
- **Refinery**. Refineries are used to refine ores, this means that you will get more out of the asteroids, both ores and rocks.

An asteroid can only have one of five resources on them, these are indicated by the color of the radar arrow.

## Controls
- You steer the the space craft, by using the **'arrow keys'** or **'WASD'**
- You can drop a supply shuttle, by pressing **'space'**
- You can click the icons at the bottom to select which building you want to build
- By pressing the **'right mouse button'**, you can switch between spacecrafts and launch sites
- You can reset the game by pressing the **'r'** button

entries.title: American Healthcare
entries.description:
![health.gif](///raw/f7e/51/z/22860.gif)
_______________________

 CONTROLS
________________________
Left / Right Keys = Move around.  Avoid red things.

Up = "Shoot", which costs a dollar.

Down = "Charge up", and increase your funds.

_______________________

 GAMEPLAY
________________________


During the game, your funds are depleted as time goes on.  At any point if you run out of money, you die.  If you're low on cash you'll have to convert some time into money and "go to work" so charge up your funds with the DOWN key.

As in all games there are enemies that spawn, consider them bills, illnesses, etc., and you have to throw your hard-earned money at the enemy to make them go away before they kill you.

Nobody's perfect, and sometimes you'll miss a payment, and if that happens, things get a little worse for you.  If you miss all the enemies they drop one level lower, and get one level closer to you.

entries.title: It's Our Last Stand
entries.description:
You are what is left of the Grey Goo, a mass of nano particles with a swarm intelligence.

![ld44.gif](///raw/4b3/91/z/20ef3.gif)

Your enemies will wipe you out, so try to stay alive as long as possible.

While they are approaching you, the enemy forces will constantly shoot at the mother goo in the center. You loose, once the mother goo has no mass left.

Defend the mother goo by launching lumps of yourself (bloblets) towards the enemy. Click anywhere on the map to launch a bloblet. Be careful, this will sacrifice some of the mass.

Bloblets will hunt down up to two enemies and transform them into grey goo mass, healing the mother goo.

If enemies detect a fallen comrade being consumed, they will stop shooting at the mother goo and instead go to destroy the remains and the bloblet.

--------

The game is written in Javascript using the HTML canvas.
The music was composed on a Kawai stage piano and a Teenage Engineering PO-33 KO and mixed using Magix Acid Pro 8.
All animated sprites were created in Blender.

entries.title: Tooth, Claw & Teacup
entries.description:
![ConceptArt.png](///raw/30d/32/z/24d87.png)
Stranded on an island, your only companions are flesh eating monsters that want to steal your money. With money being your life you can't just let them take it. So you defend it viciously with your only weapon: a teacup. But be warned, the monsters are growing ever stronger, so you must too. Be careful though, strength comes with a price, just be sure you can pay that price.

This is my first ludum dare, and my first game using Unity. I must admit I am surprised that I made it. So of course I am jumping off the walls (mentally) from pent up tension. Anyways, I hope you like my game, I'm  going to go pass out now.

(Xbox one controllers are supported, not sure about other controllers)

A video about the creation of this game:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dtDzQz4zx4g

entries.title: Luci's Little Trinkets
entries.description:
![LD44_General_Item_shop3.png](///raw/83c/z/2232a.png)

Have you awoken today and thought: "Hell, I wish there was an easier way to deal with the devil..." Say no more fam! We've got you covered with the greatly anticipated e-commerce: Luci's Little Trinkets. Purchase directly from the devil himself (now free shipping for a limited time).

Our entry for LD44 is a short **narrative experience** that is played in the same way you would purchase from a regular internet site. The only difference being that once you check out, it will tell your fate according to the items you've purchased. In other words, there's no winning or losing.

entries.title: With All My Heart
entries.description:
![Thumbnail.png](///raw/65d/z/23465.png)

![SS02.png](///raw/65d/z/2344a.png)

![SS03.png](///raw/65d/z/23453.png)

![SS04.png](///raw/65d/z/2345d.png)

# Overview

"It's wise to build close to your heart"

Place various blockers and turrets in order to protect the space station's life source.

Use the heart crystal's life source to buy and upgrade towers.

Don't let the enemy ships reach the life source. Place towers strategically to slow down the enemy and defeat them before they reach the crystal heart.

Read the in game instructions for more details.


# Controls

Click a spot on the space station to bring up the purchase menu. Click a tower from that menu to place it in the selected spot.

Click a tower to bring up the upgrade or absorb menu. Click the upgrade icon  to upgrade the tower, or the absorb icon to destroy the tower and return its remaining life force to the crystal heart.

Towers cannot be placed in such a way that fully blocks a path to the crystal heart.

Press the ESC or P key to pause the game.

# Known Bugs
- Turrets will occasional shoot towards the center of the level when switching targets.

# Note

Linux and Mac builds are untested.

entries.title: Triple Laser Death March

Bullets, missiles and lasers are everywhere and go everywhere in **TRIPLE LASER DEATH MARCH**. Dodge stuff and return fire with your own awesome arsenal - from trusty sidearms to nuke launchers and, indeed, triple laser mayhem.

You can buy as many crazy weapons as you like and build your arsenal, at a catch - buying cool guns reduces your max health, adding to the challenge.

entries.title: What do YOU want?
entries.description:
## And more importantly, what are you ready to give up for it?

![pouet_chose_menu.png](///raw/ade/71/z/22ea6.png)

In this game you play as a mild-mannered demon in charge of negotiating devil deals. To this end you receive mortals in your comfortable office to listen to their wishes and accomodate them. 

But a demon knows how to drive a devil's bargain.

While you tap in your resources to grant the petty human's wishes you must try to get as much of what they can give in exchange. But should you become too greedy, they will see through you and give up on the deal.

![propaganda.png](///raw/ade/71/z/230fd.png)

Try to make a profit out of your contracts to amass resources until you can eventually... treat yourself with a few weeks of vacations under the sun!

01/05/2019

   Untested as I could not replicate issue, but saw the issue occur in early builds.

 - **Added Level Selection slider to main screen**  
   Allows user to choose starting level

 - **Added continue instructions to pause menu**  
   Added "Press spacebar to resume" to pause menu in game

Made in 24 hours due to PC problems, was almost going to skip but decided to get something done.

Some people think pigs can't fly, Little Pig Jeffers is out to prove them wrong!
Armed with a propeller hat and a lot of gumption, Jeffers sets to the skies.
As he's flying he notices something, an army belonging to the Circular Saws has invaded Pig City!?

Jeffers may need to use the Magic Bacon from his body to slow the onslaught, but watch out brave Jeffers! Each eaten rasher of the bacon hurts you!
The Magic Bacon rasher patrol has headed to the skies to help Jeffers repel the attack, get them while avoiding the Circular Saw troops!
 

**Controls:**

W -     Move Up

S -     Move Down

Space - Pause / Unpause

R -     Eat Bacon (Deals 1 damage, but reduces speed by 1)

###### Theme: Your life is currency

entries.description:
Four teenagers are lost in the woods, and they have to pay with their souls to get past an angry toll collector. To open the way home they have to collect the three magic stone-things. Click on the buttons in the left corner to switch between them.

There are four characters to play as:
Adam, an alien....  thingy with a large sword.
Benny, a fat kid with a magic wand.
Mel, with a large area-damage-ability.
Alex, who can swing her hair around to damage enemies!

Programs used:
Unity, 
Photoshop, 
Bosca Ceoil, 
Audacity. 

HAVE FUN!

entries.title: Slave Story
entries.description:
## So what are we having?

The text-based tribulations of a slave who is born on a cotton plantation.

## Instructions

**Use the arrow keys and enter to pick an option.**

Your choices have consequences, there are about seven different endings and countless bugs. If you found one, or you suspect you are immortal, please leave a comment so I can fix or remedy this.

## Post-mortem abridged

This is my first try at a text based adventure and it was harder than I expected, both from a writing and from a technical perspective. I started piecing together the story somewhere Saturday afternoon, and my requirements kept evolving so that the storyline system ended up pretty hacky. I wish I could have added some graphics or music and sound effects, but time simply flew by.

entries.title: L.Y.L.A. - Your personal Living Your Life Assistant
entries.description:
L.Y.L.A. is specifically designed to improve your decision making skills. After her crash course, you won't be able to regret any further choice in your life. But be aware... Choices always come at a cost. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FTEIqNilgDg

All done in 48 hours

# Software used
- Engine: Unity (+ GitHub for Unity)
- Graphics: Affinity Photo
- Code: Visual Studio for Mac
- Audio: NodeBeat & Bxfr
- GTD & Planning: MindNode, Things

# Important notice
In the very last second before building, a gamebreaking (or furthermore game-skipping) bug occured. If you downloaded the game before 04:13am CEST, you might have ended up with the shortest game ever, as it jumped right from the very first question into the finale. New builds for all platforms have been uploaded - links remain the same.

# Known issues
- The camera zoom for the visual representation of the players path needs some rework.

# Controls
- Space bar starts the game and allows you to speed up LYLAs dialogue
- You click on your choices, decisions and responses with your mouse.

# Download

entries.title: Ballsy Escape
entries.description:
## What is the theme of the game?

An evil wizard trapped you in a castle, and turned you into a green ball. You want to escape, but must pay with your life!

## How many levels are there?

I have created 10 unique levels in this entry, so it shouldn't be too long while also offering some interesting gameplay.

### Change Log

 *29.04.19*

- Fixed a small issue with the spikes at level 10.
- Fixed lives to reset when starting the game over from the main menu.



## Screenshots

![screen1.PNG](///raw/b31/32/z/2175f.png)

![screen2.PNG](///raw/b31/32/z/21762.png)

![screen3.PNG](///raw/b31/32/z/21763.png)


## How to play?

- **Arrow keys** to move around and jump.
- **R** to restart.
- **S** to open the shop.
- **Enter** to purchase.
- **Space** to place a box.
- **C** to open a chest.

**Avoid spikes, and maintain a positive amount of lives to survive.**

![CCONTROLSSHEET.png](///raw/b31/32/z/217e5.png)

# FAQ

## How to buy a key?

Open the shop. press the **down arrow key**. The key will be selected, press **Enter**.

entries.title: Assault on Crown Archipelago
entries.description:
![screen5.jpg](///raw/28/z/249b0.jpg)
![screen2.jpg](///raw/28/z/249b1.jpg)

## Plot

Help a pirate regain his coins and missing parts of his ship from hordes of armed monkeys.  Hop from one island to another, solving puzzles and fighting swarms of monkeys--sometimes while drunk.

## Controls

- WASD to move
- Space to jump
- Ctrl/Mouse 1 to use currently selected weapon
- E to interact with buttons and large items
- Shift to run
- C to Crouch, C again to uncrouch
- M to glance at your map when on shore
- Esc to access settings (audio/graphics/controls)
- Scroll wheel to change weapons (once you have more than one)
- 1/2/3 to pick between the 3 weapons in the game

## Using Your Map

Aboard your ship, you will find a table upon which rests your map of the archipelago.  Press E while looking at your map to open it.  **Red islands** are islands which have not yet been unlocked, while **green islands** are islands that are currently unlocked and can be sailed to.  **Red islands** can be unlocked once you have collected a certain amount of coins (shown when hovering over the island). **You can unlock a red island by clicking on it.** Once an island has been visited, your map will reveal how many of its coins and chests have been collected.  See if you can collect them all!

## Pickups

![pickup-coin2.png](///raw/28/z/249a8.png) *Pick these up to unlock islands and **restore your health**!*

![pickup-chest2.png](///raw/28/z/249ab.png) *Collect 15 of these pirate treasures to leave the archipelago.*

![pickup-grog2.png](///raw/28/z/249ac.png) *Grog restores 1/4 of your health, but makes you drunk!*

![weapons2.png](///raw/28/z/249ad.png)

*Your weapons have been stolen by the monkeys. They're also important parts of your ship, and you must get them back!*

## Enemies

![monkey2.png](///raw/28/z/249ae.png)

Your only enemy is the monkey, the pirate's original foe.  Some wield blades, others wield spears, and some are even known to be shamans, wielding great powers.  Monkeys are known to strike when you least expect it.  It is best to be sober when facing them.

To end the game, collect 250 coins and 15 chests and click on the ship on the map!

**IMPORTANT! SOME PEOPLE HAVE MENTIONED THE GAME IS RATHER DARK. THERE ARE BRIGHTNESS OPTIONS IN THE SETTINGS. PLEASE TUNE THEM TO YOUR PARTICULAR MONITOR'S SETTINGS**
