entries.title: Apothecary's Piggy Bank
entries.description:
An apothecary with a piggy bank that saves lives instead of money is here to save the world from the plague.Instructions: Move with mouse. 

Touch the infected (green) patients to spend 1 life and heal them.  When a healthy patient gets in touch with an infected one, the healthy patient will be infected, too.

You save the lives in the areas that are no longer infected. The game ends when you end a level with 0 life left.‚Äã

The virus might mutate by chance in the following ways:

1. Insanity: Infected patients will lose their mind and run around incrementally faster.
2. Air transmission: The plague can be transmitted to healthy patients from a distance.
3. Corpse transmission: When a patient dies, it explodes and creates an area, and patients who go to that area will be infected.

Make sure you purchase essential upgrades with the lives you've saved.
![screenshot.PNG](///raw/39b/41/z/24438.png)
![ingame.PNG](///raw/39b/41/z/24439.png)

## May 1st:
Added HTML5 version

## May 3rd:
Fixed bugs:
1. Life count display will no longer be truncated when exceeding 100
2. Insane patients' speed capped so that they will not break through the wall colliders
3. Patients now will bounce off walls properly.

entries.title: Life Vac
entries.description:
![ld44_9.p8_1.gif](///raw/ed9/1/z/21e5e.gif)

## What?
In this game you play the role of an immoral bio-scientist, producing life in a laboratory to sell for a profit. 

You create the life forms in your petri dish, and sell them using the suck-o-vat 3000.

Active life forms are worth more than static life forms. You can make them active by using the "RUN" button, and you can stamp the three patterns in the top on your petri-dish to influence how the lifeforms develop.

However, note that you have a limited number of runs, and using your stamps costs money!

How much money can you make before you run out of resources?

## How?
This game is based on [Conway's Game of Life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life), a mathematical simulation of simple life forms as cellular automata.

**Hints**:
- Use "Run" to advance the simulation. Moving cells are worth more than static ones.
- Brighter life spots are worth more than darker ones.
- The three stamps in the top are likely to develop into very active life! Use them if your board gets empty.
- It is important to decide whether to continue running, or to suck the board and start with a new stamp.

## Why?
This game was developed in [Pico-8](https://www.lexaloffle.com/pico-8.php), on-site at PicoPico Cafe. Thanks everyone who participated!

entries.title: Phantom of the Mal√° Strana
entries.description:
![first.jpg](///raw/824/c/z/22474.jpg)


You play as a pickpocket in Prague. Your entire life is collecting different currencies from unwary tourists. The thief lives in Mal√° strana (Lesser Town of Prague) and steals at Malostransk√© n√°mƒõst√≠ (Lesser Town Square). He steals at noon and in the afternoon. You are stealing via this minigame:
![minigame.jpg](///raw/824/c/z/22530.jpg)
You move by arrows, pick as many different currencies possible and then before the timer depletes you leave the pocket by pressing spacebar. But beware! It takes some time to roll your long hand out. Those black circles are revealed after you are close enough.

![malostranske.jpg](///raw/824/c/z/225c9.jpg)

Some interesting facts:
You can actually see the building we were working at - Faculty of Mathematics and Physics, Charles University  (on the right). The sound of the square was really recorded at that square. 

**Controls:**
- **Mouse** - clicking on objects
- **WSAD/arrows** - movement of the hand
- **Spacebar** - start rolling your hand back
- **Escape** - back to main menu

**Team:**
- maoap - teamleading, programming, game design
- Bee Sundance - art, level design, thief voice
- Cyrdach - programming, UI design
- Standaaad - sound, screenplay

Special thanks for people at the MFF site for voices of other characters.

entries.title: Ocean View Hotel
entries.description:
A short PS1 style survival horror game with a camera inspired by *Luigi‚Äôs Mansion*. 

**Controls**

**W A S D** - *Move*

**Right click (Hold)** - *Aim*

**Left click** - *Shoot*

**Space** - *Interact*

**I** - *Toggle inventory*

You play an unnamed protagonist who one night decides to stay at the Ocean View Hotel. Not all is as it seems, though.

After hearing a strange noise in a neighboring room, you awaken to find a gun in your suitcase. Not one to leave a mystery unsolved, you set out to investigate.

Perhaps you'll find a bit more than you bargained for in this seemingly normal hotel...

![title.jpg](///raw/66c/32/z/23538.jpg)

![screen1.jpg](///raw/66c/32/z/2354c.jpg)

This is the version **1.3** we submitted **before** the deadline:

[MEGA](https://mega.nz/#!fc0DEITD!NYK4d84crJ1ebjPRJl9OCKJ0abUtGK1O3b14wKtbAag)

And this is the version **1.5** with a few bugfixes that was submitted **after** the deadline:

[MEGA](https://mega.nz/#!3A0HUKBD!OPo8T3SbxPk07ngdIdQqnhW82PKpWnTkeeR1cKgvPZM)

Here is the changelog for version **1.5**:
* Fix a scene transition issue
* Fix an issue where some sound effects would not play
* Add a missing dialogue
* Reduce music volume
* Add a new sound effect

*Had a bit more planned but had to cut some content due to time restrictions, but still pretty satisfied with the results. Thank you for playing!*

*O. Grech - L. Fest - N. Libert - J. Murillo*

entries.title: Gore
entries.description:
------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Gore** is an **ARPG**, inspired by **Diablo** and **DOOM**, where you control a lone adventurer who must **stop the demons invading our world** through a local town's dungeons. 


There are **two endings**, a **few easter eggs**, and also risks, because you have to **decide innocent locals' fates**.


**The game contains gore.**

**Please read the description further because I couldn't implement a tutorial. Thanks! :) **


-------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Screenshots


![scr2.png](///raw/a2d/8/z/21d5f.png)

![scr1.png](///raw/a2d/8/z/21d60.png)

![scr3.png](///raw/a2d/8/z/21d61.png)

![scr4.png](///raw/a2d/8/z/21d62.png)

![scr5.png](///raw/a2d/8/z/21d63.png)


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Plot

*Hordes of demons invade a local town's dungeons, and it's up to you to stop them...*

*but in the depths of the catacombs you find **locals**, pleading for their life...*

*and it's up to you to **seal their fate**...*

*and find the source of the **demonic invasion**.*


--------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Objectives

- Dwell deeper and deeper into the catacombs of a local town, until you find the **source of the demonic invasion**.

- Unchain the enslaved villagers from the dungeons, and choose their fate: **lead them to the entrance** or **sacrifice them on an altar**.

- Who knows what can they give you for their freedom...

- Who knows what the demonic deities can give you for their lives...

*(So use their lives as currency for "possible upgrades" by rescuing them or sacrificing them)*

--------------------------------------------------------------------------


## Manual

Use **WASD** to **move**.

Use **left mouse button** to **attack** and **interact** (click directly on the objects, like villagers, altars, stairs),

and *hold* **right mouse button** to **block**.

Use **ALT + F4** to **quit**.


---------------------------------------------------------------------------

## What I couldn't accomplish:

**Ranged combat,**

Not just **10 minutes for level design** on **Level 2**,

**Level 3**, with a **unique boss fight**,

Menu, **intro**, **fancier ending**,

Not just a scene restart when the **player dies**,

More **polished melee combat**,

More easter eggs, voice acting, more complex music, and many more...


--------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Ps.:

If you are interested in my other projects (like Aeldun, my diablo-like RPG), post mortems, etc, follow me on YouTube ( http://bit.do/tudvari ), or on any other social platform.

Thanks for reading. :)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

**The browser version has some glitches, please use a standalone one. Thanks.**

entries.title: GAIZAN : JUSTICE WAR
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/4a1/a/z/23b62.png)
Gameplay: https://files.catbox.moe/8hpkv4.webm


Welcome to New RoboNeoYork. The year is 2019.There is more **CRIME** than **HUMANS**. A city in strife. Ruled by a seedy underbelly of *Mechanized Mafioso*. 
You are ** GAIZAN! **  the Ace cop of RoboNeoYork's RoboCop Police force! Created for the sole purpose of taking on and defeating all Mechanized Mafia in town...

Whenever a RoboCop is created they're imbued with ** POWER **. With this Power each RoboCop is able to purchase more **POWERFUL** weaponry by accessing shops (conveniently located within most major rooms). Use these weapons to your advantage to take on more and more powerful enemies for the sake of **JUSTICE**. 

Explore the sprawling underground network created by the Mechanized Mafia with the help of RoboNeoYorks dutiful labor task force. Is it endless?... Take **CONTROL** of **GAIZAN** and bring **MECHANIZED MAFIA** to **JUSTICE** to find out.

## How to play
- Use W,A,S and D to move the player.
- Mouse to look. 
- Left mouse click to fire.
- Tab or Number keys to switch between weapons.
- Use PWR (Power) to purchase new weapons. Be careful when you run out of power, you die.
- E to interact.

## Features
- 3D Models rendered in ** 2D **
- Random level generation.
- Scaling difficulty.
- A funky beat.
- Sick references (mostly to anime).
- Amazing particle effects.
- Sort of janky looking enemies.
- Punishing! (?) difficulty
- 12 Unique Weapons
- A lot of enemy types (not even we know how many!)

## Screenshots

![Shot1.PNG](///raw/4a1/a/z/23b66.png)
![Shot2.PNG](///raw/4a1/a/z/23b67.png)
![yaasss.png](///raw/4a1/a/z/21f45.png)

Made with a lots of love and effort for Ludum Dare 44 by the following humans:
Aidan Lee, Finn Teague-Moore, Duggan

We hope you enjoy üòä

## GAIZAN: JUSTICE NEVER SLEEPS edition

We have fixed some game breaking bugs, these are on the itch page as "gaizan2.zip". You can still access the original submission, GAIZAN.zip.

Changes in JUSTICE NEVER SLEEPS:
- Pickups no longer block hitscans
- Slowed down enemy health scaling
- Fixed several issues where enemies would fall out of the level preventing progression
- Fixed an issue preventing barrel pacifist runs

Please note GAIZAN is best played full-screen via executable as WebGL has lower performance and fidelity.

entries.title: My first LD Game: Mutant Lemonade Stand
entries.description:
As title says, it's my first Ludum Dare game. I really enjoyed participating and am quite suprised I got something together at all. My artistic and musical skills are a bit lacking, but I hope you all can enjoy the game I produced anyways! 

![Capture3.PNG](///raw/27e/11/z/20ff4.png)

Rules:
0. The goal of the game is to sell Lemonade (and later, hotdogs and icecreams)
1. Play cards by dragging them onto the brown area ("the stand")
2. You pay for playing cards with health (red) and energy (green)
3. If you don't have customers you can't play cards that require customers.
4. Each turn you will recover 2 energy and draw a new hand of 3 cards. 
5. The day ends if you end your turn with 0 customers
6. After the day ends you get to add 2 cards to your deck by paying a certain amount of health
7. Try to keep a high score each day to keep your customers happy! :)

Besides that, a couple things to keep in mind:
1. Customers will start leaving faster each day
2. Red circles mean a health cost, green circles are the energy cost
3. Lemonades grant 1 base score, hotdogs 2 and icecreams 3
4. It's not extremely balanced. I decided it would be better to make the game a bit more rounded instead
5. If the itch.io version glitches due to size, then I recommend trying the stand-alone build in 1024 x 768

If you have any questions or are missing something, please let me know :)

![Capture2.PNG](///raw/27e/11/z/20ff5.png)

entries.title: Duck-Tank
entries.description:
![full_screenshot.png](///raw/9b6/81/z/21b57.png)
# Duck-Tank
The Swineviets have redistributed Fiat Greenfeather's considerable wealth!  All he has left is his trusty money-burning tank.  Help him reclaim what is rightfully his by crushing the socialist pigs beneath the indomitable treads of capitalism!

* * *

**Known Issues**:
* Background tiles flicker sometimes; probably just some Z-fighting I missed.
* Pressing Esc while a dialog is open will open the main-menu behind it; if you do this, just push Esc again to restore normality.
* The HTML5 build requires a more powerful computer than the native builds, so if performance suffers, try one of those.
* The Windows and Mac builds are untested, but they *should* work.  Let me know if they don't and I'll see what I can do.


**Post-finish change disclaimer**:  I removed the horizontal slop in the camera, and I added a couple lines of code to disable Thugs further than 2000px away.  These were necessary to make the HTML5 port playable.

* * *

entries.title: Break a Leg
entries.description:
![Capture.PNG](///raw/796/32/z/21880.png)

In this short puzzle-platformer, you'll be able to explosively fire your limbs away in order to double - even triple jump! Sacrifice your limbs to solve the puzzles.

__Controls:__ WASD to move & Space to jump/double-jump/triple-jump.

__Level Skipping:__ By default, level skipping is turned on (toggle in the options menu). Press 'N' to go to the next level or 'B' to go back to the previous level. This is so Ludum Dare raters can see all of the features/content of the game even if they get stuck on a level (some of them are a bit difficult :smile: )

entries.title: Greenback
entries.description:
![Greenback title.png](///raw/5d8/2/z/222b0.png)
Follow Harry Cashman, the entitled hipster out for revenge against his father who has done nothing to deserve it.
- - -
## Features
- Difficult twitch platforming with elements of bullet hell
- 3 boss fights
- Boss rush mode. Can you beat them all without health recovery? Try beating the story first!
- Attention to detail and presentation
- A "rich" story complete with cutscenes
- - -
## Controls
- F toggles fullscreen
- A and D to move
- Space to jump and double jump
- Mouse to aim
- Left click to shoot
- Right click to dash
- Dashing makes you invulnerable for its duration
- You get 3 hits. You recover hits between levels
![Greenback 1.png](///raw/5d8/2/z/222ab.png)
- - -
## Credits
Artwork, voice acting, sound, music, writing and level designing by Archie "KAI" Reid (https://twitter.com/thekaigames)

Programming and level designing by Finn Truman (https://finnttruman.wixsite.com/portfolio)

Made in GameMaker Studio 2
- - -

You play as Faust, an alleycat with 9 lives. You must cross the road to get to food (thrown by the open windows), and each time you die, the devil offers to buy your souls in exchange for powerups.

The game is quite hasted and unfinished, please forgive these limitations:

entries.title: Phil, The Leprechaun Of Gold.
entries.description:
**Game Story:**
Very few people know that leprechauns are actually made of real gold pieces. Yes, their bodies are actually solid gold!
Nobody really understands how it all started, but the only way leprechauns can procreate is by collecting gold and using their cauldron to make new leprechauns.
So you see, leprechauns don‚Äôt really store their gold in their cauldrons, the cauldrons are magical objects capable of giving life to the gold. You can always see if a cauldron is in use, that's when rainbows appear.

But as Leprechaun are made of gold, they are hunted by a special kind of people. That would be, the once still believing in magic and fairy tales, and therefore especially children. Children that in life sought out money instead of candy, are damned to hunt leprechauns forever and ever, so leprechauns worst enemies.

Collect all 100 coins, put them in the cauldron and extend your golden family. And avoid the damned children.‚Äã

**PowerUp:**  
Huge 4clover will expand your pocket size to 20!


![LD44GameName.png](///raw/5c7/2/z/21139.png)

**Controls:**  
A, D and Space => Left, Right and Jump. (Yes, I forgot to add arrow key control!) :/

**Credit:**  
For the amazing font: Zingot Games - http://www.zingot.com  
Friends and family for allowing me to spend most of the weekend without interuptions.

![Itchss02.png](///raw/5c7/2/z/2113c.png)

**Known Bugs:**  
Pocket text not updating when picking up the 4Clover powerup. Updates on the next coin pickup.  
Artifacts in the tiles caused by bleeding from missing 1px margin.  
Children's voices overlapping, giving distortions.

entries.title: They ran out of mana
entries.description:
After hundreds of years fighting each other a global scale war, the two rival necromancers ran out of mana.
Is this the end of the war? Will they start throwing the tableware at each other? Or will they find another source to power their spells? Lets find out in They Ran Out of Mana. The ultimate necromancer soap opera.

How to play:
1 Drag a card to the center to play it.

2 You will lose life equals to its cost

3 Then the AI will play left card of his hand (also paying with life).

4 Repeat until there is only one survivor.

entries.title: Coin Bois
entries.description:
Coin Bois is a simple puzzle game where you slide around and collect coins. The coins you collect extend your life, allowing you to hit spikes.

![ld44cover.png](///raw/f14/1/z/234d0.png)

## Controls

Arrow keys to slide around (like on ice!).

R to reset the stage.

## Details

Engine: Custom engine written in C++ and scripted in Lua.

Audio: Sound effects made with [Bfxr](https://www.bfxr.net/). Music made with [Bosca Ceoil](https://boscaceoil.net/).

Graphics: Made with [Pyxel Edit](https://pyxeledit.com/) and [Paint.NET](https://www.getpaint.net/).

Third Party Tech: [Emscripten](https://emscripten.org/), [Lua](https://www.lua.org/), [Sol2](https://github.com/ThePhD/sol2), [SoLoud](http://sol.gfxile.net/soloud/), [msdfgen](https://github.com/Chlumsky/msdfgen), [MetaStuff](https://github.com/eliasdaler/MetaStuff), [LodePNG](https://lodev.org/lodepng/), [GLM](https://glm.g-truc.net/0.9.9/index.html).

**Mac Users:** If you get a black screen, try using Safari.

entries.title: Devil's Dirty Work‚Äã
entries.description:
![ld_cover.png](///raw/78/z/23af9.png)

## Story

After spilling coffee over your laptop and accidentally deleting the game files of your actual game jam submission, you make a pact with the devil in an attempt to recover them, unaware of the consequences. 

After refusing to hand off your soul, as you had agreed to, the devil makes you an offer:

*"Collect at a hundred lesser spirits for me, and I will accept them as payment instead."*

On a quest to escape your unavoidable death, you venture into the caves of the underworld, killing bats and capturing their spirits. Be wary though.  While swinging over the deadly lava pits of doom, be sure to look behind you from time to time. Although you've made an agreement, he might just try to take your soul anyways... He is the devil, you know.

**********

## Controls

Aim the grappling hook with the **MOUSE**

**SPACE** deploy grappling hook

**W** reel player in towards grappling hook

**SHIFT** release grapple and jump

**ESC** skip cutscene

**********

entries.title: Island Chain
entries.description:
![IslandChain1.png](///raw/80d/1/z/209ed.png)

You are the Archipelago Dollar, the new currency of a loosely-aligned trade federation of island city states. Every time you are used for trade, you gain points.

Click on a city to increase the money supply there.

The black icons show which goods are produced by a city, and which goods are in demand. The yellow circles show how much money is in a city.

Cities cannot buy goods unless they have plenty of money. If a city has no money, it cannot even sell goods.

Cities with more money will produce more goods, but also demand more.

Cities with lots of money will gain more money over time - if any city experiences hyperinflation, you lose. Cities with little money will lose money over time - if three cities run out of money, you lose.

Each trade slightly reduces the total money in the system.

More cities will join the trade federation over time.

Any resemblance to real-world macroeconomics is entirely coincidental.

entries.title: TheAmmoLife
entries.description:
This is my first entry to the Ludum Dare game jam, in this case Ludum Dare 44. The game is built on a theme life is currency. In this top down arcade shooter, you have limited ammo, and have to pay for more by loseing your life. Simple. There are rules in the game but here, I'll put them in the description as well:

WASD or Arrow keys to move, space or right mouse button to shoot, click the plus next to the ammo counter to buy more.

Thanks for playing!![gameScreenShot.PNG](///raw/570/42/z/215be.png)![gameScreenShot2.png](///raw/570/42/z/215cf.png)

entries.title: RogueLife
entries.description:
RogueLife is ‚Äãroguelike game, where you can destroy enemies, gather health points and the upgrade your equipment your own health as a currency.

**How to Play**

‚ÄãThere are two ways to destroy the enemies: firing rockets at them or knocking them with your shield. Shield does more damage and can destroy projectiles too. But rockets are safer.

**Controls**

*Keyboard*  
WASD - Movement  
LMB - Fire your rockets
RMB - Deploy shield

*Gamepad*  
Left Stick - Movement  
Right Stick - Look & Fire  
Right Trigger - Shield 

**Hints**

Purple thing is an exit to the next level.  
Enemies are very aggressive and can target other enemies if they attacked them. 

## Game could be also played online on [itch.io](http://gipzo.itch.io/)

**Team**
Started as Compo entry, but unfortunately had less time than anticipated... yeah, one-man team.

**Screenshots**

![Screen_2.png](///raw/51/z/22c12.png)

**Updates**

entries.title: Temple of Sacrifice
entries.description:
![Capture.PNG](///raw/836/21/z/2198b.png)

## Important Note
* You can add another card of the same type on an existing unit to upgrade it!

* If you make a unit not defend or attack, you heal the amount of HP written on the purple drop icon on the unit!

## Lore
You are the Holy Mother, one of the true gods of a Hellenic style people. You are the mother of the people, and create them from your own holy blood. You regain your power and blood from the prayer of believers, however your loyal servants are being hunted down, by vile preachers of false gods and barbarians. The faith is down to the last temple, the Temple of sacrifice! 
Protect your people for as long as possible in this survival card game. 

This was my second time participating in Ludum Dare.
I initially wanted to make a game that was a mix between Darkest dungeon and a deck building card game.
However as is the case with Ludum dare many concessions were made along the way.

I had fun making this game, and I hope you all have fun playing it.

The game has a tutorial to help you get started, but most of the mechanics are for you to explore.
I did everything for the project from code to art and even some simple music.

## Tools used:
* Game Engine: Unity 2019.
* Art Creation: Krita.
* Music: Bosca Ceoil.

## Controls:
Mouse Clicks.
Escape key to open and close the pause menu.


These are some screenshots from the revolutionary exhilarating game play :joy: 
![gameplay1.PNG](///raw/836/21/z/21a3b.png) ![gameplay2.PNG](///raw/836/21/z/21a3c.png)



I hope you enjoy the game, I worked hard on it and am very proud of what I managed to make in 48 hours. If you are interested in following the development of this game or others I may make in the future, please feel free to follow me on twitter: https://twitter.com/Mohammed_Kapiel

entries.title: Financial Getaway
entries.description:
*Help Wanted: Driver!*

*Driver should love driving for criminals.*

*Planning to rob a bank truck.*

*Call 1 (800) 867-5309 and ask for Jenny...*

![Screenshot3.png](///raw/557/32/z/23670.png)

Financial Getaway is a fast-paced vehicular survival game where you outrace a cop in a bank truck for a few minutes while your partner in crime tries to hack into a draw bridge that's up. But be careful! Take enough hits and all that *hard earned income* goes flying out the back!

## Controls:

Action | Keyboard | Xbox Controller
-------|----------|----------------
Movement | W A S D / Arrow Keys | Left Stick
Action Sequence | 1 2 3 4 (Top Row) | A B X Y
Pause | Escape | Xbox Button
Menu Navigation | W A S D / Arrow Keys | Left Stick
Confirm Selection | Enter | A

## What's new in Post-Jam Patch 1.1:
- Controllers now have full access to menus. Hooray!
- Audio can now play when adjusting volume sliders. Headphone users, RIP no more!
- Windows, Mac, and Linux. Oh my!
- *Police are still overpowered.*

entries.title: Nutty Twins
entries.description:
![download.png](///raw/176/51/z/220fa.png)

# Nutty Twins
### rob the bank without guns

The game is about two brothers, who rob a bank without guns. As a player you control both characters, but the pink one can only walk and not jump and the blue one can only jump and not walk. Somehow you need to let them work together and use their limited but complementing abilities to collect all coins in the bank. The game focuses on puzzles, rather than violence. It is not a shooter at all, but a puzzle platformer about being unique and taking stock of your own value.

### How to play

Use keyboard or gamepad or both.

Instructions are in the game. Press I or Y to toggle them in any level.

### Engine, tools and assets

Checkout [the post mortem](https://supernapie.com/blog/ludum-dare-44-post-mortem) on my blog for a full list

entries.title: TheMechanizedHero
entries.description:
Woaw, this theme really was hard to work with :frog: :gun: . 
So the idea behind this game is to survive waves of enemies using your KATANA, but the TWIST(theme) here is that every attack you do also hurts you (So you pay life to kill enemies).
You cant just randomly attack, you need to think and position properly to get as far as possible.

Warning Mac and Linux users i have not Tested the game on these systems, so there might be unexpected bugs. Pls give me feedback if they are unstable and i should remove them from the Download List :frog:.


Controls:

Movement = WASD / up,left,down,right.

Attack = Space.

Pause = ESC.



Thank you guys over at Ludum Dare for your work and everyone who participated give your self a :clap:.

entries.title: Chess Adventure
entries.description:
Chess adventure, inspired by dota autochess, is the start of an idea i had which is to create an adventure/RPG type game revolved around the fun and strategic gameplay of autochess. I'm sorry for not taking the time to make any music or sound and the minimalist UI, i hope you enjoy the gameplay to make up for that.

Instructions:

- Before each combat phase, buy units from the shop and place them on your side (left) of the chessboard.
- You can reposition your own units on your side however you want while the combat hasn't started
- Once you're happy with your unit placement, press the 'ready' button and the combat will start
- some units have synergies, they'll appear on the bottom left if you have any
- You can buy units as long as you have 1 or more life points, if your units lose a combat you're sent back to the start

entries.title: About Ten Years
entries.description:
Plays in browser. 

## Controls
Movement: WASD

Interactions: E 


This is my first ever LDJam. I‚Äôve learnt loads and can‚Äôt wait for the next one.

![LDJAM44 Banner.png](///raw/a69/22/z/23ae6.png)

You play as a character who has made a mistake, and wants to try to fix it. Willing to do anything, he signs a contract with a dubious looking character to take him to Luna, his lost love. Things don‚Äôt pan out well, but he does eventually end up in the same place as her. 

There are many story elements that I would like to have added, but sadly I completely ran out of time. **The jellybeans are just for fun!**

I had a lot of fun making this, and I hope you have fun playing it.

entries.title: Karmaman
entries.description:
This is a platformer game in the style of old school 30‚Äôs cartoons. The main character has the ability to move around with his spirit to take over other people and by using them complete puzzles.

Story: Main character Richard and his sister Betty were captured by some scientists and tested on. Richard was able to escape and is now on the run.

**CONTROLS:**

Movement: WASD keys

Jump: space

Taking someone over: right click to leave body and right click again to take body over 

Middle mouse button to suicide.

Left click to activate levers!

**NOTES:**

Movement speed is too slow- We are scheduling a complete rework of the controls and will work towards a more fluent and better paced game feel. 

Hard to understand where you're going- Alot of other mechanics are planned for the game and we will put more effort into making it all intuitive and more understandable.
We apologise for current state as this game was developed in under 72 hours, we will put more effort into it!  

Bugs with drowning.

More levels!

Mac support.

Soul movement speed to low/Karma amount too little - We will definitely playtest a lot more after the next couple of fixes

We are working towards next version and will keep pushing this project to a full featured game. We are listening to every feedback we can get and we appreciate every syllable we get. We love what we are doing with Karma and we want it to become an enjoyable experience for as many people as it is possible! Thank you for your encouragement and your feedback!  

![starting screen winkiga.png](///raw/2b9/32/z/24531.png)

**OUR PROGRESS/DEV VLOG:**

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9pYFKlABBOE

entries.title: Life
entries.description:
A little 2.5d shooter about life. Turning around is not an option!

# Gameplay

Use your arrow keys to move around and space to shoot (if you have a weapon). Buying a weapon costs you lifetime though, so make sure you only buy what you really need. You can run past enemies in your life but they will eventually catch up with you. 

![logo2.png](///raw/194/3/z/216e3.png)

entries.title: Developer Story

entries.title: Temerarious
entries.description:
**UPDATE: Taking down the Windows download due to a bug I cannot fix at this time. You can still play this game on itch.io via your browser!**

*Temerarious: ‚ÄãAdjective meaning rashly or presumptuously daring‚Äã.* :sunglasses: 

The Vivalockes are heretics who use their own Life Force to power their attacks.  A risky practice that has huge payoffs in combat. 

![screen1.png](///raw/8de/12/z/23d4d.png)

Join the Vivalocke Juniper Breaker as she takes off an adventure to save her brother (and give him a piece of her mind while she's at it! :sweat_smile:)

![2019-04-29_1933.png](///raw/8de/12/z/23d50.png)

Every turn in combat - decide if you want to use powerful spells at the cost of your Life Force. Be careful - if your Life Force is too low, you can't use spells. Worse, if it hits 0, you will be knocked out. :scream:

![2019-04-29_1930.png](///raw/8de/12/z/23d54.png)

Controls

* Arrow Keys - Move around
* Enter - Action
* Esc - Menu
* Shift - Hold while moving to dash

You can play this game directly on itch.io! You'll find the link to download the Windows executable there too.

I'm opting out of Graphics and Music/Audio because I'm using out of the box, pre-made assets. Thanks!

The timelapse of making this can be found here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BUbO6M8iMvQ

entries.title: Traade
entries.description:
A puzzle platformer

Collecting coins increases life, touching smoke balls decreases it.
Find your way to the exit!

![traade.png](///raw/cf9/z/21161.png)

entries.title: Marvin
entries.description:
![Screen_2.png](///raw/a7/z/24881.png)
Help Marvin collect the energy cells. Your final score depends on how many you have collected. You can however use them to regenerate your health and energy.

Controls:

- Left Mouse Button - Shoot
- Space - Lift/drop objects beneath you
- Q - Regenerate Health
- E - Regenerate Energy
- WASD - Move

entries.title: The Nameless Cave
entries.description:
You play as a lone cultist, seeking the one truth. But at the cost of their sanity

How to play:
you control the cultist with the arrow keys
q,w,e activate your 3 spells. each spell costs some amount of sanity and can be upgraded through dropped bonuses

   - q:2 Sanity: a projectile that can pass through more enemies based on its level
   - w:3 Sanity: grow a scythe to cut down foes. after the initial payment, you will get an amount of swipes in front of you based on its level.
   - e:5 Sanity: summon a skeleton to fight for you. you can control more skeletons the higher level the spell

Every time a monster dies, you gain back sanity. the goal is a high score, you play until your sanity is depleated

Bugfix![screen2.png](///raw/819/z/21593.png)![Tutorialtemplate.png](///raw/819/z/21594.png)

entries.title: Sinking Town
entries.description:
![Screen1.png](///raw/76e/c/z/22eef.png)

![Screen4.png](///raw/76e/c/z/22ef8.png)

![Screen2.png](///raw/76e/c/z/22eff.png)

**!ATTENTION! If you don‚Äôt want to suffer through tons of misspelled dialog lines, please consider playing the post-jam version. It fixes tons of writing mistakes We made in the last hours hurry and makes some of the quests a little bit more obvious. !ATTENTION!**

Sinking Town is an adventure game where you play as robot fella by the name of Cranky Burns, who tries to save his robotown from sinking and rusting underwater. In this game you trade your robotic bodyparts with other robots, and for the robots their life is in their parts.

**Controls:**
- Press "Q" to switch between your body parts and items.
- Press "E" to use an active body part for interaction.
- During dialog you can skip lines and pick answers by pressing "E".
- During dialog switch between answers using "W" and "S".
- Press "SPACE" to jump.
- WASD - to move around.
- Hold LMB to rotate the camera.
- Mouse wheel - zoom in\out.

**Team:**
- Leonid Dudakov (https://twitter.com/DetectiveLosos) - art, vfx, programming
- Annie Owl (https://twitter.com/owl_annie) - programming, story
- Natalia Volkova (https://twitter.com/Natashius) - art, level design
- Problemke (https://twitter.com/morel_8ight) - music

**Tools:**
- [Unity 2019](https://unity3d.com/)
- [Blender](https://www.blender.org/)
- [Aseprite](https://www.aseprite.org/)
- [LMMS](https://lmms.io/)

entries.title: Plunderlings
entries.description:
Your strong and mighty captain just found an abandoned trap-riddled spaceship.
He has chosen YOU to have the honor of assisting him in this plunder.
Will you prove your devotion? Will you help him find the epic loot?

# Protect your captain!

entries.title: Souls
entries.description:
![Billd.JPG](///raw/3b7/22/z/21684.jpg)
This was my first Game Jam. This is also my first actuall "complete" Game.

It's a game about stealing Souls from Enemys and investing them to gain POWER!
You can spawn a new Wave of Enemies with just a push of a button! New creatures to steal souls from! There is also this satanic statue which is more then willed to increase your Power for some of these souls. You just need to get over these spikes...

__PS:__ You can also sacrifice your own Soul to the statue.. But I don't think, that this is a good idea.

__THIS GAME DOES NOT HAVE AN END. JUST TRY TO REACH A NEW HIGHSCORE!__

Tips:

Since this game turned out the be pretty hard here are a few tips for more success:

Circle around the enemies while shooting them!

Do not underestimate Movement Speed. About 2 Upgrades are very good to dodge the mobs easier.

Each Waves increases number of Mobs and Health


__Have Fun ;)__ 

__Tools:__
Unity, Photoshop, BeepBox.co , Bfxr

__Controls:__

WASD/Arrows - Movement

Space/Left Mouse Button - Fire

E - Interact

R - Restart

entries.title: A Deal on the Moon
entries.description:
Hello!
I'm FisherG.

After a long weekend, a saturday of family stress in which no work was done, and a crammed sunday,
I present to you, "A Deal on the Moon"





![LDPromoBanner.png](///raw/b63/z/21ba7.png)





![LDScreenShot.png](///raw/b63/z/21ba8.png)




=Controls=

Movement - Arrow Keys
Interact/Shoot - 'X' or 'Z'
Chek Health - 'C'





![LDScreenShot3.png](///raw/b63/z/21bac.png)





=Story=

You play as an astronaut crash landing on the moon in an 'inescapable valley'. You make your way 
through a canyon and are greeted with a lone shopkeeper, who reveals he wants more than your money,
your soul! With him as your only way out, you need to find 2 vessels to withold your soul to 
exchange for a repaired rocket, and then fly out. 





![LDScreenShot2.png](///raw/b63/z/21baa.png)





=Tips=

1.Talk to him twice.

2.If you die, you'll be returned to the 
shopkeeper's room, with full health.

3.Any time you go to the shopkeeper's room you'll have full health. 

4.Kill enemies, because if you don't you'll have to back track through them! 


=Known issues=
The combat system is wack.

entries.title: Life Death + Lemons
entries.description:
You died! But because of what you have done in your life, you are not allowed to move on to the next stage yet! Not until you have paid for your sins...

How you might ask? By selling lemonade of course! Life and Death is thirsty work, and Angels and Demons alike will pay lives in exchange for them. Just gather 100 lives and your done!

entries.title: Band of Brothers
entries.description:

You control a band of mercenaries looking for gold. Manage your resources and tactics. Pick your missions correct and one day you can be the Mercenary King.
Uses some procedural generation.(not much though)
Graphics and Programming are mine.
I used the loop from  Random Mind‚Äã - Medieval: Minstrel Dance‚Äã‚Äã for the music. 

‚ÄãFor sound effects I used 8-bit effects from LittleRobotSoundFactory attribution licenced free sounds.‚Äã![SS2.png](///raw/a9b/c/z/22641.png)

entries.title: SubMoney
entries.description:
![cover.png](///raw/7e3/z/226d1.png)

## How to play
You're a broke musician trying to get by. Day after Day. Bill after bill. You must play in subway stations to get enough money to pay for your daily expenses. 

To aggravate your situation, the city you live in does not allow artists to play in subway stations, so you need to keep an eye open for the guards. If they get you, it's the end of the day. If you see or hear one of those guys, RUN! You can also take the metro to lose them.

Your expenses are deducted from your money at the end of each day, which occurs when the timer on the bottom left runs out. The expenses increase in a daily basis, so play your heart out to get the best tips.

Each subway station has a different public, with different taste in music. You need to look out for the right genre to play.


## Controls

**WASD** To move around

**SPACE** To choose a song to start playing and to stop playing

**123** or mouse click to choose your song

**ARROW KEYS** to play the music

.

**Rock on!**

![gif2.gif](///raw/7e3/z/22771.gif)

.

entries.title: Blood, Sweat, and Money!
entries.description:
My first time for a compo... Well, much harder than the jam.  You just got too much to work on within a short range of time.
:v Best of luck everyone!

* 1600:900 is the recommended resolution, please use fullscreen for the HTML5 version


About the game.

You need to construct buildings to develop your new country.  However, every time a building finishes building, the workers die -- well they are too tired.  Your workers trade their life for your country's development and GDP!  Please clap for them >=)


Each building has different effects, positive and/or negative.


Cohesion: Speeds up the production or workers.

GDP: Attracts foreign visitors.

Stability: Decreases chance of defectors.


Occasionally, your worker will turn into defectors -- based on your stability.  And there will be visitors from other countries, too -- based on your GDP (and you need to have at least one Attraction).


Defectors are in red, and they continuously affect Stability and Cohesion -- just click to kill them.

Visitors are in green, they decrease Cohesion but give GDP.  You can click to capture them, they'll be your new workers, but this will decrease Stability by 1 (one-time only).


Game starts in 1948 and will end in 2019, be prepared for the sudden black screen -- no one get no time for the polish, right?

You can resign and quit the dictatorship at any time by pressing the button at the top right corner.

===============================================================================


UPDATE:

There's a new version that fixes

1) Collisions between workers and building blueprints

2) Wrong placement checkings

... and now workers now decrease stability continously if you get too many of them.

Both updated version and original version links are listed below, please rate me on the original one though.


================================================================================

entries.title: Super Annoying Escort Mission
entries.description:
#### My first LD game \\(^o^)/

Alien hordes have invested an interplanetary bank.

Their spawn pods are lingering everywhere!

You are now hired to get the higher ranking employees out of the base alive.

As long as they are alive, your payment is ensured.

![screen1.png](///raw/e67/22/z/214c7.png)

#### Controls
- Use WSAD keys to move the camera
- Use Q and E keys to rotate the camera
- Use mouse wheel to zoom in/out
- Left click selects a soldier
- Right click on the ground sends soldier to the location

#### Gameplay
- Try to position your soldiers in a way that they can keep the aliens in check, while escorting the suit to the exit.
- You can activate checkpoints on your way. These checkpoints are then used as spawn location for new soldiers.
- Make sure, your soldiers don't die too quickly, or you will run out of funds.


![screen4.png](///raw/e67/22/z/214c9.png)

#### Sadly,
I didn't complete the game how I wanted.
It is in a very sad state, but playable.
Since this is my first compo, I'm still ok with it.
I really wanted to learn Godot (which i never used before), 
so I knew that I probably wouldn't finish in time.
But hey! I really learned a lot, and it's just about the fun anyway.


#### Tools used:
- Linux (os)
- Godot (engine)
- Krita (gfx)
- sfxr  (sfx)
- Sunvox (music)
- Houdini (meshes)

## Hope you like it!

entries.title: Flash Dash Dungeon
entries.description:
![Capture.PNG](///raw/622/9/z/21857.png)
Flash Dash Dungeon is a top down, 2D dungeon crawler with randomly generated levels. You will race against the clock to reach the ladder of each level. You can spend those precious seconds at shops to make later levels easier. The goal is to climb down as many floors as possible.

**Controls**
- WASD to Move
- Left Mouse Button to Attack

**Edit**: Thanks for the comments to everyone so far. I'm glad you're enjoying it. I thought I'd clear up a few things:
- Some of you thought it was too easy to reach the ladder sometimes and that it might be an issue with algorithm. This is actually intentional. By taking the ladder as soon as you find it, you miss the opportunity to spend your remaining time at shops to make later levels easier.
- Yes, one of the shop's options are overpowered. Some of you figured that out and others didn't, but I left it in for this compo because it looks like both groups of players had fun either way. If you'd like a more challenging and balanced run. Avoid using the grey crystal powerup (the one that halves your damage and gives you extra seconds).
- Yes, the combat is slow and a little clunky. *Tip: Attack a little early and don't spam; the attack's hitbox only appears on certain frames of the animation.* It's not a core mechanic so if you're not enjoying it, you can absolutely skip it by running past enemies.

In the interest of fairness, I will not update or add any features during the voting period, and that includes balancing. However, if there are any game breaking bugs that prevent you from continuing, then I will fix those. If you happen to find such a bug, I'd be happy for you to include it in a comment, detailing what happened and how you produced the issue.

entries.title: LifeCoin Race
entries.description:
https://youtu.be/5GSaiJyBdKE

# Overview

Hey HandSome Tie Guy, Did you ever feel like you had no money even if you're rich ? Well this is your chance ! Join the **LifeCoin Race** and become a successful trader just before you die ! Let's go !


LifeCoin Race is a very experimental **multiplayer** gambling game based on currency price index gambling !

Players : from 1 to 4 // Prefer MultiPlayer for more fun. AI are REALLY dumb.

# Goal 

Be the heighest one  by betting on the LIFECOIN rate (the green bill moving). Bet "UP" when the price rises. Bet "DOWN" when you think it will FALL.

Once you've started the bet, accumulate boost points et SELL (any key pressed) to gain a **FLY UP BOOST** and overcome you opponents.

Your life is **constantly draining**, the games ends when every player is dead.

# Controls

- Player 1 : "Bet a Rise" -> "A", Player 1 : "Bet a Fall"  -> "Q"

- Player 2 : "Bet a Rise" -> "4"(numpad), Player 2 : "Bet a Fall"  -> "1" (numpad)

- Player 3 : "Bet a Rise" -> "T", Player 2 : "Bet a Fall"  -> "G" (numpad)

- Player 4 : "Bet a Rise" -> "P", Player 2 : "Bet a Fall"  -> "M" (numpad)

# Pro-Tips

You can throw **"balls"** at your opponents  :Press Both Buttons at the same Time.
Careful : it will **cost** you some precious **life**.

# About

This had been a great week end ! I had 24h to make the game because @guimero64 told me he was doing it. So if the game seems buggy and unfinished, it's TOTALLY his fault :;) . I really had a LOT of funs making it, Enjoy !

entries.title: Calienows
entries.description:
**Oh hey you! Yes, you!    
You like Aliens? You like COWS?! Well good, then we've got you covered!**


Hi there and thanks for checking out our LD44 entry for the topic "Life is currency"!
Our approach, as you will soon notice, is that we don't necessarily view our player life as the titular currency,

but rather those of the NPCs we abduc- erm, take with us.

![Teaserpic1.2.jpg](///raw/107/2/z/23c08.jpg)


It's **PvP**, so grab your girl/boyfriend/roommate/talking cat and get a load of this.
Our game puts you in the shoes(?) of an eager little junior alien abductor who tries to beat his colleague (Player 2, ofc YOU are Player 1) at who abducts more cows in a certain amount of time - and keep them alive.

Why is the alive bit relevant you ask?

In the beginning your gear is moderate at best - budget cuts these days, no one is safe - but you can obtain valuable upgrades if you trade in some of your carefully collected specimen in return - which then obviously wont count for your end score.
If the last bit made you think "Gee, then I'm just gonna save all my cows" let me tell you it's not always wise to be greedy - 
you know the old saying, you gotta spend cows to make cows! (Pretty sure that was it)

This Game provides **controller support** (recommended way of playing) as well as old-school keyboard controls.


**Quick overview of our awesome team:**

Angie - *3D Monkey, Rigging, Animation, Level Design*    
Benji - *Programming, Unity Guru, provider of oranges*    
Chris R. - *Graphic/UI Design, Sound bro, Level Design, Unity stuff & programming*    
Chris P. Bacon - *Programming dude, Unity wizard, Mr. Bugfix (like, a LOT)*

entries.description:
![Hunkules.png](///raw/12b/31/z/21da4.png)

The brawler game of the year ! Play as the mighty Hunkules, the fan favorite gladiator and watch the crowd go wild. Slay as many enemies as you can, which might be not as easy as it sounds...



You can roll the dice to get a (temporary) better weapon, or even refill your health. But beware, gambling comes with the cost of life...

| Space      | jump      |

How many kills can you get ?

entries.title: Mosquito Hunter
entries.description:
Scientists have genetically engineered lizards to fight the ever growing plague of mosquitoes.

You play as one such lizard on a quest to vanquish all the mosquitoes in the jungle!

To keep the lizard population in check once the mosquito population has subsided, each lizard has been genetically altered to exert it's own life force in order to move. Only the sweet taste of mosquitoes will replenish its health. Every move you make costs you life - you must eat mosquitoes to survive!

Use your extendable tongue to eat mosquitoes and grapple onto surfaces to fling yourself around!

### Controls

Use 'A' and 'D' to move left and right.
Use 'W' or 'SPACE' to jump.
Use the arrow keys to shoot out your tongue.

![level1.png](///raw/67a/22/z/22d6f.png)
![victory.png](///raw/67a/22/z/22af1.png)
![tongue.png](///raw/67a/22/z/22aef.png)
![level3.png](///raw/67a/22/z/22af0.png)

This game was made solo for the Jam. All content was created during the 72 hour competition using:

* Godot (Engine)
* Aseprite (Art)
* Bfxr (Sound)
* Font (https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Gloria+Hallelujah)

entries.title: Martian Scrapper
entries.description:
![2019-04-29_12-48-272.gif](///raw/bf7/d1/z/21d29.gif)
# Martian Scrapper

A side scroll 'shooter' game. Blow up enemies and take their scrap to heal. 

Sell parts of your hull for upgrades.

![LD44_2019-04-29_12-38-02.png](///raw/bf7/d1/z/21d21.png)

As usual, I was super strapped for time on this one and ended up skipping a whole bunch of stuff. I had fun trying to learn how to animate explosions though!

![LD44_2019-04-29_21-23-35.png](///raw/bf7/d1/z/21d9d.png)

## Random notes:
* There's no ending. At least 1 boss was planned, but only the main gameplay loop exists and it continues indefinitely. 
* I've implemented stages of 4 levels each. This doesn't yet affect the gameplay (besides random "maps" after stage 0)
* Ideally I wanted 1 miniboss/hard level per stage and the boss on the 4th+. Of course, each stage with changing background visuals too (..making 1 was difficult enough though).
* The 'Health/currency' system was supposed to be more robust, involving hp->scrap->upgrades, inventory, modules and on-the-fly repairs. It ended up being a lame direct hp cost.
* The shop is particularly hacked and rushed.
* Obviously not as balanced as it could be.
* No sound at all. I had some cool ideas but alas, time.
* I don't know why I went for this specific design of 'tank'. I think my brain had an image of a huge tracked vehicle chugging through the desert. Somehow that translated into WWI tanks.
* The whole idea kind of flopped. The core mechanics are... what even are they? I need to work on my game design! 
* Despite this, there's something about this I feel very fond about but I can't seem to put my finger on it. Might be worth revisiting.
* I was going for something kind of like the Android game 'Minute Quest'.
* 30 minutes later: Yeah I was going for a roguelite (you can tell by the existence of a pre-game intro), but decided to hack it into a 'grinding game' after seeing the clock. Still missing some features for that though.

entries.description:

entries.title: Lunch Lord
entries.description:
You THOUGHT you stole a cookbook. Instead you boosted an arcane tome with an insatiable thirst for blood and gems. Oops!
![ld44_cave_back_half.gif](///raw/7d6/z/23191.gif)

- **Brick-breaking town-raiding goat-summoning arcade high score action!**
- **Gather ingredients, mix them with your blood, summon an army.**
- **Raid towns for mega-bonus pens full of tasty farm animals.**
- **Dunk on your scrubby friends with Dreamlo-powered leaderboards!**

![ld44_01.png](///raw/7d6/z/2314b.png)

Gameplay bounces between gathering resources in the cave, and raising hell in a nearby village. Neither location is perfectly safe, but the cave offers an opportunity to stock up on the metal, blood, and gems you'll need to defeat the throngs of angry villagers trying to protect their livestock.

![ld44_02.png](///raw/7d6/z/2314f.png)

**Summon** golems of blood and stone to help you. Rolling shield walls, fireball towers, giant slabs of spiked jade, all of these are better than your spatula. Let the troops do the big fighting while **you** run off and grab **delicious farm animals** for big points.

![ld44_chaos.png](///raw/7d6/z/231f7.png)

## Goal
You have 10 clicks to destroy the blocks.
Try to reach more than 1024 points :joystick: 

- touch a color to remove it
- Points += nbBlocksRemoved^2 
- Game over after 10 clicks;
- Game over if a column is filled and a new block arrives on this column;


## Current known highscore: 1501
let me know when you beat this, I'll update :trophy: 


## Story

I missed to many LD since the first I enjoyed, but this time I was too eager to participate.
I managed to find 10 hours this weekend to push an entry \o/

Somehow it was even an advantage not to use these 48h: I was definitely pushed to remove stuffs as the time passed.

- I wanted many rules, (only one remained at the end)
- I wanted a leaderboard (but I would have used stuffs already coded)
- I wanted music and sounds (guess what)

I finally had issues building the game, (I have been stuck building an android apk) but giving up I somehow managed to export an html5 version just in time, which is quite universal for you players :rocket:
So even if the game is intended to be mobile, it's simple enough to be played with a mouse, and thus html5 it better for this LD showcase.

And to finish, it's quite nice to use a Twitter thread as a devlog as it happens ! Quick stories + screenshots to archive a step.

Now time to get some sleep, it was a draining and inspiring WE.

## Credits

- developed with Corona SDK
- assets created using gimp 2.10.10
- coin edited from https://kenney.nl/assets/jumper-pack with gimp 2.10.10

## Dev log

https://twitter.com/chrisdugne/status/1122041386088505344

entries.title: Demon Pact

## The story:
You, a lonely adventurer, find yourself in a mysterious dungeon. You have no idea how you got there. Suddenly a strange creature emerge from the shadows. It is a demon, offering you a pact you cannot decline.

## How to play:
You constantly lose your life to the demon. Survive as long as you can by slashing enemies and collecting their life essence, collect gold and potions, that make you stronger, from the crates. Your score is determined by the time you have survived and gold you have collected!

## Controls:

* SPACE - attack (hold space to charge a stronger attack).

## Credits:

entries.title: Mana Drunk
entries.description:
# Mana Drunk  
![mana_drunk_day2.gif](///raw/a9a/12/z/20dba.gif)

## Game Description
Gain Mana from enemies and treat mana as your life.  

## Rules 
- Enemy will absorb the accumulated mana on him every peroid of time and enhance themself.   
When enemy died, all of mana it accumulated will be gained by you .   
- Red emeny is special.
- When mana less than 0, our little mage dies.  
- pay you mana by pressing `1`,`2`,`3` to enhance your ability accordingly
- After defeat final boss, you can inherit all of your status and rush again with higher difficulty in next respawn generation. 

## Secrets
- Mana Bomb amplify your consumed mana on enemy with a multiplier.
- Enemies like mana.
- Over-charge mana can kill a enemy.
- Red Slime is a mana-polluted type. It will absorb huge amount of mana immediately.
- If little mana applied on Red Slime, it will be in a mana-desire status, if you always give a little mana to it, it starts to increase mana by itself.

## Secrets of Boss  
- His name is Mana Slime.  
- It has great ability to contain huge amount of mana.  
- Normal mana bullet is too little to overcharge it.  
- Mana bomb with incredible high bomb power may take effect.  
- How to get so much mana to trigger our super-power mana bomb?  

## Goals  
Beat the Boss and refresh your highscore!
![mana_drunk_you_died.png](///raw/a9a/12/z/2262f.png)

## Me  
JustusPan [Twitter](https://twitter.com/JustusPan)  

## About  
### Engine Toolkit  
- [Godot 3.1](https://godotengine.org/)
### Sprite Assets
- All of the 2D assets are created by [Aseprite](https://www.aseprite.org/)  
### Sound FX
- All of the SFXs are created by [sfxr](http://www.drpetter.se/project_sfxr.html)
### Boss Battle Bgm
- [Battle Theme II](https://opengameart.org/content/battle-theme-ii) by [Mega Pixel Music Lab](https://opengameart.org/users/mega-pixel-music-lab)  
- [CC-BY 3.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/)
### Normal Bgm
- [Final/Boss Battle#1](https://opengameart.org/content/finalboss-battle-1) by [nene](https://opengameart.org/users/nene)  
- [CC-BY 4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/)  

## Controls Description:
Mana is your life and currency in Store.
BottomRight corner of screen displayed the required mana to level up each ability.

move - `WSAD`  
mana bullet - `J`  
mana bomb - `K`  
tuning bomb power - `I` / `O`(decrease/increase)  
running - `shift`

buy mana max - `1`  
buy mana bomb multiplier - `2`  
buy mana bomb range - `3`

entries.title: Battery is here to stay
entries.description:
# Battery is here to stay.

Actually "battery is here to stay" is just the working title, one of the many things i wanted to find something cool for and change. Like a good intro and and menu you know stuff like that. 

However like any LD things went horribly wrong and i lost a whole level that costed me most of the day to fix.

"Battery is here to stay" is a short point and click game where you are are a robot for which electrical currency is indeed his live. Your battery however is almost empty and you need to find a way to charge it before your live ends

* all of this i wanted to make more clear in the game but because of recreating the level i had no more time*

Anyway i hope you enjoy.

You can play the whole game with just the mouse but you can use T to enable talk, U for use, W for walk and L for look

Made wih Godot

entries.title: The Kindercatch
entries.description:
Beware little kiddes, the Kindercatch. Close your door, lock your latch, lest your life and soul he will snatch.
 
YOU are the Kindercatch and your life comes at a cost... the cost of innocence. In order to keep the bargain for your dark soul, you must catch and dispatch as many little souls as possible. However, it may not be as easy as you would think, they can be... sneaky.

How To Play: A/D or Arrow Keys to move left/right, W or Up Arrow to float, and Space to Slash. Hunt the children, while avoiding the dogs. You float, don't fly. Just tap 'W' or 'Up' to stay adrift, you will come down automatically.

Game Tip: Children are hard to catch near their homes, stalk them from the air and catch them away from their house. Houses are also dangerous, children are more likely to release their dogs from their home if they see you nearby. 

![Kindercatch.jpg](///raw/196/a/z/22b59.jpg)

entries.title: Deep Space Prospector
entries.description:
**-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------**
**Description**
 
Deep Space Prospector is a mining/survival/exploration/space shooter with a nice mood to it (I hope). Roam the vast space of the cMonkeys Empire for precious energy. Upgrade your ship during your adventure to survive scavengers and be able to pay the Empire's energy tax. Punishment for not paying your tax is death!
 
**Info**
 
This game is made during Ludum Dare 44 as a solo project, with the support of Deozaan testing and giving me tips, and my wife Kristel taking care of me while being sick. :)
 
Being sick, I didn‚Äôt have the energy (no pun intended) to work 'full time' on this game. I had to take my rest now and then, but I‚Äôm glad how it turned out. If people would enjoy the game I wouldn‚Äôt mind working more on it, adding multiplayer and a lot more content.
 
The great music is made by Icydemon, so therefore I opted out on music. I didn‚Äôt have enough time to make a tune myself, and frankly - I loved this one too much to not use it. ;)
 
**Controls**
 
Can be found and configured in-game‚Ä¶ enjoy!

entries.title: Mortal: the fate of cells
entries.description:
Mortal is an arcade game where cells go on missions. depending on their type, cells have different missions to complete.

////
how is this related to the theme ‚Äúlife is currency‚Äù? my take is this: cells are the currency of our bodies. even if we do not often think of their work; what, when and why we are doing what we do - this is exactly what it means to be alive, but also what it means to be mortal.
////

during the missions, cells act as currency. you can loose one cell type, but in return receive two cells of a different type. there‚Äôs always a trade off, but also a price to pay.

after each completed mission, the next one is always harder and more challenging.

entries.title: Mr. Mewsifer's Malevolent Market
entries.description:
Mr. Mewsifer runs a business selling foods of all types (and colors), but his expectations for employees are... strict. Ensure that the customers get what they want, or else you may find yourself separated from your soul. At this Malevolent Market, Mr. Mewsifer accepts cash or... YOUR SOUL!

The premise of the game is fairly simple -- customers will come in and provide a hint at a single item that they're looking for. As time goes on, they'll give additional hints to help narrow it down. There's no penalty for handing them incorrect items, so feel free to rush around and guess!

Didn't get around to making a win/fail state, so it has an interim credits scene.

entries.title: Cloudwalker
entries.description:
*High up in the sky, beyond the clouds, a Sentry monitors the battlefield, restlessly pinpointing incoming enemy troops. It is said that its flight is powered by state-of-the art anti-gravity boots... But in a time where resources are scarcer than ever, is that technology really sustainable ?*

**In Cloudwalker, your goal is to spot incoming ennemies. Day after day, you will receive new communications from your commander. Keep in mind that flying is not free : watch your energy level closely.**

Communicate with your commander day after day.
![sc1.png](///raw/ccf/21/z/214ca.png)

Watch out for ennemies from your aerial position. (Clouds on Windows version only)
![sc6.png](///raw/ccf/21/z/214d2.png)

Keep track of intruders with your cursor to pinpoint them. Past a certain number of identified ennemies, the story will move on.
![sc7.png](///raw/ccf/21/z/214d4.png)

Reach the end of the game and discover secrets !
![sc5.png](///raw/ccf/21/z/214d0.png)

![credits.png](///raw/ccf/21/z/214d8.png)

**This game was developed with mobile VR (Cardboard) in mind.** As such, even in the HTML5 version, all interactions are based on the direction you are aiming for. To activate a button or identify an enemy, just keep your cursor on it (on PC) or keep your gaze on it (in VR).

**The HTML5 build makes for a nice preview, but performance is lackluster.**

Thanks for playing !

entries.title: Life Cycle
entries.description:
## About

Life Cycle is a complex 2D platformer made in Unity for the LD44 Compo. As you wander the woods something unexpected happens... Enjoy the adventure and have fun!

Beware: This one is difficult! But, if you're stuck, think first... 

![life-cycle-screenshots.gif](///raw/037/22/z/219cc.gif)


This is my first Ludum Dare entry! I'm a c# programmer and use Unity in my spare time. My focus lies on the programming side.

I hope you like the game!


## Instructions

Use **A/D or Arrow Keys** to move left and right. Use **Space** to jump. **Q** (WebGL) or **ESC** (Standalone) aborts a level. 


## Used Tools

* Unity 2018.3.13f1 and Visual Studio 2019
* Medibang Paint Pro and Paint.NET for (programmer) art
* SFXR, Audacity and a bit of Bosca Ceoil for sound effects. Not enough time for music..

If you want to know more about this project, [here is a Post Mortem](https://www.zubspace.com/blog/ludum-dare-44) which also includes a timelapse. There is also a (hopefully) [funny Comic Strip](https://www.zubspace.com/comic/reusable-cubes) related to the game.


## Changes

2 tiny after-submission-hour UI Fixes:

1) WebGL UI Fix: The Escape Key leaves Fullscreen Mode in a browser. Therefore added a button in the level selection screen to return to the start screen.

2) WebGL UI Fix: The Escape Key leaves Fullscreen Mode in a browser. Therefore listening to Q instead while playing and added an Info to the level selection screen.

entries.title: Your Life Is Currency
entries.description:
A top down shooter where you can use your HP to upgrade yourself through mutations. The game lasts until you die, and has a functional score and leaderboard system (Leaderboards are local, not online). This is my second attempt at making a Ludum Dare game, and I would love any feedback you all have.

I used Unity to make the game, Visual Studio Code as my IDE, Marmoset Hexels 3 to make the art, and Beepbox to make the music.

entries.title: Robyn H√ºd
entries.description: Steel from the rich and give to the poor Average game duration = 1-2 minutes ![giphy.gif](///raw/f9e/8/z/2116e.gif) Instructions Shoot the blue things (Thanks @jcmonkey for elevating this point) Mouse click to make it rain (hold it down if you have full auto) A and D to switch lanes. Dodge the cars The blue ellipsoids are homeless people. Give them money and they will replenish your health. Theme: So basically this is a social commentary on homelessness and how essential money is to sustain life. The main character Robyn H√ºd tries to balance out the system by giving money to the homeless who in return reward Robyn with more life. Tools used: -Unity (C#) -Paint.net -Blender -FLStudio All assets created during the competition. Update: -There is a bug causing the sidewalks to disappear after you reach around 13k points. Take a screenshot with the sidewalks glitched out if you see it. I'm taking notes of bugs -Cars will hurt you. This is not a bug. Yes at the start you do not have full health. No reloading does not heal you. Plans to extend the gameplay: -idk yet, please feel free to connect with me in the comments on any ideas moving forward. I really want to do more with this game.

entries.title: Curse of Volgax
entries.description:
![image1.png](///raw/712/z/218fb.png)

On your way to confront the twisted wizard Volgax in his dark and unforgiving domain, he appeared out of nowhere to place a curse on you! Now you only have 60 seconds left to live, which will not make taking Volgax down any easier.

![image3.png](///raw/712/z/218fd.png)

Thankfully, the denizens of this twisted land deal in lifespans. There exists all manners of methods to delay your death here, but also to beckon it closer with the promise of new powers.

Featuring:
- Two randomly generated areas, the jungle and the village.
- A boss fight against Volgax himself.
- Merchants who request seconds of your short life in exchange for items.
- Terrible background music.
- Extremely aggressive monkeys.

Controls:
- Arrow keys = Movement
- Spacebar = Jump
- Z / Left shift = Attack (Hold to charge your attack up.)

This idea was quite ambitious for me and as a result I was super rushed by the end. There are a lot of areas lacking in polish, and I am not too satisfied with the game in its current state. I do really like the idea though, and think it could be a lot of fun with some more work.

entries.title: Pixel's Villagers
entries.description:
![TitleDark_A.png](///raw/26d/81/z/24372.png)

### Your life is currency.
In this game, everything and everyone has it's own value. From the seed that you pick up from the forest to plant in your farm, the wood you use to build houses and fuel your campfire, to the different animals that you meet in the forest, each having its own set of abilities. As their new mayor, the fate of the village is in your hands, make the right choice and see it grows, or choose to keep it a smaller tight-knit community. **Your** life is the currency, **you** decide.


As you begin your new role, you will need to gather food, seed and wood to the village to make sure your community grow.
Be careful, the forest has many dangers. Bring back your finding to the campfire and the barn, build farms and houses (press B) and bring new animals to your little town.

![buildmode3.gif](///raw/26d/81/z/247f1.gif)

![AllBuilding2.gif](///raw/26d/81/z/247f8.gif)

Those new friends will help you gather food, get through bigger obstacle (rabbit = jump higher, bear = can move big boulder and rocks, duck can see danger and treasure from the sky)...

And don't forget, every day, our villagers consume food. If we ran out of food or wood, the villagers will leave until there is no one anymore... Same thing for the campfire. They need to feel secure at night, always keep some wood in stock !



~~*Please make sure that you play the game in fullscreen mode with a 1920 X 1080 resolution !*~~
~~I will fix the UI tonight so it will be compatible with lower resolution. Thank you for you understanding :)~~

Finally FIXED ! You can now play in lower resolution and the UI should still be working :) Both web and windows version are now working correctly :D

## HOW TO PLAY:
- Movement: A S D W
- Rotate Camera: right click + drag
- Zoom in/out: mouse scroll
- Jump: space
- Run: hold shift
- Build menu: B
- Reset Camera : R
- Restart Game : P

I hope you will like this game. I developed it solo in 72 hours while streaming on twitch and it was an amazing experience :) 

Oh and if you like the game, a post jam version is under development ! ;)

entries.title: Robo Portrait
entries.description:
In the future where AI takes over all artist jobs, an aspiring robot artist yearns to be painting portraits in the great outdoors. Descending from the printer lines, it's heritage was always about accurate reproductions of the world. The lifeblood of the printer still runs through it's gears, but in order to create the ink must be used. Paint as accurately as you can, and you will be well compensated in ink. Art is your life, and life is your art. Ink on little Art Bot!

entries.title: PepperTony
entries.description:
I have so far managed to do EIGHTEEN Ludum Dare game compos IN A ROW! My first was Ludum Dare 26 ‚Äî April 26-29th, 2013 and I haven't missed one since.

However... now it has been reduced to twice a year, one of the weekends that was picked happens to be the time that all my family have their birthdays. My daughters was yesterday, my dad's is today, mine tomorrow etc... so I felt bummed out that I could not participate in the 48 hour compo. 

However...I created this game in a few spare hours to submit as a token submission to keep my streak going :)
Happy Birthday Everyone! This is PepperTony.

![ItchIOPepperTony.png](///raw/7fa/z/22661.png)

PepperTony is a Pepper Grinder called Tony. Jump around and pepper the cheese on toast, but watch out! the pepper is also his life...currency...

Jump and Grind with Space / A and drop pepper. Your pepper is also your currency and your life. 

https://youtu.be/FN7PdPuxjrE

entries.title: The Bounty Hunter
entries.description:
If for some reason you cannot get past the title screen, please do not rate the game and let me know in the comments and I'll see if I can put some indicators to help test issues for people.

Troubleshooting:
Make sure you set your default mic to the mic you want to be using.  
1. Right-click the sound icon in the taskbar.
2. Select Open sound settings.
3. Choose Sound control panel on the right.
4. Select the Recording tab.
5. Choose the microphone.
6. Hit Set as default.
7. Open the Properties window.
8. Select the Levels tab.
9. Adjust the volume accordingly.


In a post apocalyptic world, you are tasked with controlling a cyborg to hunt down people, so they can be fed to the vampires.  Better them than you, if you don't comply it might be you.  Control the cyborg with your voice.
Forward: Up
Down: Down
Left: Left
Right: Right
Fire: Shoot
Defend: Forcefield
Yes: Yes
No: No

entries.title: Lifeless -- A Little Depressing Game
entries.description:
Hi, this game was made using Amethyst with Rust. This was my first time using this engine and really my first time building anything substantial with Rust.
The game revolves around giving and taking health as life's unfortunately events come flying at you. Your score is based on how many family members are alive. Health is displayed as a color. Your final score gets printed out on the terminal.

![Cover_image.png](///raw/18b/32/z/21859.png)

![cover3.png](///raw/18b/32/z/218be.png)

## Controls

**Key T** - Take Life -- Move your character over one of your family members and hold the key

**Key G** - Give Life -- Same as above

**Arrow Keys** to move around.

**Key ESC** -- exit game.

### Notes

To compile from source code is kind of a pain because it takes so dang long.

1. First acquire rust
2. Then amethyst tools
3. Then you can run

```bash
brew install rust
cargo install amethyst_tools
git clone https://github.com/tfdiaz/lifeless
cd lifeless
cargo run
```
First it will grab all the dependencies which takes a long time. Then it will finally compile. You will get a few warnings but the game should launch! You can also grab the binary and that should work. You need to decompress the file. A folder called Life will have the binary within along with 3 folders font, resources, and texture. Run the executable from that folder and the game should launch.

Thank you for taking the time to play my little sad game. It was a painful but very much a satisfying time.

Best,
tfdiaz

entries.title: God All Smitey
entries.description:
God All Smitey is a game in which you play as God and use your peoples' lives as currency. You can visit Earth to take lives in order to buy new Scepters. God's biggest desire, however, is the legendary cookie sold at the cafe in the clouds. Buy that cookie and you win.

Destroying buildings takes more lives!

Don't die! You'll lose everything! Just click the "leave" button to bail out if your health gets too low, then buy a health potion.


**TOOLS:**

**ENGINE** - Unity 2018.3.12

**PROGRAMMING** - C# in Visual Studio Code

**ART** - GIMP

**MUSIC** - Recorded myself playing guitar with Audacity. Shoutout to my suitemate for letting me borrow his guitar, and shoutout to my other suitemate for letting me borrow his mic!

entries.title: Kicky Blimp
entries.description:
![startScreen.jpeg](///raw/e18/z/22adb.jpg)

## The Story

Welcome to the Blimpy Kingdom!

Little Karl the Limper always wanted to know what's up there high in the sky...

Today, he's finally got the means to get there - a new shiny blimp that he has no idea how to pilot!

Here's the catch - YOU do. Or, at least you said so. Are you worthy?

Anyway, good luck piloting the balloon, and have fun! 


![tutorial1.jpeg](///raw/e18/z/22ae2.jpg)

## Controls

**Click** - That's all that you're gonna need. 

**Click** to get the blimp up

**Click** to avoid the obstacles (yeah, the sky has plenty of those)

**Click** to pick things up and buy stuff

**Click** to restart the game, too

**Pro Tip**: It's not a very good idea to mix the air balloon with the spikes. Try some green fuel barrels instead, should do better.


![bestScore.jpeg](///raw/e18/z/22ae6.jpg)

## How is that connected to the theme?

It‚Äôs needless to say that the fuel is life in this world. 

No fuel = no flight.

Guess what? The fuel is also the currency!

Check out those little air shops that offer you protection in exchange for some fuel.

Thus, you have a hard choice - either you have to risk your life with spikes or your fuel tank with draught...

![gameplay.jpeg](///raw/e18/z/22aeb.jpg)

## Creators 

### Nebulate.me team:

**Firellon** - Graphics, Programming, Design

**Kutase** - Programming, Design

### Special thanks to:

**Nihilore** - Music (http://www.nihilore.com/synthwave)

**Bfxr** - Sounds

entries.title: Dungeons of Taradith
entries.description:
As you enter the mysterious dungeons below the wrecked city of Taradith, you sense death in the cold air. You find yourself in a large maze of rooms. In the centre of the first room is a large altar. It demands blood for riches. 

Dungeons of Taradith is a fast-paced card combat game. Each room has 3 stages, the first and last being battle stages. The middle stage is the store stage, in which players can buy cards by sacraficing their life points, or can sacrafice a random card from their deck to gain 4 life points back. 

![LD44-2.gif](///raw/01e/2/z/212af.gif)


![ItchSS2.png](///raw/01e/2/z/212a7.png)



![ItchSS1.png](///raw/01e/2/z/212a5.png)


-- IMPORTANT -- 
Please do not play the game in edge, as for some unknown reason the cursor is invisible. Use Chrome/Firefox etc.

entries.title: Lunatic Luke

I tied this to the theme through the game play and narrative

Through the gameplay there is one resource called "Juuce" that is used for everything in the game, including health, fuel, ammo, and is a drug used in powerups. So your life is your currency.

Through the narrative, which I didn't fully put in due to time, the idea is you either die in the arena or buy your way out. So people would be placing bets on the combatants and whoever wins doesnt even get to keep the money, but they keep their life.

entries.title: Weapon Draw
entries.description:
Weapon Draw is an action game where you draw cards for weapons and encounters.
Drawing a weapon card costs a heart, but can grant you a more powerful weapon to fight the enemy waves. Surviving enemies restores your health and gives you the possibility to try to get new weapons. 
After the third wave, it's possible to get weapons with extra effects!

If you are greedy, you can try to get more weapons, but then you have less life for the fight!

Weapons that are possible to get from the pack are better as the game goes on, but the encounters get harder as well.
