entries.title: Market Master
entries.description:
![TitleScreen.PNG](///raw/24c/32/z/217ca.png)

Market Master is a game about playing the stock market. Work tirelessly to earn a few bucks here, and a few shares there. Don't like the shares you find along the way? No problem, dump them in the market and buy something else. But beware, some stocks are riskier than others and you could lose it all in no time. Will you try to pick a winner? Or learn the secrets of diversification the hard way?

## Feel free to be very critical, I really enjoy hearing feedback and want to improve!

# Controls
** Click: ** On Jobs that spawn

** Drag: ** Stock shares to the correct color

# Development
This is my first time participating in Ludum Dare, as well as my first ever game jam! I am a programmer by trade, and really struggle with the art side of game development. That being said, this is by far the most complete game I have created to date, and I am quite pleased with how the pixel art came out. I had a great time coming up with the name parodies of real companies. You might be able to figure out which ones are a bit riskier by the names üòâ

If you record any reviews/lets plays please link them in the comments. I would love to watch. Happy Jamming.

Thanks for Playing!


# Tools Used
* Unity

* Photoshop

* Bfxr

* Coffee


![HowToPlay.PNG](///raw/24c/32/z/217a5.png)

![AssigningWorkers.PNG](///raw/24c/32/z/217ac.png)

![GamePlay1.PNG](///raw/24c/32/z/217a2.png)

![Market.PNG](///raw/24c/32/z/217b2.png)

## Changelog:

** v1.1: Bug Fix and Porting Builds **

* Fixed bug for choosing wrong win condition for non 5 year length games. 

* Fixed bug that sometimes would not release workers when jobs fade

* Ported to Windows/Mac/Linux standalone version


**v1.0: Initial Release**

entries.title: Annabelle & Annabelle Otherworldly Meats
entries.description:
Two months ago, you made the life-changing decision of becoming an exotic meats butcher.  Not that being a normal butcher didn‚Äôt make good money, but it was KINDA BORING selling the same meats day in and day out.  So you moved into a new cottage, set up a cozy little house/shop, and quickly signed a binding contract with a shady underworldlian chief.  Full permission to hunt in an underworld pocket dimension, in exchange for nothing less than your soul.  At least, that‚Äôs what the contract said, but so far they haven‚Äôt actually been able to catch you.

Today, though, the chief has returned with news that might change that: they‚Äôve started to tax the borders.  You gotta pay up every time you cross.  That‚Äôll certainly dampen the income a bit, and there‚Äôs always the possibility you go broke on the wrong side of the line.  But money ain‚Äôt gonna make itself...

entries.title: Contract Cleric
entries.description:
![GameplayImageSmall.png](///raw/e56/02/z/21bd5.png)

# - I highly recommend reading the controls and ability text below before playing -

## Overview

You are a hired healer who gets paid for replenishing your party's health.  Keep Sir Whale and Fatstacks the Hunter alive by [Tab] targeting them and using your 4 abilities.  You allies are wealthy casual adventurers and will pay you in gold for each point of health you restore! When you've amassed enough gold, you can [5] send 1000 gold donations back to your church to receive upgrades to your abilities.  If you collect all the upgrades, you win!

# **Controls:**

[A],[D] or [<-], [->] - Move left/right

[Tab] - Change healing target

# **Abilities:**

[1] - _**Heal Other:**_ After a 1.75 second cast time, heal your ally for 17% of your ally's maximum health.  This ability has a cooldown of 3 seconds.

[2] - _**Charged Heal:**_ Press and hold [2] to build up a powerful healing effect for up to 8 seconds. When released, heal your currently targeted ally for a percentage of their maximum health equal to the percentage of the time spent charging this ability.  This ability has a cooldown of 10 seconds.

[3] - _**Regenerative Leash:**_ After a 1 second cast time, apply a heal over time effect to your targeted ally.  Heals 4% of the ally's maximum health per second for 10 seconds.  This effect will end early if the recipient strays too far from the cleric.  This ability has a cooldown of 20 seconds.

[4] - _**Turn Undead:**_ After a 2 second cast time, destroys all skeletons attacking your party.  Your allies rely on you to kill skeletons, because they are too frightened to fight back.  This ability has a 35 second cooldown.

[5] - _**Donate to the Church:**_ After a 5 second cast time, you use your divine powers to send a gold donation back to your church. Donate 1000 gold per cast to receive the posted ability upgrade in the top right corner of the screen from the church as a blessing.  This ability has a cooldown of 20 seconds.

_**Global Cooldown:**_  All abilities casts place a 2 second cooldown time all abilities.


Engine: Unity

Art:    Piskel

Sound:  sfxr


**CHANGE LOG:**

4/29/2019

BUG FIX:  Corrected a game ending crash that occurred before reaching the victory screen.

4/30/2019

TYPO FIX:  Corrected the title of the game as appears in game and the WebGL link.  The title is "Contract Cleric", not "Contract Healer".  (Unless you like the name "Contract Healer", in which case, a typo has been introduced.)

entries.title: Lifeforms In Space

LIFEFORMS IN SPACE
![LIS.gif](///raw/9d8/71/z/249eb.gif)
![screenshots.jpg](///raw/9d8/71/z/24a59.jpg)
![battle_01.gif](///raw/9d8/71/z/249e2.gif)
This game was written for the Ludum Dare #44 Jam in 72 hours.  The theme was Your Life Is Currency. :rolleyes:  Some additional time was spent post jam fixing bugs and tweeking.

Lifeforms In Space is a turn base strategy game that takes place in space.  The objective of the game is to conquer and colonize all the planets in the system before all your fleets are destroyed.

**Left-click to select a fleet, left-click again to warp.  Right-click to cancel warp.**

**Left-click targeter when available to attack enemy fleet.**

**Warp to planets to capture them and place 100 lifeforms to colonize it.**

**OH and sorry for the wall of text!**

Game of Fields is a digital board game. You may play with up to 4 players. Don't worry, - if you don't have friends our super intelligent bots will play with you.

The goal of the game is to reach the win field without dying. Every player starts with 5 hearts.. but be aware, traps everywhere.

entries.title: Our Dear Friend
entries.description:
What drives you? What brought you down here? Again and Again...


Our Dear Friend is a platforming game where you must venture down deep below the earth. Something calls to you, a voice in the darkness. A Friend?


Armed with a grappling hook, a bow, and a handful of arrows, you must venture down into the tombs and discover what you're willing to give up along the way.


![small2.png](///raw/409/1/z/24068.png)

---CONTROLS---


A - Left


D - Right


W - Jump


Left Click - Fire Grappling Hook


Hold Right Click - Aim Bow


Left Click (While holding Right Click) - Fire Arrow




Credits: 


Rusty Hayes - Programming, Animation


Ham - Art, Writing, Sfx


DJ Wildebeest - Project Management, Music


Grappling Hook courtesy of Sheexy's Grappling Engine


Fonts by SomePX


TIPS:

There are three platforms on the way down with powerups. Each one is optional but if you pick up the powerup (by touching the mummy in the center of the platform) it will take away some of your maximum health. The first mummy provides more arrows, the next provides a much longer grappling rope, and the third grants a double jump ability. 

Be careful with your arrows! While there are a few to pick up on your way there aren't many! Firing one directly after another is a good way to destroy one. 

Watch where you step! Use the grappling rope to slowly lower yourself into unseen territory. Always check before firing it and always be ready to use it to defend against incoming bats or spiders!


NOTES:


As often happens we had a few bugs crop up late in the jam, including alignment of the music tracks. The Post-Jam version fixes these bugs as well as adds a final scare encounter that was intended to be in the game but not quite finished in the last hours of the jam.

UPDATE: We heard you! An easier postjam version has been added for those who want to see the whole game without putting time into a stupidly hard jam game :P Thank you all for your feedback! The easier version features less damaging enemies, more helpful health pickups, and a grappling hook that kills enemies!

UPDATE 2: After even more helpful feedback we've released a further update pair of builds. We pretty much kept the old "easy" build as the current build, which has seen a few improvements and bugfixes. Most notably your guiding aura is now brighter and also has a light that follows the mouse, making it much easier to scope out possible threats before moving forward.

The new easy build features less damaging enemies and even more potent health pickups.

![CoinOdysseyBanner.png](///raw/b6b/22/z/21650.png)

Coin Odyssey is the modern tale of what it's like to be a coin on the run.
When everyone on the planet is looking for money, living life as a currency is difficult. Other coins accept their harsh fate, but you decide to run until you can't anymore.

## Goal
Your job is simple: escape before *he* catches you. Slowly flip your way to the exit, and boost yourself when necessary.

There are a total of 5 levels, each focusing on a specific challenge. Each level has a different layout of obstacles. The further you get into the game, the harder the levels become. **Each level is beatable.**

![MapPreview.png](///raw/b6b/22/z/21668.png)

## Controls
|Key|Action|
|---|---|
|`W`|Move|
|`A`, `D`, `MOUSE`|Turn|
|`SPACE`|Boost|
|`MOUSE`|Camera|

## Tools
- Game created using [Unity](https://unity.com/)
- Music was created with [Bosca Ceoil](https://boscaceoil.net/)
- Models created with [Blender](https://www.blender.org/)

entries.title: The Abyss
entries.description:
![ld44 banner.png](///raw/88f/22/z/228d0.png)
## Controls:

A and D to move. Spacebar to start the game.


## Gameplay:

Your health is shown on the rear of your ship. Collect the orbs to increase your health. To buy upgrades using your health points you need to be in the correct lane before the next round starts.

![gameplay footage.png](///raw/88f/22/z/22923.png)

## Installation:

The game works with Linux and Windows 10. Extract the .zip file and run the .exe to begin playing.

## Follow the development:
We have gotten some feedback to turn this into a full game, so we might just do that.
Follow our Twitter for updates: https://twitter.com/waymoor

entries.title: Debugger
entries.description:
**Important info update: The background music is from a third party, but we forgot to opt-out the voting category. We are really sorry!!! Please do not vote in audio category, or just vote for the sound effects (which are created by ourselves).**

You are a programmer in a dot-com company. Under high pressure, you need to follow a "[996](https://github.com/996icu/996.ICU)" work schedule. Your task is to debug routinely, consuming your life. entries.title: Blood Mage: Human Sacrifice
entries.description:
In order to play:

Drag cards over the player to sacrifice limbs (you start with all fingers, toes, hands, and feet) to gain essence. Sacrificing limbs does damage to your constitution (not your defense). If your constitution falls below zero, you die.

Left click on spells, right click on targets to use them.

End turn using the spacebar.

![screen2.PNG](///raw/a43/42/z/21bbf.png)

Use spells (which require essence) to defeat enemies.

Spells include:

Fireball - deals damage based on your destruction skill

Frost Bolt - deals damage based on your destruction skill and prevents movement for one turn

Siphon - steal additional body parts from your enemies

Bind - prevent your enemies from moving for one turn

Shield - raise your shield level by 20.

Shuffle - shuffle your remaining cards.

There is a basic leveling system that I wish could have been more fleshed out, but it at least exists.
![screen1.PNG](///raw/a43/42/z/21bc1.png)

This game was made for the Compo edition of Ludum Dare 44 ("Your Life is Currency"). It was minimally game tested and is barely functioning - but it was my first LD, so I wanted to include it.



All art, code, and music was created by me. Or, in the case of music, it was chosen by me using sound effect generators such as BRFX, SFXR, and BeepBox.

## What is the game about
The game is about living a boring office life and doing standard office work in order to win money.
What a dull life, eh?

In this game you play a office worker:
1. Go to the dollar sign to start your task.
2. Accomplish your task.
3. Repeat until your life ends (around 80 years old, I know.. this is an arbitrary choice, sorry).

entries.title: Powerless
entries.description:
Escape the underground lab facility and watch out for your energy level.

So our first idea was to create a classic roguelike where you'd need to pay with your own health for opening the doors. Fast forward two days and here's a top-down twin-stick shooter where you "pay" with your own health for every possible action.

## Featuring:

* One robot fighting for freedom
* 5 levels of underground lab facility, generated for each run
* Hidden Memory Disks telling the story
* Civilians fleeing away in fear
* Pretty solid game pad support (strongly recommended)
* Strange sound effects
* Unexpected ending scene (good luck getting there)

## Controls

* **WASD / Left stick** to move
* **Mouse / Right stick** to look around
* **LMB / Left trigger** to shoot laser
* **RMB / Right trigger** to activate taser
* **Arrow keys / D-pad** to hack doors

## Known issues

We're going to continue working on the game, but won't post updates, since that would count as new features and is against the rules. Here are some issues we're aware of:

* Level generation - there is a **small** chance that the generated level won't have a possible path to the finish. Sorry about that. :(
* Hacking requires moving your hand to the arrow keys. We're aware that this is a poor UX, but didn't come up with anything better yet.

## Authors

* Keeping the team well-fed: **Flamus**
* Graphics: **Flamus**, **Liath**, **Paulina**
* Code and Unity3D magic: **m110**, **maclav**
* Sound effects scraping: **maclav**
* Testers: well, that'd be you! Enjoy!

entries.title: Sweet Squish
entries.description:
Follow the story of Timmy, an 11 year old who receives a mobile game for his birthday. Can you find all three endings?

[Hint: The ending changes based on how far into the future Timmy has travelled before giving up on the game.]

--- 
## Sweet Squish
From the mobile game company who brought you some of those other games you played every time you were supposed to be socially interacting comes *Sweet Squish!*

Featuring your FAVOURITE sweet treats, this crazy title puts a real spin on the classic match-3 and match-4 games you play all the time.

### How do I play Sweet Squish?
Simply click a candy to select it, then click another and they will swap places. Match 3 or 4 in a row or column to _squish_ them. Once you squish all of the candies, you have won the stage, and your score will update on our patented Global Scoreboard, for all your friends (and strangers) to see!

If you squish candies in the wrong order and you find yourself stuck, do not worry! Simply click the Quit button and try again. We won't even take your ticket away until you successfully clear the level. How nice are we?

### What's a Ticket?
Each level costs one Ticket to play. Out of tickets? No problem, you can buy more with a small amount of cash - or wait for a brief moment to earn a ticket with the passage of time.

### Global Scoreboard?
Yep, the whole world can see how well (or badly) you do at Sweet Squish. If you don't want people thinking you're terrible at games, you'd better get playing!

### How did you come up with this idea?
Using our proprietary Time Accelerator‚Ñ¢ we've been able to harvest the most advanced mobile gaming technology you've ever seen. We created the *best* mobile game of the future, and brought it to the present. You're welcome.

### Don't mobile games exploit people's addictions?
Here at our company, we take these matters very seriously. That's why we promise to never do bad things with our mobile games. You have our word.

### Is Sweet Squish addictive?
Of course not. It's fun, and you'll want to keep playing it, but in the good way.

### Can children play Sweet Squish?
Absolutely! In fact, our CEO and inventor of the Time Accelerator‚Ñ¢ has just given his son a copy for his 11th birthday. If the game was addictive, that would make him a pretty irresponsible parent!


---

## How to play
#### Sweet Squish Homescreen
Click the "Instructions" button for instructions, the big "Play" button to play, and the red X to put away your phone.

#### Dialogue
Press [Space] when "[Space]" appears in the bottom-right, once the dialogue has finished displaying.

#### Bedroom
Click the Phone in the middle of the room to play Sweet Squish, click the Time Accelerator‚Ñ¢ to advance time, or the door to stop playing Sweet Squish.

#### Sweet Squish
Click a sweet to select it. Then click another sweet to swap them.

The aim is to make all sweets in a row or column the same. This will then squish them, and they will disappear. Clear the screen to win a level.


## Known Issues on Itch version
Itch.io version won't work in Firefox 66 on Arch Linux. It seems to work in Chromium on Arch Linux with stuttery audio. 

Seems to work fine on Windows10 with Firefox Nightly 68.

Sometimes the audio plays but the screen stays black. If that happens, just refresh the page and it should work.

#### Headphone users - game may be a bit loud!

entries.title: Minimum Viable Piggy
entries.description:
Minimum Viable Piggy is our submission for the Ludum Dare 44 Game Jam. Follow Hamilton the Pig on his journey through the kitchen and battle the chefs trying cook our portly porker before he gets all the truffles they have! Our pig is constantly on the move and needs the truffles to stay alive, the skinnier the swine, the faster he's determined to get his snacks. But watch out, don't be too greedy or our bloated boar will slow down, making it easier for tonight's dinner to be a luau!

Controls:
- Enter: Start the game
- Arrow Keys or WASD : Move the pig around
- Space: jump
- Shift or F: attack

Thanks for playing! :pig: 

Note: we had to make a small modification after the deadline due to a broken warp point.

entries.title: Heat of the Star
entries.description:
15th (consecutive) Ludum Dare! I feel as though I need a badge.

In my exciting 15th game, you get to experienced the action-packed life of a desert explorer, in the Victorian era. All you arrive with is a map, a small bottle, and 100 pounds (camouflaged as dollars in-game), and you must locate the treasure, hidden miles away, deep into the desert. Your money is only useful for buying some equipment in the starting town; from then on, you must trade your precious water away; your lifeline. Equipment ranges from water-carrying items, helping you survive longer in the desert (and trade for more things), to navigation equipment, which is crucial for not getting lost in the desert.

I've also implemented what I consider to be a rather interesting mechanic: the ability to toward the horizon. This allows you to navigate by the sun and the stars, as well as letting you know when you're nearby to a village, if you're ever lost (which you will be if you don't buy navigation equipment (and aren't a pro navigator)).

I would like to apologize in advance to any astronomers; I have simplified the cosmos quite a bit, due to time, but what you need is all there.

There is music! THIS ONE HAS MUSIC! AND SOUND!

Thank you very much for playing, I do hope you enjoy!

Controls:

W - Move forwards

A, D - Rotate Player

S - Perform map location reading using sextant and/or watch

H - Look at horizon

M - Look at map

E - Fill water, pick up treasure

F - Buy Item

Q - Enable/Disable Music

Tools used:
- Android Studio
- Paint.NET
- FL Studio Mobile
- Samsung Voice Recorder
- Toilet Paper (for the sand sound effect, but it was used for other things too)

entries.title: Yodin Defense
entries.description:
![Logo-export.png](///raw/92e/d1/z/23181.png)
## Description
A tower defense based around managing your only resource - being the Core's life, building material and townsfolk - to survive the longest!

## Instructions
- Build Towers to defend the Core by shooting Warriors (keep some supplied!)
- Build Labs to get skillpoints (by consuming scientists) to upgrade various features
- Build houses to increase your Cell capacity
- Try to survive the longest 

## Patch notes for v1.1 (LD Bugfix Edition)
- Warriors amount is increased by Tower's cost on purchase instead of being set to that
- Towers no longer stop shooting at random
- Tutorial text is shown in its entirety now
- Scientists amount should no longer go negative
- [Start Wave] button disappears after starting the first wave (as intended)
- Fixed sprite positions of buildings
- Fixed sprite animations of buildings
- Field made square-er
- It's possible to purchase the House for 549(/550) Cells now

*As we aren‚Äôt sure it‚Äôs valid for LD, we‚Äôre leaving the old version up as well. Feel free to check either!

## Credits
Coding and art by Neon Glass team  
Music by [Aleks SHAGI](https://soundcloud.com/aleks-shagi)

entries.title: Servant to the Reaper
entries.description:
The Reaper came to take Dave's family to the underworld, but Dave realllllyyyy didn't want the Reaper to take them, so they made a deal. If Dave went out and took the lives of 60 other people within 8 minutes, then Dave's family wouldn't have to die. The Reaper gave Dave his scythe and a bunch of food to throw at the police if they get wise to what Dave's doing.

The Reaper then dropped Dave off near a shady shop where Dave can purchase upgrades and disguises to help him finish his quest.

The catch?

The shop keeper will only take Souls as currency.


Play as Dave on his quest to save his family!...by murdering a bunch of other people...

## Description
Credit Card Rampage is a twin-stick shooter **made by two people __@playball__ and __@Gronther__**. 

You play as a credit card, shooting waves upon waves of inferior physical currencies with your trusty *BitCoin Blaster* __(patent pending)__.
 
After each round, you can buy upgrades for your blaster using the money you collected. But watch out! If enemies hit you, it takes away currency. When you're flat broke, the credit card gets voided and you lose the game.

entries.title: Space Hunt
entries.description:
# Images:
![SpaceHuntLogo.png](///raw/412/e/z/21584.png)

# ‚ÄãAbout:
Space Hunt is a Compo game made for Ludum Dare 44.

Space Hunt is a game about shooting the enemies in space.
Your life is currency - You can use it (energy) to buy and shoot weapons.

# How to play:
- Shoot the enemies.
- Avoid projectiles.
- Avoid asteroids.
- Basic Guns do not need energy.
- Use energy (health) to shoot laser guns and to buy rockets or EMP.
- Energy level must be at least at 25% (+ Cost) to buy weapon or to use laser guns.
- Damaging enemies increases your energy level.
- Use EMP to temporarily disable enemies.
- Enemies can use EMP to disable your ship aswell.
- Do not let the energy to drop to 0.
- Have fun!

# Default controls:
- Arrows / WASD - Movement
- 1 / V - Shoot Guns
- 2 / B - Shoot Lasers
- 3 / N - Shoot Rockets
- 4 / M - Shoot EMP
- Q / K - Buy Rocket
- E / L - Buy EMP
- Escape / P - Pause Menu

# Note:
- If you play WebGL version and have issues with low FPS or the game does not load try standalone Windows version. :D

# Have fun! :star::star::star::star::star:

entries.title: SpellQuest
entries.description:
**Read me!**

SpellQuest is a physics-based roguelike featuring blood magic, haunted and/or destructible furniture, and giant skeletons.

The four spells must be unlocked via periodic magical altars, and can also be upgraded later on. Casting a spell or colliding with objects or enemies reduces your health, and killing enemies increases it. Health can be seen based on the number and size of red splotches on your character.

![upgrade.PNG](///raw/370/02/z/2160d.png)

![chaos.png](///raw/370/02/z/21619.png)

The four spells are:

**Damage** - Temporarily increases damage from your sword. Can be unlocked/upgraded with red altars and cast with right arrow.

![damageIcon.png](///raw/370/02/z/21611.png)

*Health is shown by the amount of blood on the character, as seen here.

**Speed** - Temporarily increases movement speed. Can be unlocked/upgraded with blue altars and cast with up arrow.

![speedIcon.PNG](///raw/370/02/z/21613.png)

**Strength** - Temporarily increases the player's weight, which makes your body do more contact damage. Can be unlocked/upgraded with green altars and cast with down arrow.

![massIcon.PNG](///raw/370/02/z/21615.png)

**Shield** - Gives you a small number of bonus health points. These hit points cannot be used for spells, but they absorb all damage until they run out. Can be unlocked/upgraded with yellow altars and cast with left arrow.

![shieldIcon.PNG](///raw/370/02/z/21617.png)

**Controls:**

WASD - Move

Arrow keys - Cast spells, if unlocked

Mouse - Move sword

entries.title: Chimera
entries.description:
![Chimera 2019-04-29 (22013).jpg](///raw/d31/z/2370d.jpg)

A walking simulator about self-discovery.

# Log

* v3 - updated credits to include our third team member (whoops)!
* v2 - bug fixes not affecting gameplay:
   * Fixed credits reveal not generating the right model. This was a typo on a variable in a loop.
   * Removing options in the options menu where the feature the control affects wasn't implemented in the game from the first place (e.g. scrollwheel sensitivity, screen shakes).  These came from the open source project, [Template Unity Project](https://bitbucket.org/OmiyaGames/template-unity-project).
   * Fixed the default language to be back to a supported language on the system settings, instead of Pig Latin all the time.
* v1 - initial release.

# Known Bugs

* Web builds does not lock the mouse properly.  This can be fixed by simply clicking on the game again.
* Tutorial dialog sometimes overlaps one another.
* Sometimes, the "use mouse to look around" dialog does not go away.

# Timelapse (contains spoilers)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XkB9epe5T4

We also post timelapses in our previous projects in this play list here:

entries.title: The Last Duel
entries.description:
_A great space fight has just ended, and all that's left is you...and one enemy ship. There's weapons and shield generators floating around in space - you can reel them in and install them on your ship if they get close enough! Mind you there is this one enemy ship... maybe take him down first?_

The Last Duel is a card game set in space where you duel to the death. Each upgrade costs a life ("fusion core"), so you must measure up benefit vs cost. Whoever can blast away all the fusion cores in the other ship, wins the Last Duel. 

Win by attacking with lasers and rockets and special weapons like the Giant Bomb and EMP. Lasers can be stopped by the shield, and rockets can be distracted by flares. There's no stopping the Giant Bomb, and the EMP will take out your shield (unless it is massively upgraded), opening up for a laser attack!

Controls: Mouse and R to restart.


![Screenshot 2019-04-29 02.25.31.png](///raw/71/z/21980.png)


![Screenshot 2019-04-29 02.24.18.png](///raw/71/z/21982.png)

Update: Have added a post-compo version with a fix for a reported bug!

entries.title: Nine Lives

# Nine Lives
## Description
Get through the various different rooms whilst spending your nine lives to unlock the door and proceed!

First ever Game Jam, and learnt a few things such as time management. If I had more time, I'd definitely add a lot more variety to the game.

![LudumDare44.png](///raw/fc5/22/z/21983.png)

## Controls
- WASD - Movement
- Arrows - Shoot

## Tools
- Unity 2019.1
- Aseprite
- Bosca Ceoil

## Things to work on
- Time Management, even the use of a Gantt chart to ensure I'm on track. Features I wanted added to the game never made it due to time scale.
- Working with art. I've never been a designer, just a programmer. I think I should spend a bit more time practising with art work.

entries.title: Trading Lives
entries.description:
## Story:

It's been just hours since you and your daughter have been slaughter.
It seems that your gambling addiction managed to cut short a pure life like Lilly's.

You wake up in Limbo not sure how much time you have left, determined to make things right and knowing that your life doesn't weigh to much you start bargaining for her life.

You got a chance: Make your life worthier by freeing people stuck in the Limbo. 
The Limbo is a hard and dangerous place to navigate; the platforms are far away and you need multiple jumps. Watch out because you have to trade a portion of your life for every jump.

Good Luck.

## Instructions:
- Health bar is on top
- Every jump you lose life
- Regain life by cutting the chains of people stuck in limbo
- Avoid spikes (instant death)
- You can cut the spikes too but you need perfect sync (risky)
- Enjoy! (is the second time i did audio, if you don;t like it, mute it :D )

## Controls: 
PC:
- UP: Jump
- SPACE: slice/‚Äãattack
‚Äã


Mobile:

- Touch right side of screen to jump
- Touch left side of screen to slice/attack

## Known issues(!!!):
- On Mobile, the menu items's hit boxes don't mach the visuals (because of resize)

## Tech used:
- Phaser 3
- Piskel
- BoscaCeoil‚Äã‚Äã

Fight monsters in the arena, then decide how much life you‚Äôre willing to invest in upgrades to tackle the next. If you‚Äôre running short on life, you might decide to buy back your life - but will selling away your tools be the very thing that gets you killed?

You are a sentient dollar bill, sent into the small town of Stony Meadow to help a variety of its citizens make crucial decisions in their lives. This is a text-based, decision heavy game with a lighthearted story and pixel-art characters.

This game was created using Twine by a bunch of writers, a musician, and an artist. We've done our best to catch all the little inconsistencies in the text, but there may still be some stuff we missed. Sorry. Enjoy!

Controlls:

Keyboard:
Move: WASD or Arrows
Dash: space

Controller:
Move: left stick
Dash: A

The Game is easy to play and it's not to hard, but also a little challenge.
Easy to play online.
Playtime: ~15min +Endlessmode

Do not hesitate to report bugs and mistskes, make suggestions for improvements and tell me your opinion :).

entries.title: BloodKeep
entries.description:
**STORY**  
In the dark streets of Ludum city, you struggle to survive as a young vampire. As you harvest the blood of the innocent citizens to stay alive, you can also trade it for greater vampiric powers. But be warned! The Ludum City Police is watching your every move, and do not care who gets in the way of their silver bullets.

**CONTROLS**  
'WASD' or 'Arrow keys' to move.  
'Space' to attack nearby enemies.  
'Number keys' to purchase in shop.  

**HOW TO PLAY**  
Navigate the streets of Ludum and harvest blood from its inhabitants to replenish your dwindling health (blood). Purchase upgrades in the shop in exchange for blood to grow in power. Stay away from (or murder) the brave police officers who investigates your evil deeds and attempts to take you down. Your goal is to harvest as much blood as possible before your inevitable death (score in upper right hand corner).

EDIT: 18-05-2019
Added windows build with a fixed typo.

![SS2.png](///raw/3dd/32/z/21d8a.png)

entries.title: Leif is Life
entries.description:
![cover](///content/3f6/22/z/228bf.png)

## It is the year 1000 A.D. You‚Äôre Leif.

Food shortage makes your and your fellow Leifs‚Äô lifes tedious.
You lead your Leifs with the last food onboard and set sail to seek fertile land. 
To keep your Leifs alive, you need to pay with your Leifs: If you‚Äôre lucky, you will encounter an island populated by a tribe that has worked around the food shortage by eating Leifs. There, you can trade Leifs for food. Other islanders are less friendly and try to end your Leifs. Send your Leifs into battle and conquer their food supplies. If you lose, they will do the same to you. Remember travelling with too little food will send Leifs into the afterlife. Try to reach the fertile lands without running out of Food or Leifs!


## Made with love by

- @veloev (code, localhost)
- @sophiakene (music)
- @pleyad (graphics, code)
- @phi (code)


Font used in-game: [ZCOOL KuaiLe](https://fonts.google.com/specimen/ZCOOL+KuaiLe). Made with [melonJS](http://melonjs.org/).

entries.title: Only Got Nine Lives To Live
entries.description:
_"Have you seriously not heard tales of cats having nine lives? That's not just a legend.."_ 

**Only Got Nine Lives To Live** is our take on the Life is Currency theme for this jam. I mean, what other creature could effectively use their life as a currency other than cats, they've got so many of them!  
So use them wisely, to purchase a spaceship and unique upgrades for it in order to reach a sacred temple of Sanctus Cattus where you'll meet your destiny!  

### Controls:
Point and click, nothing fancy here.

### How to Play:  
A comprehensive How To Play section can be found on the game's Itch.io, to save space here.  

### Team:  
  
**Programming**  
Unity + C# - @sempiternal  
  
**Graphics**  
Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator - Kate (@kateb) 
  
**Audio**  
FLStudio + Arcade by Output - @sempiternal  

**Writing and Game Design**  
Denis (@Sleepqt)

entries.description:
Odd Jobs on a Day in Summer is a short game about helping some people out and getting paid for it, made in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 44. The game was made under compo limitations (1 person, creating all assets, etc.), except the extra time from the jam was used.

entries.title: Till Breath Do Us Part
entries.description:
A top-down shooter where you're a constantly running low on oxygen and can trade it for upgrades to have more chances in defeating deadly enemies.

Used tools:
- Unity as a game engine, 2d mode, project started from scratch
- Photoshop (made some pixel art from scratch and some floor textures from photo of household items :D that was fun)
- GarageBand (tried to synth some music, well, that did not go so well)
- AudaCity (fixed shot, hit and item pick up records, but did not really have time to add them to game)

Sorry for crappy synthesized music :) If you feel annoyed by it, please turn the volume down - I had no time to implement "disable music" button :(
I've synthed sounds for shooting and hitting enemies but did not have time to put them in actual game :\ Post-LudumDare update will follow :)

entries.title: Life Of Erdanon
entries.description:
![28-4-2019 20-44-34.png](///raw/3ed/e1/z/21007.png)


** Description **


Erdanon - mage, man of knowledge and alchemist. He is prepared for his last adventure. Will you guide him on his quest?

Remember to click "Ending" after last level. :)


Due to my unexpected illness, I had to publish game 6 hours before deadline, so it's unpolished. I wanted to add more sounds, 5 more levels, and at least one new potion.

Movement: WASD / Arrows

Jump: SPACE

Potions: 1,2,3,... (numeric keyboard) - Also, click on bottle to reveal more info

Reset Level: R

Menu: Mouse

entries.title: Money Heist
entries.description:
This is a game where you have to escape from a bank heist by navigating traps. 

You are the money - if you get damaged by the traps you lose some of what you stole.

Try to get out of the bank with as much money as possible.

Move with WASD or arrow keys.

Enjoy!

Made in Unity2D

entries.title: Currency delivery
entries.description:
![sshot.png](///raw/ed1/z/21441.png)

Controlled by :keyboard:  or :video_game: 

The selection of the states and map generation is random at every start.

Made in Unity3D/C#/BFXR/Audacity/BoscaCeoil/MSPaint 

Made during **48 hours** (actual time spent ~16h)

I used 1 font from the net, plus I didn't draw the flags (Wikipedia). I totally didn't expect to realise I'd fit into the COMPO restrictions (I always do jams), so here I am! Oooooh-yeeeah!


Rough reconstruction of my work (times in CEST/UTC+2):

* Sat 08:00 - start thinking
* Sat 09:00 - fetch groceries (30 min)
* Sat 11:00 - the idea with delivering currencies between banks
* Sat 12:00 - lunch
* Sat 13:00 - start prototyping, promise self not to do too much programmer's art too early
* Sat 15:00 - a stroll outside for an hour
* Sat 16:30 - continue working, find that I broke my promise to myself
* Sat 18:00 - map generator, textures loader, movement, some effects and animations working
* Sat 20:00 - go out for the whole evening

* Sun 09:00 - restart working
* Sun 12:00 - lunch
* Sun 13:00 - gameplay is still very bad
* Sun 16:00 - download and process all currencies and flags
* Sun 20:00 - final time count-down gameplay, win/fail screens, start screen done
* Sun 21:00 - add sounds and music
* Sun 23:00 - UI is totally broken in WebGL

* Mon 01:00 - Cry after 2 hours wasted, still not find a way to show the UI in WebGL
* Mon 02:00 - Go to bad sad and pissed off BUT submit (Win64 only + src)
* **COMPO ENDS**
* Mon 08:00 - start workaround on the WebGL UI (=porting/bugfixing)
* Mon 09:45 - submit a version with WebGL UI working (=porting/bugfixing)
* Mon 22:00 - submit a WebGL version without music (=porting/bugfixing)



PLAY HERE! :point_down:

entries.title: Withdrawal
entries.description:
Hey all, this is my first Ludum Dare and I decided last minute to work alone in making a game. I didn't have quite enough time to polish as much as I would like and attempt to make art and music (even though I'm not particularly good at either) but I'm happy with how it came out!

This is a standard wave survival shooter with upgrades in between waves that you can buy with health points.
Aim with the mouse, move with WASD, E to purchase upgrades, click to shoot, Escape to pause.

In between waves, return to the center for randomized upgrades that you can purchase before beginning the next wave. I only made 10 waves, so after that enemies will stop spawning.
Have fun!

entries.title: Snots Quest
entries.description:
Did you ever feel sorry for all the slimes slaughtered by everyone without hesitation?
Well in this game you can finally help them by leading them out of a scary dungeon and giving them back their freedom!
![snotsquestlogo.png](///raw/da4/21/z/23e7a.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-04-30 21-28-18.png](///raw/da4/21/z/23e77.png)

We are very glad we actually got it somewhat finished, because we once again went a little to high with our scope..

The game could definitely use a lot more polish which will probably happen in a post jam version :).

There is controller support as well as two player coop(though both are mostly untested).

Would be great if you try it out!

Made with the Godot Engine, Krita, Musescore and Ardour.

- Konsumopfer77 - Graphics
- Paul - Music Composing
- Lodugh - Game Design/Programming


** Update 1.0.1: **
- fixed overeating
- fixed menu bug

** Update 1.0.2: **
- fixed stuck slime

** Update 1.0.3: **
- added options
- fixed stuck eyes

** Update 1.0.4: **
- actually fixed stuck eyes

entries.title: We Pay In Blood
entries.description:
![WePayInBloodThumbnail.PNG](///raw/764/e/z/20fb6.png)

## About
"We Pay In Blood" is an arena fighting game, similar to the classic "Boxhead". Before each arena round you'll be able to use your hitpoints to buy new weapons! There are 2 bosses that you'll be able to defeat.

Even though the 2nd boss can be killed on level 10, the game can be played **endlessly** if you wish to continue!

Good luck!

### Controls
Movement: WASD/Arrows
Attack: Spacebar
Switch Weapons: E

entries.title: Coin Floor
entries.description:
![ScreenShot0.png](///raw/704/z/24e98.png)

So you find yourself in a dungeon. It's probably dangerous. Luckily you have a sword, which you sold for 12 coins and that's fine since you have a dagger, which you also sold for extra 4. Now all you have is 16 coins. But you still require more, it's like your life depends on it.  
You also need to pay to activate the levers. Don't ask how or why.  

### Controls  
* In order to walk - press a key which is used for walking.  
* In order to jump - step on a fake floor tile which is actually a button.  
* In order to interact - press a key on a keyboard, just make sure it's not the same keyboard you use for walking.  
* Main Menu - **ESC** or **F1**-**F12**  (F13 and above are not suported)

entries.title: Life is too short
entries.description:
The game is the story of an old, very sick man who before his death decided to change something in his life. You can go with him on a short journey to achieve the goal...

entries.title: Wizard of Worth
entries.description:
Help the wizard defeat the demons and their minions with nothing but a pocket full of change!  

- Move the wizard to avoid minions.
- The demon cannot be destroyed!  The minions can be killed.
- Move your mouse to tell the wizard where to shoot. Use the left mouse button to fire pennies at the minions.
- Collect coins within 5 seconds to build up your net worth... 2 pennies per coin!

The game is over when you  are attacked by a minion or demon.

This is my Ludum Dare 44 Entry for the theme "Your Life is Currency".

![master-960x600.png](///raw/021/z/2148b.png)

entries.title: Slice of Scythe
entries.description:
(Our first LD entry!)
***
Here are some things you can do in this game:

-Play as the 19-year-old cousin of Death (yes, Death with a capital D, the Grim Reaper, etc.) and terrorize suburbia

-Murder innocents

-Shop for groceries

-Buy a neat hat from Hell

-Fail to buy a neat hat from Hell

-Feel emotions (?)
***
Thanks for playing!
![unknown-2.png](///raw/06a/52/z/23630.png)

(Note: all the character sprites are Maddi, because we ran out of time. Sorry about that! Just use your imagination.)
***
CHANGELOG:

4.29.19: fixed some reset bugs so you can actually play the game, just like you‚Äôve always dreamed!

4.30.19: fixed missing text bugs and updated the resolution, because we decided that you, beloved player, are worthy enough to read the dialogue.

entries.title: Ocean Ecobalancer
entries.description:

Play as a god/goddess and create new life using your energy. There's 5 types of aquatic life to balance in this sim. Work from the bottom up to create a sound food chain.

entries.title: My Sweet Money Shooter
entries.description:
![MainMenu.png](///raw/2db/32/z/22332.png)

Tired of losing your hard-earned, sweet savings to greedy banks? Claim all of it back today, with some sweet interest on top, in The Most Awesome Online Banking Game ever created!

Arm yourself with the last coins you saved in your piggy bank and go to your nearest, greediest bank branch. Convince the employees of your right to claim by shooting them with your golden ammunition.

Watch out not to lose your last coins as well though. Shooting and being shot both require small to medium investments, but shooting may have big on-hit profits.

You can find a short briefing on financial investment strategies below.

Objective
---------
Become the richest.

Controls
--------
Push buttons.

Objective (details)
-------------------
Pick up as much sweet money as you can by walking over it. Only coins that are on the ground are sweet.

When you shoot the others with your coins, they will lose some of theirs which you can try to pick up.

They are shooting you too, so be careful when you walk in with your last savings.

Do not attempt to pick up hot money, it will hurt you and your wallet. Hot money looks hot and flies around at crazy speeds.

All money gets sweet eventually, also hot money.

Controls (details)
------------------
Use the arrow keys, or WASD (ZQSD) to move.

Use the mouse to turn around.

Left-click to throw coins.

Interface
---------
On the top right you see a countdown timer.

On the top left you can see your rank (You are "Player").

Try to be on top of the ranking by the end of the countdown.

Credits
-------
Software: Unity, Blender

Music: https://incompetech.com/

Coin sounds: https://www.soundjay.com/coin-sounds-1.html, https://freesound.org/people/bradwesson/sounds/135936/, http://soundbible.com/333-Cash-Register-Cha-Ching.html

entries.title: My Little Planet
entries.description:
My Little Planet is our entry for Ludum Dare #44. We were 2 working during the 72 hours
(Elie Paquiet &  Maxime Hanot).

![08.png](///raw/f45/e/z/23d11.png)

My Little Planet  is an immersive third person game where you're controlling a tank on a little planet. We are not really inspired by game design so we decided to create a game from the idea that inspired us the most, and that would allow us to improve our skills.


Control the tank and destroy all the turrets without taking too much damages !


![10.png](///raw/f45/e/z/23d13.png)
![01.png](///raw/f45/e/z/23d15.png)





## TEAM  :

**Elie Paquiet :**  3D Artist / Tech Artist  -  https://www.artstation.com/eliepaquiet


**Maxime Hanot :**  Developer / Sound Designer  -  https://maximehanot.itch.io/


Hope you guys will like the game !
Cheers !


![05.png](///raw/f45/e/z/23d16.png)

![11.png](///raw/f45/e/z/23d19.png)


## CONTROLS  : 

**WASD**   /  **ZQSD**   to move

**QE**   /  **AE**    to use powers ( it costs lifepoints )

Mouse movement to turn tank turret

Left click to shoot

entries.description:
! See download page for how to play !

entries.title: SHELTER
entries.description:
![ShelterLongCover2.png](///raw/b52/z/232f5.png)
SHELTER is a First Person Narrative Horror Game made in 72 Hours. We decided early on to ignore the theme because of how much we disliked it, so I hope you enjoy.  
  
#### NEWS  
- If you can: Download the game rather than playing with WebGL. It looks significantly better.  
- We're working on getting the game to be compatible with as many computers and operating systems as possible.  

#### About Us:  
SHELTER is from half of the team that brought you ATLANTIS (LD38), Off The Hook (LD41), DETRITUS (LD42), and De-Railed (LD43), our first Husband and Wife entry! We're excited to return again for our fifth completed game!  

#### Social Media  
* **Company Twitter:** https://twitter.com/OccultSoftworks  
  
* **Nick's Twitter:** https://twitter.com/OccultGameDev  
* **Mel's Twitter:** https://twitter.com/FiresongBard

entries.title: MassTransfer
entries.description:
This concept is a revision of some classic strategies.  Becoming stronger at the expense of the enemy, one should think about how the total life (Mass in this game) of own units can be used in every particular situation: the bigger is unit, the stronger but also the slower it is. The player can distribute Mass at any time. Controls:

left mouse button - selection of units  and execution orders.

right mouse button - move order

mouse wheel pressing - rotate camera

A - setup attack order

D - setup fill order

 T- setup split order

M- setup move order

S- stop any order!

[Updated line in the description] There is a text bar in the left down corner, so keep an eye on there, it may be helpful sometimes.

![Screenshot2.png](///raw/098/d1/z/21a64.png)

entries.title: Paycheck to Paycheck
entries.description:
You and your family have just moved into a new city with a mere $100 to your name. You must find a way to pay the bills and put food on the table or you and your family will suffer the consequences. In Paycheck to Paycheck you must decide how to allocate your money and how much of your life are willing to sacrifice to make ends meet. Is it worth it to work overtime so that your kid can see a doctor and eat food tonight? ![ptp title.png](///raw/3a7/2/z/21d02.png)![PtP pay.png](///raw/3a7/2/z/21d03.png)![PtP pre_job.png](///raw/3a7/2/z/21d04.png)![ptp on job.png](///raw/3a7/2/z/21d12.png)
Programming by MiltonNH25, Art by Choco and Quinn, Music by XanderTon, Sound by Quinn

entries.title: The Poor Rebellion
entries.description:
"Bam, you look just like me now!" ~ The King

Glorify your peasant subjects by gifting them gold, only to tax them when your own stash runs low!

The Poor Rebellion is my Ludum Dare 44 entry around the theme, "Your life is currency". It is a reaction based game where you must spend your own personal stash of money to turn peasants into nobles. Be careful however, as your funds might run out! Keep it full by taxing the money back off your subjects. Aim to glorify the most amount of peasants amongst your friends!

Controls:
A and D to glorify peasants, W to tax them!

Gameplay video:
https://youtu.be/b3gwIY372zM

![prGameplay.png](///raw/434/22/z/217a4.png)

![BamGif10.gif](///raw/434/22/z/24c67.gif)

entries.title: LD 44 Currency is life for Ricardo
entries.description:
Game for LD 44.
Theme: Your life is currency
Name: Currency is life for Ricardo
Platform: Windows only
Engine: Rak Engine (Lazarus)
Gameplay: You need to gather 1000 coins for healing your aching tooth by purchasing goods and selling them to customers. From time to time you become hungry and slow - eat cakes to restore speed.

![screenshot01.png](///raw/0a2/52/z/213a6.png)

entries.title: Pilgrimage of Ascension
entries.description:
Pilgrimage of Ascension is a 3d puzzle-platformer.

Controls:
* Tested with keyboard + mouse.
* WSAD keys to move. Mouse to look
* E to interact with altars
* E to break walls (with proper blessing)
* ESC for menu with "Restart level" button

![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/c44/32/z/21ab6.gif)


Tools used:
* Unity 2018.2
* Visual Studio

entries.title: AUTOTRANSPORT
entries.description:
**TLDR**

Built in tutorial uses sound, so read the tutorial here if you can't hear it for whatever reason (it is also more complete). The camera movement behaves slightly differently compared to other 3D games, will probably feel a bit weird at first. The jar is cross-platform (I hope, testing later).

**TUTORIAL**

**Overview**

You are a drone tasked with defending a transport ship (giant simplex sphere, can't miss it). You need to prevent incoming asteroids from hitting it, and you need to keep it powered. This tutorial is similar to the in game one, but will be a bit more complete. I am not super proud of the in game tutorial, but it is there.

![screenshot.png](///raw/762/d/z/21af8.png)

**Controls**

**Movement**

W - forward

A - left

S - down

D - right

**Abilities**

RMB - fire projectile

Q - match velocity

E - highlight asteroids

**Lose Conditions**

 - you can get clobbered by an asteroid.
 - the transport ship can be destroyed by asteroids if it is low enough on energy.
 - the transport ship can run out of energy.
 - your drone can run out of energy.
 - you can lose your connection with the transport ship by going too far away from it.

**Ability Details**

**fire projectile**

if the projectile hits an asteroid, it will slowly convert the asteroids mass to energy, and then fly at you, giving you the energy. If the projectile hits the transport, the energy will just be given to the transport, this is how you power it.

**match velocity**

when activated, your autopilot calculates the impulse required to change your velocity to the object your cross hair is on and applies it, using additional energy.

**highlight asteroids**

the transport ship helps you see the asteroids more clearly, highlighting all the asteroids in blue, and shows asteroids behind the transport ship.

**CAMERA MOVEMENT**

In most normal 3D games, your mouse movements directly change your pitch and yaw, resulting in a camera that will only spin around when looking directly up or down. In space its harder to define an "up" or "down", and the inconsistency of the camera can make things difficult in some orientations, so I used a camera system that moves the camera relative to where you are facing at the moment. It is a bit hard to explain exactly what the differences are, but it will probably be apparent when you jump in. I remember it being a bit confusing when I first used it, but I find it more effective in space based games.

I normally do, but I didn't end up adding a keyboard based roll. You can replicate that by moving your mouse in circles, try it out if you want to roll!

**CROSS-PLATFORM DETAILS**

My engine should allow the jar to be cross-platform, but I don't have easy access to a Linux computer, and while I am writing this I haven't tested on mac. If your platform isn't listed, it should work for the windows jar. Let me know if it works or not so I can either update it here or fix it!

THANKS FOR PLAYING, AND HAVE FUN.

This is game was created from scratch in 42 hours by 2 persons of which only one was able to really work on it.
We continue the development to the point it's finished with some bosses and more stuff so give a lot of feedback(good AND BAD!!!) and maybe you will be a proud winner of a character or weapon or upgrade dedicated to you! Enjoy üëá

[PLOT]

Once upon a time the world was normal, everybody lived their lifes as normal as in our world but than a young magician learned how to controll the time and stole all of the lifetime of the people surrounding him and gave it to himself.
This made him immortal to aging and with that he could kill anybody by just stealing their remaining lifetime.
Since then the currency changed from gold to lifetime so the richest become immortal while the young folk gives their lifetime away to survive.

But after 500 years of suppression and slavery a band of young heroes set themselves the goal to otherthrow the necromancer of lifetime to free the world of his greedy hands.

entries.title: Grow
entries.description:
So. Here we are.

This ludum dare was a LOT different from my first one. I have 130 hours of 3d modeling under my belt, and tons more experience with Unity. Also, this event wasnt during a school week.

Then, whats the result you might ask. Well. Not amazing, but I guess pretty good compared to last time. The game play is pretty stale, you have to collect health to trade for strength, while avoiding dangers. Sadly, I could program anything that moves towards you, so all dangers are static objects.

I also made a soundtrack, for the first time, I made it because I had time left. Its mediocre at best. There are no sounds effects though.

Finally the level, this is definitly what I like most about this project, the models overall look really nice with the lowpoly style.

I had some issues coverting my project to HTML5, next time Ill have to start it as HTML5 project. So, sorry, next time you'll have a HTML :D.

A note on the "Mood" catogory, the mood I aimed for was a relaxed, chill mood.

Anyways, my tired ramble aside, enjoy playing my game!

entries.title: ALIEN, e x p a n s i o n .
entries.description:
# ALIEN, e x p a n s i o n .

Small game created in under 48 hours for [Ludum Dare 44](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/44) with the theme of **Your life is currency**.

Game is built using [Lua](https://www.lua.org/) and [MoonScript](https://moonscript.org/), with the [PICO-8](https://www.lexaloffle.com/pico-8.php) Fantasy Console.


## Instructions

Play as an alien bounty hunter attempting to amass a small fortune by capturing human manned ships using a state-of-the-art vortex laser.

You will be payed by some of the galaxies top scientists who aim to study these humans.

Be careful as hitting human ships will deplete your life meter and more importantly will lead to unwarranted attention and hence will detract from your score/pay.

However capturing a human will restore a small amount of life and the increase your score.  Additionally flying past human ships will also add to your score.

Capture as many ships as possible to achieve a high payday and satisfy the scientists.


## Controls

-   **Arrows Keys** - Control your ship
-   **X Key** - Fire vortex laser / Advance menus

## Screenshots

![game-1.png](///raw/6e7/21/z/21776.png)
![game-2.png](///raw/6e7/21/z/21778.png)
![game-3.png](///raw/6e7/21/z/2177a.png)

entries.title: Lazy Boy 3000
entries.description:
## Lazy Boy 3000 

The adventure / gaming simulator - You try to be the next big streamer and have to manage your time between playing ranked games, streaming, chilling or going to bed. Also don't forget to eat healthy too. 

![MainCover.jpg](///raw/8f1/32/z/2114d.jpg)

## States  

* Gaming: 

Gaming has a chance of increasing your rank. The higher your rank, the more followers you will attract in your next streaming session. You also have a chance of winning small cash prizes. 

Gaming costs a lot of stress, increases hunger rate and tiredness rate. 

* Streaming: 

Streaming let's you gain followers. If you have a lot of followers, you will slowely start earning an income. Your rank will ofcourse start dropping if you stop playing games. 

Streaming costs a medium amount of stress, slight hunger and slight tiredness. 

* Chilling: 

Chilling decreases your stress slightly, slows hunger rate and slightly returns energy.

* Sleeping: 

Sleeping decreases lots of stress, slows hunger rate furthur and returns lots of energy. 

* Pizza: 

Clicking on the pizza gives you calories. 

* Energy Drink: 

Clicking on the energy drink gives you a boost of energy at the cost of stress. 


## Theme & Goal

I interpreted currency and life very broad. You have to balance your life (vitals to live) to achieve your goal. 

-> Survive as long as you can.  

## About Me 

This is my first ever game. Not only with Unity, but ever. I used Unity, Photoshop and WavePad to generate and record everything. I used my voice and a built in microphone on my laptop. 

The biggest problem I had was obvioulsy figuring out how to translate my ideas into the right code syntax. I would love if someone would have time to point out what sections I could do better. 

The big struggle I had was having all the variables that I needed for balance spread around all the scripts. I would definatly need a variable manager or something next time so I can tweak the values a lot faster. 

Anyway, Let me know what you think. Have fun! 

## Edit - Balance

After feedback and playing a bit more myself I did figure out that the balance is indeed off. 

You have to keep gaming to make enough money to buy food. But in doing so you will get too much stress / heartrate by day 3 or 4. You will need to rest a lot to lower it, which will make you unable to make enough money anymore. So you either die of food or heartattack. 

It's fun to figure this stuff out, would love to imporve this game and a post - LD version soon. 

Philippe

entries.title: Project Slorgan: The Escape
entries.description:
![unknown.png](///raw/76c/31/z/2485d.png)
![unknown (1).png](///raw/3dd/31/z/2264f.png)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eYcz7zO9228

#### Developed by [Infinia Entertainment](https://discord.gg/7DerY2B)
Stephan Dvoryanchikov (Codekoto) Programmer, Level designer

Emir (Anion-Z) Programmer, Animator, VFX

Timucin (Wolf-Neon) 2D Artist, Sound designer

Developer's highest score: 571
----------------------------------------------

You are Project Slorgan, you've been through gruesome experiments that have changed your once Human body into a sickening slime goop. Pushed passed the boiling point, you have decided 'No more!' and have managed to execute an escape. Making your way up the elevator, you've just got to get through the winding halls of Infinia Labs. Though no escape goes exactly to plan, the alarms have been rung and the facility is set to self destruct. As the fires of destruction chase you, you must do all in your power to escape. Good luck.

![Poster.png](///raw/3dd/31/z/2263b.png)

### Features

An intense game where the player's attention is contantly redirected, all meanwhile the procedural generation of the level will keep the player coming back to try again.

* Procedural generation

* Intense gameplay keeping players on their toes

* Unique concept

* Unique movement mechanics

* And a dedicated team ;D

### Controls

*Movement*: A and D to move left and right.

**Jumping**: LEFT CLICK and HOLD to activate the aiming of the jump. By MOVING MOUSE AROUND you can aim the jump. Jump power increases the longer you HOLD within a limit. By RELEASING the BUTTON you will jump to the chosen aimed area.

**Heart**: You PRESS Q this to generate a heartbeat which is used as fuel for the lungs to produce oxygen. Some time at CRITICAL HEART BEAT leads to death.

**Lungs**: You PRESS E to produce oxygen, oxygen is then used to produce energy automatically.

**Oxygen**: This is used as fuel to produce energy 

**Energy**: This is used to fuel any actions taken by the player such as jumping and moving CRITICAL ENERGY LEVEL leads to inability to jump and enormous speed decrease.

**Biomass**: This is the primary health of Slorgan.‚Äã
![221fe.png](///raw/0ea/31/z/240fd.png)
### Developer Comments
It has been one hell of an ride making this game. From waking up as early as 4 am to get a headstart in brainstorming concepts and ideas, to staying up as late as 4 am to try and reach the deadline. Working all together in the same physical space day in day out was one of the most beneficial experiences we've had as game developers. It has shown us what working as a team really means and has greatly improved our chemistry as a whole. 

There were many moments in this journey filled with explosions of joy from each of us and desperate lows as problems arose. We really did work until the very last seconds of Ludum Dare and have been passionate throughout the whole thing. It has been something we will always cherish forever and we will definitely be doing the next Ludum Dare in the same way we did this one. As a team, and together. I hope everyone of you had just as much of a beneficial experience as we did and we hope to see you all in the next one. We'll be keeping an eye out for those of you that caught our attention this time. 

Also make sure to check out our discord server, to stay up to date with our actual games and to keep in touch with us. We're actively on there and would love to see some of you guys hang out there with us! 
![221fe.png](///raw/0ea/31/z/240fd.png)
### Contacts

### Join our Infinia Entertainment discord server to talk with us and other members.

## [***Discord Server***](https://discord.gg/Jd3zBzT)

[![Discord-Logo-Color.png](///raw/0ea/31/z/24a03.png)](https://discord.gg/Jd3zBzT)

## https://discord.gg/Jd3zBzT

![221fe.png](///raw/0ea/31/z/240fd.png)
### Go to the link provided and download the game to play it!

#### We are planning to expand on the game in the future, we will add features such as:

##### * More unique and much better improved procedural generation of the level
##### * More types of dangers such as aiming turrets,flamethrowers and more!
##### * More unique ability upgrades that you can pick up in the game that will add to your organs

### Tell us in the comments if you would continue playing the game if we continue development!

![221fe.png](///raw/0ea/31/z/240fd.png)

#### Changelog 
Some changes had to be made after publishing which are:

[Version 1.0.0.1]

* Fixed Unity bug that would not show the game because of post processing

[Version 1.0.0.2]

* Fixed a bug which caused certain parts of the game to run much faster for people with high fps.
* Fixed a bug which caused the player's jump would endlessly continue if was spammed.

[Version 1.0.0.3]

* Fixed a bug where you got stuck on a slope
* Changed controls according to feedbacks, jump is controlled using mouse and vitality management uses buttons.
* Changed UI colors and organs image is made to make them stand out according to feedbacks


[Version 1.0.0.4]

* Fixed bug with animations
* Spikes have been updated to be more easily seen
* Player does not take damage for some time after hitting a spike
* Heartbeat is a more serious threat now
* Additional VFX added to exaggerate response to user's input

------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+------

Please Read Below

This game contains a lot of flashing and may cause seizures. The first page of the instructions has the health warning that I shamelessly stole from Sony. 

------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+------

You have infiltrated Dr. Lud Umdare's secret lab. You must find the bomb and dismatle it before the good doctor 
decides to detonate it and destroy the world!


The suit you are wearing is very special, if you pick up some Quantum Energy Balls you will be able to upgrade some stats as well as the number of bullets the suit will shoot. Press the SPACE BAR to access this upgrade menu. There is one thing I should mention, while you can use these Quantum Energy Balls with the suit there is a cost to so this and it is a percentage of your lifeforce. The good news is the suit will not allow you to use all of your lifeforce if you don't have enough. 

I mentioned the suit can attack, where ever your mouse pointer is when you click the left mouse button is where the suit will attack. As you move about the lab you will find robot guards, a special shield to protect you and some salve to heal your lifeforce. You will also find keys hidden in different areas you can use on the locked doors.

Arrow Keys to Move
Mouse to aim/ LMB to fire. There is no special crosshair for the mouse pointer.
Space to open the upgrade menu.

The flashing yellow graphics are Electric Walls. Touch them and you die. They are a little forgiving in their collision detection though.

Find the 3 colored keys that correspond to the colored doors to open them. 

Good Luck and Have fun!


Continue reading if you are interested in some insight into the game.

------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+------



NOTES:

I had a very grand idea for this game and it fell short by a mile, not because the grand idea was too large. In all honestly the idea was very doable in 48 hours. I originally wanted 4 levels with 16 rooms each. To create all of those rooms should have taken me no more than 4-6 hours but I didn't get to make the rooms until 3 hours before the end. I spent WAAAAY to much time figuring out solutions to problems I never should have had and I didn't get them all solved. So I had to cut things. I made one level that has repeat rooms. I only used 1 enemy of the 3 I had made and tested with. Because the game only has 1 level it kind of makes the upgrade menu I made useless, its there and it works though. I was able to get some sounds and music into the game as well as a win and lose screen.

So please enjoy my creation, but know I had planned for something much more entertaining. 

Oh and I know I could have switched to the Jam, but I have work in the morning and wouldn't have had the time to work on it. Besides, for me Ludum Dare is the Compo.

entries.title: Transaction Packed
entries.description:
![Itch_Banner.png](///raw/bbf/1/z/237b2.png)

Welcome to 2019, where every game that comes out has some form of microtransactions and lootboxes. Why not take it a step further? You want to shoot an arrow? Lootbox. You want to move to a different space? Lootbox. You want to do pretty much anything? You guessed it, lootbox.

Now, you may be wondering to yourself, "How can I afford all these lootboxes, I already spent all my money on Fortnite dances!" Do not worry, for the low, low price of a small amount of your health, you can get some cash and keep the lootboxes flowing.

![TPScreenshot.PNG](///raw/bbf/1/z/23488.png)

![TPShop.png](///raw/bbf/1/z/2349c.png)

![TPShop2.png](///raw/bbf/1/z/234a1.png)

**IMPORTANT NOTE FOR GRADING:**

I didn't make the fonts, so do not factor that in to your decision on Graphics feedback.

Also I didn't make any of the sounds, but I disabled feedback for that category. (Sit on the main menu for ~6 seconds to see the full effect of the song)




**UPDATE 4/30:**

Some people are getting an error where the title screen buttons are blank. I think this is because I used a default Unity font for them but not every computer has the font. I am uploading a new version now that will hopefully fix it. 

If the fix doesn't work for you, the 3 buttons are "Play", "Help", and "Quit" from top to bottom.

entries.title: Yen Master
entries.description:
Vanquish the demons to become the one true Yen Master!
Collect yen to buy powerups, but be careful because the game is over once your yen goes down to zero.  Enemy demons and their projectiles will drain your yen.

Powerups
* Move Speed (cost 25 yen) - Makes the Yen Master move more quickly.  Can upgrade three times.
* Fire Rate (cost 50 yen) - Increases the frequency that the Yen Master can shoot fireballs.  Can upgrade three times.
* Orb (cost 100 yen) - Summon an orb by your side to shoot additional fireballs (maximum 2).  Beware, if an orb is hit by an enemy or projectile it is destroyed (no refunds!)
* Coin Magnet (cost 75 yen) - Coins are pulled toward the Yen Master.  Can upgrade three times, and higher levels increases the magnet range.

Enemies
* Peon Demon (gray) - Moves horizontally, and drops 1 yen
* Circle Demon (blue) - Moves in a circular pattern, and drops 5 yen
* Fire Demon (yellow) - Move vertically and shoot projectiles at the Yen Master
* Boss Demon (purple) - Largest demon that shoots projectiles from his eyes.  Takes multiple shots to defeat.  Drops 100 yen

For more information see https://levidsmith.com/games/yen-master/

Gameplay video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ESTSEodih0Y

Time lapse development video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oUisv2K4Luw

Screenshots

![yen-master006.jpg](///raw/9a1/z/2138d.jpg)

entries.title: Life of a Hoarder
entries.description:
![2019-04-29 02-45-32.mp4_snapshot_00.10_[2019.04.29_02.47.07].png](///raw/2bd/d1/z/23e96.png)

Ok it was quite tricky to come up with something that would make this theme distinct from the theme of LD43 :)
I did not have time to do any music/sounds :(

Dragons are theoretically immortal. But it comes with a price: they buy eternal life from Demon of Greed with valuables stolen from lesser folks. This is why they are such hoarders! And Demon of Greed is a farseeing investor, he assesses market value of what dragons have to offer. So in this game, playing as a dragon, you'll need to plunder towns of the Land to keep your gold income steady, but also keep track of currency rates to make sure that Demon is going to reward you with life power!

In-game tutorial proved to be too much for me as well, there is a how-to-play instruction on itch page.


- Coded with [Pixi.js](http://pixijs.com)
- Drew everything with pencil on paper.
- Font made with [Calligraphr](https://www.calligraphr.com)

entries.title: Memory Run

You have to command your little robot (or tank) through various levels full of danger and puzzles. 

You will find different powerups, which will help you in the level.

- Q/E - Descend or ascend the camera

- Take a closer look at the whole level

entries.title: Specimen Delve
entries.description:
![Cover.png](///raw/ada/e1/z/2169a.png)
# Beam Right In!
A scoundrel specimen collector with two ray guns and some tentacles is about to show a dying planet just how little it cares about your life, while laughing all the way to the intergalactic bank. [Play it here!](https://arkinrev.itch.io/ld44)

## What's Going on Again?
Freeze the native lifeforms and slap a transport order on them to beam them back to your ship. The Sawbots are harvesting the planet too, so you'll need several tentacle slaps to take them out. Or, if you are so inclined, avoid them by using your Fire Ray to cut through the walls of the cave, or jump, wall slide, and wall jump your way around them, it's up to you!

Oh, and I forgot about the whole impending doom. Your ship's engineer is getting nervous, and they'll likely jump the ship out at any time just to save their own tentacles. Of course, if you offer a bribe of one of those delicious specimens you've collected, you can buy yourself just a little bit more time. If you are not careful around the sawblades, however, your engineer isn't going to wait around for your inevitable failure. Not for free anyway. 

**Good luck, and comment with your high score!**

## Don't Let Beaming Disorient You, Get Your Bearings Below
*Here is a suggested set of controls, as how you are playing the game should feel better with a different layout. A Steam controller will work in desktop mode, however I would suggest remapping the >(start) button to ` since the default mapping of Esc will exit full screen mode for this browser game. *

![SDControlsjpg.jpg](///raw/ada/e1/z/23db5.jpg)

entries.title: Potion Wolf
entries.description:
This is my entry for Ludum Dare 44! Skate around the forest as a wolf, fulfilling potions to earn points!

![ItchBanner.png](///raw/faf/1/z/2173e.png)

# How to Play

- Controller movement or W, A, S, D
- The potion you need to make is displayed in the top left.
- Each potion is made up of 1, 2, or 3 ingredients.
- There are 3 different types of ingredients.
- Each ingredient has a color and symbol associated with it.
- Run to the cauldron of the associated color to add that ingredient to your bottle.
- Your bottle's contents are displayed in the bottom-left corner.
- Ingredients may be added to a bottle in any order.
  - If you add more than 3 ingredients, the potion becomes toxic.
  - Run to a black sphere near the center of the play area to dump out your bottle.
  - To add multiple ingredients of the same kind, leave the cauldron and then return to it.
  - The potion order's text changes from a red color to green to indicate it is ready to be delivered.
- Run to the bottom of the play area to a white sphere to deliver the potion.
- You are awarded points and a new potion recipe is given.
- Complete as many orders as you can in 1 minute!

![ldj44_10.gif](///raw/faf/1/z/21741.gif)

# How does this fit the theme?

Originally, I wanted to build a narrative around the idea that your are making transformation potions! Each potion would transform a person, critter, or animal into some other critter, animal, or a different looking person. The idea being that in some ways we should view our own lives as a currency only so much as that we only have so long to live. Wouldn't it be best to live it most happily, as we most want to be seen and as who we are?

I really dislike the idea of selling or trading your life for commodities or even survival/living, so I didn't want to do anything with that concept. Instead opted for a much more affirmative idea!

# Find me

On twitter! @Bitzawolf

entries.title: Mercenary Management Simulator 2020
entries.description:
![banner.png](///raw/32e/22/z/2346d.png)
## Summary
You are now the manager of a team of mercenaries. America‚Äôs new favorite pastime is watching mercenaries off each other in the arena. Seeing as war profiting is really in these days, it‚Äôs your job to recruit some desperate ‚Äúathletes‚Äù and lead them on the field to their almost certain demise for our entertainment and your wallet. Your team earns money from bloodshed, so make sure there‚Äôs plenty of that. You may use your funds to recruit enemies during matches. And remember, it‚Äôs not about survival, it‚Äôs about your bank account!

## Controls: 
* WASD or Arrow keys to move the camera around.
* Left click to select players and tiles.

![game_preview.gif](///raw/42e/22/z/2387f.gif)

## Gameplay
* These instructions are not necessary to understand the game but are here for reference.
* Before battle, buy some mercenaries (click the cards) and then press "play". 
* After selecting a team member:
	* Click a highlighted tile to move your character to that position. 
	* **Blue** highlighted tiles are in **walking** range so you can both walk and shoot in one turn. 
	* **Green** highlighted tiles are in **sprinting** range so you can only run, not shoot.
	* How to **attack**:
		* Hover over an enemy player to see your cone of fire with respect to them. If you see nothing, you have no line of sight to that player.
		* If you see your cone of fire, you can click the enemy to begin the attack sequence.
		* Click anywhere to try and land your shot in the red area to deal damage. The closer you are to the center of the red zone, the more damage you'll output.
	* How to **purchase** enemy players:
		* During your turn, you may purchase enemy players by selecting them and pressing the **purchase** button in the top-left menu. Your balance is displayed at the bottom-left of the screen.
		* You retain your surviving team members between battles.

## Changelog (bug fixes post-submission, no new features as that's not allowed)
* Fixed "Your Turn" popping up behind "Victory!".
* Made it so you can't purchase more players than the maximum amount of players.
* Fixed old dead characters still remaining in the "physics" engine.
* Fixed floating names still appearing for dead players.
* Fixed cone of fire occasionally being off after purchasing enemy players.

### Game by [Marcus Dubreuil](https://marcusman.com/) (Code) and [Ethan DeFrank](https://twitter.com/discocatphd) (Art/Code)

entries.title: Jungle Magic
entries.description:
You're lost in a maze of a jungle!

Find your way back to safety, but be warned that the locals don't take kindly to intruders.

Maybe you'll find some help...

## Keys

* Up arrow: move forward
* Left/right arrows: turn

That's it! :smile:

## Screenshots

![ss-01.png](///raw/859/z/218bd.png)

## Tools

* Blender 2.80
* Photoshop
* Krita
* Bosca Ceoil
* Unity 2019.1
* Rider

## Development

This was my first attempt at creating animated characters (or any animation at all for that matter), and I'm reasonably happy with how it turned out for a first go. All in all, the learning, experimenting, and actual execution of the character and animations took just over a day, with probably half that spent on a character I ended up not using! Oops.

I wasn't expecting to be able to pull off a game given that the character took up so much more time than I anticipated, but it all came together in the last few hours. I was hoping to spend more time on the environment art especially, but I'm still not a very fast modeler so I had to go with a simple modular/tile-based environment instead. It'd have looked amazing with some shrubs along the paths, and non-square corners - maybe next time I'll make it that far.

For the texturing I used a mix of Photoshop and Krita. This was my first time using Krita, and I found the wrap/tiled editing mode very useful! It also has some nice default brushes that made the creation of the ground textures very fast. With the selection of brushes I have in Photoshop, it still won for speed/quality of painting actual textures like the wood logs that make up the witch doctor hut, even though I then brought it into Krita to finish it up in its wrap/tiling mode.

The coding went reasonably smoothly with only a few small bugs during the development that were quickly resolved - no real head-scratchers.
