entries.title: I was guilty
entries.description:
A short contemplative game about self-exploration and redemption.


You have to find three clues about what happened on this temple island. Press space to read a clue when you think you are near one. The connection with the theme is not apparent at first: you have to unravel the story to see it.

There is no audio. 

Available versions :
 * Windows version: Unzip, and double-click on the exe file, or the bat file if you want the fullscreen version. A desktop height resolution greater than 1024 is advised (e.g. 1920x1080), but if not, this should rescale automatically to fit (except in fullscreen mode).
 * (Update 2019-04-29) a web version is now available! Note: it is slightly more pixelated when rotating, for performances reasons. Loading can take a moment, be patient. If your Internet browser window is smaller than the needed resolution (1024x1024 pixels), the key Ctrl+Minus on most browsers scales down the image. So far it has been tested with success on Windows/Linux computers, was kinda working on a tablet after a while, but I could not pass the loading screen on smartphone, and anyway you need a keyboard to play.

Made with Golang+Ebiten for the programming part, and MagicaVoxel+Krita for the graphics part.

entries.title: Stargem
entries.description:
Stargem is an action platformer where you get bullets by getting hit by other bullets. Collect as many blue gems as possible!

### How to play

This game is only available on 64 bit Windows. Download the zip file in the links below, extract, and play!


### Screenshots

![screenshot1.png](///raw/23a/32/z/220d8.png)

![screenshot2.png](///raw/23a/32/z/220db.png)

### Info

Made using C++/OpenGL/OpenAL with GLFW. The source code is available at the links below. 

This was my very first game jam, so I didn't really know what to expect and how I should do things. In the end, I am quite happy with the result, even though I would have liked to polish the game some more. Especially the UI elements, which I made during the last ~1 hour, could use some (a lot of) polishing. 

Also, some more balancing time could have been nice. The game is on the difficult side. Also, getting the exploding bullets is a bit to hard to actually be useful.

### Post-deadline changes:

- Very small UI bugfix
- This description text
- Added some missing DLLs

entries.title: Blood Bot
entries.description:
**Description:**

In this game you are a blood hunting machine. Collect as much blood as possible from the last humans of earth. When the humans hit you you will lose blood, but shooting them will cost you blood as well. 

During the game enemies will spawn faster and become stronger, luckily your reload rate goes down as well. How long can you survive?


**Controls:** 
- W, A, S, D to move
- Left click for a normal attack.
- Right click for a special attack

**Tips:**
- When in a tight spot you can use your special attack
- Pick up blood before it disappears into the ground. Without blood you die.

Have fun playing!! :smile: And let met know your score in the comments if you want. 


**Developers notes:**

Unfortunately I was only able to work on this game alone and for just two days. Due to a national holiday in the Netherlands I really wanted to join. So this is just a first entry. Hopefully I will be able to deliver more next Ludum Dare.

I had a lot of fun with the theme and when I began the game I envisioned some sort of upgrade shop. But now life is currency in the sense that you have to pay for every shot you make.


**Applications used:**

Couldn't have made the sound effects without sfxr.
 
As engine I've used Godot and the art has been made in Krita.

Music has been generated on Abundant music: https://pernyblom.github.io/abundant-music/index.html

entries.title: Blood Cards
entries.description:
In Blood Cards you fight monster by playing cards that drain your health. 
Basic Steps: 
1. Start your turn by clicking on the deck to be dealt your cards. 
2. Drag cards over enemies to play them. 
3. Press the next arrow to end your turn. 
Defense (or completely negates) incoming damage. 

There are three ways to regain health: 
1. At the end of your turn you gain +1 health (this can be upgraded).
2.  Blocking all incoming damage is likely to drop some health
3. Killing an enemy gives you health. 

There are three classes of enemies: 
1, Brutes are basic guys who on average has higher attack than other classes, 
2. Healers can heal their allies on their turn
3. Tanks have a lot of health but generally low attack

Moving the slider around increases a multiplier that increases the damage and health cost to play defensive and offensive cards. This is useful because of how the game gets harder as it goes on, but it is ultimately not a great mechanic that it would replace with a full upgrade system if I had time. 

Okay, I think that's all. Hope you enjoy it (at least somewhat) and sorry for the lack of music, poor art, and problematic difficultly curve.

entries.title: What's your lifetime value?
entries.description:
Modern life is hard and complicated ‚Äì so many options, so little time! Invest your lifetime in the right choices and beat the highscore by leading the most successful life. You do so by choosing actions at every age that make you succeed in different areas:  Start as a toddler facing the existential question whether to eat your vegetables or not, daydream as a child, survive puberty with the aid of emo music and have a career without burnout. Every age brings in new needs and desires, and you cannot fulfill them all - or can you?
![cover-image-03.png](///raw/03d/22/z/2367c.png)
![Bildschirmfoto 2019-04-30 um 03.48.23.png](///raw/03d/22/z/235ed.png)
![Bildschirmfoto 2019-04-30 um 03.54.05.png](///raw/03d/22/z/23628.png)

# How to Play

1. Select a player character

2. You will automatically go through the ages of toddler, child, teen, adult and senior. Your current age is displayed on the left. 

3. The bars to the right mark your lifegoals and needs. You start with three basic needs, but while you're aging up, new desires will show up.

4. Score points on lifetime goals with the use of actions. Each action will cost you a portion of your lifetime and may have various positive and negative effects on multiple goals, so choose them carefully!

5. Try to score as high as possible on the green goals, but don't let the orange ones drop to low! Once one of them reaches zero, you die and the round is over.

# Controls:

## mouse: 
select and confirm action 
## Left and right arrow keys: 
switch between the main screen an the action menu

entries.title: Stilts
entries.description:
**NOTE: If the menu in the HTML Build doesn't work, try to use a different browser, and if that still doesn't work, download the windows build.**

After this LD's difficult theme, this is all I could come up with after spending more than a third of the jam brainstorming. This did not turn out very well, so let me try to explain. You are supposed to be a person who is obsessed with materialism and trends, who can either be with his family, or gaining stuff, (hats and stilts), while completely neglecting his family. His life is all about money, His life is money: (theme?). The stilts were originally supposed to represent how going down the path of trying to make yourself higher than everyone else will only make you fall harder later, but I didn't have the time to do that, so this is what I ended up with.![Stilts1.png](///raw/e55/32/z/24ac3.png)

entries.title: SHROUD (Synthetic Human, Radiation OUtput Determined)
entries.description:
![l4EESG2.png](///raw/870/f1/z/23726.png)


~~**Released version 0.1.01, 0.1.02, 0.1.03, 0.1.04, 0.1.05.......(lost the count). All of the gamebreaking bugs have been fixed. Nothing has been added or removed, but keep in mind that what you're playing is not the original 1.0 version. Thanks**~~

We decided to continue developing the game, so we now have a post-jam version (it's the WebGL one). You can find the changelog below so you can decide which one to play. 

The windows build has a critical bug in which you can't finish the game if you're not careful enough. It's explained in detail later.

If you're playing the post jam version [click here](https://github.com/thevinter/S.H.R.O.U.D/blob/master/README.md) and don't bother reading the LD page

Latest Version: 0.1.12 [[Changelog]](https://github.com/thevinter/S.H.R.O.U.D/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)

**It'd be awesome if you could take a second to answer our [survey](https://www.strawpoll.me/17916274/r) after playing the game, thanks!**

[If you are curious and want to learn more about the bugs of the game please click here](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/44/shroud-synthetic-human-radiation-output-determined/bugs-and-features-a-semi-post-mortem)

(You can still play the original version by downloading the windows build)

If you're playing the Jam version, read below. The text has been saved for posterity.

**CRITICAL ERROR IN THE JAM VERSION: Whenever you speak to the eye-robot never walk away from him, always use [Space] to close his dialogue. Not doing so will prevent you from finishing the game.**

*"It's been twelve years since that day.
But i still remember it as if it was yesterday.
Fire, screams, explosions and blood.*

*I've crossed mountains, woods and rivers, but now i'm close.
This RV will be my last refuge, tonight i'll sleep in a bed.
New Nuric, the Promised Land, is only a few hours away."*

SHROUD is a survival game where you can exchange body parts with robots for food and weapons. Doing so will make the game harder, but will give you money to buy food and resources. Will you survive?

- WASD to move
- Space to interact
- E to buy
- Left/Right arrow to shoot
- P to restart the level
- Click on the items in the UI to use them
- Shift to sprint (consumes more food) [Only in the post jam version]

You can sleep in your RV to recover health, but doing so will deplete thirst and hunger. It will also reset the vendors and respawn the items.

Use healthpacks to heal, radaways to get rid of radiations and food and water to survive.

Be careful for indicators. There's no audio cue so if you don't pay attention you'll die pretty often.

**Don't sell your leg if you don't want a hardcore experience :P**


Developed in 3 days for LD44

* Coding: Nikita Brancatisano (thevinter)
* Art: Miriam Oajdea (Polda)
* Music: Nikita Brancatisano (thevinter)
* Testing and Balancing: Matteo Balestra (Churippu) and Christian Taccon (Chris)

entries.title: Salvage
entries.description:
Your whole life has been spent salvaging off a small harbor. You spend every day pulling in junk and selling it for cash. You have lived a good life, every aspect of which was dictated by the currents of the seas. And then it arrived. A creature the likes of which you had never seen before. You quickly decided to get out of town and never return, but the timing could not have been worse. With an empty bank account, there is no way you can afford to leave. Explore the nearby ocean and use your trusty winch to haul in enough to get out. But be careful, the monster will be here soon.

![SS1.png](///raw/299/9/z/22e0e.png)

* Remember, "treasure" found further out to sea or deep into the depths will be worth more, so don't play it too safe near the harbor.
* You may spend your hard-earned cash on upgrades, but make sure you don't spend all of it. You need to deposit enough into the bank to get out safely.
* Don't forget to update your light when given the option, it is dark down there.
* Use the patented Claw Cam to grab items too deep for you to see otherwise.
* Watch out for sharks!


![SS2.png](///raw/299/9/z/22e11.png)![SS4.png](///raw/299/9/z/22e14.png)

Desert: 90s

entries.title: Rogue Money
entries.description:

Rogue Money is a rogue-like action game where you shoot coins at enemies to get a larger amount of money. Some enemies have resistance against low price coins so you need to carefully choose which coin to use. When you run out of money, the game is over.

Controls and rules:

- Use the arrow keys to move.
- Press X to shoot a coin.
- Enemies drop money when you shoot them.
- You can carry 10 coins at a time.
- Beating stronger enemies requires higher prices.
- Pay attention to the remaining time. When the time is up, the Tax Collector Big Hand (TCBH) starts chasing you:)

We are a team of three Japanese who are working together in a game company. As a job, we make large-scale games in a large team, but we are lately interested  in making a small game in a small team so we got together in a holiday and made this game for Ludum Dare. We hope you will enjoy the game!

entries.title: No Life No Game
entries.description:
## About the game:

We are three students of media and computer science. This is our first attempt in creating a pixel-art game, it was exhausting but fun. Unfortunately we didn't manage to get everything we wanted into the game due to some misscalculations at the start. But lesson learned!

entries.title: Powerup Puncher
entries.description:
After having to scrap all code once (let's just say I'm not on good terms with the Rust language right now...)
and spending the larger part of Saturday trying to get the skeleton animation converter to work... Here it is..
What amounts to an entire weekend of frustrations and some fun ;-)

**Powerup Puncher!**
![ld44scr2.jpg](///raw/ab7/z/213a0.jpg)
A 2d fighting game where you have the option to choose a bunch of powerups before the battle begins.
The powerups cost health so the player will start with less than full health but with some handy powers :-)
Every powerup can only be used once during a battle and only for a limited time.


The game balance is terribly off and the player contact area needs severe work,,,
But I think the main idea is ok and could be expanded on quite a lot.
Even though I'm really not pleased with the result I decided to publish it anyway...
Lessons learnt and all that...

 
**Controls**

Action:	Joystick/Keyboard

Jump:Up 	/ W

Crouch:Down	/ S

Switch Direction:LB 	/ Z

Move left/right:	L/R	/ A/D

Punch:A	/ E

Kick:X	/ F

Block:B	/ C

Activate power move:RB	/SPACE


**Links:**
Just the game:
http://www.cogitarecomputing.com/poweruppuncher/powerup.exe

The game packaged with OpenAL:
http://www.cogitarecomputing.com/poweruppuncher/powerup.zip

A video of me almost completing the first couple of levels:
https://youtu.be/qXDPeFkJ-Zo

__The final set of tools used in making this game are:__

**Coding:**Visual Studio 2017 (C++ for the game and C# for the Milkeshape skeleton parser)., SFML, Notepad++

**Graphics:**Milkshape 3D, Wings, Blender, Gimp

**Sound FX/Music:**sfxr,LMMS

**If it doesn't work on your computer you might need one of these:**
OpenAL
Visual Studio 2017 C++ redist 


**2019-04-29 changelog:***  Tiny bugfix of the character collision, from the original version.

The original is still available at, if you want a buggier experience ;-)  
 http://www.cogitarecomputing.com/poweruppuncher/powerup_old.exe

entries.title: Hide‚Äôn‚Äôrun
entries.description:
An HTML5 puzzle/defense game where you have to trade your time (= your life) in order to slow the enemies down and win.

** *Bug fixes (made after the 48 hours)* **

- I fixed a bug where you could add **WIN** to the terrain and it gave an easy way to cheat. This bug fix does not affect the gameplay as long as you were not explicitly trying to cheat.
- I added the level number on the top left of the screen. This does not affect the gameplay either, it simply makes it easier to know what the current level is.
- I changed a key binding from Enter to Tab. It makes much more sense to use the Tab key, the only reason why it was the Enter key before is because Tab was interacting weirdly with the browser, but now I figured out how to make it work.
- I changed the key binding Ctrl+arrows to Shift+arrows, as Ctrl+arrows seems to cause problems on some computers/web browsers.


![Screenshot1.png](///raw/baf/22/z/2192b.png)

![Screenshot2.png](///raw/baf/22/z/21929.png)

entries.title: Superhero Movie Universe Simulator
entries.description:
(Web game best played on **smartphones** or desktop.)

Do you enjoy Superhero Movie Universes? Only those which do not get too **dramatic**? Or only those which are not **too quippy**?

Try your hand at producing your **very own Superhero Movie Univers**e! You decide *who* fights *which villain* and *with whom*. The most important part is to **balance the different customer‚Äôs needs**. Make the movies too close to the comic books, and you lose mass appeal. Make them too movie-esque and you lose the biggest fans.


Are your movies getting too happy? **Kill off beloved characters** to get the drama value back up. However, then you cannot use them in future movies... 

Try to produce as many movies as possible, or set out to fulfill specific achievements like setting up the iconic fight between ‚ÄúMashed Potato‚Äù and his nemesis ‚ÄúDark Potato‚Äù. Watch out that you don't exhaust your actors with too much work, or neglect some characters entirely.

Best played in portrait, on touch screen or desktop. If the game is too big, remember you can scale on all browsers with CTRL and +/- keys.
![main_screen.png](///raw/4cd/b1/z/21cb8.png)
![frame.png](///raw/4cd/b1/z/23a3e.png)

entries.title: Life's a Dish
entries.description:
![2019-04-29.png](///raw/f35/6/z/22820.png)

# Life's A Dish
---
![2019-04-29 (1).png](///raw/f35/6/z/22822.png)
## Premise

Life's a Dish is a game about cultivating and mutating cultures of bacteria. Some cultures are worth more than others, and one combination is special. It will cure THE ENEMY, a terrible disease. You have it, and you have 30 days to live. You must use the tools in front of you, turn your starting cultures into the perfect antidote. 

Mutate and combine your life, sell it, and repeat.
 
---
![2019-04-29 (7).png](///raw/f35/6/z/2281a.png)
## The Disease

It goes by many names. The Lord's Plague. Silencia. Death. Once infected, most die within weeks. You, one of the final scientists still alive in London, have been tasked with finding a cure. Unfortunately, you're also infected, and your suppliers will not risk their lives to deliver the reagents you need without paying a hefty price. Find the perfect antidote, and you can kill it. But, you only have 30 days before it kills you...

---
![2019-04-29 (9).png](///raw/f35/6/z/22826.png)
## Petri Dishes

Each Petri dish contains a culture, the life that will fund your research, and perhaps, yield the antidote you desperately seek. Petri dishes can be placed on the table (as pictured, or in machines that provide various mutations).

Cultures grow or shrink over time based on their genome, so watch out! They might just die on you. 

---
![2019-04-29 (4).png](///raw/f35/6/z/2282a.png)
## Check-o-Matic

The Check-o-Matic is the first machine you might use, it tells you how close you are to a cure. When a culture has been graded, you can sell it at a higher rate than non-graded. (Unless you are very far away).

---
![2019-04-29 (5).png](///raw/f35/6/z/22816.png)
## Reagents

There are eight (8) reagents that you can purchase. They go into the Genimagic (Below). Simply drag from the top to get a unit of the substance. They modify the genome in each culture. But sometimes they can backfire.

### Descriptions
- Sulfur: Hot & Smelly (20 coin)
- Ice: Very Cold (20 coin)
- Lead: Makes you mad! (30 coin)
- Lithium: Soothing (40 coin)
- Sugar: Zoom Zoom! (40 coin)
- Lard: and how! (40 coin)
- Radium: Magnetic (40 coin)
- Iodine: Stabilizer (80 coin)

---
![2019-04-29 (11).png](///raw/f35/6/z/2285c.png)
## Genimagic

The Genimagic takes in Reagents and applies them to an inserted Culture. It applies them one at a time, and you can hit EJECT at any time to stop, but you can't go back. Each time you apply a reagent the genome is modified and mutated, so there is a chance that your effects are undone. (Part of the genome controls how often this happens).

The Genimagic shows the likelyhood of mutation (and perhaps even killing the Culture, so don't let that get too high).

---
![2019-04-29 (3).png](///raw/f35/6/z/22815.png)
## Amalgamizer

The Amalgamizer has three slots. Two are for cultures, the other is for empty Petri Dishes. You can put one or two cultures in the top, and it will combine them in the second by taking half. For example say that you had a Red culture in the top left, and a blue culture in the top right: you can expect to get a purple culture. If you only put one culture in, it just moves half of the culture to the empty dish.

However, the newly created culture is mutated, so like with the Gneimagic it is possible to have unintended consequences.

Be warned. Your initial cultures are quite small - you would be wise not to split them while they're so young.

---
![2019-04-29 (6).png](///raw/f35/6/z/22817.png)
## Coins

You can use coins to buy empty Petri dishes or Reagents. But the only way to make money is by selling you Cultures, and the more like the antidote is, the more valuable it is! (drag your cultures into the pneumatic tube)

---
# Notes

We opted out of the audio category, as we used royalty-free background music.

entries.title: Tensilver [HTML]
entries.description:
![SfPLqaFoAc.gif](///raw/b20/1/z/245ff.gif)
*BWA HAH HA HA HA*
Your life is your currency. 
The ten silver coins you took as payment for betraying your people is proof of that.

WELCOME TO THE NETHER!
You have 10 days to prove your worth as the new Currency Exchange officer for the Nether-realm of Demon Lord Marcrox.

Serve the right amount of Demon Coins to the Nether minions and your fallen people now trapped with you. ... make every coin count or die!

![jam_build_0001_H85AND5HMH.png](///raw/b20/1/z/23f82.png)
----------------    HOW TO PLAY:  -------------------

Every day "customers" approach your booth, their life bar represents the amount they are asking for.

Each coin has an individual value:
1  -  5  - 10  - 25  - 50  - 100

LEFT CLICK to grab coins (no need to hold down)

RIGHT CLICK to drop the coins on top of the customer or anywhere outside of your booth.

SPACEBAR to commit and end your turn.

If you get the correct amount the customer leaves and you get cash, if not you take damage. Demon minions will kick you if you take too long.

At the end of each day you can use your cash to purchase Health.
![NPC_Marcrox.gif](///raw/b20/1/z/236fe.gif)

entries.title: Tiacol - A journey through life
entries.description: Time Is A Currency Of Life (Tiacol). I create this game in about 60 hours, working completely alone. Tiacol is a journey through life in a modern world, and the complexities of growing up. It is not meant to be funny, and although it does not have as much content as I would have liked, some players may still find it disturbing.

entries.title: NEOLITE
entries.description:
![HighresScreenshot00000.png](///raw/813/e/z/23a54.png)

## :notepad_spiral: Description

**NEOLITE** is a third person wave based shooter sandbox game.

- This game is gonna be so frustrating, maybe? I dunno:sweat_smile:
- **You have a Neon Gun and a Electro Blade as weapons**
- **You can upgrade them after each wave with your remaining life.**
- **Try and upgrade your weapons to Marvelous, it's gonna be FUN**.
- You gain Life by killing your enemies.
- Has 5 waves of enemies with an additional 6th sandbox mode.
- Made for Ludum Dare 44.‚Äã
- :warning: **This game is not balanced at all.**
- :warning: **No Controller support BTW**
- :warning: **If the game is lagging, reduce the graphics quality using the in-game settings menu.**
- Also if you got some time please checkout all the settings and stuff,I put some serious time into that stuff which I should'nt have done. :sweat_smile:

entries.title: The Iron Syndicate
entries.description:
![work_screen.png](///raw/047/31/z/2404f.png)

# The Iron Syndicate
You toil your life  away each day trying to make just enough money to buy bread.  Is this fair? Will you continue to sell your life away for the profits of your boss?

Good luck comrade!

## Theme
When trying to come up with a good idea for a game with the theme "Life is currency", I immediately thought of labor movements in the industrial era. In the game you are trying to break free from you having to sell your life away to be able to continue living. 

## Controls
You move with the arrow keys or with A & D. The mouse should be used during dialogue to select the answer you want to give. All other actions will be prompted by the game in the upper right corner.

## Last note
While the game does contain some political opinions and events, they do not always reflect my own. I hope everybody can just enjoy the game without being hurt or upset. Have fun playing everybody!

Multicontinental Oabduction Center - X (X, just because X is always cool) a.k.a. MOC-X

![sLogo.png](///raw/877/1/z/2147e.png)

‚ÄãFulfill your dream of being an extraterrestial civilization with only one goal in mind - Abduct as many people as possible!

![20190429153149_1.jpg](///raw/877/1/z/21e3c.jpg)

Control an alien spaceship [WASD] and use your tractor beam (to use it, switch your ship to 'Abduction Mode' first [Tab] ‚Äãand then hold [RMB in Windows ver.]/[Left Shift in HTML ver.]) to 'attract' humans.

At the same time watch out for security turrets shooting rockets at you, if your energy falls to zero, it's game over.


If you can manage to stay alive on Earth for 60 seconds, then you can go back to your space garage and trade caught people for power-ups or just repair your ship.

![20190429153146_1.jpg](///raw/877/1/z/21e3d.jpg)

PS: No audio this time (that's for better I guess). I didn't even bother about it, sorry.

entries.title: Wendy the Witch in "Mind Your Damned Business!"
entries.description:
You are Wendy the Witch, who has been tasked by Beelzebub himself to summon him for world domination. But, this summoning requires the sacrifice of blood...

How to Play:

- Kill enemies by drawing a blood circle around them using left click.
- Drawing a blood circle drains your life, but killing enemies restores it.
- You can slow enemies down and block projectiles with a barrier spell using right click.
- Killing enemies gives you mana. Reach 1000 mana to summon ya boi Satan.     - Clicking on your hut will allow you to purchase upgrades.
- Farms provide a slow supply of extra blood.
- Cauldrons provide a steady supply of mana.
![wendy screenshot.png](///raw/3c1/z/21485.png)- When in a tight spot, the spacebar will kill all enemies on screen at the cost of 25 Blood.

This is my 4th finished Ludum Dare, but the first time doing Compo. I ran out of time before I could do audio, so just treat it as an 'atmospheric experience.' üòâ

Post-Entry Note: If you're having difficulty killing enemies, make sure that your lines are not actually touching them. You must draw the circles *around* the enemies, not through them.

entries.title: BodyHop
entries.description:
*(All these explanations are available in the menus of the game)*

## Background RP

You are a demon wandering on Earth with the ability to overtake bodies and possess them.

Lately, you ended up in the body of a prisoner and are now planning your escape of this boring prison. As you kill enemies, you get stronger and can take control of more powerful bodies.

Hop to other bodies as many times as you want and as frequently as you want, just be careful not to jump into a weak human while you surrounded by shotguns...

**Your goal: kill everyone and get the best score!**

## Controls and rules

### Movements

Use the arrow keys or WASD to move around

### Actions

Left click: uses the current weapon  
Right click: hops you into the body pointed by the cursor

To hop, your score needs to be higher than the targeted enemy. This is indicated by its health switching from yellow to green.


### Screenshots

---

# RISE OF....

# THE VENDING MACHINE !

## You are a vending machine. You give drinks to fighters in a robot combat arena. Those fighter robots are mocking you for your lack of combat skills. IT IS TIME TO FIGHT BACK ! You have been... hacked. And now, you want to fight. You CAN fight. Show them how powerful you are ! Throw coins and drinks on those robots to show who's the boss. OBLITERATE THEM !

Use the **ZQSD / WASD** on your keyboard to move, **Space** to jump, **T** to taunt, **Left Click** to throw coins (costs you money) and **Right Click** to throw a can or bottle (depends of your vending machine firmware configuration).

Your life is your money. You can throw coins, but you'll then loose some life. You can upgrade your machine, but you'll then loose some life too. So choose wisely !

## BE STRONG. BE FAST. THRIVE. SUCCEED.
# HYDRATE THOSE ROBOTS !

entries.title: Death's Favourite Marble
entries.description:
You were unlucky enough to die right after Death dropped their favourite marble down a drain. It's hard to tell, but you think they were sulking. Now your soul is trapped in a marble and you are cursed to keep them entertained for eternity. You try not to think about what will happen if you fail. There's a few stray souls around, perhaps if you collect enough of them you can strike a deal?

entries.title: Lifestock
entries.description:
Get into the lucrative business of trading dots - I mean the cynical life haggling scene.

As a keeper of tiny organisms your job is to prune the herd and give them optimal living conditions.
During the day the lifeforms go about their daily business procreating, but at night you can harvest and sell the specimens. Click on the ones you want to sell, you can see where organisms will die and new ones appear depending on your selections.
The aim of the game is to make as much GLC (Gross Life Currency) as possible.
Oh and theres carnivorous entities as well, maybe they can be useful in your scheme - but most likely not.

![Lifestock_small.png](///raw/2b2/22/z/21840.png)

I didn't have time to add instructions or a tutorial, so here is an overview:

Green circles represent living organisms. Organisms will die and spawn according to the following rules:
An empty (red) circle will spawn a new organism if it has exactly 3 living (green) neighbours.
A living (green) circle will survive to the next round if it has 2 or 3 living neighbours.
In all other cases living circles will die and turn red.

The game is divided into 3 day cycles and 3 night cycles. During the day cycles the simulation will run on it's own. During the night cycles the player can sell any organisms. Select a green circle to see what the effect will be if you sell it.
The aim of the game is to keep the colony alive for as long as possible, and also to sell of as many organisms as possible. The final score will be the amount of organisms you have sold.

The predators may intervene in your plans in unexpected ways, but add to your total earnings. (Also they are kind of buggy and unfinished) ;)

The game is based on a mathematical simulation / algorithm called Game of Life:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Game_of_Life

entries.title: PathOfForest
entries.description:
Another wonderful day on this glade, in peace and tranquility, in the end, you say this and any other day. You - a young but ambitious forest. There is no doubt that after a couple of hundred years you will be full of trees, treasures, dugout trolls and other important things inherent in the ancient woods, one day it will even be difficult to distinguish in what tree this brazen squirrels wanted to make a nest ... But what is it?   
     Some kind of annoying noise, namely from some suspicious creatures moving in your direction and seemingly have got not the best intentions.   
Hmm,  this won't be a problem, will it?   

=======================


Protected yourself(your precious trees) from these stupid Bull-Dozers that will attack you from time to time. You can create ent from random tree, but can't control them directly. Instead use flags system(like majesty) for orders.  
Win - survived after all waves(1 tree is alive minimum)  
Lose - losing all tree(Ents dont counting)  

hotkeys:  
Q - create ent-guardian(attack enemies)  
W - create ent-druid(gardener of new trees)  
A - put attack flag (to enemy)  
S - put plant flag (to ground)

https://littlevalhalla.itch.io/necroblood

# Maillist for future updates
Do you want to receive an E-mail notification when we release new versions outside the Ludum Dare?
Subscribe it on this link: https://forms.gle/A92VnWk5M3aEGAd17

# How it works

## Necromancer's Blood
The same HP that commands when you lose is the currency for buying minions.

## Characters

### Minions
#### Zombie
You need to have a grave on the floor, when it hits someone that is about to die, this someone have 50% of chances of becoming a zombie. Zombies lose HP over time.

Attack type: Surrounding area.

Swarm Debuff: Yes

#### Vampire
Fast, but fragile. A Vampire can regen his HP by attacking, doing it will regen a little bit of the necromancer's Blood.

Attack type: Single

Swarm Debuff: No (Single Target)

#### Skeleton
Slow, Weak and fragile. But cheap! When a Skeleton is not engaged in a battle, it returns to his spawnpoint.

Attack Type: Surrounding area.

Swarm Debuff: Yes

### Heroes
#### Thief
Fast and it can get closer to his target before being detected.

Attack Type: Surrounding area.

Swarm Debuff: Yes

#### Warrior
Strong, Though and ignores SwarmDebuff. He is a nightmare. (And yes, it will get a little nerfed in the future)

Attack Type: Surrounding area.

Swarm Debuff: No (Imune to SwarmDebuff)

*Swarm Debuff divides your damage by the amount of enemies hit by the attack.

# Tricks and Tips
- Warriors deal a lot of damage to a swarm but takes a lot of time to deal it again, use a cheap unit to trigger the attack and then use all your firepower against it.
- You can use skeletons to lure your Enemies together near some graves, then raise some zombies while attacking with your other unities.


I Hope you have lots of fun playing this game.



# Patch notes
## Patch 1.1.1

### Bug fixing:
- HUD:
	- Fixed a bug that didn't affected the visibility of the amount of Blood your necromancer still have; (Numeric representation)
	- Fixed the minimum blood value to 0; (No impact in gameplay, just not to show -5 Blood on the HUD when you died but didn't shown the game over yet)

- Animation:
	- Fixed a bug that didn't triggered the summoning animation on the necromancer;
	- Fixed most of the bugs that glitched the moving animation. (as detecting and ignoring speed 0 that werent really 0);
	- Fixed a bug that when the mage died he did the dying thief animation.
	- Fixed a bug that prevented the Zombie's attack animation to occur. (He attacked but didn't shown it)
- Battle:
	- Fixed an issue that allowed the characters to still attack the dead ones (And for vampires, that meant free blood).
	- Fixed a bug that allowed the vampires to pursue enemies that didn't had the chance of coming inside the battlefield.

### Balancing:
- Necromancer:
	- Reduced health regen.
- Heroes:
	- Warrior:
		- Nerfed damage (Now he is weaker against single enemies and stronger against hordes, as it was intended);
		- Nerfed the HP;
		- Nerfed Agility (Now he is even slower).
	- Thief:
		- Nerfed damage;
		- Buffed Agility (He moves and attacks faster);
		- Nerfed the HP.
		- Reduced blood award for killing it.
- Summons:
	- Skeleton:
		- Nerfed HP (He was too resilient for a cheap unit);
		- Nerfed Agility;
		- Nerfed Base Attack;
		- He is 25% cheaper (Costed 2Blood now costs 1.5 Blood)
		- Reduced it's cost. (From 3 to 2.5)
	- Vampire: (Now he is usable)
		- Nerfed HP;
		- Buffed Blood drainage (from 10% to 20%);
		- Buffed Blood drain that recovers the Necromancers; (From 5% to Half he get's for himself: 10%)
		- Buffed his agility. (He moves really quickly and attacks quicker as well)
	- Zombie:
		- Increased the amount of Hp it recovers when he kills an enemy;
		- Increased the amount of HP it has;
		- Nerfed his attack damage.
- Graves:
	- The graves break up 20% faster;
- Waves:
	- The wave generator now creates waves with similar chances for all the enemies.
	- Fixed a bug that made the first wave being always the same.
	- Balanced the time in between the waves.
- General:
	- All Fighting times are a little quicker.


## Patch 1.1.0

### Bugfixes:

- Necromancer‚Äôs maximum blood is now capped.
- Some engaging on combat issues.

### Balancing:
- Reduced the Necromancer‚Äôs blood regen per time.
- Reduced the amount of life the Zombie regens when it kills someone.
- Reduced the amount of blood awarded for killing foes.
- Balanced Skeleton atributes. (He is weaker and slower now)
- Balanced the amount of blood that the Vampire gives to the Necromancer per hit.

### HUD improovement:
- Added a numerical visualization on the Necromancer‚Äôs blood hud.

entries.title: This Game Blows
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare Game Jam game. 

Use the arrow keys to move the robot around.

Place a Wind Turbine in the wind to gain charge using the Left Mouse Button.

Use the Right Mouse Button to increase the battery capacity.

Wind turbines and battery capacity upgrades each cost 1 unit of charge.

Thank you for playing :)![cover.png](///raw/8da/32/z/21804.png)

entries.title: Gimme Your Heart
entries.description:
![gimmeheart_cartridge.png](///raw/71e/32/z/22202.png)

-The game:

"Gimme Your Heart" is a kind of adventure/ puzzle game where you have to give one of your heart in exchange to progress trough the story. Adorable balloons, fancy snakes...Funny and eccentric characters awaits through your short adventure! 
Anyway It was very fun creating this!

-First experience:

It was my first time making a game. I know nothing about programming, I just like to do pixel art and create characters and stories. Not having basics or time is hard, but is very challenging.

-Made with...:

The game was made in GB Studio, I just discovered the program a few days ago together with tiled... It is easy but of course has a lot of limits. It was very easy to built since GB Studio supports web. You will also be able to play It on your smartphone!


-Bugs:

GB Studio has different bugs. In this game specially It has one in the big map with the house and the last map, the dialogue box appears corrupted and I have no idea why.

-------------------------------------


-Credits:

Special thanks to  CornetTheory for the music,Caranha for helping me out, Pico Pico Cafe and Joseph for letting me work there, Nomi for organizing, the other people at the cafe.

entries.title: Furtual Rabbit: a defurred income game
entries.description:
This game is a virtual Angora Rabbit simulator. Its' life value is in its fur. By grooming, feeding, cleaning, and exercising your rabbit, you can maximize its fur output, sell it, and purchase much needed food, veggies, and treats. Not every rabbit lives forever, and poorly managed rabbits die even sooner.

Changelog: Bug fixes and some support for iOS tablets. Added a selectable speed control. Fixed bug mentioned by user where player can move when dead. Added a market label to show what your wool is currently worth on the market place (which slightly varies).

![screenshot](///raw/598/2/z/247c4.png)

entries.title: Fancy Flying
entries.description:
In the 1960's the Swedish defense strategy was to fly as low as possible to avoid enemy radar and then fire anti-ship missiles on the invasion fleet. You are the pilot of a Viggen 37 attack aircraft on a training mission. The government has invested a lot of currency in you so you better not crash into trees, mountains, radio towers, lakes, buildings, or swedish steel birds that will destroy your aircraft. Remember there are no points for second place, but you will get points the lower to the ground you fly (below 30 m).

![fancy-flying-1.png](///raw/296/z/21157.png)

entries.title: Super I-Egg
entries.description:
The Game is a platformer where you trade Life for Abilitys at the beginning. Chose wiseley!

Controls (Controller should also be supported):

Trade abilitys: Mouseclick

W-D or Left-right: Move

Space: Jump

Return: Fire
 

It¬¥s only one Level, but it is long and really (really, really) tough. Actually I wonder if somebody will take the time to beat it (yes, it is beatable) - if yes, please post it (I will trade a "like" for it ;-))

I didn¬¥t get to "restart" or "game exit" (Alt F4).


SPOILER ALERT:

In case you wonder what to take at the beginning, it turned out that there are some no brainer:

- Additional Savepoints

- Camera to left

- Single fire

Recommended:

- Double Jump

- Fire proof

entries.title: Criminal Street
entries.description:
**Your lives are just numbers to me.** - You, playing this.

You are a bounty hunter who trades in wanted criminals for money. Can you identify the perps in a sea of people? Don't let them get away!

![Screen Shot 2019-04-30 at 11.58.53 am.png](///raw/67e/b/z/23766.png)

**Controls**

Simply drag and drop the criminals onto the WANTED panel. DON'T falsely imprison people!

Check for five features:
- Hair
- Eyes / Glasses / Eye-patches / Scar
- Nose
- Mouth / Facial Hair
- Ear

**Powers**

There are four powers that will help you:
- The Freeze: Freeze everyone in time for 5 seconds.
- The Spotter: Immediately points out a criminal if they are in the crowd.
- The Snap: Vanish half the people in the crowd who are not criminals (Requires the strongest will. And $5000.)
- The Extra Life: duh

*Helpful tip for those who are willing to read this far: The criminals on the wanted list only appear AFTER the bounty has been put out on their heads.*

**Credits**
- Game Design, Code, Art, and Music: me
- SFX: freesound.org

I missed the compo deadline for Endgame. Worth it.

entries.title: Town of Currency
entries.description:
Your home town Currency has been overrun by danged extra terrestrials! Grab your shotgun and protect your way of life.

## :gun: Description

Town of Currency is a fast-paced shooter (that starts out slowly) where you face an endless onslaught of aliens. Make sure to get a score of at least 100 to see the outhouse surprise.

:mouse_three_button: Controls: Mouse to shoot and aim, WASD or arrow keys to move around. :keyboard:

![shoot.gif](///raw/d50/2/z/2237d.gif)

## :clipboard: Leaderboard

The leaderboard, kindly hosted by Game Jolt, can be found here: https://gamejolt.com/games/town_of_currency/410953/scores/417265/best

Please keep it family friendly, or we will have to remove your scores or shut down the feature altogether.

## :bug: Known issues

* Ground tiles can sometimes flicker on systems with Nvidia graphic cards.

## :alien: Credits

Created by two programmers during 72 hours, that busily tried to scramble together some acceptable art.

[Check out the link to the music, featuring a bonus track not available in game!](https://soundcloud.com/worai-col/fore-yare-gahn)

entries.title: APIS
entries.description:
In APIS, you control a swarm of bees. Gather nectar, care for your brood, defend against attackers. Gather enough nectar and you can bring forth the Imperatrix Apis, the Bee Empress.

![b.png](///raw/e08/z/22397.png)

Controls

* Click on a flower to send a bee to harvest nectar.
* Click on an enemy to send a bee to sting it.
* First Button: Make new bee (4 nectar)
* Second Button: Relocate hive (each bee can only carry one nectar, so surplus nectar will be discarded)
* Third Button: Bring forth the Imperatrix Apis (100 nectar)

## Team

![BEEEE_smaller.jpg](///raw/e08/z/21efe.jpg)

* Kathryn Criston (Music)
* David Stark (Graphics, SFX)
* Manuel Mumenthaler (Programming)

entries.title: Reach Together
entries.description:
Synopsis:
Your little group is on the road to reach a better place to live.
You stop for the first time, the battery of your cars are almost empty...


How to play:
Point and click on a character or a button.

You have two humans and four robots in your team.
If you lack of resources you can ask one to leave (or kill it), in order to lower daily needs.
Humans need food that you can harvest and robot need electricity witch is product every day.

Each time you make an action you team work a full day, and they consume resources.
If some how there is no more food for two one of the human will leave/die.


My Story: 
After 24h I trash my game and restart over so this submission is quiet simple.

entries.title: Space Rabbit
entries.description:
Space Rabbit is A 2D SHooter game in space.
The player(who is a rabbit) is on the moon and then finds enemies that should be killed.

Instructions:
-Use wasd or arrow keys to move the player.
-Left mouse button to shoot enemies.
-Click "E" to open or close pause menu.

And I hope you enjoy my game.![Screenshot (5).png](///raw/175/2/z/20f04.png)![Screenshot (6).png](///raw/175/2/z/20f05.png)![Screenshot (7).png](///raw/175/2/z/20f06.png)

entries.title: Deathless World
entries.description:
A multiplayer dystopian simulator where your citizen's lives are currency.![deathless_world_header.png](///raw/af9/a/z/20dbc.png)
In this game, you play as one of the 9 countries that are part of the Global World Government (GWG for short)
It has been decided that dying is illegal, therefore whenever someone dies you can right-click to fine them heavily.
Your citizen's lives are currency, but as they stay alive they will ask for social benefits.

You have many ways of dealing with this phenomenom, one of which is to send your citizens to other player's countries.
If you feel like it, you can also form alliances with the others or grief them.

Communication is the key!
![stream_gif.gif](///raw/af9/a/z/240f9.gif)

**How to play**
- Left click: place block
- right clik: remove block / fine dead citizen
- Enter: chat with others
- up/down arrow keys: move screen up/down (you can also move your mouse towards the border of the screen)

entries.title: ThoseBloodyGoblins
entries.description:
Hello!

This is my first ludum dare :) 

First game I made in 6-7 years and first one done in Godot.

Made a game where you try to survive some nasty goblins in the woods. The goal is to get the highest score by killing goblins and destroying their nests.

When you level up you can either regenerate your health or upgrade, but the upgrade comes with a cost!
(If your health low you will be healed automatically)

You can play on Windows, Linux and Mac, there is also a link to the source.

As this was my first time, I know there are mistakes but I learned a lot.
Unfortunately I didn't have time to ad a vicotry screen (didnt win while testing :( ).

I'm not the best artist so the graphics are meh, and the sound and animations are almost non-existent :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye: 

Hope you enjoy it, I find it quite challenging, specially when you spawn near a nest.

Controls:
In game:
- movement: arrow keys or wasd
- sword attack: space or left clicking the sword icon
- ranged magic attack: C or I or clicking the purple icon
- force push: X or O or clicking the blue icon
- pause menu: escape key
After level up:
- health regeneration: Z or P
- sword upgrade: V or U
- spell upgrade: C or I
- force push upgrade: X or O
You can also click on the icons.

Tools used:
- Godot engine
- Gimp
- sfxr

A few screenshots:
![Screenshot2.png](///raw/e98/e1/z/21597.png)
![Screenshot3.png](///raw/e98/e1/z/21599.png)
![Screenshot4.png](///raw/e98/e1/z/21c5c.png)

Have fun!

entries.title: Zoltanya, Outdated Robot Fortune Teller
entries.description:
![Zoltanya End Screen.png](///raw/116/31/z/2179c.png)
Zoltanya is a Fortune Teller, a coin operated one, her life is fueled by currency. It's bad enough that after every patron she shuts down, but if she cant keep a constant flow of money, she will be taken out of the arcade!

Keep Zoltanya in her home by hacking other more popular machines and forcing people to play yours!.

Ideal fixes
-Machines are limited and dont fix right now
-More hacking minigames
-Better feadback on health costs
-Better looking characters

entries.title: PayTime
entries.description:
In a country where all companies are controled by the goverment and all your information is processed by them, all your monthly work is paid through one of their PayTime locations. You are a teller in charge of handing out the payment of each employee, but be careful to not underpay them or overpay the!

entries.title: SERVUS BONUS

# SERVUS BONUS.

entries.title: Theseus Capturing
entries.description:
Theseus Capturing is a labyrinth game with Capture the Flag elements.

![screenshotFlag.png](///raw/2ee/7/z/20e74.png)

Find ways through the labyrinth, avoid cruel flying foes, take the flag from the other side and bring it back to your base!

![screenshotMonster.png](///raw/2ee/7/z/20e72.png)

Decide wisely on your powerups and Double-Jump your way through Greek paths before you run out of time in order to help our favorite hero Theseus.

Disclaimer: I know, I know. It's not a labyrinth but a maze. Maze sounds boring though.

entries.title: Pixel Hell
entries.description:
A small game in which you are a demon hunter stranded in hell and you have to escape with the "help" of the devil.
It's a 2D sidescrolling platformer/shooter that gets progressively harder every time you die.

The controls are a bit finicky, but it's the best I could do.

This is my second entry for Ludum Dare and it has been a lot of fun.

Tools I used:
 - Unity 2019.1  https://unity.com/
 - Visual Studio Community 2017  https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/
 - GIMP 2.10.6  https://www.gimp.org/
 - sfxr  http://www.drpetter.se/project_sfxr.html
 - audacity 2.3.0  https://www.audacityteam.org/
 - helm 0.9.0  https://tytel.org/helm/

entries.title: World Trader
entries.description:
A little click Arcade Game Prototype based on only one black and white pixelated world map.

The base engine is done, but the game play is still rather limited. My time was limited to about 12 hours due to studies. But I had a lot of fun programming this little game engine.

The whole game only uses the world Image and a button and bar texture. All colouring of the Textures and map Areas is calculated at runtime.

Gameplay:
Make earth survive as long as possible by making the right decisions (and having some luck) 
Drag with the mouse to move on the map.
Click to select an area.
Areas with pending Decisions are marked: if you wait to long the decision will be made for you.
Click on the question and all options will show up.

You score as long as there are still humans on the world.

the Game was programmed in Kotlin using LibGdx as framework.

one button texture was not created by me (CC0) (due to lack of time) i there fore disable the rating for Graphics.

![Screenshot from 2019-04-29 02-30-09.png](///raw/099/21/z/21679.png)

![Screenshot from 2019-04-29 02-29-14.png](///raw/099/21/z/2167d.png)

entries.title: Elthus
entries.description:
Dive deeper and deeper into The Caves of Elthus to replenish your supply. But be careful, the farther you delve, the more dangerous it gets.

**(Fullscreen Recommended)**

I recommend playing around with the grappling hook. After a little practice you can make a lot of different movements. The map is randomly and procedural generated, so each play through is different. As you dive down, the difficult increases.

Post your highest score in the comments! I've hit 2000.

**Controls**  
Move - *WASD & Mouse*  
Fire - *Left Mouse*  
Throw Grappling Hook - *E*  
Grappling Hook Movement - *W (Repel), A (Left), D (Right), Space (Unhook)*

Some Tips:
- You can run and jump over most hole monsters without taking damage
- Using a combination of 'A' and 'W' or 'D' and 'W' while grappling gives you the most speed
- Movement speed and jump height upgrades help your grappling hook maneuvering
- I think the game is most fun when you bolt down the caves at max speed (probably also better for score)

Feel free to check out a gameplay preview in the video below:

https://youtu.be/UU4XL9tylgI

First time ever touching music and art, and I had a great time with it.
Had a really great with my first Game Jam, can't wait to do another.

entries.title: Necroxeon
entries.description:
![gifnew.gif](///raw/24d/e1/z/2390a.gif)

# Story

Suddenly you die from a long sword in your chest while being robbed! As you open your eyes you encounter yourself with the underworld god and  he offers you to come back to life but only if you act as a his servant. You accept the offer and obscure powers and a new body are given to you. Your new task is to kill as many people as possible to comply with the underworld god's plans.

A curse is cast upon you to fulfill this task and that's that every second that passes your life will drain out and the only way to regain it is by killing people. After this, you are transported to a temple in the realm of the living where you have no choice other than to kill every villager that is praying there. You kill them all except for a child who returns to the village and warns everyone.

You suddenly hear hundreds people approaching. This is your last stand! Make no mistake! Don't let anyone live!!


![Sco8hX.png](///raw/24d/e1/z/23af1.png)



# How to play

Use WASD to move, Mouse scrollwheel or 1,2,3,4 to select your spell, Left mouse button to cast the spell, and use Right mouse button to make the enemies' bodies turn into spirits that help you.

Spells:

1. Fire spell: Does medium damage to enemies and sets them on fire.

2. Beam spell: Does large damage to enemies, also hurts you, so use it wisely!

3. Life drain: Drains life from bodies to heal you.

4. Spikes: Spikes appear, killing all enemies they touch.

entries.title: Return of the Roguelike
entries.description:
Fight your way through randomly generated dungeon and defeat the Boss.
Sacrifice your life to increase rewards!

#### Changelog:
(30-04-19)
* Fixed a bug where Knight enemies would be stuck in idle animation after death,
* Knight enemy: random weapons spawn chance adjusted: lowered for Katana and Axe, increased for Short Sword,
* Knight enemy: increased defend duration and increased attack cooldown,
* Knight & Slime enemy: greatly increased duration of wind up in attack animation,
* Blood Fountains: now they properly show animation on use,
* Added Blood Fountain that always spawns at the end of level,
* Rebalanced some weapons

entries.title: Reaper Resurrection
entries.description:
![screenC.png](///raw/11f/21/z/23d4c.png)

The souls of the dead have escaped the afterlife-all except for one. The deity of the afterlife makes a deal with a the remaining soul that remains within its domain: become a reaper under him and gather back (at least enough of) the souls that escaped the afterlife, and he'll resurrect the soul, allowing the soul to return back to the life. You are the last soul in the underworld. The deity will grant you the power to take up this mission-at the cost of your very essence of soul-or the escaped souls if you have any on you. Manage your soul and the souls of your enemies in order to complete your task.

... Except that part of the game hasn't been finished yet, so you can't actually win this game. I guess you can just mess around with it still.

**Controls:**

AWSD keys: Movement

Left Mouse Button: Use weapon.

Right Mouse Button + Movement: Dash (if you bought the upgrade).

1-5 Keys: Switch weapons (Can only choose the ones you bought).

After each battle, the black portal leads to the shop while the white one leads to the next battle room.

entries.title: Give and Take
entries.description:
![pic_1.png](///raw/cd1/12/z/224d7.png)

A game about strategizing with money. In the far future, people sell their own organs, to gain money for surviving. You, the surgeon that resells those organs, have only one goal, to earn 10 000 dollars in a spawn of few days, without killing 10 people in total. 

Every person offers you a part of their body. Thanks to their stats (price, illness, possibility of death), you can decide, if accepting their offer is favorable for your goal. But sometimes... day can be ruined by additional conditions (earthquake, no diseases....)

You control your decision by either pressing right arrow key for "yes", and left arrow key for "no". 

![tease_2.png](///raw/cd1/12/z/224f4.png)

All assets were created during gamejam.
Game created by me, Richard Hara≈°√≠m and others amazing artists - Ela Giertlov√° and Daria Serebrianska.
Sometimes the game can be incomprehensible marked as a virus - we are really sorry about that and you should try to avoid that alert if you want to play our game.

Of course, possible bugs are included!

entries.title: Kessler
entries.description:
## Welcome to Kessler

![Kessler0.gif](///raw/c27/91/z/2156d.gif)

"A nearby orbital refinery has suffered a catastrophic incident, launching debris into orbit.  Prevent debris from hitting your mining platform by deploying charges to deflect the debris away.  Charges have a three second fuse: time your shots carefully."

### Controls

**Mouse** to aim; **Space** to launch a charge.  An emergency force field can be activated by hitting **Q**, although doing so will deplete your power!

![Kessler1.gif](///raw/c27/91/z/2156e.gif)

Last year, during LD42, I put together a game with, at the time, rather basic knowledge.  This year, I had a bit more knowledge to draw on.  Ended up throwing far too much at the wall and seeing what would stick - most of the stuff developed for this hasn't made it into the final build (the code is still in there though, if you're curious).  As before, learnt a whole lot though; and very pleased with how quickly I've been able to prototype ideas this time 'round (even if they didn't make it in).  Less pleased with the actual game.  The big lesson from this year?  Time management - specifically, how not to.

Anyway, hope you enjoy.  Not the best interpretation of the theme, gotta say.  Game itself is sorta cosy, though; maybe put the FTL soundtrack on while playing for some ambiance.

**Software:** Unity, Visual Studio, Affinity Designer, Famitracker, Audacity.

entries.title: Rising Dawn - First Blood: It's Brunchtime
entries.description:
![title banner2.png](///raw/75e/z/23331.png)

Dawn is nearly here and your mausoleum is on the other side of town! Stealthily make your way back to your crypt before you turn to dust.

![splashpage1.png](///raw/75e/z/23c46.png)

Hide in alleyways and hypnotize villagers to lure them to their death and replenish your draining life force.

![splashpage2.png](///raw/75e/z/23c47.png)

If a villager sees you acting suspicious, they'll whip out their cross, draining your life force dramatically!

![splashpage4.gif](///raw/75e/z/23c59.gif)

Luckily, you have a trick up your sleeve. Spend your precious life force to transform into a bat, and avoid obstacles such as mirrors and churches. But be careful: bat form quickly depletes your life force, and transformations cause villagers to immediately attack.

### Controls
- A/D: Move left/right
- W/S: Enter/Exit alleyways
- LMB/Ctrl: Hypnotize villagers
- Spacebar: Transform

### Tips and Tricks
- You can only feed on villagers while you are in an alley
- Alleys block the sun: your life force depletes much slower in them
- Alleys hide your transformations from villagers
- To avoid suspicion, only use your powers on lone villagers, or when others are facing away
- Fly over mirrors with lots of people, or hypnotize a lone villager to walk past safely
- Sunlight burns your bat: use it only to avoid mirrors and churches, or to escape attackers

**Rated M** for blasphemy, gore

Created by **MessinaBrothers**
  - AfroAnt - programming
  - Deak - graphics/audio
  - Evil_As_Shiz - graphics/audio

**[Post-LD Version](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wtMIFTQ9GD7toRU0u9NDxJM5PBJcmK_i/view?usp=sharing)** (Do not use for rating!)

- Graphics: Added fade-ins, eyes animation
- Graphics: Improved shadow, mirror, church, mountain, bat smoke, hypnosis symbol, UI
- Gameplay: Hypnosis stops if the player moves too far away from the hypnotized villager
- Nerfed villager heights
- Added a furry friend that scuttles in and out of alleys

entries.title: Leap
entries.description:
![Leap Title Screen.png](///raw/131/21/z/2383f.png)


Infinite Runner with abilities!

Leap and bound your way across valleys and over hills :mountain: as you try to become the best runner! 

Watch out! You must sacrifice your lives :heart: to gain abilities.

How far can you make it as the game continues to speed up :arrow_up: ? 

Write your best time in the comments (my best was **8123** :trophy: )!

# **Controls:**

- Press/Hold SPACE to jump!
- R to restart
- ESC/P to pause
- SHIFT to slo-mo

# **Power Ups:**

- Slo-Mo (slow down time for 1 second)
- Double Jump
- Glide (hold space to glide)
- Platform Squish (make platforms spawn closer together)!

# **Known Bugs:** *IMPORTANT PLEASE READ*

- Occassionally, the first platform will be unreachable, if this happens, just reset the level (Press **'R'**)
- Very very *very* rarely, the upgrade system will cause a crash (this is being worked on)
- Web GL version is *super* loud for some reason (**recommended to turn down volume**)

entries.title: Unbalanced Silly Slot Game
entries.description:
More description to come later, check the Help button for details.  This was built in about 6 hours.  Unfortunately these things always fall on the busy times of the year for more at work :)

Basically you are a slot machine that doesn't want Gamblers to take your coins, but on the flip side you can only gain coins by letting Gamblers play.  Shooting at the gamblers pays them coins, do this to try and sway them from playing, but if they are not swayed, they'll run toward you faster, basically "Hey that slot is paying out!  Let's play!".  Outcomes are completely random based on luck factors of the gamblers.  Payouts are based on the amount of bet made by the player which is in a particular range for each gambler.

Game uploaded for Windows currently & HTML5

![Gambler_AvgJoe.png](///raw/384/z/248dc.png)
The average joe has a rather low luck factor and bets an average amount of cash.  His Jackpot luck is rather low.
![Gambler_OldLady.png](///raw/384/z/248dd.png)
The Old Lady doesn't bet much but she has a high luck factor and higher jackpot luck than the rest.
![Gambler_HighRoller.png](///raw/384/z/248de.png)
The High Roller is a bit of a random guess, his luck isn't super great but he bets big so when he does when it hurts.


General Screenshot
[Imgur](https://i.imgur.com/JtGraXh.png)

Only bugs I know of exist on HTML5 version, there is a weird click at the end of the "Win" sound that doesn't exist in the EXE.  Also some of the graphics and fonts on the HTML5 version seem fuzzy.  None of these should effect game play.  Not aware of any other bugs, let me know if you find any.

Tools:
C# in Unity 2018.3.5f1 (64-bit)

Paint.NET

Bfrx

entries.title: Blood Legacy
entries.description:
![TitleCard.png](///raw/c0b/22/z/2319e.png)

**Introduction:**
A quaint little game, about life in the great open spaces of some random yard somewhere in the world.

You play as a lovely little mosquito, who's only goal in life is to see his own kind succeed where others of his kind have failed. Even to the point of laying his own life on the line.

Word came down the great... mosquito vine, that enemy factions of mosquitos wanted the unique RNA that your Spawning Pool possessed. Incensed, enraged, engorged on the blood of lessers - these mosquitos raid your Spawning Pool!

DEFEND YOURSELF, AND IN DOING SO, DEFEND YOUR BLOOD LEGACY!!!

**Instructions:**
This game is an Isometric Assisted Tower Defense game, containing building, shooting, and upgrade elements.
Building purchases, and upgrade cost your LIFE, which is the LIFE of your Spawning Pool :).
After each boss, you are given the option to spend "RNA" that you have collected to make a persistent and permanent upgrade - these lasts over playthroughs, and forever.

Movement:
* WASD = Directional Input.
* Mouse = Look Direction & Upgrade/Object Interaction.

Actions:
* Mouse 1 (Left Click) = Shoot / Place Defense.
* B Key = Enter/Exit Build Mode, Build mode also display upgrade panels where applicable.
* 1/2/3 Keys = Depending on game mode (building/nonbuilding) this will select Defense Types, or Offense Types.

**Build Mode:**
When in build mode, your mouse will turn to a transparent guide, if this guide is tinted green, it denotes the ability to place the currently selected defense. If red, then you cannot place the defense.

Finally, make sure to have fun, and protect the Spawning Pool :)!

***BE WARNED, YOU CAN ACCIDENTALLY (;)) OVERSPEND YOUR HEALTH :P***

Notes from the developer:
There are bugs in this game, many bugs in fact. Little bugs, medium, and big. You also play as one. I mean Mosquitos. :P.

But, there are a few things I am aware of;
* If you have the build mode on, and hover over an upgrade - jumping will buy it. This can lead to instadeath from speedbuying - so be careful :).

entries.title: Undertaker
entries.description:
![Screenshot1.jpg](///raw/739/3/z/23a67.jpg)

The dead have come back to life! Protect your sacred grounds and return the souls to their grave. Sacrifice souls to purchase upgrades and strengthen yourself.

Undertaker is a high intensity Beat 'em up game with a unique art style and wide variety of moves. The game is made by Beefbone (art & sound) and LuckyFeathers (programming), and is our 4th Ludum Dare entry. 

**WE RECOMMEND USING AN XBOX CONTROLLER**

![Screenshot3.jpg](///raw/739/3/z/23a6a.jpg)

## Controls
(Also explained in game)

- Move: Left analog stick (controller) or WASD (keyboard)
- Jump: A (controller) or space (keyboard)
- Grab: Y (controller) or K (keyboard)
- Basic attack: B (controller) or L (keyboard)

entries.title: Black Friday Shopping
entries.description:
To be in time to buy more useless stuff on Black Friday, the hero is ready to make a deal with a daemon. He will pay with his life and the daemon will turn anything into a deadly weapon. No one dares to stand between the hero and the discounts!

![screenshot.png](///raw/191/f1/z/23672.png)

Changelog:
* v1 - The actual submission. This version lacks proper game balance, there are no sound effects, crit attacks and weapon effects. And there is no tutorial.
* v2 - Post-JAM version with a lot of improvements: fixed game balance, added tutorial, added sounds, fixed tons of bugs in the battle mechanic.

Check out video of the gameplay (v1):

https://youtu.be/jTOGLeETNIo

Art and sounds are from the Unity Store, only the free assets were used.

How to play
===========

You fight versus 1-3 enemies that block you from buying useless stuff with great discount and then you stop at a shop to refill your supplies. In the battle mode you have three buttons: (1) the left one with the crosshair switches between enemies to select the one you want to attack; (2) the middle one with swords attacks enemy with your weapon; (3) the right one opens the inventory.

In the inventory menu you have three pages: weapons, throwables and food. Weapons can have up to three upgrades (represented with skull), with the basic weapon (no skulls) being very weak and each upgrade adding great power to it (power of the demon!) but you have to pay with your life points to get the upgrade! Hover mouse over the item to see its stats (note, weapon effects and critical hit are not ready yet). Clicking on the weapon in the inventory gives you options to upgrade it and equip it.

You can throw throwables into an enemy. Click on the item and choose "Throw" to do that.

Finally, the food is there to recovery your health points.

After each battle you stop in a shop to refill your supplies. You can buy throwables and food for money (you get money for killing enemies), or you can buy new weapons with your health points.

Note
====

WebGL build is very dark in some places and overbright in others (because of "Gamma" color space instead of "Linear" to support more browsers). Please try Windows or OSX executable if you can! 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

entries.title: Boxes Rush

In this game you need to collect coins to complete the game. Total you have 5 minutes and in 5 minutes you need to collect 100 coins to win the game. But there are also some red enemies. Red enemies are stupid in the game so they are hang on the wall some time.

Facts

You can pause the game by clicking ESC button but game will not be paused because this is a bug that i make for you and only for you.

This game is designed and developed by a 14 years old boy in 48 hours.

entries.title: PunCha-Ching Bag
entries.description:
Your intergalactic overlord has scanned the galaxy searching for resources needed to continue the survival of your alien race. He has discovered a tiny, feeble planet called "earth" that seems to be abundant in these resources, and he has decided to send you, one of the most loyal and feared members of his military, to scout the planet. Upon your arrival, you are terrified to realize that the inhabitants of this world also hold this resource in very high regard. Somehow, possibly due to your appearance, it doesn't take long at all for them to become hostile and come after you. Can you defend yourself long enough to gather the resources your people desperately need?

![title.png](///raw/fbe/e1/z/23141.png)

![screenshot.PNG](///raw/fbe/e1/z/23144.png)

This was my second Ludum Dare game (check out Potty Panic!), my third game jam game, and my first solo game.

Controls:
- Move: Arrow Keys/WASD
- Aim: Mouse
- Punch: Left/Right Click
- Throw Coins: Space
- Restart: R
- Exit: Escape

Objectives:
- Beat up the people trying to steal your coins.
- Collect coins to fill your bag and win the game.
- Throw coins to use as a distraction if you find yourself in a pickle.

Credits:
- Programming, Graphics, and Music by Ryan Brenner

There are positive and negative memories, they have varied effects.

There is an end screen, so if you haven't seen it, you probably didn't do an important thing.

entries.title: Sold Soul
entries.description: Caught for treason against your cult, they force you into the worst punishment possible: eternity in the "Endless Dungeons". To fight you must spend your blood on gaining weapons to fight with, in the randomised dungeons!

entries.title: Time Thief
entries.description:
!Warning! 
--------------------------
This game is a controller based game that needs minimum 2 players to play due to the competitive nature of the game. I do have a youtube video of gameplay for those who cannot play directly, hopefully this gives enough insight for rating purposes. Thank you for checking out my game and I hope to hear your feedback!

Gameplay Youtube Link :  https://www.youtube.com/embed/wtlZoTAIZv0

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Time Thief 
---------------------------
Time Thief is a local multiplayer survival game where life is incredibly valuable and fading quickly. Two to four players compete to try and last the longest each round while trying to collect as many life hearts and power-ups as possible. Each power-up contains a special property that can hurt or heal each player. Hearts, drop randomly and add small amounts health to each player, +10 to +20. TNT- creates an explosion that harms multiple players, -35 health. Cardiac arrest steals the health of whoever grabs it, -35. Glue- slows down whoever runs through it. Soul Stealer- Shoots out and whoever gets hit cannot move, damage ranges from -20 to -30 health. Life Boost- Adds a hefty boost of health to whoever grabs it, +25. 

Background 
----------------------------
You and your cartoon friends are trying to survive as long as you can through various stages of a predicted apocalypse. As this world is dying rapidly, so are you, fight your friends to survive by gathering the last bit of life that is leaking from your world. Do your best to survive the wilderness, the ice age, and the fiery desert. Can you be the only one to survive?

![Image1.PNG](///raw/99a/d/z/22fb3.png)

entries.title: New Home. New Tomb
entries.description:
# :arrow_up: UPDATE. V 1.0.2 - Fixing few reported issues

## Fixes
* Sound should not be as loud as in v 1.0.1
* Stucking in Help screen should be fixed

The game is about turning a barren and hostile planet to life. 

A short manual for controlls:

https://github.com/seriar/ld44/blob/master/manual/Manual.pdf

Here is a short video showing controls and some gameplay: 

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Ss_8USem_8ZyI9X5EuRPaOkwKGuPBWZZ


The goal of the game is to survive and turn the planet to new Eden Garden.

But this requires a sacrifice. Resources are scarce. Player must bread the 
engineered CONWA-Y (Cyber-Organic Nutrient Woese Archaea - Y) cells, which are used to sustain the player and allow the growth and further terraforming.

Conway's GoL is the base mechanics. The player starts with a field (a continent) of 20x20, and few cells on it.
Player should sow, grow and harvest the cells on the field. End goal - unlock all continents.

entries.title: Fools Fortune
entries.description:
![thing icon.png](///raw/f54/32/z/213b2.png) ![ld44 12.gif](///raw/f54/32/z/224c9.gif) ![thing icon.png](///raw/f54/32/z/213b6.png)
It is the Dark Ages, and a shuffle of the deck can determine your fate. You are a Medieval noble, and decisions must be made, influenced by the drawing of the Tarot. Will you be a cruel dictator, or a ruler of the people? Will you show honour and bravery, or be scarred by your decisions? Fortune will guide the way.
![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/f54/32/z/21443.gif)

Notes:

- There are only four scenarios coded so **you WILL repeat cards drawn**, I've currently finished a tool to easily add more post jam and will be enforcing that end users will not see duplicates in a run
- I am adding in an indicator as to which skill is being checked against
- The game operates under DND 2nd and 1st edition rules, you want to draw under your skill
- There is no audio, that's why the game has been opted out of that category

![SprTarotCards_10.png](///raw/f54/32/z/24815.png)
![SprTarotCards_strip3.png](///raw/f54/32/z/24814.png)
![SprTarotCards_11.png](///raw/f54/32/z/24816.png)

Additional feedback needed;

- As of right now there will be 154 scenarios that are more or less completely serious, I‚Äôm debating adding a 6th suit of cards that would consist of 5-7 cards (10-14 scenarios) that would all be humorous.
Now the concern with this is would this break the immersion and feel of the game? any feedback on that idea is greatly appreciated!
- Since the jam item cards have been implemented, these cards are given to the player when they choose an option that boosts a stat with specific items being tied to specific stats. Now none of the art has been done for these cards, the thing is that there are essentially only 8 functions these cards will serve with 5 of them being the heirloom cards that will be hard to obtain.
If you were playing this and got the same item every time your strength stat was increased would you be annoyed? Would you want more than one item visual even if it did the exact same thing?

entries.title: Finite Earth
entries.description:
**Finite earth** - build and expand the earth to protect the planet from astroids.
a 360 tower defense ish game!

**Goal**: Build different machines to gain resources and don't let Earth die, and protect it from incoming asteroids by building Laser Turrets. 
**You have 30 seconds before asteroids come!**
Game over when one of the resources reach 0. Be careful!
**There is no ending just try to survive as long as you can until you get bored** :p
Good luck!

**Tips**: 

-Game is paused while in the shop, so you dont gain materials while in shop, and asteroids don't come, so take your time!

-You lose materials passively by time and if asteroids hit earth!

**Known Bugs** (We plan to polish and further develop the game in the future)

-You can buy from the shop even though you don't have enough materials, so before buying look at your materials.

-Asteroids should spawn more and more you play the game, but its all the same!

-Music changes when game goes out of focus.


**Controls**

Left Mouse Button - Place Building

Middle Mouse Button - Cancel Building

Right Mouse Button - Rotate Earth

Art by Kkochmal: https://www.instagram.com/kkochmal893/

This was our first Ludum Dare, I hope you enjoy this quirky little game ^.^

entries.title: Fokusiro
entries.description:
Everyone wants your time, because it's the only valuable currency in todays rushed world. Distractions are everywhere.  Face them and fight honorably to reach the state of flow or end up doomed at the bottom of procrastination food chain.

![logo.png](///raw/1c2/3/z/22bbc.png)

This game is inspired by Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice. While the actual gameplay is wastly different (not to mention producion qualities), I believe that both boil down to simple observation and reaction at the right time as well as planning your actions beforehand based on the situation. I let player be the judge of whether I managed to recreate similarly skill-based, potentially frustrating but ultimately rewarding experience.

![screenshot1.png](///raw/1c2/3/z/2296a.png)

entries.title: Shibbal the Pig
entries.description:
![screenshot2.png](///raw/120/31/z/2393a.png)

# About
**Shibbal the Pig** is a small sidescroller where you play as a living piggy bank with a **ham**mer, battling your way through to the end of each level.

As you move, coins will slowly drop out of Shibbal's body through the slot on his back, and hits make him drop even more. Be careful, as it's game over if you lose them all!
Don't despair though, as there are plenty of coins to be found in bags and on enemies around each level of the Concord Domain.
In addition, getting to the end of a level may give you the chance to upgrade your weapon in exchange for some of your coins.

Good luck!

# Controls
Use the **LEFT** and **RIGHT** arrow keys to *move*, **SPACE** to *jump* up to two times, and **X** to *attack*.

***Requires Java 8 or above***

## Credits
[kpCFTSZ](https://twitter.com/kpCFTSZ) - Programming, Art, Audio  
[Aeron Greva](https://twitter.com/AeronGreva) - Programming, Level Design, Art

### Extra Notes
Audio category is taken off as we wanted to include music but unfortunately ran out of time. Instead you get super-original SFXR sounds, yay I guess? This is the first LD I've done in a few years so the game isn't too flashy.

entries.title: Insurance Billionaire

# INSURANCE BILLIONAIRE

**Insurance Billionaire** is a game about swindling your insurance agent and getting rich without getting yourself killed. Hit a car. Start a chain reaction. See the cash flowing. Don't kill yourself. Your life is the currency here. Your life is the money.

**Features:**
- wreck your car!
- realistic car physics
- some complicated math behind the scenes
- covers of classical music playing as you wreck your car
- saves your highscore!
- drive around a nice town!

**Screenshots:**

![billionaire3.png](///raw/42e/z/22776.png)
![billionaire4.png](///raw/42e/z/22777.png)

entries.title: Protocol: R.W.S.
