entries.title: Dadiator
entries.description:
**Dadiator** is a gladiator fighting game where you earn more money the more fighters you defeat! After each battle you can spend your money on new weapons to make yourself an even stronger killing machine! However you must look after your family, who rely on you to pay for food, heating fuel and medicine. It's game over if you die in battle or your family dies due to hunger/coldness/illness.

## *How To Run*
 - Windows: Just run **Ludum.exe** contained within the binaries folder
 - **Important:** The Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable 2017 is required to run on Windows. It is available [here](https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/vs/older-downloads/) under the Redistributable and Build Tools section.


 - Linux:   Just run **./Ludum** from terminal while in the binaries folder
 - **Important:** [CSFML](https://www.sfml-dev.org/download/csfml/) 2.5 is required to be installed for the Linux version to work. Check your package manager.

## *Controls*

 - W/A/S/D: Move your gladiator
 - Shift: Brings up your shield (If you have one)
 - Left click / Right click: Attack and Special Attack

## *Family Happiness*

This symbol shows how well fed your family are, the more it goes grey the hungrier they get.

![food0-sheet.png](///raw/a5c/11/z/22e2e.png)

This symbol shows the how well heated your family are, if the fire gets low it'll begin to show freezing ice, which really isn't good for their health.
![heat0-sheet.png](///raw/a5c/11/z/22e26.png)

Finally this symbol shows if your family are ill and need medicine, family members are more likely to fall ill if they're cold or hungry.
![Healthy-sheet.png](///raw/a5c/11/z/22e30.png)

## *Weapons*

 - Fists (*default*): Just punch them, either hand. They'll die
   eventually. 
   
 - Sword: Good for stabbing and slashing, does way more
   damage than just punching your opponents. 
 - Spear: Its like a sword on a stick, very good for distant stabbing, even better when you throw it (Right Mouse Button) 
 - Shield: The shield isn't really a weapon, but you will want to know about it. Holding the shift key will bring up your shield (if your character has bought one) you won't negate all damage, but you'll live longer if you utilise it well.

## *Screenshots!*
![Screenshot.jpg](///raw/a5c/11/z/22e43.jpg)
![battle.jpg](///raw/a5c/11/z/22e7a.jpg)
![unknown.png](///raw/a5c/11/z/22ebc.png)
## *Technical Stuff*
Written using CSFML
## *Us*

 - Programming: James Bulman
 - Artist: Cameron Thornton [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shubwub) | [Portfolio Site](https://cameronthornton.dev/)
 - Programming: Matthew Threlfall [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MatttDewitt) | [Blog](https://threlfall.dev)
 - Music: Alex Goldsack [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Goldie643)

![Screenshot (9).png](///raw/68e/c/z/23272.png)
Go with the flow, collect little friends on the way which become your HP. Avoid enemies as the will kill your little buddies. Smash your friends into the 4 upgrade points to expand your influence and make new friends.

High score is the total number of graves from the fallen.
![Screenshot (10).png](///raw/68e/c/z/23277.png)

I had a really busy weekend so this was a late shift Sunday and Monday. This was made in 24 hours really and is a solo effort. I did not get a chance to test it. It seems ok and is simple enough. I am amazed I got anything done.

The world has fallen into chaos and a temporal distortion has brought robert (our friendly robot) into a total mess,

Rogue bots and floating islands, help him survive them ! 

Game for Ludum dare 44.

Game Tips

Enemies usually drop stuff, like batteries, which gives you some energy.

But they can also drop bonuses (spheres), whom will cost you energy so don't abuse them !

Here's the list of each one :

Blue sphere : the shield, will give you a temporary protection from your enemies attacks, will cost 5 of your energy

Yellow sphere : a multiplier, raise temporarily the amount of energy that your enemy drop (can be cumulated), will cost 10 of your energy

RED sphere : hypermod, for a short amount of time, using capacities will cost you NOTHING, so use it to obliterate your enemies ! 
will cost 10 of your energy

entries.title: Exploited
entries.description:
Hey there, it was fun and exhausting but I actually like the game I just made, even with all its non-implemented features and sometimes broken physics.

Edit : After 7h of looking for and trying fixes, I give up the WebGL export, RIP :( but the DL link for the exe is now working x)

![mainScreen.png](///raw/136/22/z/21882.png)
Exploited is the story of Fr√©d√©rique, an old and exhausted worker getting assigned non-sense lifting tasks because he‚Äôs equipped for that ! How much of his life will it cost them ?

A game about choices, boxes, giving away its life at work to buy fancy stuff at home, jumping, using its arms, but mostly doing very annoying tasks with a box in the middle of your FoV that you can merely look around because you have a torticollis ... and broken physics, ofc.
Lift the box, bring it to the green tile, looks simple uh ?

![gifExploited.gif](///raw/136/22/z/24565.gif)


Sadly I lost a lot of time learning of new stuff like mainly on Unity and 3D like its physics, materials, UIs, etc That was more than expected so I couldn't make a soundtrack. First solo game jam is hard, and I think you've heard and seen that playing my game x) But hey, you can do a lot things in that game ! 

Here are a reminder of the controls (also shown at the first level) if it can help you :
![1stScreen.png](///raw/136/22/z/218c1.png)

I've mainly used Unity 3D 2018 3.1.6f; Photoshop, Paint.net, Magicavoxel and Visual Studio.

Please tell me what you've liked or not about my game, how you felt about it, looking to share and improve :) And tell me which endings you got, or the interesting ways you found of solving the levels (I've found very nice and surprising ones already) !

I hope you enjoyed it, and got a satisfying ending (or all of them, better x) ) !

Edit 2 : with the latest build I'm only missing nice soundtracks (and good physics but hey I'm only starting Unity 3D), which I'll never create. 
When evaluating my game please consider the build you're playing and how much time I've taken out of the game jam to make it, for fairness concerns :)

Edit 3 : You can now watch my full walkthrough video, which I edited only for the different endings (which is full of spoilers, so I suggest you try the game before). So this is a honest gameplay video which highlights how much Frederique can glitch and how anoying it can be x) Here : 

https://youtu.be/sAXeLggCdG4

Edit 4 : Version 4 out ! This one should be way more enjoyable than the others and took me only 10 mins to make. That's the one I should have submitted for the jam but hey thought about it too late. Translation movement is so easier than adding force to the character uh.

Changelog :

- Character movement is now a translation and not an acceleration

- No more glitchy anoying rotations

- Fixed the factory walls

entries.title: Pay with your life!
entries.description:
__CONTROLS: move with WASD, aim with  the mouse and shoot with the left mouse button.__

It's a game where you have to kill endlessly comming enemies and can buy stats for HP.

Thank you for playing my game!

__Me rambling about making the game and some other stuff:__

Okay, so for starters, this is the second Ludum Dare I am participating in ([my game for LD43]( https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/dark-sacrifice)) and I like to think that this game is heaps better than the last one. With my first game I made a lot of basic  mistakes, like making it way too ambitious and not splitting my time correctly. I have definitely learned from my mistakes, but couldn'd quite avoid all of them this time either. On top of that I had a test on Monday after the weekend, that I needed to study for.

But despite the severe lack of time, I managed to pick a theme that wasn't too abitious and code most of the basic functions I had invisiond. Sadly I didn't have time to make proper "Start" and "Game Over" screens, my game also lacked animations, maps(combined with pathfainding for the enemies with something like [A*](https://www.redblobgames.com/pathfinding/a-star/introduction.html)), buyable abilities (like bigger bullets) and proper music.
A big time waster for me was choosing a theme, because I couldn't decide on a theme the first day, my time  on the project was massively reduced. Apart from this I spent most of my time coding.

But despite all those shotcommings I'm still pretty proud of this project, and it was a lot of fun to make. Since this was also my first game related programming project in the last 2 monts, it was like a breath of fresh air.

When I compare this to my last game([my game for LD43]( https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/dark-sacrifice)) the main improovement are art (still not good, but there is an improovement, except for the "game over" screen ^^), music (still awful, but at least there are some soundeffects and a 2 second loop song), "finishedness" and planning of the project.

After finishing the project it felt great to look at my checklist and see all the "essential" features ticked off (about 70% of all features).

Thanks for reading and playing my game.

entries.title: The Adventures of Bileous
entries.description:
The Robo-Lizards have taken over Crankville! Smashing shops, building huts, everything being in chaos.
Meanwhile, young adult Bileous isn't worrying about the Robo-Lizards. He's just living a life in exalted solitude, trying to be outside as little as possible, as if he's outside, then he's more likely to get a scar or two than get a small sunburn in summer. You see, Bileous is a social outcast. He messed up a VERY important meeting on accident, and that lowered his social currency into the negative thousands. So, there goes any chance AT ALL to be said "Hi" to or to be given anything more than dirt on his birthday.

But then, the Robo-Lizards put everyone in jail, except Bileous! (he's very protected from everything - even dust particles are eliminated from his house!!!) And then, Bileous knew how to win everybody's hearts. How to bring his social currency to the positives. He would have to... defeat the Robo-Lizards!!!

Unfortunately for Bileous, he couldn't by any protection because 1. everybody was imprisoned and 2. even if the armorer wasn't imprisoned, he couldn't buy anything from anybody in Crankville. So, he had to risk his life to do this - therefore, his life (whether he lived or not) was his social currency.

To blow up the control/production center for the robots, Bileous has to get five things: a key, a switch, a hijacker, a computer, and a wrench. They are scattered all around a map covered with Robo-Lizards - which are kind of hard to evade. But it will be worth it... if you can actually survive. Good luck, Bileous! :) Also, Robo-Huts spawn infinite numbers of Robo-Lizards. Fortunately for Bileous, if there are too many Robo-Lizards at once, then the system crashes and therefore some of the Robo-Lizards have to self-destruct to stabilize the system.

entries.title: Cards of Life
entries.description:
This is a game created for Ludum Dare 44. The theme is "Your life is currency".

You recently learned that you have only a few years left to live, and have decided to gamble with a Demon to extend your life.

##### How to play
This is a simple version of the card game "Concentration". Click on cards to turn them over. You take turns with the Demon, each picking 2 cards. If the cards match then you get a point. The player with the most points when all cards have been flipped over wins the round.  

##### Note
Placing bets has not been implemented. The wager is hardcoded at 2 years. There is no win or loss state.

![CardsOfLife_2.png](///raw/4c2/32/z/2172f.png)

##### Tools used
* Unity
* Paint.net  
* Visual Studio Code

entries.title: Your life is currency
entries.description:
In the not too distant future, all major currencies have failed.
Dollars are worthless, British Pounds are not even worth the paper it is printed on,
and other currencies like the Yen and the Euro are but a memory.
Alternative currencies like Personal Identifiable Data and Bitcoin have also collapsed.

But money does not matter only LIFE!

The life of you and others are put at risk in a racing game.
The only survivor receives fame and glory!

You drive the red car and can shoot blood clots.
Shoot too many and you loose your life; your currency.
Shoot too few and you loose the game.

Controls: Space to start, Space to shoot, Up for speed, Left/Right to steer.
Click to enable music.

============================================================================

Tested on OSX in Chrome and Safari.



Sorry, that I didn't have time to make it better (more levels, more graphics, more explosions, more soundeffects). 
I started out with melonjs, then ditched that and started from scratch with pixijs.
Hope you like it anyway!

The game works by drag and drop your material(humen,cows,spoiler,spoiler) to the sacrifice zone at the right corner. You need to match the material to the shadow in the craft zone.

Camp - let you burn material for exschange with other material.(it happens when you place the material on the camp)

Have alot of fun(didn't finish the game yet)

entries.title: Older than War
entries.description:
Apparently, I overestimated my capabilities and didn‚Äôt manage to do almost anything. In the end, I finally broke everything. And now, just as enemies cannot attack normally, the player‚Äôs control refuses to work normally (at least in compiled form ... in the editor, control seems to be quite good).

**[UPD: I fix some bugs]**

The plans were: A game where, after a defeat, you were asked to choose a card with a bonus in exchange for a few years of life, after which the level started anew, but you became weaker because you were older.

The game has no sound/music (I did not have time to do it).

## Controls (Updated):

- WASD - Movement
- LMB - Shoot
- Q - Change weapon
- Mouse Wheel Scroll - Turn camera
- E - Interact (with truck at the level end)

## Rules:

- At the beginning you have a pistol.
- You need to destroy the enemy squad and get to the enemy truck.
- After death, you can spend a few "years of life" to choose from and receive a skill card in return.
- Also, after aging (after death), your parameters will drop, except for one that you choose.
- When you run out all the years you lose the game.

![screenf.PNG](///raw/da9/91/z/21fca.png)

#### Update from 29.04.2019:

1. Fixed generation of skill cards (the choice was not from all possible cards)
2. Fixed a bug with turns (the character could not turn during the shooting)
3. Fixed a bug with terrible character management (it arose because of an extra camera, which I forgot to remove)
4. Fixed bug with the fact that enemies sometimes stopped shooting
5. Trucks were turned
6. The camera was close to ignore the enemies before they notice the player.
7. Added inscription about winning
8. Fixed a bug when you could just get to the truck without killing anyone (now the level is difficult to pass but you can)
9. Reassigned input keys
10. Ported to Windows

entries.title: The dangerous life of an indie dev
entries.description:
"The dangerous life of an indie dev" is a narrative/management survival game where you're playing an indie developer and your goal is to finish the development of your game.

You pay with your days to progress in development and you have 3 secondary currencies which are:
 
Welfare (Physical and Mental and Social Health)
Financial Health (money)
Street credibility (popularity among other devs, publishers, industry pros or communities)

We wanted to show how much an indie developer sacrifices from his life in order to achieve his goals.

Enjoy !
![Test-2.gif](///raw/35a/21/z/212cf.gif)![Test-3.gif](///raw/35a/21/z/212d0.gif)![Test3.gif](///raw/35a/21/z/212d1.gif)

entries.title: Precious is Life
entries.description:
Take a role of a mighty ancient vampire in their quest to return the stolen meaning of their life, now hidden in the heart of the fairyland. Battle your way through the wild inhabitants of the fairyland by summoning various creatures to your aid. Upgrade them to more powerful forms, cast devastating spells or heal your monsters to ensure your victory, but beware: each summon, upgrade or spell will cost you your own blood.


![scr1.PNG](///raw/36e/32/z/236af.png)


Gameplay:
Precious is life is a 2D turn-based strategy card game.

At the start of each battle you have a choice of either summoning a new creature or upgrading the existing one. 
The creatures you control have various types: melee, flying and ranged. Melee is effective against ranged, ranged is effective against flying and flying is effective against melee.
Active creature is highlighted by the yellow background. The actions it can use are on the bottom of the screen. Select actions by clicking on them with left mouse button.

While your creature is active, you can cast a spell, the panel is beneath the character portrait on the right. Click on the icon to the left of the spell panel to change the spells from damaging to healing and back.
To cancel the selection of a card action or a spell press the right mouse button.

![scr2.PNG](///raw/36e/32/z/236b3.png)

**Tutorial:**
 - Click on actions/spells using LMB to use them
 - Click RMB to cancel the action


Made with: Unity, Krita.
All the art assets were created in the three days of the game jam.

entries.title: Money is Life
entries.description:
![Banner.png](///raw/db7/d1/z/2370f.png)
![Gameplay.gif](///raw/db7/d1/z/23325.gif)

# Credits
- Game created by @lilou-cormic with original music (made for the game during the jam) by @mrjoshuamclean
- Contains graphics by Kenney [www.kenney.nl](www.kenney.nl) Licensed under Creative Commons CC0 1.0 Universal
- Made in Unity 2019.1.0f2

# Controls
- Move tetromino: A / Left - D / Right
- Make tetromino fall: S / Down
- Rotate tetromino: W / Up / Left-click
- Rotate board: Space / Right-click
- Buy bomb tetromino: E / Middle-click

# Game
- Move and rotate tetrominos and/or rotate the board
- Match 3 or more blocks. Match coin blocks to score points
- Current number of coins is at the top
- If you run out of coins you die
- If blocks go too high you die
- Score is the total number of coins you collected
- Buying bombs or hitting ! blocks will cost you coins

# Known issues
- Some collision bugs when rotating
- Sometimes tetromino fall with gravity
- Score goes down but should not

# Planned
- Controller support
- Have a delay before attaching
- Add more colors as you progress
- Make the speed increase more noticeable
- Tutorial

entries.title: Labyrinth of Souls
entries.description:
![screenshot_2.png](///raw/c06/z/23b58.png)
![screenshot_3.png](///raw/c06/z/23408.png)
![screenshot_4.png](///raw/c06/z/23409.png)


**Synopsis:**

You find yourself a prisoner in the Labyrinth of Souls.  All hope is not lost.  There is a way of escape.  However, there are guardians roaming the labyrinth, searching for souls to devour.  Can you avoid them long enough to escape from the prison you find yourself in, or will the guardians claim your soul?

*WARNING: This is an intense experience and may not be suitable for children, pregnant women, people with back or neck problems and those who are easily frightened.*


**Controls:**

- WASD - Movement
- Mouse - Look
- Shift - Sprint (be careful, you have a sprint meter and will have to walk when it runs out)
- Escape - Options (mouse sensitivity, invert y, difficulty)


**Tools:**

Made in Unity, ZBrush, Photoshop, Blender, Substance Painter, Substance Designer, Audacity and FL Studio.


*Created in 72 hours for the Ludum Dare 44 game jam.  All code and assets done by me.*

entries.title: Almost free
entries.description:
![U1zU3R.png](///raw/c12/32/z/236f0.png)

Escaping a demonic plane can be hard but luckily for you there is a friendly "it" aiding you practically for free. The more you buy, the more powerful you are so what could possibly go wrong?

Controls: WASD/Arrows, Z (buy), X (attack)

Dev notes:
- There is no restart button or death scene, just kill the game (Alt-F4 or reload page) and launch again for the next attempt to see the ending :)
- No sound or music

Leave a comment and we will play your game and leave one as well!

entries.title: King's Alchemist
entries.description:
You‚Äôre the Royal Alchemist. The King ordered you to complete 10 orders for making potions. Do it, or you will be burned at the stake!

![Book.png](///raw/a8a/d1/z/23830.png)

# How to play:
- To complete a potion order you need to drag a specified potion from shelf to scroll.
- To make new potions you need to find a recipe in a book and drag ingredients to the cauldron in the correct order.
- Your purple blood is universal ingridient. Eat a pie to restore it.
- Click on plants to get ingredients.

entries.title: Hemomancers
entries.description:
![hemocover.png](///raw/80a/52/z/22f05.png)

![screen.png](///raw/44a/d1/z/23927.png)

![charlist.png](///raw/44a/d1/z/23929.png)

You are Grobthok the wise. In your younger years you were a mighty sorcerer whose name struck fear in hearts and minds all around the world. As age has taken it's toll, however, you've found your thoughts turning more and more towards your impending death. Desperate to extend your time on this mortal coil, you resolve to steal life force from your fellow wizards. Summon demons using what little vitality you have left and live to see another day!

Hemomancers is a turn-based strategy tactics game where you summon demons to kill your enemies and defend your hero. The catch is that you lose a bit of yourself every time you make a summon.

The cost of the units that you need to summon is in the lower-right corner, but be careful with spending your health; your opponent might find it easier to kill you, or worse, you might find yourself spending more life than you have. Careful not to kill yourself! :)




We are still setting up HTTPS, will modify the link when its ready.


###Bugfixes:
- The suicide warning now shows up reliably. It used to show up only when your health would have gone negative due to the summon.

entries.description:
-------

**InstaLink:** https://franvadillo.itch.io/the-greatest-show

-------

![Portada.png](///raw/445/41/z/246e2.png)


# Context

-------

_(All this text is in the game)_

Hi! Let me tell you my story:

Let's say that I am... Hmmm... From a problematic family.

The thing is, because of some weird stuff, I have to eat souls to stay alive. Four pieces of souls everyday.

It sounds kinda evil, I know, but actually I'm not that way. I don¬¥t like hurting people and being the monster and things like that. So I had to be creative. Thats why I created The Greatest Show.

It is such an incredible show that people are willing to pay with their lifes to watch it. I give people a good show and, in exchange, they give me their soul. 

Win-win. 

It's totally fair.

Having a show like this is not easy, the key is to keep the mystery.

No matter how incredible it is, if people knew how it goes, they would not pay the price.

-------

![Captura3.png](///raw/445/41/z/246dd.png)

-------

# Controls

- ** Click ** or ** Spacebar ** to keep talking

- ** Green ** and ** Red buttons ** to let people go in or not

entries.title: The Soul Broker
entries.description:
![The_Soul_Broker.png](///raw/89b/32/z/22e8b.png)

A deep sleep turns into a battle for your very life!  Tonight the Soul Broker has absconded with your soul, trapping it in the Dream World.

You must enter the Dream World find your soul. Then fight your way to the surface, back to your slumbering body, to reunite your body and spirit before sunrise. 

Helpful golems can be used to attack or bypass these evil forces, but the golems must drain your life essence to help you. Use your precious life force wisely brave hero!

### CONTROLS:

* Move left/right with arrow keys, left stick, or D-Pad
* Jump with up arrow key or bottom face button
* Animate golem with "A" key or top face button

entries.title: Bloodcurse: Recast
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/b01/3/z/24c28.png)
Welcome to **Bloodcurse: Recast**, a *round*based dungeon fighter


## Story:
An ancient evil arises from the tomb, called forth by satan himself! It's you! A vampire who pays the Devil in his blood in exchange for cool powers that happen to be playing cards.

## Gameplay:
The gameplay is split in two parts:
**In-Fight** and **Preparation**

### In-Fight
What's up here? You, the vampire lord just revived and bloodthirsty, are going to enslave and eat *(or drink?)* the fauna and humankind!
Fighting is a mix of automated battle with roundbased decisions, where you can trade-off between short and longterm benefits to your character. If you are low on health or fighting a boss, you might be interested in healing or per-fight buffs, where in safe fights you might want to invest into permanent stat boosts to be able to stand against stronger enemies.

**After each round** (which ends once every character has attacked) you are presented three cards of whom you can choose to buy one (or none). Choose wisely!
After buying, you can play handcards. Thereafter the fight continues.

### Preparation
The fight is won, what's now? Now, you are doomed to choose how to fight in the next battle.
You start as a claw-scratching bloodsucker (literally, you wield your claws as a weapon and your equiped skill is sucking blood), but you can be so much more!
 - A summoner who turns slayed enemies into loyal minions
 - A warrior who crushes the enemies and falls into bloodrage
 - A sorcerer who leeches live like a champion
 - A rogue dodging his way through fights
 - ... or a crazy combination of it

You can equip a weapon, that defines how hard your basic attack hits and gives a bonus to your stats, like Health, Dodge, Armor, Life Leech Rate, ... . Also each weapon is connected to a class (like Dagger -> Rogue) and increases your class level. Those class levels can be upgraded after boss fights, elite enemies and at the very beginning of the game

Additionally, you can equip one skill, which is more powerfull the better you are in it's class (like summoner, ...).
A Skill is used every X attacks, which is dependent on the skill and your level in it's class.

# Have fun!
It was fun to create the game and we hope it's as much fun for you to play it!

entries.title: Blood Thief
entries.description:
# Blood Thief

You incarnate a Vampire in his quest to vengeance and blood lust ! Your goal is to kill a particular buddy whitin the levels without getting caught by anybody. Your weapons ? You fangs of course but also your dark powers :

* Killing at distance
* Becoming invisible!

Of course, those powers will drain your only life force : your blood. So use them cautiously!

Main Menu | In Game Preview
--- | ---
![BloodThief.gif](///raw/f5a/2/z/23b52.gif) | ![ingame.png](///raw/f5a/2/z/23b5a.png)

## Commands

### Keyboard

 * WASD / Arrow keys : Move
 * X (maintain pressed) : Suck Blood / will drain out somebody‚Äôs blood
 * C (maintain pressed) : Become Invisible / at the cost of some blood per second
 * V : Distant attack / at the cost of some blood
 
### XBox Gamepad

 * Left stick : move
 * A : attack
 * X : invisible
 * B : mind blast

## Credits

* Smatcher - 3D Models, Texturing, Programming
* Otakode - Programming, Unity3D specialist
* Vince - Programming
* pplans - Programming, Art (Effects, UI, ...)
* XunBel - UI
* Music by Artem_G https://www.jamendo.com/artist/376456/artem-g, specially https://www.jamendo.com/track/889941/vampire

Have fun :)

entries.title: Phaser's Edge
entries.description:
*Known Bug: Restarting too many times may make the game run poorly. In that case, refresh your browser.*

## Instructions

Protect the merchant ship from all attackers until it reaches its final destination.

* **Thrust:** W or UP
* **Left/Right:** A/D or LEFT/RIGHT
* **Fire:** SPACE

Power ups use the energy you acquire through taking damage. They also have a cooldown period.

* **Spin Missile:** E
* **Boost:** LEFT_SHIFT

Other:

* **Fullscreen:** MINUS
* **Mute Music:** COMMA
* **Mute All Audio:** PERIOD

## Credits

**Code:** Brian McBarron, Kevin Pitstick, Mark Wiggans

**Art:** Kit McLellan

**Sound and Music:** Dave Abrams

**Special Thanks:** Tony Casale, Warren Dukes, Lori McBarron, Chris Pitstick, Ben Ross, Josh Suereth, Zak Wise

## Thoughts on the Theme

The theme is "Your life is currency". We aspired to this goal in 2 ways:

1. You are a mercenary for hire in a dangerous job. Your life is the currency that your employers spend to achieve their goals.
2. Your ships absorbs enemy damage as energy. When you run out of capacity, it explodes. However, that energy can used to trigger power-ups. Thus, your ship's "life" is the currency which you spend on those power-ups.

## Intro Text

In the war-torn future, human life is one of the most valuable currencies. The AI Accords of 2246 forbid machines from choosing to harm a sentient being. Therefore, expendable mercenaries like you are recruited to pilot mostly autonomous ships of awesome destructive power in order to make those life-and-death decisions.

Your armed escort service has a rare advantage. Your salvaged Andromedan ship acts like a giant capacitor that can absorb energy weapon fire. You can harness this sea of current to power one of your custom upgrades. But be warned... if the batteries fill beyond capacity, you'll rediscover the old saying:

*Andromedans live on PHASER'S EDGE.*

## Screen Captures

Intro                                     |  Winning!
:----------------------------------------:|:--------------------------------------------:
![Splash.PNG](///raw/01e/12/z/230bc.png)  |  ![Winning.PNG](///raw/01e/12/z/2311a.png)

entries.title: Gladiator Souls
entries.description:
![2019-04-30 04_25_00-.png](///content/f4e/z/2380a.png)

# Story

Your goal is to lead your gladiator onto the path of glory !

To do so, you shall defeat the other gladiators with as much style as possible. The best way to do that is by dodging their blades at the very last moment, giving your public a thrill! Indeed, this will entice your fellow spectators to throw away money at you... That you can then use to improve you skills in between combats.

No retirement for the braves! Your thrive when bathed in the blood of these filthy opponents calling themselves gladiators. Pigs! That's all they are!

Your life is your only currency in this world, where your spectators have literally the power to end your life or postpone your death. Keep them entertained!

![2019-04-30 03_25_56-.png](///raw/6c8/z/2331d.png)

# Controls 

- Character Movement : WASD/Arrows (Keyboard) - Left stick (Gamepad)

- Attack : Ctrl/Left Mouse Button (Keyboard) - X (Gamepad)

- Dash : Space/Right Mouse Button (Keyboard) - A  (Gamepad)

![2019-04-30 03_29_03-.png](///raw/6c8/z/2336e.png)

# Gameplay

- Your attacks and you dash skill **consume stamina** (yellow bar; refills over time).

- You lose life when hit by enemies. You have no life regen, because only the weak needs that. 

- After each round you can improve your skills according to the money you received from the spectators.


![2019-04-30 03_25_00-.png](///content/6c8/z/22fcc.png)

# Changelog POSTJAM [2019-05-11.13-45]

- Add health bar in upgrade screen
- Fix increase stamina cost and price in upgrade screen
- Fix increase max health cost and price in upgrade screen
- Disable buttons when not available in upgrade screen
- Add not enough stamina sound
- Decrease stamina upgrade cost by 60
- Reduce player speed
- Reduce dash stamina cost
- Improve opponent hit zone
- Add player dash sound

entries.title: Welcome
entries.description:
-------------------------------------

## Game Plot ##

![p2.png](///raw/52f/22/z/227e6.png)

You start in a shop and buy a jetpack but learn that the shopkeeper doesn't accept coins as currency.


![p1.png](///raw/52f/22/z/227d7.png)

So, he jumps in his **death machine** and starts to chase you through various platforming obstacles while you try to collect as many tricky-to-get coins as you can to increase your score.


![p3.png](///raw/52f/22/z/227f2.png)

-----------------------

## Controls ##

  
  Control   | Key
  -------------  | -------------
  Movement | ‚Üê ‚Üí / A D
  Jump   | ‚Üë / Space
  Interact   | E

--------------------------------------

## Explanation ##
At the start of the game you type your **username** of choice (optional) into the text box on the sign and hit enter to exit the text box. Then go near the shop keeper and press *E* to buy a jetpack with your coins. After that try exiting out of the shop and see what happens!

The game consists of a shop part and 10 underground parts which have **increasing difficulty**. **Coins** are scattered across the stage and can be collected for higher scores and more challenge.

When you finish the game you will see a **leaderboard** that contains all the scores of other players who have completed it. You can try getting more coins for higher scores and maybe even reach the highest score: **1000 points**.
  
-----------------------------------

## Tools Used ##

- Unity 3D Game Engine
- Visual Studio
- Aseprite
- [dreamlo](dreamlo.com) (for the leaderboard)
- Music generated with
[cgMusic](http://codeminion.com/blogs/maciek/2008/05/cgmusic-computers-create-music/).

------------------------------

entries.title: Register Revenge
entries.description:
![coverArt.png](///raw/e78/02/z/23f8d.png)



You are a cash register come to life, that is avenging his town's recent robbery.

Arrow keys to move and jump and Space to shoot out your coins.

This is my second time in the game Jam but first as a programmer as I'm new to coding, and boy was it a challenge even for this. Spent more time trying to get the code to work than anything else, so only got three levels in time and didnt really get to explore the mechanic of firing coins and it reducing your life really :( Only managing to get some stuff working 5 minutes from deadline! But hey ho, it was a lot of fun!

This was my girlfriends first attempt at digital and game art too -

entries.title: Diffraction
entries.description:
![Banner-scaled.png](///raw/0b1/2/z/21ac4.png)

 

**WARNING: HARSH LANGUAGE**

 

**FROM THE TEAM THAT BROUGHT YOU INSTANT CLASSICS SUCH AS:**

*- Tetris*

*- Pac Man*

*- Super Mario Brothers*


 


**COMES AN NEW, INNOVATIVE GAMEPLAY EXPERIENCE**

**YOU ARE MAX DANGER, AN ELITE SUPERSOLDIER WHO HAS WOKEN UP TO FIND HIS MOON BASE UNDER ATTACK BY A MYSTERIOUS VILLAIN!**

**NAVIGATE THE FACILITY AND DISCOVER A WAY TO ESCAPE... OR WILL MAX DANGER CONFRONT THE NEFARIOUS DR. B.A.D.D. ONCE AND FOR ALL?**

---

This is our entry for Ludum Dare #44! In Diffraction, you play as MAX DANGER- a supersoldier who wakes up to a moonbase under attack.

The game is a point-and-click adventure, where every "action" you take costs health! It's a bit loose with the theme, but we all had a GREAT time working on it!

 

For the next few weeks, you can find VoDs of the gamejam at

http://mixer.com/slimabob

http://mixer.com/chambre19

http://mixer.com/divic

http://mixer.com/thegrandpa


 

*Walkthrough (SPOILERS):*

- Go to the Kitchen and grab the knife
- Go to the Cryo Control Room and use the Terminal (Password 1 2 3 4)
- Return to the starting room, and click on the now open Cryostasis Chamber
- Take the Severed Hand to the Armory Fingerprint Scanner
- Use the Power Console and pick your ending
- Go to the cafeteria and walk through the door you opened!

 

**THANKS FOR TRYING OUR GAME!**

*The Team:*
- slimabob (Programming, Audio, Level Design)
- Ryan / chambre19 (Concept Artist, Environment Design)
- Tony (3d Artist)
- Divic (DR. B.A.D.D.)
- kt2goofy (MAX DANGER)
- Renny (Robot Dog)

Github Repo: https://github.com/slimabob/LDJam44

entries.title: Bunny Powered Money Machine
entries.description:
‚ÄãPLAY IT HERE: https://rainfrogs.itch.io/ld44

OBJECTIVE: Fill the bar at the bottom to get more coins to drop.  Each death increases the difficulty of the game, but also increases the speed at which the bar fills.  The bar only fills while you are running on the ground (meaning your ghosts are running on the treadmills).  You only have 12 lives and they run out fast!

CONTROLS: 

A + D to move 

Space to jump

In this game you must balance your need for money and your ability to dodge.  Get hit by a projectile to move onto the next stage; your ghost will be placed onto the treadmill and a next rabbit will be born in a more difficult environment. 

See how far you can push it and stay alive making the most money!

entries.title: 2nd Bank
entries.description:
![2ndbank.png](///raw/8c4/2/z/2352e.png)

A well-educated and highly motivated individual, you have managed to prove your banking abilities and are looking to expand your business. Keep your customers happy and prove your love of finance.

Controls:
- WASD / Arrow Keys to move
- Space bar interacts with whatever is in front of you

entries.title: Devils Circus
entries.description:
# Devils Circus

## Description

You are trapped in a circus by a devilish figure. Your sole purpose is to entertain him by fighting monsters and by dodging obstacles.

By trading in your health points you will be able to gain score and unlock items and powerups. But don't sacrifice too much as you might regret it later...

## Controls

* A, D to move
* Space to jump
* Mouse to aim
* Hold left mouse button to charge and release to shoot
  * Charging your weapon long enough will cause a critical hit

![Controls.png](///raw/f75/c/z/227e8.png)

## Screenshots

![Shop.png](///raw/f75/c/z/227e2.png)

![Level2.png](///raw/f75/c/z/227e4.png)

![CriticalShot.png](///raw/f75/c/z/227ed.png)

![Hearts.png](///raw/f75/c/z/227f0.png)

## The "I didn't get around finishing, but I really wanted to implement this" list
* More enemies:
  * Crawler that charged and jumps at you
  * An enemy that eats the platforms
* More levels (slower difficulty curve) + Level tweaking
* Bouncing balls
* More items/ power-ups and weapons:
  * Knockback resistance
  * Crossbow (forced full charge to reload, always crit + better crit)
  * Valueables

## After jam changes

The HTML5 contains some after jam changes;
* Fixed invisible arrow bug
* Lowered heart container prices in the shop
* Added 5 levels (using the same mechanics as the already existing)

The JAM version (v0.1) is still available on itch.io.

entries.title: Hospital Horrors
entries.description:
‚ÄãEscape a monster invested hospital by purchasing upgrades with your health. Upgrades range from abilities like dash or a shield, to powers like a fireball, to spell improvements like more bullets per shot or explosive ammo.

This was my first Ludum Dare ever. Actually, it even is the first game ever I have actually finished. I feel like this has set me up for loads of amazing future game jams! So thank you for playing!

entries.title: Don't Die, Dumpstercat!
entries.description:
![game2.jpg](///raw/9cc/b/z/22d87.jpg)

Here in a city quite like all the others... there lives a **dumpster cat.**

Her name is Taki.

**Taki of House Dumpster** is just a lonely cat trying to navigate a cruel, chaotic city. She wanders the streets in search of shelter, snax, a place to warmly loaf, and most of all, companionship. 

But be careful out there, brave cat! There are foes aplenty and only but a few furiends. Her foes are furmidable and may take a toll.

If she fears she is not strong enough to make it through the streets on her own, there are mystic cat ways of seeking help.

She may **purchase a few pawers** to help her on her journeys. But know this, small cat. The cost is high... The highest any cat could hope to pay.

She must pay it with her lives.

Like any cat, she entered this world with **nine lives**. To help her on her journeys, she can use these lives to purchase pawerful advantages against her street foes. But **beware**! It may take more than one life to survive the alleys of this treacherous city.

The bargain is yours to make. Guide her well.



![Taki Cat Gif.gif](///raw/9cc/b/z/22db8.gif)






*This game was made by:* 



*Brogrammer in Chief: Justin Wash* 

*Cat Mechanics Engineer/ Pigeon Resarcher: Emilio Navarro*

*Master of Tedium/ Cat Pun Supervisor: Aubrey Byron*

*Rocket Cat Photographer: Bridget Cromien*

*Assistant Vice Principal of Beeps and Boops: Charlie Nowell*

Your life as currency: Explore the dangerous depths of a vending machine in an action packed adventure! Slay its monstrous inhabitants and claim the prize!

entries.title: Don't BET your LIFE away!
entries.description:
![Untitled.png](///raw/f90/4/z/223e5.png)

--------------------------

**Changelog:**

5/1/2019 - We added an **easy mode version**, it's completely the same as the original except the player now shoots faster than the enemy robots. This is intended for players who had trouble with beating the original version, but we encourage you to **try the original version first!** :)

5/1/2019 (a few hours later) - We remastered **easy mode** to now feature a health bonus for the player. This along side a few pre-unlocked parts should hopefully allow for a more fun experience when dying to the **DREADED FIRST ENEMY!** Do you even dare to look the final boss in the eyes? >:3

--------------------------

**About:**

Welcome to **DON'T BET YOUR LIFE AWAY!** The only game show where robotic contestants fight each other to take the opponent's body parts! 

Before each fight, contestants choose one of their own parts to bet on their victory. If they lose the fight, they will lose that body part as well. But if they win, they receive the body part that their opponents betted. Robots can then equip those body parts to create powerful fighters or absolute freaks of ~~nature~~... robotics?

--------------------------

**Features:**

- **36** different* body parts to unlock, equip, bet and lose. Including heads, arms, legs, torsos and a potted plant!
- Fight against randomly but still fairly generated robots! You can also fight two at once for double the reward!
- Fight against **8** different champions to unlock new parts!
- Exchange two parts you don't need in **THE SHOP** for a better one!

(*Well... some are at least graphically different.)

--------------------------

**Good things to know:**

- **Use your momentum to launch your projectiles further**, by walking towards the enemy when shooting.
- **Keep distance!**. Try to stay outside the opponent's fire range and shoot them from afar.
- **Keep spare parts in your inventory**, you will probably lose a lot, so it's always good to have some replacements.
- SPD - Speed
- JMP - Jump
- HP  - Health
- DMG - Damage
- RNG - Range
- RLD - Reload speed
- BLS - Bullet speed

--------------------------

**Controls:**

**A** and **D** - Movement

**SPACE** - Jump

**LEFT** and **RIGHT MOUSE** - Attack

--------------------------

entries.title: EXO
entries.description:
# About

![exo.PNG](///raw/445/21/z/23398.png)

Exo is a first person tower defense game developed within 66 hours by Firesplash Entertainment for Ludum Dare 44.

You are an astroneer on a far planet. Aliens attacked your habitate and killed your
whole team. You are the only (and lonely) survivor.
All your technology has been destroyed.

You were able to put some parts together to create anew exo skeleton robot but
batteries went low quickly so you needed to attach a nuclear core.
Unfortunatley that one emits a lot of radiation when under heavy duty so
don't put it under too much load. You will pay with your life.

* Code: Alex
* Graphics: Jan, Marie

Game crafted from about 10 liters energy, 3 liters beer and
a few more liters of water mixed with pizza. Much pizza.


# How to play
The game supports controllers (not in menu) and Keyboard/Mouse.
In settings screen you can setup the camera movement speed. This is important to know as movement is optimized for mouse by default. Speed it up for controller! If you pull the sliders to the left half the axis will get inverted.

Gameplay: Build towers to kill the aliens. The enemies will target and chase you. You can't run away. Each few waves enemies become stronger and faster.
The game runs until you are dead. Every wave you will get a small heal.
Warning: You will lose life when building/upgrading towers or using shortcuts!

Now drop into the game and have some fun :)

Found any bugs? Report them in the comments. We love too hear your opinion!

# Known Issues
- Sound is hearable too far. We were not able to fine tune this as of time missing. If late game gets too heavy, turn sound off.

# Build Time
I just rebuilt and reuploaded the whole project. Something seems to have gone wrong on initial build (defective file still uploaded for reference) as it freezes and sound is not working correctly.
The 4:30 build is the in-time code just rebuilt.

# Changelog
- Bugfix 1:
  - Fixed Mouse Sensitivity Slider
  - Fixed Weapons still targeting dead enemies
  - Fixed Bloom effect not working
- Bugfix 2:
  - Fixed Wave Timer not waiting for last enemy dead - OOOOPS!
  - Game is now slowed down to 10% while building.

NOTE: The decision is up to you if you want to rate bugfix or original versions.

entries.title: Burgers To Die For
entries.description:
Some burgers are just too good to pass up, but others would be worth your life. Create a never-ending stream of burgers so good you'd not want to live without.

entries.title: Devil's Death Collector
entries.description:
![Cover_Image_LD.png](///raw/c66/2/z/22e07.png)

In an unfortunate series of events, you accidentally sold your soul to THE NEON DEVIL for a ham sandwich. Don't ask.

Now in return for the chance to earn your freedom, THE NEON DEVIL has asked you to collect other souls for him.
![Screens_LD_1.png](///raw/c66/2/z/232f1.png)

He'll give you a rough description of the person you need to find and then it's up to you to find the correct person. Reach 5000 soul currency to earn your freedom. 
![Screens_LD_2.png](///raw/c66/2/z/232f8.png)

But watch out! THE NEON DEVIL is very impatient so your soul currency will go down over time. THE NEON DEVIL is also very irritable so sending him the wrong targets will cost you 100 soul currency!
![Screens_LD_3.png](///raw/c66/2/z/232fb.png)

Good luck! And maybe don't sell your soul for a sandwich next time!

entries.title: Live to Work, Work to Live
entries.description:
This is our first submission to LD \o 


This an office themed capitalist survival mini game based game. Your goal is to survive as many days as you can by doing your job that the nice guy in the office will politely ask you to do. Your job consists of completing with a certain score office themed mini games located in different computers across the room. If you don‚Äôt complete them by the end of the day, you will get fired and will lose the game automatically.
At the end of each successful day you will get a payment and will have bills to pay, some of them can be postponed, with the condition of getting a negative side effect.

![Captura de Tela 2019-04-29 aÃÄs 20.48.17.png](///raw/1d9/71/z/23730.png)

The Web version can be unstable, if you have any problem, try to download a platform versioon :D

This game isn't fun...

entries.title: Cyberpunk 2076: Independence Day
entries.description:
"Just a cool dude with a Jacket" was my idea when making this game, in hindsight, my idea should have been the actual theme...

Controls: 
Arrow Keys or A/D to move.
Shift to sprint, but watch out, you can't control yourself in the air after sprint-jumping!
Space, Up arrow, or W to Jump.
W/S to select an option, E to confirm. (Mouse on the first screen)

Robots are revolting! They released nanobots into the air to kill all humans! These nanobots eat at your insides, slowly taking away your senses. Once you run out, it's game over.

Goal: 
The goal is to stop the nanobots in the air from attacking humans, which will turn the tide of the revolution towards the favor of humanity. There's a switch on the map that will deactivate them, to keep it safe, the robots placed it in a high place.
The main feature of the game is losing senses, so sorta Life is Currency? Oh well, I was focusing on the game before the theme!

Note: Getting hit by enemies or their shots will speed up the timer above your head! After being hit, you will be red, you are immune while you are red!

Everything was made by me, except the font "DS-Digital". A link can be found on my HTML5 version of the game.

TODOs:
- Improve the aiming, the gun isn't aiming at the cursor exactly at the moment
- Add a losing screen
- Better story
- Running sprite for the player
- Shaders to make the game feel less flat.

entries.title: Cards Against Sanctity
entries.description:
Have You ever wanted to play cards with the devil itself? Now You can! You will play a well known card game in the underground: Cards Against Sanctity. Who doesn't like gambling? Oh, did I mention that instead of boring money, You will be playing for the years of your life?
 ![t≈ÅO2.png](///raw/4c6/c/z/231b3.png)

How to play:

First choose how much You want to bet by pressing LMB on coins in the bottom part of screen. The number below this coins shows amount of coins You have. ![Coinstack6.png](///raw/4c6/c/z/2326c.png)
Number of coins in the middle shows the bet size.

When You're done with bets press LMB on this emblem to start a game.![Emblem2.png](///raw/4c6/c/z/232dc.png)
In this game there are 4 types of cards (which are shown on emblem) and each card has its own power value. The goal of the game is to have more card points on the table than the opponent. You can view your cards power by simply putting your mouse over one of your cards. To pick up a card press and hold LMB then drag to your desired place. The places where You can put your card will green sides as shown on the picture below. ![Card background 2 oN.png](///raw/4c6/c/z/233ba.png)
You are always able to put your cards on any of your side of the table, but You can also destroy your opponents cards (your card will also get destroyed). But to destroy your opponent cards, your card needs to be specific Type (Fire card can destroy ice cards, ice can destroy water and water can destroy fire). There is also a fourth type of card: Ground type. Ground cards cannot destroy any other cards and can be destroyed by all the rest of types, but they work as shields: To be able to destroy fire, ice or water cards, all shields must be destroyed first. All of that is shown on the emblem.![Emblem2.png](///raw/4c6/c/z/234f8.png)

In your turn You have 2 moves. When You want to end your turn simply press LMB on the emblem. In the each bet there are 4 turns (2 are yours and 2 are AI turns), after 4 turns bet ends and bet is won by player who have more power points (The amount of your points is shown above your placed cards). After that You are back to placing bets.![t≈Ço3.png](///raw/4c6/c/z/2359c.png)

I know that rules might be a bit complicated, but I hope You'll still enjoy it. Have fun!


Bugfixes:

-repaired not looping music bug.

-fixed not going back to menu after game over bug.

entries.title: Buckubus: suck 'em dry!
entries.description:
We thought the theme SUCKED, so to vent our frustration after too much fruitless brainstorming, we decided to make a game that involves sucking everything up, starting with various currencies.  At first the game itself sucked as well and we were in despair, but by the end of day 2, we started to like it! So we proudly present...

Throughout different times and places, there's always some BLOODSUCKER waiting to steal your bucks and SUCK YOU DRY.

You are that guy: the Buckubus.  Slurp all the money and grow bigger, until you can suck up everything else!

Controls: 
cursors or w,s,a,d - move
Z or shift - flip left / right

Credits: 

Boris: game design, programming, backgrounds made using evolvotron.

Val: game design, graphics, sound

![Screenshot_2019-04-30_01-40-26.png](///raw/78a/1/z/22bbb.png)
![Screenshot_2019-04-30_01-41-50.png](///raw/78a/1/z/22bc0.png)

entries.title: Soul Knight
entries.description:
![header.png](///raw/430/8/z/228cf.png)

You are one of the damned souls who have been sent to Castle Moldark to spend the rest of your life among other exiled ones. Legends say the castle is ruled by the most evil of souls - a mighty marble, a greedy ghost and an evil eye *(watch out, it's truly evil!)*. Defeating them all will grant your soul pardon and allow you to live a happy life once again.

## Game Mechanics

The game is a 2D platformer in which your life total - souls - can be traded for at a merchant. The merchant will trade you other souls which grant you special powers. Until you lose them, that is, by taking damage from evil creatures in the castle.

## How to Play

Use **Arrow keys to move**

Use **X to attack**

Use **Space to interact** (doors & merchant)

> In the merchant GUI, use the mouse to get souls from the merchant (bottom) in exchange for yours (top). You can also use the top screen in the merchant GUI to reorder your souls. The order is important, as the souls get damaged from right to left.

## Screenshots
![1.png](///raw/430/8/z/22868.png)

![2.png](///raw/430/8/z/22869.png)

![3.png](///raw/430/8/z/2286b.png)

### Credits
Apace - code monkey, Unity guy, credit author, humble

Raphnika - powerful art wizard, contemporary John Williams, incredible level designer

Merle - helpful ideas, boss names, but most importantly, keeping the devs alive with awesome food

Special thanks to Sebastian Lague for his great 2D character controller which we modified and used for this game. We couldn't have done it in time without it.

entries.title: Cats Against The Society
entries.description:
# Cats Against The Society
![titre2.png](///raw/6b8/32/z/23a01.png)

** Make a choice and try to keep the love of your owner, stay healthy and/or be brave enough to rule your neighborhood and see where every decision is carrying you! **

## Our approach to the theme
In a cat life, three things are importants: keeping your human under control, having the respect of the other cats and staying far away from the vet. To gain something, you need to lose something. Let see what part of your life you are ready to give away to improve your cat existence!

## Inspiration
We were inspired by the game [Reigns](http://nerial.fr/reigns/). The goal is to become the queen / king of the neighborhood or just keep alive.

## Game play
The game play is simple because we use only the click mouse.

![Capture du 2019-04-30 09-35-31.png](///raw/6b8/32/z/23a09.png)

![Capture du 2019-04-30 09-36-02.png](///raw/6b8/32/z/23a0a.png)

![Capture du 2019-04-30 09-36-22.png](///raw/6b8/32/z/23a0b.png)

## For the future
We want add more questions for less repetitly and some music.

entries.title: HONC: The Building Blocks of Life
entries.description:
![honctitle.PNG](///raw/880/8/z/23554.png)

![newearth.PNG](///raw/880/8/z/2306d.png)

Pronounced "honk", HONC is a 3D space exploration game about giving Life to a solar system by distributing Hydrogen, Oxygen, Nitrogen, and Carbon. Explore and document the planets of System No.1876.

Technical details: the game runs at 144p with limited color palette/scan line/distortion shaders to create an old-school effect :) This would be a very fun postmortem to write, I think.

![yellowmoon.PNG](///raw/880/8/z/22b36.png)

There is a web version and a Windows version, just scroll down the itch.io page to the downloads section (added the Windows version after the jam on 4/30/19). Windows is in my opinion the definitive version due to mouse first-person lock control being consistent.

Controls are on the itch page :)

*NOTE: The three music tracks in this game were created outside of LD44 by [Benjamin Busche](https://twitter.com/pichuscute0). All other sound design was done in-jam by myself.*

entries.title: 60 Second Supermarket Sweep
entries.description:
[![title.png](///raw/268/3/z/240b4.png)](https://stuckinaliftstudios.itch.io/supermarket-game)

From the team that brought you [**K.R.A.B.S**](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/38/k-r-a-b-s) and [**Dear Leader's Diet Plan**](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/dear-leaders-diet-plan)
    
*British TV gameshow meets Bollywood action movie in*
## 60 Second Supermarket Sweep

### Controls:
WASD to move, F to Interact, Esc to pause the game and access the options

### Objective: 
Fetch all the items on your shopping list before the store closes. You can buy things from the mysterious upgrade shop outside the supermarket to improve your shopping experience, but be aware, all things have a price...

If you find the game is running a little slow (ie it's a bit choppy) you can always adjust the graphics options in the options menu to something that works for you.

![explosion.gif](///raw/268/3/z/23b5b.gif)

-----

Yes we know you get slightly more than 60 seconds in the game, but the alliteration was too strong that we didn't feel like renaming. 

Of course this was made in a weekend by two people who also work jobs and have lives, so it's far from perfect and there is a lot of room for things to improve, so we hope you'll forgive any unexpected behaviour. Depending on feedback received we may make an improved 'post-jam' version.

I'm interested to know if our game is worth continuing development on. To do so, it would be great to have some more detailed feedback from you, the people who have played our game.

If you have a few moments and feel like leaving us some detailed feedback here are some questions we'd like answers to:

- Did you enjoy this game? Would you play it again, or recommend it to a friend?

- Would you like to see the concept for this game expanded?

- What elements of the gameplay do you enjoy the most?

- What elements of the gameplay did you not enjoy?

Thank you for stopping by, we hope to have improved your day üòÉ

-----

### Software Used:

This was built using **Unity 2017.4** with the *PicaVoxel* plugin, **MagicaVoxel** for all our models, and **MSPaint** ;)

All art, music (all written and recorded by @Limejuice123 aka [Embers of the Willow Tree](https://embersofthewillowtree.bandcamp.com/)) and 90% of the code was put together by us in the 72 hour period. The other 10% came from [our unity gamejam template](https://github.com/historymaker118/GameJamTemplate).

-----

### Patch Note:

Thanks to the great responses from our early testers, we've found and fixed the one tiny line of code that was causing a crash whenever the player went for a second game. The good news is that you all enjoyed the game enough to want to play it a second time in a row and found the bug for us. Awesome.

entries.title: Slave: Unpaid
entries.description:
Embark on an ethically, questionable adventure as you struggle to scrape together the gold to fulfill your rental obligations on your Roman era estate.

Will you push your workers *cough* slaves *cough* to the limit? Will you break the chains of oppression and refuse to even play? Or will you knowingly and delightfully engage yourself in a cycle of never-ending suffering?

In Slave: Unpaid, a person's life is only as valuable as the labour they produce.

Credits:

Tednesday - Programming

Sven - Art and Sound

Najimi - Consultancy

entries.title: Brian, Your Life Is Currency
entries.description:
Brian works at a bank. Brian isn't sure if he ever leaves work... For all he knows, his life is currency. 

---

***//Instructions//***

Customers entering the bank have requests shown in their corresponding column on the left (line 1, line 2, line 3). Move to each station and collect their request, which will turn yellow to show it has been filled. Once all of the customers requests are satisfied, you can let them know and they'll leave happy. But be careful, each customer has a finite amount of patience, shown above their head. If it runs out, they'll leave angry. As well, if you missed any of their requests they will leave angry. If you generate more angry customers than happy ones its game over! 

---

***//CONTROLS//***

WASD / arrow keys to move,  E to interact

PS4 controller: left stick to move > X to interact (O on web version)

*Note for web version, the X button on Dualshock controllers is swapped with O button due to WebGL gamepad API differences*

---

Thanks for checking out my jam game. I had a blast doing it. I learned the hard way not to push balancing/playtesting to the end, as I'm not sure the difficulty curve works too well, but maybe I'm wrong. Either way, had a blast making this and thanks for checking it out!

---

entries.title: ShellShark!
entries.description:
![03.png](///raw/ab9/z/22876.png)

_After wasting a long day doing crappy work no one needs, the worst thing an old shark could imagine is coming back to a lonely home where no-one waits. People can do anything to escape the cruel reality: video games, casino, drugs. All those bad habits did not just happen for no reason. I'm kinda lucky to have the most innocent one. Although, I still wonder what troubles it will lead me to..._

Play a game of ShellShark! The rules are simple: all you need is a deck of cards and a bunch of shells (we used to use livin‚Äãg molluscs‚Äã). You have _creature cards_ and _action cards_, should be easy to tell the difference once you see them. Creature cards have their characteristics (_power_ and _health_) and some special abilities. Also you have 48 molluscs that denotes your HPs. You win when your opponent's health turns down to zero.

Shuffle your deck and take 4 cards from it.

In the beginning of the turn take a card from your deck. Now you can put one creature on a table (order matters, so choose wisely) _and/or_ use one of your action cards. When you're done, just say "pass" (if no-one answers, try clicking "end turn"). Then comes the fight phase where your creatures beat each others' tails. Then comes the opponent's turn.

Knowing these rules should be enough to beat Bob. Good luck!

***

I hate the theme! If you find any clue of it in this game, tell me about it.

***

Credits: 

* [Syudzius](https://twitter.com/syudzius) -- Real Artist‚Ñ¢.
* [Yngvarr](https://twitter.com/_yngwarr) -- surreal game programmer.

entries.title: Fishtastic - The Adventures of Kailax
entries.description:
![fishtastic.png](///raw/151/a1/z/223cf.png)

# Fishtastic - The Adventures of Kailax

## Kailax is the coolest salmon in his river

One day something horrible happened: Kailax was kidnapped!

He was dropped in the ocean. Lost in a terrifying place he is desperate to find his way back home.

Can you help him? Or will he be doomed to swim in the big ocean forever? :scream: 


## How to play
- W - up
- A - left
- S - down
- D - right

## Team
- Emil (limered) - Movement, Physics, Special Effects, Programming
- Sven (justsWn) - UI, Sound (all self made)
- Michi (ryupold) - Animation, Special Effects, Movement, Programming, Level Generation
- Helen - Content Creator, Design, Level Generation

*We hope you enjoy playing our game!*
*Greetings from Germany* :smiley: 

![6.png](///raw/151/a1/z/23684.png)
![3.png](///raw/151/a1/z/23688.png)
![7.png](///raw/151/a1/z/23694.png)

entries.title: Super Epic Insurance Fraud 3000
entries.description:
This game is about getting yourself hurt and getting some of that insurance money! :smile:
How much moneys can you get out of your insurance?! Post your highscores below!

## Controls
* Move with W, A, S, D
* Press any key to start
* (Reset the game with Space)

## Core Mechanics
Throw yourself in front of as many cars as you possibly can and avoid the police cars. You get money for every car you hit but you'll get a penalty for hitting police cars! You get more points for getting hit by faster cars. Red cars are heavier and will get you slightly more points on average.

![preview7.gif](///raw/6e2/42/z/23669.gif)

## Art
* The omnipresent [Synty Simple Town](https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/environments/urban/simple-town-cartoon-assets-43500) for Roads, Building and Cars
* The handy [Synty Simple People](https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/characters/humanoids/simple-people-cartoon-characters-15126) for the player character
* The awesome [Lowpoly Style Forest Environment](https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/environments/landscapes/lowpoly-style-forest-environment-98307) for everything else!
* Sound? Nope! Why not, would have made the game way better?! My dumb ass forgot about it :cry: 

## Story
You are Randy. Randy is a simple man, all he wants of life is to be able to kick back, drink a couple of cold ones and never ever spend a second of his precious time working (Also he can't find any because "THEY TOOK ERR JEERRBBS!"). So whenever he's short on money he likes to cheat his insurance company out of theirs. Yes, he's getting himself hurt badly... but at the end of the day, isn't having money all that matters?

## Personal
I have no idea how much hours I put into this. All I know is that I'm dead tired and work will suck tomorrow! :smile: But I'm glad I finished in time and am pretty okay with how it turned out. Yeah, it's not really a full game, no progression, lots of issues and no sound but it's something :rainbow: Hope you'll enjoy it for a minute or two and please let me know what you think! Should i work on it some more and make it into a more complete experience?

entries.title: Ancient Current See
entries.description:
## Ancient Current See

![2019-04-29_20-03-44.png](///raw/8f3/1/z/2314c.png)

### Your World is running out of Power.

You have been sent to the Ancient catacombs in search of the place where your ancestors found a source of unlimited power.

Use your wits, and your life, to get through each room, getting more and more closer to the source of your Worlds source of Life, the Ancient Current See.

### Hints

There are six "levels", and all are completable.

You can drop more than one life at a time.

I was planning on having the ability to collect more life force along the way to allow for more complex puzzles but was not able to get that part completed. 

### Controls 

- WASD to move player
- E to use life or activate items
- F3 to change screen resolution

### History

- 4/30 -- added Desktop binaries for those having issues with Browser version
- 4/29 -- first release

entries.title: Reaping Riches
entries.description:
Reaping Riches is my second ever ludum dare entry, and once again, I created it with my friend William. Scheduling was more of an issue this time around, as it didn't take place during the summer like the last one we participated in, and ultimately we weren't able to make everything we wanted to in the time we have, but we hope that the 2 levels of content that are here are still enough to keep you occupied for a couple of minutes. Reaping Riches is a fast-paced bullet-hellish game in which Gold is everything. You get gold by collecting it scattered throughout the level or taking it from your slain foes. You use gold to pay your way past toll gates. You use your gold as a weapon to defeat monsters. Gold is the source of your life, and if you run out of it, you die. Play as some grim reaper looking guy on a hoverboard as you shoot through tons of enemies and crush (two) giant bosses in your quest to do... nothing, really.

p.s. If you want me to rate your game, just leave a comment. I make it a point to get to all of my commenter's games.

![Untitled2.png](///raw/3eb/b1/z/2356b.png)![Untitled.png](///raw/3eb/b1/z/23579.png)![Untitled3.png](///raw/3eb/b1/z/23e9b.png)![Untitled4.png](///raw/3eb/b1/z/23ece.png)

entries.title: goldenpixel
entries.description:
![goldenpixel.png](///raw/5bb/2/z/2318e.png)
![1.png](///raw/5bb/2/z/23192.png)
![2.png](///raw/5bb/2/z/23193.png)

You are dying of a terrible illness. The treatment is expensive and you are very, very poor. Rob banks to get enough money for your next treatment.

Collect gold throughout the level. When you have enough, run back to the green square to exit the level.

There are multiple ways to complete each level; you can either sneak around, disabling cameras and unlocking doors, or you can blast your way past all the enemies without a care for civilian lives.

If guards or cameras see you with a gun out or unlocking a door, they will start firing at you. 

Barrels will explode when shot, dealing huge amounts of damage.

Every camera is connected to a node. When this is shot, all cameras connected to it are shut down.

Controls are in game.

LINK:
https://klekky.itch.io/goldenpixel

entries.title: Empathy
entries.description:
Welcome to Empathy, a game where you play the role of a depressed man trying to find redemption.

![illus 1.png](///raw/056/d1/z/21e9b.png)
![illus 2.png](///raw/056/d1/z/21e9c.png)

The game is very short, only a few minutes long, and it has 3 different endings depending on your actions (or lack thereof).

WARNING : I haven't tested the Mac and Linux versions, so sorry if they don't work, I don't have the tools necessary to do it.

ABOUT THE GAME : 
Personnaly, I have mixed feelings about this project. On one hand, I learnt a lot while making it, but on the other... It's not a fun game. Or a "game" at all for that matter. If you wanted to have fun, you're on the wrong page x)

But, it doesn't really matter. I had fun while making it, and it was a challenge on some points. I trained my programming and my drawing skills, so that's still a plus in my book.

entries.title: Minus
entries.description:
Can you escape a city where you will be hunted?

![Screenshot 1.PNG](///raw/8bf/21/z/23072.png)

Minus is a 2d platformer in a dystopian world where every life has a value. If it becomes negative, these humans will be hunted. Your goal is to escape from this city.

Also it would like to start a small competition to make the game more fun. Try to get a score as low (not negative high) as possible and post a screenshot of it. The winner at the end of the voting-phade will be added somehow ingame.

![screenshot 2.PNG](///raw/8bf/21/z/2307b.png)

The controls are pretty simple:

You move with ‚ÄòA‚Äô and ‚ÄòD‚Äô or the left and right arrow key and you jump with ‚ÄòC‚Äô or 'Space'
If you get Stuck somewhere you can die with 'R'

![Screenshot 3.PNG](///raw/8bf/21/z/23086.png)

Known issues:

The character can stick to walls very rarely.

![Screenshot 4.PNG](///raw/8bf/21/z/2308c.png)

Now good luck and have fun :)

entries.title: Aging Toads
entries.description:
![Screenshot (163).png](///raw/279/1/z/22f69.png)

Aging toad awaken, transforming to its ancient form.


*There is a legend of subaquatic creatures awakening from ancient times. Once every century they rise to feed and regain their strength. Time diminishes their appearance, but they transforms in short bursts to a heroundus size. Once feed enough they engulf everything in its path and finally falls asleep for another century. Few witness them directly but most can hear it's uproar as the sound of thunder, only the wise knows it's true nature, the sound of aging toads...*

You play as a aging toad awaken from ancient times. The toad need to feed on insects and has 180 lifetime before it falls asleep. The toad can transform to its ancient form for 5s for the cost of 15 lifetime and can then consume bigger insects to grow faster.


# Constrols
## Gamepad
** Left / Right ** - Short hop

** Down ** - Crawl

** A ** - High jump

** B ** - Long jump 

** X /RB ** - Lick up flies

** Y ** - Transform to ancient toad 


## Keyboard

** Left / Right ** - Short hop

** Down ** - Crawl

** Z /Space ** - High jump

** X / Shift ** - Long jump

** C / Left Click ** - Lick up flies

** V / Right Click ** - Transform to ancient toad


# Music

*"Another Way"* CCBY  Psykick http://dig.ccmixter.org/files/Psykick/52938


![Screenshot (162).png](///raw/279/1/z/22f65.png)

![Screenshot (161).png](///raw/279/1/z/22f66.png)

# Change log 
2019-05-03
- Moved the camera 64 pixels up, so GUI under the player is always visible.
- Removed a bug that would make the player stick while jumping very low onto an edge.
- Made it possible to hold down left or right and jump buttons and jump instead of continuing to only move.
- Tweaked a level chunk that used to be impossible to traverse in a specific combination. 
- Fixed a bug when the pipe insect sound would continue to play if they get killed. 
- Now plays transformation sound effect also after transforming back from big to small.
- Now possible to quit the game from the win screen.

entries.title: Lonely Heart
entries.description:
Lonely Heart is a 2D game about a lonely heart. You as the lonely heart is trying to collect three stones. You start with 1000 HP and you have no way to regain them. Between levels you can spend your lives on upgrades, but then you have less hitpoints. The game also has a timer, which allows for speedruns. Post your times in the comments!

There's a few bugs here and there, but nothing major. We will probably patch these after the jam! :smiley: 

### Tools used:
- Unity
- Visual Studio
- paint.net
- Reason
- Audacity

### How to play:
- W,A,S,D for movement
- Left click for melee
- (Unlockable) right click to shoot
- (Unlockable) space for dash

### Features
- 3 Levels
- Upgrades
- Music and sound!
- Three enemy types and one boss

### Screenshots

![LonelyHeartScreenshot1.png](///raw/756/91/z/2225a.png)

![LonelyHeartScreenshot2.png](///raw/756/91/z/2225b.png)

![LonelyHeartScreenshot3.png](///raw/756/91/z/2225c.png)

### Important notes

Thanks for checking out our game! Currently there's a little problem with the UI scaling on WebGL when you're not in fullscreen mode. That will probably be fixed soon! Thanks for playing our game tho! For the best experience you can play our download version! :smiley: https://aveuse.itch.io/lonely-heart

entries.title: dRUNKEN nEIGHBOR
entries.description:
In dRUNKEN nEIGHBOR you are drunk after a party and you must find your own apartment without getting your neighbors mad. Includes branching paths, alcoholic beverages and a dog. (OPEN THE FILE WITH A WEB BROWSER)(PLAY MAXIMIZED) Made with Twine. 

## How to Play

To win the game don't knock at the doors randomly. There are specific tips that you must gather to find your exact apartment. So pay attention to the descriptions and find your way to avoid the police.

## ITCH.IO https://hgvaz.itch.io/drunken-neighbor

entries.title: Bioenfluencer
entries.description:
![imxcJG.png](///raw/85e/32/z/23442.png)
![Intro02noposter.png](///raw/85e/32/z/235eb.png)

*"Followers are love. Followers are life. You need followers."*

Chase impending house debt by biogenetically crafting creatures to sell to a market audience. Hit those trends or the government will take your house.


**Changes**

In our submission, there was a single letter typo bug, which made it difficult to progress

We've uploaded the single letter fix and labelled those files: -bugfix on itch.io. 
The original files are still there in case you prefer to play that version

** Post Jam Version **

If you've already tried the jam version and you want to see our development after the jam, you'll find another version on our itch.io page labelled -post-jam. We've tried to incorporate feedback from everyone who commented here and everyone who streamed the game.

(In interest of fairness, please rate the jam version or the bugfix version, not the post-jam version.)

entries.title: Auto destruction m.a.c.h.i.n.e.
entries.description:
![icona gra ludum.png](///raw/207/52/z/22730.png)

I started late, so I basically had one evening for this. It's my first game on a jam, and one of the first overall, so please don't be harsh. At least i did something productive.. 

"Auto destruction machine" is a simple top-down shooter where you use your health to attack. You need to balance your health to be able to pass all the levels in which you have to kill enemies, use a teleporter and open locked doors.

W, A, S, D - movement   
LMB - shooting   
E - teleport (unlocked later)

-- music and sounds are not mine

entries.title: wArshippers
entries.description:
Gattocorno Production is back with a brand new videogame!
A Deity lives thanks to its faithful followers, Its power depends on their number!
Challenge other Supreme Entities and beat  your opponents to death using your believers as ammunitions! 
Steal other Gods' followers by throwing your proselytes at them, but be careful, do not remain without disciples, your very existence depends on them!

**Please Note:** the game is best played with xbox controllers!

**BUT:** if you really can't get your hand on a pair of those, we've just added keyboard support (up to 2 players)

CONTROLS:

Xbox Controllers
+ Left stick: Movement
+ A: Dash
+ X: Shoot

Keyboard Controllers (player 1)
+ Arrows: Movement
+ N: Dash
+ M: Shoot

Keyboard Controllers (player 2)
+ W/A/S/D: Movement
+ T: Dash
+ R: Shoot

GAME FEATURES:
+ Shooting game
+ Multiplayer up 4 players
+ Original soundtrack

CREDITS:
+ Daniela Sonia Pessot ‚Äì 2D Artist & UI Designer
+ Davide Della Casa Venturelli ‚Äì Game Programmer
+ Giammarco Agazzotti ‚Äì Game Programmer
+ Giulia Zoccarato ‚Äì 2D Artist & Animator
+ Giulio Bursi ‚Äì Sound Designer
+ Luca Gatti ‚Äì Game Programmer

[ Game developed in 72 hours | Ludum Dare 44, April 2019 ]

entries.title: Dovregubben
entries.description:
![logo-litn.png](///raw/4c/z/227c9.png)

Can you evade the troll for long enough for the sun to rise and turn it to stone before you perish, and can you afford risking your life by plunging downhill to get ahead of this foe?

![2-kopi.png](///raw/4c/z/227e9.png)

A loose but working interpretation of the theme. Your life is not currency in the sense of money, but you can choose to "pay with your life" (to an extent) by jumping several platforms down when the risk seems worth it.

I usually do three day jams, but I was moving to a new home this weekend and missed the first day‚Äîstill happy I got something together!

---

## Credits üëí

* Ava Skoog

Sounds from [zapsplat.com](https://www.zapsplat.com/).

Partial melody by Edvard Grieg (*In the hall of the mountain king* / *I dovregubbens hall*) is public domain. I used a MIDI and cut out a part of the song and assigned my own instrumentation and tempo and made it loop properly.

---

## Controllers üéÆ

Keyboard only. Arrows or AD to move left and right, down arrow or S to jump straight down.

---

![1x3-kopi.png](///raw/4c/z/227fb.png)

entries.description:

Supports USB controllers for 1-4 players.

![dungeon-boast_0.gif](///raw/de1/3/z/2300f.gif)

entries.title: The Tree of Bounty

Create conditions for Bountiful life to thrive around you, which in turn gives you Life to create even better conditions!

Inspired by Conway's Game of Life, but on a hex grid and with flowers and birds and stuff :)
