entries.title: Boskov
entries.description:
Game done during the Ludum Dare Jam 44 (Theme : Your life is currency), in which you are a prison supervisor and you must maintain Vladimir Pouchkov awake, eventually alive, otherwise he won't give you the needed information he knows. Your weapons ? Coffee, a bucket filled with water, your own voice to yell at him and other crazy stuff you'll discover during the game. Good luck !

To be able to play, you need a mic and a Xbox controller.

Controls : 
- Mic = Yell at Vladimir
- Button A = Smash / Calm down Vladimir
- Button B = Press / Give him coffee
- Button X = Press / Drop water on him
- ‚ÄãTrigger LT = Press / Put on some music‚Äã
- Trigger RT = Maintain / Activate the microphone‚Äã
- Left Joystick = Rotate / Recharge the battery‚Äã

Credits : Corto Pavie / Lucas Kauff / Kilian Allaire / Elie Sarfati / Maxence Droz

entries.title: Lifetime
entries.description:
Life is short.

Seek out androids and kill them to steal some of their lifetime. 

Break crates to get weapons.

Stay alive and use your extra lifetime to purchase upgrades.

**CONTROLS**

WASD to move around.
Mouse to aim and attack.

![screenshot 1.PNG](///raw/eae/9/z/23ea1.png)
![screenshot 2.PNG](///raw/eae/9/z/23ea2.png)
![screenshot 3.PNG](///raw/eae/9/z/23ea3.png)

entries.title: Mutant Alien Zombie Hunter
entries.description:
![ld_preview.png](///raw/4b5/81/z/22556.png)

Fight off waves of enemies and beat the boss. Earn evolution points by killing the enemies and spend them on powerful upgrades if you die and need to try again. However, keep in mind that every installed upgrade has an HP cost.

Controls:
  - WASD or arrows to move
  - Mouse to look around and swing your blade on click
  - Shift and Space trigger some abilities and are described on the upgrade screen 

This game was made from scratch (code-wise) in Godot by 4 people. Some of the assets are our own and were also made from scratch, but others are used based on their free license. The full list of the used assets is below.

Used graphics:
  - Beam (https://opengameart.org/content/lasers-and-beams)
  - Zombie by Riley Gombart or ChessMasterRiley (https://opengameart.org/content/animated-top-down-zombie)
  - Alien by MillionthVector (http://millionthvector.blogspot.de, https://opengameart.org/content/set-faction3-spaceships)
  - Boss by MillionthVector (http://millionthvector.blogspot.de, https://opengameart.org/content/set-faction10-spacestations)

Used audio:
  - Sound effects (http://soundbible.com)
  - "Eventide" by Purple Planet Music (https://www.purple-planet.com)

Notes:
  - Dying and trying again after buying upgrades is a part of the game, don't worry if it seems too hard at first :)
  - If the game shows black screen, try reloading the browser tab (we also had reports of crashing when the mouse cursor was on the page during the reload, so try to keep it away). Sorry for the inconvenience, we'll try to take a look if this is something we can fix

entries.title: Spare Life
entries.description:
![Screenshot (49).png](///raw/27c/21/z/23200.png)

You are a lonely dude. You can fix that. You can sacrifice part of your ability to gain the friendship of another.

Use your newfound skills to reach the end!


**Controls:**


**Keyboard and Mouse:**

A or D (Left or Right) - Move

Space or W - Jump

Left Mouse - Shoot

Left Shift - Dash

E - Sacrifice

Q - Swap Guns



**Switch Pro Controller (if input isn't registering, connect via Bluetooth):**

Left Joystick - Move

Left or Right joystick - Aim

Y or Right Trigger - Shoot

Left Trigger - Dash

B - Jump

A - Sacrifice

X - Swap Guns


**Best of luck!**

Proceed to the itch.io link for the download VVV

entries.title: Soulbound
entries.description:
You are a lone human trapped in the underworld, and your freedom rests in the cruel paws of the Sphinx. 

In order to escape, you'll need to sell pieces of your soul to the hungry devils in exchange for their aid. Just make sure not to give up too much...

------------------------------------------------------------------------

‚ÄãControls:
WASD to move
E to talk to NPCs
Click buttons and characters in combat
Banish your allied demons to break their contracts and consume their souls yourself.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

‚ÄãWritten in C# with Unity.
Sprites made with GIMP, Piskel, and MSPaint.
Models made in Blender.

"Desert of Lost Souls" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

entries.title: Invest¬Æ
entries.description:
Invest¬Æ is the world's only peer to peer investigation service. And you're on an investigation! Discover the fate of Clark Newton before the culprit gets off-world.

And remember, a successful investigation is a successful investment!

Built with Inkle Studios' [Ink](https://www.inklestudios.com/ink/). Most images were CC0 or purchased from a marketplace, so opting out of graphics.

entries.title: Take them with you
entries.description:
This is our first Ludum Dare. Don't judge too strictly, we tried :) Enjoy!

Something bad is happening at the basement of one research institute. A terrible computer virus broke free, captured several working machines and no one can stop it... except for three small cleaning robots. They can't fight, but they can help to destroy them! But at what cost? Depends on your actions. 

![Screen02.png](///raw/243/32/z/21c63.png)

![Screen01.png](///raw/243/32/z/21c64.png)

![Screen03.png](///raw/243/32/z/21c65.png)

We're the team of two people, we made this game in Jam mode in 2.5 days.
We used: Unity3d, Blender, Photoshop

Thanks for your feedback!

entries.title: Tiny Roguelike
entries.description:
Gain abilities by killing enemies.
Enemies only engage from a certain range.
Learn what they each do to master risking new abilities for health.
There is no healing.
Get points for each staircase you go down.

entries.title: Moneycorp: your life is our currency
entries.description:
![ld44e.PNG](///raw/eb2/2/z/21f21.png)

![ld44d.PNG](///raw/eb2/2/z/21f25.png)

![ld44f.PNG](///raw/eb2/2/z/23c31.png)



You are tasked with typing AI-generated messages and sending them to the company clients!
Don't mess up!


Music made by Michael Sj√∂berg: https://soundcloud.com/ichaeljberg

entries.title: A Miner's Life
entries.description:
![Aminerlife.png](///raw/101/22/z/22f5f.png)

## The game

Play a miner who needs to feed an horrible Alien with gems to regain life.

But there is a twist, a stock exchange system determines how much life each type of gems is worth.

![stock.png](///raw/101/22/z/2327b.png)
 
You'd better feed the right gem at the right time to stay alive.
 
Your life is definitely a currency for this sadistic Alien....

## Controls

Classic platformer controls:
- arrows left and right to move
- spacebar to jump
- walk over the gems to grab them
- walk over the alien to feed the alien
- head to the wall to wallglide

![wallglide.png](///raw/101/22/z/23292.png)

## Credits

A home brew game done with my sons, son's friend and nephew:
- myrmyxo (david) : graphics/animation/level design
- remtom (r√©mi) : code/sound/level design
- Gogolexicomatisation (Hugo) : code
- oddarock (corrado) : code
- ethan : sound

We would really enjoy your comments and suggestions. It is very far from being polished we hope you still enjoy it a little bit.

Thanks!

entries.title: Mojo
entries.description:
## :scroll: Summary
You travel through the spirit realm, trade your life for upgrades.

* Switch between Good/Bad dimensions.
* Buy upgrades in the Good dimension. Moving in the Good costs life.
* Traders will come to you as soon as you enter the Good realm.
* Collect Life (currency) in the Bad dimension.
* Kill the boss to win the game.

:bulb: **ProTip**: Buy upgrades every time you have full health.

## :mouse_three_button: Controls
* WASD or Arrows to move.
* SPACE to attack.
* Hold Right Mouse button to strafe and Aim with mouse.


* Press bottom right UI button to switch dimension.
* Walk up to trader to shop.

## :camera: Showcase

![screen.jpg](///raw/49e/8/z/23b1b.jpg)

![traders.png](///raw/49e/8/z/23b32.png)

![spells.gif](///raw/49e/8/z/23b36.gif)

![curve.gif](///raw/49e/8/z/23b38.gif)

![enemies.png](///raw/49e/8/z/23b39.png)


*Every asset is selfmade during the jam. (textures, models, animations, scripts, shaders)*


:warning: **Known Bugs** 
* Rotating the camera in the start makes you fall through the ground.
* Sometimes after dying, the game "pauses".

Thanks for reporting!

entries.title: Lifes to Spare
entries.description:

Your life, your blood, is the currency to overcome every obstacle.

entries.title: Wu-Wei
entries.description:
![wu169.png](///raw/349/91/z/23a78.png)


*What one says is right, the other says is wrong. And what one says is wrong, the other says is right! If we seek to go beyond ‚Äúright and wrong‚Äù we need to seek out the light of true understanding.*


**Controls:** 

Movement: WASD

Restart Level: R

Back to Menu: Escape

Interact: Space


**Dev Note:** I wanted to do something that made me really uncomfortable.. I've tried puzzle / level design before and gave up mid jam. I had a goal going into the jam of completing a level based game with at least 20 levels w/ enough mechanics to make levels not feel like repeated clones.. I will admit I am awful at level design and this was not easy.. but the amount that we learned feels well worth it. I'm proud of the game delivered in the time (always wishing for more to complete more ideas) and hope folks enjoy!

entries.title: Life Engineer
entries.description:
![vid.gif](///raw/2c9/22/z/23e03.gif)

Hello, this is my first game jam. I'm 12 and this is my first game on Unity, so, go easy on me. I made all the music, art and programming.

In this game you can build strange creatures. This game is a sandbox.

**Download:** Open the link and click the download button in the right top corner

**Controls:**
You can change the instrument with icons on the left.
1. Join/build body parts
2. Delete body parts
3. Place body parts

To place body part, select instrument 3 and grab the part from the bottom icons.
To delete body part, select instrument 2 and click the part you want to delete.
To join parts, select instrument 1 and click the first part (It will be limited for the rotation from current angle (Limits: Min -75 deg, max 75 deg)). Click second part. Body parts connected!

That's all! Have any questions? Write them down in the comments! Good luck! And press the "Wiggle" switch :)

![reclama.gif](///raw/2c9/22/z/24c2e.gif)

entries.title: I Burn
entries.description:
This game is about you, me & everyone else. This is one of the weirdest things I've ever done, but it's LDJam, so whats the point if not making something weird!

Till the last moment, there were many texts in the game, and I decided to remove all of it, and make you feel, imagine & remember your own stories. This can be more biased to be an experience than a game, but still, it is worth a play! It won't take long from you!

**Team:** Just me
https://twitter.com/_mamoniem

entries.title: Drop of life
entries.description:
Two students in animation and one developer (and not game developer !) decided to co-op for this ludum dare and created Drop of life !

![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/298/22/z/2425b.gif)

The goal of this game is simple, there is a pillar that give you some drop of life. These drops are your life so you have to protect this pillar from the monsters that come to 
destroy it.

For that, you can just kill them with a basic attack (button 1 or space) or you can use some skills but if you do this, you have to pay with your drops of life (button 2 or f for shield and button 3 or shift for dash) So be aware of your life and defend your pillar üôÇ!

![tutorail.png](///raw/298/22/z/23acc.png)

This prototype has only one infinite round of enemies just to get a feeling of the game :v: . In the future we want to add multiples round with more difficult enemies and boss :muscle: !

![Credits_00000.png](///raw/298/22/z/22ab1.png)

Music by [Heatley Bros](https://www.youtube.com/user/HeatleyBros) ("8 bit evil!")

## UPDATES

#### 30 april

~~He heard you for the problem with the keys ! We are looking to change it ;). Also we are looking to add a new wave of enemies for more fun and testing :v: !~~
The new inputs has been edited for more comfort ! Moreover, the monster spawner has been fixed :tada: ! They now spawn infinitely for more joy (and quicker and quicker)

entries.title: Cyber Radiation
entries.description:
You are a cyborg who was sent in a mission to cover up an accident that happened in a secret nuclear power plant. All of the worker robots there have been corrupted by radiation. But remember, the only energy you have to power up your weapons, is your own!

### Controls:
WASD - Move

Left Mouse Button: Primary Fire

Right Mouse Button: Secondary Fire (uses your own hp)

![Game 1.png](///raw/b2/z/2378b.png)
![Game 2.png](///raw/b2/z/2378c.png)

### Update 1 - Fixed a bug where the game would spawn multiple bosses in the same room.
### Update 2 - Fixed a bug which prevented enemies from dropping health (green icons).

entries.title: Deal With the Devil
entries.description:
![Deal With The Devil_2019-04-30_16-52-29.png](///raw/9a9/81/z/23eb4.png)All sound effects,  music, code, art and game design was done by us. We did not make the font.

This is our 3rd Ludum Dare entry. You can check the others out on our page.

In this game, you play as Frank trying to pay off a ... "loan". Frank needs some money, so he sells his soul to the devil but there's a catch. He has to kill all of the devils escaped prisoners and send them back to hell. The devil will keep his soul until this is complete.

We were going to add a mechanic where you could heal yourself, at the expense of some of the souls you collected for the devil, but ran out of time. The enemy design and combat system could definitely use some work, the weapons were going to inflict debuffs on the enemies, making them useful for different situations.

I think it was a little too ambitious for us in a weekend, and it's something to learn from. 



Controls:

W A S D / Arrow Keys - Movement

Shift - Dash

Q E - Switch spells

Space - Pause

Click - Fire !![Deal With The Devil_2019-04-30_16-53-31.png](///raw/9a9/81/z/23eb6.png)

entries.title: Lifetris
entries.description:
Life, one line at a time.

A game by Fully Bugged Software.

1 and 2 player modes.


Scoring:
--------

Landing a tetromino: **1 pt**

Clearing a line: **10 pts**

Reaching the top of the screen: **-50 pts**


Controls:
---------
```
F12                     - Capture a screenshot
BACKSPACE               - Restart the game

Player1
-------

Move Left               - Left arrow
Move Right              - Right arrow
Drop                    - Down arrow
Rotate Clockwise        - Right Control/Right Option
Rotate CounterClockwise - Right Shift/Right Command

... or gamepad #1

Player2
-------

Move Left               - A
Move Right              - D
Drop                    - S
Rotate Clockwise        - E
Rotate CounterClockwise - Q

... or gamepad #2
```

Credits in readme.txt![Lifetris.png](///raw/6f1/52/z/21c42.png)

entries.title: Corporate Hamster
entries.description: Your life is ‚Äúmy‚Äù currency. The game (Corporate hamster) is about an average joe stuck in the wheel of capitalism continuously grinding and overcoming financial problems making peanuts in comparison to his boss. The boss sees the player‚Äôs life as nothing but currency.

entries.title: A Lively Village
entries.description:
![rsz_highresscreenshot00001.png](///raw/ced/d/z/22c00.png)

You are a magical living Village and everything that it has in it. 
Your life depends on the well-being of the people who live on your surface: Humans, Elves and Dwarves. That means you have to look after their resources: if one of those reaches too high in number or goes to zero you loose your living power. 

![aaaaaaa.png](///raw/ced/d/z/22c67.png)

All kinds of strange events happen in the Village, but with your will you may decide whether to let things happen or not. However, certain decisions harm you while helping the people. Can you survive for long enough and maintain equality in resources? 

![rsz_highresscreenshot00014.png](///raw/ced/d/z/22e3b.png)
The Village can then develop into a Town, a City and other stages, with its buildings and culture changing with time.
We designed the first stage for this Demo: the traditional, pre-industrial fantasy village.

P.S.: Yeah, we know it's more of the 'Tiny Town' theme than 'Your life is currency', but in the end it's sort of a combination of both. We really enjoyed working on them. 
No regrets though ¬Ø\\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø

# Description

** WELCOME TO THE FUTURE! THE FUTURE OF FASCINATING MUTANTS! **

In this future, your life is the only valuable thing you have. And the only way to succeed is to participate in fights at the mutant arena, where you spend your HP on mutations. And the only way to get more HP is killing other mutants.

But you should choose wisely, the more HP you spend, the less HP you have at the beginning of the fight!

**KILL > GAIN > SPEND!**

www.youtube.com/watch?v=zc48G7WlGWE

# Genre

Top-down arena shooter with AAAAAAH and bananas

# Controls

- Movement - WSAD
- Shoot - LMB
- Change weapon - Scroll

Recommended to play in fullscreen mode

entries.title: Tecuhtliztacuhxochitl's Sacrifice Simulator
entries.description:
---

Tecuhtliztacuhxochitl's Sacrifice Simulator is a game about growing a colony of farmers, warriors, and civilians with the help/hindrance of a sadistic deity.  

Made by @adafheyesh (code, art, music) and @almost (code, UI)

---
### Summary:
* The god offers things in exchange for human sacrifices
* VICTORY is an offer in the permanent demands tab
* Permanent demands upgrade your people

---
## Controls:  
* **Mouse**  
* **Pause time** - spacebar or the pause button **(for planning and reading)**  
---
### Sacrificing:  
* Choose effect, choose people, click sacrifice  
* **Some offers have multiple requirements**  
---
### People:
* **Can change profession in the People tab**  
* Farmers produce food  
* Civilians give birth to new people  
* Warriors increase army strength  
---
### Mechanics:  
* Food < population ‚áí starvation (damage over time).  
* Army < invaders ‚áí damage to some people  
* Time passes ‚áí People level up ‚áí more efficient.
* Profession change ‚áí reset level.
* Max level can be increased with Permanent Demands.  
* Max population is 10.  
---
### Tips:  
* **Increase your population size early**.  
* Once you have 5+ people, it's ok to sacrifice, you can repopulate.  
* **It's ok to take some damage**. Plague / Invaders / Starvation are not game over.  
* **Use the pause button** to plan ahead and to read things.

---

Note: there is a victory message, but the game will keep playing.  

---

![screen8 release.png](///raw/974/1/z/23923.png)

![screen9.png](///raw/974/1/z/23924.png)

entries.title: Evil Current
entries.description:
Your life as an electric _current_. 

As sentient electricity, you do not need to follow the wires that have been laid out, you are free to choose your own path. Utilize this power to conquer the world (or, I mean, the levels that we ended up completing in time).

## HOW TO PLAY

Click on marked points on wires to enable/disable paths. Moving through some wires will also turn on connected electromagnets or servos.

BLUE wires have current in them, GREY ones do not.

In order to progress to next levels, you have to close all switches that prevent power from reaching those levels.

## NOTE

This game is quite raw and unfinished, as around 70  hours were spent writing a game engine from scratch, figuring out how physics is supposed to work, implementing collisions, etc., and only the last few hours were allocated for actual game development. But even so, the third and fourth level turned out fun for even ourselves in the end, so hopefully you'll get a kick out of this game, albeit only briefly.

![evil_current.gif](///raw/bae/31/z/236e7.gif)

entries.title: Mobile Protection Unit HEADLESS
entries.description:
HEADLESS is a PSX-styled tactics game, in which you fight using cover and tactics instead of with brute force

![headless_1.png](///raw/91/z/237a2.png)

### Controls
A controller is *highly recommended*. Chrome is a bit finnicky with controllers, but Firefox seems to be fairly reliable. If you can't get controller support working:
```
Z -> A
X -> B
C -> X
V -> Y
SPACE -> START```
I know this is a bad layout in some countries, so apologies in advance.

**Start/Space will skip the rather long dialogue sections, which you'll probably want to do after your first attempt.**

### What the heck do I do

I realized this is LD, so many of you simply don't have time to read the dialog. So here's a quick rundown of what you need to do:
* Pick up a Dorothy XL Gatling gun. They look like this: 

![gatling.PNG](///raw/91/z/237d1.png)
* Shoot The Beast, which can be found near the middle of the map
* Every two shots, the gatling gun is junk and needs to be replaced.
* The Beast's attacks will **instantly kill you**. Stay behind buildings.
* You will instantly lose if The Beast is not shot at least once per round.
* Once Shiki does her magic, all that's left to do is gun it down using normal attacks without getting yourself killed.

#### Known bugs
Controllers don't work in all browsers. Firefox seems to be fairly good at working (Tested with an Xbox 1 wireless controller). Chrome seems to be good at knowing a controller is attached, and bad at actually forwarding input. No idea on other browsers.

#### Credits/Technologies
* Code: @fireslash
* Art/story: @kiririn51
* Music: [Zircon](http://zirconmusic.com/)

SFX from: [Syna-Max](https://freesound.org/people/Syna-Max/), [unfa](https://freesound.org/people/unfa/), and [wangshoukun](https://freesound.org/people/wangzhuokun/)

Written in Haxe; while dragging Heaps along, kicking and screaming the whole way.

entries.title: Golden Galaxy
entries.description:
Golden Galaxy is a "Space Invaders" type of game, in which you are required to defeat waves of enemies and proceed until you reach final boss.

![scr1.png](///raw/d35/61/z/2295d.png)

Your ship is powered by gold (Which comes in satchels and coins) and taking damage will remove one piece of it. This is important because gold can be used to purchase artifacts which will greatly help in figthing enemies. Shops can be found at the end of each stage and randomly throughout the level. And while gold is reset between stages so there is no reason not to buy everything (That is if you can afford it!), shops mid-level will remove your life and make you easier to kill.

![scr2.png](///raw/d35/61/z/229fe.png)

There are 8 unique artifacts, 5 common and 3 rare, each of them with stackable effects (That means getting more than one of the specific artifact will make it even more powerful). Coins and satchels can be obtained from chests and enemies. In addition satchels can generate 1 coin per cleared wave with 33% chance of succeding, but are a lot more rare than coins. Your coins are reset on stage completion (Not satchels though) to specific amount which can be altered by one of the artifacts.

![scr3.png](///raw/d35/61/z/22a93.png)

I really enjoyed this Ludum Dare even if theme was not something I was hoping for and I went for pretty safe implementation of it.

![scr4.png](///raw/d35/61/z/22ac1.png)

Some additional tips:

Always spend all of your coins at the X-10, they are reset next level anyway.

Try to hold on your satchels early on because they generate coins, unless upgrade is really tempting.

Try to get as many upgrades as possible before reaching 5-10

Arrow keys - Movement

Z - Use/Shoot

Update: I fixed 2 bugs and added 2 QOL changes (Hopefully they are allowed):

-Fixed the particles of player ship and homing missile not being properly centered.

-Fixed the "Artisan's Lens". Because of an oversight, it would work only so often. Now it works all the time making it very powerful item.

-Added AZERTY keyboard "support" - by support I mean that now both Z and W can be used to shoot/use.

-Added disclaimer in shops that you will lose all your coins if you proceed, as this mechanic was only mentioned in the description.

-Decreased difficulity of one particular room with 4 dart ships (There are only 2 now).

entries.title: Belinda Bloodmage
entries.description:
Hello Ludum Dare! This is my third LD in which I've 'finished' a game. Last LD I struggled for ideas and ended up giving up and not finishing, and I didn't want to repeat that, so with somewhat limited time this weekend I decided to keep things real simple and keep the scope small. It's not anything groundbreaking but I'm proud of finishing it after again nearly giving up on a LD, and I've learnt some things, and certainly found some more things that I should try to improve on in future. Anyway, hope you all had a good Ludum Dare, enjoy my game, and I look forward to playing everyone elses!

Belinda (the one armed*) Bloodmage:
![screenShot.png](///raw/bc2/41/z/23df4.png)
Your goal is to defeat the enemies and collect enough blood to summon the Blood Lord. Can you defeat Bloodlord, the Lord of Blood?

Instructions:

WASD to move

Left mouse button to shoot

Sapce to cast blood magic that shoots in all directions at the cost of health

*She has one arm because I'm bad at art, and only noticed when it was far too late.

entries.title: STR!PES
entries.description:
# Contest outcome
**As I promised those who played and rated my project, I give a free key of my previous game Theorem available on Steam (five best scores). Send me a message at this address : 1337geckoo@gmail.com **

_______________________________________________

**For an unknown reason, a hacker has decided to destroy my leaderboard online. So for a while it was not reachable. It‚Äôs a pity. I fixed it today, ~~but all previous scores have been lost~~. Thank you for your comprehension. Also I would like to promote this cool project, offering for the best five players a free key of my previous game which is available on Steam - [Theorem](https://store.steampowered.com/app/838490/Theorem). This contest runs until LD results. Try if you dare :) **

_______________________________________________
**your life is (con)currency**

Done! This is my entry for the 44th LudumDare session. I create a super-hexagon clone, changing the chosen theme for something a little bit different - your life is (con)currency. In computer science, **_concurrency_** refers to the ability of different parts of a program or algorithm to be executed in partial order, without affecting the final outcome. In my project there is only code - some procedural generation for shapes and stripes - no sprite, no prefab, no physics, no implicite value (excepted a radius PI). I optimized each part of code so as to reach the lowest execution using a simple (but efficient) pooling system and an improved implementation of coroutine. Also I use a leaderboard on-line so as to save best scores. This way all players can rival with others. Of course, like in the original game, the main gameplay is really really hard, but with training you can reach some good score and skill. Try it if you dare ++

![ii.jpeg](///raw/991/z/21e51.jpg)
![kk.jpeg](///raw/991/z/21e52.jpg)
![ll.jpeg](///raw/991/z/21e53.jpg)

I did a video for those who don't want to play. I guess that it's enough so that you can understand the gameplay, the main aesthetic and the smooth execution. Not my best score :)

https://youtu.be/SCC3W4h-u-E
___________________________________________________
**I did another version of this project which has been modified according some comments about hitboxes. Now there is no penality when you hit a collider on its side. It's true! The game is more interesting this way - and easier. I optimized some part of code, adding a flicker fx on stripes, allowing to change speed during game (use arrows up and down) and more...**

entries.title: Piggy the Bank
entries.description:
![cover.gif](///raw/f5d/42/z/20d3d.gif)

![coin.gif](///raw/f5d/42/z/20cc8.gif)

Meet Piggy.

Piggy is a bank. But not just some ordinary bank, no! Piggy is nothing less than a master-crafted ceramic piggy bank, one of its kind. State-of-the-art, really. 

As all piggy banks, Piggy is drawn to coins ‚Äì it has an insatiable desire for collecting all the coins his small universe can offer. But there's a danger lurking nearby ‚Äì the Collector, a hammer-wielding entity with the same goal as the Piggy. And the Collector won't hesitate to bang the Piggy to get all its coins!

But Piggy is not about to give up its savings.

So it starts running.

![piggy_17.gif](///raw/f5d/42/z/2252e.gif)

*Piggy the Bank* is a game inspired by the endless runners and life itself. You are controlling a piggy bank called Piggy that is on the run from the fearful Collector ‚Äì if you get hit by Collector's hammer, the game ends. Your goal is to manage the intake of coins for as long as you can in two aspects.

‚Äì More COINS mean more weight and thus slower SPEED. Eventually, you might be just standing on the spot waiting to be bashed. Don't forget to release coins in the time of need!

‚Äì Manage your coins MULTIplier. It will multiply the number of coins that you currently have with the duration for which you will be able to hold them. Whenever there is a change in the number of coins you have, you'll SCORE the multiplier (add the value to your total) and the multiplier resets.

.

**CONTROLS**

LEFT, RIGHT: movement speed

UP: jump

DOWN: drop coin

Z: back

X: start game

![piggy_5.gif](///raw/f5d/42/z/224b1.gif)

# MAGICAL FARTS

@Kusaihana : Programming

@Twister : Programming & Music

@nicneznic : Game design & Playtesting

@TheSunshineRaven : Graphics & Sounds

Made in PICO-8 (first time in PICO for everyone!)

entries.title: Vital Operations
entries.description:
### :warning: This game contains pixellated depictions of blood, gore and body horror. :warning: 

Dr. Stein is a surgeon with a unique way of performing transplants on his patients. Their lives are in his hands, and his life is in your hands. Will you have a successful operation, or die trying?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T9PzoOBOrVM

## Screenshots

![Vital Operations - Menu for page.png](///raw/360/1/z/22e51.png)

![Vital Operations - Patient needs body part.png](///raw/360/1/z/223bd.png)

![Vital Operations - Operating table.png](///raw/360/1/z/223be.png)

![Vital Operations - To the door.png](///raw/360/1/z/2240f.png)

# How to play
- Use WASD or arrow keys to move
- Press X to interact with a patient
- Use the mouse to operate on your own parts by clicking and dragging within the red lines according to which body part the patient needs. 
 - If done correctly, the limb will come off and you can click and drag it to the patient's missing body part. 
 - Each body part you give up gives you 100 points. 
- Move to the door up north to spend your points and regain your body parts and blood (health represented by the red bar at the top). 
- The goal is to prevent your blood supply from completely draining. 

## Organ/Limb prices (based on the number of organs you go to the shop with)

Prices to repair your missing limbs/organs: 
- **1** :arrow_right: 200
- **2** :arrow_right: 300
- **3** :arrow_right: 350
- **4** :arrow_right: 400

## Updates
### **May 1, 2019:** 
- Shop now works as intended.
- Mouse cursor is now hidden during operations.
- Knife is bigger in size.
- Victory/game over music no longer overlaps when you complete an operation/lose.

entries.title: Black Market Crackdown
entries.description:
![Boss.png](///raw/90d/2/z/22fdf.png)

**Space Merchant Action Game**

![LevelSummary.png](///raw/90d/2/z/22fef.png)

When the government starts enforcing authoritarian policies, your life as an ordinary citizen comes to an end. Risk your Life Force to because a black market space merchant and deliver contraband to the people who need it the most! Fight off space pirates, who are eager to get their hands on your cargo!

![Map.png](///raw/90d/2/z/22ffb.png)

**Enjoy this intense procedurally-generated Space Action game!**

![Cruising.png](///raw/90d/2/z/22fe5.png)

entries.title: With It Or On It
entries.description:
![Cover image](///content/256/c/z/23f18.png)

### About
With it or on it. There is no middle ground. You can be the last Spartan resisting Persian invasion of Thermopylae. You will die today, but you will take as many enemies with you as you can.
### How to play?
Stab, hit, slam and bash your enemies. You will become stronger after each received hit. Every spilled drop of your blood makes you more furious and increases your combat abilities. Use this adventage to decimate your enemies.

### Controls

| Button  | Action |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| **A**  | Move left  |
| **D**  | Move right  |
| **W** or **Spacebar**  | Jump  |
| **Mouse L-click**  | Attack  |

### Screenshots

![Zrzut ekranu z 2019-04-30 23-02-25.png](///raw/256/c/z/23f1b.png)
![Zrzut ekranu z 2019-04-30 23-02-59.png](///raw/256/c/z/23f1c.png)

entries.title: Goal: Bounty
entries.description:
![Logo.jpg](///raw/607/22/z/23f3a.jpg)

This game is a runner mixed with QTE. To JUMP you need to use the UP arrow, to CROUCH you need to use the DOWN arrow and to DASH forward you need to use the RIGHT Arrow.
About the theme, the bounty represente the value of the thief life, don't know if it works for you, but it worked for us ;)

Thank you for trying this game, hope you'll like it ! Feel free to leave a comment :D



/!\ DISCLAIMER /!\

The sound effects was founded on the wedsite ZapSplat. But the music have been made by us.
Every 3D models have been made by us.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ABOUT THE GAME
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

It's a game that let you be a thief that want to give value to his life. In order to do that he start to rob a lot of things. But be careful, every mistake you do could be you're last one... Have you listen?  The head-hunter is comming to you.

The best bounty we made is around 17000$
Let us see in the comments how many you did :)

![screenshot1.png](///raw/607/22/z/23b47.png)

![screenshot2.png](///raw/607/22/z/23b48.png)

![screenshot3.png](///raw/607/22/z/23b49.png)

entries.title: Cashier Simulator 2019
entries.description:
![Splash - Kopie.png](///raw/78c/31/z/226bd.png)
by @marcari (artwork) and @fraukauz (programming)

**[Download here](https://teamgarnelio.itch.io/cashier-simulator-2019)**

You are a passionate cashier and currency connoisseur. You love currencies. You can put together change in your sleep. **CURRENCIES ARE YOUR LIFE**.

Yep, it‚Äôs a cashier simulator.

### How to play ###

![0 instr.png](///raw/78c/31/z/23b82.png)
When a new customer arrives, you have to react fast! The longer the person waits, the less time bonus you will get.

![1 instr.png](///raw/78c/31/z/23b83.png)
The customer's money appears on the plate. The display shows the amount of money that you have to return. I hope there is no technical problem with the display, such as temporarily malfunction üòú!

![2 instr.png](///raw/78c/31/z/23b8a.png)
Are you a tidy person üòá? You may clean up the plate, but you don't have to. Let's see how this turns out otherwise... 

![3 instr.png](///raw/78c/31/z/23b86.png)
Place the change money on the customer's hand and click confirm. The customer doesn't accept less money, but more money is okay. Rounding up is the easy and quick way, but be careful, that'll give you a point deduction!

![4 instr.png](///raw/78c/31/z/23b88.png)
If you're running out of change coins, request more! Whops, what a mess. I hope there's enough coins of the type that you were looking for.

![5 instr.png](///raw/78c/31/z/23b89.png)
Argh! The line of customers grew and it got out of hand! **You loose if there are >12 customers waiting**.

### Rules ###
- You will earn 100 Points for each customer
- If you are fast enough (<20 sec) you will get a bonus
- If you are not careful and return too much money, the difference will be taken from your score
- If the line of customers grows too large the game will end
- Place the change in the customers hand by dragging the coins to it and click "Confirm"
- If you run out of coins, click "Get more change money"

![BlogEntry.png](///raw/78c/31/z/23baa.png)

### About us ###
This is **our second jam together** and we decided on some experiments this time. We first changed roles! **The artist was doing the code work and the programmer the art work**.

We also tried out an unusual (at least for games) technology for implementation: Microsoft WPF + C#. You can see the result for yourself üòÖ. We also did sound recording for the first time, but sadly due to time we didn't add a background music. 

We used the following tools: Microsoft Visual Studio 2017 Community, Affinity Photo, Quick Time Player (for sound recording).

### Hints and Known bugs ###
- The game looks best in a window of size 1440 x 900. The window can be resized.
- The drag and drop functionality is a bit buggy. Even if this contradicts with the aim of the game, we recommend medium mouse-drag speed üòÖ.
- (to be continued, **let us know in the comments!**)

**Have fun trying out the game!! Let us know what you think!**

entries.title: Invade Spacers
entries.description: Take the fight to them! A space invaders style boss rush game. Fight the capitol ships of the alien race. Collect and spend your extra lives on upgrades.  ![Game Start.PNG](///raw/905/42/z/23c87.png)![Upgrades.PNG](///raw/905/42/z/23c88.png)![Almost Won.PNG](///raw/905/42/z/23c89.png)

entries.title: Choice Master
entries.description:
Spend your years wisely as you choose your way through life. See if you can die of old age before poverty, sickness or sadness kill you first!

Designed and developed by Daniel Black, art by Ben Moss, audio by Robert Shaffer.

Use the mouse for everything.

entries.title: Nebula Rush
entries.description:
A Space Shooter where you pay for upgrades not with an in-game currency, but with your own lifetime.

![nebula.png](///raw/809/22/z/22603.png)
![Bez¬†tytu≈Çu.png](///raw/809/22/z/22605.png)

Features:
10 enemies with unique weapons
Infinite waves to fight through
An upgrade system
3 Special attacks - bullet-clearing explosion, temporary shield, and a powerful laser

Controls:
Mouse - movement
Left mouse button - fire
Right mouse button - special attack
Middle mouse button - change special attack

entries.title: Rotten Planet
entries.description:
![unknown.png](///raw/327/32/z/21fa0.png)
Prosperity and progress!
Become part of our great civilization and join the Domus Corporation! A new planet awaits, ready to be transformed into the spring of a new colony. Gather resources from the planet's surface and spread around the globe. Provide houses for new citizens and fight vile terrorist who try stop technological progress.

Rotten planet is a strategy game where you have to gather resources to build as many buildings as possible. But watch out, air pollution is a threat coming from the buildings themselves!

(Excuse the gif quality)
![Menu.gif](///raw/aa7/22/z/21fb8.gif)

![gameplay.gif](///raw/aa7/22/z/21fbc.gif)

Play the game here: https://sky909.itch.io/rotten-planet

entries.title: Bloodslinger
entries.description:
Out in the Wyld West, where dragons roam the plains, there's a new breed of cowboy. Wielding wands instead of guns, they imbue poker chips with the power of their very souls and wager them on life-or-death duels. Outlaws by trade, and gamblers by nature, these living legends are called...***Bloodslingers.***

Choose your play from the three cards you're dealt: beat your opponent's Defense with your Attack and his Attack with your Defense, or play a high card to Luck if you're confident in your aim. How many rival Bloodslingers can you take down before you're cashed out?

Gamepad and keyboard supported. Arrow keys/D-Pad/analog stick to move, Z/A to select.

![love_2019-04-29_18-56-11.png](///raw/1f3/1/z/23650.png)

![love_2019-04-29_18-55-42.png](///raw/1f3/1/z/23662.png)

**UPDATE:** Fixed player/enemy death flags not resetting properly.

entries.title: AstrO2
entries.description:
Deliver payloads from one end of this unreasonably dangerous space station to the other using your oxygen as propellant.
Be careful though, if you hit your oxygen tanks too hard they will start to leak.

Had really fun making this, despite very limited time (hence the very basic graphics/UI and lack of audio)![1.png](///raw/1f5/1/z/22896.png).
Expect significant updates once the jam is over!![2.png](///raw/1f5/1/z/22897.png)![3.png](///raw/1f5/1/z/22898.png)

entries.title: Library of Madness
entries.description:
The tomes in this library may prove of use for escaping it, but the cost of your sanity may be too great...

![screenshotA.png](///raw/660/2/z/22e62.png)

![screenshotB.png](///raw/660/2/z/22e66.png)

Library of Madness is a cinematic platformer where you can find tomes that will help you in your journey out. But reading these comes with a cost: madness. Escape while minimizing the sanity you spend.

Controls:
- Left and Right Arrows - Movement
- Up Arrow - Climb/Jump
- Down Arrow - Drop Down
- Q, W, and E - Pickup/use tome
- R - Restart level

Tomes:
- Slash - Slash forward at an enemy
- Force - Hit an enemy with arcane might
- High Reach - Climb to a higher point
- Leaping - Jump horizontally a longer distance
- Featherfall - Drop down any distance
- Dark Healing - Restore all health
- Vanishing - Temporarily turn invisible

entries.title: The Gardener
entries.description:
![TheGardener.png](///raw/316/42/z/230dc.png)

The Gardener is a Stardew Valley clone about growing body parts.

WASD to move, click to pick up/use items, right click to drop.

Keep an eye on your life bar, if it hits 0 you die! Otherwise, have fun gardening!

entries.title: Man-sized Disposal
entries.description:
While playing Man-sized Disposal you will be set in ancient Egypt or Greece. Your city is craving a monument. To put  it together you need to provide the construction site with material and some fleshly currency. This currency will spawn in your city if you provide enough food. Beware, since there is a serious deflation going on, which is heard to worsen during food shortages.
When you have provided your monument with enough material you can watch it rising up step by step. 
News of the monument has spread to your neighbors and they do not want you to have this glory, be prepared to defend your city from enemies.

We wanted to do a small project this time and it turned out to be bigger than we thought. The plan was to implement three stages/levels: Egypt, Greece, and Rome, but we only managed to finish the first two. It is our first game with sound and we believe the music turned out pretty well. Also, our time management got better so we could testplay the game the first time Saturday night.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D8WphUpGtIw

![main_menu.png](///raw/250/3/z/22dec.png)

![tutorial.png](///raw/250/3/z/22def.png)

![egypt.png](///raw/250/3/z/22df3.png)

![greece.png](///raw/250/3/z/22df7.png)

Team:
- @Alfadas - Engine Work, Programming
- @Rhiannon - Modelling 
- @kruemelkeksfan - UI Design, Programming
- @Peppsen - Music, SFX
- @TresorGiraffe42 - Modelling

entries.title: The Vampire's Prisoner
entries.description:
"The Vampire's Prisoner" is a top-down escape game inspired by "Escapists". You are stuck in the dungeon of a Vampire that comes back every Midnight to get some blood - and you are his only source. So try to stay hydrated to get the blood-regeneration running.

Instructions:
- Movement: WASD / Arrow-Keys / Left Stick on Gamepads
- Interact: Space / A-Button on Gamepads

- You are regenerating life if you have Water
- You can regenerate life by sleeping, but that skips time by 3 hours
- At 12 o'clock the vampire comes to the dungeon and takes half the life from the bloodbank. If there isn't enough, you die

-> Find a way to escape the dungeon

entries.title: Current_CE
entries.description:
This is our first Ludum Dare Game Jam launch!

## Ludum Dare Theme: "Life is Currency"

With some random Google searches, and a stroke of creative luck, 44's theme turned us to the saying of ** _ "Dead Batteries Bounce". _ ** 
The more energy you have, the safer you are from death...but to bounce over hazards you'll need to spend some electric current...cy! ;)

** Get to the "Current_CE Cart" with as much energy in your battery as possible‚Ä¶ **

** ...because in this game... your life IS currency!! **

entries.title: Borrowed time
entries.description:
You have borrowed HP from Death and it's time to pay back your HP-Loan.

Death tells you what he wants if you get it wrong you will loose HP. If your very low on health just visit death again and take a new HP-loan.

Controls:
WASD/Arrows : Move
SPACE : Pick up, interact, throw
ESC : Quit
R : restart
Q : Mute sound. (You might need it. :) )

![ezgif.com-optimize (3).gif](///raw/b73/5/z/2222b.gif)
![ezgif.com-optimize (4).gif](///raw/b73/5/z/2222c.gif)

entries.title: Zombie Rush
entries.description:
You got bitten by a Zombie. You have 360 Seconds left to live, so try to reach the Hospital far on the right. Every Shop purchase will cost you more LivingTime. But by killing Zombies you can get additonal 5 Seconds each.
Controll with w, s and Mouse. 
Good luck!![Screenshot.png](///raw/d00/81/z/23207.png)

entries.title: Soul Collector
entries.description:
You, The PoPo, have one job: to "collect" the souls of the cursed with the help of your car!
https://youtu.be/Hiu_PTyGizw


---
Our team had a lot of fun developing this game, where the point is to run over crazy monsters. It evolved significantly from our original plans, which were notably more aligned with the Ludum Dare theme than the final product. This was the first hackathon for 2 out of the 3 of us, so we're pretty stoked that we pulled this together, and we feel that we really learned a lot in the process.

Music credit: George Shaw

entries.title: Long live the king!
entries.description:
![Capture.PNG](///raw/a97/6/z/243d3.png)

Visit https://pixelsplash.itch.io/longlivetheking


This is my first time working on unreal, and creating my own art and sounds effects (almost all), it was difficult, I needed 2 days more to finish the game but I am very happy with what I got.

Enjoy it and please give me some feedback so I can keep improving.

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

(Inspired by the King Arthur movie, GOT, Adventure Time and others)

You are the King of the Farland Kingdom, as a king, you are always concerned about your gold... people***.

Your kingdom is not doing so well, you have some power issues, something to do with people management.
In an act of despair, you signed a pact with the demon living under your castle, an agreement for exchanging life for power.

Of course, you are not stupid, are you?
For a reason you are (still) the king, you noticed that nowhere in the contract says that it was your own life.

As a king responsible for hundreds of people, you have to "collaborate" with your subjects to guide them to the demon, or to the armory.

Gain power, defend your kingdom!
________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

The idea of the game is to survive until the 6th wave, managing your power and army, using it to defeat the mercenaries. Then the game will keep going, but you can name yourself victorious in that moment.

You have to command your people to follow you, to the demon to gain power, or to the armory, to use your power to turn them into warriors despite of what they want.

Oh, and there are some delicious mushrooms, if you are into that!

The number in the left is your power, you gain power giving people to the demon, and spend it turning people to soldiers.
The number in the right is your life, if you run out of life everything would be in vain.

Controls:

WASD - Movement

Shift - Sprint

Left Click (keep pressed)- Command people to follow you


If the game runs slowly, give it some time, it will get better in a moment.


![Capture1.PNG](///raw/a97/6/z/243d4.png)
![Capture2.PNG](///raw/a97/6/z/243d5.png)

https://youtu.be/qpcDpIBditA

entries.title: The Soul Machine
entries.description: ‚ÄúThe Soul Machine‚Äù is an arena-style battle game that puts you in the sneakers of a young witch as she fights off wave after wave of tentacle cultists! You can purchase upgrades at the Devil‚Äôs Gashapon, but beware! The currency is your life! Bwahahaha!![screen3.png](///raw/eb4/21/z/23149.png)![screen2.png](///raw/eb4/21/z/2314e.png)![screen1.png](///raw/eb4/21/z/23150.png)

entries.title: Under Wave
entries.description:
![Person_skeleton_Clip_super.jpg](///raw/766/22/z/2374a.jpg)
Your life depends on many factors. By abandoning them you give up life.

And then came the moment when you stayed under water and your life depends on your oxygen. Any action takes some time to implement, and for this you spend your life, air.

In the game you find yourself in a difficult situation on an underwater base, you have to calculate your most valuable resource to save your life.

To control these buttons are used:
WASD - movement;
E - to interact with the subject, return to the base;
F - for securing resources.

In order to get to the land and win you will need:
- Update O2 Generator to max Level
- Update Rubbish Recycler to max Level
- 3000 materials and 3000 oxygen

But you must remember:
- Your oxygen level is constantly decreasing.
- You must constantly turn on the generator, because your oxygen level will decrease faster
- And the constant lack of resources

List of updates:
- Added prices for updates
- Fixed bug with pressing E
- Added background music
- interface changed

!!All the textures and objects we develop ourselves!!
Here is a video of textures:
https://youtu.be/0x12csIp0dw

![unknown.png](///raw/766/22/z/21035.png)

Here are two notes that will help get you up to date:

"May 10, 2030 12:00
John Smith

 It's time to make my montt report. 

 When we arrived here, we were told, that the capacity of the batteries is big enough to supply us with energy for two yesrs. After the term, crew had to deliver us new batteries. 

 A week later, we lost electricity, the reason was that the batteries were stored in the remote compartment, which was gone. We made a suggestion, that it was destroyed by a large animal. To solve the electricity problem, we have built a new generator.

 For the third week, we realized that we were running out of oxygen, and with the extra materials we built a new oxygen generator."


"April 1, 2031 10:30
John Smith

 Over the past year, more than half of our employees have disappeared, so as many compartments with materials and supplies.

 We still got no idea, what's going on.

 Employees are terrified, we run out of oxygen, the pressure is above normal.

 To solve these problems, we want to create a material generator that will recycle garbage.

 After that we will be able to improve the oxygen generator with the obtained materials.

 But we won't be able to leave our base for a long time. Every drop of oxygen and every second is priceless
 If we stay alive for a next year, those who bring us batteries will pick us up."

https://youtu.be/GnNsD4mlpZ8

If you have problems with 1 cut scene in the form of a white screen, please watch it, we tried very hard:
https://youtu.be/PsqbaLquOfs

entries.title: Coin Defender
entries.description:
Defend the large gold coins from the menacing green bullets by dragging & dropping coins to block them while fusing together coins of the same value to achieve the goal in the upper left corner.

Play in browser: https://nikos1011.itch.io/coin-defender

entries.title: 36th Bank of Mammon
entries.description:
![ScreenshotBloods.png](///raw/21c/91/z/24033.png)
![ScreenshotEyeballs.png](///raw/21c/91/z/24034.png)
![ScreenshotCultists.png](///raw/21c/91/z/24035.png)
![ScreenshotFired.png](///raw/21c/91/z/24036.png)
It's a bit of a mess, but it's my mess and better yet - it's broadly categorisable as complete.

You are Squita, an accountant at the 36th Bank of Mammon. You're tasked with the job of hunting for prospective debters to take out a blood loan, prowling the streets for weak and forgotten souls and giving them some of your own lifeblood. When that loan matures, demons known as blood debts will spawn, and by defeating them you can reclaim the blood you paid in, plus a little extra. You can then use your newfound lifeblood to make even more loans or to pass on to your boss. You do have a quota to meet after all.

'A' and 'D' to move left and right. Spacebar to jump. Press and hold spacebar again in midair to fly. Left click to perform a swipe to fight the blood debts. Right click to perform a dash to avoid damage. And finally, press 'E' to interact.


----------------------------
Emergency Bugfix Update v1.01

-Fixed blood ignoring maxhealth

-Fixed blood demons being inclined to spawn in the wall

-Fixed Squita's dash attack being visible whilst dead

-Fixed Damage Cooldown being longer than intended

-Escape now closes the game so you can close the game in fullscreen

entries.title: Between Light and Shadow
entries.description:
![1.png](///raw/dc4/2/z/229c2.png)

![2.png](///raw/dc4/2/z/229c6.png)

![3.png](///raw/dc4/2/z/229c7.png)
## Description

The worlds are threatened.
Salesmen are everywhere and take away life.
In the light world they offer worldly goods in exchange.
In the shadow world they involve you in relentless battles.
Two heros‚Äìone from the light and one from the shadow pick up the fight.

## Keybindings

The game uses keyboard and mouse.

- **Up**: Move Up
- **Down**: Move Down
- **Left**: Move Left
- **Right**: Guess what
- **T**: Toggle worlds

---

entries.title: Life is precious
entries.description:
![ld44_screenshot.png](///raw/4c6/2/z/224ba.png)
### Theme - Your life is currency
Use your lives as currency in the shop.

### Gameplay
You start the game with 9 lives, like the cat you are, but a person.
When you die, you may sacrifice some of your lives to be blessed with better weapons. Beware, the game ends when you have no more lives!
Shoot crates for powerups and barrels for a helpful explosion.
Complete the game by clearing all enemy nests. White trackers in screen corners.
HA, fooled ya! You must now also kill the boss!

### Controls
- Control player: WASD + mouse (scroll wheel temporarily zooms out)
- Switch between bought weapons: 1-4

### Project info
Game made in Unity. Graphics mostly made with Aseprite. Sound effects made with sfxr and Audacity.
* Nice Graphics: @potter
* Dev Graphics: @Weine, @Lakrits
* Code: @weine, @freso, @Lakrits
* Music: @treqie

entries.title: ‚òê‚Äã‚òê‚òê‚òê‚òê : an experimental narrative   ‚Äã
entries.description:
is about a relationship between two friends. Discover a slice of life from different perspective, and try to retrace the events...
All your decisions costs you ‚Äãa part of your lifetime. "Press R to watch with a new eye" : that's how it asks you to pay with your own life.
__________________________________________



 ![an_experimental_narrative-Life-is-currency.jpg](///raw/7eb/52/z/2381b.jpg)


__________________________________________
This game is an entry for the 44h Ludum Dare, and also our first participation in a Game Jam. We're two art students and we worked here on Game Maker.
We know that some adjustments may be required, all feedbacks are welcomed !
__________________________________________

## CONTROLS 

Choose with **UP** and **DOWN**

Speedup or go back with **LEFT** and **RIGHT**

Select with **SPACE**

Toogle fullscreen with **F**


__________________________________________

## SOME MODIFICATIONS

*Changelog v2* : Just fixed some text collapsing and speed issues.

*Changelog v3* : Some more fixed some text collapsing, speed issues and control issues, you know, when you fix a thing and the others actually get worst...

*Changelog v4* : Even more fixed some text collapsing, speedup with RIGHT.

Add macOS version.

*Changelog v5* : A lot of text collapsing fixed. Change aspect ratio to make reading easier.

*Changelog v6* : All of the text collapsing is finally fixed ! (well, I think, I hope so...)

**_PS: if you see TEXT OVERLAPS could you please send me a screenshot in the comments ? (Those are pretty hard to find for me cause of the multiple places the different text can take...)_**

__________________________________________

entries.title: Speedrun Your Life
entries.description:
![illu_ldjam44.png](///raw/b2c/22/z/2348c.png)
Main Character Artwork

**Finally ! We made it on time..! Or did we ?**

Time was the greatest foe we could ever face in our first ludum dare, but we managed to get it on our side. 
Time is what you have, time is what you need, and time is what you spend to get more time.

Speedrun Your Life is a game where **time is only what you have left**. An endless sidescroller where death awaits you at every corner. 

The goal is simple : get as far as possible to achieve the best score possible.
One little details may slow you down though, **THIS GAME IS HARD**.

Due to some complications in terms of time (this was a simple one) the game will punish you in ways we can't even imagine.

This event was challenging and fun, hope we will be there on **time** for the next ones.
This game took all of our time so we will take back in our sleep.

**Known Issues** 

- ~~Platform Collisions can be a bit unfair towards the player.~~
- ~~Some of the player's attacks happening before they are visible.~~
- ~~Dialogues in shop doesn't display correctly/at all.~~

**Credits**:

Programming: Cyril Monty (@Kyrios)

Art: Thibaud Lacoste (@Nomus)

Music/Sound: David Boulle

entries.title: Tetris: Tempo
entries.description:
# Tetris: Tempo 
![MenuScreen.PNG](///raw/856/22/z/2355f.png)
---
## What is Tetris: Tempo?
Tetris with a twist! Play NES-Style tetris with a time limit (your life). For every line you clear, you gain time. If you clear a tetris (4 lines), you gain even more time. ** You can spend your time on blocks and add those to your queue. **

Once you lose, submit your score and see if you make the leaderboard!

## Controls (re-bindable in menu)
All movement keys are ** re-bindable ** in Menu>Key Binds, but by default are:

Move Left: a

Move Right: d

Hard Fall: w

Soft Fall: s

Rotate Clockwise: c

Rotate Counter-Clockwise: v

Numbers 1-7: Purchase their respective block

NumPad 1-7: Purchase their respective block

Pause: Escape

Adjust Volume: Bottom right corner of the menu, or from the in-game pause menu (Press Escape).

---
## Pictures
![Gameplay.PNG](///raw/856/22/z/234b6.png)
![Keybindings.PNG](///raw/856/22/z/234bd.png)
![Leaderboard.PNG](///raw/856/22/z/234be.png)
## Motivation
We felt that the theme was a little tough to brainstorm with initially. We decided to make a simple game, using a proven concept, and add a little to it. This is standard tetris, but you are on a timer and can spend time to buy more blocks. This was two of the team members first time making a game, and we believe it came out pretty well. We appreciate any and all feedback!

entries.title: WE:FX „Éü„É≥„Éä„Ç¨FX
entries.description:
![cover.PNG](///raw/f96/2/z/21e45.png)

# Top down shooter + Floating exchange rate = WE:FX

SELL YOUR LIFE. YOUR LIFE IS NOT YOURSELF.

shoot monsters. earn currency.

get 1UP whenever you can.

clash to nest. transfer your life into their currency.

CLASH TO EXCHANGE. TRANSFER YOUR LIFE INTO FINAL SCORE.

time limit is 60 seconds.

get higher score as you can.

# Controls

**KEYBOARD**

WASD, CURSOR = move

left SHIFT = fix direction

SPACE = shoot

ENTER = 1UP when you have enough money pool

TAB = show how to play

ESC = quit

**XINPUT GAMEPAD**

LEFT STICK = move

LB = fix direction

A = shoot

B = 1UP when you have enough money pool

RB = show how to play

# Strategies

I took care most on making game system while creating this game. 

so I'd be more happy when you understand and enjoy these system.

### Basic strategy : kill them, kill yourself

![youhaveyourprice.PNG](///raw/f96/2/z/2443c.png)

you should know you have two parameters other than life. the money pool (upper smaller number of the image) and the rate (lower bigger number of image).

when you kill the monsters. you get your money pool increased.

when your money pool exceeds to your rate, you can mak 1up.

so, below is the most simple gaming cycle.

1. you shoot and kill many monsters, that increase your money pool.
2. get you money pool exceed to your price, then make 1UP.
3. sacrifice your ship(=life) clash to the exchanger (rotating coin in the screen) to get final score.

but when you understand the game system further, you can achieve higher score.

### Intermediate strategy : you have a rate, that's floating

![youhaveyourprice3.PNG](///raw/f96/2/z/2443e.png)

I make the size of displaying the rate bigger than the money pool.
the rate is impoertant, that is FLOATING, getting higher and lower.

so you can get higher score adding below strategy to the basic strategy.

1. when your rate is low (say, 50) you should 1UP.
2. when your rate is high (say, 200) you should sacrifice your lives.

and now you'd notice there are other numbers on the game screen.

### Advanced strategy: they also have their rate and money pool

![nesthaspricetoo.PNG](///raw/f96/2/z/2443f.png)

there is 3 monster's nests that have the rate and money pool, too.

their rates are also floating. 

and when their money pool exeed their rate, they spawns monster.

so taking care about these rates. you can do...

1. when the nest's rate is low and getting higher, clash to it. GIVE your life as they spawn much monsters, and KEEP THEM ALIVE.
2. when the nest's rate is high. kill the monsters they spawned, to TAKE higher moneypool. harvest time!

put all of strategy into the gameplay you can exceed 10,000 pts as final score.

enjoy!

entries.title: The Necromancer Saga: Endless Dungeons
entries.description:
# Welcome to the Necromancer Saga! 
In this adventure, you're a novice of the dark magics, trying your best to improve as a necromancer... Your mentor asked you to bring a very special book: **The Necronomicon**. This book will allow you to reach the next level in your path as a Master Necromancer. The only thing standing between you and that book is a dungeon filled with guards, trying to keep that precious book away from the wrong hands.

Sadly, your powers are still weak, and wielding such dark magic creates a huge burden in your own humanity, as bringing back something from the death requires a high price. Not everything's lost though, as you are well familiar with the other schools of magic, proficient in the _art of healing_, and dangerous with the power of _firebolts_. 

Use these powers wisely, as the sole fuel of them are other human souls...

## Some Screenshots

![Image 1.png](///raw/ed6/z/234b5.png)

![Image 2.png](///raw/ed6/z/234b7.png)

## Controls
- **Right Click** to move the mage
- **Left Click** to cast fireball
- **Space** to summon a skeleton
- **A/D** to move camera around the player
- **Mouse wheel** to zoom in and out
- **C** to heal (uses one available skeleton for summoning).

## How to Play
Find your way to the Portal at the end of every level to advance in your quest.

### A little bit about the game...
Graphic assets were all brought from the asset store, so we opted out of the Graphics category, becase it just wouldn't be fair... Anything else, such as music kindly made by @Fran198, is made in the actual 72 hours of the Jam event.

- @frankitox16 : Programming/Development
- @Fran198 : Music/Art

Hope you enjoy it!

**Note:** Windows executable is highly recommended, as the Web version might run out of memory while generating the map. If you just want a feel for the game or just don't want to download it, be aware that bugs may appear in the Web version (just refresh the page until it works...)

## UPDATE 1
List of bugfixes:
- Lighting is improved. Now you can actually see behind those shadows!

**Before**
![Image 1.png](///raw/ed6/z/249a7.png)

**After**
![Update 1.png](///raw/ed6/z/249aa.png)

- Loading screen now's working as it should (It's used to avoid that camera flickering at the beggining).
- Lowered music volume as it was too high.
- Skeletons now fight the enemy that was hit by a fireball, if they weren't attacking before.
- Added particles to fireballs when they collide with an object to provide more feedback on the player when it's attacking an enemy
- Enemies were nerfed. (Needs a bit more playtesting, as I find them a bit too easy. I'll probably do a balance patch later).

Hello there player!!

We are proud to present you our first ever Ludum Dare entry, Adventures of Crimson Warlock, where you play as a warlock using blood magic to defeat anyone standing in his way. Can you defeat your enemies without draining yourself out of blood?

- Howler as audio engine

- Aseprite and Gimp for the little graphics we made ourselves

**Some few last bullet points:** 
- game is not mobile friendly
- sorry for the longer load times

entries.title: Les Pattes (The Legs)
entries.description:
Each player must control one leg of the extraterrestrial insect. The insect spends its vital energy to move and has to reap resources that can be exchanged for vital energy if it manages to reach the outpost. The outpost also gives him a powerup that will help him to cross the course until the next one. Each power up also improves the look of the insect.

Strongly inspired by Gettin Over It, we have intentionally made a hard-core game out of its particular controls. We wanted to create a relaxed atmosphere in the game and wreak havoc in your living room just as Overcooked do. We would love to start from this prototype to make it a game for a Twitch / Youtube public.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JEaYybE82KU

entries.title: Temple of Life
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/a67/8/z/23c14.png)

## **Description**
You have stumbled upon a temple that demands you pay with your life in order to get the keys that grant you access into the temple. You try to run but the guardian at the entrance intimidates you so you decide to go in. 

Can you make it passed all the floors of the Temple of Life with out perishing?

## **Swap Shop**
Spend your life wisely here to ease your trials.
![example-shop.png](///raw/a67/8/z/23c1b.png)

## **Controls**
- **Movement**: WASD / Arrow Keys
- **Use/Pick Up Orb Key**: E, Left Mouse Button
- **Pause Menu**: ESC

## **How to play**
- Use your life to buy keys
- Use the keys to turn OFF the various traps
- Find the big terminal to activate the exit
- Make your way back to the exit to win
- Keys used on smaller terminals can be re-collected

Navigate the through the treacherous temple avoiding the traps that lies within
![ToL_Screen2.png](///raw/a67/8/z/23c3b.png)

Find the terminal that activates the exit pad
![ToL_Screen1.png](///raw/a67/8/z/23c3d.png)

Make your way back to the pad to finish the level
![ToL_Screen3.png](///raw/a67/8/z/23c3e.png)

There are a total of 4 levels to complete 

## **Team**
- **Programmers**: Nelson, Travis
- **Music**: Jesse
- **Graphics and Level Design**: Michael
 
## **3D Models**
This time we did not have a 3D artist so we opted for assets from the unity asset store
We are opting out of graphics rating because of this but if you like the artwork, please let our Graphics Artist know :)

## **Post Mortem**
This time around we managed to get all the features we wanted to have and were so excited of having a full day to replace stock images/models with better looking ones that we forgot to playtest and playtest hard! (Rookie mistake, I know) so the game may be harder than anticipated to the point that it may be unwinnable. A lesson well learned for sure. As time allows, we aim to make a post-jam version to fix the little bugs here and there and make sure the game is winnable without requiring luck or perfect timing. lol

## **Known Issues the post-jam version attempts to address**
- WebGL does not render the graphics therefore the exit pad doesn't light up but if you hear the sound then you found the right terminal (fixed by changing the model an adding particle system)
- Spikes' timing are hard to navigate
- Turning off spikes, leaving a room and re-entering the room causes them to rest their position though still disabled
- You can quickly put/take a key which is more funny than anything :) but can make you lose a key lol (sorry)
- The keys in the UI change size when they change state (I actually think its funny in a good way lol) :D <-- still happens - lol
- Music volume doesn't change the music volume
- Did not take the time to play with the sound ranges so some sound far/too soft or too loud (another rookie mistake)

**Still Happening**
- UI changes in size
- UI doesn't always properly reset

Even still we hope you like it and thanks for playing!

entries.title: Cash Clash
entries.description:
# Ludum Dare 44: Cash Clash

![splash_screen.png](///raw/cd5/32/z/226ef.png)

A game created for Ludum Dare 44 under the theme "Your life is currency".

## Concept

*Cash Clash* is a local multiplayer top-down arena shooter game where you directly take control over a currency.

![currency_anim.gif](///raw/cd5/32/z/226e6.gif)


Your goal is to fight other currencies while keeping an eye on the current currency strength, an important component of the game. This strength is visualized in a line chart as follows.

![currency_strength.png](///raw/cd5/32/z/226f5.png)

The strength of a currency constantly varies between the values 0 and 100 and directly impacts the prowess of your player character in the arena.

### Game Mechanics

You and other currencies move around in an arena, firing bullets and dodging enemy projectiles. Besides regular movement, you can also utilize a dash skill to surprise your opponent.

The strength of your weapons and your own armor scales in real time with the currency strength. The current timepoint is highlighted with a white vertical line and you can see some seconds into the future to plan your next strategic steps.

It is also possible to change your currency. This is possible in one of the exchange stops which are spread over the map. When you switch to a better currency, you will loose health (but gain weapon strength and armor) - switching to a worse currency will increase your health but lower your strength and armor. But keep in mind that the currencies values keep changing! However, you will keep the health you gained.

The game always uses three player characters, each playing as an individual currency. In the main menu, you can define how many of them are controlled by humans. You can only change to other currencies which are not already taken by other players.

**Hint: When you play the game for the first time, you should definitely start it in three players mode** - even when you want to play alone. The AI is quite powerful and would most likely frustrate you when you directly fight against it. In your next rounds, you can decrease the number of human players to two such that the AI takes over a single player character. If you feel prepared enough after some training, you can switch to the true single player mode.

### Available Weapons

There are three freely changeable weapon types. Their basic properties are listed below.

| Name        | Fire rate           | Range  | Damage |
| ------------- |:-------------:|:-----:|:-----:|
| Minigun | high | low | low |
| Laser | medium | infinite | medium |
| Crossbow | very low | infinite | very high |

## Controls

The game contains three player characters, each of them can be controlled either by a human player or an (not very intelligent) AI.

### Human players

#### Player 1
* Movement: W, A, S, D
* Aim: Relative mouse position
* Shoot: Left mouse button
* Dash: Right mouse button
* Change weapon: Tab

#### Player 2 and 3

Both of them expect controller input signals.

* Movement: Controller left stick
* Aim: Controller right stick
* Shoot: R2
* Dash: L1, R1
* Change weapon: L2

## Used technologies and resources

The game was created with the [godot engine](https://godotengine.org/).

**Additional utilized software solutions**

* [Inkscape](https://inkscape.org/de/) for the splash screen
* [Gimp](https://www.gimp24.de/) for backgrounds / simple graphic modifications
* [Piskel](https://www.piskelapp.com/) for very simple tile graphics
* [OpenSCAD](https://www.openscad.org/downloads.html) to generate the player and cash exchange station graphics
* [Ableton Live 10](https://www.ableton.com/en/live/) for sound effect creation

## Used third-party assets

**Sounds**

* [Cash register sample](https://freesound.org/people/kiddpark/sounds/201159/)

**Fonts**

* [Noto Mono](https://www.google.com/get/noto/)
* [Cash Currency Font](https://www.dafont.com/cash-currency.font)


## Contributors

This project was created within 72 hours by [jcklie](https://ldjam.com/users/jcklie/), [mbugert](https://ldjam.com/users/mbugert/) and [tomatenbrei](https://ldjam.com/users/tomatenbrei/).

## Gameplay video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ydjk-2oP6GQ

entries.title: Conway's Currency
entries.description:
Conway is venturing into the dungeon to find the answer to life. Conway's (game of) life is the only currency accepted in there.
 
Good Luck, you will need it.

Move Conway with arrow keys, click and drag items with mouse.

**Hints and Tips**:
 - Your coins behave according to the rules of [Conway's Game of Life](https://bitstorm.org/gameoflife/). There is a lot information online about it, you can even use an online simulation to see how it behaves. 
 - Especially [this list of patterns](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life#Examples_of_patterns) can be useful.
 - It always takes one heart to kill a slime, as they will attack you when you are on an adjacent tile. Just move into them to actually kill them. (Skeletons will take two hits to kill)
 - You can Drag & Drop items and coins from chests and bags into your inventory.
 - Your inventory contains items and coins. 
   - Items can be re-arranged by dragging and dropping them.
   - Coins can only be placed initially in your inventory, then they simulate one step of Conway's Game of Life every step you take.
   - Items count as dead cells for the simulation.
   - The potion and the sword can be double clicked to use them. The potion will turn all surrounding items and coins in the inventory to hearts. The sword will cause you to attack all enemies within 2 tiles range.
 - The most effective strategy is to use potions to convert a bunch of coins into a lot of hearts.

![conways_currency_2.png](///raw/d33/z/23278.png)

([Fonts are by Eeve Somepx](https://somepx.itch.io/humble-fonts-free))

entries.title: Against The Ninja
entries.description:
*Top down 2D Ninja Vs Demons Action !*

You're a ninja fighting his last fight against the endless hordes of hell, and you need to survive for as long as you can and get the highest score. Also your health bar acts as a stamina bar (so i guess it's more like "your life is a resource" rather than currency, but i feel like it still fits the theme).

![screenshot1resized.png](///raw/92f/22/z/23dd1.png)
yeah sorry this doesn't look really good but it's kinda hard taking a screenshot in the middle of this game.

Instructions :
	
* Arrow keys : move.
* Space : dash.
* F : attack.
* D : direction lock (keep attacking in the same direction even when you move).

Attacking and dashing depletes your stamina, but will never leave you with less than 1 point of stamina.

Taking hits from enemies also depletes your stamina.

Your Stamina will start recharging after a short time without takings hits or doing anything.

If your stamina reaches 0, you're dead!

Dashing lets you move through your enemies.

Keep your combo up to get a damage (and score) multiplier.

Protip : leave some skull piles alive to be able to combo from the skulls that they spawn.

You can't win this fight, but you can try to give this ninja the badass death scene he deserves !

If you can survive for 30 seconds you're already doing well.

(I hope this is helpful, it's 1 a.m. as i'm writing this, and i need some freakin' sleeeeep)

ps : we don't own the copyrights to the images used to make the titlescreen, but all the rest has been made 
during the jam.

pps : some issues with the game that we already know about
* needs more balancing
* needs more visual feedbacks
* the dash is kinda useless
* all the sprites have been made in a very limited time (like 6h), so lots of animations are missing

Nevertheless, the game is already fairly playable as it is.

Credits : 
* graphics : Tori
* audio & titlescreen: Monogatari
* code & placeholder graphics: Berumondo

entries.title: My Memories

You wake up in a strange place with no memories of how you got there or any memories at all for that matter. The only way to solve this mystery is to fight monsters and recovery memory fragments. These fragments of your life are used to purchase upgrades, unlock areas and even as ammo.

To Move:
	+ W,S,A,D
	+ Controller Left Stick
	+ Arrow Keys
	+ Controller D-Pad

Sword Attack:
	+ X Key
	+ Left Mouse Button
	+ Controller X Button
	
Gun Attack:
	+ C Key
	+ Right Mouse Button
	+ Controller Right Shoulder

Reload (Costs One Memory Fragment per Reload, Ammo already in Gun will be lost!):
	+ R Key
	+ Middle Mouse Button
	+ Controller Right Bumper
	
Interact:
	+ F Key Board
	+ Controller A Button
	
Pause

To close the shop, press the interact key again or the Controller B button.
