entries.title: The Harvest
entries.description:
![theharvestcover.png](///raw/577/1/z/22f6c.png)

All life in this universe is merely currency to you. As an unfeeling master species, seed solar systems with life, wait for biomass to accumulate and then harvest it to accrue funds. Attack those systems impertinent enough to try and defend themselves. What level of funds can you accrue? [Play in browser now.](https://machinescreen.itch.io/the-harvest)




## Reference
**Systems**

- A system's Habitat rating affects the speed of Biomass production.
- A system's Defence increases by 1 for every 5% of Biomass production from 55% onwards to a maximum of 10.

**Seed Ship - Cost 5**

- Begins Biomass production in a system.

**Harvest Ship - Cost 10**

- Harvests all Biomass in a system for Funds.
- Destroyed by a Defence of 3 or more.
- Systems need to be reseeded after harvesting.

**Attack Ships - Cost 20**

- Reduces Defence by up to 5 and Biomass by 25%.
- Destroyed if there is Defence remaining after this reduction.
- Prevents further Biomass production if not destroyed.

All ships replace each other in a system.

entries.title: Little Robot
entries.description:
In the distant future humanity is extinct. Robot life forms roam the wasteland. Jambo, running low on resources has invented a new worker "Little Robot" to replace the old workers who have become dysfunctional and rebellious. Little Robot's job is to locate energy cells which can be used as currency to purchase upgrades to locate more energy cells which also maintain Little Robot's health.


Break open old electronics to find energy cells.

Controls
Move: WASD
Melee Attack: Left Shift
Talk: T
Jetpack: Spacebar (Once upgrade is purchased)
Fire: Left Mouse (Once upgrade is purchased)
Quit: Escape

Keep an eye on your energy! Using upgrades costs energy as well.

Gameplay Video

https://youtu.be/4EL_esLv_X0

All original assets made for LD44

entries.title: Lifo, The Forest Necro
entries.description:
From an unknown forest, there is a necromancer that watches over all the trees on the unseen land. One day, travelers have found this beautiful forest but because of the dark nature of these trespassers, the trees are slowly dying. Bound by the responsibility of the necromancer, he uses its life in order to payback the lives of the trees that the trespassers have bought. This necromancer's heroic name is...

Lifo, The Forest Necro 

It is a submission for the Ludum Dare Jam 44

Made in 2 days.

Theme: Your life is currency

Mechanics:

The goal of the game is to save many dead tree as many as possible by transferring your own life force. The more trees you save, the higher your life force multiplier will be. 

Controls:

A and D - to move right and left

Left Mouse - to attack


v.02 Changelog:

- Fixed the mouse problem
- Add Scoring Counter 
‚Äã- Add Exit game when failed




Tip: Do not waste your life :(

Install instructions:

Unzip then play.!

entries.title: Thief of Hours
entries.description:
In Thief of Hours, you play as... well, a thief. But your thief is no cat burglar. He steals the very life from people, transforming young boys into old men! Like most thieves, though, he must avoid the police and hide into alleyways to escape.

Controls:
Arrow keys to move
Space to dive and steal life
Up/down near a ladder to climb it
Up near an alleyway to hide in it

Gameplay: Your goal is to dive into as many brown-haired people as possible to steal their years. Upon turning into old men, they will begin to chase towards you. To hide from them, you must press [up] at an alleyway to hide from them and disengage them. The more years you steal before you hide, the more combo points you get! Stay away from police officers and grab randomly spawning health potions to replenish life.

This is my first Ludum Dare project, so please give helpful criticism.

![Gamepic.png](///raw/449/f1/z/21ba3.png)

entries.title: Rent for Life
entries.description:
![Title Screen Shot.png](///raw/f55/d/z/22cd8.png)

## *Real estate is a precious commodity, even in Hell...*
###### ... and when your landlord is the ruler of the Damned, you better pay up!

In "Rent for Life", you play as Skully McSkull the Reaper (Skully for short) who has not always been the most prompt in paying his bills, but he's a pretty OK tenant. He takes modest care of his humble ~~shack~~ home in his own corner of Hell, raising his loving canine companion. So when the Landlord of Hell approaches you with threats of eviction, Skully better get back to collecting the local currency: *the souls of the living.*

This top down 3-D game will send you to the mortal world where you will race against time to collect the souls of the living! A grim responsibility, yes, but your fiery homeland doesn't run on rainbows and kittens (unfortunately). Do your best to keep up your rent payments, or face the wrath of your landlord...

|| PRESS SPACEBAR TO ATTACK ||

entries.title: GEMiNiD S484
entries.description:
![2 ss.png](///raw/94d/71/z/24be3.png)

##### Astronomers still have much to learn about the vastness of the universe. The more they discover the more questions they have. While studying the stars they discovered ~~people~~ beings never before seen. These beings appear to battle by creating and throwing stars, using them to defeat one another in a never ending battle. 

#### This is where stars come from.
 
##### Here we stand before their training field, reporting to you live from this sector of space.

##### Between one of their rounds we asked each of them a few questions about themselves, here are their answers:

### Red

- ***What is your favorite color?*** "Teal."
- ***What are your strengths?*** "My arms."
- ***How old are you?*** "What."
- ***What do you see in your future?*** "I cannot see the future."
- ***What gets you up in the morning?*** "Myself."

### Blue
- ***What is your favorite food?*** "What."
- ***Who is your mentor?*** "I don't name meteors."
- ***How would you fire someone?***  "With a star."
- ***What is your name?*** "OFoubgsO43JBhcyx754"
- ***What makes you uncomfortable?*** "These questions."

### Green
- ***How do you handle failure?*** "Just do not fail."
- ***What is your dream job?*** "I do not dream of jobs."
- ***What is your greatest weakness?*** "Being hit by stars- thrown and stationary stars both cause damage."
- ***Are you an indoor or outdoor person?*** "Here."

### Yellow
- ***What is your favorite animal?*** "Blue."
- ***Name your favorite thing about yourself?*** "That is a strange question but I guess I could name it Bob."
- ***What do you spend your day doing?*** "Training."
- ***What is your greatest fear?*** "Either falling or being hit by stars."
- ***Where have you traveled?*** "Here."

### Programming: James Tusha (http://www.twitter.com/PopDaddyGames)
### Level & Gameplay Design: Josh Damian (http://twitter.com/AtmcType)

##### Thanks for visiting our page! 

##### :stars: ***Here are some gameplay tips*** :stars:
- GEMiNid S484 is a 2-4 player local co-op game
- The starting area is a safe zone and is also where you can upgrade your character.
- Throw stars to damage other players. 
- Collect hearts to increase your life - you can spend your hearts to buy upgrades for your character.
- Start/Options brings up the pause menu where you can find all the game controls.

# P.S. You need a controller to play this game!

### P.P.S You can walk on stars. ;)

![01.jpg](///raw/94d/71/z/24a92.jpg)![02.jpg](///raw/94d/71/z/24a8b.jpg)![03.jpg](///raw/94d/71/z/24a8c.jpg)![04.jpg](///raw/94d/71/z/24a8d.jpg)![05.jpg](///raw/94d/71/z/24a8e.jpg)![06.jpg](///raw/94d/71/z/24a8f.jpg)![07.png](///raw/94d/71/z/24a90.png)

entries.title: Bloody Medic
entries.description:
## Info
Slip into the role of a sick medic who is trying to cure his fellow countryman.

As you reach further into the caves of your village you might be able to find the source of the spreading sickness (10. UG).

![Unbenannt23.png](///raw/60a/2/z/22439.png)

## Controls
### Keyboard

[WASD] Move

[E] Interact

[Space] Attack

[Q] Throw Needle

[R] Restart Level

### GamePad

[L-Stick] Move

[A] Interact

[X] Attack

[RB] Throw Needle

[Select] Restart Level

## Notes
* Potions do nothing
* Door might be unreachable => restart
* You have to execute start.bat or the jar from the command line
* Press W/ L-Stick up to spawn

* **MAC Version** might not work (because of the OpenGL version)

entries.title: Bread
entries.description:
You wake up in the middle of the night. All you want is bread. The only thing standing between you and the supermarket is a swarm of paparazzi, desperate to get a picture of you in your pj's. The longer you avoid them, the more persistent they will become!


Try to make it to the supermarket undetected to avoid losing your fame and all of your wealth along with it.
As long as you make it with $3 to buy your bread it will all be worth it.


## Controls

Movement: W, A, S, D

![gif1.gif](///raw/d98/02/z/2296f.gif)

![sc2.png](///raw/d98/02/z/22941.png)

entries.title: Worked to Death
entries.description:
![screen0.png](///raw/138/1/z/237d4.png)

You‚Äôre an overworked Grim Reaper trying not to get fired. Your boss has set you an ever increasing quota of souls to claim and your family‚Äôs expenses threaten to ruin your finances. Can you keep your salary up and pay the bills?

Featured: crazy physics and nightmarish landscapes.

Claim souls that are RED. Claiming innocent souls causes a monetary penalty (-3). You have to meet your soul quota in your shift, which can range from 12 hours to 24 hours. At the end of each day you will receive money based on your salary. If your money can't cover your bills or you don't meet your quota, the game ends.

There is a day/night cycle that can make recognizing colors difficult. DAY = YELLOW, DAWN/DUSK = ORANGE, NIGHT = BLUE. The levels are randomly generated.

Controls

WASD - move, also french in Post-LD

LEFT/RIGHT - turn

SPACE - attack (claim soul)

The game was programmed in Go using Vulkan (vulkan-go).
GLFW is used for windowing. It uses my own engine, Gorium.

Vulkan is very hardware-specific, so any bug reports are appreciated. The terrain generator sometimes produces geometry that makes the already bouncy physics hiccup. The Post-LD version (only bugfixes) doesn't have these problems.

You need working Vulkan drivers to play the game

Post-mortem:
https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/44/worked-to-death/doing-ludum-dare-with-vulkan

entries.title: LifeMutation
entries.description:
***********************************************************************
                        Eat blobs. Get stronger. 
                    Mutate to a more powerful creature. 
                  Eat even more blobs. Get even stronger. 
                             
                                Don't die!
***********************************************************************


Move using WASD.

Eat any blobs that have a strength less than you. If a blob stronger than you hits you, then you die!

The higher your strength, the more health cores you can get (10 Strength = 1 life core).
(To convert click on the mutate button twice) You may want to know that life cores last through death.

When you have sufficient health cores you can mutate into a more powerful creature that has extra lives, and can also fire at the blobs (use mouse to aim). To do this you go to the mutate screen and press the creature you want.

My friends and I are in grade 8 and this is the first game we have ever made with GameMaker. We had lots of fun making it and learnt heaps, so we hope you like it too!!!

If you enjoy it, please rate us!


**Known Bugs**

Unfortunately there are some issues in version 1 that we didn't have time to fix. These have been fixed in version 2.
 - You lose your life cores on death
 - The big blob costs 11 instead of the written 10
 - You can infinitely gain life cores once the red character is unlocked
 - You can die on the mutate screen

**Credits**

- Aaldwyn - Play testing, support and Ratings
- Sparkysam5 - Major coding + Ratings
- Patttriple - Graphics + minor coding

entries.title: Alien Easter Cat
entries.description:
# Alien easter cat
You play Alien Cat who wants to get home in time for Easter. But he has to travel trough the dangerous Dog Nebula and defeat or evade enemies and bullits.

At the start of the game he can choose how to outfit his spaceship. As a cat he has 9 lives which he can trade for credit with which he can buy bullitpacks and shields. The idea is, you can buy the stuff to fit your preferred playing style.

The game was made in 3 days in 6502 assembly. All code and graphics were made in those 3 days. Most of the time was spent in debugging, though :)

The music was made a few years before by Roel and is used with his permission. He also made the few sound effects the game has. The Cat character is based on an idea by Ingeborg.

Because I spend so many time on a few stubborn bugs, I didn't have time to tweak the gameplay, so the game is not balanced. Lucky for you that means it's a very easy game.

The game has no restart facility (which isn't that bad, because at the moment replay value is pretty limited) (just rerun or press F5 if playing in a browser).

## Controls
On a C64, you need a joystick in port 1.
On the Vice emulator or the first mentioned online emulator: Use keys on the Numpad and Space. (8=up, 2=down, 4=left, 6=right, SPACE=fire). 
If you have downloaded an emulator yourself (like Vice), you may have to change the joystick settings.
* In the buying menu use up and down to select, left and right to decrease or increase amount. Fire to fly off
* In-game Up activates shield, down deactivates shield, left and right for steering and fire to fire your bullits.

The playing field uses only the leftmost 256 pixels (which is considered a bit of a cop-out in C64 circles).

## Running the game
The best way to play it would be on a Real C64, but that would be difficult for most people. Second best is an emulator running on an Desktop or Laptop. Running the game in a browser demands a decent Desktop/Laptop. Running on a mobile in the browser is not adviced.

An emulator that is available for Windows, Mac and Linux is VICE. Link to the VICE site: (http://vice-emu.sourceforge.net/index.html#download). 
You can drag the game file 'main.prg' on the executable to run the game. You may have to change the joystick settings in the menu. The game uses joystick in Port 1. I've also included a zipped windows version that is stripped to just the C64 emulator and has a batch file that you can click to run the game (it does the joystick setting for you).

If you don't like to download an emulator or can't use that version, there are online options:
### Playing Online
* https://ib-goerp.nl/c64/emulated/
Chrome demands some user interaction before AudioContext is allowed to start. Therefore you must click the button below to start the program.
After clicking the script will be loaded and the game will automatically start.

This online version emulates a C64 with Vice.js, which is made by R. Janicek link to a demo sitelink to the repo. Vice.js is a javascript port of the great Vice EmulatorLink to the VICE site.

I changed the settings of Vice.js so it emulates joystick port 1 using the Numpad Keys. According to Vice documentation, the Numpad '0' key should work as Fire button, but on my computer it didn't work, so I changed the game so it would use Joystick in port 1 and set Vice to emulate that joystick port on the numpad. That way the SPACE key can be used as fire (who would have thought that the C64's crosstalk between joystick and keyboard would come in handy 37 years later, he?).

* https://c64emulator.111mb.de/index.php?site=pp_javascript&lang=en&group=c64
It's another good online emulator
Download the game from the Ludum Dare page, and upload it to the emulator page (on the drop file and play, part). Set Joystick in the dropdown to 'Joystick Keyboard 2-> Player2' to be able to use Cursor keys and Space to control the ship.

## Version
I've made three changes since the first upload: I changed the joystick port so I could get it to run online and I fixed two major bugs: 
* a bug that always changed the lifes you had at the start to 9 (therby defeating the whole idea of the game)
* a bug that prevented enemies turning up (making the game even MORE boring).

## Bugs left
There are still plenty of bugs left. A few notable bugs:
* score isn't working
* collision detection with enemies isn't working
* enemies freeze from time to time
* you can't see how for you've progressed

If you've found another bug, please let me know in the comments

![2019-04-29 (2).png](///raw/73a/z/224df.png)![2019-04-28 (2).png](///raw/73a/z/224e6.png)
![2019-04-29 (1).png](///raw/73a/z/224ed.png)

entries.title: Rainbow Rampage - Twitch Overlay Game
entries.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pzOHwHEmOUw

_In the near future, Halloween has been banned. Professor Fluffington has recruited secret agent Teapup to infiltrate Sugar-Free Headquarters and skittle her way to the top and save the greatest candy holiday from oblivion. Will you help her with her mission?_

Type **!candytime** to start the game and then each round, vote to use life to upgrade or to restore life by typing **!power, !speed, or !heal**. Good luck!

## Setup Instructions for the streamer
Replace the **_[yourchannel]_** part of the URL with the name of your Twitch channel and then add the following URL as a Browser Source into OBS or XSplit:
`https://www.instafluff.tv/RainbowRampage/dist?channel=[yourchannel]&overlay=true`

The **_width_** and **_height_** of the Browser Source should be **_1280_** and **_720_**

You can also play on a web browser by removing **_&overlay=true_**


## Instafluff ##

We built this Twitch-integrated Overlay game live on Twitch for Ludum Dare 44!

> *Come and hang out with us at the Comfiest Corner on Twitch!*

> https://twitch.tv/instafluff

> https://twitter.com/instafluffTV

entries.title: All You Can Eat
entries.description:
On board the **Matrix**, a *Salem* class containment cruiser, a demonic presence released several abominations. You are one such abomination, bound for some random **rimworld** in the **3b1b system**.
## To get there alive you'll need to:
* Feed on your fellow freaks.
* Rip out some of your many spines with [**Left Click**] or [**RT**] to subdue your foes, this comes at a cost.
* Engulf them with your tendrils to C O N S U M E them.
* Deftly dash out of danger with [**Left Shift**] or [**LT**].
* Bash the rats, hexapods, and mages with [**Right Click**] or [**RB**].
* Keep an eye on your meater or you might meat your end.


### Nothing like a buffet in space!

![screen1.png](///raw/1dd/z/238bf.png)

![screen2.png](///raw/1dd/z/238c2.png)

### EAT OR BE EATEN

There is a matrix channel for the game at `#ayce:riot.firechicken.net`, for people interested in coordinating multiplayer.

entries.title: Generation: Why?!
entries.description:
![logo.png](///raw/f36/8/z/22240.png)

**"Your life is a currency"**: for no other person in the world this statement is more true than for **instagramm models.**
 
Play as one of these poor souls trying to become famous by making degrading pictures of themselves and their desperate attempt to get followers and likes. Give your best by making **selfies** with potential **followers** and find the 
**three legendery selfiespots**, or you will be doomed with a **9till5-job**.

Your **coolness** is your life and it will decrease by touching **weebs** or **hobos**, so stay away from these filthy people. You can restore your **coolness** by taking selfies with followers and can get extra coolness if you collected a **pumpkin-spice-latte** for the purrrfect picture!

So get ready and chase your dream to become a famous model on **TurtleGramm**!

**Controls**

**WASD**! - you know this come on!

**SPACE** - Jump!

**E** - Selfietime!!!

![Screen.PNG](///raw/f36/8/z/23ca1.png)

* W or up for jumping
* S or down for ducking

entries.title: Victor Sold His Soul
entries.description:
About the game:
The year is 1903. In a desperate last attempt to save his dying wife, Victor Lavecroft reached out to any power that could help him, but sometimes power comes with a catch, and in Victors case a terrible price. The Old One Cal‚Äôthulu granted Victor‚Äôs wish, and happily Victor‚Äôs Wife made a 
miraculous recovery. However, since that fateful night Victor‚Äôs life has taken a dark and twisted turn. 
His dreams are plagued by dark visions, he finds himself sleepwalking, and terrified
 by Victor‚Äôs change in temperament his wife has left him alone in their small, ever
 darkening village. To make things even stranger, Victor keeps waking in his lab to find curious objects humming in dark energies, that he has no recollection of.

Victor is terrified by the cost of his deal with the ancient creature, 
but when dealing with an Old God, your life is the only currency they accept.

![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/11d/12/z/233f5.png)

About us:
We're a group of 30 something year old mates from Harrogate, North Yorkshire. None of us have any previous game jam experience or any formal training in design/game development, this has been a learning curve for us all! We've made EVERYTHING* in the game from scratch during the 72 hour jam, nothing was pre-fab and nothing was made before the theme was announced. We've used the following programs: Unity, Photoshop, GIMP, Affinity Photo, Blender, Audacity and Garage Band.
Cheers!

![Untitled.png](///raw/11d/12/z/233fb.png)
*angry mob noise taken from audioblocks at the last minute. All other audio was original.

*Fixed Bug making the game unbeatable 30/4/19

*Updated version added to Itch.io page fixing Bug that made the game unbeatable.
*Also added Mac version

entries.title: MAX PAYIN'
entries.description:
Max Payin‚Äô is a simple rouge-like action game, although you use YOUR OWN REAL LIFE as a currency. Literally. You spend your real life time in exchange for goods. The prices are different, so you need to spend more of your life for advanced equipment than for usual ammunition and a medicine kit. 

![Gameplay_1_0_0_4.gif](///raw/6c5/e/z/23e4b.gif)

Space - flip with invulnerablity.

WASD/arrows - move.

Click/ctrl - shoot.

If you like our game follow us on Twitter https://twitter.com/snovagames

entries.title: Front Line Fury
entries.description:
![one.png](///raw/6eb/32/z/22c5b.png)

Front Line Fury is Tower Defense 2D Game that use the official LDJam 44 them "Your Life is Currency" as it's main highlight. You are a unique ape that have power blood that can be used to build structures, then enemy want to take it from you because it's priceless. Your job is to protect yourself from waves of enemies by deploying structures that will defend you but with the cost of your own hp. Be wise managing your resources, which is you.

![2.png](///raw/6eb/32/z/22c60.png)

Solo for this time and using my favourite engine including the other opensource software as my choice. Godot Engine 3.1, Krita for 2D art and texture.

All assets are my own (art, music, etc) and I made entire of it in 13 hours of total game dev for this jam, solo. I hope I'll go better next time. thanks!

![three.png](///raw/6eb/32/z/22c65.png)

entries.title: Keyboard Warriors
entries.description:
## Read first

- **Multiplayer** - for best experience join at even hours (0-2-4-6-8am-...) 
- Ping players on my Discord server https://discord.gg/Jn9TQRR

## More info

The year is 2112; in the Facility, humanity has finally put their bugbears at rest: poverty, discrimination and stupidity are finally behind us. 

Behold the pinnacle of human evolution: the geek.

Only problem is, there is nothing left to EAT.

In this uniquely keyboardian PvP shooter, help the last humans keep population under control and recycle biomass. 

WARNING: below video contains profanity. If you are sensitive, or underage, please don't watch it. This is actual play testing with friends, not some sanitized PC thing.

https://youtu.be/KC4f94EOG14

Are you ready for POPULATION ONE?

- Navigate, shoot and other things using your keyboard. Be quick, be witted, be tactical.
- Good news: every game action brings you closer to getting recycled! 
- Keep chatting, or be toast.

![Screen Shot 2019-04-30 at 7.35.16 AM.png](///raw/bee/42/z/22bcb.png)

*A few tips*

- At any time press ENTER to start chatting/emitting commands. Then press ESC when you are done; for example after a match press ESC to resume bouncing around via WASD
- Needless to say this game is played with friends. To help ensure that you don't just stumble into an empty room, I've taken a "one room, one server, one region" approach.
- Many commands are disabled when no match is setup. On the other hand, before matching you can WASD around the game area, which is not possible during matches.
- This game uses keyboard input. Some of the basic commands: move forward, look left, look up, look down, cam up, cam down, shoot (you can see the full list, except hidden commands, in the banner at the top of the game view!)
- Share your tips/discoveries on the game forum (via itch.io)
- If you type smileys, they will appear in the digital display above brainy (really)
- Because this game includes a chat function, I kindly recommend that you play it with a parent so you don't get upset or to minimize exposure to bad language. Seriously.

*Parting shot*

This game is a branch of Project Neo, a framework which I cleaned up and pushed to Github when LD44 started. You can find the source and media here:

https://github.com/eelstork/Neo/tree/br2112

Licensed media (sound) aren't made available. Also, I do not include a list of profanities used by the chat filter. Other than that, you are welcome to look around the project and derive works from this. I'll consolidate the license later, but for now, the general idea is: derivative works okay; plagiarism... not okay : D

I hope you will enjoy this game! Have fun!

entries.title: Pharaoh's Purse
entries.description:
You are the ancient Pharaoh Ramses XVII.  You've been hanging out in the afterlife with your friends, Khufu, Tutankhamen, and Cleopatra, as well as your boy Osiris.  However, in recent years, you've seen most of your friends become suddenly bankrupt and you realized you might very well be next.  So you hopped into Ra's boat and rode with him into the day, and back to the mortal world.  Your mummy, preserved in linens, accepted your spirit, and now allows you to fortify your temple against intruders.  There is no one here yet, but they will come.  It is up to you to protect your wealth and ensure that your afterlife vacation will never end.

This is our first game ever made and published!  That we made it in three days is just insane to us honestly.

![ludum2.png](///raw/ab0/22/z/23d65.png)
![ludum1.png](///raw/ab0/22/z/23d67.png)

So, a few things to take into account before you play.  Firstly, pressing Esc clears your current selection.  The Urn MUST be placed first, to 'unlock' new spots to place towers.  New towers must be placed in the gray circle.  Sneks have short range, we recommend they be placed towards the edge of the circle.

entries.title: STUPID BEAST!
entries.description:
STUPID BEAST! is a Path of Exile (PoE) fangame and a Ludum Dare 44 submission.

Story-wise, it probably won't make sense if you haven't played PoE.

## GAMEPLAY
- survive as long as possible without being captured by beastmaster Einhar
- pick up potions to restore health
- destroy green tiles by sacrificing some of your health
- you earn score by destroying tiles and surving

## CONTROLS
- WASD or arrow keys to move
- spacebar to destroy tiles
- spacebar or mouse to press buttons

## Installation
For best performance, it's suggested to download and run the windows build, but the game is also available for playing on the browser. I've noticed that it runs worse on fullscreen (at least on Chrome).

## Credits
- art & code - Sƒ´manis Mikoss
- most sfx & audio - taken from Path of Exile
- other audio - taken from creative commons

## Tools used
- Unity
- Gimp2
- Paint
- Audacity

## EDIT - post LD update
The game version has been updated after the end of LD submission deadline.

Here's what's new:

- Potions and destroyable tiles no longer spawn outside of map
- Added option to mute game
- Your highest score is saved (data is lost upon closing/reloading the game)
- Adjusted voice line volume

The original Ludum Dare version is still available in windows build.

![strategy.png](///raw/5a1/01/z/2254f.png)
*destroy tiles strategically to trap the hunter*

entries.title: Loose Change

NOTE: Play the Windows version if you can. It has nice intro and win videos that aren't working in the WebGL version.

entries.title: Coin Puzzles
entries.description:
In Coin Puzzles you play as a bag of coins. The amount of coins in the bag influences your movement and interaction with other objects. Like your movement speed and jump height for example. The amount of coins in the bag is indicated by the bar in the top left, this also represent your health. There are 6 levels and 6 extra levels.

![Schermopname (275).png](///raw/2cc/c1/z/21f4b.png)

## Controls
Coin Puzzles was designed for a keyboard and mouse setup. In theory controllers are supported for the platforming, but not for the menu's.
* **Move** using A/D or left/right arrow
* **Jump** using W or up arrow or spacebar
* **Restart** using R

## Tips
These tips are also integrated into the level designs.
* Collect coins to gain weight.
* The heigher you jump, the more coins you loose upon landing.
* Toggle buttons when you're almost full (80% or more).
* Go up fan blowers when half full (50% or less).
* Go down fan blowers when almost full (80% or more).

![Schermopname (276).png](///raw/2cc/c1/z/21fbe.png)

## Credits
**Mika la Grand** - Code, Art, SFX, Music

First time I made art and music.

### Some additional sounds
* https://freesound.org/people/abramovichalex/sounds/439221/
* https://freesound.org/people/Resinderate/sounds/340443/
* https://freesound.org/people/Quistard/sounds/166823/

## Patches
* Decreased coins required to toggle buttons and go down fan blowers.
* Increased the speed for going up and down fan blowers.
* A bunch of bug fixes.
* Changes to first level, to make it more clear how you gain and loose coins.
* Added eight additional levels (first extra level was present in jam build).
* All changes are detailed in the patchnotes on the itch page.

entries.title: Watt Balance
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/2df/2/z/234df.png)

On a lonely, desolate planet, one lone rover sets out to restore power to what's left of the world's technological society. Only scavengers remain.

Starting on the surface, you can climb the mountains or descend into the caverns towards the core. There are seven ancient power stations, broken
down and in need of repair. You can also find power cells cached in the caves of the planet. Finding these places comes at a cost: The civilization
traded energy as a form of money, and opening the caches and repairing the power stations will cost you.

You have a power collector that you can use to recharge from ambient energy when you are idle. It can charge using sunlight on the surface, but as
you descend into the depths of the planet this light cannot reach you. Underground, repaired power stations can fill your batteries within a certain
range.


Controls
--------
* Move: Arrow Keys
* Jump: Space
* Boost: Space (in air)
* Confirm: Z
* Pause: Escape

![screenshot.png](///raw/2df/2/z/234a7.png)

entries.title: Blood Farm
entries.description:
Blood Farm is my Submission for the Ludum Dare #44 Game Jam.

Controls:

WASD          - Movement

1, 2          - Plant Respective seeds

Q             - Water Plants

E             - Talk to Vlad, the not-so-friendly seed shopkeeper

Space         - Attack

Mouse         - Controlling menu options



In Blood Farm you play as Garlic Gary, a zealous garlic farmer who desperately wanted to branch out. Garlic Gary decided to cheap out on buying additional plots of land to farm garlic on, and instead started planting it in the gardens of abandoned houses.

One of these houses wasn't abandoned, and contained a vampiric resident with a distaste for Gary's practice. He caught Gary and forced him to work by making him farm blood from the mysterious plants the vampire showed him. But Gary quickly found out how much harder this type of gardening is, compared to garlic farming.

Unfortunately I didn't make the sound effects myself, so I can't upload this as a Compo, and well, I'm too tired to fix that.

Any kind of critique welcome, please be harsh and constructive. Thanks.

entries.title: Guttula (HTML)
entries.description:
**THE GAME **

Help a little water droplet [Guttula] traverse the desert to find its way back home, but be careful -- the desert is dry and every step you take costs you your life. 

Along the way there are springs that can replenish you, but also bugs and plants that want your essence. 

Being selfless and helping the desert bloom gains you mana, but at what cost? 


https://snufkinshat.itch.io/guttula-ld44


** HOW TO PLAY **

Find your way through the maze to the main spring


WASD or arrow keys to move

Every step takes water


You can touch cacti to make them bloom, but it takes water


Watch out for the spiders!



** DEV NOTES **

Made from scratch using Unity, Pyxel Edit, BeepBox, Bfxr, and Audacity.

I'm tired, hungry, thirsty, and I need a shower -- but I did it!!

entries.title: Slime, Blood and Pain
entries.description:
Welcome to the Dungeon!

You are doomed to die in a randomly-generated dungeon, inhabitated by not really friendly creatures: cute slimes, some skeletons, creepy multi-eye monsters...

Luckily, you won't need to rely only on your fists: inside the dungeon you'll be able to find hearts that can heal you (and some that will poison you), and you can also improve your equipment... at a cost. A cost in blood...

# Controls

`Arrow keys` - Select a direction  
`A` - Switch to Attack Mode (Attack in the selected direction)  
`Escape` - Switch to Move Mode (Move in the selected direction)  
`Space` - Skip a turn  

# Meet the cast

![You](///raw/d4d/z/22628.png)  
You! An adventurer stuck in the Dungeon, willing to sacrifice part of his life to slay more monsters.

![Bart](///raw/d4d/z/22652.png)
Bart, the Shopkeeper. He sells two swords... for your blood!

![Slime](///raw/d4d/z/2265e.png)
A slime. Be careful! It can bite with its sharp teeth.

![Skeleton](///raw/d4d/z/22674.png)
Spooky scary skeletons roam the Dungeon. They wield iron swords: don't get sliced! They can also jump back a square after attacking.

![Ranger](///raw/d4d/z/226a3.png)
Some skeletons decided to wield a bow instead of a sword, and will shoot you from far away.

![Watcher](///raw/d4d/z/2273e.png)
The terrifying Watcher. He's a mighty foe. He can dash after attacking.

# Items

![Heart](///raw/d4d/z/227b9.png)
An heart. Heals 1 HP.

![HeartPoisoned](///raw/d4d/z/227c0.png)
A poisoned heart! Damages for 1 HP.

![Sword](///raw/d4d/z/227cf.png)
This sword deals 3 damage, and can be bought... For **4** of your **Max HP**!

![Sword](///raw/d4d/z/227ca.png)
This sword deals 5 damage, but if you buy it... You will lose **10 Max HP**!

# Misc

![Vase](///raw/d4d/z/227d8.png)
A vase. You can break it, I guess?

![Candles](///raw/d4d/z/227e0.png)
Arcane candles. A spell protects them from destruction.

![Demon](///raw/d4d/z/227eb.png)
A demon you aren't ever going to see. Our artist thought it looked cool, though.

# A final note

_We salvaged this in the last Game Jam day from an unplayable mess. It's an awful disaster of code, sprites, and even some audio?_

entries.title: HeistLyfe
entries.description:
# Thanks for checking out HeistLyfe
Plays best on windows Desktop: Collect safes, artwork and cash laying around for some reason. BUT BE CAREFUL. If security gets after you, their damage makes you lose monies. Lose too much and it starts taking health. Collect enough to get the extraction point to appear, and see how much you can get away with. Watch out for alarmed items.

![600.gif](///raw/ae7/1/z/23fed.gif)

## Post Jam Thoughts:
We wanted to do a top down 2D game this time (because 2D is easier right??!? (it isn't)) so we could focus on making sure we had good gameplay. I think even though we had to do a lot of learning (like using tilesets) we still got a good number of features, however we had to comment out a few things like slowing down when too laden or the guards having guns. We also had one of our guys who had issues with his git setup and couldn't get us all the custom artwork for the steal-able paintings, which would have been fun, they were super creative.

entries.title: Hajime no Botto
entries.description:
‚ÄãWelcome to the Robot Combat League! You are about to face your rival in a death match, will you be able to knock him down?

**‚ÄãInstructions:**

- Enemy status is displayed on top on blue panels, player status is displayed on red panels, below
![battle.PNG](///raw/30a/1/z/244da.png)


- Activate a weapon of choice and select which part of the enemy to attack
![activate_weapon.gif](///raw/30a/1/z/244ca.gif)


- CPU, Battery or Weapons can be attacked
![select_target.gif](///raw/30a/1/z/244db.gif)


- An attack can only be performed after a cooldown
![cooldown.gif](///raw/30a/1/z/244cc.gif)


- Heavy weapon has big damage, but take long to cooldown and takes a lot of energy
- After cooldown defence is performed while holding its button, it will recharge CPU and Weapons, but will consume battery. There is also a damage reduction
![defence.gif](///raw/30a/1/z/244cd.gif)


- If CPU is hit, the cooldown will take longer
- If Battery is hit, damage will be boosted
- If Weapons are fully damaged, they can't be used
![weapon_down.gif](///raw/30a/1/z/244ce.gif)


- If CPU or Battery are fully damaged, the fighter is knocked down
![ko.gif](///raw/30a/1/z/244cf.gif)
‚Äã

**Comments:**

This was a very busy LD for me, so I wasn't really able to finish all the features I wanted. In addition, I used godot engine for the first time, so it took me some time to get adjusted to it. I hope it's still enjoyable, and who knows, I might use this mechanics for a future project!‚Äã

** Update:**

05.02: Added gifs to illustrate better the instructions

entries.title: Wild West Devil Pact
entries.description:
PLAY HERE:
http://yanwittmann.de/game/wwdp/

GAME TYPE:
A western-style 2D-Platformer and shooter!


STORY:
You, Denton Straddy, want to scare the evil, gold stealing Bloid Dillon away.
But you aren't strong enough! So you decide to make a pact with the devil.
He lets you exchange your maximum health points against abilities.

So, you begin your journey to meet Bloid Dillon and compete against him!
Will you succeed?


HOW TO PLAY:
Use the arrows up, left and right to control your cowboy.
Shoot by aiming and left-clicking with the mouse. You can reload by right-clicking.
Your bullets bounce off the walls and the floor.
By killing enemies, you get more health points you can spend later in the shop.
In the shop, click on the button to purchase the upgrade. The more frequent you buy an item, the more it will cost the next time.
What else? You can eat food to regenerate health and jump through portals to get to the next area.
There are also a few puzzle areas.

entries.title: The Final Rescue
entries.description:
![cover_sm.png](///raw/c5c/z/24442.png)

## :pen_ballpoint: Story

_Food is scarce. Money is gone._

_The machines will trade... but only for human lives._

_Save as many as you can._

## :video_game: Gameplay

* Find survivors under yellow beacons - teleport them aboard with your targeting system
* Beware, as more survivors will mean a quicker drain on your food supply
* Fly into shops at red beacons to trade with the machines
* The survivors' lives are currency - buy upgrades and food to survive

## :metal: Pro Tips

* Look at the controls (F1 for keyboard or Back for gamepad)
* Look at the game information (F2)
* Save early, save often (F6) - there's no autosave
* Controls are inverted only - it's the way I like it, and if you don't, now you know how I feel for most first-person or flight jam games! :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye: (but for serious it's high on the post-jam to-do list)

|||

entries.title: Mouseketeer
entries.description:
### **Mouseketeer** is a procedural platformer with a hint of narrative allowing the player to *cheese* his own adventure!

![mouseketeer-03.jpg](///raw/458/c/z/23c95.jpg)

You play a little mouse eager to go on quests. This is of course very dangerous: the owl's dungeon is rigged with traps and his minions ‚Äìrats, bats and blobs‚Äì are expecting you! Fortunately, should you meet your end (you will), there's plenty more adventurers where you came from: you're indeed from a very large family, and your many many siblings will right away follow your steps.

Is it a lost cause, then? Should everyone of your kind get squished in the attempt, one after the other? No, as you had the wisdom to take up a life insurance before entering the dungeon! Each sibling who die pave so the way to the next, allowing him or her a better chance in the maze.

Amass honour points to maximize the insurance bonus, invest in equipment, defeat enemies both by sword and by word, and finally vainquish all the dungeon keepers!



Made with Unity, narration elements made with Fungus.

### Controls:
WASD to Move
Space to Jump
Alt to attack, provided you have bought a weapon first.

## Gamepad support!

entries.title: Piggy Bank's Adventure
entries.description:
Piggy Bank and his family were living on Pig-Island without worrying about he future. Each day was better than the previous, and they all lived together as a happy family.

But those peaceful times suddenly ended when the evil Greedy Boar stole all coins of Piggy Mother and Piggy Father. 

It's now up to Piggy Bank to reclaim the honor of his family by getting back the stolen coins and defeat Greedy Boar

entries.title: Just a Dungeon
entries.description:
Just a Dungeon is a 2D Dungeon Crawler game.
It was made using my own [VulcEngine](https://github.com/Vulcalien/VulcEngine).

## How to win
To win you have to clear all the dungeon rooms, you will find a Yellow Tile of Win in the last one.

With your HPs you can buy armor and weapons.
Kill monsters to gain more HPs.

## How to play
Download the jar file to play (You must have Java installed and updated)

Instructions in Game.

ESC to skip dialogs (don't do it in first run, it is a tutorial).

## Post Ludum Dare
Modified monster's attack damage (literally changed a line in source code)

entries.title: Me And Sir Knight
entries.description:
Small game about a noble Knight and his brave Squire (you). Help your Knight by giving him a weapon, repairing weapon and even pour him with a water when he is on fire.

Update: translated into English (by numerous requests).

entries.title: Divine Worshiping
entries.description:
A simple game in which your goal is to convert all humans on earth. You can achieve this goal by sacrificing your worshipers to call down your wrath on the impious, boost your follower's faith or gain a more efficient converting power. You can also train priests, build churches and deliver scriptures to your followers, bought with their own money of course!

This was our first game jam and we did not have time to do everything we hoped for, but it was still a lot of fun!

**Instructions:**
- Click on the Convert button to start converting on your own
- Drag a preacher, church or scripture on the map to convert worshipers automatically
- Click on the plus sign to sacrifice worshipers and get soul power (spell currency)
- Use powerfull spells to send your religion to the top

![ScreenshotDivine.png](///raw/e5d/22/z/23090.png)

Changelog: 
- 2019-04-29 : Fixed a UI glitch on smaller resolutions

entries.title: Azure Combat

![Capture3.PNG](///raw/d8c/22/z/22dd2.png)

A top-down view game with pseudo 3D graphics. This is about a purple knight named Kommander Kork. He revels in the slaying of the teal knights, his sworn enemies. The reason why is how he gets stronger, his blade more powerful, the more health he has. He gains the health of his enemies as he slays them, traveling into the teal knight fortress. Once he is in the core of the base, there is no telling what he could do. Guide him using WASD, with space to jump, and the mouse to hit.

  Fixes

- Damage is now indicated by sounds and overlay

- Enemy damage is lowered, their hitbox is larger

- Enter button is indicated in menu screen, this is fun.

- Music is more dynamic

entries.title: The Gr8 Scamming Adventure

So since no one will ever get how this is a your life is currency I will tell you. Or maybe I won't, neither of us has any idea how we got from your life is currecy to this at this point. However I want to say it is one of the modern masterpieces that surpass many of the modern games in virtually any genre.

Each trial takes a sense away once it is complete - You pay fragments of your life in order to complete the objectives. You may need to replay several times in order to get the ‚Äòright‚Äô ending.

entries.title: ONE MINUTE STORE
entries.description:
### (Store Management Game)

**Description**

It's your job to watch your poor employee doing everything for you, order wares to be put up for sale and keep finances in check while also expanding.

The store only opens for one minute at a time before its closing time.

During the downtime you will be able to re-stock wares and purchase various upgrades, etc.

**Theme**

This is my first ludum dare - instead of doing "**your life is currency**" the way I assume you're supposed to,

I decided to literally make currency your 'life'. If you run of out cash, its game over.

I wanted to add more cash sinks but ran out of time.

Also did not have time for audio.

**Known Bugs**

-First time you open the finance window it shows the wrong values.. Close it and open it again!

entries.title: Apocalypse Hero
entries.description:
![Apocalypse Hero PNG.png](///raw/419/f1/z/23219.png)

My first time in Ludum Dare, it was a great experience!

-----<>-----

A simple game that needs a little strategy.
In a post apocalyptic era,so many defenseless people out there, so you decided to sacrafice your life to help them and they support you financially, so you can keep your mission to save the world, to save humanity.

Game mechanics:
Whenever you shoot it drain an amount of your health, also your health drains over time.
Whenever the timer reaches zero, you are able to choose another skill or upgrade a skill.
Keep an eye on the timer and health, if you risk the shot it might be your last.

-----<>-----

Health Shield - Basicly you can spam shots for a period of time without losing health.

Gain Health - You gain health over time but still lose an amount when you shoot.

Gold Multiplier - Multiplies the gold recieved when someone is saved by 2, upgraded with a maximum of 5.

-----<>-----

Controls:

-Mouse

Have fun :D

-----<>-----

Software used:

-Unity 2019.1

-Medibang

-Bfxr

-----<>-----

Music downloaded from itch.io credits go to its respective owner.

Track: Ludum Dare 28 - Track 1 by "Abstraction"

http://abstractionmusic.bandcamp.com

or

http://www.abstractionmusic.com

Twitter @ben_burnes

-----<>-----

entries.title: Moon Miner
entries.description:
**Lore-**
You run out of fuel and land on a Stray Moon, you find a cabin in the middle of the barren asteroid and find Bill the shopkeeper. He offers to sell you the required fuel to get home but the catch is he only takes oxygen as currency your "Lifeline".                                                                                          To get home you must mine the Moon of its valuable Metals well battling the natives before you run out of oxygen.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                 
**Instructions-**                                                                                                                        
Mine the Metals Take note of how hard they are to mine in the top right hand corner when looking at them.                                                     
Look out for The Native ‚ÄúRocks‚Äù                                                                                               
Sell your Metals to Bill for Oxygen                                                                                         
Buy Upgrades at the two vending machines (Tool Upgrade ‚Äòn‚Äô Oxygen Tank Upgrade)                                                         
                                                                                                                          
**Controls-**                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                       
Movement-                                                                                                                                     
WASD- Forward, Left, Back, Right                                                                                   
Space- Jump (Take Note of the Gravity)                                                                                  
                                                                                                                       
Other-                                                                                                                 
Left Mouse Click- Mining/Shooting                                                                                                                                        
E- Interact Button (You will be prompted when you can use this button)                                                              
Scroll Wheel OR Q ‚Äì Switch Between Tool and Gun                                                                                        
                                                                                                                             
**Known Bugs-**                                                                                                                
Flying, When heading upwards on the terrain you start to fly this is a bug best fix atm is to stand still and float down will try to fix tomorrow                                                   
                                                                                                                            
**Future Dev-**                                                                                                     
Add Starting/Ending Animations                                                                                             
Add ending to game                                                                                                    
Animation/Lighting Overhaul                                                                                        
Redo Gravity System                                                                                                    
Planet Terrain/Decoration Overhaul                                                                                          
First Person Option / Better Use of Third Person                                                                              
                                                                                                                                            
**Software Used-**                                                                                                
Engine- Unity                                                                                                     
Art- MagicaVoxel                                                                                                        
Music- FL Studio Pro                                                                                                       
Coding - Visual Studio                                                                                             
                                                                                                                       
**Team-**

Please Leave Comments With Suggesions :)

entries.title: Slaves of the Carribean

Everything is controlled with the mouse. In fights: left click (or hold) to control your ship, rights click to fire.

- get enough canon balls! If you're out, there is nothing to do but die by the hand of the enemy (or luck your way to the next harbor visit)

entries.title: Lost In Limbo
entries.description:
LOST IN LIMBO (5 level shareware version....yeah ok i run out of time but im an old dos gamer so it's now "shareware"!)

Use arrow keys to move and jump.
Pick up keys to unlock the doors of each level and collect a score. that score will be lost if you get hit by any enemy before you reach your heart in the level you chose to leave it in.  

<<<< IMPORTANT >>>>  use the mouse to choose which level to place your heart in when prompted to do so on the map screen. This allows you to choose the difficulty of the game, the further away you place the heart from your current level, the harder it will be to retrieve it again.

 The map will appear between levels to remind you of your progress.
How to win

Retrieve 666 pieces of Tag's hear and bring the heart score down to zero to help him leave limbo and re-enter the real world again. 

You cannot die as you are in limbo but you will be sent back to the start of a level if hit by an enemy. 

pick up mini bonus hearts around the levels to help your score. 


Gameplay/story summary

Tag's in limbo between heaven and hell......the devil holds the cards...will Tag be rewarded with life for the bravery to overcome the vices that put him there?...

Convince the devil Tag is worthy of life again by choosing the furthest level you think you can reach without dying, and collect what's owed to you for your determination and bravery. 

Here's are some previous game jam games i've worked on....  http://ludumdare.com/compo/author/ariake81/

entries.title: Particle Overload
entries.description:
![banner.PNG](///raw/c87/32/z/2116c.png)
A weekend LD44 project: 
Play any of your music and enjoy the reactive environment. Collect points while being pushed around. NOTE: For best experience, decrease game's audio via windows panel and increase audio in-game.

There is a default music track (royalty-free, but not mine sadly) included, but click "load" and then "play" to enjoy your own music.

- "WASD" to move.
- Sit on the music pad if you just want to listen to music and not play the game!
- Getting off the music pad starts reducing your "music" power. increase this by getting the green boosters.
- Avoid red boosters, which the minions are trying to push you in to. 

Feel free to leave feedback :)

entries.title: Everyday
entries.description:
Welcome to Everyday:

You have 3 ways to spend your day: going to work (clicking on the door, gives you money), playing or watching something on the television (clicking on the TV, gives you Joy) and reading something (clicking on the book, gives you Emotions). Each activity is going to raise one of yours status and lower the other two. Yet, everyday you will have different events, possibly affecting your status in a good or in a bad way.  Your luck is determined by your stats: Emotions affect Work, Work affect Joy and Joy affect Emotions, so try to no lose control of any stat. You have a limited amount of time/actions, which is affected by your Emotions.Try to survive ultill the end.

Enjoy :)

[Screenshot_32.png](///raw/8f1/42/z/2462a.png)![Screenshot_33.png](///raw/8f1/42/z/2462b.png)

entries.title: Influencer
entries.description:
![logo.jpg](///content/477/8/z/21499.jpg)

Being a famous influencer on the internet is a hard job.

Come and take lots of selfies :camera: , share your day with everybody and and sell advertising slots to buy :heavy_dollar_sign: better equipment!. But maybe it's your own life you're selling.


### Features
- 2 scenarios :mountain: :wavy_dash:
- in-game shop :shopping_cart: 
- cute fishes :fish: 
- wonderful panoramas :frame_photo: 
- lots of photo opportunities :camera:
- unexpected death :coffin: 

### About the team
This game is the first one we made in Godot, and it was very fun to make, even though we wanted to create many more scenarios and more items for the shop.

When judging please notice that the background pictures are not ours, but the mountain, character and the shop are.

### Updates
After the first release we fixed a few shortcomings that came up in the early feedback (thank you! :smiley:)

Changes:
- Allow exiting earlier from the death screen and going straight back to the first level.
- Add label on the balance meter
- Show number of likes in the death screen.


The updated v2 was released still within the game jam time limit so we recommend using it for new judging :smile:. We decided to keep also the old version if you want to try out what we had before feedback!

Using the Canon uses health as well as increasing the speed of player.
Upgrading the speed is necessary as the speed of ball increases gradually.

The game is still a bit buggy at times, but I completed it before deadline , completing my goal while entering the Game Jam

entries.title: Currencies of Life
entries.description:
**EDIT:** The scoreboard doesn't work. This is because dreamlo doesn't work with the WebGL build.
I don't know the exact reason but it had something to do that http links don't work.


**This is my first time I've entered a game jam and first time I "finished" a game. Feedback is appreciated :smile: **

"Currencies of Life" is about the three main currencies in life:
Money, TIme and Health.

The goal of the game is to make sure you don't lose any of the three currencies for as long as possible.
The longer you survive the higher your score. 
Losing any currency is GAME OVER!


**HOW TO PLAY**

Walking with WASD
You aim with your mouse and left-mousebutton to shoot


**MONEY**

You start with 100$, and when you kill an enemy you get 6$. But every time you shoot you spend 5$. So choose your shots wisely and don't just spam.


**HEALTH**

You start with 10 health, every time you get hit by an enemy your health will decrease by 1.


**TIME**

You start with 60 seconds, you have two ways to manipulate time.


Holding down L-Control will increase the timer by one second every two seconds. However this will also speed up enemies and their spawn time. Try to hold L-Control as much as possible to prevent the timer from running out.


If you're in a bad situation you can hold L-Shift to make all enemies move slower, while you move faster. But beware this will make your timer go down twice as fast.


**POWERUPS**

There are three different kinds of powerups which spawn every 20 seconds in a random spot.


Money - Will increase your money by 15


Health - Will increase your health by 1


Time - WIll increase your timer by 5 seconds


**SCORE**

There are a couple of ways you can increase your score.


Every seconds that passes your score will increase by 1, when you hold L-Control the score will increase faster.


For every enemy you kill your score will increase by 1.


For every powerup you pick up your score will increase by 15.


**SCOREBOARD**

There is a public scoreboard at the game over screen. If you want to enter your score, type in your name after you're game over and your score will be sent to the scoreboard.


The scoreboard only shows the top 10, so if you're not on there you should try again ;)

entries.title: Heart Sacrifice
entries.description:
First game I made for Ludum Dare. Hope you like it and comment if you have the time. 

EDIT: Link now works. 

I made a mistake when posting on itch. Accidentaly posted it as private instead of public game. I'm very sorry about that and hope you can play it now!

EDIT 2: I tried fixing the blue slime error and I think I did. Yesterday I rushed to post the game so I didn't test it at all that's why there were errors. I updated the download file and it is now called version 1.0.1. The error appeared very rarely for me during testing (about once in about every 10 test plays) and now it didn't appear at all. I will continue the testing and see if there are any more errors (I hope there aren't). Thanks for reporting the error messages, they helped me a lot.

Also, not many people have realized that there is a dash mechanic (which you have to unlock).
You can get it if you have 7 full lives then click on the icon in the middle of the map. Once you do that you can press "C" on your keyboard to dash.

That is the reason the game is called Heart Sacrifice. You have to sacrifice your health to be able to get dash ability thus the gameplay feels faster and also it's way easier to dodge enemy fireballs. Originally, I was supposed to make a statue in the middle instead of that icon but I didn't have time to do so since I didn't work on the first day of the jam, only on the second and third.

entries.title: BCoin - currency simulator

## Buy, sell & speculate = BCoin - currency simulator

You are investing in cryptocurrency called BCoin.


You begin with 4000$. Earn the money by buying and selling BCoins at the right time.
Your actions are impacting the demand and price!

## Hints:
- Buy when the price is low, sell when the price is high.

entries.title: Extraterrestrial Tower Defense
entries.description:
Extraterrestrial Tower Defense is a simple tower-defense game (hence the name) where you try prevent any extraterrestrial life from existing.

There are 4 towers to choose from that you can purchase. You use your *life* to purchase these.
You can also sell your towers and be payed back a reasonable price. Simply click on one of your purchased towers, and select 'Sell for $_'!

The most powerful tower can only exist in one instance. If you wish to move it, you can sell it, re-purchase it, and move it to where you wish. :D

The controls are quite obvious. Press Return/Enter to start the next wave. Press ESC (or click the button in the bottom-left corner) to pause the game.

Enjoy! Please rate!

To play:
* Download from any of the linked archive files (.rar, .zip, or .tar.xz) and extract somewhere.
* Run 'XTC_v1.1.exe'
* Play!

Made with:
* Unity3D game engine
* Audacity
* Paint.NET

Apologies for the lack of originality - hopefully the theme won't be so random next time. Also sorry about the horrific weapon sounds :P

entries.title: Stay alive!
entries.description:
![screen2.png](///raw/31e/8/z/24183.png)

Your life of you body is like a currency. It's about circulation and passing through. You have to keep it alive. You have to maintain it to keep its value. You have a very good maintainer, your brain. It does big amount of work in controlling your inner organs. How long could you stay alive if you take the its job?

### Instructions

There are four stats (blood circulation, oxygen, water and nutrition). Your goal is to keep them above 0%.

**Blood circulation** is maintained by the heart. Press **F** key repeatedly to make the heart beating.

Level of **oxygen** is increased when inhaling by holding **J** key, when you release it, the lungs exhale.

When the **water** level decreases below 80%, the body will drink - the stomach fills with a water (but only if it's empty). To absorb the water, use the stomach, by pressing **K** key.

The most complex process is to obtain **nutrition**. You have to wait for the body to eat (nutrition level is below 80%). By pressing the **K** key, the stomach will digest the food. Digestive process has multiple phases. First the stomach has to fill with gastric acid, next it must churn multiple times until the food is fully digested. 

![stomach.png](///raw/31e/8/z/241b8.png)

Nutrition from digested food is absorbed mainly by using small intestine (pressing **D** key). This will create some amount of waste material in large intestine.

![intestine.png](///raw/31e/8/z/241c1.png)

Large instestine is controlled by **S** key to move the waste material throuh it and absort remaining nutrition (smalled amount then small intestine).

### Tools

- Unity
- Visual Studio Code
- Inkscape
- Gimp
- Wikipedia (learning about bodily functions :D)
- ScreenToGif (for making gifs)

### Changelog

- **2019-05-04**: Fixed time shown in score (was still showing game's total running time)
- **2019-05-02**: Added link to updated version, where smashing all the buttons randomly won't keep you alive. You must keep the frequency of heart beats in certain limits and use deeper breaths using lungs. **Remember you should rate the original version.**
- **2019-05-01**: Time reset after restart, ox**i**gen typo

entries.title: BetYourLife
entries.description:
TEASER


We created a short teaser for our game and uploaded it on YouTube. You will find the link below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pcSTZW3-PBw

==============================================================================================

![1.png](///raw/b66/52/z/226a5.png)


Hi!

Me and 3 of my friends gathered around to participate in this gamejam. This is actually our first Ludum Dare gamejam. We decided to make a russian roulette kind of party game as the subject of this event is "Your life is currency". The game will be launched on android devices (with +5.0 android). In case you wanted to try it out it will be available to download .apk file. PC version will be android port if trying it out before you install it on your phone seems more convicing. Each player (from 2 to 8) gets his own revolver and uses it to bet his life. The one who stays alive and is the richest one is the winner. It is your life, that you use as money and well... life!


We created all the graphics including 2d art and 3d models. For music and sound effects, we used gamesounds.xyz

==============================================================================================

TEAM


Kamil Florek - 2d artist

The game Minister 2.2K is made to give us xp, gastritis of the cafes and also to reflect a little about the situation that passes our country.

Our country, lives a government of backwardness with corrupt and privileged politicians. However, those who have much, decide the lives of those who have little.

entries.title: Provide
entries.description:
Provide - An experience.. of life.. family, and the choices you make.

A game of life, made for Ludum Dare 44, with "Your life is the currency" as the theme.  A short story simulation of life in general, providing, or not providing, for your loved ones.  Created in 72 hours (really 48 if you count the first game I built and threw away). Cut short, with a lot of content never making it in for the deadline, but here it is!!

CONTROLS: Click text options with your mouse pointer.

Thank you to Pixel Prophecy https://www.youtube.com/pixelprophecy for the inspiration and motivation to participate in Ludum Dare.  If you haven't seen his videos, go take a look; amazing talent with all creations, especially video.

. 

![provide.PNG](///raw/195/c/z/23619.png)

.

.

I removed myself from the graphics voting category, as I used assets used for human characters: https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/characters/humanoids/low-poly-business-people-130313  |  Went the asset route as the first model I worked on.. for almost 24 hours, had an extra cloven hoof thing every time I exported from Blender, so I burned him to the ground.  At that point I gave up on the jam/compo.. but Pixel Prophecy and friends provided the motivation to get going again; knowing I couldn't do much in the time remaining, I pulled in the asset to help me move along, and have fun with the project!
![burnItDown.gif](///raw/195/c/z/238fd.gif)

entries.title: %usergosh% bless you
entries.description:
You are the Gosh. Like a god, not as mighty.

Your goal is to capture all regions/temple-cities on the map, while keeping manna (aka currency) above zero.

There is no direct control in the game, you only support your followers and convert heretics via miracles, be it blessing that will convert heretics to your faith, or devious curse that will reap it's toll on all living things in region. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j2fZCCzHipw

Tutorial:
Main thing you'll interact with are regions/temple-cities. Click on them:)
![LD44_tut1.png](///raw/3ef/32/z/22305.png)
They can be in three states: 
Marked by yellow swirly stuff - yours.
Marked by brutal warrior - controlled by heretics and non-believers.
Marked by lock - isolated from you. They are ignoring you.

Faith is how much people believe in you in this region. Keep it high!
Yellow population is loyal to you. Red are heretics and non-believers. They are converted over time, but you can help;)

Try to keep manna high, it's your currency and life. See how long it takes you to conquer everything:)
![LD44_tut2.png](///raw/3ef/32/z/223dd.png)
Blood must flow! Your followers will make sacrifices in your name, that will replenish your manna - both your currency to spend on spells, and your source of life. Run out of it - and you're as good as dead.

Regions are connected via routes marked by green doted lines.
![LD44_tut3.png](///raw/3ef/32/z/223fb.png)
Those roads are only way people go around this land. There are two main types of movements - attacks and patrols. Brutal warriors depict attacks, while praying people (that is what is drawn on those small things) are patrols. Patrols go from friendly regions to friendly region, but can participate in battles for regions, should need arise. Brutal warriors kill most people, but also convert some.

Hope you'll have fun playing the game, just as we enjoyed making it. Heck, we're even proud we accomplished so much :)

Technologies used:

Unity3D 2019.1

DOTS (ECS FTW) :)

UGUI

Data bind: https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/tools/gui/data-bind-for-unity-28301

Photoshop

You are lost in space and attacked by endless waves of dangerous pirates. Your shield is powered by rare and extremely valuable energy crystals. The single shop in the area only accepts these same crystals as payment. You must choose wisely between fire power and survival ...

## How-to play ##
Kill enemy ships with your weapons and collect the green energy crystals they leave behind. Increase your score!!

## Controls ##
- Move your ship: W,A,S,D
- Weapon: Left click
- Use a bomb: Space
- Pause the game: Escape

entries.title: Piggybanks in Space
entries.description:
If your life is a currency, you're obviously a bank, but banks are boring as hell and not suitable as game characters, unless, of course, they are **piggybanks**. Your goal is to become the biggest pig of them all. You control your piggybank by moving the mouse. You should pickup coins and eat smaller pigs to grow, while avoiding being eaten by the bigger ones. Hit Space to get back to the menu.
Tools used: 
- Unity
- Visual Studio
- Inkscape to draw everything in the game, including the font (the only thing that was done in advance)
- freesound.org to get the base for the sound effects
- Audacity to edit the sound effects
- OBS Studio to record the gameplay video

Special thanks go to [Aziraphal](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOyk1QIBrvT8F4MniT1egfw) for the soundtrack made especially for this game, not to mention QA.
https://youtu.be/-r8fc87QwnA

entries.title: Timing of Ignatius
entries.description:
Timing of Ignatius is a singleplayer game made for the Ludum Dare 44 Game Jam.

You only have one minute to live, fortunately you can make other creatures drop time by shooting them in their face with your cool projectile superpower.

To gain more strength, speed and other improvements you can use our Awesome Shop to buy upgrades with your lifetime.

During the gameplay you run through different stages and levels where you encounter different enemies and boss monsters which are trying to stop you from reaching your goal.

This is our first game jam game ever. If you have any problems or constructive feedback we would kindly appreciate it!

Winning Conditions
* Get to stage 48
* Have at least 5 minutes of lifetime

Controls
* WASD to move
* Mouse to aim
* Left mouse button to shoot, you can hold your left mouse button down to shoot very fast

**In order to advance to the next stage, you have to go through the black archway on the right side of the screen.** 

![TimingOfIgnatius Screenshot1.jpg](///raw/9cf/12/z/2267b.jpg)
![TimingOfIgnatius Screenshot2.jpg](///raw/9cf/12/z/2267d.jpg)
![TimingOfIgnatius Screenshot3.jpg](///raw/9cf/12/z/2267f.jpg)

**Play the game in fullscreen, otherwise the  edges on the left and right side are cut off.**

entries.title: Dragon Runner
entries.description:
You are a dragon, last of its kind. An evil wizard stole your eggs, the last hope to preserve your species is to take them back.

Try to collect 100 eggs in the shortest time possible. For each 5 eggs your health will increase a litte.

Two spells are at your disposal. Shield (Q) which prevents all damage done to you, and Time Stop (E) which freezes all enemies in time. You have limited uses of each but who knows, maybe you will be able to purchase more later...!
![screen1_lr.png](///raw/fd3/01/z/22192.png)![screen2_lr.png](///raw/fd3/01/z/221ad.png)

entries.title: Cat Your Life on It
entries.description:
This is a game about two cats betting their lifes on a game that will cost their lifes

How to play:
(This can be played as 1 versus 1 player)


- Push the slider to the right on each cat`s turn and very carefully waits for the gun to shoot, once it shoots you can drag it to the left again, if you keep on the right it you will keep shooting your cat


- There are 30 bullets, 14 lethal that will kill the cat and 16 fake that will not kill the cat


- The one who loses is the first cat to die, it is more of a competition to see which is the luckiest cat, in this case the cat that will take less lethal bullets
