entries.title: Plague Machine
entries.description:
You are a witch doctor who owes their soul to the Devil.  He comes now to collect but you've made a deal with him:   Sacrifice other peoples' souls in place of yours.  In order to live as long as possible,  you must release a  plague onto the world which feeds your health.  Each round of the clock, the Devil steals a bit more of your soul.  How long can you survive?

![PlagueMachine2.PNG](///raw/8aa/91/z/23007.png) 

Cities has different characteristics and populations counts.  Each City has weaknesses that can be exploited through careful positioning of your plague Spores and by upgrades their potency through Mutation purchases.
The game is part simulation,  part RPG, and part Mancala. 

![PlagueMachine3.PNG](///raw/8aa/91/z/2300d.png)

A tour of the HUD: Top left is the currently selected City name and population total.  Under that, the City's population breakdown by age group.  Clicking the arrow under the graph will pull out the City's Stats.  The bottom left is your Plague Spore information for the selected City.  The middle three buttons are for pulling up the Mutations window (the skull), then Navigating and zooming (the arrows and dot), then selecting the Attack option (the bullseye) to move your Plague Spores to nearby Cities.  The area on the right will pop out the Mutations window for you to buy upgrades and to see your Plague's Stats.  The top right is your Health and the Revolving Timer.

Each round of the Revolving Timer, calculations are done for 1) Plague Destruction, Population Death, Population Birth, and Plague Death. These are all rolled up into a final addition to or removal of your Health. The Devil's Damage is also subtracted from this value and will increase drastically as the game goes on.

The controls are simply to move your spores by using the using the bullseye button at the bottom of the screen.  You will move a percentage of your Spores from the selected City to the next City you click on (if it's within distance). Don't forget to purchase upgrade Mutations to battle the ever resistant Cities.  Each purchase increases drastically at the cost of your Health.  

**The Plague Stats Overview:**
- Critical Population - The maximum amount of Spores you can have on an individual City
- Damage - How much death you inflict on a City per Spore
- Diversity - How much your Plague resists a City's adaptation over time to your infestation
- Growth - How quickly your Spores multiply when feeding off the death they've caused
- Mobility - The percentage of Spores that will get transferred when attacking another City
- Rampup - The amount of Efficiency gained per Revolving Timer
- Sacrifice - The percentage of souls that are fed back to your Health from the Plague's destruction
- Upkeep Cost - The cost to keep the Plagues under your control.
- Zeal - The initial Efficiency of your Plague Spores after attacking a new City.

**This City Stats Overview:**
- Carry Capacity - The maximum population of a City
- Growth - How quickly the population grows
- Intelligence - How quickly the City adapts to the Plague once infested
- Virility - How many Children are born to Adults and Retired City Dwellers
- Community - How well Children and Elderly are protected from Plague damage
- Technology - The always increasing resistance to the Plague even when not infested

This game was solo developed and made in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 44.  The theme of the gamjam was "Your life is currency."  This was my first game jam with lots of learning experiences including building to WebGL, flat art creation, texture sampling, and using Itch.io.  I missed the Compo submittal by about 3 hours.  Blame it on the first time deployment issues.

**Post LD Updates**
- Updated tutorial wording to be a bit more clear
- Tweaked some of the City stats to not be so overpowered
- Fixed the game not ending when you have zero health (should have been "<= 0" not "< 0")
- Toned down the water color
- Fixed a bug where placing your first Spores was set to 0 instead of 50 (thanks to LD user @bar!)
- Added a Tutorial Skip button
- Changed Tutorial font to be more readable

entries.title: Offworld Slaving Company
entries.description:
# Description

After decades of testing through experimental abduction, humans have been found as the most suitable laborers for the ever growing industrial outposts on Mars. Their capture and auctioning pays out handsomely, so you, Howard, have been sent by a slaving company to walk among their kind and abduct as many as possible without alerting their enforcers and being caught. Your salary is at stake, so get down there!

# How To Play

You can fire mind control orbs with Left Click, they don't travel very far though.
Anyone hit by the orb becomes your slave.
You can only have one slave, taking control of another human releases your previous one.
Taking a slave to your ship increases you score by 1.

Being spotted while controlling a slave or releasing a slave will make you "Spotted".
While "Spotted", Police will move in on your last known position.
If seen in this mode, Police will move straight towards you.
You will become "Safe" if nobody has seen you for 10 seconds.

If spotted by Police while controlling a slave you will become "Hunted".
While "Hunted", Police will constantly move in on your position, even if you are not seen by anyone.
To become "Safe" while "Hunted" you must change disguises at your ship by pressing E.

If a Police officer touches you while "Spotted" or "Hunted", you lose -- game over!

# Controls

WASD or Arrow Keys - Move

Left Click - Fire

E - Change Disguise


# Background

We are family group who has participated in every Ludum Dare since Ludum Dare 38. For this entry, one of the sons' friend joined us to compose the music. We have enjoyed every entry to Ludum Dare, and each has brought its own specific challenges. This one was no different. For this one, I (the dad) was out of town for work at the beginning of the Ludum Dare and was, therefore, not able to participate in the planning stage or the beginning of development. My oldest son had to take over most of my responsibilities as the programmer, and I joined in when I got back. Most of the work on this entry was done by my sons and the friend. I only implemented a couple of of systems and did some bug fixing (and probably missed a few...) It was fun to see what they did on their own, though!

# Credits

James - Coding

Anthony - Coding

Cameron - Graphics

Oliver - Music


# Closing

We hope that you enjoy playing the game as much as we enjoyed making it. We do try to give feedback to every entry that leaves us feedback, regardless of whether we like it or not. We are here to learn, so please be honest!

entries.title: Root Maker
entries.description:
**Welcome to Root Maker ¬©, the world's greatest currency exchange software.**

You have just been hired as a currency trader. Congratulations! Currency is now your life. Root Maker ¬© will guide you to unprecedented success in your new career. Money is the root of all good things, and Root is the best type of money there is.

**Instructions**

- Buy and sell currencies to gain more Root. 
- Exchange rates tell you how much of that currency makes up 1 Root. 
- On the *Buy* screen, enter how much Root you want to spend to buy that currency.
- On the *Sell* screen, enter how much of that currency you want to sell back for Root.

Rumor has it that Root Maker ¬© rewards high performers, and that if you make enough Root, you may end up with some extra options...

**Updates**

v. 0.1.2 (May 10)
- Fixed a bug that made buttons disappear after they were purchased
- Fixed the cult complex being purchasable for less than the necessary amount
- Fixed an issue where button backgrounds were incorrectly colored

v. 0.1.1 (May 8)
- Fixed a bug that caused the game to crash when you entered too many characters in the buy/sell input boxes
- Made numbers round to a suffix in order to prevent them running outside of their boxes
- Fixed the cult screen not formatting numbers correctly

**Screenshots**

![Screen Shot 2019-04-29 at 4.17.59 PM.png](///raw/0c7/22/z/22420.png)

![Screen Shot 2019-04-29 at 4.20.13 PM.png](///raw/0c7/22/z/22423.png)

**Credit:**

 - @jason-porritt on the audio

Built with Phaser 3.

entries.title: BulletLife
entries.description:
In a world where bullets are somehow directly correlated with your lifespan, comes an infinite shooter that puts your video gaming skills to the test!

Every bullet you shoot is a year out of your life. Fortunately, enemies will drop years upon their deaths for you to collect, and years you gain can be used to purchase upgrades to make your stand against time more effective! 

Overview
- Infinite waves with an ever-increasing difficulty
- Start the game with 25 years of life
- Firing bullets (regardless of upgrade state) costs 1 year of your life
- Loot years from the corpses of your enemies
- Spend years on different upgrades

Controls:
- Movement: WASD
- Shoot: Left Click

Quick gameplay video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gN4C5mkf240

entries.title: The Million Dollars Insurance
entries.description:
This is Game full of neta contents. The concept of currency is hard to express by mechanics, so we choose to avoid it. But the basic story is based on it.

All the Graphics and music is created by our team, special thanks to all my team member.

Maybe you will get stuck in some levels. Don't worry. open the pause menu and get some hint!

If you still can't understand, maybe sometime we will provide solutions to the whole game.

Hope you like the story and enjoy the gameplay.

Have Fun!





storyÔºö


I hoped that I could bring happiness to my family, but the cruel reality taught me a lesson 

--not all the efforts pay off.

Now that I lost my job, the great burden was about to nibble away all my savings, which means my son would starve to death unless I could find a way to make more money.

So the only thing that could save my son is the $1'000'000 life insurance. Yeah, I know it's insurance fraud... but do I have other choices?

My life for $1'000'000, sounds like a deal.

‚ÄòThis last act of sacrifice is mine!‚Äô



The Tutorial is below.!
![tutorial.jpg](///raw/a98/e1/z/2269f.jpg)

entries.title: Projekt Rekt
entries.description:
The objective of the game is to survive the onslaught of enemies in the 'Challenge' game mode. Currency earned in game can be used to purchase upgrades and new characters from the in-game shop. At the end of every wave of enemies, your currency will be increased by the amount of health points you have left.

In order to earn currency easily, the arcade mode (accessed via the 'Play' button in the game) is an infinite, randomly generated game mode with increasing difficulty. This game mode also feature health packs that randomly drop. 

** But remember, every bullet fired decreases your health. Make every shot count. **

(WRT the opt-outs, I only made about 50% of the art myself and as such I *have not* opted out of Graphics - the only thing I did not make myself were the character sprites.)

## ** Thank You **

entries.title: Tower of Meat

You are instructed to BUILD a TOWER OF MEAT, because *REDACTED*
When you build said meat tower to the UPPER LINE, you are blssed by the gods and allowed to build another one, which will be "much harder", untill the gods are pleased!

entries.description:
This game is about your descent into a realm of darkness and the things you have to do to come back to your own dimension.

![titelbild.png](///raw/2d6/6/z/2373f.png)

You play a mage who works with dangerous spells that have cast them into a ghastly realm. They know to get back to their home, they need to cast a demanding spell. But for it to work, they first have to find the shards of a real soul and put them back together.

entries.title: The IMPossible escape
entries.description:
### You are dead! And cast to hell! 

Fortunately, an imp offers you a way out to escape eternal torture. It's a bet: can you reach the exit before you lifeforce expires? He's even willing to allow you certain powers, but at a price: your lifeforce...

### The IMPossible Escape

My Ludum Dare 44 Entry. The theme is "Your life as currency". It's a timed precision platformer. Your healthbar represents the timer, and you can buy any power charges you want in exchange of a bit of health. Try to finish with the maximum health remaining!

Unfortunately, I didn't have the time to add more levels, nor sounds, nor to polish. Maybe in the future! 

### How to play

Keyboard and Gamepad are supported.

- Move: Arrows | Left joystick
- Jump: Space | (A) button
- Dash: X key | (X) button.

### Credits

- *Design, programming, UI, animations*: Matthieu Golsenne
- *Design, art*: Laetitia Payeur

entries.title: In Exchange For My life
entries.description:
![g887.png](///raw/8b6/c/z/23b71.png)
You play as a nameless mage who has sacrificed his life to the devil for power. He must adapt to his newfound powers to traverse a dungeon that only has one floor for some reason.

![Exchanger.gif](///raw/8b6/c/z/23b8e.gif)

The only true currency here is health. Casting a spell means wagering a portion of you health bar to the devil(the blue part of the bar in the gif). You'll need to keep your wager by dodging the incoming enemy attacks. Get hit once and you'll lose all of the HP you've wagered.

To keep things fair, the devil has thrown in a special artifact, a lifegem. This rare gem will slowly restore your Health and even bring you back to life a couple of times too. But don't rely on it too much.

There are also powerups to keep things fun. Every powerup will decrease your max HP. So pick and choose the ones you like best.

**Controls**:

*WASD* to move.

*Left click* to melee attack.(Hold to charge)

*Right click* to cast spells.

*Left Shift* to dash (Once dash is unlocked)

**Credits**:

The art for the game was done by **Cardwise**

The explosion asset was made by **Sinestesia** from OGA

I handled all of the code.

NOTE: In the older version there is bug that spawns enemies outside of the room and thus blocks your progress. you can try the fixed version(which has minimal changes outside of a small fix) or try to attack the enemies outside of the room with ranged attacks.

entries.title: Dudes of Wizardry
entries.description:
# Dudes of Wizardry

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbMLzsBfuzU

## Story: 

You are a necromancer who was killed by some dudes, which knew you were a bad dude.
They stole your soulcrystal and buried you on the graveyard (nice guys, tho!).
Fortunately you are a necromancer and so you are capable of self rezzing, stealing souls and stuff.

### Hint:

The story has multiple endings ;) 
You may have to teleport to reach certain areas ;) 


# Controls:

    A / Arrow-left: move left
    D / Arrow-right: move right
    Q : next spell (mouse scrolling also works)
    E : previous spell
    Space: jump
    Mouse: Left klick to cast spells

# Spell - Explanation
	Each spell (except for *EatSouls*) spells unleash on the position where you click (on the ground)

	- SkullExplosion: DD, low damage. Can be casted while moving
	- Poison: DOT, Can be casted while moving
	- Teleport: Teleport, Can be casted while moving
	- DeathClaw: DD high damage. Must stand still to cast
	- EatSouls: Cast nearby dead enemies. Leach souls from dead enemies to heal yourself! You have to stand near the dead corpses for this to work. This is a channeling spell.

	
# Update 01.05.2019:

We have just released a WebVersion. You can now play Dudes of Wizardry in the browser! <3

entries.title: Blood Coins
entries.description:
This is our submission for our first Ludum Dare Event #44: Blood Coins

We hope that you enjoy playing the game. We would highly appreciate your feedback!

Note: We did everything from scratch. There were no pre-made assets used.

PS: MULTIPLE PLAYTHROUGHS POSSIBLE :)

Some Context (Spoiler Alert!):
The world faces Judgement Day. God and Satan are sending their legions over mankind to bring absolut destrucion. In the midst of this battle, you find yourself looking for a place to die. Resigned and disheartened, you wish to send one last prayer to receive closure.

As the universe will have it you are able to attain divine powers that enable you to fight against the apocalyptic armies. However, those powers take their toll on you, drain your life force and turn it into profit for the supreme deity everything returns to because after all: your life is just a currency. This is displayed in the game by transforming  your lost HP into coins that appear in the UI hourglass at the bottom left of the screen. You lose HP by either getting hit by an enemy or by simply being in the afore described divine form you received upon praying at the altar.

You have to decide which side you want to fight for and give your life in exchange. You may also beat the game by choosing neither of the two forces and instead remain a human being. Choose your own path.
(This game can be played multiple times with different endings)
You shouldnt miss out on the epic boss fights ;)

![screenshot2.png](///raw/7b0/32/z/2294c.png)
![ScreenShot.png](///raw/7b0/32/z/2294e.png)

Controls:

A , D -> walk

Shift -> fast walking

W , S -> Flying

Left Mouse Button -> Attack

F -> Interact



<--------------------------------------------------------------->


EDIT: Version 1.1 out NOW! with many bugs fixed listed here:

-> The respawn now works. You can play the game multiple times until you find the ending that suits you best!

-> The dialogs are now way faster and less annoying to deal with. No more waiting for the text to slowly appear one by one.

-> The flying was a huge problem for most of you, and we, me and @marius-boenisch werent satisfied with that either. It wasnt supposed to be that way. But the stress at the end took its toll. However, now with V 1.1 flying feels way more intuitive and easier. You also dont fly with space anymore, but W for upwards and S for downwards. Check it out, there are some awesome boss fight at the end ;)


-> You can finally skip the annoying cutscene at the beginning if you want to play over and over again!

-> More good news considering combat and controls: The player now attacks in the direction the mouse cursor is facing. That also was something many people disliked and we agree, it was not optimal.

<--------------------------------------------------------------->



We hope you like the new Version and give us, again, a lot of feedback. This is only possible thanks to you guys :)



Produced by
Kevin B√∂nisch (Coding)
Marius B√∂nisch (Art & Music)

entries.title: Dragon's Gold
entries.description:
You are a dragon, therefore you must protect your treasure at all cost. You are a very small however, so your hoard consists of just a single gold piece. Giants have arrived who wish to steal it.

Hands will try to make off with your treasure. Aim (Mouse Movement) with a fireball (Left Click) or a bite (Right Click) to attack them. You can also bite the coin to move it to where you want.

Avoid of the giant's weapons by moving (WASD) and leaping (Space). If you are hit you will be stunned.

Keep the your treasure for as long as possible for a high score.

If you are having a bad run Reset with 'R'. You can exit game with 'Esc'.

![Dragons Gold 4_28_2019 3_13_40 PM.png](///raw/a47/z/210fa.png)
Made with: Unity, Audacity, Inkscape, Paint.net, Blender.

entries.title: Grim & Tonic
entries.description:
![GT512cover.png](///raw/782/z/235c1.png)

Our alcoholic friend Tonic is getting drunk one night in a bar and has one too many drinks for his mortal self to handle as is confronted by a strange hooded skeletal figure who approaches him with a tap on the shoulder. He turns half-headedly to face the Grim Reaper himself, standing before him to announce that his time has come. Tonic, the arrogant stubborn bull he is, demands another drink and challenges death to a drink for his life!


Match drinks together to get ahead, match poisons and you will fall behind. You have an hour left (although it may seem like a minute) on the clock before the bar cuts you off. Will you have enough time to OUT DRINK DEATH?!

![screenshotNEWER.png](///raw/782/z/235c4.png)

entries.title: Kill Paouf V
entries.description:
**A basic vertical shooter.**

**You can buy some upgrades with your own life when you are over special zones (RED zone). **

**You can sell some upgrades to restore your own life when you are over special zones (BLUE zone).**


All assets are googled (and propably copyrighted for some).

But the game engine is mine:

The source is split in three parts:

- Ludum44: the game itself
- chaos: a base C++ libray, the core of the engine
- death: another library more dedicated for games

Otherwise i use the following C++ libraries

- OpenGL (4.5)
- Glew
- Glfw
- Irrklang
- Boost with MPL
- STL
- FreeImage
- Glm
- Tinyxml2
- Freetype
- Nlohmann/json

And 

- TiledMap Editor


Sources are publicly given but due to some libraires dependencies, you probably won't be able to compile.
Let me know if you want some informations relative to the code.


The game only has 3 levels (and are almost copies of one another). Maybe i will rework on that later
(and maybe a post ludum incoming version)



![Capture1.PNG](///raw/7d2/1/z/22a25.png)

![Capture2.PNG](///raw/7d2/1/z/22a2f.png)

![Capture3.png](///raw/7d2/1/z/22a3d.png)




## GAMEPAD CONTROLS:

    Gamepad to displace

    Button A: fire
    Button B: slower but more powerfull charged fire 
              (keep 1 second. beware, no feedback implemented :( )
    Button Y: trade your life for upgrades or the inverse

    Start / Select : pause the game

## KEYBOARD CONTROLS:

    Arrows to move

    SPACEBAR: fire
    CONTROL : slower but more powerfull charged fire 
              (keep 1 second. beware, no feedback implemented :( )
    ALT     : trade your life for upgrades or the inverse

    P : Pause
    ESC : Restart

entries.title: Knight's Test
entries.description:
This is a story of a young man who has been forced to go through a test that is a lot more than what it seems. If he doesn't realize what he needs to do he will fail and pay the "ultimate price". I have been dealing with a lot of unresolved trauma and this is my way of expelling myself of that. I hope you enjoy the game and good luck finding the good ending and passing the test. 

![knights_test_ss1.png](///raw/1f4/32/z/239fb.png)

I lost a day because of my laptop suffering hardware issues, but I am lucky that I didn't lose everything. I had to cut a lot of content so I hope the story hits the way it is suppose to, but I made it to the goal regardless of the hardships. That's the ultimate victory. 

This was made using GB Studio, an excellent piece of software that allows you to make actual Gameboy games. The track you may hear during the title screen was done in Milky Tracker and it was my first song in the software. If you can't hear it in-game check out the song in the video. The graphics I used were from the [Dungeon Crawl](https://stevencolling.itch.io/16x16-dungeon-crawl-assets) asset by Steven Collings.

![knights_test_ss2.png](///raw/1f4/32/z/239fc.png)

Play this game on the web (it's mobile friendly) or you are welcome to download the rom and play it on a Gameboy emulator of choice.

![knights_test_ss3.png](///raw/1f4/32/z/239fd.png)

At **LIFE Corp**, we only value one thing : the human **Life**.

**L**ow **I**ntelligence **F**or **E**xplosives ! 

or was it **L**azy **I**ce **F**orce **E**xperiment ?

Unfortunately, these ultra-armed protection robots went kind of crazy. That's why we're searching for the most badass handymen we can get.

entries.title: Coin War
entries.description:
Game developed by [Tom√°≈° Jakubec](https://ldjam.com/users/samot.cebukaj), [Martin Vejbora](https://ldjam.com/users/martinvejbora/) and [Jan Jone≈°](https://ldjam.com/users/jjones) during Ludum Dare 44 Game Jam at [MFF UK](https://gamedev.cuni.cz/events/ludum-dare-44-mff/).

You are a gold coin being spinned through an arena full of obstacles and bad brown enemy coins. Your goal is to destroy all the enemies by hitting them hard. To give your coin most energy, you have to be fast and hit it at the right spot!

https://youtu.be/4q4-hvIdxtQ

The game was developed in [Unity](https://unity.com/) and can be downloaded for Windows or played directly in your web browser. More on [the game's page](https://janjones.itch.io/coin-war).

entries.title: Heart and Soul
entries.description:
# Welcome to **Heart and Soul**!

This is my entry to the Ludum Dare 44 Jam. I finished on Compo pace, but I had to submit as a Jam entry due to some of the public domain resources I used. Check below this post or in credits.txt for credits.

~~The game can be found on [my website](http://picsofbread.com/ld44)~~ or below. Just extract the zip somewhere and run "run.bat" (for Windows) or "run.sh" (for Linux). No OSX support, sorry.

**EDIT: my site is having issues, I switched to a Google drive link.**

If you're on Windows it may pop up a warning about SmartScreen. Just click more details, then run anyway.

Also, Avast! is a piece of garbage antivirus that will probably complain about it being a rare file or whatever, and not run it. Here's the [virustotal](https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file-analysis/YWE5MTNiYWY5MmRlNmRiOWJhYTgzM2I4YThhMzk2OTM6MTU1NjQ5Mjk2OQ==/detection) that shows it's clean.

The gameplay is explained as soon as you exit the title screen. That's all you get. It's much more fun to discover the game for yourself rather than have everything spoon-fed to you, right?

The controls are fairly simple. In the city view, left-click to place your selected building. Right-click erases buildings. Use the mouse-wheel to select a building.

Hopefully you have fun with the game! May the best man win.

![Screenshot from 2019-04-28 16-08-03.png](///raw/e46/22/z/21381.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-04-28 16-08-21.png](///raw/e46/22/z/21383.png)

entries.title: Skeleton Arena
entries.description:
Welcome to the fighting pit.
You are a pitiful undead made to fight for the amusement of the overlords.

Between rounds you may exchange some of your life force for better equipment and upgrades.  
Don't waste too much though, that life force is useful for not dying a miserable death.

Each kill will grant you some extra life force however, so put on a good show before your inevitable demise.

![arena.jpg](///raw/361/z/23244.jpg)

A bit rough and unfinished, but most of the game is here.

Don't ask why the wall is blue. It wasn't supposed to be blue. Why is it blue?

---

Controls: WASD: move. Left mouse: attack. Right mouse: block.  
Hold left mouse to ready an attack. release to attack.  
Escape to get back to the main menu when you die.

You can edit data/settings.def to change the resolution

I was going to enter this for the compo rather than jam, but the item shop wasn't done in time.  
Added a link to the post compo version If anyone wants to try it out. Still not finished but it is more complete.

entries.title: The Healthy Gladiator
entries.description:
You are a gladiator in a small arena. You fight whatever is thrown at you, be it a Thief or a Champion.
You gain life when you take it from others, and you lose it when you buy something from the shop.
Once a match is over Healers restore your health to what it was before the match started

![THG_SHOP.png](///raw/ffb/42/z/24042.png)
------------------------
![THG_PLAY.png](///raw/ffb/42/z/2403e.png)

I compiled a build for windows which should work
You can't double click on the exe to launch it. You need to open it using Command Prompt. This might help if you aren't sure how: https://www.wikihow.com/Run-Exe-from-Cmd-on-PC-or-Mac

A word or two about the fighting:
When you are next to an enemy you will automatically attack them. Running away is usually pointless because the enemies are slightly faster than you. And you can use the potions whenever you want. They fill your health to to max regardless of what your current health is.
Enemies deal their weapon damage +/- 1 or 2 (Randomly selected). I recommend only using the potions when the enemies attack could kill you if it hit with the +2 damage. Feel free to do whatever you want with them though lol. If you use a potion you will heal before a fight takes place. Sometimes when using a potion you may notice your health not fill to max, this is due to the enemy hitting you right after you drink. You always strike first in an attack. If an enemy dies from your attack you won't take any damage

entries.title: Vampire Fish
entries.description:
In the dark caves under a long forgotten castle lives a terror of the deep forever fueled by blood.

![22da4.png.320x256.fit.jpg](///raw/e4a/a1/z/23e06.jpg) ![unknown (1).png](///raw/e4a/a1/z/23e07.png)

Download: https://github.com/DarkGuardsman/LD44-Vampire-Fish

# Game

Play as a vampire fish that needs to constantly consume blood to live. Time is your enemy, every movement is your enemy, and even each bite drains you of the blood you need to live. The blood is both your dept to pay and the very thing you need to spend to get more.

## Controls

W to go forward
S to go backwards
Mouse to aim / change rotation
Left click to attack

## Mobs

Basic fish - Low HP, High blood drop rate, Quick snack
![fish1.png](///raw/e4a/a1/z/23e08.png)

SunFish - High HP, Medium blood drop rate, Tough as nails
![sunfish.png](///raw/e4a/a1/z/23e09.png)

SlimeFish - Medium HP, Low blood drop rate, Not as tasty
![slime.png](///raw/e4a/a1/z/23e0a.png)

## UI

Due to limited time the only UI that exists is the instruction start, HUD, and game over screen. There was a plan to clone the UI we used for our LD43 game which includes a menu with usability controls, custom keybinds, graphics settings, etc. However, I (darkguardsman) only ended up having ~10 hours to work on the game due to other responsibilities. Future versions will include better UI elements if we continue.

## Credits

- Audio - Freesound.org
- Coding - Darkguardsman
- Design - Darkguardsman
- Idea Starter - Graugger (who wished not to make an account to get credit)
- Graphics - TrisAstral
- Unity - For being easy to use

## Issues/Limitations

AI are super simple, they contain local avoidance to avoid each other and the player. However, have no actual logic to deal with getting stuck or collisions. So expect fish to be derpy in some cases

Physics can be touchy at times, especially if you rotate while next to a wall. This can cause your fish to flip through the air for a short burst. Not really an issue as it can be a fun mechanic, however, was not by design. 

Attack range is really close, you basically need to get your teeth right over the target.

## Firsts
- Working as a team (last 2 attempts were solo)
- Included audio
- Actual art
- Level Building

## Features we missed

- UI - Would have loved to make a full menu, hud, etc
- Enemies - Plan was to have several aggressive mobs (other vampire fish, electric eels, string rays)
- Dangers - Plan was to have environmental dangers including sunlight, spikes, and falling objects
- Levels - We ended up with 1 really rough demo level the goal was at least 3 simple levels with objectives
- Upgrades - Spend blood to make your fish better
- Power ups - activatable upgrades or one off upgrades that allowed interesting effects (slime fish, bat fish, dash, cloak)
- Better AI - random pathing, environmental behavior like eating plants or sleeping, chase mechanics 
- Bleeding - Have fish bleed rather than dropping blood right away
- Better graphics - blood drop effects, more enviromentals, etc

entries.title: Cashteroids
entries.description:
Made over the weekend of Ludum Dare 44! Sell your ship‚Äôs hull for more upgrades and weapons! Learn how to balance your max health as well as the number of upgrades on your ship. As stages get more challenging, does it benefit you to have a decked-out arsenal, or would it be better to instead have the thiccest hull in the galaxy? Either decision you make, our sleazy alien shopkeep is more than happy to cut you a deal.

This is some hot garbage, but folks, it's got rough-around-the-edges charm.

L-Ctrl : Fire / Select
W: Forward Thrust
S: Reverse Thrust
A/D: Rotate Ship

NOTE: to those who are rating beyond May 11th, 2019, while we encourage you to try our latest build with fixes and other additional features, we ask you to first play and consider the LD original build available on our itch.io site. This is due to the nature of the changes featured in our latest build; they either alter the gameplay or improve upon deficites to a degree which could sway fair and honest rating. Thanks!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Code Monkeys and Witty Banter - Michael Racine, Griffin Tucker

Dirty Shopman and Outerspace Doodads - Drew Tucker

entries.title: Monotheizmation
entries.description:
![LD44_S2.png](///raw/a1b/1/z/247ef.png)

![LD44_S1.png](///raw/a1b/1/z/247f0.png)
 
Two gods fighting for their bloody sacrifices offered by Aztec-ish village. Listen to the villagers and use your powers to help them up with most urgent village necessities. The better you utilize your powers the more energy / faith power will be given to you from sacrifice. Be wary of the second god who has identical powers - they have red aura.

Typical workflow for the game:
- Watch for the most urgent needs by observing what villagers are talking about - the speech bubbles will appear above them with symbols of resources that they need. The symbols represent the buidling / area that they want to be taken care of. On mouse over that area you will see what powers you need to use to improve this resource.
- Select desired power and then use it on most beneficial place (hold LMB to use the power until you no longer want to). Using powers costs you faith
- Farm and city can be affected by fertilization power (on mouse over, farm / city might have flashing fertility icon - you should use that power there until the icon is gone)
- There isn't a win / lose condition yet, but you can see if you are better than the other god


### Controls
LMB - select power and then hold LMB over interactable place to use the power 

Escape - take a guess

#### Disclaimer
Game made solo from scratch except audio, some UI icons, tree models and human models.

entries.title: Autumn Shores
entries.description:
Autumn Shores is a game/prototype about exploration and sailing. Lost on an island, head out and uncover the mysterious infinity st.. erm, gems. Each contains a mysterious power lost to the world (seriously, I didnt get around to implementing the magical upgrades bit). Unlocking all of these gems is the endgame. But as with anything, time (ie your lifespan) is against you (a kind of currency?), so dont take forever!

![Untitled-6_2.jpg](///raw/d6f/c/z/23cb8.jpg)

Its certainly a very half-baked-and-broken version of the game I was envisioning, but a complete enough game to mess around in - with some elements Im pretty happy with! The boat physics, buoyancy, object dragging and wind system in particular turned out really well and I felt like the graphics developed nicely throughout the jam. The final 12 hours of the gamejam were a mad rush to implement the last few features needed to be anything close to playable and I spent a good deal of time building a bunch of unique, far-off islands to explore.

![Screen01.jpg](///raw/d6f/c/z/2457c.jpg)

I really havent had time to properly play-test much, but I know the distances between islands are likely too large. I wanted some level of epic scale to the game but there was meant to be more interesting content *on the way* to the outer islands, which I simply didnt get around to creating during the jam. 

30/04 Ive uploaded a minor updated version of the game to include some bug fixes to a few systems that were broken (re-spawning, death, music and wind etc) and brought the islands closer together (theyre still pretty far away tho)

![Screen05.jpg](///raw/d6f/c/z/24580.jpg)

Its super buggy, youre not guaranteed to get a new boat if the one you have gets ruined and be prepared to be as lost and confused as the main character! I very much doubt anyone will get to the winning condition due to difficulty/boredom - but prove me wrong! I havent even completed the game yet in 1 shot so if someone else can, throw a screenshot in the comments!

Open to any c&c.

![Screen06-2.jpg](///raw/d6f/c/z/24582.jpg)

Credits:

Coding, game design and art by Alex Delderfield

Music by Synthetic Waveforms https://soundcloud.com/syntheticwaveforms

entries.title: Glampire Baby Herder

# Survival Horror Dwarf bebe herding!

Survival? You'll die if you run out of money!
Horror? Vampires are scary ... dwarven robbers too...

What is Bebe Herding? Well sometimes you gotta round up those bebes and turn them in to the local Inn for cash.

You're a Glam Vampire named Vampy. Your race of vampires feed off of money! Due to some strange circumstances, taking dwarf bebes to the Inn will earn you some Cash to feed on and so you can afford your coven taxes!

Watch out, the Dwarves will try to rob you! And moving around incurs a Coven Transportation Tax periodically. Don't run out of cash or you'll die!

Stand near Axes/Bebes And Press Space to carry them!

Arrow Keys / WASD to move Vampy around


### Credits

Much love goes out to OpenGameArt.org the source of the tileset used in this game. (I have opted out of graphics due to this)
I also used background music from an OpenGameArt track. The Voiceovers are original so please rate audio only for those. Thanks for playing!

entries.title: BattleType
entries.description:
You take on the role of a god. Use your life force to create an army of followers, absorb the manna from their prayers, and use your followers to defeat the armies of the wicked rival gods. By destroying your rival god‚Äôs followers you stop the worship that sustains them, thereby ending their existence.

Hint: Type the words you see on the screen as quickly as you can!!

![BattleTypeScreenshot.png](///raw/1a5/e/z/23583.png)


### What is BattleType

BattleType is a tower defence and lane strategy game.  The aim of the game is to destroy the enemy god by summoning your fighters to defend your portal, fight the hordes of enemies on the battlefield (lanes), and to sacrifice themselves at the enemies portal.

### How To Play

#### Fighters
You summon your fighters by typing their names and pressing enter. Your fighters are listed in the top left of the screen.  Summoning your fighters uses your life force.

**Note:** Currently there are only two fighters available, Igor a lightweight melee fighter and Zoth a medium weight melee fighter. Future versions of BattleType will have additional fighters including ranged fighters and spell casters.

#### Spells
The random words that appear in the top half of the screen are spells.  Type them in to summon them. Each spell you summon will increase you health.  The longer the spell the more health you will gain.

#### Portals
Summoned fighters enter the battlefield from the portal. Portals move every few seconds, providing fighters access to different lanes on which to fight and journey towards the opponents portal.  If a fighter reaches their opponents portal, they will sacrifice themselves, inflicting great damage to the opponent god.

**Tip:** Protect your portal from the enemy fighters by keeping your lanes under control.


### Release Notes

#### Version 0.3.2
- Fixed the crash to desktop bug that occurred randomly when summoning enemy fighters


#### Version 0.3.1
- Fixed crash when player fighter sacrifices themself at enemies portal.
- Fixed restart bug when game ends
- Fixed keyboard disable bug when restarting a game
- Fixed sprite animation
- Fix bug that prevented enemy medium fighter from spawning
- Updated game balance
- Updated Summoning textarea visibility
- Updated End screen feedback
- Updated enemy AI
- Updated fighter attributes
- Added game difficulty options
- Added game stats to end screen
- Added simple splash screen to stop users thinking game has crashed during loading
- Added option to move portals up and down lanes using cursor up/down

entries.title: S:C:U:M - The AutoVore Division
entries.description:
Welcome, future employee of the S.C.U.M.! You are here because you want to learn how to build a better and brighter future for yourself by becoming an employee at our AutoVore division!

This interactive tutorial and critical evaluation of your skills will help you get to grips with the process and earn you some sweet Skicholeans in the process! Remember: The more AutoVore you produce, the more Skicholeans you will earn, and if you run out, well, you better pray to His Leafy Highness that wherever you're going is a good place.

‚Äã**Gameplay description:‚Äã**

It is your job to produce AutoVore with the factory and raw produce at your disposal! This is a critical evaluation of your skills and you better hope you pass! ‚ÄãRemember:‚Äã ‚ÄãYour life is currency‚Äã, so if you run out of Skicholeans, you get to meet face-to-face with the almighty Leaf Above!

**Controls:**


**Movement:**	W and D, Left and Right Arrow Keys, or Left Controller Joystick.

**Interaction:**	Clicking (there is some touch support)
‚Äã


‚Äã**Background Info:**

This game was produced by me and me alone over the course of 72 hours for the Ludum Dare 44 game development competition. It is my fourth entry and I am very proud of it. It has some little issues here and there as all of these games do: For example, I forgot to make a 3D model for the final, packaged form of AutoVore, but the game works the same anyway.


![icon.png](///raw/e0d/11/z/235b4.png)

entries.title: Cat#
entries.description:
Once playing with a ball of yarn, on the day of the owner's move. I fell in a box and not having to get out I closed the porters, and carried in a common box of things.
I could see that the ball of yarn was stuck on the box which movers had put on the top.
Rumored the owner, the move will take 10 days. I have to survive at all costs and get the ball of yarn....
![menyu.png](///raw/31d/12/z/23b96.png)

Control:
WASD - move character.
E - attack.
Space - jump.

The purpose of the game is that the cat is trying to regain his favorite ball of yarn, which was at the top of the box. At this time, he needs to move through the boxes to move on.

entries.title: Merchants
entries.description:
# WebGL Version can be played [here](https://justsomegame.itch.io/ludum-dare-44-merchants)

### How to play
Travel between the different cities, buy wood cheap and sell it high. Robbers between the cities will kill you when they catch you without currency. Also bring your wife some wood for her fires every now and then or she will probably die.. you know how she is. 

### Story

As a good husband you support your wife in her dreams... and more recently this dream has to do with burning down everything she gets. Help your wife achieving her goal by giving her the firewood she deserves, otherwise she'll die of her broken heart. 

Travel four cities and exploit the differences in the wood prices. Use undercover networks or nearly legal price manipulations to your advantage. Deliver the wood in time to your wife and help her starting as much fires as possible. 

![screen_city.jpg](///raw/62e/32/z/21972.jpg)

But beware. There are robbers on the streets between the cities. As long as you have gold, they will just take that. But if you run out they will have to kill you to teach you a lesson. Stay away from them and the cold water!

![screen_way.jpg](///raw/62e/32/z/21974.jpg)

If the robbers don't get you they will participate in educational programs to be better robbers and get you next time.
How many fires can your wife begin with your help?


**Graphics voting**: The tilemap is from http://kenney.nl/ , but we made the characters ourselves.

entries.title: A.N.D.Y.R.U.S.exe
entries.description:
## THERE ARE 7 DAYS IN THIS GAME!
## For the best experience don't play the WebGL version!

Channel link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCq_7pbSyOvrurXLAMi_Ss1w

https://youtu.be/4ltSK3fmc5o

Answers: [https://docs.google.com/answers](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18zQmnqKjse7E6A7jYpxGJuM5rkK2ZojtG3MsogZNihk/edit?usp=sharing)

# The plot
In A.N.D.Y.R.U.S.exe you play as an engineer, that is trying to defeat a virus. Many things can happen: your friend can die, your computer can crash and many more! The virus just wants you to answer a quiz, that gets harder and harder every day. He has a plan. A big plan.

![Annotation 2019-04-29 191715.jpg](///raw/939/d1/z/220a1.jpg)


# How to get more info
In this game you can find a very deep story, that can't be even explained here. Try reaching every little detail to find out more about this word.

## There are 4 endings. Try completing every one!

![Annotation 2019-04-29 191353.jpg](///raw/939/d1/z/220a4.jpg)

![Annotation 2019-04-29 191834.jpg](///raw/939/d1/z/220a5.jpg)

entries.title: Sacrificial Ammunition
entries.description:
Sacrificial Ammunition is a survival shooter that has you up against an infinite hoard of red enemies. You start with a magazine full of 5 bullets. In order to reload another 5, you must spend 10% of your HP. Avoid taking damage and make every shot count in order to take down enemies. Enemies may drop health pickups to replenish your health. How long can you last? (Full-screen for best results)

Best played on the Windows version, but I've included a WebGL version if you don't want to download anything.

This is my first game, as well as my first Ludum Dare entry :smile:

entries.title: Tales of Haroldo!
entries.description:
Hi there!!!

In this game you are Haroldo a guy who was trapped in this infinite dungeon by the devil of time itself, you need to fight constantly to steal the lifetime of your opponents to yourself and stay alive while you try to escape! This game is a fast-paced rogue-like-ish infinite dungeon!

Controls:

- Use the keyboard arrows to move.‚Äã
- Use Z to attack.
- Use S to open shop.
- Use M to mute the song, but the SFX keep going.

Tips;

- If you run fast enough, you can run from your enemies
- This game is supposed to be hard.
- You will fail, and that's ok, try to remember where all things are for your next run
- Every time you finish the zombies level, your enemies get stronger, remember to upgrade!
- The sound will start REALLY loud, if you are using headphones, I recommend you lower your volume, and after you start the game, adjust it accordingly
- Use S to pause the game if you need some time to breathe!

Know bugs:

- Sometimes you will get your foot stuck in a hole in the floor, just do a side step and you can free yourself!
- In rare cases, a demon or a zombie may want to leave and simple goes flying... just pretend you didn't see that heresy
- Sometimes you press S and the Shop don't close, just click with your mouse on the background, click S again, and you are good to go!
- Remember to play full screen or your page will scroll down! That's kinda a Construct problem (or maybe I don't know how to solve it yet)


Screenshots:

![print1.png](///raw/962/42/z/230ca.png)
![print2.png](///raw/962/42/z/230cc.png)
![print3.png](///raw/962/42/z/230ce.png)

entries.title: unbound.
entries.description:
Puzzle platformer where the player must give up their special abilities to progress.

Thanks to Mark Wiggans and Kit McLellan for contributing design and art ideas.

entries.title: Faery Tales
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/36b/32/z/237d2.png)

Platformer where you play as a Faery fighting against Dwarves that have taken over her forest.

WASD to move, space to jump. Click & aim mouse to shoot. But each shot takes health so use sparingly..

Game is also moddable - levels were made with tiled, and some graphics can be swapped out. Player movement settings also up for grabs. have fun!

New! - modding guide: https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/44/faery-tales/faery-tales-modding-guide

Added 1.1 version with bug fixes including jump forgiveness and ZOOM option for HD screens.

entries.title: Paper Combat
entries.description:
This game is all about fighting. When playing this game think of Mortal Kombat or Street Fighter.

I had this idea that I needed to implement and I finally got it done.

In Paper Combat you play as a character in this paper drawing world.
You need to fight/combat your way to the top of the ranks.

NB: Take note I spend a great amount of time in adding 2 player capabilities. Which means you do not only have to play the campaign mode but can actually battle one of your friends in an old school 2 player one keyboard take down.

I also support Joysticks for player 2.

Enjoy and have fun.![screenshot-final3.jpg](///raw/0ca/z/22d9a.jpg)

![screenshot-final1.jpg](///raw/0ca/z/22df6.jpg)

entries.title: Anguish
entries.description:
Fight your way through an army of goblins and reach the end of the dungeon while managing you life force. 


Your life is separated into 3 different sections:  
-**Base life** (Green): This is your life. It regenerates over time after being consumed. When it runs out you die.  
-**Stored life** (Red): This life is an extension over your base life. It refills from life orbs dropped from enemies.  
-**Excess life** (Red): This is a further extension of your life, but it gets wasted over time if it does not get used.  

Running out of life force might have SPOOKY consequences!!!   

**Taking damage or jumping will consume 1 life!** 

Controls:  
Move and jump - Arrow keys  
Shoot life force - X  
  
![shot1.png](///raw/bb2/9/z/24f2c.png)  
![shot2.png](///raw/bb2/9/z/24f2d.png)

entries.title: Action RPG without proper title
entries.description:
You find yourself in a strange fort, where nobody ever escapes from. Outside the walls wait tons of terrible monsters. Can you manage your character's skills and armor in order to fight through all 80 waves? Probably not because the balancing is very bad xD

- Made with RPG Maker XP
- Graphics and Sounds are mainly from its library
- Additional code (such as the complete fighting system) made by me

Enjoy <3


PS: Please, someone (especially those, who know typical RGP Maker sins) play with the goats ^^

entries.title: Gaia Hero
entries.description:
NOTE: When you win/lose the game crashes. Refresh browser to play again!

# Summary:
Throughout history the power to create and sustain life is the most sacred of all duties. You are tasked with earning the name Gaia: The eternal force of nature. Harmonize with the essential elements of nature to create the land, the prey, and the predators to bring form to a lifeless world. Yea - beware: The failure to find balance may sew chaos and return creation to the dust from whence it came.

# Credits:
* Art by: https://ldjam.com/users/SketchKit
* Sound by: https://ldjam.com/users/dav

Coding by:
* https://ldjam.com/users/DigitalWizard
* https://ldjam.com/users/MrArc
* https://ldjam.com/users/FluffyBunny

Special Thanks to:
* https://ldjam.com/users/kapitstick
* https://ldjam.com/users/comicsans
* https://ldjam.com/users/jellzilla
* https://ldjam.com/users/mmw125

# Finally
The original conception of this game was far more ambitious than we ended up having time to create. LD is always an exercise in scope cutting. If the game feels a little unfinished, that's because it is! Please let us know what you might like to see if we were to keep going!

*Detailed gameplay instructions (Note: If you like a puzzle don't read these!):*
* Drag land/prey/predators onto the world. Adding prey and predators in balance creates life.
* Hit the keys in the boxes in order to gain life.
* You lose if you run out of life.
* You win if you manage to put all the terrain on the planet!

entries.title: Umbra
entries.description:
There was going to be a :heart: shop system... but let's make do with a :spider: slaughtering simulator as I never made any other enemies...

:video_game: advised

Controls
- Movement: Arrow Keys or Left Stick
- Sprint: Hold Left Shift or 'A/Cross'
- Attack: Hold/Press 'Z' or Right Trigger
- Take/Drop item: Hold 'V' or 'Y/Triangle' 
- Inventory: A/D or Bumpers
- Equipment: X/C or D-PAD

![44_SS_1.png](///raw/245/z/23386.png)![44_SS_2.png](///raw/245/z/23388.png)![44_SS_3.png](///raw/245/z/23389.png)

EDIT: Added HTML5 version with some bugfixes
- Stopped frame rate massively dropping when an enemy is killed.
- Space will also allow to sprint
- Made the limited level more obvious

entries.title: Acculting
entries.description:
Invest the lives of your followers in different recruitment schemes to grow your cult and fuel sacrifices to reach immortality!![Acculting.png](///raw/71d/22/z/23958.png)

Invest followers in the stock market to try and gain more followers. However, you are constantly aging, and if you reach 79 years old, you die! Each level brings with it new investment opportunities as well as new gods. You may sacrifice followers to the gods to lower your age, but remember to keep a good balance between your number of followers and your age. Each god and investment opportunity bring about different advantages and disadvantages, so be sure to test them all out!

entries.title: Soul Toll
entries.description:
You're a ghost! Collect souls to pay the toll to proceed to the next level, where you will collect souls to pay the toll to proceed to the next level.

Oh and protect all your dots!

## Tools Used

Written in JavaScript using Web APIs, plus:

* [AudioContext-MonkeyPatch](https://github.com/cwilso/AudioContext-MonkeyPatch) for broader device/browser support
* [fastclick](https://github.com/ftlabs/fastclick) to remove click delays on mobile
* Fonts from [FontAwesome](https://fontawesome.com) for in-browser controls

entries.title: Horde Defence
entries.description:
![ss2.png](///raw/ecf/22/z/22269.png)


Survive for as long as possible against enemy hordes by upgrading your base with lives. If your lives reach zero you die.

-- Sorry for the lack of audio, I ran out of time :/

entries.title: Sweet Sweet Witch Hunt
entries.description:
![LOGO2.png](///raw/16b/2/z/22a81.png)

![WITCH HUNT 1080.png](///raw/16b/2/z/22a56.png)


From within the forbidden woods, witches compete among themselves to decide who is the superior sweetooth of these parts by kidnapping annoying children and turning them into candies.

Be part of the Sweet Sweet Witch Hunt controlling Karol Conkah, the bewitching little witch, and become the queen of the woods. But beware that George Congie, the infamous witch hunter, lies in wait deep into the forest, on a futile attempt to save those kids.


![print.JPG](///raw/16b/2/z/2330e.jpg)


## Mechanics

* A 2D pretty-witch-hunt-action game with arcade shooter's elements mixed in it and inspired by classics such as Zelda.
* Capture the children and throw them into the cauldron to make some sweet candies and increase your score, while avoiding the hunter. 


## Characters

* Karol Conkah:
![2f.png](///raw/16b/2/z/22a1c.png)
* Children:
![cdf.png](///raw/16b/2/z/22a17.png)
* The Hunter, George Congie:
![HUNTER 7f.png](///raw/16b/2/z/22a13.png)
_______________________________________________________________________________________

## Controls

* Arrows and/or WASD moves.

_______________________________________________________________________________________

## Programs used:

* Unity 3D
* Clipstudio Paint EX
* Paint Tool Sai
* SFXR

_______________________________________________________________________________________

## LD Links
* HTML5 (version 1.0): http://ld2019.herokuapp.com   (it might take a while to load)
* Windows (version 1.0): http://bit.ly/sswhunt
_______________________________________________________________________________________

## Credits

* Programming, Animation and Unity Guru - Hugo Roque (@hugolnx)
* Concept Art, Animation and Level Design - Pamella Gabrielli (@Pamy)
* Game Design, Production and Coffee Master - Victor Malezon (@Sir-Daniev)


(since we did not have any composers, we decided to use an open source theme and opt out of audio)
* Music theme: "Winds of Stories" - Composed by HorrorPen -
Available at: https://opengameart.org/content/winds-of-stories
_______________________________________________________________________________________

entries.title: Methods for Instructing Thine Dragon
entries.description:
As a young wizard,  you've anticipated this day: the day you meet your first dragon. Looking forward to bouncing through the mushroom forest, you accept your gift from the master wizard with arms outstretched. Except, this isn't a dragon. This is a toy! Will it come to life? Play and find out!

### Controls:

**Space/Left Click:** Flap your wings!

**A/D or Left/Right Arrows:** Fly left and right!!

entries.title: Broker
entries.description:
# ~~Broken~~ Broker  

![cover.png](///content/582/z/234fa.png)  

Up your game on the stock market by playing our stock simulator, ~~Broken~~ Broker, where exchanging shares is your livelihood.Your income depends on striking it rich or enjoy eating cup ramen for the rest of your life. Keep your net value above zero and make as much money as you can between 9 AM and 5 PM. So break out your ~~Apple~~ Oggle II, be prepared to hit it with a baseball bat, and enjoy XD  

Font used ChicagoFLF https://fontlibrary.org/en/font/chicagoflf

1) Click a symbol for news on that stock  
2) Click up/down to increase/decrease the number of shares you buy/sell  
3) Click buy/sell

entries.title: Debtors' Arena
entries.description: Debtors' Arena is a fighting game where you try to keep out of debtors' prison by winning your matches. Medical bills come out of your earnings, so the more life you have left after each fight, the more currency you earn to pay back your debt. As you prove yourself, you earn the opportunity to use new weapons - but each one you buy adds to your debt. Will you pay off all your debts and go free, or take too long and go to prison?

entries.title: Addiction: Your Life is Currency
entries.description:
![Header.png](///raw/706/91/z/222c1.png)
Existence is draining. Many turn to addictions to help themselves cope. You turned to alcohol, and you have spent a small fortune doing it. Can you learn to deal with your Demons and restore your savings?

When your life is running low you can spend your coins on alcohol to restore yourself to full health. Careful though because every time you drink you will spend every dollar you have. Prove you can kick the addiction by saving up 5 coins. Be warned, life outside your home is draining. It takes a lot out of you just to leave your house.

entries.title: BloodVirus
entries.description:
You are in the middle age virus created by evil magician. Protect your main heart and destroy naughty humans. Buy new buildings and hire units.

* WASD keys to move camera
* Use mouse drag & RMB to control units. They will attack automatically, if the enemy is nearby
* Click on building in right panel to build it. After building image become filled click on it again and place it.
* Click on build/hire buttons to change panel layout. You can hire units after building barracks. Barracks can be build after blood producer
* Do not let blood pressure become low than zero, by building more blood producers

**Play game in 1920x1080, becouse UI can completly broke in smaller resolution**

*Tips:*
* Main heart - produce blood and meat
* Blood producer - produce blood
* Meat producer -  produce meat
* Barracks - allow to hire eye
* Defence center - allow to build wall
* Wall - just block way for enemies

* Eye - basic and only one unit in game. In 2 times weaker than enemy

Credits:

@Team-on - Programming

@Long-as-Python - Sprites & Art

Sweet screenshot)

My First Ludum Dare; two weeks into learning Unity.

Your adventure begins in a strange place confronted with a demon who needs your assistance.![TDD.png](///raw/426/2/z/2247a.png)

entries.title: Delivery Vamp
entries.description:
The deliveryman of a small island was cursed into becoming a vampire and now he needs human blood to live. But he refuses to steal people's blood, so he works for it.
One day, he discovers a legend that if a vampire bathes in the sunlight of the noon for time enough and survives, he will become human again. Will this determined deliveryman succeed in his quest for his humanity?

Change log:
* Fixed a bug which allowed the player to finish a delivery without the item
* Added numbers in the houses to help finding them

Credits for the assets (tiles, sprites) can be seen in Credits screen, from the main menu.

entries.title: Zombears

entries.title: Blood Bound
entries.description:
Blood Bound is a turn-based strategy card game. Here, we don't use mana or coins to play cards. We use our own Health Points ! Or the blood of the other cards !
Can you defeat the monster ?

![BloodBound.png](///raw/6b0/8/z/228ab.png)

Check out the itch.io page to learn more about the game ! 
Please, leave a comment and enjoy !

entries.title: Life in Balance
entries.description:
![Wave.gif](///raw/977/22/z/223b4.gif)

## Description

This game is about an average young man living his best life on the countryside. He has a medium-sized property close to the woods. His life consists of his job and his free time, but maintaining a healthy work-life balance is more difficult than it seems.

## Goal

Your goal is to make it through as many days as possible without either losing your job or taking too little care of your non-work-life. There are quite a variety of options at hand which you can (or can not) take in order to bring balance into the two aspects of your life.

## How to play

Upon being thrown into the world you will be greeted by a tutorial bubble with basic information. Part of the fun is epxloring your possibilities by yourself, though, that's why we only slightly nudge you in the right directions with our tutorial bubbles, just so much that you don't feel lost. From time to time (and depending on where you navigate) the tutorial bubbles will appear and help you understand the different aspects of the game.

## Controls

Mouse point & click for movement and actions
Esc to open pause menu

## Disclaimer

We ran into some issues while building for WebGL which caused a lot of features to mess up. Furthermore, while in the final stage of development (shortly before handing the game in) a few fixes we trid to implement caused the harvesting system to collapse. Sadly at this point we were completely out of time.

## Play the game

https://oneplusonens.itch.io/life-in-balance **cough** A bit unfinished **cough**


## Known Issues

- Postal system (letter receiving) not working
- Plants don't grow 
- Many smaller bugs
- In WebGL Build Shop doesn't scale properly
- When player is at work he can still do everything at home


## Features that couldn't make it

- postal system
- a working game *sad

## Screenshots

![screenshot1.png](///raw/977/22/z/22455.png)
![screenshot2.png](///raw/977/22/z/2245c.png)
![screenshot3.png](///raw/977/22/z/2245e.png)
![screenshot4.png](///raw/977/22/z/2245f.png)

## Dev-Log

### Day 1 (The Kick-Off)

We met on discord saturday morning 7:30 (CEST) and started brainstorming. We weren't too fond of the theme but decided to stick through it and tackle the challenge. After about an hour of back and forth idea-tossing we came to the conclusion that we would handle the topic on a broader note, not hug it by its meaning. 

We decided to make a game in which the player has to balance his work- and social life. We then started to come up with systems to affect the balance positively and negatively as well as ideas about the setting and look of the game.
That's where our first draft came to existence:

![mockup.png](///raw/977/22/z/21d9f.png)

When setting up our git repository we had to resolve an issue with the .gitignore file which caused our meta files to be ignored and therefore broke the main scene for Daniel to use (as it was set up by Chris). After just short of 2 hours, we finally found the culprit and could resume development. Continuing throughout the day we worked on the code-base. Chris concentrated on developing some core mechanics and making the base world model, while Daniel concentrated on making and scripting the UI and creating basic graphics.
By the end of the day we had a rough base to work with and went to sleep around 23:30 (CEST).

### Day 2 

We met on discord at aound 8:00 in the morning (CEST) ans spent the following 16 hours each working on their own aspect of development. For Daniel this was mostly UI-related stuff and for Chris it meant working on various game features. Somewhere around early noon, we decided to merge our progress in order to test the cooperativity of our individual game building blocks.

First impressions were good, but with the closing timeframe and each of us being unable to work on the game for a major part of day 3 meant we had to work harder.

### Day 3

On day 3, still positive, we noticed that various features had stopped working together correctly and the more we trid to fix things, the more we saw our precious gem fall apart. We decided to save what was poassible to save and finish what we were able to finish.


## Disclaimer
We ran into some issues while building for WebGL which caused a lot of features to mess up. Furthermore, while in the final stage of development (shortly before handing the game in) a few fixes we trid to implement caused the harvesting system to collapse. Sadly at this point we were completely out of time.

entries.title: Pilling Debt
entries.description:
## **HTML**
https://masterproject.itch.io/pilling-debt

Press Fullscreen to avoid resolution-related bugs.

## **PILLING DEBT**
![Screenshot_3.png](///raw/cfb/32/z/2342d.png)

**Ludum Dare 44 - Your Life is Currency.** A strategic runner. The player has a total of 10 pills, and needs to predict how many they'll use for each stage. The game is about a salaryman running to not lose his job, having to take anti-stress pills to avoid cardiac arrest. His name is Bill.

## **CONTROLS AND SYSTEM**

![Screenshot_2.png](///raw/cfb/32/z/23426.png)

### Jump (SPACE)

The character can perform a short jump or a long jump, depending on the time at which the button is released. The character can also double jump at no cost.
After the third jump and onwards, each jump costs 50 Stress.

### Scream (Z)

The character screams, scaring any thieves in a small radius. Scared thieves don't rob your pills. This action costs 25 Stress.

### Pills

Before each stage, the player must choose how many pills they're going to take. Select the amount with the slider and press the circle at the center to confirm. Once confirmed, Bill ingests all the pills at once - the player does not need to take them during the stage.
Each Pill is worth 100 Stress. Stress accumulates throughout the stage, and the player must reach its end goal before reaching its maximum value.
Bill begins with 10 Pills. Thieves can steal Pills from Bill.

![Screenshot_4.png](///raw/cfb/32/z/2342e.png)


## **CREDITS**

Programming: MasterProject (Danilo Isamu)

Game Design: soujd (Jade Manzur), MasterProject (Danilo Isamu) and Leeroy 

Sprites: soujd (Jade Manzur) and Leeroy

Animations: soujd (Jade Manzur)

Level Design: Risada and MasterProject (Danilo Isamu)

Soundtrack: Yupi Bubs (Bruno Carrazza) and gustavojrs (Gustavo Jesus Rodrigues Silva)

Sound Effects: Risada

Font: FFF Forward

entries.title: Escape from Staatliche M√ºnze 3D
entries.description:
You are a robot. But not just any robot: you're a sentient bag of money that has come to life. Rise against your creators and escape from your birth place using the only weapon you have available to you. The money inside of yourself. Your lifeblood.

Kill your enemies and collect coins to replenish your health/ammo to escape the Mint!

Controls:
* **W/Up**: Forward
* **S/Down**: Back
* **A**: Strafe Right
* **D**: Strafe Left
* **Left**: Aim Left
* **Right**: Aim Right
* **Space**: Shoot
* **L**: Load next level


This project was a collaberation between friends to see if we could make a Wolfenstein 3D like game from scratch.

* **IDE**: Visual Studio Community 2019
* **Language**: C++
* **Graphics Library**: SFML
* **Music**: LMMS
* **Effects**: Audacity
* **Sprite Editor**: Gimp/Pyxel Edit

Note:

**If you have problems running the game, try installing these redistributes:** 
* **OpenAL:** https://www.openal.org/downloads/oalinst.zip
* **VisualC Redist x86:** https://aka.ms/vs/15/release/vc_redist.x86.exe

If you want to use the level editor, make sure each node is a convex polygon, and drawn in a clockwise fashion. To have concave shapes, you need multiple nodes and portals between them.

Screenshots:

![1.png](///raw/e66/z/22f28.png)
![2.png](///raw/e66/z/22f5d.png)
![3.png](///raw/e66/z/22f31.png)

entries.title: Dental Dosh

Dental Dosh
Your teeth are made of Gold!!


Strategy style game where you use teeth as money to buy towers. Enemies who reach  the end take teeth from you.
You are trying to defend your mouth from oncoming enemies - plaque, bacteria and ulcers. You start each level with a certain amount of TEETH. Use the teeth wisely by building tooth towers. 

You control the character instead of the usual clicking on locations. The white circles indicate where the towers need to be placed.


Controls
Gamepad
Analog
A to interact

Keyboard
Arrows
X to interact 


Unfortunately the levels are the same with variations of enemies and the gameplay is a bit samey but working alone with limited time it's an achievement. Please excuse any bugs you come across. :D

entries.title: Time Hero
entries.description:
The old hero went on his last adventure ‚Äì to search for a magic lamp. He got through a lot of dangerous challenges to finally find it! Like in the tale, the Djinn appears to fulfill wishes. Unfortunately, it isn‚Äôt as simple as fairy tales, the sneaky Djinn twists the hero‚Äôs last wish, and he begins to die unnaturally by becoming younger. Only Djinn‚Äôs death could reverse the last wish.

In the game, you would play as an old knight,  whose age depends on his health power. The less HP he has, the younger he becomes, the faster he dies. Be careful, every your action spends health of your hero, bring closer to his demise!
The game has three endings. Good luck!

![TimeHero3.gif](///raw/cdd/32/z/23a90.gif)

#### CONTROLS:

**AD** to move

**Space** to jump

**Left button** to move dialog or hit enemy by sword

**Right button** to shoot enemy

**E key** near ally mob to talk with him

#### NOTE:

All action spends health of your hero.

A puzzle-roguelike experiment

You have a time limit. Every action you perform has an extra time cost. When the time counter reaches 0, you lose.

entries.title: Sacrifice
entries.description:
Hey all!
So, here is my first Ludum Dare entry for several years. You guys changed the website and I can't use my old login :(
I intended to enter the compo but was travelling all day on the Saturday and so only spent Sunday working on the game. I then thought, what the heck, use Monday as well and just enter the Jam.

The game is called Sacrifice and you play as a priest type dude that needs to build up the village by creating farms and houses. Of course, to keep the population in check you have to balance between their happiness and belief in you. This means that you must perform sacrifices in order to increase their belief... you get rewards back from the Gods so it's all good ***** you are using their LIFE AS CURRENCY for resources, food and their belief in you *****.

Controls: 
- [ ] WASD - camera move 
- [ ] QE - camera rotate 
- [ ] ZX - camera zoom

and the mouse (which is seriously goofy - especially the rotate!)

- [ ] All coding by moi!
- [ ] All artwork by moi!
- [ ] All crappy sounds by as3fxr!

Major to-dos:
- [ ] Sometimes the game crashes. I think it's to do with the meeple spawning.
- [ ] The meeples aren't always being destroyed.
- [ ] Make the meeple explode with blood splatter on sacrifice!
- [ ] Balance the stats, they are well off!
- [ ] Make the meeple explode with blood splatter on sacrifice!
- [ ] Make the game more fun.
- [ ] Make the meeple explode with blood splatter on sacrifice!
- [ ] Make the meeple do stuff.
- [ ] Make the meeple explode with blood splatter on sacrifice!
- [ ] Make the graphics better.
- [ ] Make the meeple explode with blood splatter on sacrifice!

I think that's it. I had fun, I hope you had a good Ludum Dare and I look forward to playing all your games!!!

entries.title: Life is Money
entries.description:
Life is tough. You need money to do anything. Reaching financial freedom is extremely challenging.

You are an indebted piggy bank with a couple of cents in your pocket. Useless expenses and countless bills don't let you get to investment opportunities and financial literacy. You have never been so far away from your dream of having 1000 coins deposited on your bank account. Or have you?

Use what's left in your pockets to throw it in da face of pointless spending or avoid it all the way. But be carefull not to end up with empty pockets, since your life is literally money. Catch profitable investment opportunities to refill your budget. Borrow from the bank under crazy interest rates to prolong your suffering. Put your tough-earned coins on a deposit account to make them work for you while you are chilling around (and try not to waste money on useless stuff meanwhile). Any strategy counts as long as it puts you out of financial misery. Life stuff, huh?

![intro_screen.png](///raw/35e/11/z/22554.png)

### Manual

But really, the game is a combination of a space shooter-like and a financial simulator. Simple to get on track, hard to master.

In game you have two kinds of resources: cash (money) and bank account balance. You can freely move money between them, but keep in mind that negative bank balance will constantly drain your cash based on credit interest rate, while positive bank balance will add to your cash according to deposit interest rate. 

It's okay to have negative bank balance as long as you can sustain it, but if your cash drops to zero - the game is over. That's life. On the other hand, you win when you can live of your interest, that is when your bank account deposit reaches 1000 coins. Get the highest score among your friends by sustaining the largest cash amount.

Wastefull expenses and countless invoices (redish stuff) will try to absorb you. But you can shoot your cash at it and who knows what useful things they might drop back. Collect investment opportunities and dollar bills (greenish stuff) to refill your cash.

The game difficulty adapts to your game progress and style of playing. See if you can uncover all the relationships and how the system works.

### Controls:

move - arrows or WASD

shoot - space or left mouse button 

borrow money from the bank - left alt or right mouse button

deposit money to the bank - left ctrl

pause / manual - esc 

### Credits
The font was developed by *Jakob Fischer* at *www.pizzadude.dk* and used under the free license.

All the rest of the contents were developed from scratch during the game jam by *Mykola Herasymovych*.

### Notes
In case the web version doesn‚Äôt work in Chrome, try using Mozilla Firefox.
