entries.title: Earn Your Life
entries.description:
This is a short text game about living your life. 
![Screenshot (842).png](///raw/668/22/z/225fa.png)

You can take opportunities as they appear, or you can choose to do nothing. That is okay.

Your choices may affect the paths available to you in the future.

You are mortal, and cannot keep living forever. You are 18 right now, and you likely wont live much past 80. (It's a good thing untimely death is not a possibility).

The game is as short or as long as you want it to be. Trying to breeze through life is an understandable temptation.![Screenshot (839).png](///raw/668/22/z/225ed.png)![Screenshot (841).png](///raw/668/22/z/225ee.png)

(The music was written by the lovely @manicInsomniac, who was a part of the team behind https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/44/mahou-shoujo-monster-promised-fate . I am opted out of the music category at her request- if you want to support her, please check out that game as well c: )

entries.title: Bloody Accord
entries.description:
‚ÄãBloody Accord allows you to fight in an epic battle, and see how long you last. There are several enemies, and even more attacks. The big twist? Everything costs some blood.

Play Medium settings or above.

**Made by Coast To Coast**

Programming - Ryfi

Graphics - Cincerteri (Blunderguy)

Sound - Twenty5Clocks

![unknown-7.png](///raw/b82/d/z/231cc.png)

![unknown-8.png](///raw/b82/d/z/23560.png)

![unknown-9.png](///raw/b82/d/z/23564.png)

**Game Dialogue:**

Welcome gladiator. You have been chosen to demonstrate your skills of battle in the arena. In there you will find several enemies: spiders, bats, drones, sorcerers, and the doomba. All of them are attempting to kill you and they get stronger over time, you must dodge their attacks. You also fight back. Look out for heart crystals to replenish health. The first slot is your sword, it deals damage and knock back. The second weapon is a bow. Hold to wind up, then release. Your arrows are limited. Next is your handgun. It is instant fire and deals more damage. Next is the spell book. You have several spells each with its own code. Learn the codes to perform the spell, but at a cost! Finally, you have a tele-porter that will bring you back and fourth from the shop. At the shop, and you can buy swords, armor, arrows, and bullets. In the shop, you don‚Äôt spend money - you spend blood. So keep your health up in there! Good luck gladiator!

entries.title: Money Bag Kidnapper
entries.description:
Avoid enemies and kidnap the kid, then bring him to the starting mat, then negotiate with his father to get the ransom using various mini games. Press x to advance dialog and only try to press f when the police man reaches the end, keep playing the mini games until then.

Press F...

entries.title: Soul Searching
entries.description:
**It takes decorum to deal in lives.** 

![screenshot 1.png](///raw/3f1/52/z/223b2.png)

In Soul Searching you play as Grim, who has taken on the role of Grim Reaper from his father. In order to survive as the reaper, you need to harvest lives from the village above. But how do you decide on who is ready to die? Soul searching asks you to converse with the village folk and ask yourself that question. You may even feel those who are ill deserve a second chance. You have the power to give that to them. 

![screenshot.png](///raw/3f1/52/z/223b7.png)

![screenshot3.png](///raw/3f1/52/z/223b8.png)

**Controls:**

LEFT ARROW = MOVE LEFT
RIGHT ARROW = MOVE RIGHT
UP ARROW = JUMP
X = USE SCYTHE
C = TOGGLE TAKE LIFE/GIVE LIFE
T = START DIALOGUE

**Instructions:**
Once the purple timer empties, you will lose one of your own lives. 

You are encouraged to talk to the villagers as much as you can to determine who is ready to die. 

By pressing X over a villager when you are in "black heart mode" you gain their life. 

If you want to give lives to villagers who are dieing then toggle "C" to "red heart mode" and then press X over them. 

Oh, and don't fall. 

**MUSIC AND SOUND CREDITS**

Music from https://filmmusic.io:
"Come Play with Me" by Kevin MacLeod (https://incompetech.com)
Licence: CC BY (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/)

‚ÄúSound effects obtained from https://www.zapsplat.com‚Äú

entries.title: Doc. BLOODAWAY
entries.description:
Welcome new subject on this test directed by the famous Doc. BLOODAWAY. 
Everyone in the country know the legend, but no one survive his test. 
Perhaps it's not that simple. You actually have to choose between 3 type of moods. 

Persuade: convince him not to take your blood.

Stay passive: say nothing and hope for the best.

Be agressive: try everything to stay alive. 


Like a rock paper cisor game each mood can beat an 
other one: Persuade > Stay passive > Be agressive > Persuade. 


Each time you select a mood, it 'll be compare to an other patient. 
If you loose, some of your blood 'll be taken and that 'll increase each turn until 
some one hasn't enough to survive. So try to survive for the next test.


This game has been made in 48h it's my 2nd LD. Hope everyone that gonna like to defeate
the doctor will enjoy this compo. By the way it's made in l√∂ve 2D for windows.

Thanks in advance for feedback. Enjoy and have fun.

entries.title: Mr. Bees Wild Adventure: Buzz Off
entries.description:
**Story**

In a world where bees are used as currency, bees have to hide in order to avoid capture. Mr. Bees was created when a bunch of bees stuck in a mansion decided to work together and escape. Now it's your turn to help navigate Mr. Bees out of the abandoned mansion and escape the evil wasps.

**Controls**

Use W or up arrow to jump, holding it allows you to glide.
Use A or left arrow to move left
Use D or right arrow to move right
Spacebar to shoot bees
Click screen to respawn if dead

![beeScreen1.PNG](///raw/8d4/42/z/2335c.png)
![bee2.PNG](///raw/8d4/42/z/23395.png)

**How To Play**

Don't get hit by incoming wasps. The objective is to escape the abandoned mansion and the only exit is all the way to the right at the end of the hallway. Use your abilities to fight your way through, but be careful not to shoot out too much of Mr. Bee. If you die, you will find a queen bee at your last known position, collect these to replenish bees in order to escape.

entries.title: Dissuasion
entries.description:
Lol, Every Ludum Dare I tell myself that this time, I won't dream too big.
Aaaannnd every Ludum Dare, I dream too big again.

This time was no different, though I did get my father, brother, and sister to help me.
Still, the game is not half what we wanted to make, but at least the code was pretty clean. I can't write spaghetti code unfortunately for me, so it always takes forever to write anything..

Now, on to Dissuasion.

Humanity has discovered the technology to manipulate the lifetimes of people and creatures, and it is in years, days, hours, and minutes that goods and services are traded.
However, all is not well. A monolithic world government called the Order tightly controls this currency, and the world is not well.

As an operative for the resistance, you infiltrate businesses and organizations, and spread propaganda from posts on the hypernet, the only safe haven for resistance communications.
Can you get in and get out, making an impact and avoiding the Order police force?

..I wish... we only ended up getting the bare minimum done, but it was a really interesting jam anyway!
Leave a comment, and I'll definitely play and rate your games!

**How To Play**

So.. after watching some of my siblings play-test this, I realized that I really need to put a quick overview of how NetCrawler works. NetCrawler is the app that you, as an operative, use to propagandize the organization you have infiltrated. Using a company connection to the hypernet, it pulls in posts and articles that its AI thinks might be relevant. Then, it's up to you to read them and decide whether or not they would serve as good propaganda tools. If so, press the Send button, and if not, the Reject button. It takes a bit of time to make its way around the company, and longer posts will take longer. However, the shorter posts potentially have less convincing power, so choose wisely. You can send several posts at a time, but they will build up in the queue, and only send one at a time. The personel markers at the lower right hand side of the NetCrawler app will turn green when you have influenced them. How many can you influence before you run out of time?

Oh, and if you get stuck trying to find the password, it is sometimes written backwards; the whole string, the individual letters, or both. It is never shuffled though, so just try it forwards and backwards.

See: https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/44/dissuasion/oh-the-madness for my post on the making of this game.

entries.title: obsessed
entries.description:
obsessed is a fun game where you - the player - are so obsessed with money that your life depends on it! Can you manage to reach the end of the hard parkour level whilst collecting as many coins as possible? Well, you better...!
The game includes some fun features such as background and floor color-change over time as well as a rewind time function that will help you get back up when you stumble upon one of the deadly spikes!

I'm a high school student from France. This is my first game jam and my first full game! I've really enjoyed the process of making it, it was great fun! It allowed me to practice what I had learned and experiment with new features.

![Screenshot_2.png](///raw/dbe/22/z/2252c.png)

entries.title: Panic Percussion
entries.description:
tap Z on beat! a kind of rhythm-puzzle game.

**the big number:**  
your life is time! the fraction part marks the current beat. on every 8th beat, your life goes down by -1, so work fast!
 
**control:**  
tap "Z" with the rhythm. you will bounce to the opposite side of the circle, triggering an event on your sector.
 
**events:**  
**green zone**: hit the enemy. it will drop something. most of them have 3 hit points.. the level changes once you've beaten the enemy.  
**hourglass**: +2 life. remember that you have to be on beat to get this, otherwise it counts as a miss! (-1 life)  
**red zone / dynamite**: don't step here! it will cost you 3 life! once the dynamite goes off, it's safe.  
**two arrows**: auto-bounces you. hmm, what is the effect if you "GET!" this on time..?  
**lock**: it blocks your movement. you have to bounce -into- this sector to break the lock! (respawns in 6 beats.)

![gif-show.gif](///raw/7df/8/z/22194.gif)

entries.title: Birdy Bombardier
entries.description:
Have you ever wanted to poop on a critters head? Maybe save a helpless baby from danger? Well than Birdy bombardier may be the game for you!

Poop on cats and snakes before they reach the chicks and bunnies.
When you defeat many enemies, you will get positive karma (aka a good life). With this life you will continue to a better one! If you fail to do so, you will get a darker life.
Can you get to heaven?

You can play the game here: https://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/730569?updated=1556581118

entries.title: kard
entries.description:
**About**

 _kard_  is a 2D pixel-art platformer placed in the future. It's really glitchy becous we wasted a lot of time on a one bug that could have been solved in 3 minutes. Only 5 levels becouse of this.

A D - move

W/Space - jump

X + A/D - Speed Powerup [if bought]

C + W - Jump Powerup [if bought]

In game you have two stats:

Your Lifecoins [top left] and your Resistance [top left]. When your resistance ends you need to retry the level. When you run out of lifecoins you need to start over the whole game.
![sshot 2.PNG](///raw/87f/e1/z/234b1.png)

**Story** 

Somewhere in Russia, 3019... 

In the Moscow State University something unbelievable has happened. The university's antennas recieved a reply from an other civilization to the Arecibo message sent in 1974.
Aliens sent us a codec to communicate quickly [in just one month]. Unortunally, the codec was recieved uncorrectly and the University's reply instead of saying ,,What planet" said ,,War planet". The next day when people realised their mistake a flood happened. The codec was saved on intelligent robo-cards which aren't water proof. Three copies were made and you are the last robocard left now. When you escaped the university you realised that the air was so wet that it was damaging you.You need to get to the Emergency Facility as quick as you can, so they can send a corrected message.

![sshot2.PNG](///raw/87f/e1/z/234d6.png)
**Authors**


We're two friends working together with @samgus [ @bajtix 's dad ] on a game. 


Credits:

- @bajtix - programming, art, story, idea, levels
- @snajper-1212 - art
- @samgus - level design


**Changelog**

**v1**

- Uploaded!

**v2**

- Added key binds to powerup use. Check controls section
- Made the last level harder
- Updated itch.io page
- Tweaked player movement

entries.title: Curren¬¢
entries.description:
**Instructions**

WASD - Movement

Q/E - Change between you and your changes

F - Interact

Esc/P - Pause

![Capture.PNG](///raw/5c8/81/z/21fb1.png)

![Capture2.PNG](///raw/5c8/81/z/21fce.png)

You are money. You want to be $10 in the end of 5 days.

Special Thanks to @DarrenPang-95 and @Gavin-Chin for helping with the idea.

**Mechanics**

Day/Night cycle - Day lasts 15 seconds. Night lasts 5 seconds. Night triggers money gain from Forex/Bank and Wallet.

Life Changers - Split yourself into smaller pieces or become a greater note again.

Beggar - Donate a piece of yourself. Cannot be used if no other notes/coins.

Economy - Changes every 6 seconds. Next economy state will have 1/5 chance of being the same economy again. Cannot be used if no other notes/coins.

Forex - Invest a piece of yourself to get double, nothing, or no changes depending on economy state at night. Cannot be used if no other notes/coins.

ATM - Invest a piece of yourself to get 1.5x invested. Cannot be used if no other notes/coins.

Wallet - 5% chance to swoop in for every piece of change you have.

Vending Machine - Goal of the game. Must have exactly $10 to use.

**Credits**

Cha Ching Register Sound - Muska666 (www.soundbible.com)

Pterodactyl Screech - Mike Koenig (www.soundbible.com)

Deliberate Thought  - Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)

SyncStelar - Game Programmer

AyuTazYumi - Game Artist

Note: Use the GameJolt link if the Itch.io doesn't work for you or if you 're not using Windows.

entries.title: Pricelist
entries.description:
You're in a middle of a war. No one remembers why it started. No one knows when it will end. Human lives are just another expendable resource here. Your goal is to win by capturing all important points before the enemy no matter what.

All art is done by Esus and all music is done by Cyber Night both of whom agreed to participate with me in Ludum Dare but don't have LD accounts.

Your goal is to capture all 4 points on the map. To capture points end your turn while your soldiers are near the flag. The more soldiers you have on the point the faster it will be captured. Every turn each captured point gives you money. All units also drop money on death. You can spend money to hire new units.

Camera is moved by A/D keys.

Summary of all units in order of their appearence in the shop in the bottom left corner of the screen:
1. Heavy - has most health. Unlike other characters can shoot multiple times on one turn but has to sacrifice his mobility until the end of the turn in order to do so.
2. Good Boy - quickest unit in the game. Can bite enemies causing them to bleed until they are healed by medic or blow up explosives on it's back to destroy everything aroung including covers and walls. Doesn't count when capturing points.
3. Sniper - more accurate on bigger distances. Can deal massive amounts of damage and gains even higher accuracy and damage when passes a turn without moving or shooting.
4. Trooper - cheapest and weakest minion. Beats enemies with quantity, not quality.
5. Engineer - can build extra defences for the point with his mines, covers and walls. His second ability is a hit with a wrench that can stun opponents causing them to skip next turn.
6. Medic - heals units and cures their bleeding. Also has a pistol that can be used on short distances for offence.

# Gem Heart
### A game made for Ludum Dare 44 - "Your life is currency"



This is a platformer somewhat inspired by Shovel Knight and Downwell.

You are a small jelly blob trying to reach the exit door of every level. In your way are different kinds of obstacles and enemies trying to ruin your day.

This is my 2nd ever Ludum Dare game and my first ever platformer so I apologize for all the bugs and jankyness of the game. I ran into a lot of issues while making it. I still hope that you can get some joy out of it!

Feel free to leave any kind of feedback I appreciate every critique you can offer!

entries.title: Brain Jam
entries.description:
![BrainJam.png](///raw/b98/5/z/22c23.png)How much of yourself are you willing to sacrifice for a project?

*Brain jam* is a *simulation* of a *solo Dev life* during a *gamejam*.

In the *beginning* and *end* of each *day* you'll face *random* day to day life *events*.

You'll have to *choose* between *sacrificing* your own *life* or the *game* project during these *events*.

During the day you'll *manage* which aspect of the *game* to work on.

In the *end* you'll be *evaluated* on:

How well the *game* ended

How poorly your *health* was treated

To win you have to:

*Not die* during the *jam*

Make a *game* that's *not horrible*

entries.title: Courtyard Madness
entries.description:
Another game created during a 72 hour GameJam!
This time, it is Ludum Dare 44.

We have worked in a team of three programmers on this little game.

**What's the game about?**

*You are an adventurer with a laser gun, who woke up in a courtyard of a medieval castle.
There are many evil zombies appearing in the area and your only option is to shoot your way through.*

![1.PNG](///raw/773/d/z/22c4c.png)

*You may also come across various items that will make slaying your enemies much easier for you. However, you will eventually find yourself in need of more items, but you can not longer find any more items around the place.*

![2.PNG](///raw/773/d/z/22c87.png)

*That's when you resort into your only hope. Using some of your life power to bring a sacrifice to a fountain in the courtyard. This will grant you another item. It is possible to return to the fountain every once in a while for another item, once the water clears out and the fountain expects another sacrifice.*

![3.PNG](///raw/773/d/z/22c9b.png) 

*Do not let this fool you. The game starts out slow, but the speed and difficulty increases as time goes on!*

![4.PNG](///raw/773/d/z/22f08.png)

**What's the end goal?**

*The goal is to become strong enough to be able to challenge and slay the greatest evil that's hidden in the courtyard. However, once you are done with the challenge, you might find yourself wanting to pursue even further, beat more waves of enemies, collect more items and test the capabilities of the game itself.*

*There are secrets you might come across in the game. However, will you be able to find the right answers?*

### Thank you and we hope you have fun playing our game! :)

entries.title: Life Broker
entries.description:
__Investing in stocks ain't what it used to be.__ Gone are the days of traditional currency stock exchanges, since every broker now directly trades a much riskier asset--Life. 

You can invest your liquid Life into the Life market by approaching one of the trading booths. Keep an eye on the market at all times, try to buy low and sell high. You lose the game if you run out of liquid Life points, so you may want to withdraw some Life from your investments if your liquidity gets too low. It's a dog-eat-dog world out there, other Life brokers are always trying to steal your Life!

Try to profit as many Life points as you can, but know that at any point you can quit your job and walk away with your current earnings. Don't let greed make you a victim of the market!

![ld44.PNG](///raw/56d/71/z/21fa8.png)

## Controls:

WASD/Arrow keys: Movement

SPACE: Attack with your briefcase

Q: Quit

H: Help

V: Withdraw investments from stock booths

B: Invest liquid health at a stock market booth

#### Known issues
- There are a few bugs left in the game. If the stock graph is not being drawn refresh the page.

entries.title: Blood Type Z
entries.description:
Bash monsters with your trusty heavy duty umbrella that also has a syringe built in (surprisingly).
Drain the monsters' blood and turn it into your own life force! Then sell it to a shady person for power ups.

Try not to get hit or you're gonna damage the merchandise.
Your umbrella is very durable, so you can always use it to block anything that feels threatening to you. As long as you're facing your threat, naturally.


![ludum44.exe Screenshot 2019.04.30 - 03.27.46.23.png](///raw/4b6/81/z/23155.png)

![ludum44.exe Screenshot 2019.04.30 - 03.28.26.87.png](///raw/4b6/81/z/2315f.png)


More of a tech demo than anything. Lots of placeholder graphics, mechanics and, you know, *things*.

Made in Monogame.



**CONTROLS:**

Arrow keys - Run places

X - Swing your umbrella

C - Use your umbrella to block attacks (and buy stuff from the shady guy)

Spacebar - Jump



**CREDITS:**

@ceuteum - Code, Level layouts (Twitter: https://twitter.com/AMasumary)

@youkaidrawing - Art, Main game idea and Design (Twitter: https://twitter.com/YoukaiDrawing)

@sat9 - Sound, Music, Voice acting, Level layouts (Twitter: https://twitter.com/domainofeyes)

entries.title: Tower of Soulon
entries.description:
Climate change is on the rise and your world needs a solution. Using your soul magic, you journey to the deepest parts of hell to receive the divine flower and recover the damages humans have done to the overworld. Satan has left you with his most difficult challenge yet, getting through his obstacle course and reaching the top of his tower to receiving the divine flower. It will be a tough journey, but using your soul magic, you stand a chance at reaching the pinnacle of Hell and acquire power for your people. Good luck soldier.

Instructions:
Movement: Use the WASD keys to move along the horizontal axis.
Jumping: Use the Spacebar to jump
Double Jumping: Press the Spacebar midair to jump again. This action consumes 3% of your soul
Boost up: Press the E Key to boost jump. Like the double jump, it can be used midair. This action consumes 6% of your soul  and has a 10 second cooldown.
Wall Running: Hold the Q key when near a wall to wall run for up to 2 seconds. 

Credits:

Jickamangah: Map Design, Voice Acting, Sound, Music
Kintama45: Lore, Dialogue, UI, Abilities, Voice Acting
NotLivingPool: Programming, VFX

Screenshots:
![Screenshot 2019-04-29 at 3.28.34 AM.png](///raw/9d4/91/z/21090.png)

entries.title: The Bloody Merchant
entries.description:
Hello, This Is My First Ever Ludum Dare.

my game were faaaar from complete, when the compo ended. so i decided to just go for the jam instead.
its still far from complete. some major elements didnt make it, but the main gameplay is there.
im going try and finish this game, so feedback is welcome either good or bad.



the setting is a world where bodyparts, are on demand. body parts that are starting to fail are switched out with robotic parts. the people of this world have started to understand the mistakes they have done, and are now looking for bodyparts to get their life back.
 
so this is a auction house game, where the man with the biggest pocket wins.
managed multiple buyers at the same time, accept a price that gives the best profit.
accept or decline the offer. the currency is blood and if the blood points -_- reaches 0 you lose.



as mentioned this is just the basic gameplay i wanted. alot is missing, which sadly was the part that had the theme in mind.

but this is all for now, see you all in the next compo/jam

entries.title: Instagram Boyfriend
entries.description:
**Overview**

A game made for Ludum Dare 44, the theme was Your Life is Currency.

The basic idea is that Instagram models and photographers make money by oversharing their life and make it look a certain way. 
So your goal is to take a photo that will get the most viral shares one way or another. And enjoy soothing audio while being judged.


**How to play**

Objective: take a photo that will be "on brand" for the model. You need to hit the red button at the right time, and can modify some background objects. Or add a filter!

**Things that we wanted to get in but didn't have time**

- We were originally way over-scoped trying to get in 5 levels, instead we got in 2 levels
- Scoring unbalanced
- Not enough time on the HUD making it feel like a phone
‚Äã

**Tools**

- Unreal 
- Audacity
- Photoshop

**Other notes**

- Screenshots are saved in LD44InstaBF/Saved/Screenshots/WindowsNoEditor
- Our team had a good mix of experienced and first timer game jam participants. We originally started out with more of a pokemon snap idea and kind of shifted later.

entries.title: Hearts for Coins
entries.description:
# Coins for Hearts


## The Game

In this game you control two characters ‚Äì a Heart and a Coin.

Your goal is to reach the red platform with both characters.

The Heart character loses hearts over time and can only collect coins.
The Coin character loses coins over time and can only collect hearts.
To fill up the energy, you have to collect one key with each character and move with both to a green platform. There you can exchange the collected items.

The red platform is only visible, when both characters have collected a key.

The level is completed as soon as both characters reached the red platform.

The game is over, when one character falls down, runs out of energy or collects both keys.


## Controls
* Move characters: WASD
* Jump: Space
* Change characters: Left Mouse
* Exchange items: Left Mouse (only on green platform)


## Used Tools
* Unity 2019
* Aseprite
* sfxr
* Bosca Ceoil

## Update 2019-04-30
I accidentally uploaded the wrong setup.exe at itch.io. Fixed now.

entries.title: More Power, Less Life!
entries.description:
More power, less life, a blessing in disguise.

This is our first LudumDare. So please be polite. We are both developer, but we also did all of the graphics and sounds by ourself. It was fun for us and we probably will participate on the next LudumDare.

In this game you literally have to pay with your life to get upgrades. The goal is to survive as long as you can. But be aware, there are some enemies who likes to kill and devour you.
We tried to do a local coop-game, where you can play with two controllers and fight together against the opponents. 

Unity isn't the best solution yet, because the Input of controllers differs.

__CONTROL:__ You have to use one controller and the keyboard. (Using the arrows and space for fighting).

__INFO:__ There are two players as default. We didn't make it to get the option for single-player. Sorry. :c

We used:
Unity, 
Visual Studio, 
GitHub, 
Photoshop, 
FL-Studio

entries.title: Ares, Fairies, and Berries
entries.description:
[ares000.png](///raw/177/a1/z/22eb9.png)

Ares, the god of war, has hatched a plan to create chaos and war: Bring as much wine as possible to Dionysus, the god of wine, so that he will make the world drunk. However, Ares spills wine from his goblet with each step he takes, and leaves a path of flame behind him, making it dangerous to backtrack. Can you find a way through the labyrinth to make Dionysus merry?!

Note for players: During later levels of the game you unlock the buttons to activate your diagonal and dash powers. They appear at the top left, click to activate them.

entries.title: Blood Bastion
entries.description:
You're a vampire without a castle ! Watch out as the sun will drain all your life. Exchange what remains of your life to cast powerful spells and regain your bastion !

![Wallpaper.png](///raw/939/b1/z/23043.png)

I did not add everything I wanted but at least it is finished on time !
That's my second entry into Ludum dare, and certainly not my last. I had a blast doing this, hope you did too :)

entries.title: Harvester
entries.description:
![Harvester](///content/e99/81/z/23260.png)

[Play _Harvester_ here!](https://mertios.itch.io/harvester-jam)

## Controls

- **W/‚Üë** or **A+D/‚Üê+‚Üí:** Throttle forward

- **A/‚Üê:** Throttle left

- **D/‚Üí:** Throttle right

## Story

The year is 2119 A.D. and the Earth's economy is completely reliant on asteroid mining harvester ships. You are a harvester pilot. *Your life is currency: the Earth depends on you.*

## Objective

Extract and collect all resources in the zone. The white arrows point in the direction of asteriods. In order to begin extracting resources from an asteroid, dock your harvester ship next to the asteroid.

## Details

This game was entirely made in the last 24 hours of Ludum Dare using first-party assets after the failure of two other game prototypes.

- **Engine:** Unity 2018.3.14f1
- **Source-code editor:** Geany
- **Graphics editor:** Aseprite/GIMP
- **SFX editor:** Bfxr
- **Music editor:** Musescore/Bosca Ceoil

Thanks for playing!

entries.description:
**Tl:dr** Color based tower defense! ü§ñ

Hey guys,

We are a german team of 3 members. We made a little tower defense game. Unfortunately, there are still a few features missing. Time was just too short this time. We hope you enjoy it anyway. It's recommended to play in fullscreen.

![Unbenannt.png](///raw/621/z/245c2.png)
![screenshot_game.PNG](///raw/f74/z/24126.png)

Have fun with our entry,  
Team Banana4Life

Website: http://banana4.life  
Twitter: @bananafourlife 

## Controls

Use the sidebar on the right to select the tower you want to place.

- Left-click to place a tower
- Right-click to place a wall
- Left-click-drag any of the 3 color clouds at the bottom center to any of your towers to add color to it

The clouds will shrink as you use up your colors. Enemies that reach your home will eat up color.
Enemies that are defended will gain you back some color.

Chose your towers wisely!

## Submission 2 Changes

The currently linked version is "post-jam" with just 2 small fixes:

- enemies can't go out of the screen anymore
- a typo in the intro has been corrected

The original version can still be played on github under the "First Submission" release.

entries.title: Save Your Soul!
entries.description:
My submission to the Ludum Dare Game Jam 44.
Each time i dont feel ready to join the jam but this time i was doing it no matter what!!
Although i did join late but i had this idea that i wanted to make and show you guys, hopefully you like and enjoy it :D 
The game is simple and reflects the Theme, you are a human surrounded by zombies and there is a safe place you should go to that zombies cant reach. So its like a zombie puzzle game.
In order to go to that safe spot you need to run away from zombies by throwing body parts as a decoy to run away until you figure out the hide spot.
You should read the Rules before playing since i wanted to add more logic to it by not allowing you to do certain things if you cut the wrong body parts(ex:- no legs, no jump, etc..) 

It was an amazing experience to join the Ludum Dare! Thanks :)![ss3.PNG](///raw/d0c/42/z/21ca1.png)

entries.title: The Capitalist Fireman
entries.description:
![cover.png](///raw/88f/2/z/22109.png)

Omg, the new mayor decided some new budgetary cuts this year for the fire department, if you want to keep your job you will have to prioritize your rescue. Big Donations come from big donors, you will have to save the wealthy first ! But don't overdo it or wage-worker might notice it and you will get fired too. Good luck Hero !

![ezgif.com-video-to-gif(1).gif](///raw/88f/2/z/2214f.gif)

# Dev Process
We decided to make a game where the price of life is competing with the cost of the fire department sustainability. The game rules try to question the player about the duality between efficiency and ethic.


# Controls

| Action | key |
| -------| --- |
| Move | Arrow keys |
| Estinguish| Space |


# Team

| Member | Role |
| ------ | ---- |
| Florian Escuer | Graphics |
| Aurelien Montero | Sound Design |
| Guillaume Gomez | Programming |

entries.title: Highway To Hell
Evoform
entries.description:
![QQÊà™Âõæ20190430001322.png](///raw/e64/f1/z/23904.png)

Turn-based strategy game where you need to control your clones to kill enemies, consume them for reproduce new clones, then spend your clones to evolve your abilities.

------------------------------------------------------------

Control: 

LMB: Control units

RMB: Zoom in/out camera

Arrow/WASD: Control camera move

------------------------------------------------------------

Tips:

Player clones currently reproducing cannot move in current turn.

After each wave player can select clone to spend as evolution points to upgrade new clone abilities.

------------------------------------------------------------

***Note: The core gameplay features are complete, however there are still bugs need to be fixed, please be patient :D


***Update01: 

Probably got a stable build now, will upload WebGL soon.

I forgot to put limit to how much you can evolve your clone's each ability... but I think that's considered as a new feature so I won't add it... for now... However, be cautious about evolving your clone out of control, I don't know what will happen! (literally didn't test it yet)


***Update02:

Already gathered a bunch of bug reports, will fix them ASAP!


***Update03:

Thank everyone that helped me identifying bugs, I think I fixed the bug that causing players stuck at the reproduction phase!

I think I also forgot to let player be able to "stay in position" or cancel unit selection, but I guess that's count towards new features... Oh, I also forgot to add a counter for how many waves the player has cleared...

Also I think the current difficulty is too hard... It's very easy for the system to roll a very powerful enemy right now. (Or maybe it's just I'm suck at strategy games)



------------------------------------------------------------
Bug fix log (all fixes are done after the submission period)


@SnowTelevision

Fixed a bug that make player stuck at reproduction phase.

Fixed a bug that player turn won't auto finish if there are reproducing units.


@SnowTelevision

Fixed a bug that player can move a longer route than max move route length

Fixed a bug that enemy turn will finish before last enemy finished act

Should fixed a bug that no enemy will be generated for new wave
 

@SnowTelevision

Fixed a bug that if a player clone just reproduced a new clone, and the player moved the new clone, the parent clone cannot move anymore.
 
Fixed a bug where enemy won't move towards player unit that is out of its move range.

Fixed a bug where enemy have unlimited move range.
 
Fixed a bug that new player unit clones is start at "reproducing" phase.


@SnowTelevision 

Fixed a bug when a level is finished, player turn is not finishing.


@SnowTelevision 

Fixed a bug causing moved player unit cannot move in future turns.


@SnowTelevision 

Fixed a bug when player skip an "Unit" 's act, player's turn is skipped instead.

Fixed a bug where the arrow keys does not move the camera correctly.
 
Fixed a bug causing the player cannot attack enemy. 

@SnowTelevision

Fixed a bug causing the UI show "Enemy Turn" does not disappear after enemy's turn.

Fixed a bug causing the camera not "Zoom In".

entries.title: Little Dead Riding Hood
entries.description:
You play a minion of death. Your mission, to help troubled souls move to the afterlife.

![screen-1.png](///raw/c18/61/z/2491c.png)

CONTROLS:
WASD for movement.
K to attack.
Step on a soul to absorb it.

Team:
Aim Diab
Michael Marney-Brusstar!

Theme: Seems I need to clarify. The main character is a minion of death and makes his living by dealing in souls. Souls are lives. Their lives are his currency. We were going to add a Ferryman (Charon from Greek mythology) character that you would take your collected souls to and exchange them for power ups, equipment, etc.

entries.title: Rat Lab
entries.description:
Rat Lab is a wave-based scoring game, in which you are a test dummy,
a poor clone forced to suffer through randomly generated rooms and endless combat simulations, until death.

Your life is the only thing you have that is worth anything, so the lab A.I. has designed an upgrade system based around it. You pay in permanent loss of health the precious upgrades to your stats and your shiny new weapons.

The cycle of the game is simple: it begins a new wave, throws you in it, and it doesn't end until you've cleaned up the generated room of all the slimes. Then, you'll be able to activate the Upgrade Console (by pressing F near it), and to trigger the next room generation (and the next wave...).

Controls:
- WASD: Move your player
- Mouse direction: The direction you're shooting/hitting toward
- Left mouse click, Space: Use equipped weapon (shoot)
- Escape: Pause and quit menu
- Cheat! "k" (think KillAll) is bound to a function that wipes all enemies in the current wave.

TODOs and ameliorations:
- Balancing! Lots of it.
- More than one type of enemy
- More content in general (Gauntlet types, room prefabs, upgrades...)
- A simpler stat handling system
- A way to indicate "used" upgrades
- A crowd pathfinding algorithm (it gets really really crowded in later waves)

Regrets:
- Lost way too much time on stats and balancing
- Not enough content

Points we are proud of:
- Own implementation of the A* pathfinding algorithm (by tenshi42), fast and optimized enough for most needs

entries.title: CorrupSoul
entries.description:
**Story:**

You're a tomb robber who once opened one grave too much and accidentally released a colony of monsters from hell, the monsters went to your city and started hunting it. In order to rescue your city you went to a very isolated and far away Mayans temple. The legend says that the Mayans got a special weapon from aliens that visited earth thousands of years ago that can kill creatures from the world beyond. But surprise is waiting for you at the main hall of the temple, you get locked with special ghosts that have physical body and can get killed by your sword, but that comes with a price, every time you kill a monster your soul is corrupting by a bit, eventually you'll be turn into one of them, to heal yourself you'll need to pay HP and to short your life. The gate to the weapon room will open after you'll beat all of the waves of the monsters.






**The theme (Your life is currency) within the game:**

In CorrupSoul , In order to make it through you'll have to pay good amount of HP to survive.






**Gameplay tutorial:**

**1.**Use the WASD keys to move







**Gameplay tutorial:**

**1.**Use the WASD keys to move 
      Use the 'F' key to attack
      Use the 'Z' key for interaction (instead of ENTER) 

**2.**To fix your soul you need to in front of the soul soul purifier facing it and then press 'Z' to interact with it,the soul bar will reset and the health bar will lose 5 point's of 20;


**The purifier:** ![Shop.png](///raw/393/41/z/2246a.png)




**Use mouse:**

When turned on: When you want to attack, click in the direction you want to attack and the character will turn automatically and attack.

When turned off: When you want to attack you'll have to turn the character manually but you can still activate it by clicking or pressing 'F'

Note that the exploding monsters can explode on walls



**3.:**
When the waves are done the door will open, just go in front of it and press 'Z'

**4.**
Make sure that the health bar doesn't go empty and that the soul corruption bar doesn't go full.

![Dugma.png](///raw/393/41/z/23d07.png)
 



**General goal:**

Survive all the waves and go into the door

**The door:** ![Layer 1.png](///raw/393/41/z/22574.png)


__A little disclaimer -__  Even though we participated in the Jam (the 72 hours challenge) we couldn‚Äôt work for 26 hours so the game did not come out as good as we wanted :(


**Problems:**

The AI is so annoying! Yes we know that,we had problems with the collision system of th enemys
and that's the result
 

Why can I only attack in 4 directions?! It's coming from lack of sprites for the character and one lazy graphics man.



__We'll hopefully make a post jam version__


See you in the next Ludum Dare! " :)



![Layer 1.png](///raw/393/41/z/225b2.png)

entries.title: Unpredictable dungeon
entries.description:
Unpredictable dungeon is a FPS RogueLike game. You fight your way through a dungeon consisting of several rooms. There are a couple of premade rooms which are randomly connected together to form a random generated level. You enter the next level by standing on a yellow platform. You can use either a laser gun which has a large magazine and high firerate or a sniper which packs a bigger punch and has a longer range. When you begin reloading a weapon you need to finish reloading that weapon before you can change to another one.

The keyboard controls are:
* WASD or arrow keys to walk
* space to jump
* left mouse button to shoot
* r to reload
* 1 to equip laser gun
* 2 to equip sniper
* k to decrease aim sensitivity
* i to increase aim sensitivity

entries.title: Kaumaha

An animation-heavy exploration game!
![islandSHORTversion.gif](///raw/9b0/42/z/23082.gif)

In this game you control a tribe of hawaiian people. Your goal is to keep them alive! To achieve this, you must sacrifice some of the members of your tribe to one of the 5 hawaiian gods. Do this in the right order and your tribe survives! Make a mistake and all will be doomed! Good luck!

[Disclaimer] We have already recorded pretty much all the audio we need for the game, but simply ran out of time to implement it. We are certainly going to work on adding the audio later on, but also on fixing some bugs and just overall polishing the game with better animations and smoother UI. For now, we hope you enjoy this version of the game. We had a lot of fun participating in the Ludum Dare and are very pleased with the result!

entries.title: Life Bet
entries.description:
![Cover image](///content/b3/z/23401.png)
  
**___**  
  
*- Hey dude! My demo‚Ä¶ My pals and me, we like to make bets, are you interested? What kind of bets? ‚Ä¶Er, well, funny ones. Price? There's no price, hu hu‚Ä¶ Says, here's the game : we want you to run along a big room, and you have to reach the other side without dying. What do you bet? You bet a part of your life. And you bet it just before you run, so‚Ä¶ Well, that's the funny part : if you bet too much, you have more risk to fail, and give me your sou‚Ä¶ Er‚Ä¶ Make my pals and me very sad. But if you win, you gain more life, and so you will live longer‚Ä¶ Or you can try another run, with better chances - and you can also bid more, to gain more, of course. So, interested?*  
  
**___**  
  
I'm not the only one who didn't wanted this theme, as almost every LD for a long time. And it's not because I suggested the one wich reached the second place (not sure I would have made a better game with it), but because I don't like this kind of very restricted theme, wich leads to two or three main ideas, all the same for almost everyone, and it's very difficult to find something not that boring, to twist any of those first ideas - plus, here, some of the main ideas are weird or disgusting. So, without any surprise, I didn't came up with a satisfaying idea before late saturday night (much more sunday morning, in fact), just before going to bed. Fortunately, this was not too hard to program, so I managed to finish something playable in time, but, well, there is a lack of juicy things, no sound, only procedural graphics barely better than programer art, no story in game, and the balance is very approximative. I hope you will have at least a little fun playing it - I will have fun for sure trying yours.  
:smile:  
  
**___**  
  
Controls are on the game page, under the game.  
  
Tips :  
  
‚Ä¢ All the obstacles make different damage (for ex. crates hurts more than lamps, but less than cactus - yes, the green things are cactus, I swear)  
  
‚Ä¢ The more you gain life, the more the difficulty raise, even for easy choice (the runs will be longer, and from times to times, the minimum bet will raise too)  
  
‚Ä¢ If you finish a run without losing any life, you'll gain a safe bonus (function of the run long, but same whatever the bet difficulty)  
  
‚Ä¢ Your best score is the longer life you reached. It's saved, even if you quit the game (as the *bookmaker* said, you can stop anytime :rolling_eyes:)  
  
**___**

entries.title: Impact!
entries.description:
A collaboration between PixelLunatic and AspiringGameDev.

You only have so much time in your life. It is imperative that you spend that time wisely to have the greatest impact on the world. In this side-scrolling platformer, avoid distractions and find doors of opportunity. Behind each door is an opportunity that will improve your impact score, at the cost of time from your life.

Get the highest amount of impact before your life runs out!![A+ivhB.png](///raw/3c5/d1/z/23ca2.png)

Controls:
- Arrow Keys to move
- Up to jump
- E to interact with doors
- Spacebar to use your abilities
- 1: Activate flying ability
- 2: Activate blink ability

entries.title: Deer Zombie Hospital
entries.description:
> This is our __first__ ever gamejam and first serious game ever. You need to press play repeatedly in the main menu for game to launch. 
![ludum_dare_44_swarm.png](///raw/3e4/42/z/2428b.png)
![ludum_dare_44_lot_of_zombies.png](///raw/3e4/42/z/24295.png)
# Description
Zombie deer virus took over the world. You wake up in a hospital because of the operation on the finger you almost cut off. It is now 3 days after the breakout. All you remember is that there was an accident in the nearby chemical lab and that something wrong happened. Every animal living in forests next to the lab were infected. No one knew that it was only the beginning of apocalypse. After this event, every TV and radio station reported more and more frequently about people being bitten by wild animals and falling into madness - acting a if they were predators hunting for meat constantly. There is not much time for anyone now. No one knows how many there are already... How long can you survive?

# Gameplay

Your objective is to survive as long as it is possible before the virus gets you. In order to do so, you need to complete quests to maintain health. You have limited amount of time to complete each of them. If you fail, your maximum value of health decreases. Weapons, as well as different types of enemies are scaterred around the whole map. Remember, there is not ammo. Different weapons use your health as ammo, each at different rate. Those are determined by their power and capabilities. Killing enemies refills some hit points back.

## Controls
- WASD/arrows - movement
- mouse - aim
- LMB - shoot
- Mouse wheel - change weapon
- E - pick up weapon

## Enemies

- TIER I:
 * Basic patient - every game needs this one enemy who is easy and pretty much useless (still don't underestimate the number of them)
 * Contagious patient - read above, little tougher with damage over time added
 * Alcoholic - many years in urban environment with everyday C2H5OH consumption resulted in lower speed with increased toughness

- TIER II
 * Life-guard - guess what, read first one above, then bump up all statistics a bit
 * Narcoman - fast enemy with mediocre toughness that has low-damage and high-frequency attack
 * Wheelchair patient - what do you except from a guy in a wheelchair - he is slow, why is he then in TIER II if he is slow then? you guesed it - he is very tough

- TIER III
 * Nurse - ok, we actually implemented something more than variations of the first type of enemy, slow but tough unit with high damage that has passive ability to heal others
Injured soldier - again we come back to tweaking the first enemy's stats, tough with mediocre speed and powerful but slow attack
 * Bodyguard - now we actually, you won't believe, refer not to the first enemy type but to the Life-guard (who is actually referring to the first enemy type but shhhh), bump his stats a bit evenly
 * Freak - typical kamikaze guy - high speed, high damage, low toughness

- TIER IV
 * Doctor - wow, now actually we have even more mechanics, high toughness with low speed and damage that boosts damage dealt by enemies nearby
 * Psychopath - you almost forgot about referring to the first guy, didn't ya? bump the last guy's stats more evenly
 * Psychologist - strong unit with mediocre toughness and speed

- TIER V
 * DEER - BOSS, no spoilers

entries.title: Ludum Meta
entries.description:
Here's my entry, Ludum Meta. You have 48 hours to make a game! But! You have to balance out life and health, if not, you'll find finishing a game will be the least of your worries!

All you need is a mouse to play. I'm looking forward to your feedback, don't be shy about it! Your feedback helps me build better games!

INSTRUCTIONS -
You assign points or hours into GAME and LIFE. Balancing the two out should allow you to complete the game before Time runs out! If you're not careful though, your health will run out if you work too hard on game with no life in between! If you work only on Life, your progress bar will add up slowly, but time may run out before you can complete the game!

BUGS -
Fixed the known bugs related to the progress bar and the time allocation buttons going under 0.

Let me know if you spot any other bugs!

![Screencap.png](///raw/872/2/z/23ef6.png)

entries.title: Petulant Petrolheads
entries.description:
This game is an infinite scroller that requires you to spend your resources to upgrade your car, fighting off other cars to fulfill your quest of going, well, as far as possible! Get as far as you can without running out of fuel or scrap. Taking damage reduces your scrap as you use it to patch up your car. Run out of scrap or fuel, and you will stop, or explode, or both!

Has both keyboard and gamepad controls!

Keyboard Controls : Arrow keys to move. Q to boost, W to reload your primary weapon, E to create a shield, R to fire a rocket.  Space to fire your primary weapon.‚Äã

Gamepad Controls (XInput) : Left Analog stick to move. A to boost, X to reload your primary weapon, B to create a shield, Y to fire a rocket. Right trigger to fire your primary weapon. Right trigger to fire your primary weapon.‚Äã

This game was made using Construct 2

entries.title: Demon's Wages
entries.description:
This is a story of an ordinary demon with his ordinary job. Help him so he can get his wages!

Chat with people to know what their desires are about: Art, Science, Fame, Wealth or Love. 
If you bother them too much with a small talk, character would leave. Pay attention to the news - it affects the character desire level, if one the news aspects matches the character desire. Fill their hearts with the desire, and when it turns black - offer them a deal! Their soul will be yours. Collect five souls to be a good worker!

How to find out what's the character desire:

- They can talk about it in a small talk or think about it, standing alone in the pub;
- Their desire level changes when news have the aspects, that matches their desire.
- When talking about desires, character can react positively (that means that's his desire), negatively (that means that's not his desire) or neutral (it can be both).

(We would even recommend to write down the character name and their desire (when you find it out) :D)

![Screenshot_5.png](///raw/d23/01/z/222ba.png)

![Screenshot_4.png](///raw/d23/01/z/222bd.png)

![Screenshot_8.png](///raw/d23/01/z/226f1.png)

entries.title: Reap into Cash
entries.description:
# Reap into Cash

![dead_like_me_parody_background.png](///raw/938/1/z/20c6e.png)

## Directions:

##### WASD to move. Arrow keys work too.

##### Grab your victims to reap them, *their lives are your currency*. Get it?

## Rules:

Other Reaps are gunning for your peeps. 

They will reap any peeps they can grab. 

If they grab you, they will steal your hard earned cash. 

You start will 10 CASH.

If you run out, you "die". 

Once you reach 30, ~~or whatever arbitrary number I change it to during DEV,~~ you "Win!".

## Story:

You are running around as whatever monstrosity **God** created or allowed to exist that is neither Man nor Grim Reaper. 

You reap victims anyways, at your leisure, to save up enough life-cash-soul-essence-billfolds to purchase your very own Scythe and become a full Grim Reaper.

entries.title: Life'$ A Coin
entries.description:
Hello everyone this game is a FPS Platformer having a single goal that is to maintain a balance of your net-worth. You need to overcome the obstacles and earn coins. You will die if you have no coins and you will move slowly if you have a surplus amount of them. Try to maintain a balance in the amount of money you possess. There are a lot of surprises that you will encounter in this journey and try not to get SAD, good luck have fun ;)

![ss3.png](///raw/381/41/z/21e13.png)

### With 5 endings.

‚ÄãA short narrative driven game, in which the player takes up the role of a person who is out in the world trying to figure out what to do with his life. The game has multiple endings and you will be choosing what the future holds!

entries.title: Precious Memories
entries.description:
Each memories in your life have the own price. Memories with positive emotions are greatly appreciated, whereas memories with negative emotions are useless and nobody needs it. Your memory has limit space and you should choose what memories you want to keep. You can sell your positive moments of life, but if you want to get rid of negative moments you must pay for it. Keep a good mood in your life. Try to be happy in the ugly world.

![00c9e1d086eb0479492ef55004034ea9.png](///raw/974/32/z/21f82.png)
![8b203110cd04985d378725b2f1ae0a3d.png](///raw/974/32/z/21f84.png)

Controls:  

Move mouse to move the character. 

Click on objects to use it. 

"Space" or click on right-top icon:  go to the memories shop. 

You can sell the positive memories and must pay to delete the negative. 

If your memory is full you should clear your memory by deleting one of memories.‚Äã

entries.title: Soulbound
entries.description:
## The Game
You are a Battle Mage tasked with saving the world from encroching darkness by defeating the god Mal. As an oculus you have the ability to cast spells at the cost of your own life force, lum. Bewarned there are many dangers ahead of you, but with your trusty sword Nightkeeper blessed by the godess Atlas herself who can really stop you?

## Controls
Hold the right mouse buttion to use your sword.
Press the left mouse buttion to cast magic.
Magic is very useful but also costly.

## Development Notes
Further development and future updates will be on [Errant Flux](https://errantflux.com/).

entries.title: Your Life
entries.description:
Spend your time, literally.

**Your Life** is a game about using your time wisely. Which I struggle with, as should be evident by the simplicity of the game. :sweat_smile:

![screenshot.png](///raw/14/z/23732.png)

This is a very basic, mostly text-based game I made after abandoning my previous game due to overestimating my abilities. There are no sounds, nor graphics apart from colored progress bars. Just use the mouse to click buttons. Fully mobile friendly, as far as I can tell!

It's definitely missing things such as more stats and items to buy, but I think I managed to add enough to convey the point.

entries.title: Maritz Dungeon
entries.description:
Our second game. I made the code and a friend made the art. You play as https://www.twitch.tv/maritzhd in a mysterious Dungeon. You can balance your stats(Health,Speed,Strength) by selecting which to increase by 2 with the mouse wheel and pressing the right mosue button to increase this one and decrease the other two by 1. You walk with WASD and shoot with the left mouse button in the direction of your cursor. There are magic cards you can buy from a mage for your life you can activate them by simply clicking on them.

PS:Fixed a Bug where you get stuck in level even though all enemys are dead.
PSS:Added Apple Release

entries.description:
MEGATOID is a side-scrolling shooter made with HTML5 canvas. Controls are:

entries.title: Deathly Trade
entries.description:
Your goal is to finish your end of the bargain to leave the deepest pits of hell by trading away what remains of your soul. Other Demons are hungry for the souls you are carrying, so watch out!


**Controls**

**WASD** to Move

**Mouse** to Aim

**Left** Mouse button to attack

**Escape** to Access shop and pause

**1** for Blink Ability

**2** for Petrify Ability

**3** for Armageddon Ability

**Abilities Require Purchase To Activate**

entries.title: Barter In Blood
entries.description:
A shoot-em-up roguelike with a twist - at the start you get to choose how much life to pay for an advantage in the game. Will you pay all your life except 1 for the best bonuses? Or will you refuse to deal with the devil and go in without anything? It‚Äôs all up to you in Barter in Blood.
Controls: WASD or Arrow Keys to move, Enter or Z to shoot

UPDATE: I made a post ludum dare update to the Barter in Blood game, which you can play at https://snowinn.itch.io/barter-in-blood-v2. The new features added are  pressing ‚ÄúEnter‚Äù will skip through the intro and the game automatically restarts when you die. These features are solely to help you play the game without going through the intro every time and should not be a factor in the rating of the game. If this is against the rules, I‚Äôll take it down.

entries.title: Pig Web Tower Defense

Here's our first Ludum Dare attempt! It's a web based tower defense game, where you try to keep the 'pigs' from over running you. The catch? The only way to make money to build towers is to let some of the pigs get past you. ![Capture.PNG](///raw/67f/c/z/23675.png)

Change Log:
Fixed a bug where the text in the shop blocked the buttons themselves. Does not change actual game play

entries.title: EnigmaDeath
entries.description:
In a world like any other platformer...
Except you have to die!
![screenshot1.PNG](///raw/cae/d1/z/20e85.png)
Die as many times as possible to buy items in the shop.
![screenshot2.PNG](///raw/cae/d1/z/20e87.png)
Featuring unique pixel art, 3 handcrafted levels, mediocre physics, and a soundtrack that only gets annoying after about 20 minutes!

There are three levels, and the last is quite difficult, but if you finish, share your score here!
Good luck!

Controls: WASD or arrow keys to move. Q or Space to toggle shop. Click a rotating image to buy the item. You can double jump.

The WebGL doesn't work as well as the windows, but should have all the same functionalities(probably). PLEASE PUT IT IN FULL SCREEN.

entries.title: Mani
entries.description:
![titulo_ld.png](///raw/a1c/6/z/248f0.png)

A rich old duck has aquired one more coin to store in his safe-like house, but this time it was no ordinary coin... It was Mani, the cursed coin!

You control Mani and try to escape the fortress, controlling other coins to get bigger and stronger. Beware of the old duck's flying cane!

## Controls

A key or Left arrow key: Move Mani to the left

D key or Right arrow key: Move Mani to the right

Space bar: Jump


## Links

- [Windows](http://texkiller.eu.org/Builds/Windows/Mani.zip)

## Development notes

Mani was developed using our own engine, the same one used on some of our previous LD entries. As with previous entries, I have found and fixed some bugs and implemented new features into the engine while developing this, so it was already worth participating, but I'm also grateful for any helpful feedback!

The tiles used in the game were adapted from CC0 content found in Kenney.nl, the songs were released by Eric Taylor licensed as CC-BY and four different Freepik.com vectors were adapted to make the old duck vector image. Links to the resources and their licenses are included in the archive.

entries.title: A Hill To Die On
entries.description:
This game was developed by a two person programmer team with no prior Unity or game development experience.

The theme of the game jam was "Your Life is Currency".

Press ESC to begin the game.

![Hill-Screenshot.png](///raw/f2a/32/z/2391c.png)

![hill2.png](///raw/f2a/32/z/2396d.png)

Controls:

WASD - Control character

Q and E - Decide how much life to sacrifice during auction phase

After Auction, use WASD to place opponent back in the maze

ESC - Begin Game

L - Restart Game

Acknowledgements:

- Art assets were from OpenGameArt.org

- Music generated by MuseNet, a deep neural network for generating music.

- Astar search and navmesh provided by AStarPathfindingProject at https://arongranberg.com/astar/

entries.title: The Insured Man
entries.description:
Can he fly? No. Is he invincible? No. What is he, you ask? He's insured!

![title3.jpg](///raw/f07/z/23168.jpg)

An unlikely superhero, protecting city from gangsters. Roaming streets, keeping things in order. Shot by a gangster? Insurance will pay for the next shootout. Hit by a car? No problem! Just more money for **The Insured Man**.

### How to play

Earn money by from your insurance. You can get shot by gangsters or you can get hit by a car. Use the money to pay for bullets. Patrol streets and shoot every gangster you see. They will try to convince other citizens to join them. Game is over when over half the population is gangsters (or you die).

You are **The Insured Man**.

### Controls

* Controls: Arrows or WSAD
* Shoot: Space or Left Control
* Change Weapons: 1 & 2
* **BUG**: The "Restart" button doesn't work and you have to reload the whole game to play again


PS: This was to be a compo entry, but I had scheduling issues. All assets are new, as you could have guessed.

PPS: I also had scheduling issues on Monday and the game can't be considered finished. But some might consider it a game.

entries.title: HWEY Heist
entries.description:
The Mexican Drug Lord (MD) goes on a mission to locate the HWEY Master and destroy it, so he can take all of its money!

### GUIDE

| ![Currency.png](///raw/e26/91/z/246a9.png) | ![MD.png](///raw/e26/91/z/246ab.png) | ![HWEY_Master.png](///raw/e26/91/z/246ae.png) | ![HWEY.png](///raw/e26/91/z/246af.png) | ![HWEY_Cub.png](///raw/e26/91/z/246b0.png) | ![Water_Gun.png](///raw/e26/91/z/246b1.png) |
|---|---|---|
| **The form of currency** | **The Mexican Drug Lord** | **The HWEY Master** | **A HWEY** | **A HWEY Cub** | **MD's Water Gun** |

- **HWEY:** HWEYs are aggressive creatures who will kill you without hesitation, and it's not out of instinct-- it's purely out of evil and malice!
- **HWEY Cub:** These aren't aggressive like the more matured HWEYs. MD can eat them to replenish and increase his energy!
- **MD's Water Gun:** This shoots out water, the weakness of HWEYs.

### SCREENSHOTS

| ![6.png](///raw/e26/91/z/240e5.png) | ![3.png](///raw/e26/91/z/240dc.png) |
|---|---|
| ![2.png](///raw/e26/91/z/240da.png) | ![1.png](///raw/e26/91/z/240d9.png) |


### CONTROLS

 - Arrow Keys: Move
 - Z: Jump
 - X: Fire
 - R: Respawn (This is in case the game gets a little quirky. The spawn points are automatically set as you progress.)


### CREDITS

- Graphics: Hunter Towe
- Audio: Hunter Towe
- Programming: Hunter Towe
- Game Engine: [Unity](https://unity.com/)
- Font: [Joystix](https://www.1001freefonts.com/joystix.font) by [Typodermic Fonts](http://typodermicfonts.com/)

   

- Tools Used:
  - Adobe Photoshop CS2
  - [Bfxr](https://www.bfxr.net/)
  - [BeepBox](https://www.beepbox.co/)
  - [Audacity](https://www.audacityteam.org/)
  

### UPDATE LOGS

- v0.1.1:
  - Corrected title text on title screen
  - Fixed game breaking bugs that kept player from interacting with enemies and items
  - Fixed problems with ambient noise and music
  - Other minor adjustments

  

- v0.1.2
  - Controls aren't quite as screwy now
  - Fixed a bug that was causing the game over sequence to not play

entries.title: Blency
entries.description:
‚ÄãBlency is a top-down shooter created for the 44th Ludum Dare with the theme "Your life is currency" by three students at the Institut de l'Internet et du Multim√©dia (IIM) [Romain HABIB, Sebastien GUAROBER and Paul LEDUC].


![Blency_1.PNG](///raw/ca2/22/z/2117b.png)

![Blency_2.PNG](///raw/ca2/22/z/2117d.png)


‚ÄãIn this game, you have to survive to some waves of zombies and you only have a gun to defend yourself. You regain life over time and have the opportunity to buy a speed boost with your life points. There is also two puddles of blood placed on the map to win life faster.!

entries.title: S.U.C.E.S
entries.description:
Do you have what it takes to fight with the best at S.U.C.E.S? If you think you're up for the challenge, you better put your big boy pants on cause this is gonna be on hell of a ride! Your gonna be fighting your way through hordes of aliens, and collect the organs of their fallen. Then you will be able to trade those organs in for some nice rewards from Pete. So let's see what you go and join S.U.C.E.S today!

**(S.U.C.E.S Tip: Your blood has been infused with special chemicals that can dissolve the barriers inside of alien hideouts, so shooting them a couple of times should do the trick.)**

EDIT: Added web & .zip versions to itch.io game page.

entries.title: Billr
entries.description:
Wanna collect some rare and exotic currencies? Billr is the hottest new place that allows you to do just that! Trade unique bills with other numismatists anonymously in the marketplace, and complete your collection.

The website's been having trouble dealing with fraudulent bill sales, however, and here's where you can step in as well! Help to identify real bills from fake ones and get rewarded for your time. How much of your life will you spend before completing that collection of yours?

entries.title: Ashes
entries.description:
## INFO AND CONTROLS:

Ashes is a fast paced game in which you put out fires. Use WASD and Space to move. Click to use Fire Extinguisher. The icon in the bottom right is the amount of water you have. It will deplete as you use your fire extinguisher. When you run out, go to the fire extinguisher outside to refill it. The fires are a bit finicky, but it's possible to put them out. TIP: Try to spread the spray of the extinguisher as long as possible.

![Animated GIF-downsized_large.gif](///raw/bc4/d/z/22c89.gif)

# FEATURES

## WATER SYSTEM
Use up your water and you have to go refill it.

## FIRE SYSTEM
This one is self-explanatory

Get hurt by fires.... Also self-explanatory

entries.title: Stick Dungeon
entries.description:
Stick dungeon is a procedural dungeon crawler where you use your various aspects of life to enhance your stats.

You will be using three different forms of life which are: Physical(red), Mental(blue), Spiritual(yellow).

If either of these falls to 0 then you will lose and have to reset the game.

By using your life to purchase enhancements, you will be upgrading stats such as damage and cool down.

![screen1.PNG](///raw/675/42/z/24a23.png)

Explore the dungeon and defeat the boss!

Repeat on each level that is different from the last with the increase in difficulty!

![screen2.PNG](///raw/675/42/z/24a24.png)

# Controls #

Key           | Action   
------------- | ------------- 
Left Click    | Melee     
Right Click   | Magic    
Space         | Interact   

* Press F9 after playing testing for some more fun! :D: *

entries.title: The Adventures of Billy Bob Jones
entries.description:
‚ÄãThe Adventures of Billy Bob Jones is a silly platformer about a a cloaked figure who needs to extract the life-force of others in order to make himself more powerful.  This game unfortunately had to have many features scrapped due to computer issues (Unity decided to go into a crash loop, and then later went into a hang whenever we tried to play the game), and being a bit busy.  This is YellowZombie's second LDJam, but SquirreI's first.  After the issues we had, we're just glad that we made a working product. SquirreI created the Art, and most of the Level Design, while YellowZombie did the rest.  (Even though YellowZombie is more familiar with level design than SquirreI.)  
Original Concept Art (by YellowZombie): ![Untitled.png](///raw/5e1/e1/z/232f9.png)

These Turned Into (by SquirreI): ![Billy Bob.png](///raw/5e1/e1/z/2333a.png)

entries.title: GROW UP
entries.description:
![Spice_Cabinet_Banner.png](///raw/7dd/11/z/200c1.png)

GROW UP
In this Spice Cabinet game you will re-live your childhood as you explore your home and learn new things. Some things were good experiences and some were more bad than good. Go through life learning VALUABLE lessons such as to not eat the dog food and to stay out of your parents room. Do your best to learn as much as you can, get your parents keys and get out the front door without dying in the process.

Simple Controls

entries.title: Swarm survival
entries.description:
![img03.png](///raw/61c/z/2292c.png)

I've just heard about the jam 10h ago, so i've tryed my best in this little time.
I will work on the Project after the jam to compensate the timeloss and hope to bring this project to a stadium where it is nicely playable.

Till then i have to explain some thinks, that the game dosen't tell you:

Game

-restart the game with 'r'
-use 'esc' to go back to the menu
-move up with 'space'
-move left and right with 'a' and 'd'

-you have to get as fast as possible to the goal
-you get a bonus if you have more then one life
-you get an even bigger bonus if you find a timeitem and sacrefice one or more lifes


Editor

-save with enter
-the maps are saved in the 'maps'-folder
-the edited map is always saved as 'test.map'
-you have to delete or rename the old 'test.map'-file to save the maps correct

-use 'esc' to go back to the menu

-use '1', '2', '3' to switch between modes


What are modes?

-mode 1 (line):
   -create a line with leftmouse
   -create a new line with space
   -spawn static cubes along the line with rightmouse

-mode 2 (player):
   -set the player/s with leftmouse

-mode 3 (goal):
   -set the goal/s with leftmouse


-mode 4 (timebonus-item):
   -set the timebonus-item/s with leftmouse

![img06.png](///raw/61c/z/23873.png)

I hope you like it. Have fun!

entries.title: Boredom Be Gone
entries.description:
![Satan.png](///raw/121/42/z/23031.png)

Out of pure boredom you decide to summon satan to make your life more interesting. As satan is a friend of good entertainment he gladly offers you a deal:
He grants you great power in trade for your very own life energy. But sadly those powers tend to consume more energy than you have, so you see yourself forced to kill others for their energy.

You can move your character around using the W,A,S,D keys and jump by pressing Space. Hold shift to sprint, but keep in mind that sprinting and jumping consume energy.
You can wield your mainhand weapon by holding down the left mouse button and drag it to the desired strike direction. You can cast or charge spells by holding down the right mouse button. Some spells have an instant effect, while others have an over time effect. Casting spells also consumes life energy.  
Press F to pay respect, summon satan or proeceed in dialogs.

---------

If you encounter any bugs or similar insects feel free to contact us!

_________

Have some screenshots:

![Satan Rising.png](///raw/121/42/z/23d98.png)  Summoning satan  

![Skills.png](///raw/121/42/z/23d9a.png)  Leveling interface  

![Weapons.png](///raw/121/42/z/23d9b.png)  Weapon interface  

![Spells.png](///raw/121/42/z/23d9c.png)  Spell interface  

![Enemy.png](///raw/121/42/z/23d9e.png)  Some combat  

![LifeOrb.png](///raw/121/42/z/23da0.png)  Life orb  

![World.png](///raw/121/42/z/23da1.png)  The world  

_________

__Version 1.1__

- Added a little questline including five mini bosses  
- Added a follower that assists you in combat as reward  
- Added some new weapons and spells  
- Added a beautiful sky + reflections for weapons  
- Fixed the map (did you know there was a hole in the wall?)  
- Replaced that horrific chunk of granite in the center of the map  
- Some minor fixes and performance improvements  
- F11 to toggle Fullscreen  
_________


__Hardware requirements:__  
  
Requires OpenGL 3.3  
Works perfectly on AMD Cards and most Intel cards.  
On Intel Cards we recommend to lower the transparencyLayers-setting to 1.  
You can alter these settings by modifying the settings.confix file.
You can also edit the deferred shader and transparency resolution in case you have performance issues.

![Unbenannt.png](///raw/121/42/z/24498.png)

Thanks to all that told us about the Intel and NVidia issues.
_________

entries.title: Live for Light
entries.description:
You, the player, are put through a gauntlet until you reach the light, located at the very end. The main goal is to have enough hearts to be able to open the door to touch the light, winning the game. Do you have what it takes to complete this challenge unscathed?

F to shoot.

WASD keys to move forward/back and turn left/right.

Spacebar to jump.

All moving, purple platforms will freeze in position when shot at.

![Platform freeze.png](///raw/add/71/z/244d5.png)

White pylons can be shot at to temporarily allow you to teleport at the top of them by pressing T.

![Green plat.png](///raw/add/71/z/244d6.png) ![Teleport.png](///raw/add/71/z/244d7.png)

The top of dark purple pylons can be shot to temporarily reveal a platform to jump on.

![Platform Generate.png](///raw/add/71/z/244d9.png)

Have at least 3 hearts to complete the game.

When you run out of ammo, you may still shoot, but at the cost of a heart.

There are three pickups throughout the level.

Press O to open the door at the end of the level.

Touch the light to win.

Press esc to reset the level at any time.

Try a different browser if the game doesn't work.
Some tablets with keyboards may be able to play.

Tech Used: 

Unity, Blender and Photoshop.

entries.title: Escape

This is a demo scene. When the fight is over, the game resets.

entries.title: Electric Sheep
entries.description:
Look after a herd of AI sheep, every so often you can breed survivng sheep to create a new sheep with the attributes of the parents. Keeping the best sheep alive and breeding them will allow you to essentially upgrade the herd. Protect the herd and keep them fed and watered.

![Screenshot (68).png](///raw/ee0/9/z/2237c.png)
This was kinda more of an experiment, I wanted to see how much of a game I could get an AI to make.

The sheep and grass graphics come from [google quick draw]([GitHub Pages](https://pages.github.com/) and I ideally wanted to generate new images on the fly, but couldn't figure it out. Instead it selects images from a small sample of the dataset.  

The music comes from [MuseNet](https://openai.com/blog/musenet/) and was generated and then I curated it. 

The logic for the sheep and wolves is created by a neural network that was trained using reinforcement learning. Unity has a really simple toolkit for this [ml-agents](https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents) and basically all I had to do was define the rewards. 

So really all I did was assemble the game.  
![Screenshot (69).png](///raw/ee0/9/z/22382.png)

entries.title: Castle Mania
entries.description:
Our first Ludum Dare entry. 

Unfortunately we had other commitments, such as coursework and revision, that needed to be done during the Jam period and so we didn't spend nearly as much time as we would've liked on this game. However we hope this proves to be an interesting proof of concept at the very least.

Description:

A dungeon crawler where you are a vampire.
Damaging enemies increases your life force, which 
you can spend on buying upgrades.  

Aim:

Defeat all the enemies in a level to progress to 
the next. Complete all the levels without dying.

Controls:

WASD - Movement

Space - Use Spell

Esc - Pause game
