entries.title: Mercenary
entries.description:
Mercenary puts you in the shoes of an Intergalactic Mercenary, tasked with completing contracts for a bounty. 
As an Intergalactic Mercenary you risk your life to make a quick buck.
Opposing factions will seek your help to further their agency, but you must decide which contract is more valuable.
Complete the bounties to collect currency or pay the ultimate price... your life!

A little about the Insomniacs:

We are a group of young professionals working for an MSP & Software For Hire business.
We also partner with a local STEM Tech Academy to help teach high schoolers programming through the event.
This is our second ludum dare together and we are improving quickly.
Our first game - Ascension was a 2D adventure game.

We tried our hand in the 3D space this time around and faced some challenges:
- Colliders were being extra difficult
- Physics issues with camera
- Player seeking attacks not working correctly
- Battled Illness

We were able to overcome these items and learn from them but had to leave some mechanics out.
post-jam we intend to make updates and include the mechanics we needed to skipped, these include:

- Multiple missions / bounties
    - Add skins to give each mission a unique feel.
    - Cumulative count of currency collected across missions
- Ally Patrols
    - Ally ships to assist in your mission and dog fights
- Using Currency to purchase upgrades
    - Additional weapons (secondary not available immediately)
    - Shields
    - Escape pods (Extra Life)
    - Additional ships
    - etc.
- More in-depth dog fights and arming the Citadel
    - This relates to the player seeking attack issues
- Skins / Materials
    - Faction specific skins 
    - Ship skins
- Added visual effects
    - movement animations
    - better attack animations
- Improves Sounds
    - with better software and equipment we‚Äôd like to make more in depth sounds
- Dialogue
    - In game dialog between factions 
- Easter Eggs
    - Hidden Morality Bonus

In short wed love to complete this into a full indie game in the future, and we feel much more comfortable tackling 3D projects in future jams.

Some things we are particularly proud of:
- Modeling
    - we created all assets and are particularly proud of the modeling work done
- Scripts
    - Player seeking enemy ships that detect when you enter their cluster
    - randomized asteroid and Citadel locations

We've enjoyed our second Ludum Dare together and look forward to the next, we learned a ton and can‚Äôt wait to show that off again!

Hope you enjoy our game - Mercenary!

entries.title: The Ball's Path
entries.description:
![Screen Shot 2019-05-01 at 3.57.17 PM.png](///raw/693/42/z/24205.png)

"The Ball's Path" is a challenging, control-based 3D platformer - with the unique twist of the possibility to "gamble' your life away. 

Starting with a limited amount of health, the Ball gains the ability to "gamble" away life for certain abilities, i.e. lose 50% of health to gain a double jump, or 90% of health for a temporary invincibility. Certain parts of the game will be extremely difficult to complete without sacrificing some life, hence force the Ball to use its powers.

The Ball will travel across the The Land of Cubes, now taken over by the evil Triangles (actually tetrahedrons). The Ball is encounters Little Fairy Cube, who then gives the power of "life gambling". Running away from a mysterious shadow, the Ball runs towards the centre of the Pyramid to defeat the evil Triangles.

**THERE IS A BUG IN THE TUTORIAL WHICH LOCK THE ABILITY TO SHOOT - PREVENTING GAMEPLAY - IF THAT HAPPENS, USE "1" + "0" TO SKIP TO NEXT LEVEL (or "1" + "9" to return to previous level). BEFORE SKIPPING TO NEXT LEVEL, YOU HAVE TO AT LEAST GET TO THE SECTION IN THE TUTORIAL WHERE YOU CAN JUMP AND SHOOT**

Preview:
![Screen Shot 2019-05-01 at 3.50.38 PM.png](///raw/693/42/z/24202.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-05-01 at 3.51.35 PM.png](///raw/693/42/z/24204.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-05-01 at 3.51.07 PM.png](///raw/693/42/z/24203.png)

entries.title: Get Me My Drones!
entries.description:
Get Me My Dormes! (GMMD) is a small Shoot 'em up, where your goal is to get as many drones as possible to the end of the level. Easy, right?

## Controls:
 wasd   : movement

"space" : fire your drones at the enemys (but look out, you only have the amount you see)(press not hold!)


### Bugs of the ludum dare version:
- spawning of enemys and hostile projectiles does not work correctly (fixed in postLD version)
- enemy rockets wont explode, so they are invincible (fixed in postLD version)
- the try "again" button does not work correctly; the player spawns without drones and is invincible (fixed in postLD version)
- the ending screen does not trigger (not fixed because we had no time yet)

--

[@akronsus]: "Unfortunantly it's not possible to win the Ludum Dare version, since the rockets don't handle their collision correctly. Enemys and enemy-projectiles also do not spawn as intended. For some reason they are weirdly offset to the far right or left.

Next time we really should focus on the base mechanics first and then expand the game, not build a lot of stuff that could be interesting and try to mash everything together in the last few hours. Well, atleast it was a fun exercise in using the Godot Engine and in how loosing your mind, as the remaining time ticks away, influences your decision making in prefering bad architectural choices."
![ld44_game_screenshot_v2.png](///raw/ef0/52/z/241e5.png)

entries.title: Stabman!
entries.description:
## Disclaimer
This README has been updated for the post-jam version. Most of what's written here is directed at the post-jam version. Jam-version executables are still available for download below, but we recommend the post-jam version :)

For a more detailed version of this README, check out our [GitHub repository][GitHub]'s README.  
_(The original README is about double the size of this one, be warned.)_

## Screenshots
![overworld.png](///raw/11c/d/z/2528d.png)
![graveyard.png](///raw/11c/d/z/2528a.png)
![graveyard_alt.png](///raw/11c/d/z/2528b.png)
![bonus_a.png](///raw/11c/d/z/2528c.png)

[Level One Preview Video][level-one-preview-video]

## Description
The theme for _Ludum Dare 44_ was...  
> Your life is currency

We went for a simple, generic approach:  
_You pay with your health to buy items._

The game is a _2D action-platformer_.  
Your goal is simply to get to the end of each level.  

Throughout the levels you will find _items_ which you can buy using your health as currency.  

You regain health by defeating enemies.  

Each level acts as a _checkpoint_; when you die, you restart at the beginning of the level.  
The game will also automatically save your progress to a savefile, each time you beat a level or die.  

As always with our jam games, we never properly finish.  
This jam's game was _especially unfinished_.  
If you intend to check out our game, we recommend trying our post-jam version.  

After the jam ended at the end of April, we continued working on the game  
with the goal to release a finished product (like always).  
This time, we are proud to say, that we _actually finished this game_!

## Controls
The exact controls are specified in the file `resources/config/bindings.ron`.  
You can change bindings in this file however you want; the syntax _should_ be self-explanatory enough.  
But careful: if you make a syntax error, the game will crash.  
See the generated file `logs/panic.log` for error messages, if it crashes.

__Note:__  
For the controller buttons we are using the Xbox naming scheme.  
So the `A` button would be the `X` button on a DualShock controller, etc.  

| Action                            | Keyboard                    | Controller                            | Notes                                                                      |
| :-------------------------------- | :-------------------------- | :------------------------------------ | :------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Move LEFT                         | __`A`__                     | `DPadLeft`, `JoyStickLeft`            |                                                                            |
| Move RIGHT                        | __`D`__                     | `DPadRight`, `JoyStickRight`          |                                                                            |
| Jump                              | __`Space`__, `K`, `Up`, `W` | `A`                                   | Hold down the jump button for a slower fall (lower gravity).               |
| Attack LEFT                       | __`Left`__, `H`             | `X`                                   |                                                                            |
| Attack RIGHT                      | __`Right`__, `L`            | `B`                                   |                                                                            |
| Buy item                          | __`E`__                     | `Y`                                   |                                                                            |
| Dash                              | __`Shift`__, `J`, `Down`    | `ShoulderButtons` (_left_ or _right_) | Need to hold down movement keys + press dash key; diagonal dashes work; can only dash in-air |
| Toggle pause                      | `P`                         | `Start`                               |                                                                            |
| Start game from main menu         | `Enter`, `Space`            | `A`                                   | Starts the _normal_ campaign, not _bonus_.                                 |
| Continue game from pause menu     | `Enter`, `Space`            | `A`                                   |                                                                            |
| Quit game from main menu          | `Escape`, `Q`, `Backspace`  | `B`                                   |                                                                            |
| Quit to main menu from pause menu | `Escape`, `Q`, `Backspace`  | `B`                                   |                                                                            |

---

## Development
### Tools Used
- __[Rust]__, programming language
- __[Amethyst]__, engine
- __[Deathframe]__, framework
- __[Vim]__, code editor
- __[GitHub]__, git repository hosting
- __[Gimp]__, tile/background/menu graphics
- __[Aseprite]__, sprite graphics
- __[Bosca Ceoil][BoscaCeoil]__, music
- __[FL Studio][FLStudio]__, music
- __[Tiled]__, level design
- __[Google Drive][GoogleDrive]__, file sharing
- __[Trello]__, task management

---

## Licensing
This project, including all of its code and assets (such as images, audio, level files),  
excluding fonts, are distributed under the terms of the [MIT License][MIT-license].  

### Fonts
The fonts (found under `resources/fonts`) remain unchanged,  
and are licensed individually by their authors.

#### Undefined Medium
- Located at `resources/fonts/undefined-medium.ttf`
- [OFL License][undefined-medium-license]
- [Website][undefined-medium-website]
- [GitHub Repository][undefined-medium-github]
#### Ruji's Handwriting
- Located at `resources/fonts/rujis-handwriting.ttf`
- [OFL License][OFL-license]
- [Author's Website][rujis-handwriting-website]


### SDL2
This project uses and redistributes an unchanged copy of [SDL2],  
for controller support with [amethyst]'s `sdl_controller` feature.  
`SDL2.dll` is distributed under the [zlib license][SDL2-license].

entries.title: Demon of Doom
entries.description:
# About the game

You are a demon. You have been sent to destroy the human world. Not you specifically though! You're part of an army. You're just cannon fodder, as you only have 1 live left. You need to rank up and collect some lives from humans. There's a friendly hell shopkeeper which will give you stuff, in exchange for some of those lives.

# Ludum Dare
**@JPiolho**: Sadly I barely had time to work on this game so it's very unfinished but I did my best to leave it in a playable stage to resemble a game. I want to continue working on this game for some time though. *There is no sound in the game.*

# How to Play
- Arrow keys to move
- Ctrl / Mouse 1 to attack
- Kill humans to earn lives
- Cops will shoot at you

entries.title: Skeleron
entries.description:
The goal of the game is to make sure you don't get killed for as long as possible and collect as many bones as possible. The longer you survive the higher your score. You can trade bones for upgrades but be aware you will be weaker and the prices go up the more of them you buy

HOW TO PLAY

Walking with WASD, attack with [spacebar]. Go outside of the spawn area to start the next wave go inside to prevent it from spawning.

HEALTH & MONEY 

You start with 200HP,which also act as your money, and when you kill there is chance they will drop a bone which without upgrade gives you plus 10HP. Enemies damage goes up over time .


Upgrades

There are four different kinds of upgrades which you can buy at the shop.

Speed - Gives you movement speed

Shield - Reduces the damage taken from enemies

Attack speed - Makes you attack faster

Bones - Increases the amount of HP given by dropped bones

entries.title: The Last Bank
entries.description:
This is a platformer/recource managment game where your life is currency but also currency is your life. The HP is actually money you have saved up in the bank. Warning: The game is very hard. It is at times a near pixel-perfect platformer combined with an unforgiving recource managment system where one mistake in either can kill you. In this it is similar to games such as Geometry Dash and Cuphead. 
Controls:

Arrow keys: Movement
AD: Camera movement
C: Upgrade Generator Type
X: Upgrade Generator 
B: Upgrade Air Jump
V: Upgrade Player
F: Upgrade Guard Generator(required to stay alive)
R: Make 1 guard (usefull for emergencies)
Z: Precision mode


If you would like some tips on surviving, then read on. If you want to find out for yourself and get brutally murdered in the process, than go straight to the download.

First things first: You need to get the hang of the controls. Practice getting on top of the bank until you are able to do it easily. Also grab the money there. Start by upgrading the guard generator. Always prioritize this and the money generator. Do some of the other platformers and get the generator ASAP. You will need money in the later rounds once the money from the platforming challenges runs out. Remember to try and keep the guard generator 1 or 2 levels above the wave level just to be safe. In the platforming challenges, remember that not all of them are possible without upgrading and that some upgrades require to be found in world first.








Have Fun and Enjoy!! Please Rate!

entries.title: Click Heartbeat
entries.description:
## Click number of heart will flow through some node and become larger or lesser.

## Game Play

+ Add a node by **press the number** on card under screen, you can only add 1 node every heartbeat. 
+ **Press the heart** and number will flow throw these heart and add to the number above the screen.
+ I only made 4 kinds of card for now.

![Snipaste_2019-04-30_19-45-37.png](///raw/04b/f1/z/23b44.png)

## Tools

+ Unity for game engine

+ Audacity for sounds (opengameart.org [Heartbeat sounds](https://opengameart.org/content/heartbeat-sounds) and [Heartbeat](https://opengameart.org/content/heartbeat-single-sound))

entries.title: Prostage
entries.description:
![cover.png](///content/a54/32/z/24847.png)

**Sorry if the game seems a bit rough, we only had something like 12h to work on it. An artist and a dev. A friend joined us for the music toward the end.**

You're a bank robber protecting himself by using shield holding hostages.
Grab all the money you can before the cops neutralize you.

[Little useless "blooper"](https://youtu.be/DbaJmyowAjw)


Commands:

Controls | Function
---------|----------
**Arrows** | Move
**Q or A / D** | Rotate Shield
**Left Shift** | Speed up the shield rotation
**Page Up/Down** | Raise/Lower volume
**M** | Mute Music

entries.title: Shadow Seekers
entries.description:
This rogue-like is a very fun game with some humor mixed in. I hope all 
enjoy the search through this merchant's basement for a life. It is really fun and satisfying with the generation system fully functionally after a bug fix (it stop working 2 hours till publish). Your goal is simply to collect items to improve stats. You can use a sword to stab or throw with your shadow. This is my second Ludum Dare but the other developers first. It was a great learning experience and I can't wait to playtest your games!

entries.description:
![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/c89/11/z/230bf.png)s. 


Finally, the one and only Placeholder_Game_1. 
You can only control the game with the mouse. 
Left Button - Controls Your Spirit.
Right Button - Shoot terrible ghostly bullets. 

You gotta move your green square (that's the spirit you control) with the mouse to hunt animals that run through the screen (the brown squares). 
with 3 offerings (the white squares that appear around the altar (the blue box)) you can but 3 bullets clicking the white button above the altar (the button is also white because i suck at UI Design)

Who survives the most time earn exactly $1,31 that's my actual Paypal balance. 

THANKS FOR PLAYING THIS TERRIBLE GAME. I love you all.

entries.title: What Death Has in Store
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/065/3/z/21492.png)

"Precious unborn soul, Death is feeling...playful today. There is no choice. Play its game if you wish to live!"

In *What Death Has in Store*, you play with your unlived 'life' on the line. If you emerge victorious, Death may allow you to spend your winnings on a selection of perks, but beware! If you are greedy and spend too much of your 'life', Death will be there to collect on your debt.

entries.title: Deenero
entries.description:
Deenero is a game where the protagonist gets a special gift from the flying spaghetti monster which is being able to remember the previous lives and have an infinite amount of lives. Throughout his journey, he is challenged in different ways and in all of his lives he tries to find a purpose and fulfill it. The game portrays different periods of time and a few challenges that the character goes through.![Screenshot2.png](///raw/07a/22/z/2469d.png)![Screenshot1.png](///raw/07a/22/z/2469e.png)![Screenshot3.png](///raw/07a/22/z/246a2.png)![Screenshot4.png](///raw/07a/22/z/246a3.png)

entries.title: Mayan Mayhem
entries.description:
A small platformer where you have to find your stolen tribe people, so you can sacrifice them yourself!
The game is quite buggy, so you may have to use T & G to jump out of pits that stop you from moving. Not sure why that happens...
The game is set in a Mayan village.![Screenshot 2019-04-29 at 21.09.57.png](///raw/aab/71/z/223a2.png) There are 4 different people types, and you are the leader rescuing them. ![Screenshot 2019-04-29 at 21.10.44.png](///raw/aab/71/z/223a6.png)
There is no real objective to the game currently, but some plans have been made. Once some bugs have been fixed, a post-jam version will be uploaded.
We used Photoshop for the graphics, GameMaker for the game itself, and Musescore for the music.

entries.title: Zombie Survival
entries.description:
# intro
Simple game from me, working on some other stuff, actual work and just plain old laziness means im keeping it extremely simple this time. I do plan on working more on this in my free time though. This was also done as a solo project.

# game
The goal in this game is simple, survive the zombie horde and at the end of each wave, you can buy some more ammo using your health to replenish what is lost!

# Controls
Move Up  		W

Move Left  		A

Move Down  		S

Move Right  		D

Interact 		E

Shoot 			Left Mouse Button

Reload 			R	

Next Wave  		Enter

entries.title: Death's Purse
entries.description:
Hello!
This is our entry for this LD-Jam! 
It's a 2D-Roguelike (yes, the turn based kind) where you get to control a Man who recieved a purse from Death himself.
This purse keeps the man from aging but there is a catch: Once he looses all of his money he'll die! On top of that. 
Death provides services to the man in exchange for his lifespan, but look out, even if you don't age yourself you can still die of old age!

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

CONTROLS

WSAD / Arrow Keys -> Move Around
Mouse -> Select action
Some actions require you to input a direction after using them (Sprint, Stab) so don't forget to do that!

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

NOTE: This project was way to ambitious for us so it ended up kinda lack-luster and feature less.
We still hope that you have some fun with it and pls tell us what you think about it!

NOTE 2: Electric Boogerloo: We'll maybe add some more features and quality of life changes so pls tell us if something comes to mind :)
